If I notice a student without notebook paper or a pencil, I want to discretely hand them some without questioning. My students are loving and grateful right back. And on many occasions I have received notes and letters from my students with words that express their gratitude of having a giving teacher. Please help me give my students what they deserve. We hand out a school supply list, but many families are unable to provide these basic supplies to their kids and those students come to class already feeling behind. I have asked for notebook paper, pencils and composition books as these are the essential supplies needed in my math classroom. I have also requested dry erase markers, because my students have fun working on mini whiteboards while doing math problems. They ask if they can practice with whiteboards often, but if I don't have dry erase markers for the entire class, we cannot do things like that. I have also asked for a classroom box of colored pencils, so the students who do not have their own individual packs can use the big box in the classroom. This box lasts several years. I had one a few years ago, but I am in need of a brand new one for my room. By having these basic supplies in my classroom, I can give the students what they need when they first enter my room for the new school year. My job is to make my students feel as comfortable and safe as they can when they enter my classroom, so having extra notebook paper and pencils handy in my room can help me fulfill that goal. Thank you so much for helping me provide a safe and fun environment for my students!
needStatement: My students need the basic classroom supplies, such as notebook paper, folders, markers and pencils, to begin the new school year with a great start!

name: 'Where Is Your Pencil?' We Need Supplies!
description: How can students achieve if they do not have basic supplies? How can they get those supplies if they cannot afford them? This is an issue my students struggle with daily. My students attend a rural school in a high-poverty area. Many of my students come to school without necessary school supplies. They also do not have the means to purchase such supplies. I do my best to provide what I can, but I am unable to keep up with all of my students' needs. Without pens, pencils, markers, and the variety of school/office supplies high school students need regularly, my students are unable to be fully engaged in the learning process. How embarrassing must it be to be unable to afford simple necessities like pens and pencils? My student face this issue day after day. I would like to have supplies available to my students so that they can do their best work without having to worry about whether they can find someone to lend them a pen or an eraser. This is a barrier to learning that is easy to fix. Although my students do not come to school with all of the necessities, they deserve to have the ability to maximize academic achievement, just like any other student. Having a variety of school supplies available to my students would allow them to place all of their focus on their studies.
needStatement: My students need a variety of basic school supplies, such as pens, pencils, highlighters, and craft paper.

name: Getting Up-Close and Personal With Science!
description: 'What is that?' is a question I get a lot from students, as we explore our butterfly garden outside our school. 'I can't believe so many little things work together like a team!' That is the message I would like our kids to get as they explore all of the little parts of our outside world. When you look into our school, you see students with a story. Our kids have often seen more than any child should have to witness. Often migrating for fieldwork, losing homes, living with family members, while parents are in another country are some of their obstacles. When they come to school, they deserve to get their hands on technology and materials that may be out of reach in their personal lives. We are a Title 1 school, with a Hispanic majority. Our students face unbearable challenges outside of school, but often put those aside to trust their teachers enough to learn. Many students come from backgrounds that have not allowed a formal education before their middle school years. Yet, while disadvantaged, they have so much potential and heart when it is motivated in the right direction. They are driven to use the resources they have to build a better future. They really do deserve the tools to be successful! Many of our students are not given the time to truly explore the outside world that surrounds us in beautiful Florida. Often because of their home lives, other things that are essential to survival take place. As a Title 1 school, many of our students have limited access to technology outside of school. The best way to engage our students and encourage them to take the time to explore, is to place this limitless technology in their hands! These digital Microscopes will allow them to explore around the beautiful butterfly garden outside of our classroom. They will learn cooperatively with their classmates how such a diverse ecosystem lives in sync, despite the differences among its population (just like our area.) Our students are often 'skipped over' when new technologies are tested in our district. Having the opportunity to get their hands on something new will prove to them that they are worth it! Please consider donating towards this great project for our kids. Allowing them to explore their surroundings, that are so often over looked due to hunger, worry, stress, will encourage them to look at life differently. It will show them the essentials of being a contributing member of your population, and that it is essential that we all work together. Seeing things up close and personal will help them see the big picture!!
needStatement: My students need 7 Zoomy Handheld Digital Microscopes to explore organisms from our butterfly garden.

name: In Need of Supplies
description: Did you ever feel ready for the first day of school? I am a teacher at a Title 1 school located in a low-socio economic area. At the end of the school year we are given a certain amount of money to spend on school supplies. Unfortunately this year the budget for supplies was cut. Not having school supplies can really affect the beginning of the school year. Not only for the students but also for the teacher. I try to instill organizational skills in my classroom so that I can teach my students a sense of independence. Having the appropriate supplies to do that can help them start the school year with a positive outlook. Each resource can help my students organize their work as well as any assignments needing to be done. Majority of my students are unable to provide themselves with the appropriate classroom materials, so I want to be able to help them feel provided for. I can not buy all the supplies but at least giving them something will help feel ready. I truly hope that you can help us. I know any little bit goes a long way, and seeing that you can help us can show them that there are people in the world who care for others. Thank you so much for your time!
needStatement: My students need school supplies for the beginning of the school year.

name: Let's Get Engaged in Math!
description: 'Tell me and I'll forget. Show me and I may not remember. Involve me, and I'll understand.' Native American saying. By using whiteboards and easel pads, my students will be engaged in math daily! They will be involved and more likely to understand mathematical concepts. My students are amazing young adults with a wide variety of backgrounds and interests. The students have a strong sense of pride that is displayed in sporting events, extracurricular activities, and community service. They attend a low-income school that serves an increasing amount of minorities. Our school promotes high expectations for all and has more and more students taking a 4th year of math and AP courses every year. These resources will help my students be more engaged in the classroom. They will be able to graph, solve problems, and share responses quickly and easily by using the whiteboards. This will give them immediate feedback, which will allow them to learn from their mistakes and gain confidence in mathematics. Students will leave the classroom having practiced good math and having asked pertinent questions to the material. The whiteboards can be used almost daily by working problems on one side and graphing on the other side. They can also be used with any level of math class. With the easel pad, students will be able to display group problems and have discussions with other students about the mathematics involved. The papers can be posted throughout the room to encourage math discussion in all courses. Both the use of whiteboards and the easel pad will promote understanding, use of math vocabulary, content practice, fluency, and engagement. By supporting this project, you will be helping my students be more involved in their mathematical learning. This can help increase confidence, fluency, and understanding of math concepts. When the students are involved in the math, they can more easily reach the high expectations set for them.
needStatement: My students need dry-erase markers, whiteboards, and an easel pad to be more engaged during class time.

name: Classy and Cool Storage
description: Help us clear up the clutter on our tables! My students' books and supplies are piled on their tables leaving them little room to do their work. I teach a wonderful group of first-graders. They love to learn and are excited to come to school each day. My school is located in a low income area. 90% of the students receive free breakfast and lunch. Many of the students come from less than desirable homes. Yet, they come to school ready to work hard and do their very best! My students sit in groups at tables. They do not have storage space for their books, pencils, and crayons. We need seat sacks for our chairs. These will be used daily in order for my students to keep all of their materials organized. This will allow them to clear off their tables in turn, freeing up space to read books, explore math concepts, and conduct science experiments. If we are lucky to receive the seat sacks that we are requesting, our classroom will be greatly impacted. Our classroom will be more inviting to enter. It will be clean and clutter free. My students will have their materials neatly organized in their own space. They will be able to complete educational activities without their supplies getting in the way or getting lost.
needStatement: My students need seat sacks to keep their books and supplies organized.

name: Classroom Supplies
description: 'There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure,' said Colin Powell. With these supplies my students will be prepared to succeed. The students in my class are very diverse. I have a wide range of children in my collaborative class including special education, GT and a kids from all ethnically backgrounds. To successfully teach this mix of kids it is important to use many different teaching styles. These kids love to be read to and to be able to move around the classroom with different activities. As a first year teacher my classroom is missing many important tools. I believe in teaching through literature. These books will integrate reading with math,science, social studies, writing and character education. I believe these books will be a great focus to many different lessons that will get the kids excited about learning. The mailbox station will allow the students to easily and smoothly pick up their returned papers. Jenga (1) can be transformed into a math game by adding addition and subtraction facts. Mailing labels(2 packs) will be used as a quick way to secure word problems in the journal. Cd sleeves (1) will be taped into their different journals to hold things like flash cards, and thermometers. Jumbo post-its (2) can be transformed into large graphic organizers for their journals. Dice will be used to play many different addition and subtraction games. all of these supplies will engage the students. Engage students increase overall learning in the classroom. This donation will allow my student be prepared for success. If this project is funded, my students will be engaged and excited to learn through hands-on activities, and will help the class run smoothly.
needStatement: My students need a mailbox system, books and other basic supplies to start the school year.

name: Library Lagoon
description: Save our classroom library! Our book bins are breaking and our bean bags are busting open. My 24 eager, ready to learn students who attend a school in suburban Indianapolis are eager to start the school year and progress with independent reading this year. They are all wanting to grow as readers and build stamina to read for longer periods of time. With the addition of the new beanbags, my students will be able to enjoy reading during our literacy block. We call bean bags in our classroom our 'Cozy Comforts' because we want the children to feel comfortable and 'cozy' while reading. The book bins also make it very easy for the students to find the genre of books they are looking for in the library. It helps organize the hundreds of books, so there is less searching and more reading! This project is important because I want to instill the importance of independent reading in my students. This is such an important part of their learning path. I want to take away as many obstacles as I can and make it a successful path to becoming a lifelong reader!
needStatement: My students need book bins and new bean bags for our reading area.

name: Rug For Reading!
description: 'There are many little ways to enlarge your child's world. Love of books is the best of all.'-Jacqueline Kennedy My classroom is a diverse culture of English Language Learners. These amazing students deserve a chance to experience reading and have a love of books. We are a Title I school, but that does not stop the children from being the best they can be and giving it their all in the classroom. Having a rug in the reading area of the classroom will provide a comfortable and inviting space where students will want to open up a book. Students are more likely to focus on what they are reading if they feel comfortable. Indulging in reading will help increase their vocabulary, which is crucial for ELL's. It will also benefit their analytical thinking, writing skills, and hopefully instill in them the value of being life-long learners and readers. I have tried my best to create a classroom that every student in the world deserves. I know my classroom is an inviting place where students feel welcome, but the last piece of the puzzle that is missing is a rug to relax on and open up a book. I want all of my students to have a love for books, and I feel a rug to read on will help create an environment in which this can happen.
needStatement: My students need a rug to read on so they are comfortable while they are reading in the class reading nook.

name: Ms. D's Math Bees Need a Document Camera!
description: Have you ever wanted to share a great new discovery with all of your friends? Or perhaps, wanted to show something enhanced right away? As a teacher, this is our life- to share! Both my eighth graders and myself are eager to share everything we learn and know with our class. A document camera will enable us to do so. I teach in a Title One, diverse, multi-cultural school. With over 29 languages represented on our campus, we need all the tools we can use to communicate with our students. My eighth graders love math and technology, and luckily math is a universal language. Our school is in a low socioeconomic neighborhood but full of eager, creative learners. In our district, our goal is to have all children excelling and to be college and career ready. We follow the common core standards to ensure that all students are getting the same quality education. My students get so excited when we are able to experience new learning through our smart boards, graphing calculators, laptop carts, and responders; however, we have needs that a document camera would fulfill. With the document camera, my students will have greater opportunities to share their work and discoveries, and learn in a more dynamic way! This will lead to greater listening and work skills. With this, they can share in a positive, encouraging manner. They will be able to use and display math manipulatives under the camera to explain thinking, as well as share their work and steps. Our school is big on STEM teaching in our classrooms, which allows more investigative exploration of topics. As a teacher, I would be able to model more efficiently to the class as a whole. This will also save A LOT of time, for documents not available for the smart board to view, will be able to be shown and not needed to be copied onto a whiteboard. Picture your child in a classroom with a document camera, would you not feel more confident in the learning taking place verses not having a document camera? They truly do help speed up the learning process, while making the learning more engaging and fun! Technology is the future! This will give our students another opportunity to be challenged and to express their ideas and thinking in a different, functional way. It is a more efficient way for me to model, to demonstrate, to display my graphing calculator to teach steps, and to show each other'ÂÂs work, which will enhance learning and knowledge of the world around us. Teaching is my passion and with the use of a document camera, I will be an even more effective educator for our future!Other's
needStatement: My students need a document camera in order to engage their learning, save time, and view virtually anything within moments.

name: Instant Feedback And Interaction In Our Classroom!
description: Don't you just love dry erase? Easels and student marker boards make instant learning centers, interactive lessons, and provide immediate feedback. They work well in all subject areas and provide the students with an engaging medium on which to work. We need your help! Our classroom is a second home to 24 bright and motivated third graders. We attend school in a high poverty-low income area and most of us are second language learners. Our free lunch program includes almost 90 percent of the students in our school. At this point, there are 11 ESOL Students and 8 students participating in the Early Intervention Program. My students love interactive writing lessons. We are constantly working on new anchor charts, practicing our writing skills, and participating in small groups in all subjects. A new dry erase easel and individual student marker boards would make participating in these lessons so much easier! The easel, with it's removable storage baskets, would make a fantastic place to store all of our regularly used items and allow us to use our time more efficiently. The new dry erase boards would allow us to replace the old shower board marker boards that we currently have. Those are bulky, heavy, don't erase very well, and the edges are chipping and peeling. These materials would make a huge difference in our room! My students truly deserve the best that can be given to them. They are bright, motivated, and really love to learn. Small group instruction is excellent for building the reading, writing, and math skills that students need to be successful. Please help me provide my students with new tools to assist in teaching them what counts!
needStatement: My students need a new dry erase easel and 24 marker boards to participate in interactive writing lessons, guided reading groups, and small group math instruction.

name: School Supplies Lead to Success
description: What would you do if you couldn't afford a box of pencils to do your work at school? This is the problem several of my students face every day. As a result, most of my students do not come prepared for school on the first day. This makes it difficult to be successful in the classroom. My students all come from low income families that cannot afford to purchase their children the basic supplies needed for school. Many parents try their best and are able to purchase some supplies, but cannot afford all the supplies necessary for school and homework. Every year I try my best to hit the summer back to school sales to purchase a few supplies for my students. Without the basic supplies, learning and activities would be limited. I want my students to be successful, but that means they need the necessary supplies. My students need new school supplies to start off the new, upcoming school year. They need basic supplies that will be used on a daily basis. I have requested items like paper, markers, and crayons. These supplies will be used in individual work, small group work, and whole group work. By having new school supplies, my students will be prepared to start off the new school year, eager to learn. By donating to this project, you will be making a huge impact in all of my students' lives. We need new school supplies to start out the new school year with. My students will not be embarrassed, because their family cannot afford their supplies. By having new school supplies, my students will be more eager to learn new material.
needStatement: My students need paper, markers, and other supplies for daily classroom use as we start our new school year.

name: Yoga for Autism
description: My students with autism need to learn how to do yoga. This will help them with their sensory integration because it creates a new pathway for development. Yoga will help them learn body awareness, eye hand coordination, and spatial awareness. My students are ages three to five with autism. They are amazing and wonderful children. Our school is a title 1 school with most of my students receiving a free lunch. My students have difficulty with self regulation, body awareness, and have poor motor coordination. I am requesting yoga mats, videos, and cards to help improve physical, emotional, and educational benefits. Yoga will help my students learn body awareness, eye hand coordination, and spatial awareness as well as learning to calm their bodies. We breathe, play, stand, stretch to find balance. Donations to this project will help my students with autism gain needed sensory integration while learning a healthy form of exercise and self regulation techniques. Yoga is important to help my students develop calming strategies and boost their self esteem.
needStatement: My students need basic yoga equipment such as 2 classroom kits, 2 DVDs and Angel Bear Yoga.

name: Multicultural Listening and Learning in Third Grade
description: How did people in history respond when their civil rights were challenged? How does this affect our classroom today? My students are eager to learn the answers to these questions through reading and listening to stories about important figures in history. I teach an active and diverse group of third graders who are eager to learn. We are a Title One school with dedicated teachers and staff. All staff work hard to help students be successful and to promote a school community of respect. I want to provide all my students with the resources that will enable them to be successful in third grade and throughout their lives while understanding the importance of the different cultures throughout their community. I am requesting a set of several biographies to help students learn about important African Americans in history. The style of these biographies is engaging to students. The biographies about Sacagawea and Rosa Parks will help students learn about important women in history. In addition, I am requesting a CD player and connector to help build a listening center in our classroom. This will help students to improve their fluency and learn information while reading and learning. I have also requested a set of books and a CD for our listening center about Frederick Douglas. This is an important project because it will help my students to understand the importance of showing respect for the diversity that surrounds them. While learning this important idea, they will also become more fluent readers.
needStatement: My students need multicultural biographies about important people in history as well as a listening center.

name: Mathematicians Need Hands-On Centers
description: Did you ever struggle in math? Would math have been easier with a hands-on center that allowed you to move at your own pace? My students are enthusiastic and eager to learn elementary students in South Georgia. Math can be a struggle for many students. Hands-on math centers would aid in small group instruction and allow my students to strengthen their math skills at their own pace. I am in need of Learning Palettes for Math and Take It To Your Seat math centers. Both resources are tactile math centers. The Learning Palettes are fun, tactile centers that use colored disks to engage students in math practice. The Learning Palettes allow students to move at a slower or faster pace based on their individual needs. It is so important that young learners be able to learn math with manipulatives and hands-on centers. The Learning palettes and Take It to Your Seat math centers will give my students the opportunity to learn math this way.
needStatement: My students need tactile math learning centers that will allow them to practice math skills at an individualized pace.

name: Totorogumi Gets Ready for School!
description: Do you remember your first day of kindergarten? Please help my kindergarten students begin school with essentials such as: nameplates, journals, lapboards, erasers, storage containers, Common Core standards, and other supplies. My students will attend an elementary school in an under-served community. We have many English Language Learners from various language backgrounds that require specialized English language instruction each day in addition to their typical classwork. Many students do not have consistent or concrete learning opportunities outside of school, and their kindergarten year is often their first experience with literacy and learning. While our families and caregivers want to be involved in their child's education, it is often difficult for them to provide both the financial support and volunteer time commitment our school needs to be truly successful. When school begins, my kindergarten students will be able to walk into an inviting classroom filled with new supplies and materials for learning. They will be able to take part in everyday class activities like reading, writing, and drawing with their new journals, lapboards, markers, pencils, and erasers. With the new Common Core standards kit, we will practice the math and language arts standards. In addition, the kimochis will give my young students time to practice sharing their feelings, so they can express themselves, make friends, and get to know their school family. Please help my kindergarten students begin their school career positively! Donations to this project will help students start off the year reading, writing, drawing, and feeling welcomed and special in their new learning environment.
needStatement: My students need nameplates, journals, lapboards, storage containers, the kindergarten common core standards kit, and other basic supplies to start the school year.

name: Classroom Library Makeover- More Variety Needed
description: We have created a cozy, comfortable reading area in my classroom. However, the book selection now needs a makeover. Students are most interested in current, popular authors and pretty new books. They love reading materials, but they are more likely to enjoy and complete the books if they are new. My class is full of amazing, curious nine year students. These South Carolina students don't always have brand new books or materials at home. We are a Title I school, with over 95% on free and reduced lunch. These kids face many daily challenges; they should not have to face a challenge in the reading area at school! During small group reading and time with text, my students will now have more of a variety of texts from which to choose. I believe these new books will allow students to escape their sometimes unstable home-lives and enter another world through the text. I hope to motivate students to become life-long readers and learners through current, fresh books. With these new books, I hope to empower and inspire students to love reading. By requesting popular series books and popular authors, I believe students will take a great interest in these new books. It's my job to create literate students and creative thinkers, and these materials will allow me to do this a little easier!
needStatement: My students need more text variety, including Stink, Diary of a Wimpy Kid, Where the Mountain Meets the Moon, and current publications in our classroom library.

name: Building a Nurturing Reading Environment: Carpet
description: Have you ever been taught in a mobile unit that was covered in tile with cracks here and there? My children will be receiving instruction in a mobile unit for the upcoming school year. Please help us make our trailer more comfortable for instruction and independent reading!! My students attend a Title One school in North Carolina. Our school educates a significant part of the inner cities' low income families. They are aspiring to be able to read for enjoyment and for it to not be such a tiring experience. Contrary to the struggles they face in their communities, these smiling students show up everyday for a quality education in a nurturing environment. Being able to have a space in our mobile unit that has carpet will extend our learning beyond sitting at a desk the entire day. We will be able to meet in a central location to have mini lessons, discuss facts and ideas about what we are reading individually and have an area where students can just stretch out to enjoy a good book. Being able to have a carpeted area in our mobile unit will lift the restrictions of having to sit at a desk for the entire school day. Students will be able to enjoy the comfort of sitting in a neutral location to receive quality instruction, reading books, easily working with partners and feeling right at home. Please help us have a more nurturing classroom environment in our mobile unit!!
needStatement: My students need an area to meet as a class for mini lessons and read comfortably.

name: Technology Driven World....And We are Being Left Behind.
description: I am an 8th grade special education teacher in a low-income Middle school in Bronx N.Y. South Side neighborhoods. We have approximately 380 students in our school, with 96% being economically disadvantaged. Many of my students come to school without adequate supplies and rely on their teacher to provide them with materials. Therefore, technology is an area of extreme need. The majority of the students in my classroom do not own any type of technology at home and consequently do not have knowledge of saving a document or using the web for research. Computer time in our school is limited due to the fact that all classrooms are competing to use 1 computer cart that holds only 30 computers! That's why this project is important to us! With our own tablets, my students can use tablets in their classroom whenever it's convenient which will provide countless opportunities for them to increase their knowledge of basic computer functions such as typing on the keyboard. The tablets are perfect for class projects involving research and writing. Writing is becoming a very important component in today's curriculum and having tablets handy will motivate students to want to write and do research because kids love to use computers. It gives them a break from traditional pencil/paper writing. Tablets are small and light-weight, which makes them very mobile and easy to use within the classroom. Students can move around with their tablets, which makes working with partners and small groups easy and fun. My students being of special needs can benefit in the areas of communication, social interaction, sensory processing support and behavior support. Technology is advancing everyday, and students in schools need to have access to form a basic general knowledge of the technology around them. With your help, you will make it possible for my students with special needs can have a brighter future in our competitive world. The more my students use the tablets, the better prepared they will be in a technology driven world.
needStatement: My students need 3 tablet Androids.

name: Give Middle School Boys a Voice Through Art!
description: My students have incredible potential and a real need to express themselves. With a budget of under fifty cents per student we lack the basic materials to create projects of value. In our school, we address the unique academic and affective needs of male students through a rigorous college preparatory inquiry and project-based curriculum. We are committed to providing a structured, safe, supportive and motivating environment. Our single gender school uses nontraditional teaching techniques and structures that are well suited to aspects of male learning differences. By providing paper and pencils students will be able to create a number of figure drawings that express a problem they are experiencing. Then they can use the sets of paint and paint boards to create final color paintings that offer a solution. Each painting or drawing will raise awareness about the topic the student feels strongly about. Such as violence, family, drug use, or gangs. The drawings and paintings will be displayed in the school. Along side each project will be an explanation of the process the student went through to express their important issue and come up with a possible solution Middle school boys can be frustrated when they think no one is listening. I want the boys to know that they can make a positive impact on their world and change their own situation while they are helping others. Art is a huge tool in their hands that can give them a voice.
needStatement: My students need basic drawing and painting materials for Art class.

name: iPads are Awesome!
description: iPads are awesome! We love them as adults, and I know my kindergarten will love using an iPad as well. Please help me to expose my kids to technology while learning in a fun non-threatening way through the use of an iPad and learning apps. We live in a rural community where the students don't have a lot of technology to use at home or school. 75% of the students at our school qualify for free and reduced price lunches, so most families do not have a lot of extras at home. Kindergarten age kids are so excited about learning different things in different ways. An iPad would be a great tool to help me reach my kids where they are academically, while keeping them excited about learning. I have requested an iPad because it will open my students up to explore opportunities they would not have on their own. With all the amazing apps available now, my students can work at their own levels, whether they are learning letters, numbers, reading, or writing. Many of the learning apps available now to children make it where they can log on each time and pick back up where they left off. Many of the apps even track the individual child's progress and areas they may need extra help in. At the kindergarten age, children are like little sponges who have the ability to learn so much more than we can imagine. Please support me in helping my students to feel they have the same opportunities as other children through the use of an iPad.
needStatement: My students need an iPad to utilize all the new cool apps for kindergarten. The iPad can be an amazing tool to help with letters, numbers, reading, and writing.

name: Doc Camera
description: Do you remember when a teacher was trying to show you something on a piece of paper and you could not see it? My students struggle with our language, and when they can't see what trick or change I made on a worksheet, it is hard for them, or when someone solved a problem and it can't be seen. My students are from all over the world. Some are just learning the English Language and this is their first classroom in America. Other students have been here or were born here. Our school is striving to achieve excellence in a low socioeconomic part of our state. We encourage and create lifelong learners and instill go ethics into our students. This way they do go on to further their education. Our school itself is on a 98% free and reduced lunch program to help the struggling parents. We don't have the funding for document cameras and other things that will help our children be prepared for the world. The teachers usually provide most of the school supplies and other basic needs for the children. Having a document camera will help my students inspire and learn from one another. It will help them see clearly where we are on a worksheet no matter where they sit in the room. An example of an activity is when we use factors in a Venn diagram to find the greatest common factor. Students can come up and place their document under the camera and explain how and why they got the answer they did. If they are incorrect it allows the other students to encourage a different answer. The students can now see each other's evidence and reasoning. This request is very important to me because even though my students are from a low socioeconomic area I want them to have the tools and skills any other child would. This way they can thrive in the environment and not continue to repeat a cycle of poverty. My students will have a chance to learn from each other and have clarity when doing a worksheet. Thank you for your time and consideration of this project.
needStatement: My students need a document camera so that they can follow along when another student displays their work and many reasons to show a document immediately.

name: Limitless Learning With Limited Resources
description: Fuel our creativity! My middle school Language Arts students cannot print typed work, computer projects or research materials! Their teacher cannot print lesson plans, fliers, letters home or make copies of instructional materials to share with the students. My students are 6th graders at an urban low income public school. It is a visual and performing arts magnet school and these kids are brimming with creativity! Many of them do not have access to a computer or printer at home. Though I lack technology in all areas, we do have a few old computers in the classroom. It would be so nice if the students were able to print their papers and projects as this bit of technology will help engage and excite them! I am requesting a multifunction printer, paper, and other accessories. Just a few examples of how it will be used include creating graphic organizers, printing final drafts of typed essays, printing spreadsheets and other visual projects, and printing letters and other documents to be sent home with students. This donation will help boost creativity, excitement, and self-confidence. Every little bit will help move us toward our goal and providing this small step toward having a more technology integrated classroom.
needStatement: My students need a printer, ink and paper for their classroom.

name: Help My Students Have A Fantastic School Year!
description: My students love sharing their mathematical thinking on their individual white boards! However, our school lacks the dry erase markers my students need to show how smart they are! My 6th grade students are dedicated, hard working young people who are driven to succeed in school. However, with over 90% on free or reduced lunch, the majority of my students are unable to afford the basic supplies necessary for success. My students have fewer opportunities than students in affluent communities because of their lack of supplies. Please consider helping my amazing 6th graders! I'm requesting three-ring binders and dry erase markers for my students to start off the school year organized and prepared to learn. I hope that my students not only increase their mathematical knowledge during their 6th grade year, but also that they leave the 6th grade with important organizational skills that will help them succeed in middle school, high school, and beyond. Three-ring binders will help my students stay organized this school year. I am also requesting dry erase markers. My students love to use mini dry erase boards to show off their math skills, but unfortunately often have to fight over who gets to use the few working markers we have available in the classroom. Your donation will provide ALL of my students with the chance to show how smart they are! Please consider donating to my project! Even a small donation will make a huge difference in the daily lives of over 80 students. My kids are amazing young adults and deserve the best education and supplies possible - please help make this a reality!
needStatement: My students need 3-ring binders and dry erase markers to start the new school year.

name: iTune Into Reading!
description: Help my students TUNE into learning in new and exciting ways with an iPod touch! My students love working with technology but have limited resources in the classroom due to massive budget cuts. This device would help my students get excited about learning & improve reading skills tremendously. My students attend a small Title I school in a rural town in North Carolina. They are an eager bunch of students that LOVE working with all aspects of technology. As much as the children love working with technology most are not fortunate enough to have many experiences in engaging in technology outside of the classroom. 80% of the students in my class receive free or reduced lunch. Also, 50% of the students in my class are English Language Learners who need constant practice in developing their second language. An iPod touch would provide a daily opportunity to differentiate instruction through engaging classroom centers. An iPod would allow the students to build their reading comprehension, fluency, and accuracy through literacy apps, audio recording, and more! It would allow my students to build their reading stamina by listening to read alouds. Each week I could record students reading aloud and then replay the recording to allow the student to hear their own reading. This would help students to point out mastered reading skills and also other aspects of their reading that need improvement. Students will be able to create podcasts, voice threads, and collaborate with students while developing 21st century skills. A classroom iPod touch would allow students to practice and encourage independent learning and small group instruction while working at their own pace. The headphone splitter will allow two students to use the one iPod at the same time. This project would provide so much excitement and motivation for learning in our third grade classroom. iPods are constantly adding new learning apps. Our opportunities for learning would be LIMITLESS! The students would truly benefit from the device on a daily basis.
needStatement: My students need a classroom iPod touch and headphone splitter device.

name: Seeing Is Believing...In Education!
description: Seeing is believing. You've heard that quote many times before but have you ever thought of it in relation to education? Being a visual learner myself, I understand the need for my class to have that same experience. Children need to SEE what they are learning to develop and challenge their minds. My classroom is currently full of 34 second grade students who are all eager to learn and come from very diverse and difficult backgrounds. I teach in a high poverty neighborhood in Arizona, where most of the population in our school are English Language Learners. Our kids have a strong desire to learn and challenge themselves, despite the hard challenges they face at home. They are extremely hard workers and push themselves to 'Achieve the American Dream'. As a child and an adult, I have always been a very visual learner. I need to see it to understand it, and experience it to remember it. My second grade students are the exact same way and I would love to give them ALL the opportunity to fall in love with learning through the use of a document camera. Since I have a large class this year, 34 students, it is difficult to model and teach in the way they need it without them seeing it first hand. By using a document camera, I can not only bring more technology into the classroom, but I can enhance their learning experience. Showing them other students work using the camera, or modeling lessons and independent practice that they can all visually see will be so much more rewarding to them as a learner. I also would love for my students to be able to teach their classmates using this technology tool. I can only see positive learning and success coming from the use of a document camera in my classroom! I honestly believe that a document camera could make a huge difference in my students' behavior and learning. Technology is so widely used within our world now, it is so important to bring it into the classroom as well! By using the document camera I will be able to meet the needs of my students much more effectively! Any donations from you will be greatly appreciated by my 34 amazing students and me!
needStatement: My students need a document camera.

name: Hunger Games Books Needed!
description: I teach at a low income school in Kentucky. I currently teach an advanced reading class which has a high percentage of boys in it. I took a survey of what book they would be most interested in studying and they told me 'The Hunger Games.' I would love to have a class set to use. I teach 7th grade students at a small middle school in rural Kentucky. Even though these students are advanced in their reading level, the 'love of reading' isn't in all the boys in my class. I have seen what a great book can do to open up students to reading more often. We will do a literary study of the world Suzanne Collins has created in her novel 'The Hunger Games.' The students will have a chance to analyze the literary elements found within, create their own Utopian or Utopian society, and be prepared to go to view the new movie 'Catching Fire' in November. Being a great reader is key to being a great student. By finding books that grab student's attention, it inspires them and creates a love for reading and knowledge. This book helps them to analyze the world around them and the possibilities that exist within it. Please donate to my cause!
needStatement: My 20 students need a classroom set of 'Hunger Games' to use in advanced reading, since school budgets at my school are tight and there isn't funding available to order these.

name: Math is FUN with Ipods!
description: Have you ever had to face a challenge that just seemed impossible and made you feel hopeless? My students feel overwhelmed when it comes to understanding basic math skills. Mastery of math skills seems almost unattainable for my students. My students are from a low socioeconomic area with a high percentage of students where English is not their primary language. Majority of my students are performing far below the first grade math level. Many of my students come to me without basic knowledge of number concepts and relationships. When they struggle with the building blocks of math there is no way we can expect them to understand and master harder concepts such as addition and subtraction. Math is a subject where each concept builds on each other and I would love for my students to be able to climb that ladder of math and soar! Technology is everywhere around us and I believe that it can be used to help my students achieve their goals of becoming superior mathematicians. I am asking for two students that will be mainly used during our math block and any other available times during the day to practice math skills. The students will be using the iPods, through the use of various apps, to practice number identification, number manipulation and math facts. All of these skills practiced daily through fun apps instead of boring paper and pencil activities will not only differentiate the learning based on each student but will make learning fun and exciting while preparing my students to soar through math!I want my students to reach their full potential and not get left behind in the dust. The iPods will be able to make learning fun and improve my studentsÂÂ math skills. Through your donations you will have the opportunity to take part in growing children into confident mathematicians. I believe that my students could reach their full potential and master the building blocks of math this year if they could only have a chance at having fun while learning math skills. I believe the usage of iPods with fun and exciting math apps will help them reach that goal. Please participate and ignite the fire in my students for math! Who knows one day with your help one of my students could be the inventor of something great!
needStatement: My students need two iPods to improve their math skills.

name: Little Learners Long for a Library
description: Plain and simple, my students have not yet been able to be exposed to enriching and powerful reading materials which has caused a lack of excitement when it comes to reading. My class consists of 20 third grade students who are all anxious and excited about the idea of having a full library with a wide variety of books to explore. Unfortunately, because my school is in a majority low income district, many of my students have not had the luxury of being able to explore through good quality literature. Most of the books that the students at my school get their hands on are books that are outdated, destroyed, and simply not that exciting or engaging to read. My students have yet to experience books that truly allow them to 'go anywhere in the world'. Inevitably, their lack of being exposed to a wide variety of literature has caused their experiences to be limited, thus limiting them when it comes to each of them reaching their full learning potential. Through enriching literature, my students will not only become better readers but I feel that they will become more excited about learning. This will then create life long learners who journey the world through the pages of literature. Through reading, I would like to truly impact the lives of my students. I understand that reading can influence my students to become the life long readers and learners I hope for. By creating a library full of enriching literature, my students will have no other choice but to get excited about reading and learning. With a wide variety of leveled readers and popular chapter books, I will surly be able to motivate each and every one of my students to be excited about exploring literature with me!
needStatement: My students need a complete library filled with exciting, enjoyable, and enriching literature to read throughout the entire school year.

name: You Can't Learn What You Can't See
description: My students are writers, poets, and artists, but don't have the technology resources necessary to share their work and learn from each other. The first graders in my class are hardworking and hungry to learn. Despite their persistence, they face substantial obstacles: 94% of the students at our school receive free or reduced price lunch and the majority of the students in my class are English Language Learners who speak Spanish at home. In my dual immersion class, all students are working on learning or improving their Spanish language comprehension, so visual supports are key to understanding. Without any way to share class work or assignments with all the students, however, many will not be able to see and therefore miss out on the lesson. Being able to show exactly how to perform a new task, or better yet, having a student demonstrate it, is far more powerful for a learner than just being told. A document camera is a boring name for a fantastic device: by hooking it up to an LCD projector, students will be able to project a large image of their work so that all their peers can see and learn from it. When I teach a new strategy, I can demonstrate for the whole group how to employ it, from revising a piece of writing to creating a diagram to solve a math problem. Students will easily transfer a skill to their own work because they've gotten to see exactly how it's done: no telling necessary. I've seen document cameras in action in classrooms, and their impact across the curriculum is impressive. In reading, picture books can be shared so that all students can notice and make inferences from the illustrations. In math, different methods of solving the same problem can be quickly compared. In writing, the teacher can demonstrate a new technique and then show student examples of that skill the very same day. This little camera quickly becomes integrated into the life of the class because it allows the group to achieve something that both teachers and students crave; the ability to easily, almost effortlessly, share the products of student learning so all can see, understand and build on what's been done. This device will drive students to create and show their very best.
needStatement: My students need a document camera to allow them to share their stories, problem solving strategies, and ideas in real time with their peers.

name: Be the Change You Wish to See in the World
description: In a classroom of 34 students, it is so difficult to easily reach each and every one of them in the way they deserve. Through small group work and learning centers I know I can create a classroom environment that is successful and effective for all my students! My classroom is currently full of 34 second grade students who are all eager to learn and come from very diverse and difficult backgrounds. I teach in a high poverty neighborhood in Arizona, where most of the population in our school are English Language Learners. Our kids have a strong desire to learn and challenge themselves, despite the hard challenges they face at home. They are extremely hard workers and push themselves to 'Achieve the American Dream'.Teaching with small groups and learning centers gives each child the time, effort and education they deserve, and with this teaching easel that can be done so much easier. Our space in limited with so many students, and so many desks so we are trying to find creative ways to store manipulatives and items the students need to use. However, with this storage cart and easel in one I can create centers or small group work that the students will be able to access all in one place. My students deserve the best education possible, and tools such as this easel will help provide quick transitions and easy access, in order to promote more learning time. I can see my students teaching each other using this easel as well, and I cannot wait to put this resource to use in my classroom! I truly believe that a large teaching easel/storage cart could make a huge difference in my students' behavior and learning opportunities. My students will have easy access to learning centers and small group work, which in turn will allow me to meet the needs of my students much more effectively! Any donations from you will be greatly appreciated by my 34 amazing students and myself!
needStatement: My students need a teaching easel for various learning centers and small group teaching.

name: Analyze This: Developing Historical Thinking with ELMO
description: Students are inundated with a variety of media messages every day. The ELMO document camera will enable my class to engage in discussions that develop their analytical and critical thinking skills when engaging with visual media. My students come from very diverse backgrounds in an urban area in California. There is a range of socioeconomic status, English Language proficiency, and students with special needs in my district. My school is a California Distinguished School, and a National Model Middle School. Despite these distinctions, we are still in need of resources to provide the best possible education to our students. The ELMO document camera will allow my students to engage in all-class discussions while viewing historic photographs, political cartoons, posters, letters, speeches, and more. A big component of my history class is working with students to develop higher order thinking skills. These skills will enable them to analyze and engage with media messages they see on a daily basis, encouraging them to view everything with a critical eye. I believe that a big part of getting students engaged with history is answering the question: Why does this matter to me? Allowing them to dissect and discuss both historical and modern media messages will increase student interest, and provide skills that will be invaluable to their lives as they become critical citizens.
needStatement: My students need an ELMO document camera to be able to review each others' notes and analyze primary documents including photos, letters, and political cartoons.

name: Computers For Special Education
description: Have you ever tried completing something on a slow computer? Sometimes it seems like we have dial up internet. We need your help to supply our special education classroom with some working technology to help contribute to the success of our students. Our school district is based in a low income town. Our middle school has a specific program called the Target program. The Target program supports students with emotional disorders. Our students need extra help in all core areas, along with encore classes such as music and physical education. In our program this year we serve 12 students. Our students range from sixth grade through eighth grade. These students come from very diverse backgrounds, and live within a low income population. A few students from our group are considered at risk youth and use school experiences as a positive way to be get involved.I have requested two new desktop computers and mouse pads so our students will be able to succeed in many areas. Having new desktops that boot fast and operate at a good speed will increase productivity time in our classroom. These computers would help a great deal in getting our students involved in using technology to complete work in our special education classroom. We are not always able to use computers within the building, so having the computers directly in our classroom would eliminate time wasted on locating open computers for our class, and transporting the students out of their classroom environment. These computers will provide us with an easy way to research and learn. If we have computers that work, we will have students more excited to use technology in our classroom. These computers would not only serve the current students in our program, but many students to come. With your help our students will be impacted greatly. Our students deserve a chance to interact with today's technology and they deserve to do so in fast and productive manner. If our students have the opportunity to learn 21st century skills, they will be able to practice skills that can be used in their bright futures. The information they will be able to learn, and the creativity they will be able to channel through a computer will help meet many of their educational goals.
needStatement: My students need 2 computers and 2 mice.

name: Rockstar Readers!
description: As an ESE and ESOL inclusion teacher, my students come from many different backgrounds with very different needs and learning styles. I need equipment in my classroom that will motivate them to learn and engage them in the learning process. My students face many challenges such as poverty and second language acquisition. As an ESE inclusion teacher, I also service many students with disabilities. Many of my students are just learning the importance of education and how to be responsible for their own learning. I am requesting Kindles to get the students excited about reading. Many of my students do not have access to tablets or e-readers. By having these resources in my classroom, my students will be excited about reading and want to read more! I plan to use these readers in small groups and as a resource for literature circles. My students will get to choose the books that are purchased for the Kindles which will make them even more excited to use them! My project is so important because I feel that one of the most important jobs as an educator is to make students excited to come to school and want to learn. By providing my students with tools that help to keep them engaged and excited about reading, I can accomplish this task easily. Kindles will help to ensure that my students leave my classroom at the end of the school year with a passion and love for reading!
needStatement: My students need 6 Kindles to become more engaged and excited about reading in the classroom.

name: Welcome To Middle School!
description: Do you remember your first day of middle school? Middle school can be overwhelming and expensive for a sixth grade student. My school is a Title I school which means most (if not all) of the children require free transportation and lunch. My students deserve the best possible opportunities to reach their goals, opportunities that many of us take for granted. My students face difficult identity issues each and every day. Many are immigrants with significant language and cultural challenges. English is a second language for most. It is heartbreaking to see the effort they put forth in spite of the obstacles they must face. Providing them with appropriate school supplies for the new year will allow my students to do their very best! My students need markers, pens, post-it notes, bulletin board sets and other supplies to start the 2013-2014 school year! These materials will be used daily in my classroom. My Special Education students will use the dry erase markers to come up to the white board and write responses. The different colored markers will be used to differentiate instruction and allow students to use visuals to enhance learning. The dividers and clear sheets will be used in each student's individual binder portfolio. Students will place their best work in this portfolio and they will be able to see their progress throughout the year. At times, my Special Education students have difficulty retaining information taught. Therefore, the posters will be used to reinforce skills taught and to use as a reference when needed. Your generous donation will help my students succeed in the area of English Language Arts. My students will be able to use all the materials on a daily basis. We can change their future by this simple act of providing the students with the necessary materials for success.
needStatement: My students need markers, pens, post-it notes, bulletin board sets and other supplies to start the 2013-2014 school year!

name: Supplies to Start the Year Off Right
description: 'Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.' This is the motto my class works by on a daily basis. We work as hard as we can to reach up, and to make the goals that seem extreme become reality. My students are some of the most caring, loving kids you will ever meet - but their love cannot buy them the supplies they need for their daily activities in the classroom. My students attend an inner-city school that has a very low-income average. Actually, the poverty level in my school is so low that all students receive free breakfast and lunch everyday. They also face many challenges in their homes that they have to overcome just to be able to make it to school, much less making it there with more than the bare minimum required to start the day. However, my students are also hungry to learn, and work extremely hard with what we do have to succeed at the highest levels. For my classes, I am requesting materials to build a writing resource center. The materials to do this include pencils, loose leaf paper, construction paper, and materials to help us organize the center itself. With these materials, I hope to help both of my classes of students create authentic and inspirational writing. We will use them in our writers workshop where we will be creating stories, as well as learning to form arguments, which will then be presented to our class as we learn public speaking skills. We will also use the construction paper in our other classes, as we create and design materials to improve our understanding and engagement in what we are learning. This project is important because by donating you are helping to enrich the lives of my students by enabling them to secure materials that they may not be able to access otherwise. You will also be enriching their learning, for we will be able to apply what we are doing in new and creative ways that will make it truly authentic for them, which will help them to hold onto it as they move forward.
needStatement: My students need paper, pencils, index cards and other materials in order to be able to create and inspire through their written words.

name: Building a Movement for Change
description: We are building movement for change. Drawing inspiration from the civil rights leaders of the past, my students will use government knowledge and critical analysis to build the social movement of today. Support their path toward increased equality! My students cannot possibly be summed up in words. They are bright, silly, and passionate. You will never be without laughter on any given day in my classroom. These students are full of potential, but have been broken down by the gaps in education and poverty that engulf their Texas community. My kids will most likely get by if they continue on their current path right now. They will find jobs, get married, and have children. But they will not be living up to their potential. For the most part, they will work in blue-collar jobs and will struggle to provide for their families. Many of them will not go to and through college because they will not be able to afford it and will not know how to succeed in an environment with a whole new level of rigor. Again, they will be able to get by on what they have, but they will not be reaching their full potential. But this is not enough. Within my classroom, I will seek to forge with them an alternative path. Walking into school every day underneath the banner proclaiming the building as a 'technology center' is a struggle for my students. Although there is some up-to-date technology in the school, the portable building where I teach does not boast such amenities. With the addition of Kindle Fire tablets, my students will be able to integrate technology into their project research. They will research topics such as homelessness and educational gaps to gain a greater understanding of what is occurring in their communities right now. They will first use the poster board and decorating supplies to present their topics to their friends and family within the neighborhood community. Then, using the Kindle technology, they will create a social media campaign to reach out to outside communities. With the tablets, my students will be able to access websites such as Twitter and Change.org to actively engage in political discourse every day. They will use real time information to create change. The urgency of youth involvement in politics is undeniable. However, most of my Texas-based students feel disconnected to the goings on in the nation's capital. My students live in a low-income community with little access to technology in the home. With the addition of Kindle Fire tablets into my class, students will experience government as a living and continuously changing subject. More than this, they will use all of the supplies to actively engage in politics and voice their opinions.
needStatement: My students need 4 Kindle Fire tablets for project research within their small groups. They will also need posters, markers, and glue to create project presentations.

name: Tech In The Classroom
description: Summer's over and school's boring! I haven't read all summer and I want to play some games! We live in a small town in Oklahoma. We farm, ride horses, and play video games. My school is made up of primarily high poverty students. The kids are hard workers for the most part. Those who are not hard workers would turn in to hard workers when they saw the Kindle Fires! I'm requesting 3 Kindle Fires to use in my classroom. I will mostly use these during centers. We do centers daily, and focus on reading skills and fluency. There are many apps to help my kids accomplish the needed skills. We work hard to get these kids reading, and a fun 'game' would be exciting for them. I will be able to use these tablets every year. They will reach numerous students. The kids would look forward to using the tablets and benefit greatly from them. These will be in use daily and the kids will be so excited!
needStatement: My students need 3 kindle fire's to practice reading and math skills.

name: Art Urgently Needed for Little Spanish Learners!
description: Imagine being 4 and doing grammar drills! My little Spanish learners need arts and crafts supplies to make engaging manipulatives to help them better grasp the materials. My students are very curious students attending a Title I school in an urban setting. Their school is predominately African-American with a very small, slowly growing ELL (English Language Learner) population. They are eager to learn and are very excited about the idea of learning Spanish 'like the big kids.' Arts and crafts supplies are going to make Spanish class very engaging for my Pre-K through 1st graders! They are eager to learn Spanish but are currently in a Spanish classroom that is set up for big kids and that doesn't have any materials for little learners to use. The markers, construction paper, crayons, wiggly eyes, etc will allow my students to make creative projects that will help them create their own manipulatives to help them cement the new Spanish knowledge they are acquiring! Students will be able to create face masks during our body parts unit, create animals to play games with during our animals unit, make paper dolls they can dress up in different ways according to the weather we're studying and much much more! My students have the opportunity to acquire a new language before they get older and develop an aversion [to learning foreign languages]. My students are very excited to learn Spanish, but we need materials to make it more engaging and accessible for them! Helping them develop their foreign language skills will put them on the path to becoming global citizens and allow them to communicate with and help their ELL classmates too. It will expand their cultural knowledge from an early age.
needStatement: My students need basic classroom supplies (scissors, crayons, glue) and construction paper, popsicle sticks, arts and crafts cutouts, to have engaging Spanish lessons.

name: Marvelous Musical Muscles
description: 'I think music in itself is healing. It's an explosive expression of humanity. It's something we are all touched by. No matter what culture we're from, everyone loves music.'-Billy Joel 510 students in our old mill town visit the gym for PE every single day. Even though our mills have recently closed and many jobs were lost, the students are still vibrant and active. It is my job to make sure they stay that way in spite of our tough financial times! With the increase in childhood obesity, it is my job as a Physical Education teacher to encourage students to be active and take pleasure in it! It is important to find ways to motivate and enhance exercise for children. Previous research has indicated that MUSIC has a positive effect on exercise performance. MUSIC can inspire students as well as bring enjoyment to students while exercising. Popular MUSIC can heighten their interest in an activity because they have a connection to the MUSIC. Physical Education teachers routinely use MUSIC to stimulate students during physical instruction. MUSIC is often used in Physical Education to also keep students on task. Researchers have concluded that there was a substantial increase in the exercise patterns of students when MUSIC was played. MUSIC can help change our obesity dilemma by collaborating trendy tunes in the PE program and encourage youngsters to stay active for life! We need this boombox!Music does a body good, and being active is a whole lot more fun while listening to music! If we DON'T take care of our bodies, where will we live? So it is important to me that my students come to PE and have FUN, and then I know that their bodies WON!
needStatement: My students need a boombox for MUSIC to motivate them in PE to be active for life and help end obesity in our youngsters!

name: Classroom Supplies Needed ASAP
description: We need some organization in our classroom! The students need some supplies to help with math manipulative storage, desk name plates, pocket charts for reading centers, and a weather chart for science. I also need a laminator to help protect the paper materials we use daily. I have a very diverse group of students; non-English speaking, exceptional education students, and general education low income students. My class is excited to learn and ready to listen. But, they have a few issues with motor skills and need some items to help them out with daily tasks. The students are sweet and loving and their eyes light up when I add new supplies for them to learn with. Our math manipulatives keep spilling on the floor. I have exceptional education students that need help with motor skills. The 6 caddies will hold the tens, ones and hundreds cubes. It will help tremendously with the manipulatives. We are also working on the weather in science. They would love to have some visual representation of the weather and would be able to track it with the pocket chart. The smaller pocket charts will help with reading learning centers - word building and word sorts. The desk frames will help them not knock off their nameplates everyday. All the supplies will make our day run more smoothly. This project is important because I have chosen these items specifically for the needs of the younger exceptional students. Their motor skills are not as developed and we need a way to organize and protect our things. Your donation will greatly improve the quality of learning in every subject in our daily routine!!!!
needStatement: My students need classroom supplies to make our day run more smoothly. We need 6 supply caddies, a laminator, pocket charts, weather calendar, and desk nameplates.

name: Visual Supports For Student Success!
description: Have you ever been in a situation where you were confused about what to do? My students face these challenges every day. My students are in first through fifth grade, in an elementary special education classroom. They have a variety of needs and abilities, and many need support to focus and complete work. In addition, others need visuals to transition throughout the day and facilitate communication. Our classroom is in a low-income school in a growing city. I am requesting materials so that I can make visual supports as needed for my students, as well as a timer. The laminator and laminating sheets are able to seal harder laminate that makes visuals more durable. The velcro will be used to attach the visuals around the room, to choice boards, communication boards, and individual schedules. All of these supports will make my students more independent and successful throughout the day. This project is essential for our classroom to help my students increase their independence at school. In addition, visual supports will be used to encourage positive behavior and help alleviate anxiety about expectations and schedules.
needStatement: My students need materials to make visual supports including a laminator, laminate sheets, velcro, and a timer.

name: Learning While Playing Games
description: The students in my class will have so much fun playing these games they will not even realize they are learning. My students need dominoes to use for patterning, counting, and addition. They need play dough for making spelling words and strengthening little fingers. My students live in Moore, Oklahoma. Our district was hit hard at the end of last school year by a tornado. The school that I teach at is a Title 1 School. This means that at least 50% of the students qualify for free or reduced lunches. These students often go home to empty houses due to parents being at work and do not always have someone to help them with school work. Making learning fun is very important with these students. The games and activities will make learning fun for my young students. They are learning to read and count and need to be motivated in a positive way. These games will provide just that motivation. Many of my students begin 1st grade behind students that have more advantages than they have. If I am able to provide a fun, safe, and educational atmosphere for them it will follow them for years to come. If they feel successful, half the battle is done. Making students love learning and coming to school when they are young is very important. Adding games to our reading and math instruction will keep them excited and engaged. Help my students love learning by helping with this project.
needStatement: My students need games, Sight-Word Puzzles, an Adjustable Pocket Chart Stand and activities to make learning fun.

name: Empty Centers in Kindergarten
description: Curious Kindergarteners! They love to learn and explore. Studies show that concrete hands-on learning centers provide a solid foundation for young learners. Right now our centers are mostly empty with very little variety to choose from. My students are curious and so excited to be in school and learning. They love to interact with each other and learn through play. My classroom did not exist last week. Our school had much larger enrollment than anticipated and needed to create another classroom to reduce class size. Because this classroom needed to be put together the week before school started, there was very little time to plan and budget for it. We have done the best we could to provide a warm and welcoming room for them to learn in, now we just need to get them some things to use during center time to help meet their needs. We are located in upper Michigan where most schools are experiencing declining enrollment. We are very fortunate that our district is growing and thriving, but this growth brings budgeting concerns for added classrooms. The resources that I am requesting include a variety of Lakeshore instant center hands-on items that will help my students gain concrete understanding of counting numbers, one-to-one correspondence, sorting objects by a variety of attributes, exploring shapes, graphing objects, and learning real world early math skills. We are also requesting a math counters library which includes math links, counting cubes, bears, fruit, vehicles, and several other items which my students can count and sort. These items will allow me to provide regular center time where my students can choose learning activities at their level.
