I will be able to differentiate lessons according to the individual needs of my students. These center activities will help prepare my Kindergarteners for first grade and beyond. Center time also provides much needed social interaction in an early elementary setting. My students will learn to problem solve, share, and help others work through problems. The requested items will provide years of center time learning for not only my current class but for many classes in the future. These items are reusable and sturdy enough to be used for several years. Your donation will help my students start their learning career off in a fun and interactive way.
needStatement: My students need hands-on learning centers. Counters and objects to sort, graph and learn one-to-one correspondence with. These centers will help reinforce daily lessons

name: Help! We Need iPads
description: iPad minis are everywhere these days. I feel making learning fun helps engage and motivate my students' academic progress. The specific apps will be chosen with individual student needs to help differentiate instruction. Many of my students do not have access to any type of technology within their homes, so it is up to the school to provide this opportunity. Our school is a Math Science Technology Magnet school, there are 34 students and two computers in my classroom. We are a title 1 school. So many of our students get breakfast and lunch for free. The two iPad minis in my classroom will engage and challenge my students with brand new and interactive methods. I will use the iPad minis to differentiate instruction through small groups. This way I will be able to individualize instruction for those students who are outside my small group and the group I will be working with. Since students all know how to play various electronic games, such as PSP, XBOX, Wii, and many others, I feel these iPad minis will help engage and motivate my students in learning the skills they need for reading and math interactively. The speakers will help us hear what we record. The tripod will help us set up a station to record with the iPad mini. The Flash drive will help save all their recordings. The covers will protect the iPad minis. My students need the two iPad minis, tripod, speakers, flash drive, and covers to allow them to learn at their own differentiated levels. My students love to learn, it is up to me to bring in as much supplemental materials as possible to stimulate their minds and encourage their exploration of new concepts.
needStatement: My students need technology! So we need 2 iPad minis, iPad mini covers, speaker for the computer, memory card to save our projects, and a tripod for video recordings.

name: Developing the Future of Health Care
description: Do you know how many bones are in your body? Or what the major muscle groups are and their movements. Or maybe what happens to the food you eat after it's been swallowed. The school I am at has just started a Health Science program. In the past, new programs have gotten money for start up supplies but our district is no longer doing that. The students I teach in these classes are the future of our health care system. They are enthusiastic and eager to learn all about what makes the human body tick. Within our health science program, we offer Health Science 1, Health Science 2, Health Science 3, Sports Medicine 1, Sports Medicine 2, Sports Medicine Internship, and Medical Terminology. All of these courses are designed to motivate students to pursue a health care career. In five of those seven courses the students learn anatomy and physiology of the human body. These charts will help give my students a much better visual of what they are made of and the various systems that are working at any given moment of the day. I will be able to use the charts as references right there in the classroom instead of searching in a book or the Internet for a decent picture. The students will also be able to use them as a reference as they work through various projects associated with each body system. Think about the people who will be taking care of you as you grow older and encounter sickness. Think about your loved ones who may be in the hospital. Who is going to be taking care of you? The answer is the students that we are teaching now. Help me give these students a better understanding of the human body and health care.
needStatement: My students need a chart stand plus anatomy and systems charts to help them learn basic body structure, medical terminology, and how each system works.

name: Reading Motivation
description: Help us increase our reading scores! Being a first year teacher is tough. I am starting 'flashlight Friday' for my students to enjoy reading. 'You can find magic wherever you look, sit back and relax, all you need is a book,' by Dr. Seuss. This quote will increase the students' motivation to read. My students are all well-rounded individuals, who have not made the adequate growth in reading that is expected. They attend a low-income school in a K-12 building. The students can develop close relationships with their peers and the teachers. The students mean well and do not have any behavior problems. We have been working hard on developing fluent and accurate readers. Please help us reach our goals. The plastic book boxes will replace the worn out cardboard ones we have previously used. The students use their book boxes multiple times throughout the day during Daily 5 instructional time. The plastic ones will be more durable for student use and will provide more color to the classroom. I am trying to increase the students motivation to read and grow a passion for reading. I will be starting 'flashlight Friday,' where the lights will be shut off and the students will use their flashlight to read. My hope for this will increase the students motivation and reading fluency and of course be fun for the students. Donations for this project will make a difference in my students lives by improving their reading scores. Reading is such an essential life skill, that having non-proficient readers is inexcusable. My students would love having upgraded color books boxes to keep their books in. The impact this project will have is indescribable, but it will have a significant influence on the lives of my students
needStatement: My students need book boxes to hold their books and flashlights to increase their motivation to read.

name: Can You Hear?
description: My students: Our charter school shares mobile computer labs with grades from K to 9th. Many of the headphones that are on our mobile lab are 5 years old and are broken. Many of my 3rd graders cannot hear the math problems or the stories on Successmaker, which is our individualized learning program. Our charter school has students from a broad economic background. Many families are Title One families. We have to rely on the support of grants or donations to get most of our technology. Unfortunately, when we have our mobile computer lab, many of the students are frustrated because we do not have enough headphones for the students to use. Many of the original headphones are now 5 years old and broken. There are no headphones to use. The students cannot hear the Successmaker program. All students benefit with reading and listening to the program. It helps with their fluency as well. Students who have a low reading level are at a particular disadvantage using our Successmaker program because they cannot read accurately and with fluency the problems on the computer screen without headphones. I believe all of my students need reliable headphones. If each child has their very own headphone to be responsible for, I believe that they will last several years. My Project: The most important computer program in our school for math and reading is our Successmaker computer program. Successmaker is unique in that it can find the student's ability level through questions and problems that the student answers. Then Successmaker individualizes the program to each student's abilities. With a headphone, each one of my students will be able to understand not only by sight, but by hearing the words and sounds all of the educational activities on Successmaker. This will definitely impact the ability of my students to learn their math and reading in 3rd grade. Each of my students will succeed and get confident in their understanding of important concepts of the Common Core. When each student has their own headphone, they will be responsible for a certain labeled headphone that will be placed in a storage bin. I have students of all levels of reading and math ability that need to understand through sight and sound the educational activities on Successmaker. All of my twenty-seven students will achieve to their highest potential when they have the advantage of not only seeing the problems, but hearing the stories and activities on the computer program. This will maximize their learning. Headphones are an invaluable tool for my class to have. Thank you for your support!
needStatement: My students need headphones for our mobile computer labs because the ones at our school are broken and need to be replaced.

name: Help Keep Us Organized with Chair Sacks!
description: Learning how to be organized is a lifelong skill that will help my students for the rest of their lives! Storage sacks will be a great benefit to my students to help them stay organized. My fourth graders attend an elementary school in California's largest urban school district. They come from various ethnic and cultural backgrounds, as well as different socioeconomic statuses, which means that some have more access to resources than others. I would like to use Donors Choose as a vehicle in supplying a much needed resource, chair/storage sacks, in order to teach my students how to be and stay organized. No matter what grade level I've taught, from Kindergarten to fourth grade, teaching students to be, and stay, organized has always been a challenge. It isn't a state standard, it's not tested, but it's an important life skill. With chair sacks, students will learn how to keep their things in order. Learning how to be organized will greatly benefit them now and in the future. Please help with our class project however you can! My current 4th graders and future students will greatly benefit from this added resource in the classroom. In donating to this project, you will be directly affecting the lives of many and aiding in the teaching of such a beneficial skill.
needStatement: My students need 32 storage seat sacks to help us stay organized throughout the year.

name: I Want To Swing Too!
description: What would it be like to see your friends actively playing on a playground you could not access because of your physical disability? For most students this will never be a concern, but for my students this is a daily frustration. Help us gain access to the simple joy of recess time. My students are all hard working, funny, and smart. They each have an exceptional smile and laughter that brightens everyone's day. My students inspire me with their individual challenges, unique view of the world we live in, and outpouring of love they have for everyone they meet. My students faced the challenges daily, of having a significant cognitive, physical, social and or speech disability, and are teaching us all how amazing they are, and how lucky we are to know them, and have them in our lives. This project will help the special education students at our school have access to a playground that is currently not accessible to a child with severe cognitive and physical disabilities. Access to the swing will not only provide the child with a disability access, but it will also teach the child without a disability that all children like to swing, regardless of physical ability. The swing will also open up natural opportunities for peer interactions that would not occur otherwise, as the supervising adult can safely step back and allow the non-disabled peers to facilitate the interactive play. This project is so important because it helps bridge the gap between children. Not only does the swing give all kids access to the playground at recess, but it also teaches the kids without disabilities that even though a child has a disability they still enjoy playing and can do the same things as their friends with modifications, helping facilitate positive interactions, and friendships.
needStatement: My students need an adaptive swing to help them safely access playground equipment during recess like their typical peers, as well as provide much needed sensory input.

name: Basic Kindergarten Supplies Needed Please
description: Do you remember how excited you were on your first day of kindergarten and you were given a new pack of crayons, a bottle of glue, a pair of scissors, and a pencil that were your very own? I would like to be able to share that wonderful feeling with the students in my classroom. I have a class of 14 sweet kindergarteners who are eager to learn and experience the fun and excitement that comes with being able to attend school. We are a small school in a region of Virginia that has been hit very hard by a faltering economy and the loss of jobs. We are in great need of supplies for daily use in the classroom. Those supplies include large kindergarten crayons, scissors that are safe for small hands, large pencils that are easy for those small hands to grip as they learn how to write, and glue sticks so they can be creative, as well as other items. With the assistance of these items and supplies, my students will learn how to hold and use a pencil/crayon correctly, how to cut using scissors that are made specifically for young children, and how to be creative. We will not only use these supplies for daily activities such a handwriting, coloring, and picture sorts, but also for exciting craft experiences that inspire creative learning. This project is important because kindergarten is the first time some of these children are experiencing school with the exception of those children who attended some form of pre-school. I would like to ensure that these children get every possible benefit from this experience so that they may be fully prepared to go on to do great things in the future. Please consider donating to this project. Thank you!
needStatement: My students need supplies such as scissors, crayons, pencils, and art supplies for daily use in our kindergarten classroom.

name: Love of Reading
description: Do you remember being in high school and not reading anything that was assigned? It is my hope that my students don't leave our school with that feeling! I want our students to read and actually enjoy it and look for more books to read. Kids will no longer graduate having never read a book! Our students are rural kids who have a liking for the outdoors and the military. Many of our boys are not reading or are difficult to find books for, so this will remedy that problem or start to remedy that problem because these are books that boys read. My students are going to develop a love for reading by finding books that they want to read. They are going to develop a stamina and endurance for reading because they are reading more and they are being prepared for the rigors of college! These books will start to narrow the gap between nonreaders and readers! The love of reading is something that has disappeared in recent years. Students want to look at their technology and shy away from books. It is my hope that by providing more books that they will read, they will regain that love of reading that many of us have!
needStatement: My students need these 26 books including 'Hatchet' and 'That Was Then, This Is Now' so that those who don't want to read find an interest in reading!

name: Students 'APP'lying Themselves
description: There are so many technological advances to engage and excite my 3rd grade crew in technology-based learning... But, with not much technology to call our own, this can prove difficult! We are a crew of 17 students living and learning in Louisiana. We are a Title I school with over 75% students receiving free or reduced lunch. Many of our students do not have access to computers or tablets outside of school. Some students only dream about being able to use an iPod. Our iPod will be a staple in the implementation of our new Common Core curriculum. There are numerous applications available for students to use that agree with our curriculum. With the help of a new iPod, I have the opportunity to bring technology into my teaching 3-4 times a week. They will be put in stations for students to use independently. These applications encompass all areas of Common Core, providing, online manipulative's and examples to enrich the actual delivery of instruction, as well as many interactive learning games for students to practice with teacher and peer guidance. Students will engage themselves in all subjects with an iPod. Technology creates an instant spark of interest and engagement in the classroom. Students will learn how to use this technology to better their lives. Our new iPod will bring excitement to our classroom learning!
needStatement: My students need an ipod touch and case to help improve engagement in multiple subjects in our classroom.

name: We Want To Be In the News!
description: Knowledge is power! My students are sponges and would love to absorb more of it. I teach at a charter school where kids come from all types of cultures, backgrounds, and home-lives. I have students that come from families of varying socioeconomic backgrounds and speak the languages of English, Spanish, Bosnian, and Arabic. My students would love to have a current events magazine to know what is happening in the world. Individual copies of Scholastic News would provide my students with knowledge of current events, as well as help to improve their reading skills, vocabulary, and motivation. Scholastic News comes with a teacher's guide that will help the kids and me get the most out of the magazine. Activities, graphic organizers, and think sheets are provided to make reading fun! It is essential that third graders learn how to read and comprehend nonfiction text. This magazine would be a way for my students to regularly develop those necessary skills. In Texas, third graders have to take the STAAR reading test in April. Scholastic News would help prepare them for the nonfiction portion of the test.
needStatement: My students need 54 copies of Scholastic News magazine to increase their reading comprehension skills, vocabulary, and motivation.

name: iPad For My Class
description: Independent learning is great and an iPad would be a wonderful tool. My kids are Title I gifted students and lack the income and resources to become connected with the Internet on their own. I want them to experience the power of the Internet and it's resources to increase their academic potential. Through the use of the internet I know their smiles will be priceless. My students need an iPad to discover literature, expand vocabulary, and complete language arts research. I want to inspire my students to discover literature, vocabulary, and research through the Internet. Currently we use an iPad to increase vocabulary and Internet research. I have a vision to increase technology by creating Google groups to conduct reading comprehension groups discussions. Finally, I want to prepare my students for the future through the use of technology iPads in my classroom will increase student achievement and the joy of of learning. I want to provide another avenue of leaning through the use of technology. By adding more iPads I can expose additional to the wonders of technology
needStatement: My students need an iPad to discover literature, expand vocabulary, and complete language arts research.

name: Little Things Here And There
description: Right now we have simple challenges that we are trying to overcome. We are trying to make sure we have a successful sixth grade year and have the materials we need to do so. My students can't really offer the supplies we might need for our class so this is a great way for us to do it. My students are amazing! They take care of the supplies we have and want to have a classroom that allows them to focus on what's important to their learning. We are a title school with a 75% free and reduced lunch rate but our spirits are high and we love a good challenge. We are just requesting some basic materials to make our day to day run a bit smoother. We are requesting 4 staplers, a pencil sharpener, and testing dividers for when we need to separate ourselves from our neighbors. We sit at round tables and students should have the luxury of focusing on what they need to do not their neighbors work. These items would help our classroom run a bit smoother. Our project is important because sometimes the little things add up and can cause learning to slow down. With a few of these necessary items we should remain on track and keep on cruising.
needStatement: My students need just a few items here and there to make our classroom run a little more smooth. We need staplers, testing dividers, and a pencil sharpener.

name: Much-Needed Classroom Materials
description: Do you ever remember creating something truly special over the course of a school year? My students need class notebooks to store their materials and create a year-long portfolio of their hard work. Our middle school is located in California and provides instruction to roughly 650 seventh and eighth grade students. Approximately 20% of the student body qualify for special education services, and are placed in either SH, NSH, or RSP placements. The students in my classroom comprise a mixture of seventh and eighth graders, and are mostly in NSH (Non-Severely Handicapped) placements. This means that they receive approximately 50% of their instruction within the general education setting, and the other 50% in my SDC (Special Day Class) special education classroom. Four of the students in my class are in SH (Severely Handicapped) placements, and are in the class for more social exposure to other students. I am requesting a variety of classroom materials to help our class run smoother. The first, class notebooks, are vital for my students to create a powerful collection of their work. These notebooks will help us maintain organization, and create portfolios for my students to keep beyond this school year. Also, book bins are necessary to create our class library. With these book bins, my students will be able to choose books from a variety of genres that interest them. It will be our very own classroom reading haven! All of the students in my class qualify for special education services and many of them have difficulty maintaining organization. The classroom materials I am requesting are essential to helping my students stay organized. They also help maintain a sense of order in our room. This serves to create a brighter, safer space for my incredible students.
needStatement: My students need class notebooks and book bins to organize our classroom library.

name: Composer Connections
description: We know that 'studying the past will help define the future' (Confucius). This can be applied to learning about historical composers of music. However, most students have a difficult time learning about music's past because they cannot make real connections to these people and events from so long ago My students range in grade level from kindergarten to 5th grade. They attend public school in the state of South Carolina. They attend music class once a week, where they learn about the fundamentals of music and discover the world of music around them. Elementary School music curriculum covers a wide variety of topics and standards that also connect to many other disciplines and life situations. My goals as a music educator are to instill in my students an appreciation for all things surrounding the arts and to create independent life-long learners of music as well as life. In order for students to become life-long musicians and music learners it is important for students to understand the history of music and great historical figures in music history. Often times students have a difficult time learning about the great classical composers of our past, because they have a difficult time connecting to people that lived so long ago. The Composer DVDs make the lives of famous classical composers such as Bach, Handel and Strauss (to name a few) come alive, while connecting their stories to real life situations that current students can relate to. Each of the 6 DVDs are told through the eyes of a child and center around 1 composer as well as a current issue facing students today (such as friendship, bullying, etc). The teacher's guide has reproducible activities and lessons to help supplement each DVD. By adding CD recordings and posters of famous composers, students will have a well-rounded engaging curriculum about the great composers of music's past. When students are able to learn about great composers of music's past, they are learning how to become better musicians for the future. Furthermore by being able to connect the lives of significant historical people to current real life situations, students will be come not only better learners in music, but better learners in life.
needStatement: My students need interactive instructional tools about musical composers such as DVDs, composer guides, CDs and posters.

name: Learning to be an Expert
description: Were you ever able to play games in school to help you learn something!? If so, do you remember how much fun it made learning!? Playing games and using hands-on materials are a great way to ensure that all students are engaged and interacting. My kindergarten students love school and give their best to everything they do! My students love learning especially when a game or anything hands-on is involved. The majority of my students are attending school for the first time and come from low income families. Learning can be very challenging for them since they are learning new concepts for the first time. If my students were able to learn using an 'Eggspert,' learning would be so much fun for them and would insure that all the students were involved. It would also allow the students to work together in groups and learn what it means to be a team and a class. The 'Eggspert' will help us turn learning into a fun interactive game! The 'Eggspert' consists of a six buzzers. Each child would be put into a small group of four and then each group would get their own buzzer to be used to answer teacher questions. I am requesting an 'Eggspert' to help my kindergarten students become experts when it comes to learning. If my students were able to use this in the classroom they would have so much fun learning. We would use this tool everyday to learn every chance we got! Please help my students become better learners by allowing us to have this awesome hands-on tool in our kindergarten classroom! As a teacher to twenty-four sweet kindergarten students it is my responsibility to ensure that they are all learning to the best of their ability and having fun while doing it! By having the opportunity to have an 'Eggspert' in my classroom I can ensure that all students are engaged and know content that is taught. I can also teach students about how working together is so important not only in kindergarten but in life!
needStatement: My students need an Eggspert game system to become experts in math, reading, science, and everything else we learn about!

name: Let's ZOOM in on Reading and Writing with a Document Camera!
description: Have you ever listened to a read aloud and missed the illustration as the reader turned the page? Have you ever been following a lesson only to miss the next step because you looked down at your own work? My students need this document camera to zoom in on reading and writing in our classroom. My students are the most talented, creative, generous, motivated fourth graders you've ever met. They are 43 nine and ten year olds who are learning to be leaders. They are voracious readers, independent thinkers, and eloquent writers. We work and learn at a year-round elementary school in North Carolina. We spend nine weeks together pushing our minds to the limits, and then we enjoy a three week break before we come back to learn some more. We have a strong sense of community in our school, and we work closely with community sponsors to bring character education, cultural arts, and health and wellness activities to our school. This document camera will allow students to see texts and illustrations up close. It is rare to have 43 copies of a common text to use for instruction in the classroom. When I am modeling how to annotate a text to capture my thoughts while I read, how to draw evidence from a text to support my thinking, or how to use context clues to determine the meaning on an unfamiliar word, the students struggle to see what I am doing to the text because they don't see it up close. This camera will allow me to zoom in on a piece of text for everyone to see. Now, imagine the benefits for sharing students' work. The students themselves will be able to use the camera to model their own learning. They will show the annotations they made in the text they read. They'll show the parts of the text that support their ideas. They'll show the context clues they used to figure out what that new word meant. The possibilities are endless! As teachers, we know the importance of modeling during instruction. You can't just stand at the front of the room and talk. You can't just tell them what to do. You have to show them what to do. The students need to see how a reader marks a text to show their thoughts. The students need to see how a reader draws evidence from a text to prove a point. The students need to see how to use context clues to determine the meaning of new words. This camera will allow all of my students to see!
needStatement: My students need a document camera to see the authors' words and illustrators' art up close, to learn annotating strategies, and to learn to draw evidence from a text.

name: Our Students Want to Become Global Citizens!
description: At our school, we have formed a fantastic new initiative called Kids and Culture. We offer tutoring services and a rigorous program that culminates in a study tour abroad. Our students have never been given even the opportunity to leave their hometown! In just a few years, our program has given students the opportunity to explore the world. They spend the months before conducting independent research on a specific country under the guidance of college advisers from multiple participating universities. The work produced is extremely high level, but more importantly, their investment in their studies has never been higher. The students are asking questions and seeking out information on a culture they previously new little about. Right in front of our eyes, we are forming a new generation of global citizens. This authentic form of learning has long been reserved for those who are financially stable. Despite the fact that our students come from low income neighborhoods, they manage to prove how high achieving they truly are. The growth in their maturity is matched by their new sense of determination to further explore the world and make their own lasting impression. The success of this program is epitomized in their final research projects that not only are factual, but have a personal element to them as they implement personal accounts of what they saw and studied on their tour. The students incorporate their own photos, video journals, and narratives while tackling critical problems like water filtration, the global economy, or religious uprisings and the governments level of involvement. A dedicated group of students will be traveling through Morocco. Here they will gain first hand experience as they study the geography that makes living conditions challenging, compare the education system with that of our own, and practice their new formed language skills that they have learned prior to arrival. They will volunteer and give back to the local communities by working with local villages and after school programs. In funding this grant, you allow another student this opportunity.
needStatement: My students need the opportunity to travel on a study tour of Morocco with the Kids n Culture program, immersing themselves in hands on learning abroad.

name: Itty Bitty English Language Learners
description: Help stock our classroom library with a variety of books written in Spanish. I teach preschoolers with special needs in a Title 1 school. Many of my families are Spanish speaking only. We encourage parents to read for at least 20 minutes to their child each night but many of our families do not have books in their home nor can they read the books in English I send home each night. I am asking for a variety of children's books written in Spanish so my families can begin reading to their children each night. These books will be used as nightly reading as well as a home/school connection as the books come back to school with the student each day. The books will be rotated between many families each day. Because my students have a variety of disabilities, it is imperative they are exposed to books and are being read to regularly. This will help to improve their receptive and expressive language development, help the with attention to tasks, help with cognitive development and foster an overall love of reading.
needStatement: My students need a variety of books in Spanish so their parents can read to them each night.

name: Listening Center
description: Help us gain literacy skills and a quiet classroom environment during small group instruction. Right now we are using a CD player with volume on low because our headphones and connection station have broken with daily use. We are an at-risk school in Michigan. The students come from diverse backgrounds. Our community is just outside a larger city. Our district consists of 2 elementary, a stem academy, middle school, and a high school. I am requesting 2 listening centers to hear books and write about them during Daily 5 small group time. These listening stations come with a CD player station with headphone connection and headphones for 6 students. We currently have two CD players, one with a broken tape player and one with a broken CD player. The connection for the headphones I currently have has a short in it so we are not able to use headphones right now. We have to play the tape or cd on low volume while reading groups are simultaneously going on. This new listening station with working headphones will make life easier and quieter during reading instruction. We really need a working listening station for our reading group time. This will allow for six kids to listen to books while I teach reading skills to other small groups. A quieter environment will assist focus and attention toward our reading goals.
needStatement: My students need 2 listening centers to hear books and write about them during Daily 5 small group time.

name: Freedom of Speech- Public School Students &The First Amendment
description: 'Tomorrow is Now. It is today that we must create the world of the future.'~Eleanor Roosevelt 'Nothing But the Truth' integrates Civics into the English classroom. My lessons begin by having students explore cases where claims were made that students' first amendment rights were violated. My students are motivated kids who want to learn. This year is a giant transition for them as their middle school was shut down due to budget cuts and they were moved to the local high school where I teach. For the most part, they are the group that represents the above average sector of their grade level, and I believe that researching first amendment court cases and then reading 'Nothing But the Truth' will produce critical thinking and writing from this group. The school they attend is in a lower socioeconomic area where there is little parental involvement. The majority of our school population receives free or reduced lunch. Our district offers free breakfast and most of our students take advantage of this as the free breakfast and free lunch might be all they eat that day. Additionally the students come to me with very little prior or background knowledge of the world outside their community which makes discussion of literature difficult. I will be able to integrate civics into the English classroom by doing a pre-reading activity with the first amendment. Students will understand the first amendment of the constitution as it applies to public school students. They will learn concepts such as advocacy of illegal action, commercial speech, and forum. They will research cases where students' first amendment rights were violated such as Tinker v. Des Moines (1969) where students were suspended for wearing black armbands as a silent protest to the Vietnam War. They will identify the facts of each case, each sides' position, the decision held by the court, and its effect on the country. Students will be grouped by case and will create a digital presentation to share with the class. As a class, we will then read 'Nothing But the Truth' where a student is suspended for humming/singing along to the Star-Spangled Banner instead of standing at silent, respectful attention. We will conclude with a persuasive writing opportunity. Students will have the opportunity to read from books that are new and not falling apart from being used for year after year after year. They won't have to stare at a sticker saying the book belongs to another school that's in a more affluent area because I had to beg and promise favors just to borrow a class set for a limited time. They will know that this class set belongs to OUR classes and they will feel ownership and pride. Most importantly, they will glean real world knowledge.
needStatement: My students need 30 Nothing But The Truth books, as severe budget cuts have eliminated funding for new materials. A huge supply of books had to be thrown out because they had fallen apart.

name: Cooking in the Functional Skills Class
description: Do you remember learning to cook your first meal? My students will be adults in the next few years, but have had few opportunities to learn appropriate cooking skills. I teach a class for students with moderate to severe disabilities. My students all attend a public school and spend some time in a special education setting and some time with their typical peers. They have a wide range of skill levels and abilities, but they are all on a functional life skills curriculum, meaning their goals in school are to learn basic skills required to navigate life. With the addition of cooking supplies, including a skillet, a griddle, a crock pot, and kitchen utensils, my students will have the opportunity to learn to make and/or assist in making simple meals. We will be able to make a wide array of foods traditionally cooked on a stovetop including pancakes, tacos, and spaghetti. They will also be given the opportunity to try new foods that they have not tasted in the past, broadening their food preferences through experience. By donating to this project, you are helping my students learn skills that will last them throughout their life. My students will be able to learn some basic cooking skills and try new, delicious foods that they've never tried before. Please consider donating to this project.
needStatement: My students need electronic cooking supplies and utensils to work on functional life skills in the classroom.

name: Improving Reading With Technology
description: Do you ever remember being so frustrated with reading because it was hard, or you just couldn't read it or understand what you were reading? I am trying to unlock these frustrations! I have 24 eager fourth graders who are simply amazing! We are in a public school in California. They are an incredibly bright and sweet group of students. They work together and are so eager to learn and become better. They inspire me every day to be a better teacher. Students will be able to access the Internet and work on applications that they are excited to use to help them with basic phonics skills, sight words, vocabulary, reading comprehension and much more with this tablet. It will allow students who don't speak English to be able to view pictures that match with unfamiliar vocabulary and hear how words are supposed to sound. This would be an important asset to our classroom because some students never have access to current technology. This will help them learn about technology as well as improve their reading skills.
needStatement: My students need a tablet to be able to work independently at their seats to work on applications that will assist them with their reading skills.

name: Regulation Through Rocking and 'Recking
description: Remember that frazzled day when you ran late, the traffic was horrid, you left your travel mug of hot coffee on the kitchen counter, and your check engine light went on? All before 8 AM? Many of my young students with special needs feel that dysregulated (stressed) much of the time! I am an early childhood special education teacher in a low-income, high-needs public school. My young learners are three to five years old, and each one has an educational disability and/or a developmental delay that impacts his/her functioning and academic achievement. What does 'rocking and 'recking' have to do with learning, anyway? Regulating (calming) activities, like rocking in a rocking chair or building with safe foam blocks and then knocking them down, give children a sense of mastery and calm. My young students are as dysregulated much of the time as you are on those really awful mornings, and having equipment and materials in the classroom to help them calm and focus so they can learn is vital to their success. Help make a difference in these young lives. You will feel happy that you've helped. But, even more importantly, you will know that a good quality early education program is a research-based intervention that saves money down the road through less need for special education and social welfare programs. Help my students on their road to becoming regulated, life-long learners who can contribute to our society.
needStatement: My students need child-size rockers and safe foam blocks for activities that are regulating.

name: FUNtastic Learning In First Grade
description: Trying to create leveled centers or activities for my students without the resources creates students getting instruction either way: above their level or not meeting their potential because the work is below their level. Please help us to get leveled materials for our classroom to meet all levels. My students attend an inner city, neighborhood school in the third largest school district in the country. Our neighborhood has the second highest murder rate in the city, so generally students are not allowed to go outside during the day. My student population is 100% African American. All of my students are designated low income and receive free lunch. Over 75% of my students are reading below expected first grade levels. Few of my students have access to computers outside of school. I have personally purchased class manipulatives and materials for my classroom. However, without more materials available at different levels, a lot of important skills are not learned to their full potential and the instruction becomes time consuming and ineffective. I will use reading and math materials daily for guided reading, guided math, and during centers. During small and whole groups lessons, I will be able to pull materials that are right for each student's personal reading and math level. I am requesting three different activity boxes that will help with phonics and reading readiness through our listening center in our classroom. This will be used during centers daily along with the lap whiteboards, dry erase markers, and erasers in the writing center. There are many things that it feels our classroom is in need of, so I am also requesting a math games library to build on foundational math skills in a fun and exciting way for my students. My students love to learn new things but without the proper materials and correct leveled materials, the work will not be done at an enriching level. Please help my first graders to reach their full potential as readers and mathematicians!
needStatement: My students need different leveled materials for reading and math. Our class needs math games, whiteboards for writing center, and activity boxes for our listening center.

name: The Art of Colonialism
description: Due to the increased pressure to perform on Common Core Assessments ALL budgetary money has been taken away from extracurricular activities at the elementary level. No money has been allocated for purchase of ANY creative materials or activities. Our students face the challenge of learning in a date driven environment. Teachers need to justify every minute of the day and show how all activities will produce results. The new teaching model is all about Common Core Assessments. Our students are no different than anyone else's. They enjoy learning but not when they are being bored to tears. They are diverse learners who have their own strengths and individual weaknesses. They learn best when they are stimulated. They have proved this year that when they are allowed to be creative, they are much more motivated to do their best. Our next Common Core Module study is on Colonialism. There are countless pages of worksheets to accompany this module. We would like for the children to experience Colonialism by creating their own Colonial Journals. Collaboratively, they will use the journals to depict aspects of daily life for colonial children and compare them to modern day life. Partners will then create masks and author plays in which they will act out the different aspects of daily life - depicting a comparison of today and yesterday. Rather than complete a graphic organizer, children will be bringing colonial times to life and really get a sense of what it was like to live during the days of our Founding Fathers. Not all children learn the same way. However, Common Core Modules force children, no matter their talent, to fill out worksheet after worksheet based on written material. It is critical to give every child the opportunity to show their strengths. While some thrive on written material, others need to be creative. While some work well alone, others need to collaborate. While some can read texts and spit facts back out, others prefer to think critically to develop their own opinion. Help us shine!
needStatement: My students need 2 of the Mask Making Packs, assorted craft supplies, like glitter and markers, and Cover-It notepad sets to bring the curriculum from Module 2 of the Common Core to life.

name: Speech Tools to Boost Middle Schoolers' Confidence
description: Imagine being a preteen or teen and not being able to talk correctly. My middle-school speech kids are predominantly inner city African American males. The stigma of not being able to pronounce sounds correctly has a big impact on their lives. They are reluctant to speak in class, fearing they will be made fun of (and they often are). They have even gotten into fights because of their speech. They work hard in speech therapy, but despite their best efforts, there are a few sounds they struggle to master (especially /s/ and /r/). Cutting edge therapy tools, such as Speech Buddies, will give these kids a chance of conquering their targeted sounds. Speech Buddies are radically different from other articulation tools. They go where the Speech-Language Pathologist can't, directly into the student's mouth, to teach the exact placement of the tongue and lips in order to make sounds correctly. It is my hope that the Speech Buddies will be just the thing to help my students, whom life has not given a fair shake, to sound like their peers and give them the confidence they need to succeed in school.
needStatement: My students need Speech Buddies, cutting edge tools to teach correct production of speech sounds.

name: Science Rocks With Hot Dots
description: Science will rock with Hot Dots science skills cards! We are a wonderful group of fourth graders in Colorado. Our class is 60% boys and 40% girls. We have many military families at our school. We are eager to learn new things and are anxious to grow up and become knowledgeable young men and women. We come from various academic, ethnic/cultural, and economic backgrounds. For several of my students, English is their second language. I am requesting a set of Hot Dots science skills cards and three Hot Dots pens. My students will be able to utilize these during centers and science time. They will be able to work individually or with a partner to practice science skills. They will get instant reinforcement when they get a question correct and be able to fix ones they miss right away. We will also be saving on paper because we won't need worksheets to practice these skills. So often science is overlooked in schools these days, but it is so important that we encourage all students to understand science and we might even inspire some to become future scientists.
needStatement: My students need Hot Dots Science Set and three Hot Dots pens to learn and practice their science skills.

name: Help My Students Become Global Citizens - Travel to Morocco!
description: St. Augustine once said, 'The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.' Today's students live in a global society, and all students deserve the opportunity to explore and experience the world through cultures with which they are unfamiliar. Despite the fact the my students come from an urban environment facing economic and social issues that can bring them an enormous amount of stress, they continue to show that they are dedicated to success at amazing levels. My students are committed to their education in both an academic and personal sense. They seek out opportunities, such as the chance to study the culture of Morocco, in order to learn more about the world they live in and their place in it. These high school students hope to strengthen their understanding of the world as they begin to explore their collegiate opportunities, and plan for their futures. The opportunity for students to experience learning on the international stage has long been relegated to those who are financially able to attain these goals. However, my colleagues and I believe that these experiences should be available to all students. In the months leading up to their trip, my students begin conducting research in various areas of the culture of Morocco. For many students, this is the first time they are able to completely self-direct their learning, focusing on various aspects of culture- from fashion trends and choices, to studying the education system in the country they visit. Students will conclude their research by visiting the country they are studying, gaining the chance to live like a local and to see the world from a new perspective. Students gain the opportunity to grow as individuals and as learners as they gain college credit for their research endeavors. In addition, students have the opportunity to give back. They will be volunteering their time in local communities, participating in activities as diverse as visiting local schools and working with local farmers to better understand the way of life in the country. In funding this grant, you will help to fund the trips of 5 students who are in great economic need. These students will be able to compare their experience in a western nation to the experience of teenagers living in a world vastly different from their own. You will help to instill a love of learning that will carry these students through their academic careers at the university level, as well as in their professional endeavors.
needStatement: My students need the chance to travel abroad with the Kids n' Culture program on a study tour of Morocco.

name: Cash Register for Intellectual Disability Classroom
description: We have a student staffed break store from which students can purchase snacks. The store is currently working on a toy cash register. My students are adults, ages 18-22 with intellectual disabilities. They are in a life skills based transition program. The program focuses on teaching students adaptive life skills and career training. My students have a strong desire to work in the community. They have an inspiring work ethic, but need the opportunity, tools and support to practice their skills. We are requesting a cash register with PLU buttons and a scanner to use in our class break store and our REACH Greetings homemade card business. This is the tool needed that will allow the students a more realistic job experience. Realistic job experiences translate to real community based jobs. A cash register will allow the students to learn skills that will create more job opportunities for them. It will also allow the students to sell the greeting cards they make at local craft fairs. We have a long term goal of having a community based store from which to sell our cards.
needStatement: My students need a cash register to practice job skills and money skills.

name: Hurricane Sandy One Year Later: Help My Students Express Feelings
description: A year after Sandy struck the little shore town I teach in, houses are still missing and children in my class need ways to deal with their emotions. We need games and toys to help my children as young as three learn about expressing their feelings. My students are the best thing about my job. They are creative, lively and eager to explore our world. I look forward to seeing each of their bright sunny faces every day. I teach in a low-income school district which means many of my families work very hard to provide for their families with many of them working more than one job. After the hurricane devastated their town last year, many of my students were traumatized. They are still dealing with emotions from loss to anxiety. They need books and games to help encourage them to express how they are feeling. My students need books, games, puppets, and music such as Kimochis Mixed Feeling (Pack of 6, Links to Literacy All About Me Book Set, and How Are You Feeling Today? Display Center to help learn about how they are feeling and how to express their feelings. I am requesting a wide variety of materials to meet the many different needs of the students in my class based on identifying emotions. I have requested several story books to read to the students plus books to help me create a classroom that encourages them to explore their feelings. I am also wishing for some soft puppets for role playing and games about emotions. I have selected some music that also promotes healthy ways to deal with emotions. My students are very young and still learning how to deal with their emotions. With the anniversary of Sandy, the media coverage and conversations around them will bring up memories that they need to talk about. Please help me by providing me with the tools to help them recover and express themselves.
needStatement: My students need books, games, puppets, and music such as Kimochis Mixed Feeling (Pack of 6, Links to Literacy All About Me Book Set, and How Are You Feeling Today? Display Center to help learn about how they are feeling and how to express their feelings.

name: Bring on Common Core!
description: Common Core is among us. Starting in the school year 2014-2015, teachers will be required to teach Common Core using task and questioning techniques. One such technique is being able to analyze peers work and finding or correcting other students work. My students come from a variety of backgrounds that resemble situations that range from rural to urban. The school has a recent reputation of failure, but the students work hard everyday to prove the naysayers wrong. While they all show interest and ability, over half of my students come to class each day unprepared to learn mathematics. Though they come unprepared, what they soon realize in my class is that math can be fun and interesting if taught the right way to fit them. My students generally love my class because of the different avenues used to teach them. The document camera that I am requesting will be used to show student work to the rest of the class for us to be able to determine an appropriate course of action in solving various algebra problems. Common Core is based on letting the students work through situations based on questioning and answering and discussing different ways in solving a problem. I feel that a document camera is the best way in order for a class to actually see work and determine what should or should not be done in order to solve the problem. In order for students to be successful in the work force, they need to be able to think analytically, have a creative and innovative mind, and have the curiosity and imagination to take them further. A these skills can all start by using a document camera to view and critique others work. With CC coming, students need these analytical skills!
needStatement: My students need a visual presenter to be able to see and analyze other work to determine the best solution for problems.

name: Inclusion and Diversity Materials
description: Everybody should feel they have a place in society. Many times children with special needs feel different because their equipment is not seen in mainstream society. Having adaptive equipment in the play areas will help students with and without special needs learn about each other. There are 20 three- and four-year-old students in my public preschool classroom. They enjoy exploring the world around them through a variety of hands-on activities. They also learn about their community and world through play experiences. The students have a variety of abilities. I am requesting materials to expose my children to the needs of individuals with a variety of abilities. We have students with a variety of abilities in the classroom. The students are very accepting of their peers, but these materials will allow them to interact with a variety of devices that help their friends. It also allows the students that use these devices to see them as a normal part of their community. Having dolls with wheelchairs, walkers, and crutches will help the students who use these devices feel like a part of the mainstream community. It will also help other students understand these devices and how they help their friends.
needStatement: My students need one set of adaptive equipment for dolls including a cane, seeing eye dog, walker, crutches, and leg braces. They also need one set of braille blocks.

name: Operation Organization
description: Help us return from the black hole! We exchanged our individual messy desks for clean, space saving group tables to foster collaborative learning. Our pencils used to get swallowed up in the darkness behind all the clutter of notebooks and folders. Now we need an orderly way to store our supplies. My students come from many different cultural backgrounds with many different experiences they bring with them. Yet they all have the same desires, to be successful in school. Our school is a Title 1 school with most of our students on free and reduced lunch. We are an International Baccalaureate school which strives to inspire global mindedness in our students. Our schools mission is to create a learning community where students use the inquiry process to become knowledgeable, develop intercultural understandings, and become active, caring and lifelong learners. We have recently acquired five collaborative group tables in place of our individual desks. We would like have a management center for each table to organize their supplies like their Daily Language workbooks, Inquiry Journals, working folders, etc. While individually the students had a hard time keeping their desks clean and finding their materials, the management centers will allow them to work together to keep their supplies organized in an easy to use way. The centers will help us make every minute count in our hectic daily schedule! The construction paper organizer will be used to store our commonly used graphic organizers/thinking maps for writing, inquiry, and reading. This will enable the students to easily record their questions, ideas, and new learning in a more independent manner. Many students need these supports to be more successful in class and increase their academic growth. Please help us make every minute count and improve academic growth with these classroom organizers. The management centers will allow us to be more efficient with our collaborate work. The construction paper organizer will help us organize our questions, ideas, and new learning to lead to an increase in student achievement!
needStatement: My students need table organizers to keep notebooks and folders organized and a place to keep copies of commonly used graphic organizers.

name: Sitting in Style Part 3
description: Does your job require you to sit for long periods of time? What kind of chair does your office have? I am sure it is not the old, hard, heavy chair that my students need to use every day. I teach third grade in a very low-income neighborhood in California with 100% of my students receiving free or reduced meals and 90% are English language learners. It is a very diverse population with Hispanic, Pacific Islander, Indian, and Black students. Many of the students are considered high-risk due to the conditions in which they live (gangs, violence, and drugs). They are also the most charming and eager students anyone could hope to meet. My students thrive in an atmosphere that is consistent, fair, and filled with many opportunities to express themselves Imagine going to work every day and having to sit in old, hard, heavy chairs. It is not a comfortable learning environment for students. They spend more than half their school day sitting in these chairs. The Virco Zuma chairs are comfortable, light weight, ergonomically designed with the student in mind, and the cool cantilever shape makes sitting down fun! When children are sitting correctly, they can spend their energies focused on learning rather than on finding a more comfortable way to place their bodies. These ergonomically styled chairs will help this year's class learn in a comfortable environment as well as many futures classes to come.
needStatement: My students need 2 new comfortable and ergonomically engineered chairs.

name: Literacy Circles: Whole Group And Small Group
description: My students need to be able to have the books in their hands while we are reading together. This allows the students to connect on a deeper level with the text and provides them with the opportunity to develop their reading skills in an engaging setting. My students participate in our district's dual immersion program. This program provides the students with the opportunity to spend half of their day learning a new language. My students are very bright. We need quality books that expand their minds with its rich vocabulary. We are requesting a classroom set of Charlotte's Web, Because of Winn Dixie, and The Miraculous Journey of Edward Tulane. These books are appropriate for my student's age group and are also exciting reads. I have developed a curriculum that is based on these books, but I can not incorporate it into my classroom until each child has a book for themselves. There are reading programs that school districts adopt because they support learning that is connected to the Common Core Curriculum. I am hoping to provide my students with more than just a basic reading program. I want to give them books that entertain while they are learning valuable skills related to our curriculum.
needStatement: My students need 25 copies each of 2 chapter books that I use in addition to our reading program. We would love the chance for each student to hold their own copy so we may read together.

name: Catalyzing Student Achievement With Chromebooks!
description: Every day our students are told 'Excellence. No Excuses.' These students arrive ready to be excellent, but many of them lack access to the basic technology they need to fulfill their potential. Students at my school are part of a transformation -- only several years ago this school was one of the most dangerous in the city. Today, our students have worked hard to close the achievement gap, virtually eliminate violence, and are now preparing for college and beyond. Though our students come to our doors with bright minds and great attitudes, we are frequently reminded about the barriers poverty creates in terms of access to materials and information. Having access to four Chromebooks would open up a world of possibilities for my kids -- both through research for class and the ability to connect them to summer opportunities and outside of the classroom experiences. Additionally, there are so many online resources students can access to reinforce and/or relearn the content from my course -- differentiation at it's finest! Our entire community is working tirelessly to help our kids reach their goals -- and in our increasingly technological world access to the Internet and practice with using computers is an absolutely vital skill my students will need. Many don't have reliable access to the internet or a computer and with many of our teachers (including myself) requiring assignments to include outside research or be submitted on the internet, some of my students are excluded from that opportunity. Computers in the classroom would eliminate that barrier from my kids. Access to information is the single biggest barrier that my students have to overcome to fulfill their dreams. Reliable and accessible computers in the classroom will allow me to differentiate materials, connect my students to resources, and prep them for high school and beyond by being able to require some assignments to be submitted electronically.
needStatement: My students need four Chromebooks to use for classwork and enrichment, submitting assignments on-line, and connecting themselves to opportunities outside of our building.

name: Magnetic Power
description: We are busy bodies in Kindergarten. One of our favorite subjects is Science because we love to be explorers and little scientists. We are a busy group of 50 Kindergartners at a charter school that offers the best education. We are different and pride ourselves in the fact that we always, always strive to be the best for ourselves, our school, and our community. Doing our best means that we are hard workers. With the materials, each Kindergarten student will have the opportunity to experiment with magnets and how they work, especially in our classroom. We love to use our hands and bodies to learn. Using these magnets will be very rewarding and personal for all students! By helping to provide a magnet for each child, they will have the opportunity to truly understand how a magnet works. We learn best hands on and with all of these magnets, we will get to do just that!
needStatement: My students need magnets that they can manipulate with their hands in order to understand the power behind the magnetic force.

name: Figuring Out Fine Motor
description: My students have significant disabilities and anytime I can provide creative, hands-on activities, my students thrive and accomplish more than they ever thought possible. Having appropriate manipulatives and games to teach with allow my students to have fun while learning. I teach Special Education elementary students at a Title 1 school in Arizona. My students all have special needs. I have students with many different disabilities including Autism, Orthopedic Impairments, Visual Impairments, and Intellectual and Emotional Disabilities. Most of the students at my school live at or below the federal poverty guidelines, and school funding in Arizona is at an all-time low. Because of this, obtaining extras is next to impossible. These manipulatives and games will help my students master curriculum standards while also helping them to improve their fine motor skills, which are so important in their daily lives. In addition, these materials will make the learning and skill building hands-on, and much more fun than the traditional fine motor building activities. It is my hope that this will help my students to master concepts and improve their motor skills at a much quicker pace. Manipulatives and educational games make a huge impact in learning and skill building, yet they are almost always purchased at the teacher's expense. Districts don't have the funds for these 'extras' and so often students go without. With your help, my students will have all the materials that make learning and fine motor skill building fun and engaging. This will foster a positive attitude about learning, and help them to be even more successful. Thank you!
needStatement: My students need various fine motor activities like cutting fruit and lacing cards to help them build the necessary fine motor skills to be successful writers.

name: Creating Critical Thinkers Through Art
description: Art is an experience that focuses not on the product but more on the process. All children are excited to create art and each child is successful when art plays an integral role in the classroom. The students in my class and at my school are full of energy, inquisitive wonder and enthusiasm. They come from various diverse cultures, speak different languages, and many of their families are struggling economically. The school they attend is in the state of Washington. It is culturally diverse with over 83% free or reduced lunch and over 40% English Language Learners. The supplies I am requesting (crayons, colored pencils, markers and oil pastels) will give the students in my school the opportunity to learn about the elements and principles of art. These students will receive monthly hands-on art lessons that are aligned to the Washington State Art Education Standards and are integrated into math, reading and science curricula for each grade level. Through volunteers (community, parents and retired teachers), the students will be exposed to various artists, art periods and artistic styles. Your donation of supplies will help classrooms in my school by exposing them to 8-10 art prints by both Master and Ethnic artists representing a diverse array of artistic styles. They will learn about each artist, learn to scan each print to become critical thinkers, and then receive success oriented art lessons linked to the individual artist. At the end of the year, each child will choose one of their original pieces of art to display at our annual art walk.
needStatement: My students need art supplies such as markers, colored pencils, oil pastels, multicultural crayons and classic markers to create critical thinkers and creative learners.

name: Mama MIAmi! From Broadway to South Beach!
description: My students love making music by singing or playing an instrument. Many have yet to experience the art of musical theatre and the story telling that it involves. Musical theatre, like the opera and musicals, will improve my students reading comprehension through studying the libretto. The music class showing the weakest performance in reading as evidenced by the least number of students meeting high standards on the FCAT 2.0 reading assessment is the chorus. There are a total of 18 students, with three at a Level 1, and five at a Level 2. The three Level ones are in the lowest 25%. Our school is a Title I school with a 'D' classification. This year's theme is 'One School, One Goal'. The school is located in the South Dade area serving nearly 600 students in grades 6-8. 82% of the learners receive free lunch meals, a small population are Limited English Proficiency, 24% receive services through Special Education. Demographics demonstrate a varied student body consisting of 50% of the learners are black, 40% Hispanic, 7% Anglo, 1% Asian, 0.4% Indian and 1% are multi-racial. Romeo, Romeo, wherefore art thou? What dreadful luck that you would have the name of Montague, a name so despised by my family. (William Shakespeare). Today, Juliette would not have to utter those words from a balcony. She would merely text Romeo from her bedroom and he would have Tweeted the world on his whereabouts like the average celebrity. The latest trends in technology have allowed teachers to accent lessons using various websites and software. The most effect literacy building activity, which helps to develop math, reading and writing skills, has been introducing the opera to middle school students. Adding technology, like the downloading tunes to student iPods/MP3 players will bring the operas and musicals to the 21st century. Using programs like Discovery Education also transforms classrooms and inspires teachers with engaging content, to fully engaged students in reading the stories, characters, settings, costumes, orchestral music, and actual singing. This project will allow me to use every resource to broaden students' musical and cultural experiences, and continue students regular attendance to the Florida Grand Opera's full dress rehearsals. Opera FunTime books are provided, along with free dress rehearsal tickets. Students ask to attend the opera because they love attending such a grand events at the cultural arts center. More importantly, students dress in formal attire. Students will also attend live Broadway musical production.
needStatement: My students need dvd's of Mama Mia, Annie, The Wiz, Fiddler on the Roof, Phantom of the Opera, Hair Spray, Grease, Guys & Dolls, and Rodgers/Hammerstein musical collection.

name: Enriching Storytelling
description: Do you remember wanting to hear the same story over and over again as a child? The ability to re-tell a story is an incredible way to build reading comprehension and vocabulary, especially for children with little or no experience with books and stories. My students are enrolled in the first year of the new Indianapolis Public Schools preschool program. They are four and five years old and they are eager learners ready to learn and explore. Many have not experienced daily stories or literature at home and 95% qualify for free or reduced price lunch. Our classroom is housed in an urban, elementary school. The flannel board materials and books that I am requesting will help my students increase their reading comprehension and vocabulary. With the movable flannel pieces that the children will recognize from the stories that they hear in class, the children can re-tell the stories in their own words, building on their ability to recall and remember details from literature, which will equalize their learning readiness to their suburban peers. These children have not had many experiences with stories and books. These materials will give them the opportunity to explore, feel and tell the stories in their words, encouraging learning while they feel they are 'playing.' Since they work in small groups while using the materials, they also engage in conversations with each other, increasing their confidence, verbal skills, and social skills. This pre-K program was designed to give urban children the same opportunities that their suburban peers receive from home or private preschools. We are a universal free school lunch school. Most of my students have not experienced literature and storytelling in their homes. We have one copy of 'Brown Bear, Brown Bear, What Do You See?,' and the students eagerly wait their turn 'reading' it each day. These materials will truly enrich their vocabularies and story re-telling abilities.
needStatement: My students need sturdy books and flannelboard storytelling materials in our classroom library and literacy center to enrich their vocabulary and reading comprehension.

name: Graphing calculators
description: I have a class set of calculators, but a number of my students would like to have a calculator on their own so they can reinforce their learning in the classroom by having this as a ready resource. My school is a Title I school with more than 70% of our students on free or reduced-price lunch. Our students are composed mainly of minority groups who come from low socio-economic background. Often they are at a disadvantage because they have difficulty providing for themselves the required resources they need to be competitive in school. To be successful in calculus, my students need to constantly practice their learning and acquired skills and knowledge by doing homework, which more often than not requires a graphing calculator. I would like to have extra calculators that I can check out to them to help them with their homework. This project will help decrease my worries that my students will not be able to do their homework because they do not have the required resource they need at home. It is also my hope, that they take ownership of these so they may be motivated to do their best in this very challenging subject.
needStatement: My students need 3 calculators that I can check out to them so that they may be able to do their homework and other assignments outside of my classroom.

name: Technological Advantages For The Development Of Literacy
description: My students understand that Common Core State Standards has changed what is expected from them. Technology is not the future, because it is already here. The use of technology allows our students to become engage in complex texts and become life-long learners. My students are in a Chicago Public School which has an enrollment of 1,350 students, with 88% of them being low-income and 32% English language learners. My students love to use technology whenever they get the chance because many do not have much technology when they leave the school. As educators who are able to buy certain technological devices, we tend to forget that many of our students do not have that opportunity. Technology is the new resource that engages our students and challenges them academically. Every Monday my students read differentiated articles and answer questions about the article using an online program called Teen Biz. There is a huge problem with implementing this program for all of my students because we do not have enough netbooks for my students. My classes range from 33-38 students! I have to allow my students to use my personal tablet and laptop because we only have 30 netbooks. I also have to send two students to two different classroom to use a desktop. Even with all of these accommodations, there is always at least 2 or 3 students that are not able to do Teen Biz because we do not have enough netbooks. Although some of my students use their cellphones to complete the articles and questions, the small screen on the phones is not beneficial to reading long articles and answering questions. The use of the requested tablets will also serve as an additional resource for my ELL's and struggling readers with the use of specific apps. The tablets will also serve as additional research devices. Honestly, it is a struggle to implement Teen Biz because we need more technological devices. The tablets will allow more students to do Teen Biz activities and improve their literacy skills. Technology motivates and engages all students, regardless of their academic level.
