Since I teach over 200 primary students who range from ESE Pre- Kindergarten to Second Grade in the arts, these materials are cost-effective. The students can create pinch pot bowls, animals, food items, monsters, people and more. They can even embellish their play-dough or clay creations by using sequins, wiggle eyes, straws, popsicle sticks and pipe cleaners. The students will learn self-expression along with having the freedom to create art which is important. The play sand will help meet the sensory needs of my ESE students. Students will feel successful using these art materials in the art room because they will receive immediate rewards from creation. Most of my students have never experienced working with play-dough or play sand due to their backgrounds. I want to bring them these experiences. These are basic materials needed for a strong art program.I know my students will enjoy exploring and creating something new with these materials. These supplies will also help my students develop their fine motor skills for writing. I hope you consider supporting this project for my wonderful primary art students
needStatement: My students need play-doh, dough extruders, play sand and trays to help explore and create. These items will also help with sensory and fine motor skills in the art room.

name: If You Can't Make the Room Bigger....
description: Imagine sharing your work space with someone who spreads out all over your space! Imagine needing to get up and move, but having no place to go! We would like to replace our large tables with some single desks. We need to have some sensory breaks! Our school is +90% autistic, currently grades K -10, expanding to K - 12 in a few years. We have sensory breaks every 15-30 minutes, which can be difficult in our small spaces. Our class size is kept at 16 or less, but with a full class and 8 tables, the classrooms do not have room for any movement. We have a wonderful school where everyone works to create a loving learning space for students who are just trying to make it through life. Many of our students know they are in a safe environment, and are working so hard to succeed. We want to help them on their path to their wonderful futures. Our staff works together as a team, using the same expectations for all of our students, yet treating all of our students as individuals. In this specialized environment we can watch our students blossom! With our current tables, the room set-up only allows for different walking spaces. By removing some of the larger tables, and putting in the smaller desks, we can arrange the space so we have an open area where the kids can grab a pillow and read a book, play a game with friends, or just have a mini dance party! Our tables are heavy and bulky, and take time to push to the walls, losing either valuable academic time, or limiting the sensory break. Smaller desks will be easier to move if necessary, or by just taking up less floor space, we are going to create more of an open area. Working with students on the autism spectrum, it becomes necessary to create an atmosphere that is uncluttered. The open floor space allows for less congestion, and less distraction. Some of our students have executive functioning issues. Containing their things in the smaller space will help with their organization as well! Having the additional space by replacing the bulky tables, our students will be able to access sensory breaks in an uncluttered environment. At the same time, our larger tables can be moved to our new building addition, and used as work tables in the new library. This will be a win-win for many students.
needStatement: My students need to be able to move around in their classroom. We have large tables that we would like to replace with ten single desks.

name: We Measure Up In Life
description: In life, we have to measure up to a lot of things. It helps when the students have the tools to do so. My students will do a unit on measuring soon. Since they are so young, they don't understand what an inch is or what a foot is, (except for the ones they walk with.) So I would like to help them to understand our basic units of measuring. With these items my students will be able to measure so many things. The tape measuring will introduce them to inches. The place value blocks actually help with measuring in centimeters. The children count the squares on the blocks and measure things with them. The 2-D and 3-D shapes will introduce them to the different shapes in geometry. These donations will greatly add to the fun of learning math. I try to incorporate manipulatives everyday in my math lessons so that my students have that tactile learning as well as auditory learning. These measurement tools will make abstract lessons more concrete for them. They will be able to measure using centimeters, inches and feet and understand what those measurements mean.
needStatement: My students need measurement tools such as geometric shapes, linking cubes, measuring tapes, and place value blocks.

name: Bring Me Some Technology
description: We are trying our hardest to keep up with technology in our class. My students don't have computer access at home. Most of them only come in contact with technology when they are in school. Unfortunately, we don't have enough technology to go around. They do enjoy the computers that we do have, when they work, which is not everyday. With this iPad we will be able to have our guided reading using technology. Our groups consist of 6-7 students and this would help us to share the technology amongst each other. They will be able to go on educational websites, such as ScootPad and Raz-Kids. Both sites will help them immensely with their reading comprehension. Our classroom would benefit greatly from added technology. In addition to my lessons, they will also gain more knowledge from the various websites that would be designated for them. BrainPop, Quizizz, Kahoot and ABCMouse are all different websites that my students would be able to go on and learn from.
needStatement: My students need an iPad.

name: It's a Beautiful (Clean and Healthy) Day in the Classroom!
description: Imagine trying to complete your school work while your tummy is rumbling because the last time you ate was last night. What if you needed a tissue for your runny nose...but had to use toilet paper or a paper towel? Healthy and happy kids make for bright and healthy learners. My students come from a very low socioeconomic status rural area in North Dakota. Little things, like getting a tissue when their nose is runny, or counting the minutes until lunch because the last time they ate something substantial was the day before school, plague my students on a daily basis. It is difficult for them to focus on their studies and learning when they are dealing with rumbly tummies. Most of my students do not even have essentials such as Kleenex or pencils to use during class. I want to distribute the snack during my reading group in the morning. This will tide the students over until lunch time so they can focus on their reading, and not their tummies. A vacuum, hand sanitizer, and cleaning wipes will help ensure my students will stay healthy throughout the school year. Little things such as Kleenex, pencils, and a paper sharpener are things my students wish they had on a daily basis. My students will become become better learners and will be able to focus when their normal, everyday, daily needs are being met. The students will be able to focus on reading and vocabulary, and not on growling tummies and pencils. The student's lives will be tremendously affected by this donation. Students have a really hard time focusing on reading when they are worried about how far away lunch is. Students will be able to not worry about the inability to have sharpened pencils during class time when they know they will have access to one in the classroom. A clean classroom not only keeps students healthy, but it will keep moral and general attitude positive.
needStatement: My students need everyday needs such as snacks, hand sanitizer, Kleenex, an electric pencil sharpener, and a vacuum to ensure we can all get through our day happy, healthy, and full!

name: iPads Helping Monitor Learning And Receive Specific Assistance
description: 'Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.' -Benjamin Franklin. My students are a great group of kids who are all striving to reach academic success. The majority of my students are struggling readers who need additional support to help them reach success. I have a very diverse group of students that are all excited about school and ready to learn. We are in a low-income, high poverty area where the majority of our students qualify for free or reduced price lunch. A lot of students also have parents or family members serving in the military. My students are very supportive of one another and want to succeed within our classroom and within life. As a teacher, providing my students with additional items to support their learning, is quite expensive. This is why I am seeking out your help. With the two iPads we are requesting, we will use them to monitor students online and to access learning sites such as IXL and Raz-kids. These sites allow teachers the ability to see how students are doing and what they are struggling with. My students and I will both use these iPads to monitor their learning on these sites and provide assistance when needed. iPads are very portable and will allow use to move about the classroom freely to provide specific support each student. This project will help make learning fun, meaningful, and more engaging. It will also allow students to receive more specific and direct feedback from myself and other students within the class. All donations are truly appreciated. Thank you for supporting us on our journey!
needStatement: My students need two iPads with cases to help us monitor our learning.

name: Reading Opens the World to Kindergarteners!
description: 'The more that you read, the more that you know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.' -Dr. Seuss Kindergarteners in this classroom are ready to learn and open up a world of opportunity and learning. With a great start to their educational path, they can do anything they choose! The kindergarteners in my classroom come from ethnically and racially diverse backgrounds. Many speak English as a second language and are refugees to the country. We are Title 1 school and many children receive reduced-price lunch. They are excited to learn and love being at school! My students need engaging books and manipulatives that capitalize on their experience and interests. These materials will be used in our classroom library to help them practice their budding reading skills independently and with partners so that they can reach their reading potential. Kindergarten sets a foundation for school success. In kindergarten, many reading skills are taught, but children learn the best through hands-on activities and need books to read at their own levels. These leveled books and manipulatives will provide students the opportunity to practice their skills and learn to love reading! Students need access to engaging text that represents their own experiences, interests, and culture. Currently, our library is stocked with few books that reflect the students in the room. These new materials will engage our little readers so that they learn that books reflect themselves and reading is for everyone. Because they are leveled, the ability to differentiate for all learners comes to life. Differentiated instructional strategies best meet the needs of each individual child.
needStatement: My students need engaging books with storage bins and manipulatives that capitalize on their experiences and abilities. Reading can open doors for kids - let's share with them the world!

name: Stools for Students
description: I currently teach in a high poverty school. We could really use some stools instead of the current chairs that I have now. Students currently lean back and are unsafe. I would like to provide my wiggly students with a stool that they can't lean back on, but that they can still sit safely upon. My kids are really great kids. They are funny, caring and they work really hard, even though many of them struggle outside of school with just the basics of life. I have been trying to meet the needs of my more wiggly kids, by giving them stools instead of chairs. I would like to provide them with a stool so that they stop pushing back on their chairs, which is unsafe. I think that stools would help with this problem. Thank you for helping out my kids. I appreciate it greatly. My students need stools chairs. For my students, the basic chair is not always useful. I would love to see none of my students push back on their chairs. I would like to be able to have the option to allow for those that can't stop, to have another alternative. This would help me as a teacher greatly. I would love the expensive wiggle chairs, but those would be something everyone would want and they are very expensive. For my kids a small stool could make all the difference by allowing them to be safe at all times in my classroom. I would also appreciate it since I worry about them hurting themselves and don't want to make them stand instead. A stool is a great alternative to my daily dilemma.
needStatement: My students need stools, instead of chairs. I have several students that would benefit from a stool instead of a chair. They lean back and are unsafe currently.

name: Traffic Rounder Fix-up!
description: Project Based Learning is a blast! We are integrating academics while instilling in our students that they can make a difference in their community. Their community is filled with strife, poverty and crime, but they can make it a better place, and be proud of their efforts. Our school sits the midst of a gang zones, crime and high poverty rate (95%), yet these wonderful students come to school eager to learn and with smiles on their faces. We have a variety of ethnicities (in which Caucasian are a minority). Teachers are here at our school because they chose to be, not because they have to be, which results in a high effort to help students in academics, social, and emotional distress. We value teamwork and celebrate success and growth, not matter how small they are. Our third grade team has chosen to renovate the traffic circle near our school for our Spring Project. Students are reading about various types of plants, experimenting with seedlings, and creating a landscaping plan to be voted on. We have a store donating dirt, and now we need a gift certificate to purchase plants. A master gardener speaker will explain to us the different types of plants, and what might be good go our traffic circle. Students then will do further research into the plants presented, and vote on what kind of plants they would like to include in community traffic circle. They will have to take into consideration the city's restrictions for height, and develop a landscaping plan. This project will help students know that they can make a difference in their community, and develop pride for their neighborhood. Currently, the traffic rounder is full of weeds and some trash. The completed project integrates reading about plants, math for spacing, and writing in our plant journals about our project step by step. This finished traffic circle will give students pride and a sense of accomplishment every time they walk by it. High effort and hard work equals success!
needStatement: My students need a gift certificate to our nearest gardening center for plants. We are renovating the traffic circle near our school.

name: 5th-Grade Close Reading for Literacy
description: In every content area, everyday, I ask my students 'WHY?' or 'Please explain your thinking?' or 'Let's use text evidence prove our thinking?'. I work in a Title 1 School that has a wonderful group of dedicated staff believing every child can learn. The majority of students are coming from a financially challenging backgrounds. The students, even though they have challenges at home, are happy to come to school and determined to participate in learning. In today's technology, fast paced, standards-based driven educational world, the demands on students as learners is higher than ever. However, in my particular classroom (and many other classrooms in my building), the students are knowledge hungry and not afraid to struggle to improve their learning. The students in my room need to read a variety of complex texts for multiple purposes. The students also need to find evidence to support their learning. Having the evidence kits will help my students read nonfiction and fiction text while being able to find key details, compare and contrast, summarize,discuss vocabulary and find the theme for multiple grade level texts. During the school day, we will use white boards for multiple reasons and in multiple subject areas. With the white boards the students can practice their work and show their thinking. Students also hold up white boards in whole group lessons so the teacher can get a snapshot of learning and understanding to provide more intense intervention/small group time when needed. Currently, my school does not have a traditional literacy program. As teachers, we are finding our own materials that increase rigor and engagement in the classroom. The materials I chose will be able to increase my instruction with grade level text focusing on the area of strength I would like my students to achieve.
needStatement: My students need 30 dry erase boards and a variety of kits with reading passages that develop comprehension skills while increasing knowledge on how to explain and prove their thinking with text evidence.

name: Electronic Exploration of Literacy
description: It's 2016, and my students are told that mastery of technology is the key to their success in the future. Yet my classroom only has one very old, very slow desktop computer. How are my students supposed to research authors, create new films, explore, or engage with all media without technology? My students are 10th graders with great curiosity and desire to be successful in school. They come from a variety of ethnic, linguistic, and socioeconomic backgrounds. There is great disparity in most of my classrooms. While a few students may be well off and have ample access to technology at home, most only use the computers they have access to at school or the public library. With a recently failed bond, there is no new technology coming to our district and in the meantime, my students are falling behind students in other, more technologically affluent districts. With the current demands of our standards, college readiness indicators, and our global society, it is imperative that my students have constant access to good technology. They will use the Chromebook laptops and licenses to research topics or authors we are studying in class novels. They will produce professional presentations for their peers. They will learn how to decide whether a source they find online is valid or useful. They will watch a variety of online media (poetry performances, film clips, advertisements). They will be able to write often and share their writing with peers to get revision. They will be prepared for their future. Students who have materials that they know are useful to them (both now and in the future) feel empowered and valued. My students deserve to be given these Chromebooks that will help them to produce their best work. They are tools that will remove limitation on their learning.
needStatement: My students need six Chromebook laptops and licenses for our classroom.

name: Let's Get Drumming! Empowering Students Through Art
description: In accordance with our motto 'Sing, Move, and Play EVERY DAY!' and the Georgia Performance Standards, students in my music classes get to learn music through simply having fun in 3 different areas: singing, moving, and instrument playing. Every day I am impressed with my students' musical abilities. It saddens me that, due to the low income area of our school, many of these students do not have the opportunity of exploring their talents outside our music classroom. Therefore, I believe it is so important for me to give them as many experiences and paths to explore and refine their inner musician as I possibly can! I love using music to create connections to culture and history. We have a diverse population of students at my school, and recently we've been getting more and more students from African countries where drumming plays a big part in their culture. I would love to make these students feel empowered to share their culture with us through the art of drumming with tubanos! Building up our selection of drums will help every student get a turn to play and explore different drumming techniques. This will take our music program to the next level, helping us appreciate the music of all cultures!
needStatement: My students need tubanos to embrace their African culture.

name: It's a Bird! It's a Plane! It's a Comic Book!
description: Ever read a book you can't resist? Graphic novels are the most popular books in our classroom!Our students come from a high-poverty area here in the Midwest. Our student population is very diverse with families from all over the world! Many of our students don't have access to simple luxuries like their own books to read. We try to provide a safe, engaging learning environment so that every child is successful in their own way. With our new superhero reading area in our classroom, students are begging to take a break with a good book. These graphic novels will give us hours of entertainment while helping to increase our reading fluency and vocabulary. What better way to improve than with an awesome comic book?! These graphic novels will increase our students' love and passion to read. Many students spend hours poring through a graphic novel, not even realizing the depth of reading they're doing. We would love to add new books to our library and make reading fun!
needStatement: My students need graphic novels to add engaging and entertaining new books to our class library!

name: Chromebooks for the Classroom
description: My students want to be prepared for whatever path they choose after high school, so they are enthusiastic about the idea of being tech-savvy and tech-literate. Being tech-savvy and tech-literate will not only prepare students wanting to continue their education post high school, but it also makes them more marketable when looking and qualifying for careers. However, it is difficult with the limitations of access to technology in both the classroom and at home. Currently, the access to technology at my school is a challenge. Teachers are only allowed to reserved the computers for 4 days in each month based on a first-come-first-serve basis. Thirty Chromebooks would give each student access to technology everyday in the classroom. It would also allow them to authentically engage in the learning and it creates equity because some students do not have access to technology at home, making it difficult to achieve at the same level as their peers. The charging station carts will allow me to store the Chromebooks in a safe place in the classroom, allowing them to last longer and maintain it's quality. Donations will immensely improve the quality and access to learning in my classes. In this day and age, being tech-savvy and tech-literate is essential for college and career readiness. I want to set my students up for success in whatever path they choose for their future.
needStatement: My students need 30 Chromebook laptops with a Google EDU Management Console License and two charging carts to help them with researching and the writing process.

name: 'Mo' Elephant and Piggie Books Please!
description: Remember when you learned to read and you couldn't wait to get your hands on a new book? My students especially love to read new Mo Willems books. When we read his stories my students literally roll on the floor laughing with excitement and they echo my every word as I read aloud. I teach an inclusion class of 21 wonderfully sweet kindergartners. Our school district is large and the population of students is very diverse both demographically and ethnically. The children are eager to learn, eager to help, and especially eager to show off everything they have learned. We are asking for a library of Mo Willems storybooks to use during an author study in our Reading and Writing Workshops. The children will be reading the books as part of a book club. They will also learn to write more engaging stories as they attempt to some of the techniques Mo utilizes in his stories. The children will learn techniques such as adding dialogue through speech bubbles, creating a series of characters, and using different font sizes to demonstrate emotions. Mo Willems' Elephant and Piggie series and his Pigeon series are just right books for Kindergarten readers. When I use them to teach my students it ALWAYS gets them excited to read and write. This project will provide my students with the resources they need to build their academic confidence and to get them excited about reading.
needStatement: My students need Elephant and Piggie plush toys and books for a Mo Willems author study.

name: Rock, Paper, Scissors...Kindle Fires!
description: We love to learn! My first graders are working hard every day, and so am I! These six and seven year olds are learning to read, have become writers and have made big gains in math. We are busy all day long, and there's still much to do. My students are in first grade, and enjoy coming to school. They come from a wide variety of living situations. Some come from two parent homes, some from single parents, and some with multiple generations, or multiple families living in one apartment. Some of my students come from families who support public education and encourage their students to do their best while at school. Some of my students live with families that do not help them with their homework, or who appear not to be supportive of education. While at school, I hold high expectations for each student in their behavior and their academics, no matter their home life. We learn together, we work through problems together, and we celebrate successes together. Helping my students learn the skills of reading and math will help them for their entire lives. I am asking for five Kindle Fires kids Editions. These come with a free year of Amazon Free Time Unlimited and a kids proof case. We will be able to use this for reading and math practice. There are many apps available such as books that are read to the students to help them learn fluency, and math games that can reinforce skills taught in class. I plan to use these during reading and math groups. This donation of 5 Kindle Fires will allow my students to practice important academic skills and be exposed to using a touch screen, building their technology skills too. We are coming to state testing, and again this year it is a computer based test. This will continue in the years to come, I'm sure of it. These materials will allow the students more time with technology, and will help prepare them for tests, as well as giving them time to practice reading and math activities. Some students have little or no access to technology in their homes, so the practice at school is critical to help them prepare to show what they know on the state assessments.
needStatement: My students need more experience with technology, these Kindle Fires, will help improve their reading, math and technology skills.

name: Let's Build a Library MakerSpace
description: Our school is the smallest public secondary school in Massachusetts. We are a farming community and I aspire to empower students to reach beyond their tiny, isolated town and interact globally. Building a Makerspace will provide them with the tools to begin their discoveries. My students complain that school doesn't prepare them for the real world. They work on farms or in the barns before school and arrive having spent time in that agricultural world. They mostly do well in school, but that disconnect impacts them and makes this portion of their education seem pointless. Our tiny school does well to provide the basics, but our limited funding can only support small classes, nothing else. My students are thirsty to learn meaningful skills and I yearn to bring the real world to our school. With the requested littleBits Electronics Deluxe Kit my students will learn about electronic circuitry. They'll learn how to build various devices with the Raspberry Pi Electronic Starter Kit, the Arduino Starter Kit and the LittleBits Electronics Kit. They will explore basic programming with the Kano Computer Kit and robotics with Ozobots. Ultimately, they will begin inventing new designs with the Makey Makey set and the Teknikio Activating Origami and Fabtronic Sewing Kits. I envision my students designing and building computers and robots. They can create electrical devices and learn how circuitry works. I will facilitate a new class during our activity periods, a place where students come to create. They can tinker with tools and gadgets, practice programming and problem solving, etc. This exploration will feed a hunger they may not know they need. This makerspace will foster confident builders and thinkers, creators of all sorts. Once they have gained a basic understanding of the necessary components, they will begin to design their own inventions. They will visit various websites to learn more about computer design and robotics, and become part of a global conversation. Donations to this project will provide students with necessary tools to begin their journey. Their successes will be shared throughout our community, so stakeholders will become aware of what engineering and coding projects interests our students. This first step can become a jump off point for future funding from the community. This project will impact my students' lives by gaining empowerment, a safe space to explore, and finally, seeing more students entering college to pursue STEM careers.
needStatement: My students need a littleBits Electronics Deluxe Kit, a Kano Computer Kit, The Official Arduino Starter Kit, an Ozobot Dual Pack, one Makey Makey, a Hacking Electronics Starter Kit, a Raspberry Pi Cookbook and Starter Kit, and Teknikio Activating Origami and Fabtronic Sewing Kits.

name: Bilingual Students Need Books!
description: Reading is like riding a bicycle--the more you practice, the better you get. However, without books, you can't read. If you don't practice reading, you cannot develop your literacy skills. I work with students who need access to books in their native language, so they can read, as they learn English. My students are middle schoolers in 4th though 8th grades. All are immigrants from other countries, are learning English, have relocated to an inner-city urban area, and are in an over-crowded school. Most of them are Spanish speakers, and come from families who have limited or no English speakers as well. Most students come from low-income families and qualify for free lunch status. The literacy skills with which they arrive to school vary from very beginning to highly developed. They are still expected to read and keep up with the classroom curriculum, however, and this is very difficult to do in a language they are still in the process of learning. My students are eager to learn and wish to adapt to the culture and language quickly. This is why I need to provide them with access to quality literature in a language they understand. My school district has frozen budgets, which means I am very limited as to what I can purchase for my students, though they need instructional materials. Students will utilize these books to check them out for independent reading, as nightly reading is required as homework. Independent reading at one's instructional level will develop many reading skills, such as comprehension, synthesizing information, questioning, inferencing, summarizing, fluency, and accuracy. Additionally, independent reading will develop students' vocabulary, even in their native language, and this knowledge will transfer to and enhance their English acquisition. Students are often asked to respond to their reading in writing, and frequently they must refer to their texts, but if they cannot truly comprehend what they read because of a language barrier, they will not continue to develop any literacy skills at all because they do not have appropriate materials to use. Books for my students will improve their literacy dramatically, since I only have a modest collection in varying levels for 15 limited-English students. Our school library has a very limited selection of Spanish books too. Students are expected to read daily in class and for homework, and the small selection that I have compiled is not sufficient for these students' use throughout the year. My students will be able to develop their literacy skills at a higher level, even as they learn English.
needStatement: My students need books in Spanish so that they can continue to develop their reading skills in their native language as they learn English.

name: Nonfiction Reading Equals Student Success!
description: My students have independent reading time approximately 30 minutes daily. It is very important for them to have a variety of nonfiction texts to read! Our classroom library is in short supply of Levels J-N. Adding approximately 60 new nonfiction titles will impact them as they build knowledge! My students are bright and eager to learn. The majority have excellent family support for reading. They come from a variety of backgrounds and many have traveled extensively. Most of my students read fiction. ( Research shows that on average elementary children read 4 times more fiction than nonfiction). They are able to focus and keep their mind in the book, when they are reading books on their level. Upon receipt of the nonfiction books, I will check the level using a leveling app or book leveling website and place them in bins accordingly. These will be placed in our classroom library. Students shop for books once a week and place them in a book box. They read these during independent reading time. Students will be able to choose books that they are able to read proficiently and comprehend. The donations will enable students to have a variety of high-interest topics to choose from. The benefits of students reading nonfiction are numerous: *learn new vocabulary*assist with research skills*learn about important people in all cultures (biographies)*recognize/interpret nonfiction features such as charts, graphs, maps, flow charts, etc. *choose motivating books to increase knowledge about our real world
needStatement: My students need nonfiction books in our classroom library! We need a variety of high-interest topics across Levels J-N.

name: Classroom Essentials Needed
description: My students are active and they get tired of sitting in a regular desk. They want to stand or sit on a stool and they also want games to play when they are done with their work. The bistro table, stools would help them take away their jitters and to be able to focus. My students come from a high poverty area in which 61% of the students that attend this school are on free and reduced lunch. We are only an hour away from the beach and major towns that offer many exciting events, but some of my students have never had the opportunity to go and enjoy those things. Some of my students this year were not able to even bring in basic school supplies for the school year. My students are active and they get tired of sitting in a regular desk. They want to stand or sit on a stool and they also want games to play when they are done with their work. The bistro table, stools, would help take away their jitters and to be able to focus. Focusing and completing their work is very important. They need to be able to move around the room and by changing where they are sitting will help with that. We also have Kindle Fires in class but we don't have cases for them, so I want them to last longer if they are accidentally dropped. My students' focus will improve. The quality of work will increase and they will not be as distracted because they can move where they are sitting. They will also be able to play games and take a break from academics and learn cooperative learning skills and how to work with others.
needStatement: My students need standing desks, cases for the Kindle Fires and mailboxes for homework and important papers.

name: Let's Get Organized!
description: Studies have shown that organized work spaces lead to increase productivity, focus, and efficiency. This is also applies to the classroom. I teach a group of 32 fourth graders. They are super eager and excited to learn as much as they can. The students come from a high poverty community where there is a high degree of gang presence. Our school is a Title I school, and a large majority of our students receive free or reduced lunch. Many of our students speak a language other than English at home and will be the first in their family to go to college. My students need their own space to store all their learning tools, such as their notebooks, folders, and most importantly, all the books they have chosen to practice their reading skills. With these seats sacks, the students will have easy and convenient access to their supplies. This will make our transitions significantly more efficient and increase my students' focus on learning. We currently have large tables, which are great for fostering group work amongst my students; however, they lack storage space. This means much of my students' supplies end up on the floor or spread out on the tables. The seat sacks will help us declutter our classroom.
needStatement: My students need seat sack organizers to store their books and other supplies.

name: Making 'Cents' of Math
description: Imagine barely speaking English and having to sit through a state mathematics exam that consists entirely of word problems. That's what it's like for my students. My classroom consists of students who are primarily English language learners. Many of the students come from families who are migrant farmers. Their parents value education, but lack the ability to help their children. These students are eager to learn, however it is extremely difficult for these students to solve word problems when they have difficulty comprehending them. My students require hands-on materials in order to help them make 'cents' of word problems. Some of these activities include capacity centers, mathematics array dry erase boards, place value puzzles, and fraction puzzles. These materials will be used as part of whole group and small group instruction. In addition, interactive word problem books will be used for independent practice and homework as reinforcement. These materials will give my students the opportunity to be successful on their end of the year state assessments. My students need hands-on experiences in order to help them comprehend the word problems.
needStatement: My students need math activity centers and practice books in order to prepare them for the rigor of the new state tests.

name: Kinders Want To Add Rhythm and Art To Literacy
description: What better way for me to be Empowering Students Through Art than by incorporating music and art into our literacy block! I teach in a K-5 magnet school and I have twenty-two enthusiastic, fun-loving kindergarten students this year. The students at my school come from a wide range of family dynamics. Some live in traditional households while others live with single parents or with extended family. My students' economic situations are just as varied as their family dynamics and more than sixty percent of our school qualifies for free lunch. A large percentage of our school population are also English Language Learners. Regardless of these factors, every one of my students always possesses a passion for learning, exploring, and creating! My students LOVE their specials classes, especially art and music. I want to bring more of those subjects into our everyday learning with the materials requested in this project. The rhythm sticks and the drum would be used in learning sight words and counting patterns. We currently use a technique in which students tap the letters of a word on their arm then slide down as they say the whole word - how much fun would that be to do with a rhythm stick or to the beat of a drum instead?! The art supplies, especially the watercolors and tissue papers, will be used to mimic the artistic style of Eric Carle's collage. We will also use the art supplies to create characters from Dr. Seuss's beloved books. The word builder boards will help us learn how to blend sounds into words and help improve our reading. Finally, we need a remote to use with our Amazon Echo we received from a previous project. Thank you for reading about our classroom project for materials that will allow us to incorporate art and music into our learning. My students will love learning sight words with the rhythm sticks and making Dr. Seuss characters and Eric Carle collages! Together we will be Empowering Students Through Art!
needStatement: My students need rhythm sticks, art materials, and books to integrate art and music into literacy.

name: Sensory Academics Create Joyful Learning!
description: Every day, students are greeted with a smile, a song, and lots of learning. We integrate as much of this learning into engaging activities throughout the day, which includes a lot of active learning. Sensory learning materials are essential to allow all students to learn through play. We are a Title One and special education cohort classroom, which provides our community with a diverse group of kids with diverse life experiences. Often, these kids are new to our country, have limited English, or limited resources. Additionally, I am a co-teacher for a group of ASD students, who require special activities that integrate their sensory needs into their academic learning. Students in this classroom, both regular and special ed, thrive when practicing and learning their academic skills through play and sensory activities. The sensory bins, which are pre-made with letters, numbers, and shapes, are perfect to engage our learners with their academic skills. The magnetic board, shapes, and building tools, also allow for academic skills to be practiced and learned through play. This project will make a huge difference for my students. With the inclusion of sensory academic materials to help them learn through play and with their needs in mind, all kids can thrive. Your donation to this project will help all of these students learn joyfully!
needStatement: My students need learning items like alphabet and number sensory bins, pegboard activities, and create and design kits to help them learn through sensory play.

name: Headphones for Individual Learning
description: My students use computer programs daily to assist them with math and reading. My students are the best! They are in the sixth, seventh and eighth grades. They are special education children with specific learning disabilities, other health impairments, intellectual disabilities, and autism. They attend a rural middle school in South Carolina. We are also a Title I school. The majority of the children from our school come from middle-class and lower-income families. After instruction, during reading and math time, my students use computer programs to assist them with basic skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) in math and (recognizing letters, phonics, fluency and comprehension) in reading. The headphones will assist with the noise level in the classroom. The student's will be able to practice the basic skills in math and reading without being distracted or distracting another student in the classroom. Their reading and math skills will improve with practice.
needStatement: My students need 10 headphones for individualized learning.

name: Give My Students More Time to Take on the Day!
description: I am a reading teacher that teaches multiple grade levels. I teach 4th, 5th and 6th grade reading at a charter school in central Minnesota. Being a charter school, we lack a lot of the basic supplies you may find in a traditional classroom. Teachers need to be creative and flexible! As a teacher, it is my responsibility to provide for my students as best as I can. I spend a lot of time researching new ways to engage my students. Through the years, I have found one thing to be true; if you can make learning fun, the kids will be very willing participants! I try to do just that, each and every day. I think reading is like going on an adventure. In fact I tell the students this quote: 'A person who reads lives a thousand lives; a person who doesn't read lives only one.' I try to take my students on an adventure every day through our reading. Because we lack the funding of a traditional public school, sometimes we have to go without basic supplies and materials that you may normally find in a classroom. For example, we currently make due with very old and worn out pencil sharpeners. Because the students switch rooms, we take a lot of time in the morning making sure we are prepared for the day. An upgraded electric pencil sharpener would literally shave loads of time off our morning routine! We also do our best to stay as organized as we can. Our school is made out of an old hospital building, so our rooms are small. The kids do not have their own cubbies to keep important documents and homework in. Having those would also help us save time by keeping us organized and ready for both the school day and the evening at home. And every minute saved is more time we put towards reaching our academic goals! These items would literally change our everyday routines and give us more time for the important stuff like building friendships, discovering new ideas, and of course learning! Every minute we don't have to spend trying get a pencil sharpened or sorting through stacks of papers is a minute we can use to help these kids reach their potential, both in and out of the classroom.
needStatement: My students need two pencil sharpeners and cubbies to help organize our classroom and get us ready to take on each day!

name: Flexible Seating for a Student-Centered Class
description: In third grade, students are expected to be sitting for longer periods of time than they have before. Third grade is the first testing grade in our state. This will give them the freedom to move around more rather than just sitting at their desk all day. A little movement can really wake you up! My students are in third grade at a high-poverty school. They are wonderful students who love reading. They're also very active so they need movement to keep them engaged. I let them stand behind their chairs or sit on the floor to work, but I would love to be able to give them a comfortable place to sit. Flexible seating will offer this to them. My students will have the choice to sit where they would like. Right now, they stand behind their desks or sit on the floor to work. At the beginning of the year, or when I get the seating squares, Wobble chairs and exercise balls, we will go over how they are to be properly used and the expectations I have for them working in different areas. Student-centered classrooms are very successful and I hope this change will help my students become more focused and engaged. This will make a huge difference in my classroom! The freedom of choice, even for elementary students, is very powerful. They have control over something. Third grade is the first year they are tested and I see several of them struggling to focus. They work very well with movement. I hope to see overall focus and scores go up because of this small change.
needStatement: My students need seating squares, Wobble chairs and exercise balls.

name: Music Practice Rooms...Outdoors!!
description: My students impress me everyday with their creativity in musical performance and skills. When given the opportunity to share this talent with outside the classroom doors, they are always ready. They are eager for the time and space to perfect their talents. My students are the most talented, brilliant, comical, entertaining and kind-hearted students that I have ever had an opportunity to work with. Our small school is the hub of the rural area of our county. We are a Title I school which simply means that many students come from low income households. They are not always afforded the same opportunities as neighboring schools in our district. In our music classroom, we do not have any practice rooms for which students can go and focus on individual practice. Usually when students practice, they are distracted by each others practicing. Fortunately, our school sits on acres of beautiful land right next to the river. Students enjoy being outside practicing. The stand and chair cart will make it easy to transport equipment in and outside of the classroom Having a music stand and chair dolly will allow students to get more instruction out of the hour of class time we are allotted. It takes a lot of time for students to not only set-up their instruments and music, but to also carry their own chair and stand inside and out leaves a minimal amount of time to work at their skills. This will give students faster transition times in class.
needStatement: My students need a music stand and chair dollies to safely and easily transport equipment outside while having individual practice.

name: Special Supplies for Special Kids!
description: My classroom is a multi-grade special education classroom. Finding a way to present age appropriate materials that challenge my students, without being too difficult, is a struggle. I teach students that have varying physical and developmental delays. My school is a low income school that has suffered from budget cuts made to Oklahoma education. My students learn best in a structured environment that has more hands on materials. The problem is that most of our materials are either outdated, or missing many pieces. My students will use the requested materials to help them understand the sequence of putting words together, and then sentences. The materials help present this very abstract concept in a more concrete, hands on, manner. The magnetic letters, as well as flip charts, will allow even my students who have poor fine motor skills, to be able to construct a sentence. In the past my students have been dismissed, it has been assumed that they aren't able to read or write just because of their diagnoses. I think these products such as Following Directions Building Set - Level 1, Magnetic Sight-Word Sentence Board, and Look What I Can Do! Vocabulary Center will help me prove to them, and everyone else, that they are not only capable, but that they can excel!
needStatement: My students need concrete visual activities for centers to help them understand how to put words and sentences together.

name: Integrating Speech & Language Therapy Into The EC Classroom
description: Daily we challenge students to be the best they can be! Not every child speaks the same, but all students have the ability to communicate. For our active EC age group, we continually raise the bar, with the family's engagement, to provide quality, creative and meaningful learning opportunities. Our diverse preschool classrooms includes learners ages 3-6 years. The students in our program present an array of learning styles and learning needs. We have 4 blended and 1 specialized classroom, where children participate in regular preschool curriculum, and students with specialized needs and supports are assisted through IEP programming. Within our classrooms, approximately half of the students present with delays in the areas of communication: language production, language comprehension, articulation/phonological delays which impact speech intelligibility, and pragmatic language delays. Our students are learning, with adult supports, therapy, interventions, and peer modeling, how to improve overall communication skills. Within our classroom, you will observe students using their words, communication devices, picture boards, picture schedules, social language supports, prompts/supports to assist in sound production, while engaging in meaningful activities with their friends. By obtaining the grant materials, our learners will expand speech and language learning opportunities within their classroom environment! A literacy center, focusing on expanding students receptive, expressive and pragmatic language skills is being developed within each classroom. Access to the materials requested through the grant will provide consistent access and programming to activities which focus on expanding vocabulary, retelling stories, creating stories, describing items, follow directions, increase conceptual knowledge, and assist in question comprehension. Using hands on manipulatives with structured language tasks, in a designated location within each classroom assists the Speech Language Pathologist in modeling, sharing, and training additional educational staff for greater carryover and skill generalization. In addition, students learn and apply social language skills, such as turn taking and conversational exchange, to increase engagement skills with peers. Through generous donations, our classes will have consistent core sets of language materials to promote speech and language carryover activities within the classroom environment. Students will stay in their classrooms for push in therapy services, which will increase language carryover. These center based activities will be part of their natural daily routine, which will provide daily opportunities to expand and develop vocabulary, increase sentence length, and improve literacy knowledge.
needStatement: My students need language and communication activities including Building Language Photo Library, story sequencing cards, and storyteller writing box to improve language skills.

name: Can You Hear Us NOW?
description: This student-led project excites me because as the school's drama coach, I've known for a long time that our school needs a set of wireless microphones for school plays, presentations and productions. Tyler, Macy, Mandy, Hannah, Jaylin and John have researched and found the ones they want. My students developed this idea after becoming very frustrated during our last year's Christmas play production. The audience could not hear the dialog and were lost as to exactly what was happening on stage. Throughout the play, the two working wireless hand-held microphones were passed back and forth interrupting the flow of the program and becoming a huge distraction to both the actors and the audience. The students began asking why we couldn't purchase a set of wireless microphones and when met with the 'it isn't in the budget' reply, began searching for ways to fund this project themselves. I've used donorschoose.org in the past successfully and I pointed them in this direction. I will assist them in promotion of their projects, but as required, most if not all of the work will be performed by these talented 14 year old 8th grade students. Through working on this project, my students have definitely learned to negotiate and work within a team. They have learned to budget money and search for the best price and greatest quality product available within that budget they've set for themselves. In addition, they have learned to write persuasively, which is a huge part of the Writing Core Content of Studies for our state. The students identified the problem themselves, worked on a solution, brought their ideas to me, and then facilitated getting the request completed online for approval. I couldn't ask for a better team of kids focusing on a lost piece of education today... 'drama and the arts'. I'm pleased that the lack of microphones and audience enjoyment has led them to problem solve in real life and I am more than happy to help them in any way I can. If funded, they will also set a great example for other students who come after them with needs that are not met in the regular budget. We are trying to accomplish the acquisition of 8 wireless microphones for our school's program and play productions. Our goal is to raise awareness of the arts and be able to perform for an audience without worrying that our audience members cannot hear what we are saying. If this goal is met, I am sure my teacher will be more encouraged to direct more plays and programs. I think this will be a win-win situation if funded. The more art in a school the better I say! Tyler I plan to be a leader in this project by using social media and my contacts to 'get the word out' about our project. My teacher will assist me with this by typing our proposal and submitting the requests for approval. Once approved, I will work around the clock to keep my contacts and social media friends aware of our great need for wireless microphones at our school. I will also not only share myself, but ask everyone I know to forward the information in case just the right person sees. Macy This project will solve the problem of our audience not being able to hear us in a production without awkwardly handing a hand held wireless microphone back and forth during dialog in a play. In addition, we will feel more professional and not have to worry about dropping a microphone or forgetting a line in a play while passing the one microphone we have to another actor. We will most likely have more productions because they will be enjoyable to watch and perform in as well. Hannah
needStatement: We need wireless microphones for our stage productions in order for our audience to hear us without interrupting the flow of the program.

name: Flexible Seating in Ms. P's Class!
description: Growing up in a Montessori classroom, I learned the benefits of flexible seating. Now, as a teacher in a regular public school classroom, I would love to see my students benefit from the flexible seating options! My students learn best when they are comfortable! These flexible seating options will help them be comfortable in their learning environment and will enhance learning further. My students are hardworking and committed to their learning even though a lot of obstacles are stacked against them on a daily basis. With these flexible seating options such as wobble chairs, a cozy lounger and core stability balls, my students will have the opportunity to learn in a way that is comfortable and appropriate for them. My students will use these materials for work throughout the day. This includes their silent reading time, literature circle time, guided reading time, during whole group instruction, and so much more. There is no doubt that flexible seating options would give my students something to look forward to everyday in my classroom. A place where they feel safe and comfortable will ultimately foster the best learning environment for them.
needStatement: My students need a variety of flexible seating options such as wobble chairs, a cozy lounger and core stability balls in my classroom.

name: Alternative Seating
description: I teach in the lower elementary and have very active students. It is hard for them to sit in a chair at a desk all day. We struggle to sit still and spend most of our day redirecting. Giving them options of seating with movement, I feel will help improve our learning. I have eighteen kindergartners this year and more than likely will move to first grade with them next year. We are in a small town with a high poverty rate. Our elementary is K-5 with two kindergarten classes and one of every other grade except fifth which has two classes as well. Students feel safe at school because they know the routine and know what to expect. We work on building social skills, along with academic skills that are needed to be successful in society. My students will be given the choice of where they sit besides desk and chair. They will have the opportunity to try each flexible seating option that we have and decide what works best for them. They will be allowed to sit in these seats to do their work and it will help them learn to be responsible for their work. Students will be allowed to sit or stand at tables and will have other options as to where to sit. They will be able to choose wiggle seats, crate seats, stability balls, pillows, cushions and comfy chairs. There is a connection between the brain and body, and movement is very important in helping students be engaged, especially those with focus issues and short attention spans. Alternative seating will allow movement, while helping them to stay focused on their work. This project will allow for students to see how their choices affect their learning and how making positive choices will allow them to be successful. These new seating options will also allow movement while learning. Kids are active by nature and need a lot of movement. They will be kinetically learning within the classroom.
needStatement: My students need Cozy Chair and Ottoman, Wobble Chair, and other flexible seating options to help them take responsibility for their own learning while allowing movement.

name: Just for Kicks
description: I want to create a fun and safe learning environment for my students both in school and after school. I want to provide them with opportunities to learn new games and cooperate together to achieve a goal. I also want to challenge them daily to be the best they can be both in and out of the classroom. My students love physical education but we are limited to a few games they are able to play because of lack of equipment. My students come from very diverse situations. Our community is very rural. Most of my students are from single parent homes with little or no income. Ninety- eight percent or more are from homes subsisting on at or below poverty level. I try to teach my students to rise above their problems to be the best they can be. I want to provide many opportunities to learn new games and sports and furthermore cooperation. According to research, students who participate in sports do better in academics than those who do not. Lastly, I want my students to be healthy. Part of being healthy is to move and exercise. My students will use the soccer goals and balls daily during class to learn new skills dealing with the games of soccer and kickball. They will learn to work cooperatively as a team while keeping their bodies healthy and fit. We will also use the balls to play games and relays. I also plan to use these balls as part of an after school program designed to teach kids outside of the classroom. My students will benefit from this project both physically and mentally. My students will become more fit and healthy while increasing their knowledge in the classroom. The equipment will help keep them focused and engaged. I feel that most of all they will learn the importance of cooperation and teamwork.
needStatement: My students need pop-up soccer goals and soccer balls to replace worn out equipment and to be able to play indoor and outdoor sports.

name: Mouse Trapped....Need Touchscreen
description: How can we teach 21st Century without modern technology? Our classroom consists of students who are all identified with severe intellectual and physical disabilities. Most of our day is focused on developing skills in communication and independent functioning. All students are in the Exceptional Student Education program. They have severe intellectual disabilities including Cerebral Palsy, physical impairment, etc. Most of them are coming from very low income families and have difficulty in obtaining up to date technology for children to use at home. Most of the students are non-verbal and require adaptive technology for communication. However, most are able to reach and touch with their hands. Unfortunately, the computer screens in the room are not touch screens. It makes activities and tasks less effective due to the fact that teachers or aides use the assumptions this is what the student want/respond. Students lack skills to use computer mouse or keyboard. A Touch Screen can provide the opportunity for students to use the computer. Programs and activities will become much interesting and will motivate student learning. Students can use the touch screen for many tasks and activities. They can access specialized curriculum such as the Unique Learning Systems, News 2 You, etc. They learn from interactive materials developed for all subjects such as matching or sorting. Making choices, drill and practice can access technology to explore new horizons. Although the touch screen technology has been around for a while, it is used in public areas more for efficiency then in education. This technology can be very effective in education for children with disabilities. Students will not only have a chance to improve academic skills, but also be motivated through games and interactive programs.
needStatement: My students need a Touch Screen Monitor for improving independence and academics. Stroke has limited hand dexterity.

name: Massabesic High School Girls Soccer Program
description: Our girls are motivated, talented, and eager to learn. They are also underfunded. We imagine a future where our soccer goals are not marked by shoes and jersey but by proper equipment. The girls soccer program is made up of honor students, students who give back to the community and students that represent our district in the highest fashion. They are motivated and they never give up in a soccer match. Our school is the 3rd largest district in the state. It is a rural community that represents Maine. The student will use the materials to improve their soccer game. They will use the pop up goals to get better at quick play and placement over power shots. They will use the agility sticks to get faster. By using these materials the soccer program will continues to excel. The donations will improve the all round play of the girls soccer program. But more importantly by seeing that they finally have state of the art equipment that will start to have more confidence in them self's and in the program.
needStatement: My students need the pug mini goals and the agility training sets to better improve their fitness level and soccer abilities

name: Lady Knights Volleyball
description: My overall goal is for my girls to continue to play volleyball after high school. Our biggest challenge is the lack of funding for proper equipment and uniforms, not attending camps and parent support. Majority of my girls face their individual hardships with home life. We do not have family support and volleyball has been their escape and safe haven at the same time. My team is built on being a family. I also faced similar hardship growing up and I am able to relate with each player, so I understand the importance of volleyball. We are more than just a team we are a family. I want the best for my girls and continue to keep them in the volleyball program. I honestly believe that my girls would not be successful in school and their personal lives if it was not for volleyball. I have a very high expectation in school and on the court, but with the amount of love the coaching staff gives, the girls love that sense of being a part of our family. Each player we see as our own daughter. We not only provide the fundamentals of the game but also for life. My girls have matured over the years and they all have maintained their grades staying on honor roll. My students need equipment such as balls, nets, and a net antennae in order for us to keep our volleyball program going. With the proper equipment my girls will be able to practice with the right balls, and the proper height of the net. We will be able to conduct drills that will better in enhance hitting, serving, and passing. With a new net the girls are exposed to right height of the net and we will be able to conduct drills that deal with blocking and hitting. Volleyball is everything to my girls. With donations it will help the coaching staff to better their confidence in them and give them a solid foundation in the skills they need to be successful as they continue on to the next level of volleyball.
needStatement: My students need equipment such as balls, nets, and a net antennae in order for us to keep our volleyball program going.

name: Horseshoe Table for Group Success
description: Mother Teresa explained, 'I can do things you cannot, you can do things I cannot; together we can do great things.' Each of my students brings unique strengths and talents to my class, and giving them a place to do group work allows for them to help each other succeed. My students are 6th graders attending an urban intermediate school. Many of them qualify for free or reduced lunch. My students are on different learning levels grouped into a homogeneous setting. They come from wonderfully diverse backgrounds and bring different experiences to our classroom. In my classroom, students have opportunities to learn in many ways. A lot of the time, they are working in heterogeneous or homogeneous small groups. This group work helps them contribute their knowledge while strengthening their abilities to problem-solve, communicate clearly, and work with others. This horseshoe table will help contribute to the strengthening of all of these skills. This table will help greatly to improve the work environment of our classroom. It will provide a place for students to gather to complete group tasks. It is also a place where I can hold teacher-led small groups and where I can work with students who need more intensive instruction.
needStatement: My students need a horseshoe table to complete small group work.

name: For Children, Play is Serious Learning
description: There is no typical day in a middle school classroom; that's for sure! This applies to outdoor recess as well, when our students are given a chance to run free and be children. At our school, students have a variety of locations available for outdoor recess. Our students are middle school age, which means they are confident and doubtful, self-assured and self-conscious, grown up and childish all at the same time. Our school motto, PRIDE, stands for positivity, respect, integrity, dedication, and excellence. These traits apply to so much of what we do every single day, which contributes to our amazing school climate. Students are empowered and given the freedom to play at recess, something not all middle schools can fit into our busy schedules. When students have access to a variety of games at recess, behavior issues are reduced. Given a well-run recess environment, students have a chance to play a semi-organized game such as basketball, knockout, football, soccer and so much more. Positive recess experiences not only provide a break from the academic school day, the provide students with social interactions in a less structured setting. Problem-solving and cooperative work happens at recess just as it does in the classrooms. This all circles back to a supportive environment which carries over into effort and achievement. The benefits to these types of daily recess experiences are immeasurable. Our children need to play. Recess equipment is not often high on our budget list, but we can change that.
needStatement: My students need to play outside with a recess package including frisbees, 4-square balls, jump ropes, footballs, soccer balls and more.

name: Empowering Students Through Art by Kindling a Spark
description: My students are always highly engaged when we use technology. They are also very creative young people that love art and music. I would like to combine their love of art, music, and technology to enhance their understanding of math concepts. Lets Empower Students Through Art! I teach at a model school that incorporates performing arts, visual arts, coding, computer science, and STEM (STEAM) within the curriculum. Our urban school receives federal funding for programs that provide free breakfast and lunch for every student, and title 1 services to economically disadvantaged boys and girls. We are a class which includes military families, gifted students, ESL students, and the tech savvy. My students are energetic and very busy within the classroom. Even with parental support, I would love to say that my students have everything that they need to be successful. But they don't. We are preparing students for college, the workforce, and the world beyond, so they can have a better life. I love teaching geometry because it allows my students to learn concepts while being as creative as possible. I wanted a new way for my students to share their growing math knowledge. They love technology and all forms of art, so why not empower my students by using Kindle Fires. They will use the Kindles to research and view different paintings and drawings by downloading apps and taking virtual field trips. They will also be able to create designs and art showing symmetry and patterns using attribute blocks and tessellations with a variety of art websites and apps. Make algebra concepts fun by adding music and art to re-enforce patterns will make learning come alive. We can even tackle fractions and problem-solving while creating with the Art apps. All of my students will have the chance create and make arts that will teach math concepts to all who enter of class. The Kindles will bring the arts into our class using technology in a way that was not possible in the past. Knowledge empowers students to greatness. We can now empower more students through art. Every child has something that they are passionate about whether it is drawing, creating music, or dance. We as educators need to make those connections for our students. We need to create lessons that will teach math, science, and reading in a way that integrates a students' love of the Arts.
needStatement: My students need 23 Kindle Fire tablets and cases to empower students by integrating art with mathematics.

name: A Larger Class Needs a Larger Class Rug
description: My students love curling up with a good book, but unfortunately this is a far less pleasant activity when sitting on a cold tile floor. With a much larger class coming next year, my current rug will not be big enough. We need a new rug that will be big enough for everyone! I teach third grade in a low-income school, and more than half of my students are learning English as a second language. So many of my students struggle with learning a new language and learning to read and write in this new language. Many do not have English language models at home, so a number of my students need to be given all of the tools they require for language acquisition during the school day. My students try so hard in school every day to do their best work, and I want to ensure that they have the best working environment. Many of my students do not consider themselves to be readers or writers when they first enter my classroom, and it is my mission to make sure that they do by the time they leave. My students need a classroom rug. A rug creates a community meeting spot, which can be the most important place in the classroom. As a class, my students and I meet on the rug to exchange ideas while listening to a story, or we use it as a relaxing spot for independent or partnered reading or to play a game. A new rug for my classroom will give my students the opportunity to come together and learn in a cozy, warm area; instead of on a cold and uncomfortable tile floor. My students, their families, and my community trust me to provide my students with the best education possible. I take my responsibility very seriously, but I cannot do it alone. I need your help. I need high-quality resources to provide top level instruction. Together, we can ensure that all students succeed.
needStatement: My students need a classroom rug.

name: The Art in Words!
description: We have a vocabulary center because many students struggle with new vocabulary words. My students come are from a high poverty neighborhood in a city surrounded with school deficit and lack of materials. They still come to school and try to do their best with cheerful attitudes. Many of them only have the school for their educational needs. The resources I am asking for will, 'Empower my students through art!' It will turn the vocabulary center into a world of colorful art. I want them to have index cards, markers, glue sticks, paper, and other material readily available so that they can have fun making vocabulary words that they will remember and want to study with family or independently. Your donation will allow for a time of art during literacy. Children love to color and I know they will be happy and creative at their Vocabulary Center. They will also hold on to their vocabulary cards because of the work they will put into it.
needStatement: My students need supplies such as paper, index cards, markers, glue sticks, and other materials to make their new vocabulary colorful and memorable!

name: Energetic Bodies Need Alternative Seating - Round 2!
description: The first set of ball chairs has greatly improved the learning in our classroom! Some of my friends that were always focusing on anything other than their work or me are now able to wiggle their way to success! Knees, hands, feet...everything except the bottoms of my students are on their chairs! My kiddos have a serious case of the wiggles that is distracting them from learning. My students' homes are located in one of the most crime ridden zip codes in our city. Many of my students witness situations daily that a young child, or an adult for that matter, should never have to see or hear. Unfortunately, in their homes there is little or no value put on education. As dismal as many of my students' situations are at home though, they thrive in school. My school provides a safe and nurturing environment where children know they are loved and well taken care of. In return students put forth 110% effort each and every day. The curriculum is rigorous and the standards are high. They rise to the occasion. Our school is well known in the district for the high performance of our students. The first set of chairs were intended to be used for instruction during my small groups. However, I quickly noticed how well my students were able to focus during small groups. We immediately incorporated them into our everyday learning. The chairs have been an amazing asset to our classroom. Not only have they benefited my students with attention struggles, but also have provided a more comfortable alternative for a student that has hip pain due to sickle cell. I would like to add 5 more chairs to my classroom to provide even more alternative seating for my students! The first set of chairs were smaller. These are the same design, but are able to accommodate some of my taller friends! I am requesting the five chairs to replace the traditional student chairs in my classroom and provide an alternate seating option for my friends. These chairs are great for wigglers; the benefits of children being able to wiggle and move while they are working are numerous. The students I took on this year needed a lot of help!
