More than half my class started the year at a 1st-2nd grade reading level. They have grown SO much! As a class of 22 students, they have grown an average of 102 lexile points based on SRI! I need to continue to provide the best setting and instruction so they can be successful. The chairs will provide the best setting, literally, for my students. I can teach my heart out, but if they aren't focused they will not improve and be successful.
needStatement: My students need five balance ball chairs that will allow them to learn while also providing them an outlet to move.

name: Leveling the Field
description: Students need hands on experience with technology to be competitive in today's world. My classrooms are up to 80% English language learners. They are some of the most determined students you could ever meet focusing both on mastering the content and learning a new language. Not only do I have multiple ability levels for content but also language levels and background knowledge.  As a low income school, many of my students do not have access to handheld devices to access the Internet in the classroom and the increase in mandatory state testing has limited the availability of computer labs. Access to Kindle Fires in the classroom will allow students to use internet based supports for the content as well as translation resources. Students will use the kindles for everything from simulations to review games in class including Quizlet and Kahoot. My students will gain experience in using technology while supporting their development of language and science content knowledge. Our classes span everything from physics to environmental science and the Internet allows students to learn the most up to the minute discoveries.
needStatement: My students need 6 Kindle Fire tablets.

name: New Technology to Help Students with Autism Learn-Part 2
description: My students are eager to learn despite their learning difficulties. They come to school every day with a smile on their faces. My students are special education third-graders, at a diverse Title I (about 70% of students are entitled to free lunch) community public school in Queens, New York. They have been diagnosed with Autism. My students are in a special ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) Horizon program. This program is In its second year at my school and I have the pleasure of working with these children in my classroom. There are presently 7 students in my self-contained class this school year. The purpose of the Horizon class is to help my students gain the necessary skills they need to be able to function in the general education environment, and to eventually be able to attend a class with general education students. Children love technology. Using an Acer Chromebook laptop would allow my students to use technology as a tool for learning. An Acer Chromebook laptop would give my students a very motivating opportunity to play educational programs where they would learn reading, phonics, social studies, science, and math skills. My special education students learn best in a multi-sensory environment. Playing educational games and reading books will give my students the motivation to read more and practice skills they may need help with. It would be wonderful to see an Acer Chromebook laptop in my classroom so my students can practice skills to help them increase their grade level skills that they presently struggle with. Please help my class receive a new piece of technology to help them become better learners. An Acer Chromebook laptop would provide many opportunities for my students to grow and learn and have fun while doing it.
needStatement: My students need an Acer Chromebook laptop.

name: Sensory Fun in Kindergarten; Playing to Learn
description: My classroom is a place filled with active children who love to play and learn. We like to get up and move to learn. We also have a huge focus on literacy and writing in our room. We are explorers, researchers, scientists, artists, and interested in discovery. My students are bright and interested in the world around them. We are in a very large title one, urban school. It is also a community school and our community is incredibly resourceful in providing for our kids. About 60 percent of our population is ELL so they come in with language barriers. I can walk my class to the community garden across the street or go to the public library and get them library cards. We work really hard as a staff to provide a loving safe place to learn for our students. I requested a sensory table because Kindergartners aren't all about sitting in chairs and writing long dissertations. What they are about is exploring the world. My coworker recently told me a story about her students using Magna tiles and one of them came to her and said, 'Hey, did you know that if you put two triangles together it makes a square?' We teach our shapes in drills, but the learning that we see through discovery is so much more valuable because the problem solving and the thinking skills develop along with the social emotional skills in Kindergarten. These students need to have resilience as they go through life and those are the skills that we can offer if we resist the skill and drill testing culture we are in and offer a balanced education that meets the needs of every student. Students will explore the alphabet in materials such as sand and water as part of our approach to balanced literacy. This project will make a difference to about 50 students as we are working together to team teach. Our students will get a better opportunity to explore materials and make discoveries on their own as well as converse and develop language skills as they negotiate in free play. It will ease the stress of two teachers to have the materials they need to make our learning environment more fun for our students.
needStatement: My students need a sturdy sensory table for a hands-on literacy center along with Kinetic sand, Kidfetti, an alphabet fishing game and some abc molds.

name: Reading is Succeeding
description: By the end of the year my goal is for students to love reading, and to do this by providing access to a variety of quality books from a variety of genres. They come from a variety of backgrounds, and we can all find common ground through good literature! I teach 3-5 grade gifted and talented students in a title 1 school in South Carolina. The students I teach are very capable readers, but oftentimes need help getting engaged in a book for the long haul! Each year the state of South Carolina publishes a list of books they recommend. My students love the challenge of reading all of the book nominees, and doing book talks or book recommendations to encourage others to read their books. Some even make it a goal to finish all of the books in the list over the course of the year. By having all of the books in our classroom library I will be able to give students a choice about which ones they want to read, and we will be able to pass them around as students finish. All of the the books on this list are quality literature, and they provide great talking points and discussion starters for our class. In addition, they encourage students to read something outside of their normal genre, because there are so many to choose from. In my classroom, these books will take center stage! They will provide a great selection of books for students to choose from. I envision students choosing a book, reading it at their own pace (with my checking in, of course), and doing activities with the books in order to encourage others to read their books. They will learn to do book talks, write book recommendations, and film videos/commercials to 'sell' their book! The funding of this project will make a huge difference for my students. It will motivate them to read, give them access to quality literature, and get them excited about sharing their reading. Gifted learners are good readers, but they oftentimes need that extra push/challenge to get them into a good book. These books will do just that!
needStatement: My students need books that will encourage them to read and recommend books to others. The books in this list are all from the South Carolina Book Award Nominees.

name: Team Sports Can Help Develop Good Character!
description: With all the technology readily available to today's young students, it is getting harder and harder to get them to do any physical activity. Our students are required a minimum of 100 minutes of physical education. It is a challenge to maintain this requirement, without equipment that encourages them to participate in physical activity. Our school is located in a neighborhood that is high crime and high poverty. Introducing them to team sports would have an impact on their learning and behavior choices. With the equipment that I have requested, I can help create a structured physical education schedule. I hope to create stations where students can rotate through several team sports within the time provided. I would like to have a volleyball station, relay racing station and a soccer station. This would allow the students to experience different levels of activities, and give them the opportunity to develop an affinity for physical education. By providing our students with this equipment I hope to develop my students ability to work together. I believe that having them participate in team sports will develop their social emotional well being by teaching them how to problem solve, how to be more empathetic with each other, and how to relate to one another with respect. I would like to thank you in advance for your kindness and donations to this project.
needStatement: My students need physical education equipment to participate in team sports such as relay batons, pinnies, volleyball equipment, and a ball pump to maintain our equipment.

name: Let' Get Flexible: Flexible Seating in 3rd Grade
description: Flexible seating is a wonderful way to create independent learners. This strategy will allow students to choose their own work space within the classroom. Choosing their own work space allows students to work in an area that they feel they will succeed in. Our school is in an extremely low income district; 60% of our students are receiving free and reduced lunches. Our building is also a Title One school which allows every student with a special need to be serviced. The students within our building are looking for stability and structure in their lives. As teachers, we are always trying to find new and innovative ways to catch and keep the attention of these high need children. We have limited resources and funds to try these wonderful ideas and most of the time, the money for these projects comes from our own paychecks. My students will be able to choose which seat they prefer best in my classroom. The flexible seating arrangement will allow students to sit, stand, kneel, or bounce on an exercise ball in order to maximize their learning. The research behind flexible seating shows that when students have the choice to sit where they would like to learn, then those students achieve higher because they are comfortable in their learning environments. Our materials include a shortened table for students to kneel/sit and work and beanbag chairs for students to work comfortably on. These materials will be extremely needed in order to implement flexible seating in the best way possible. This project will make a difference in my classroom by creating independent and strong learners. The students will feel independent because they are able to choose their seating and they will feel comfortable in their learning space.
needStatement: My students need these bean bag chairs and table to be able to choose where they would like to sit. The freedom to choose seating will create independence for my students

name: Projector Cart for our Classroom!!
description: My classroom is a first grade in an urban school district. My students need to gain more life experiences and using our projector will allow them to do this. A cart to put the projector on to use for lessons would be a wonderful addition to our class. My students are in first grade and love to learn new and exciting things. The school has a high poverty rate and therefore they are not exposed to many opportunities. Having a cart so we can use our projector will give us the opportunity to engage in more exciting lessons and learning. This projector cart will be used so that we can use the projector to show educational videos, create slideshows, and presentations and go deeper into the amazing opportunities technology has to offer us. We can incorporate it into all areas of learning from writing to math, and of course literacy. This donation will help us to improve our classroom facilities and will expand our learning so students can experience even more. It would help expose them to new things we cannot currently access. It would be a great addition to our classroom.
needStatement: My students need a cart so that we can use our projector and students can engage in technology.

name: Scholastic Magazines Needed!
description: While I love telling students about events of the world, it's better they get used to reading it for themselves. Scholastic frames the stories from the point of view of a teenager and this draws in students in a way that the big news outlets don't. Our student body at my middle school is very diverse in both backgrounds and academic ability. They are all working hard to get into rigorous high schools so magazines which challenge them while informing them on current events really compliment our curriculum. Our English classes try to mix up the curriculum by analyzing various kinds of writing, but we don't have a steady source of articles which are appropriate for their level. Scholastic Magazine is loaded with activities which subtly check for comprehension and build persuasive argumentation skills. Having the magazines come in every few weeks makes the class more dynamic and really helps the students get connected with the world in a manner they can relate to. Articles on healthy eating habits will eventually have to get through to them, right?
needStatement: My students need up to date news and stories which affect their lives. The Upfront and Choices magazines are perfectly leveled for our students abilities and have great vocabulary builders!

name: Our Trumpet Players Need Some New Gear
description: We are small (but growing) band at a medium sized high school in rural California. Many of my students can't get the right equipment they need to excel in music. Our band students have been working hard to build our band program up over the last few years. Many of them rely on school owned instruments and equipment to play, and we never seem to have enough quality equipment to go around. The school has been supportive, but the budget only goes so far. The trumpet mouthpieces I am requesting will be used daily by our trumpet players. The different sizes of mouthpieces will help the players get a better sound as they become more experienced. Generally, trumpet students start on a smaller mouthpiece, and gradually work up to a larger one over time. When the students have the right equipment, they are able to put more effort into actually performing and less into wrestling with improper mouthpieces. It will help the entire band sound better.
needStatement: My students need new mouthpieces. The correct mouthpiece can make a world of difference for student trumpet players.

name: Flexible Seating
description: Our kids today have brains that are wired differently than our grown up brains. Requiring them to sit still all day in a hard chair just doesn't work anymore! They need to move and have seating options that will best meet their needs. I have 24 students in my 2nd grade classroom. The majority of the students in my school come from poverty. We live in an agricultural area, so many of them are migrant students. This creates many challenges with meeting their needs in the classroom, but my students are amazing and I wouldn't trade them! Wobble chairs give students the opportunity to move while they work, but in a safe way. The chairs will not topple over. These chairs also help with core stability, which is something that is lacking in many children these days. I would like to have these chairs as an option for my students to use throughout the school day. I believe they will help aide in student engagement, which will increase individual performance. Using wobble chairs in the classroom will help to better meet the sensory needs of my students. I have several that have been diagnosed with ADHD as well as other students that just need to move! I am unable to sit for long periods of time in uncomfortable chairs and pay attention to the task at hand. It is the same for my students and I hope that giving them better seating options in the classroom will make them more eager to learn!
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options in our classroom.

name: Creating an Engaging Classroom with Flexibly Seating
description: Imagine a classroom environment where you weren't restricted to a traditional desk and chair. Where there were flexible seating options and learning lounges. Where you had the freedom to choose a spot that fit your learning needs! My students are innovative, strong and have grit. They are a mix of the working class, the homeless and migrant workers. They receive free breakfast and lunch through our school and in the summer when school is out they can come and get a free lunch. Many have life stories that pull at your heart and make you thankful for what you have. With these resources, I hope to create a learning environment that would allow my students the freedom to move and learn in comfort. Students are asked to sit for hours at a time in a traditional desk and chair. For many of my students, this does not fit their needs. They need to move. They need comfortable learning areas where they can interact with each other in groups or in a learning area where they can have personal space if they need it. These donations will help me create a classroom that provides equity for all students. Each learner in a classroom has individual interests, learning styles and needs to achieve rigorous standards. Sitting in a desk for 8 hours a day can be challenging. Providing different learning environments for my students will give them a fair opportunity to learn. They will walk into my classroom and have multiple seating options and a learning lounge! It will promote increased engagement and motivation!
needStatement: My students need Ball Chairs, Flower Shape Activity Table, and other flexible seating options to help with concentration and focus.

name: Space Saving Storage Solutions
description: What do you do when your classroom is so small, you don't have room for work spaces beyond the desk, and you only have one closet? Where can the students sit for literacy and math stations? Where are we going to store our literacy and math station supplies? I have found the perfect solution! I teach third grade in a small classroom, in a small school, in a small district, in a small community in Alabama. But my students have a big appetite for learning! One of their favorite parts of the day is being able to explore our learning materials during station rotations. The only problem is that they don't have adequate space to work, if they are not in their desks. Who wants to sit at a desk all day? With this requested book bench and cushion, my students will be able to sit with partners or independently to complete the day's literacy and math activities during station rotations. The bench includes 5 compartments for storing books, games, manipulatives, or any other materials needed for stations. Students will be able to have quick access to our learning materials, and will be able to clean up quicker, when it is time to rotate, saving valuable learning time. The storage compartments will also encourage organization. The bench is low enough to fit under our dry erase board, since we have limited wall space. Having this bench will provide my students with an opportunity to get out of their desks and to get comfortable when working. By creating an inviting and comfortable learning environment, students will be more eager to attend school, where more learning can occur.
needStatement: My students need a storage bench and cushion.

name: Alternative Seating for Squirmy Students
description: When you walk into my second grade classroom, you are immediately greeted with 19 adorable, smiling faces. If you stay for awhile, you start to notice the fidgeting, wiggling, and constant motion that comes with 19 seven and eight year old children being confined in one room. My classroom is made up of 19 wonderful, talented, smart, and most importantly, unique, students. The typical 'desk and chair' classroom does not meet the individual needs of unique personalities in my classroom. Because of this, I am turning my classroom into a room full of alternative seating options. To start this project, I am asking for 2 wobble chair, 2 balance chairs, and 2 floor pillow. This allows students a choice of seating based on their individual needs. Some students need to be moving constantly. The wobble and balance chairs are perfect for those students. Some students like to be comfortable and have the freedom of moving around the classroom. This is where the floor pillows will come in handy. Please help my students have the ability to choose the seating that will allow them to have the most academic success! To start this project, I am asking for 2 wobble chairs, 2 balance chairs, and 2 floor pillows. This allows students a choice of seating based on their individual needs. Some students need to be moving constantly. The wobble and balance chairs are perfect for those students. Some students like to be comfortable and have the freedom of moving around the classroom. This is where the floor pillows will come in handy. Please help my students have the ability to choose the seating that will allow them to have the most academic success! Alternative seating will improve my classroom in many ways. It is so important to give kids a choice. By choosing their own seating, they are asserting their independence and setting themselves up for success.
needStatement: My students need 2 wobble chairs, 2 balance chairs, and 2 floor pillow for alternative seating options.

name: Native Son for Critical Consciousness
description: Every day we start off the day with circles, which allows my students to share more about themselves. It allows us to build a community and get our day started with positive energy. I want my students to have a critical understanding of social injustice in America, which begins with 'Native Son.' My students are tenth graders, who all live in an inner-city. My high school is large (over 1,000 students). My students are fiercely loyal to each other, their friends, and their families. They are resilient, strong, and extremely inquisitive. When it comes to current social issues, my students make relevant and intelligent text to real world connections, which pertain to race, class, gender, socio-economic, and political issues. This year, I had to make copies of this book because my school did not have enough copies for all of my students. My students were affected by this because they had to use large paper clips to hold their pages together (there were too many pages to staple), and they had to receive the book in chunks. My young readers will see these brand new books and know that they deserve them; they will be able to take them home, use their post-it note strategy in order to record observations and critical questions, as well as be able to read ahead and not lose or misplace any pages because the book would be bound together. This book will serve an entire semester, not just one quarter. We will be able to hold close and critical readings, discussions, as well as record sections and quotes in the book for the two essays that we write for this book. These donations will improve my classroom because it will let my students know that they deserve new, shiny, and personal resources. In many instances, students often receive old and battered copies of books. This time around, these new copies will inspire in them a desire to take care of them and appreciate them. Every student deserves new and well-kept materials.
needStatement: My students need new copies of the book Native Son, which we read over an entire semester for our Social Injustice Unit.

name: Adding a Lego Wall to Our Makerspace!
description: My classroom is not defined by the four walls that surround us. Our learning goes well beyond those walls. We are inventors, researchers, creators, collaborators, philanthropists, technophiles, and scholars. My students are always reaching for more ways to learn. My business and technology classes have students from various grade levels, socioeconomic backgrounds, ethnicities, religions, and academic capabilities. These students come together in such an amazing way to create real results. They support each other unconditionally and really have a desire to change the world around them. To increase the Makerspace opportunities in my classroom, my students need Lego baseplates, bricks, adhesive, and a caulking gun to construct a Lego wall. The wall would be constructed to be on display at all times, becoming a permanent part of our classroom. Students would be able to express their creativity, build structures, collaborate with students in other classes, and admire their own handiwork on display. Do you look back on your own childhood and smile when you think about building something with Legos? I do! My students do! Everyone does! Whether it's a collaborative project to build a specific structure, or just a few moments to get out the wiggles and express some creativity, a Lego wall in my classroom would do wonders for my students. Donations to this project will help my students build structures and wonderful memories!
needStatement: My students need Lego baseplates, bricks, adhesive, and a caulking gun to construct a Lego wall in our classroom.

name: It's Noisy, I Can't Hear
description: Technology is so important for children who are learning in today's fast-paced society. My students do not have the number of experiences that many children have. Tablets in the classroom will allow teachers to bridge the gap for students that need a technology attention magnet to learn. My school is a Title I school with 84% of our students qualifying for free or reduced price lunch. There are students in my classroom that only eat during the week while they are at school and don't have the right clothes to wear to school. My students are curious, energetic, hard working, and sweet. What I love most about my students are their excitement for learning. There is no place they love more than school and they work very hard when they are there. I want headphones to help with noise to make class time more fun and valuable. Our supplies are very limited, and fun games with technology make learning more meaningful. Help make learning better in our classroom! My students need headphones to be able to use their new tablets and computers to do many activities throughout the year. Students love reading books and playing games on the devices. This technology can teach important concepts for this grade. Requests for support have worked and provided an amazing improvement in the past, so I continue to ask for various items to help my class. Students will learn to care for their materials and enjoy the content in a fun way. I try to increase my students' motivation in reading, math, science, and social studies by making learning fun. With creative ideas and fun activities, students begin to make connections between my classroom and real life. The curriculum continues to get harder, and students must have many opportunities for fun. Many materials that students currently use are boring. Headphones for our tablets are an exciting addition to our classroom.
needStatement: My students need 8 wireless Contixo headphones to use with our classroom iPads.

name: Creative Expressions
description: 'All I really need to know, I learned in kindergarten' As a kindergarten teacher, this is my favorite quote because it underscores the importance of our kindergarten experiences. I want to give my kindergarten students the best possible start in school. And what is better than learning through art? My students are curious and active researchers! They learn best when they can interact with and manipulate learning materials. They love learning in this way because to them, it seems like play. My urban school is very diverse, with students who come from every corner of the globe and speak over 20 different languages. The vast majority of our students live in poverty. In my classroom of 23, my students speak 7 different languages at home. Four of my students are on the autism spectrum. My students are academically diverse as well, with several students functioning above grade level, and others who struggle to meet grade level benchmarks. My school is a wonderful place to teach and learn, despite some of the challenges our students face daily. Many school staff members go above and beyond to make sure our students have their basic needs met. It is important to our staff that each child knows he/she is truly cared about and valued as a member of our school community. My students will use the dot painters and watercolor paints to create works of art related to many content areas. When my students learn about the ocean, they will be able to create beautiful pictures to go along with their non-fiction writing about ocean animals. When solving addition and subtraction problems in math, they can use the dot painters to show their thought process with 10 frame templates. My students can use clay and modeling sand to make the shape of letters, spell sight words with letter stampers, and more. Donations to this project will enhance the learning experiences of my students. Through the use of these art materials, my students will be even more motivated to learn and will stay engaged in their learning for greater amounts of time. Donors will be empowering students through art by making creative, hands on learning materials accessible to all students.
needStatement: My students need art materials, such as dot painters, watercolors, and clay, to creatively express themselves.

name: ROOTed in Reading
description: 'The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more you learn, the more places you'll go.' My kids hear this Dr. Seuss saying so much from me, they can quote it. I love when I start to say it and they finish it for me! I hope they understand how true it is! My 2nd graders have dreams of becoming the President, firefighters, teachers, actors, nurses, and more. They have a long road ahead of them to reach these dreams, but I feel each one of my students will be able to! Right now, they need to learn to read and one of my goals every year is to teach them to LOVE reading. Part of the long road they face is that the world is already against them. Most of my students come from a low income home and enter my classroom grade levels behind from where they should be. I teach kids with family members who are incarcerated, who don't know where their next meal is outside of school, who are being raised by other relatives, or come from an environment where school is not a priority. Luckily for them, they are in one of the best schools they could be in, with a staff rooting for them all the way! Our elementary school has over 1,200 students and very little money, but we make the most of it! My students LOVE read aloud time, especially when it is a book I have hand selected and NOT from the old textbook. It is when I put the 'teacher's manual' to the side and teach from the heart that I notice a HUGE difference in my students attention and learning. These books that I have chosen are just for that purpose. They are books I can use to introduce our skills and teach from. This project will allow me to step away from the basal and really teach! My resources are limited and it is hard to track down these books from various libraries. Also, when I get them from the library, that means they have to go back in 2 weeks. The kids are not able to enjoy them for long. They love being able to reread books that Ms. H read to them and with library books they can't! After using these books for read aloud, I would like to put them in our little class library for the students to enjoy over and over again during centers or free reading time. In order for my students to learn to read and learn to LOVE reading, they need good books! I will be able to model comprehension and other skills with these books and then the students will be able to enjoy them on their own. These books will help me get my students get excited about reading as they join me on amazing adventures in literature.
needStatement: My students need engaging books to amplify our comprehension and vocabulary skills.

name: Walkie Talkies for a Safe School Environment
description: As our school's vision states: 'The Bobo Family envisions a school where faculty/staff, students, parents, and the community work together to improve student achievement, parental involvement, and positive school climate.' We do that in countless ways, resulting in a happy safe school for students. Our school is located just inside the city limits. We are a Title 1 school, where 89% of our students receive free or reduced lunch. Our students work hard everyday to be their best, do their best, and try their best. Our students strive to be respectful, responsible, and productive all throughout their school day --which usually runs from 7 am to 6 pm, if the students attend our free after school program. The faculty and staff at our school take pride in the hard work we put into our students and the hard work our students put in at school everyday. It is a partnership for the greater good and we expect our students to do great things! Our school needs a new set of walkie talkies to help ensure our students' safety. Walkies are used all day long as to not interrupt school-wide instruction with the intercom. These walkie talkies are used during morning drop off, to communicate with our school resource officer, for communication between the office and teachers while they are outside on the playground for recess, during dismissal in the afternoon, and the same walkie talkies are also used for communication during our after school program. This grant would enable each grade level K4-5th grade to have a properly working new walkie talkie to ensure the safety of our students. Walkie talkies are vital for our students safety and for proper communication throughout our school. Having walkie talkies will improve our school's effectiveness and safety by improving our ability to communicate with office staff during the school day. Walkie talkies limit interruptions to learning because they cut down on announcements made on the PA systems and allow teachers to communicate without having to walk to a phone. Having walkie talkies will help with communication both during the regular school day and during our after-school program, helping to keep our students safe.
needStatement: My students need walkie talkies to ensure all of our students in the school are managed safely throughout the school day.

name: Teaching with Tech
description: Mastering reading and writing in the modern world requires that students more than simply open up books and write in notebooks. While those are still valuable modes for communicating, my students need access to modern technology. My students are 10th graders at a low income high school in a suburban neighborhood on the outskirts of a major city. They are curious, driven, and enthusiastic about learning. More than anything, they want to be prepared for the world after high school--college and employment. To do this, they know they must be tech savvy. My students need 1 HP Chromebook and Google license. With this Chromebook I will have a complete set of classroom laptops (one per table group). Students will be able to research authors, watch relevant TED Talks and college videos, work on service learning projects, apply for summer jobs and internships, access online tutorials, as well as type essays and reports for classes. With this donation, students will feel empowered to do the work they need to do in order to feel prepared for life after high school. Having the technology they need to do great work will leave them feeling proud and important.
needStatement: My students need 1 HP Chromebook and Google license.

name: Channeling Energy Through Physical Education
description: On a typical day every class I have arrives full of energy, cannot wait to play, and is excited about being challenged in new ways. With the energy that the students have I strive to keep them moving as much as possible. I teach students in grades 5-8 who come from a variety of cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds. Team sports is a new concept to many of the students since they have not played them outside of school before. Most of the elementary schools that the students come from do not have a gymnasium, so there are a lot of skills and activities that the students have never heard of or had the opportunity to play prior to middle school. When students first come into the gym for PE they are amazed that this is where their classes will now be, and they cannot wait to get started! The equipment that I requested will be able to help me increase the number of items I have or replace broke/overused items. Being able to provide my students will more practice and the correct equipment I will be able to strengthen their skill set and knowledge and increase their confidence in settings where they are physically active. This equipment would help the students learn new team sports, have a chance to practice more, and increase their cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength, and coordination. Having pinnies and cones will allow me to create more teams and fields for team sports like soccer. My current jump ropes are short for the students, so the longer ropes will help more students use jump rope as a cardiovascular/muscular endurance activity. The flags and hula hoop hoops will help us play more/new games. Whiffle ball equipment will help students learn the rules of baseball and improve their hand-eye coordination. This equipment will help my student succeed in class.
needStatement: My students need soccer balls, jump ropes, whiffle ball equipment, flag belts, pinnies, and cones to increase their time being physically active!

name: Carpet Space for Learning!
description: It is full of active children who come to school every day to feel safe and to learn. I want all of my students to make progress in academic and social areas, and a challenge is keeping their attention throughout the day and teaching them personal space. 'Every child deserves a Champion,'~ R. Pierson My classroom is made up of very active and eager to learn 1st graders. 1st graders' attention spans are very short, so I need to always be on top of my game to keep them fully engaged and give them every tool they may need to keep their learning successful. Teaching children about personal space and how to keep their focus is something that we work on constantly throughout the school year. It takes practice and consistency. My school has a very high poverty rate, and most students are on the free and reduced-price lunch program. Most children come from single parent, foster or grandparent raised families. We are a very safe and caring school and want our students' learning environment to be one that is respectful and purposeful. Classroom rugs that show students how to maintain their personal space is very important in the lower elementary grades. We spend a lot of time on the floor doing activities and learning in front of our smart board. Students are taught the Magic 5 Listening Rules at the carpet which is, 'Hands in lap, sit crisscross, eyes on the speaker, ears listening and mouths quiet.' Having a defined space helps students maintain their focus and become aware of how much space they need and to be courteous to the space of others. I am hoping that by having a classroom rug we can spend less time on personal space issues and more time on learning and exploring new things. Students can take what they learned about personal space to other classrooms or places they may go, so that the procedures are consistent.
needStatement: My students need a classroom rug that defines their personal space, while also using the rug for simple phonics activities with the letters and sounds.

name: Wiggle-Wobble While We Learn
description: Technology and children are changing faster than ever. Our classrooms need to change and adjust too. For the past several decades teachers have grown accustomed to the traditional classroom model: orderly classrooms made up of ruler-straight rows. I want to look at learning a bit differently. My students are 6-7 year olds just beginning their education journey. They come from a wide range of ethnic and cultural backgrounds. Some of the students qualify for free and reduced price lunch. Having a safe and comfortable place to come and learn is of top priority for me. The Hokki Stools I have chosen will have many different uses in my classroom. The wiggle seats are something I have been wanted to try for a while. They help the students have a comfortable seat to rock or wiggle in while still staying engaged in the lesson. These seats will help my students learn in a way that is best for them. These seats will help with learning and give them the right accommodations that will benefit their learning experience at such a young age!
needStatement: My students need Hokki Stools for seating where learning, thinking and movement are integrated.

name: Stand Up for Learning
description: My Middle School English classroom is an active space with lots of choice as to what students learn, how they learn it and where they learn it. I have tried to build in quiet spaces, relaxed spaces, group and individual spaces. Middle Schoolers need lots of choice and variety. I teach in an urban k-8 school. We are a gifted and talented magnet, recognizing that giftedness comes in many forms and looks different for each child. My students come from diverse backgrounds, both culturally and socioeconomically. We have many languages spoken in our school. As sixth graders, our students are figuring out who they are and how they fit into the world around them. We aim to provide lots of different opportunities for our students to explore these ideas through projects, experiences, and conversation. I am requesting funding for two stand up desks. While I have tried to create multiple learning environments in my classroom, I find there a small number of students in each class that need to move and walk more than others. I have tried stability (yoga) balls, but the bouncy quality is over stimulating for some. I have tried bike inner tubes around chair legs for those who need to bounce. I would like to have two work options that allow for students to stand up as they work. They can use the kick bar to swing their legs or wiggle or sway their bodies as they work. I think that there are at least two student in each of my six classes that would benefit from this seating option. The rest of the class would benefit from the reduced distraction these student s currently provide. Here is a link to an article that supports my theories. http://www.nea.org/tools/47003.htm This donation would be more than a one time effect. The desks would last for many years, serving many students over time. I have asked my principal and custodian for funds for these, but it has not be feasible given our budget. I would love to be able to have two standing desks to be able to offer observable proof as to their benefits that could lead to possibly investigating funding sources for even more of these wonderful desks.
needStatement: My students need two Stand Up Desks to accommodate kinesthetic or active learners.

name: Social Studies and Science Chromebooks
description: In our class, we explore our history and the world around us. We would use these Chromebooks to research important people, places, events, and ideas. All our my students are on free or reduced lunches. They are eager to learn, and love to use any technology available. Many do not have access to technology at home, and these chrome books would provide them an exciting way to explore their world. They love to learn how things work, and where they came from. My students need two Chromebooks. This year, we have been exploring the digital resources available with our curriculum. These Chromebooks will allow more students to deepen their understanding of both science and social studies topics. We would use them to research important individuals, and developments, in various content areas. By using these Chromebooks daily, I believe that my students will have a better understanding of their world, and how they fit into it. It will also allow my students to experience different types of technology throughout their day.
needStatement: My students need two Chromebooks.

name: Let Students Choose the Way to Learn!
description: I have a class of 20 first graders. My students receive free lunch daily due to their economic status. They all come from low socioeconomic backgrounds, most of them living in single parent households. For these learners, school provides them with their only safe haven and structure. I have a class of 20 first graders. My students receive free lunch daily due to their economic status. They all come from low socioeconomic backgrounds, most of them living in single parent households. For these learners, school provides them with their only safe haven and structure. For many of my students, school is the only safe environment they are exposed to. It is a place where they should feel safe and secure from many of life's everyday challenges. These students are amazing survivors. They have ambition and drive, all essential qualities that we, as educators, do our best to nurture and embrace. My students are five and six years old, attending an old building where furniture we have in our classrooms, our tables and chairs. We do however have one to one devices which supports my blended learning approach to learning. We do need more opportunities for student choice and where they can sit to learn the best that they can. I envision each student in our classroom having a choice of where they sit during instruction and independent work. Regardless of the amount of regular standard chairs in the classroom, students can independently choose where they want to sit at any time throughout the day to give them choice and accountability for their work. The various seating options will be housed in the classroom. I currently have five tables, each table will be a different option of seating. My students will learn how to share the seats and be conscientious of their classmates and their needs. This will truly benefit those students that have a hard time focusing, have ADD/ADHD, sensory issues, and just any student who needs a change throughout the day. Donating to our classroom project will have a large impact on our classroom productivity. The various seating choices will enable students to learn independently while other instruction is occurring, as well as, allow them to choose the best way for them to get their work done and done successfully! We need your help. We need this!
needStatement: My students need various options and choice of where to sit to complete work in the classroom. They need Wobble chairs, beanbag seats and fitness balls.

name: Let's Find Out Together
description: We are a kindergarten class of excited, energetic learners. We love doing hands on activities about topics that are relevant to our every day lives. Science and experimentation is a huge part of growing our young minds. By the end of the year we want to be rich in science knowledge. We are a classroom of 20 English language learners. We are a very close knit school with students that are not afforded many opportunities that other students our age across the district may receive. We try our best despite our economical challenges and we definitely make the best out of what we have. We work very hard as a team to further our knowledge of real world topics so that we can be contributing members of our community one day. We are happy, energetic kids that just want the chance to explore and learn new things. My students come from very low economic situations and do not have the experiences or materials other students may receive. It is so rewarding to see them feel so proud about getting their own magazine that they can take home and share with their families. I have done this magazine in my classroom for 2 years now and it has been a great tool. We do a science lesson each Friday with the magazine. This magazine helps in so many different areas. We can focus on our reading skills while learning new science topics. We use the online resources for skills such as sorting, sequencing and language arts. I create a mini lesson to send home with the students for the parents to work with them and extend the learning outside of the classroom. This helps parents become involved in a rigorous and relevant learning experience with their child. Most of the topics are common core related and fit perfectly within our units as an extension of the required teaching. The magazine is a fresh, exciting way to present a topic to my students. Because my students are in a very low economic situation at home they do not own many if any books. Although not much to some, getting to take home this magazine is so exciting for them. After doing this project for 2 years, I can see this resource benefits my students in a huge way. As science has become a subject that is not at the forefront in the classroom this tool is a great way for me to introduce exciting, engaging science material for my students on a level that is very age appropriate. Because we are such a low socioeconomic school much of my school budget goes towards school supplies students can't afford therefore extras like this aren't always available.
needStatement: My students need Scholastic Let's Find Out magazines to explore science and learn about our world!

name: We Need Sacks for Our Seats!
description: Our day consists of a lot of movement. We spend the day collaborating with our peers. Our classroom has been transitioning to become more learner-centered. We do not have desks in our classroom. We now have group tables. My students are active, fun, and technology savvy. They are independent and have grown so much this year. We always love to move and get our wiggles out. Go noodle is our favorite website to visit when we need a brain break from our busy schedule. Our school goes above and beyond in all they do. My students are going to use the chair bags in order to organize all of their materials for the day. This will allow for quicker transition time and more learning during our day. They will have access to their learner materials. The bags will allow for each student to keep their work space clear and their work off of the floor. The donations will allow for us to make our learner-centered environment even more safe. As we begin to organize our classroom with group tables we have lost the original storage of a student desk. We can have our material at hand and easy to find when needed.
needStatement: My students need bags for the back of their chairs.

name: Social skills for the Ninjas!
description: Our classroom is called the Ninjas. We use Class Dojo to earn points for rewards. Our classroom is a self-contained class that has 1st through 3rd grade students who have social/emotional/behavioral issues. We are housed in a K-12 alternative school in a rural low income community. More than 80% of our school is on free and reduced lunches so we qualify for Community Program which allows all of our students to receive free breakfast and lunch. All the students that have been placed in my classroom are in the Exceptional Children's Program and have many behavioral issues. The students have many diagnosed disorders that include but are not limited to Autism, Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, Oppositional Defiant Disorder, Anxiety, Depression etc. They are great kids that have many unique needs. Several times a day we work specifically on social/behavioral skills. These skills are practiced and reinforced throughout the day. The books and games will allow us to have more options for ways to share social and behavioral norms with the students. The games and tablets will help reinforce social skills such as sharing, teamwork, cooperation, patience, learning new skills and learning how to lose, and managing frustrations and disappointments. My students need multiple opportunities to learn and practice in our classroom environment so they can use these skills outside of our classroom. If the students in my class can learn some of the skills from these books and games, they will have a better chance of transitioning back into the regular classroom. In the year, I have been teaching this class we have already had two students successfully transition back to a regular education classroom. These materials will help my students learn how to control their emotions, and appropriate ways to learn to deal with frustration and anger.
needStatement: My students need books and games on social skills and student tablets to improve their social and emotional skills.

name: Literacy For Little Learners
description: Teddy Roosevelt once said, 'People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care.' I have found this to be the truth in teaching a group of PreK cuties! By introducing students to engaging reading activities, I hope my students develop a love for books! My students are some of the cutest and funniest children you could ever meet! With precious smiles, squeals of joy and loving, warm hugs I get from them every morning, one would never guess that many of the children come from low income households that are unable to provide their children with modern technology, age appropriate books, or even toys to help them develop their imagination. In addition to having an identified disability, few of my children know how to open a book the correct way or how to play a game with their friends. Though we are at a school that loves and gives attention to each child in our room, funds are limited and there is only so much material support they can give to each classroom. Through a project such as this, I am hopeful to give my students a learning experience that extends beyond the classroom and has a lifelong impact. Literacy manipulatives will support the development of reading skills by creating an environment that actively involves students in meaningful literacy activities. Students will retell familiar stories read to them, develop phonemic awareness through sorting activities, and learn to explore books in an inviting environment. The reading center will be used to create a comfortable and inviting area for students to read. The differentiated reading cubes will be used to gage and assess student learning with reading comprehension. The story puppets and kit will be used to model and encourage students how to retell familiar stories and rhymes. The smart pencil and learning cards will be used to create a center where students identify, match and sequence letters. Finally, the positional word resource box will be used to develop students listening to and demonstrating their listening skills to key details. This project will not only improve my classroom environment and learning opportunities I am able to provide, but will also encourage students to love to learn. By having this project funded, students will receive materials they would not otherwise have access to in their everyday lives and overcome disabilities to be able to solve problems, play cooperatively, share responsibility, and think creatively!
needStatement: My students need literacy materials to help them address IEP goals. Items include a reading center, reading cubes, storytelling props, and vocabulary building kits!

name: First Grade Buddy Readers
description: Our students come to first grade eager to read. They love to sit down with a friend to read, and they love to talk! Reading and talking about books with a friend helps them grow as readers and helps build community in our classrooms. Our school is an urban elementary school in St. Paul. We are a neighborhood school. We have two first grade Language Academy classrooms serving mainstream students as well as many bilingual students who are learning English. Some of our students have recently arrived in the United States and did not have an opportunity to attend school before. We serve all our wonderful students through a co-teaching model with two classroom teachers and one ELL teacher working together to meet the needs of 51 students in two first grade classrooms. During Academic Choice Time, students choose an activity to practice math, reading, or writing skills. These group activities are also intended to support the children in developing social and language skills. One choice will be Buddy Reading. With a buzz of excitement, pairs of students will select a set of books from our buddy reading cart, which is shared between two classrooms. Having chosen their books, they sit down together and share the books. There will be two copies of each book, so that each child has one in hand. They practice listening to each other read and matching their voice to read at the same pace. They work together to figure out difficult words by looking closely at the word and at the pictures, and thinking about the story. They apply the reading strategies we have taught them. After reading, the students talk about the book, helping each other retell story or tell about what they learned from the book. Reading together is fun, and makes them want to read more! Our first graders need many different opportunities to read and work together. Buddy Reading will help improve their reading level and their confidence as readers. They will become teachers to each other and help each other figure out difficult words. Buddy Reading will help them develop social skills as they learn to work together and listen to each other in a conversation. Talking together will also strengthen their oral language skills and vocabulary. Students will be excited to read!
needStatement: My students need sets of Reading Recovery books with two copies so that they can read with a partner and talk about the books they are sharing.

name: Calculating Our Way to Success
description: The first half of the school year is considered a 'no calculator' zone in my math classroom. The only calculator a student gets to use is the one inside his/her skull. However, as soon as January rolls around, we start the task of moving from paper/pencil to...wait for it...technology! I get the pleasure of teaching an amazing group of students each year.150 different personalities, 150 different learning levels, 150 different backgrounds. That is what makes my job awesome. The students in my class work harder than they have ever worked in their lives, and they love it! They know that a wrong answer just means they are closer to the right one, and although they may stumble, they know there is only one way up. Picture it: January 2nd, 2017. I present my students with the following problem: Rory bought 14 sunflowers at the local flower shop. He spent a total of $35.42. Exactly how much was each sunflower? By this time in the year, my students can solve this problem in about 50 seconds...which means they don't need to spend time solving it anymore! I want my students to begin focusing on concepts of proportion, unit rate, and percentage, not basic division. By utilizing a class set of calculators and teaching students how to correctly use them, my students can begin moving from elementary to secondary math! Ask yourself this: would you solve that problem without a calculator right now? I am requesting a class set of forty calculators. A lack of resources should not dictate their mathematical reasoning abilities. I'm looking for a chance to give them the education that will set them up for success in the future and a clear understanding of how to work with one of our most basic technologies, a calculator; one that most of us use every single day!. Please help me help them!
needStatement: My students need a classroom set of calculators.

name: Flexible Seating Project
description: 'All students can learn to succeed but not in the same day or the same way.' William G. Spady. Flexible seating allows students the opportunity to learn gives students to learn about themselves as learners. I have a very diverse group of students ranging from ethnicity, social economics, learning abilities, languages, etc... Our school population is a reflection of my classroom, we have about forty-five different languages spoken, seventy-five percent free or reduced price lunch, and a high population of EL students. By creating a flexible seating arrangements in my classroom I want to create a comfortable learning environment that encompasses the diverse learners and to honor everyone's different ways of learning. School is a place where educators help guide students to become critical thinkers, 'The goal of education is teach one to think intensely and critically,' Martin Luther King Jr. I want to rearrange my classroom by creating flexible seating opportunities such as wobble chairs and foot rests for my students. I would model the expectations for each different seating arrangements; how it would look like, sound like, and feel like during our independent/partnered work time. Once each student has had the opportunity to try each seating arrangement, understood the expected behavior, and learned their preferred seating situation for themselves to get optimal learning, students will then be able to choose how they would like to sit during independent or partnered working time. The donations to this project will improve my classroom my allowing my students different opportunities of seating arrangements instead of the traditional seating arrangements of desks and hard rock chairs. The donations will help my students start seeing our classroom as a community of life long learners. As Maya Angelou said, 'When you know better you do better.' If students can understand themselves as the learner, they will be more engaged in learning.
needStatement: My students need the swing-roll and thinkers attachment and wobble stools to provide stationary movement in a flexible seating arrangement.

name: Sensory Sensations
description: My students walk into our classroom and, for some each day it is a struggle, many have sensory issues and have trouble paying attention. I have high expectations and I want all children, even ones with labels to achieve to their highest potential. My students are from a rural community, about 60 percent receive free and reduced lunch. Our school is the main attraction in the community. Most activities revolve around the school. Many of the children come from farming backgrounds or their parents commute to work. My students will use these resources daily. The whole class will benefit from 'brain breaks' that the bubbles and lights will provide. I will have a special sensory corner that students can enter when a break is needed. Students will be able to choose to go there or it can be suggested by me. The balls will be held by anyone that feels that it will help them, I will also suggest it for someone that is struggling. The essential oils will be used to create a calm atmosphere. Students will be able to attend longer with the visual breaks and the sensory tools (balls) will allow students to fidget but maintain focus during a lesson. The sensory corner in the classroom will allow children to take a short break and return to the learning quickly. Some students have meltdowns or lose control when frustrated. These tools would allow them to stay in the classroom and get their needs met in a positive way versus time outs or time in the principal's office.
needStatement: My students need essential oils and sensory tools to help increase their attention and time on task. My students need sensory tools to help them stay in a General Education class longer.

name: Getting our Hands Dirty
description: In a classroom where children are working and learning together requires many different supplies. My students are ready to get away from their desks and work together in groups. The biggest challenge is having supplies available for them to truly explore and learn from each other. My students are members of a school that is labeled as 'failing'. However, my students are succeeding everyday as they face the endless challenges of poverty. The everyday struggles they endure are motivation enough to do all I can to help make their classroom experience a fun, exciting, and safe journey. Empowering Students Through Art is my goal. My students love to paint, color, and create. I plan on using the printer ink and photo paper to document projects through pictures. The letter/number sponges will infuse creativity into simple activities. The bags and envelopes will be used to create story bags and character envelopes. We will also use the filing cabinet to keep our valuables safe. Our laptops and materials will be secured and easily accessible. Opening up the doors to creativity allows my students to truly explore what they are thinking. Simply taking out the paints, crayons, and craft supplies excites my students and gets them eager to explore. Empowering Students Through Art is what we are working towards!
needStatement: My students need craft bags, sponge letters, photo paper, and printer ink to incorporate art into our lessons.

name: Multicultural Literature Unit
description: I teach in an inner-city public school located in Chicago. Our student demographic is quite diverse as are the needs and interests of our learners. The vast majority of our students are designated as low-income. Despite obvious social and economic challenges, our students are great young people who envision themselves as being successful. Most of my students are upperclassman who are preparing for post-secondary education. Their dreams and goals are consistent with those of young Americans all across the country. Even though our students live in one of the largest metropolitan areas in the world, they very rarely step outside the confines of their own neighborhoods. As a result, their world view is limited by the blinders of a few city blocks. Literature, especially multicultural literature, provides students a window into the lives of others. The purpose of this project is to familiarize my students with Muslim life. While Muslim students represent a small minority in our school, each year their numbers continue to grow. Sadly, many of our Muslim students are bullied. I hope to use the book Ms. Marvel to teach our non-Muslim students that Muslim students are no different than any other student. Since the story’s protagonist is Muslim, I’m hopeful that Muslim students will feel a sense of pride as they see an aspect of themselves represented in the curriculum. Conversely, I’m hopeful that the non-Muslim students will learn respect and tolerance for their Muslim peers. Once individuals learn to look beyond outward differences, they start to see that the similarities we share as human beings are far more important. By learning about others, we often learn about ourselves. If students can recognize that people are people, they will not only respect people that are different but respect themselves, too.
needStatement: My students need 50 copies of Ms. Marvel for a multicultural literature unit.

name: Bring A Midsummer Night's Dream to Life with Accessories!
description: My students make me want to teach for a lifetime in this urban environment. They are part of one of the largest urban school districts in MA. There are 42 languages spoken in our school community. We struggle with many of the same issues all urban school struggle with: full classrooms, not enough supplies, the many faces of poverty... But that is not what defines my students! My students are bright young individuals who deserve access to a thriving educational environment which challenges them to examine their own identity and how they can relate to others in this diverse world. We read A Midsummer Night's Dream by William Shakespeare every spring in order to both introduce students to the dramatic form and the rich language of Shakespeare. I encourage students to stand to read their roles and act out the scenes. With the addition of crowns and fairy wings flowers and wedding veils, A Midsummer nights dream can come to life even more in our English classroom. Students are so excited when they can watch their peers act out what they are reading or when they can participate in the actual play. The use of props will excite students and the classroom. We additionally need a few more copies of 'Shakespeare made easy.' With extra copies of the play students can take home books if they miss a day of class I need to make up work. Students faces light up when I bring in props from home, but it will be even better if these props can belong to my classroom and be used for multiple pieces of literature.
needStatement: My students need crowns, fairy wings and veils.

name: Reduce the Stress
description: In our classroom community you will see many different cultures and hear many different languages. Many of the students live in poverty and lack resources for learning at home. Despite these obstacles they all show up for school ready to have fun and learn. Every day the students' learning grows as: readers, writers, scientists, athletes, engineers, technologists, and mathematicians. I set high expectations and they meet every one of them. When you choose to give to our products you are giving to growing brains and life long learners!Our project has been created to relieve some of the environmental factors that get in the way of learning for some of my students. Our classroom has one window that is south facing. We do not get much natural light. We live in MN where the sun is not strong for 8 months of the year. This means that we need to have the classroom lights on. Some students and staff get headaches from the fluorescent lighting. The light covers will take the glare off. There are 26 six and seven year old students in my room. That is a lot of energy. The wobble chairs will help release some of that energy.
needStatement: My students need Wobble chairs and light covers to reduce the stress of the classroom.

name: Baby Belly Practice
description: Our school is in a rural Arkansas with over sixty percent of our students receiving free and reduced meals. Some of my students will go straight into the workforce, some will attend college and some will seek apprenticeships. All of my students need life skills to make sure they find success in their lives. We are on the edge of adulthood. Some are ready to leap and some are holding on with every fiber of their being. My class is a great preparation for life.  Students will discover what it feels like to carry a child by wearing the pregnancy simulator in our Child Development class. Discovering how you carry on with day to day living is a challenge for all. Boys and girls alike will utilize the simulator. By going through this simulation, students will gain knowledge about pregnancy. I'm wearing the belly without the responsibility! Students discover that it is a huge responsibility. Students will find out about the effect of pregnancy on the body and how women adjust. Our hope is that by using the pregnancy simulator, students will make good life decisions.
needStatement: My students need an Empathy Belly Pregnancy Simulator for our Child Development class.

name: School Supplies to ROCK!
description: Everyday in our classroom we are on the move! We work hard and rotate through different stations to focus on reading, writing and math concepts. We have to learn to collaborate and work hard in order to achieve everything we need to know to be ready for 2nd grade! My students come from pretty rough homes. A lot of my kiddos are in need of basic hygiene and healthy food. Getting them to learn is a challenge, especially without the materials we need every day. I work hard with what I have to give them the best education possible. I want them to have access to learning tools that will help boost their brains and make them grow! I want to be able to reach all types of learners. My students all have different needs and learning styles. I want to give them what they need in order to be successful. We will use the caddies at desk spots to keep our materials organized and safe from being broken or damaged. All of the puzzles will be used during a free choice time to work on strategies and to take a break after hard work! The markers, pens and clipboards will be used to work on our writing. Having a clipboard makes it easy to write and sit at the carpet time for instruction at the same time. The materials such as ten frames, number lines and magnetic letters will be used at independent work stations, mostly. The materials will help with math and reading centers. We also do a lot of cutting, gluing and coloring every day. We usually run out of glue half way through the year. It is something we always need! I try to do activities that are fun and engaging, not just pencil and paper work. We need these materials each day in order to make my lessons engaging. Doing this means the kids will have fun while they learn! This project will make a difference because it will provide the things we need in order to learn math and reading concepts. Its hard to teach on limited resources because most first graders are very hands-on. Just simply telling them and showing them a concept isn't enough. They need to have materials in order to build and create! These materials will help them to explore new concepts and learn.
needStatement: My students need these items (number lines, glue, puzzles, pens) to successfully do reading and math work stations. We will use these materials to do word work, sight words, and work on math concepts.

name: Stick to Learning
description: 'Every child has a different learning style and pace. Each child is unique, not only capable of learning but also capable of succeeding.' Robert John MeehanI have a group of 11 students with a variety of special needs. My students typically are two years behind grade level. This means that most of my first graders are performing lower than kindergarten. Many of my students are working on letter recognition, letter sounds, and creating words. Providing different resources for my students levels the playing field and gives them what they need to succeed!My students become very frustrated when their letters move off of the boards or table while they are working. When they become frustrated, they might shut down and not want to continue working on their goals. To prevent this we would love to have boards that the letters stick to. This will also allow the students to have a reference to how letters are formed without a teacher writing the letters each time. The students will be able to find the letter, identifying it, and then practice writing it! Our screen protector will help the students keep the iPad in great condition longer! We use our iPad every day for different applications that the students just love. Since they love it so much I would hate for the screen to get scratched because a scratched screen would mean that they would think it was broken and wouldn't want to use it.
needStatement: My students need magnetic white boards for letter and word work. We also need a screen protector for our iPad!

name: Vegetables and Butterflies, Oh My!
description: My students are a wonderful group of urban young people. We are a diverse group of Prek-8 students (99% African American) and most are from low socioeconomic backgrounds. One hundred percent of my students receive free lunch. Included in our population is a large group of hearing impaired students who have seamlessly intergraded into our classrooms. Being an urban district with very little funding, the only available resources we have are textbooks. Teachers are expected to work miracles with little or no funding. I believe that my students deserve so much more than that. When working in our vegetable and butterfly gardens the students have to take turns using the gloves and tools that were donated. We need each student to be able to work at the same time. It's no fun to sit and have to wait your turn when digging in the dirt! A drill and staple gun will enable the students to make signs for our garden. The students have ideas about making signs and need the tools to make those signs. They want to do all the activities in the garden themselves. They have collected recycled materials to make the signs and are excited to put their ideas to work.
needStatement: My students need garden tools to work in the school vegetable and our butterfly garden. We need gloves and tools for all students to use at the same time.

name: A Tisket, A Tasket.... We Need Baskets!
description: Our middle school is a diverse high-needs school of about 1,400 6th, 7th, and 8th-grade students. Almost 50% qualify for free or reduced-rate lunches. Many of our students receive services, including ESL, special education, and academic intervention. Despite the many obstacles my students face, they are hardworking, passionate, and enthusiastic about learning. My students working on this project love taking ownership of their classroom with student-led projects. We have received a ton of supplies and technology through DonorsChoose.org and they are so grateful for all of it. When they see a need for something and know there is an option to take an active part in their classroom, they do with DonorsChoose.org. Our class is broken up into 6 cooperative learning groups. Each group has its own supplies for various activities, lessons, or projects. They have scissors, glue, tape, crayons, markers, calculators, and their interactive science notebooks to keep organized. One of my students suggested to me to get something that can hold those supplies and keep them organized and easily accessible. My students are learning real-life problem-solving skills. They realized that our current system of staying organized with our supplies was not working. They brainstormed and came up with a great solution for the problem. They are learning to become responsible for their materials and learning to maximize their time. We need to organize our supplies. It takes away from our class time to get, use, and clean up our supplies. Many of our supplies get lost or broken when they are left at our group tables. It would be nice to have baskets at our group table to help oragnize all of our supplies so they are easy for us to access and use.
