We will take the lead by helping Mrs. Pitkewicz get this project funded. When the materials arrive, we will help her open all the boxes and oragnize the supplies into the baskets. The baskets will hold crayons, markers, glue, and other supplies. We will also help our classmates get and stay organized with this baskets. This project will help us get our groups get and stay organized. It will help keep all of our supplies neat. It will decrease the amount of messes and supplies getting lost or broken. It will teach my classmates to take responsibility for the supplies donated and bought for our classroom.
needStatement: We need various size baskets to organize our cooperative learning centers.

name: Kindergarten Playing Our Favorite Stories Everyday at School! ATPE Member
description: I have 24 bilingual students who enjoy listening to stories, write stories, and act out stories. Most of my students receive free breakfast everyday and receive free lunch. We are a Title I school with more than 900 students. For some of my students, this is their first year in school, and some of them do not have access to books or have someone that reads to them at home. They love to come to school to read, listen, and act out stories. All my students want to read the classic stories but having puppets and the books in a dramatic play center will be awesome. The dramatic play center will encourage my students to act out their favorite stories and at the same time, they will improve their social skills and their language. This project will help my students to have the opportunity to act out their favorite stories in their own dramatic play center in our classroom where they can present the stories to other students. This project will encourage my students to read more stories to be able to act out the stories and use the puppets.
needStatement: My students need books and storytelling puppets for a dramatic play center. They need Lakeshore Storytelling Kits, Let’s Talk! Storytelling Puppets, The Napping House Storytelling Kit, Storytelling Puppets, and three Storytelling Gloves.

name: Help Us Lock Down Our Exciting New Technology
description: My students make me want to teach for a lifetime in this urban environment. They are part of one of the largest urban school districts in MA. There are 42 languages spoken in our school community. We struggle with many of the same issues all urban school struggle with: full classrooms, not enough supplies, the many faces of poverty... But that is not what defines my students! My students are bright young individuals who deserve access to a thriving educational environment. Princess (Yes that is her name) is no different. She has been an articulate addition to my honors English classroom this year. Students are now able to work collaboratively to develop real world research and technology skills in our English classroom. I am thrilled to have funded laptops for my students through donorschoose.org, and now I want to secure this investment by bringing a secure laptop charging station into the classroom. Students will not only be able to research and learn more about our exciting world of literature, but they will be learning to work together on projects and developing their own group work style and ethic. The additional laptop will add to our growing classroom set of laptops. This will be more more devise to get technology in the hands of our students. The goal that I am trying to accomplish with this project is for students to be able to have computer access, and be able to use the computer for factual information related to school work. Also, the computers help students who don't have access to cellular devices and might not be able to use data in school. Having a cart for the computers to be secure would be great because that way they can be locked up when not in use.I am excited to do this project with Mrs. Bauer because I want students to have access to to different sources of what they could use to research school work. As a students I don't have internet source at home apart from my phone which I do not like to use for typing school work. Also I love being able to help my classmates and other students within the school who don't have access to computer. This project is important to me because as a leader in the class I want to expand my understanding on ways I can help students accomplish work related to school. My school community will appreciate this project because the school does not have enough money to buy technology for each individual classroom. With this project for a laptop and cart to store our laptops, it will help get more equipment to students.
needStatement: We need somewhere to secure our new technology in the classroom!

name: Boardmaker in Pre-K
description: My students are 4 and 5 year olds who love to 'read' to friends and to me. They love to work together and to show off what they know. My students are excited to learn new things in class. My students love to learn reading skills, math skills, science skills, and many other skills. I want them to stay excited about learning. This project will help me keep them excited about learning new and exciting skills. We will be able to work on pre-reading skills and students will know what we will be doing from day to day and minute by minute. My students, who may not recognize their names, do recognize picures. This program will allow students to put a picture with their names. I also have 4 and 5 year olds who cannot read yet. The boardmaker software will allow them to have picture schedules, picture job helpers, and numerous other pictures to go with our lessons in the classroom. It will also help them to improve our vocabulary in our day-to-day lives, too. This will allow students to improve talking to each other and they will be able to 'read' to each other, too. This will be super for our classroom.
needStatement: My students need Boardmaker software to be able to see pictures to go with our schedules, job helpers, pictures that start with the same sound as our name, to make alliteration and rhyming books.

name: Pedaling for Success
description: Research shows that our district scores 3 out of 10 possible points in relation to performance on test scores, parent involvement, income levels, family units, structures, and Title 1 funds. As a teacher in a high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. One of the ways that teachers are addressing these deficits is by taking a thoughtful look at how we are teaching our students. How can we change our strategies and best practices to more efficiently address the special needs of our population? The idea to have pedal bikes in the classroom that allow for the sensory input the students need is such an exciting part of our multi-tiered solution to our unique needs. As with all school districts, budgets are tight, and the tools we need to foster movement and build a kinesthetic environment are lacking. Help our students get the tools they need to help them become more successful in the classroom. Every person learns in their own unique way. Every student benefits from learning in a multi-sensory way; therefore, we, as teachers, need to present our lessons in a multi-sensory way. Multi-sensory learning involves teaching your child through each of the senses at the same time. This includes auditory, visual, and kinesthetic learning. Many teachers easily incorporate auditory and visual learning; however, including kinesthetic learning is more difficult. These pedal bikes will incorporate this important movement into learning. Many studies show that children who are physically active learn more; however, there are an increasing number of academic demands that limit the amount of time children can be physically active. These pedal bikes allow students to move without taking time out of their academics. Pedal bikes are going to help us pedal into success. Exercise helps stimulate the brain and the pedals keep kids moving without distractions. There has been a great deal of research on kinesthetic classrooms. Our vision is to bring these pedal bikes into our school to begin developing a kinesthetic classroom of our own. The National Education Association (NEA) published a great article and video on a kinesthetic classroom that can be found here: http://neahealthyfutures.org/the-kinesthetic-classroom-teaching-and-learning-through-movement/ Including pedal bikes into our classroom is one small step to making a kinesthetic classroom and incorporating movement into everyday learning for our students!
needStatement: My students need a way to incorporate movement into their day. These eight bike pedals will give students a way to move while learning.

name: Sensory Stools
description: A typical day in a classroom involves twenty to thirty students at desks or on the carpet. Students have sensory needs that are currently not being met. Each classroom is full of unique students; one size does not fit all! Our dream school would have lots of options for different learning styles. Our students come from a diverse neighborhood that has experienced significant shifts in recent years.A strong teacher and parent community has come together to support authentic, integrated learning experiences and provide the best education possible for each and every student. Our students are vibrant, active, inquisitive, and caring. They like to work, share, and play. As an International Baccalaureate school, we strive to provide a holistic learning environment. It is our goal to meet each students’ intellectual, social, physical, and emotional needs. Students with emotional, sensory, and academic needs will have a safe place to calm themselves, self regulate, and build confidence for academic success. The space will have subsections to accommodate students' specific needs. For example, a student who is agitated will have mats, fidgets, pillows, dim light, and/or a movement area to help with calming and regulation. This space will help students that need a break from the general classroom, as well as students that need help transitioning between classes. Students will learn how to identify their specific sensory needs and apply sensory tools to improve their regulation. We believe the sensory space will have a positive impact on the entire student population. Students, teachers, and parents will further their understanding of sensory systems and how an environment can shape learning and behavior. The donations to this project will enable students to stay focused and productive. Students will feel more successful when they have a space and the tools that meet their individual sensory needs such as three Hokki stools. Students will be able to transition into “school mode” and prepare for the day. This is a proactive approach to support students with repetitive behaviors that impact the learning environment. These tools and space will impact every student as it will decrease classroom distractions and disruptions.
needStatement: My students need three Hokki stools as part of a calming sensory room we are creating.

name: A Space for All Learners
description: A strong teacher and parent community has come together to support authentic, integrated learning experiences and provide the best education possible for each and every student. Our students are vibrant, active, inquisitive, and caring. They like to work, share, and play. As an International Baccalaureate school, we strive to provide a holistic learning environment. It is our goal to meet each students’ intellectual, social, physical, and emotional needs. Our students come from a diverse neighborhood that has experienced significant shifts in recent years.A typical day in a Vernon classroom involves 20-30 students at desks or on the carpet. Students have sensory needs that are currently not being met. Each classroom is full of unique students; one size does not fit all! Our dream school would have lots of options for different learning styles. Students with emotional, sensory, and academic needs will have a safe place to calm themselves, self regulate, and build confidence for academic success. The space will have subsections to accommodate students specific needs. For example, a student who is agitated will have mats, fidgets, pillows, dim light, and/or a movement area to help with calming and regulation. This space will help students that need a break from the general classroom as well as students that need help transitioning between classes. Students will learn how to identify their specific sensory needs and apply sensory tools to improve their regulation. We believe the sensory space will have a positive impact on the entire student population. Students, teachers, and parents will further their understanding of sensory systems and how an environment can shape learning and behavior. Students will feel more successful when they have a space and the tools that meet their individual sensory needs. Students will be able to transition into “school mode” and prepare for the day. This is a proactive approach to support students with repetitive behaviors that impact the learning environment. These tools and space will impact every student as it will decrease classroom distractions and disruptions.
needStatement: My students need materials to help create a space to calm down, energize, and re-focus.

name: Music Therapy for Special Ed.
description: My special education students are unique because they learn in different ways. They are energetic and excited to be in school. They sometimes struggle in class, which is why they qualify for special education. In my classroom, I try to make learning fun. Seeing kids smile when they learn is very rewarding. Some children learn better with hands-on activities. I like to design activities that allow kids to be active. If their bodies are moving, more blood flows to the brain, and learning is stimulated. Your donation will fund a music therapy project for high school and elementary special education students. Music soothes the savage beast, so it is said. Some kids can use the instruments to reset from a bad mood, some can build confidence, and others can use it as a social activity. Kids love music, and playing empowers them. This package contains instruments for a variety of skills. Students can make choices based on their ability or challenge level. Emotionally disturbed children will benefit from this project in several ways. First, playing music activates a different part of the brain than when they are angry, thus they are redirected to a happy place. Second, they learn social skills while playing with other students .
needStatement: My students need music instruments. These instruments, including a trumpet and a recorder, will help us.

name: World Geography through Maps
description: The students that I teach come from a variety of life experiences. We have students that struggle to make it to school because they have to care for their siblings while their parents work. They put in the effort when they are here, and really do want to learn. I always try to give them creative output for their learning, as I find it makes it more memorable, and the projects stay with them. Students at our school are always willing to step up and be creative. They are willing to try new things and love learning about the world. In Geography, my 6th grades truly get to experience the world and I cannot give them enough real world examples. My students are going to study the world. I need updated maps to help show how the world is constantly changing. I choose atlases that have current information about each of the regions of the world so that they can learn information outside of our normal textbook, as the information is often out of date. Learning about the world is increasingly important in order to be part of the global community. I am hoping that through the file folder activities, I can push my students to learn in a different way, and provide them the enrichment activities that pair well with the day to day learning.
needStatement: My students need updated maps and world information to study the world. The books that I have selected have great resources as well as current world maps of the world.

name: Music Makes Learning Happen in Our Classroom!
description: I am blessed beyond measure to teach in a true neighborhood school! We are one of the last remaining in our area. Each morning I greet my students at the door with a hug and a smile. I love to start their day off with happiness and positivity. I am blessed to teach five and six year old kindergarten children in my classroom. They come to school eager to soak up every morsel of knowledge they can. In my classroom, you will find a day filled with thematic teaching and projects, centers, shared reading and journal time. I teach in a title 1 school (high numbers of free/reduced lunches) in Alabama. I have 20-21 fantastic and precious kindergarten students in my classroom each year. I am blessed to come to a job each day where I can help these children learn, grow and most importantly develop a love of learning to last them a lifetime! Plato was quoted saying 'Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination and life to everything.' Music is such an important part in any thriving classroom, especially in early childhood. Music has the potential to enhance a child's learning, and set the tone for the optimal learning environment. I use music in my classroom during each and every part of our day. iPads and iPods are a portal to newer and higher levels of learning, even in kindergarten. We currently utilize this technology in our classroom to play our classroom music. A challenge all teachers face is time, or not enough time in the day. Each day I play character education songs, clean up songs, songs about rules/feelings, brain break dancing songs and even songs to set the tone for our activities in my class. Each time I choose to play music, I must take time out of the routine to hook up the iPod to the smart board. Having a wireless speaker in the classroom will allow me to save so much valuable instructional time by having the songs at my fingertips. I am so excited to not only save time, but be able to introduce so many more valuable learning songs to my kindergarten students.
needStatement: My students need a wireless speaker for our iPod that is capable of filling our entire room with our daily music.

name: STEM Activities For First Grade
description: Most of my students are behind in their academic progress. They have little help from home, so any learning gains take place in the classroom. We work all day long on writing, reading, science, and math and using the STEM materials we have has helped my students remain engaged and focused. My title one students are currently using our STEM materials and I have seen dramatic improvement in their learning gains. We have limited supplies and that is why I am trying to acquire more to continue this momentum we have built. We have an extra hour added to our day and using these activities helps my students stay engaged and become less fatigued. These experiments and engineering activities will extend my students learning and build critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Students will be able to design, build, test, and then improve their designs until they successful. Students will be learning about magnets, how objects sink and float, how objects move, weight and balance. Donations to my classroom will make a tremendous difference in my students' lives. My students will be talking, planning, building, testing, and improving their thinking and listening skills. These materials will enable my students to expand their minds and continue their learning gains using scientific, technology, engineering, and mathematical supplies.
needStatement: My students need a STEM kit and Giant Roller Ramps to build engineering designs. My students need STEM activities to teach problem solving skills and do open ended activities.

name: Ready For 1st Grade
description: My students are hard little worker bees. Give them a project and they are ready to tackle it. Give them a job and they are ready to do it. Their interest in school is pure and intrinsic. They love cutting & pasting and coloring. However, they also like having their own supplies. I see that sharing is not a high priority among 6 year olds. They try to share, but sometimes it just doesn't work out. To make everyone happy, they all need their own supplies. These items will help my students get off to a good start for 1st grade. The amount of supplies that students come in with has dwindled year after year. We need binders, erasers, markers, scissors and glue. When you start the new school year off right, nothing can stop you. Sharing supplies does not always work in 1st grade, so I am asking for basic supplies that my students will be able to use all year long. We do a lot of cut and paste activities, which they love. They also need the binders so we can save their work throughout the school year.
needStatement: My students need basic classroom supplies to keep everyone happy. Such as highlighters and dividers.

name: Non Fiction Science & Social Studies Books
description: In our classroom community you will see many different cultures and hear many different languages. Many of the students live in poverty and lack resources for learning at home. Despite these obstacles they all show up for school ready to have fun and learn. Every day the students' learning grows as: readers, writers, scientists, athletes, engineers, technologists, and mathematicians. I set high expectations and they meet every one of them. When you choose to give to our products you are giving to growing brains and life long learners!First Grade is the grade that students spend most of their day reading. Many students enter first grade as beginner readers. They are eager to put their hands on as many books as they can. The books in first grade are usually short and students need to have fifteen to twenty in their books boxes for independent reading. The books I have chosen for this project focus on non fiction reading in Science and Social Studies. Your generous donation to our project will improve our First Grade classroom by building a stronger reader and writer. When many different genres are offered to young readers, interest is born. Thank you for supporting the life long readers in my classroom!
needStatement: My students need nonfiction science and social studies books for independent reading.

name: Fidget to Focus
description: In our classroom community you will see many different cultures and hear many different languages. Many of the students live in poverty and lack resources for learning at home. Despite these obstacles, they all show up for school ready to have fun and learn. Every day the students' learning grows as: readers, writers, scientists, athletes, engineers, technologists, and mathematicians. I set high expectations and they meet every one of them. When you choose to give to our students you are giving to growing brains and life long learners!There are students that have a difficult time controlling their bodies or sitting for extended amounts of time. When they move around during lessons it creates behavior issues. The ball chairs, fidgets, and exercise bands will allow the students to use their energy while reading writing or working on math. By donating to our project, you will not only help to improve and increase student attention and focus, you will ultimately help to increase their academic achievement. With these motivating and creative ways to move, the students now have a way to use their energy in a positive and productive way. With fewer behavioral issues, we can increase our learning and time on task. I'm looking forward to seeing my students happier and ready to learn.
needStatement: My students need fidgets, ball chairs, and resistance bands to release extra energy and improve their focus.

name: Learning Powered With STEAM
description: In our classroom community you will see many different cultures and hear many different languages. Many of the students live in poverty and lack resources for learning at home. Despite these obstacles they all show up for school ready to have fun and learn. Every day the students' learning grows as: readers, writers, scientists, athletes, engineers, technologists, and mathematicians. I set high expectations and they meet every one of them. When you choose to give to our products you are giving to growing brains and life long learners!The snap circuits, Quick Cups, Suspension Game, and Chain Reaction Crafts will be used every day during our STEAM ( Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Math) time during class. STEAM will be a new piece in our daily schedule and your donation, will give students access to needed materials. The donations to this project will help to improve my students' understanding of authentic life long learning skills. Giving students that live in poverty the materials at school to learn with is an investment in their future. These materials allow students to tackle larger and more complex STEAM activities which will prepare them for college-level work.
needStatement: My students need games (Bounce-Off, Spot-It), kits (Snap Circuits), and supplies to work with to empower their learning of STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Math).

name: Help Us to Explore Our World
description: 'Some children may need a behavioral approach,whereas other children may need a sensory approach.' -Temple Grandin My students need access to more science and sensory materials so that they are able to actively explore their environment. They need to be able to move their bodies so they can learn. My classroom is one of four Pre-Kindergarten classrooms in our school. Our school has students ranging from pre-K to fourth grade. My classroom consists of 15 amazing children. They range in age from three to five. Seven of my students have Individualized Education Plans. The students with disabilities in my classroom vary. I have students who are unable to walk independently, students who are non-verbal, and students who have sensory needs that impact their education and social skills on a daily basis. My students come from a variety of cultures, socioeconomic sectors and family structures. Although they are all unique, they all have a common goal to be lifelong learners. They are curious and energetic. They play and move to learn. Even at a young age, they learn to work together to explore their environment and solve problems. My students have so much to offer, they teach me everyday! My students are very curious, active learners. They learn best from experiencing hands on learning opportunities. My students will be able to use the science materials to more actively explore their environment and thus learn more effectively. My students' curiosity will be fostered and their learning enhanced through being able to access these materials. My students will be able to participate in activities such as collecting natural materials outside, explore color mixing, experiment with magnets, look at different objects with a magnifying glasses to see a different perspective. In addition to the science materials, my students will also benefit greatly from the sensory materials. These materials, flashlights, tweezers and magnifying glasses, will directly impact their ability to focus and learn. My students will be able to adjust lighting to meet their needs. Students will be able to sit in chairs that are not stationary which will allow their bodies to move when they need to most. There is always room for change and improvement in our learning environments. Our students are constantly changing and growing. From day to day the needs of our students change and as an educator it is my job to foster a learning environment and classroom community that is able to best meet the needs of my students. If my students are able to be challenged yet have their basic needs met, they are more likely to become successful lifelong learners. This project will allow my students to grow.
needStatement: My students need materials to foster their natural curiosity! My students need materials such as flashlights, tweezers and magnifying glasses to enhance their learning.

name: Room ReDesigned...Flexible Seating
description: My students are amazing! I know you may have heard that before, but my students really are amazing. They are eager to learn and I love teaching and learning with them everyday! The students work hard to be successful. My students unfortunately do not have many opportunities living in rural New Mexico. They are members of the Navajo Nation and I want to give them the best opportunity to succeed. All students receive a free lunch each day. Our school has some of the highest scores in our district and students in my class scored with their grade level peers on the PARCC assessment last year.'Differentiation is simply a teacher attending to the learning needs of a particular student or small groups of students, rather than teaching a class as though all individuals in it were basically alike.'Carol Ann Tomlinson Flexible seating in the classroom will allow students to sit comfortably around the classroom where they will learn best. Students take the initiative in their learning. It prepares them for real-life, we are more successful when we make choices. Education and learning are changing and classrooms need to adjust to this change. Students will have the opportunity to work at a traditional desk, a standing table, couch, or floor. Various seating options will be available like cushions, roller chairs, stability ball chairs, and stools.
needStatement: My students need new seating options and tables to provide the opportunity to sit where they learn best. We need Gaiam Kids Stay-N-Play Balance Balls.

name: Renew Our Learning About Renewable Energy Resources
description: We are an inner city K-8 elementary school in a very high poverty area of a large metropolitan school district. Many students have their first experiences with science during their time with me. One unique aspect to our school is that we serve a large population of Somalians that are new to our country. The majority of my students are English Language Learners from both East Africa and Latin America. Our free lunch status is 98% or higher. My teaching position is one of a resource or specialist teacher who serves over 650 students throughout the school year. One of my personal joys is teaching these students year after year as they transition through their elementary grade levels. The future of science and engineering is in the hands of our young students. With that being said, we can add that the future of energy resources will be renewable ones. My students are blissfully unaware of how their consumption of energy is affecting our earth. With your help, our students will explore how electronics work using alternative methods of electricity. I am requesting 10 Green Energy Snap circuits electronics sets for hands-on learning about renewable energy. Using Snap Circuits Green Energy electronics kits, students will make a working wind turbine, a solar radio, hydroelectric powered light and more. It is with these hands-on activity kits that we will inspire the young scientists to be the engineers of the future.
needStatement: My students need 10 Green Energy Snap circuits electronics sets for hands-on learning about renewable energy.

name: Juicing in the Classroom
description: My students come from homes with little to no knowledge of health and nutrition. These kids live in a city lacking access of affordable fresh vegetables and fruits. The rising cost of living for students in this area places nutrition at the back burner of families financial needs. I have witnessed students consistently coming to school with bags of hot chips, Cups of noodles and blended coffee drinks for breakfast. When asked if they enjoy eating healthy students responded by saying they did not enjoy eating whole fruits and vegetables. Hearing these responses I did more research into other ways of enjoying nutrition. I found students would enjoy the amazing benefits of juicing their fruits and vegetables for the mind and body. After students got to experience the taste and process of juicing vegetables and fruits. They responded with high interest to continue juicing and want to make it a regular part of our classroom curriculum. Students will have the opportunity to explore other healthy options then accessible. Currently students are fueling their bodies with simple sugars, carbohydrates and high sodium products. This throughout the day is not substantial enough to have students perform at their best abilities in the classroom. We ask that you can contribute any amount to helping us reach our goal of purchasing four juicers. We will use these juicers to fuel the bodies and minds of all students. When students are provided the essential nutrients and vitamins their academic performance will excel not just in Physical Education but other core contents as well.
needStatement: My students need 4 Juicers to promote healthy nutritional choices.

name: Life Cycles and Life Science Excitement
description: My students come from all over the globe to learn in a small and aging school. Our neighborhood is in a huge city with a high number of refugees and energy employees. The diverse ethnicity in the class models the reality of our society, and I love seeing it work in real time! Many of our students arrive in the United States with absolutely no supplies. They learn how to eat in a cafeteria, and how to hold a pencil. This is their first introduction to books and the alphabet. Meanwhile, they are learning 2nd grade science concepts. We have two aquariums and a working garden, and butterfly habitats. Books and Hands-On Specimens will provide opportunities to explore and acquire science knowledge and vocabulary. Students will benefit from easy readers and life science exploration. Science vocabulary will be attainable with books and centers for both specific and open ended exploration. Life cycle books will supplement our butterfly gardens and frog environments. English Language Learners will thrive with colorful photography and clear diagrams from the books. The hands-on explanations and specimens will motivate use of vocabulary. Students will use the books to journal and create presentations about butterflies, frogs and more. Your donation will go far in helping 2nd graders!
needStatement: My students need STEM nonfiction books and books about the life cycle at levels appropriate for 1st-3rd reading levels. They need specimen centers to explore Life Science concepts.

name: iCan Learn with iPads
description: All kids deserve the same opportunities, including technology, in their schools. Kids are kids and we need to teach them that learning can be fun and that it is a life long process. My students are highly engaged in their learning when they use technology. My biggest challenge is making learning fun and interesting. I am a special education teacher in an elementary school. The grades I teach are K-6. I teach in a low income, struggling area and the resources just are not there. Our children need to experience and learn from computers to be up to date with technology. I believe the students can learn from many websites and apps on the iPad. The younger students can review letters, sounds, and numbers. The older children can review sight words and practice math fluency. There is so much that the students can learn from the different games and sites! An iPad will improve my classroom because my students will have a chance to use technology to learn in ways other than paper and pencil. All children need the opportunity to learn in a variety of ways. The bright colors, interesting sounds, and action on a iPad can really get students engaged in learning!
needStatement: My students need an iPad so they can be engaged in many different types of learning through games.

name: Tech for Kinders!
description: 'EDUCATION is not a problem, Education is an opportunity!' Lyndon Johnson. Here at our school, we are a family full of 5 and 6 years olds who are eager to learn and exceed beyond expectations and challenges that are presented to us each and every day! Our low income, Title I school raises the bar and sets expectations high even though teachers and administrators know what adversity and challenges the students meet every day. Our school is home to English Language Learners, a variety of cultures and customs as well as Life Skills Special Education children. We understand that some of the best success comes after challenges!Our eager kinders would utilize the iPads with cases daily in a variety of content standard tasks. The iPads allow ebooks at each kinders' reading level to be accessible and easily found for center reading. In math, a variety of apps will allow me to choose specific tasks and challenges to each student throughout our math time. We are also a STEM school and the more technology we get in our students' hands the better. I plan to have the students access our new 'Project: Lead the Way' curriculum via the iPads weekly. It is so essential for our young learners to have new technology at their fingertips daily!
needStatement: My students need STEM tools and technology at their fingertips! Our kindergarten class would utilize the 6 iPad minis and cases daily in class.

name: We Need Pet Supplies! Wheek! Wheek!
description: Many of our students have few 'extras' in their homes with overwhelmed families, many of whom are single parents struggling to make ends meet. Our class pet guinea pig, Minnie, is at the heart of our kindergarten classroom community. We need you to support us so we can continue to care for our beloved furry friend. Funding our project will help brighten the life and school experiences for some of our youngest and most impressionable learners. Please help us learn love, care, and responsibility!We have classroom community jobs each week, including class pet care for our guinea pig, Minnie. Minnie loves to be read to and is included as a regular literacy station students may participate in during our school day. Students will learn responsibility, turn taking, and patience. We will spend a lot of time reading and studying guinea pigs and how to care for them. Our goal is to become 'guinea pig experts' through the exploration of high interest picture books about guinea pigs. Visiting Minnie is also a special and highly motivating reward available to all students in our school building. She brings knowledge and joy with her!
needStatement: My students need small pet bedding, guinea pig food and hay, cage cleaning supplies, and books to read about how to care for guinea pigs.

name: Using iPads as Communication Devices
description: My students attend a special education school. This means that they have specific disabilities or diagnoses that interfere with their ability to attend a regular education program. They require teachers, related service providers (speech, occupational, and physical therapists) who are specialized and have experience working with students with special needs. They also require adapted equipment such as modified chairs or desks that have more support, use of objects and pictures to convey information, equipment for the related service providers, and communication devices that help my students speak and express themselves. My students have special needs such as autism, intellectual disabilities, motor-speech disorders, genetic syndromes, etc. They have a lot of difficulty with language and communication. This means that many of the students cannot speak or speak in one-two sentences. These students use an alternative form of communication such as an augmentative device or laminated picture cards. Most have language delays that affect their ability to understand, express themselves, and interact with peers. This may also lead to issues with frustration or expressing themselves through behaviors. The 2 iPads I am requesting will help my students communicate. Most of them have difficulty with expressing themselves. Some have motor-speech disorders that make it extremely difficult to speak, in addition to other disabilities such as autism spectrum disorders or an intellectual impairment. Other students have difficulty speaking in sentences and typically only use one or two words. The iPads will be used with students in speech therapy to teach them to use communication applications to 'speak'. These applications uses pictures and words laid out in a specific way so students can press cells that speak for them. The iPads become their 'voices'. It gives them the ability to connect with others in a way they cannot naturally. It helps give them control over their environment by being able to say yes/no or to describe what they want.
needStatement: My students need 2 iPad Air tablets so they can express themselves using communication applications.

name: Wobble While You Work
description: The school in which I teach is an arts-infused school. I will be teaching 2nd grade in the 2016-17 school year. My students come from a variety of backgrounds. Some of my students have the latest technology at home, while others see the latest technology in the classroom. The students at my school have a love for learning and a great deal of creativity. They are very active, and they are always ready for an opportunity to show their 'colors'. As a teacher at an arts infused school, it allows me to engage and motivate students by emphasizing active learning rather than passive learning. I have found it to be easier to level the playing field for my children so they all have the opportunity to be successful! I want to help our 21st century learners by providing them with alternative seats for their growing and moving bodies. The perfect solution is the Wobble Chairs. I would like to purchase 6 Wobble Chairs for my classroom for the students to use as an outlet for their energy. Young children are made to move and the Wobble Chairs allow them to do just that! The chairs provide stability and flexibility; they are great exercises for their backs, legs, and abdominal areas. The Wobble Chairs are designed with a rounded bottom and the seats become a playground for the child’s imagination. The Wobble Chairs allow the knees, hips, and backs to find comfortable positions. We would love for you to help us with this project so we can Wobble While We Work!
needStatement: My students need 6 Wobble Chairs so they can wiggle and move while they work.

name: LEARNING WITH ART & MUSIC
description: My students live for creativity and incorporating music and art into their love of learning. My school is in a 100% critical needs area. As one of the poorest regions with the lowest income rate in Mississippi and America, the children in this community use art to build projects, draw, and paint while listening to classical music . Students spend hours writing and following the writing process and have drawn posters in their own creative ways to remind themselves that writing is a process. My students have also created posters with grade level vocabulary words and definitions to catch the eye of all of the students while they are changing classes. I purchased I Pads and art design apps on last year to help the students create their own design/vocabulary journals called, 'Smart By Design'. My students started to look forward to coming to class to write in their journals which they had to leave at school daily. Attendance increased and behavior of the students dramatically increased as well. I have taught many years and when I started to incorporate 'Art, Music and Journaling' into my classroom on a daily basis, I saw 100% success rate. Donations to this project would be momentous. The graphic drawing tablets will allow my students to incorporate technology into their skills and enhance their abilities. The sketch book paper and paint will allow them an outlet to do formatted assignments with the right supplies. The projector screen would serve as a collaborative tool along side the projector I purchased this past year for my classes to trace art and watch films, music and art shows. Art and music give the students an imagination boost to create beauty as they would like to see it. My students look forward to my class everyday and it is because of the way I incorporate art and music in my lessons every single day in some form or fashion. My students are of all ethnicities and backgrounds. The students use their drawings to paint pictures about History, Shakespeare, Slavery, Mathematics, Spanish, Reading and so much more. The students place a summary of the meanings of each painting beneath each painting. The students post their paintings all across the campus for other students to learn as well and I can tell that they are proud and excited about their work. Attendance has increased and students' morale is at an all time high. I differentiate instruction for my students with special needs and they love my class even more. If given this donation, all students will be able to continue their work with adequate training and supplies. This donation would be a dream come true for us all.
needStatement: My students need art supplies for project based learning activities we do daily in my class. I am requesting graphic drawing tablets, sketch books, and art supplies, a radio to play music.

name: Dress Up Our Choir!
description: My students live in a small, rural town in Michigan. Our school is considered high poverty and does not have the extra resources needed to run a full-fledged choral program. The students in my high school choir love to sing and want to be given the chance to have the same opportunities as other schools. Last year we had 36 students involved in our choir and most of them are coming back next year. They have so much potential and I really want them to see their dreams become reality.  Our high school has just one choir for students to be involved in. That means we have to make our one choir count! We would love to go to choral festival this year, but we need to get new dresses to look professional. Our current dresses don't match and have seams ripping out of them. The girls in our choir would really like to have dresses that all look the same and help us represent our school with pride. We may have a small school district, but we take pride in who we are and what we have to offer. The students have worked very hard this year to learn more about choral singing and how to perform with a professional appearance. Having new dresses would help them feel more confident and proud while they are performing. It would also help them know that their community believes in them and the music they are making. The choir students were thrilled to look through the dress catalog and pick out a new dress style that they really liked. The dress they chose looks professional, and is one that we will be able to order again in the future if we need to buy more or get another size. They also liked the rhinestone pin that was shown as an accent to the dress. Purchasing 40 dresses and pins allows us to have enough inventory for the students who will be in choir next year and in the future. Please help our choir represent our school with pride as we are performing at choral festival, our concerts, and graduation.
needStatement: My students need new dresses with Rhinestone pins for their high school choir performances!

name: Flexible Seating, the Effective Way to Learn!
description: Every day my fourth graders bring to life our classroom with their individuality, laughter, emotional intensity, and willingness to learn. Collectively, they ask 100 questions before they even manage to sit at their desks. “What are we doing today?” “Is it lunch time yet?” “Do we have math this morning?” I quickly catch on to what type of question will come from which student, and the best way to answer it to satisfy the eagerness. The individuality of my students is evident from the easy questions in the mornings to their learning styles that lead to their academic success. At all different educational levels, I provide rigorous lessons as well as tutoring for those who need extra support. Primed for learning, my fourth graders are passionate about their work. I am a part of one of the fastest growing districts in our county because families move here so their children can attend quality schools. The quality schools allow me, as a teacher, to design a unique learning environment tailored to support unique learning styles. If student motivation and higher engagement is truly what my goal is, then I must adapt right along with my students in my classroom. I've noticed over the years that most of my students cannot sit and learn in a conventional classroom so I've found that some of the immediate benefits of flexible seating include using up excess energy, improving metabolism, increased motivation and engagement, and creating a better oxygen flow to the brain. I want my classroom environment to be conducive to open collaboration, communication, creativity, and critical thinking. This simply cannot be done when kids are sitting in rows of desks all day. I teach and live in a great district that provides for their students but new concepts are at the expense of the teacher until they are proven to be effective. With the donations of wobble stools, yoga balls, and floor cushions my students will be able to focus more on engagement instead of their inability to sit in a chair.
needStatement: My students need non-traditional seating like wobble stools, sit-upons and balance balls.

name: Colorful Carpet
description: In our classroom community you will see many different cultures and hear many different languages. Many of the students live in poverty and lack resources for learning at home. Despite these obstacles, they all show up for school ready to have fun and learn. Every day the students' learning grows as: readers, writers, scientists, athletes, engineers, technologists, and mathematicians. I set high expectations and they meet every one of them. When you choose to give to our students you are giving to growing brains and life long learners!In first grade we start our day gathered around in a circle to have a community morning meeting. It is an engaging way to start each day, build a strong sense of community, and setting children up for success socially and academically. Our classroom needs a colorful carpet to gather on for morning meeting and during whole group lessons. The colorful carpet we choose has the alphabet and numbers on it to reinforce learning. Not only will we be able to see each other we can reciting a poem, dancing, singing, or playing a game that reinforces social or academic skills.
needStatement: My students need a colorful oval carpet to gather on for lessons.

name: 3D Printer to Lift My Students to a Higher Dimension!
description: My students LOVE to create 3D shapes using paper. In a typical day in my classroom, we work together as a creative team questioning, learning, and exploring the world around us! I am eager for them to learn the engineering design process using a 3D Printer! As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things simple and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. Our 3D Printer will be safely stored in a specialized location in our Science Tools' Gallery within the classroom for access to all students. The students will engage in 3D printing and design activities. Giving low-income students access to new technology is an investment in their future. My students will see that I appreciate all that they do for our school and our community. A 3D printer and filament will be an asset to our class and school community. We are excited and can't wait to have a 3D printer this fall. The lower grades will be able to learn, design and print the four basic 3D Shapes (a sphere, a cylinder, a cone and a cube). The upper grades will design and print tools that are helpful to some of their peers who needed assistance with daily living activities, like a cup holder. We will be hosting a mini STEM fair at our school site before the district-wide STEM fair in later this year.
needStatement: My students need a 3D Printer and filament for our STEM Program.

name: You Should Listen to Yourself!
description: All of the students in my classroom are bi-lingual. Most of them speak Spanish and English as a second language. They also speak mostly Spanish at home, which makes it extra important they speak mostly English at school. If they can hear their own words as they speak them, it will greatly improve their listening and speaking skills. We practice English Language Development on a daily basis. We also have to double our efforts to learn to be strong readers in English. It's a challenge, but it's awesome to see the progress they make throughout the year as their reading levels rise. Donations to this project will allow my students to have a personal Toobaloo whisper phone to use at their desks as they read independently. We do this every day for about 20 minutes per session. Students love this. These simple tools will improve student reading skills and build confident readers. It's always challenging to find good ways to raise reading levels. Strong reading skills are essential to strength in all other subject areas. If I can help my students strengthen personal reading levels, they will be more successful and more prepared as they are readied for the next grade level.
needStatement: My students need 24 personal Toobaloo whisper phones in order to build strong reading skills by speaking and listening.

name: Literacy Materials for Mrs. B's 1st-Grade Class!
description: My students are creative, clever and very spontaneous. They like to move, they love to read, and love lots of positive attention. Many of them are being raised in single parent households and all of them receive a free lunch based on their socioeconomic status. These things may prevent them from getting ahead early in life and may not provide them with the life experiences many of us see as 'typical'. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom, I focus on their potential and growth while they are with me. I may not be able to control their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. By doing this in a loving, creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our earliest learners to continue on a path of academic excellence. Your generous donations to my project will improve our 1st grade classroom by investing in the reading foundation of these students. A listening center, sight word games, and fun and calming classroom decorations and supplies will help improve my students' reading skills by giving them more opportunities to read and hear literature, as well as having a fun and calming environment to read and learn in. Creating a solid foundation will build stronger readers and writers. This will change our students' lives for the better, because with a solid reading foundation, they will have a better opportunity to become successful individuals and beat the odds that have been placed against them, being more than half residing in low income, high poverty areas. By doing this in a loving, creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our earliest learners to continue on a path of academic excellence. My goal is for my students to love school and feel success at an early age --- having fun while learning!
needStatement: My students need a listening center to help improve their literacy skills. My students also need materials to help improve their literacy and math skills and to create an inviting classroom atmosphere, including sight-word puzzles, practice cards, and games.

name: Seating That Stimulates Learning
description: Our student population is economically diverse, 50% of our students come from low income families.. Our school houses diverse special education programs for the district, and these students are integrated into our classroom. Over the years we have seen an increase in diagnoses of ADHD, Autism Spectrum Disorders, and various emotional behavior needs. Due to the changes in our population and diverse needs of our students, we have decided to combine all 5th grade classes into a flexible learning environment. We are hoping for a complete classroom makeover and are leaving the traditional classroom behind for a flexible learning environment. Flexible seating is phase 1 or our project. Flexible seating spaces allow students to work collaboratively and engage in critical thinking. The wobble chairs, bean bag and stability ball will allow students to make choices in their environment to help them discover how they learn best through flexible seating options. As recess decreases in our schools, we see the increased need for students to MOVE. These materials will benefit the classroom by making it a more welcoming and student-centered environment catered to all individual learning needs.
needStatement: My students need opportunities to interact with each other in flexible seating to learn in ways that best meet their individualized needs. We are leaving traditional seating behind and moving toward flexible seating.

name: From HOME to HOMEroom to classROOM!
description: My students make me want to teach for a lifetime in this urban environment. They are part of one of the largest urban school districts in MA. There are 42 languages spoken in our school community. We struggle with many of the same issues all urban school struggle with: full classrooms, not enough supplies, the many faces of poverty... But that is not what defines my students! My students are bright young individuals who deserve access to a thriving educational environment which challenges them to examine their own identity and how they can relate to others in this diverse world. Sitting in desks all day is overrated. WE want to create a safe, comfortable space which makes us at ease discussing sometimes uncomfortable topics around race and ethnicity. I want students to have a place which feels like it is 'theirs.' Students will be encouraged to read and have small conversations in our 'library' area of the classroom. This area is already rich in books, but we want to build a room within a room with a rug and arm chair. The donation of these materials, will help add to the enrichment and feel of our classroom. My students will enter a class which is transformed beyond the standard classroom. They will be comforted and secure to begin the difficult work of learning and growing.
needStatement: My students need a 'space' for feeling at home - They need an area in our classroom to feel like they can hang out and read a book or have a conversation.

name: Easel For Learning Activities!
description: I have twenty-five wonderful, energetic, and curious first grade students. The students in my classroom speak a variety of languages-eight total! My school is eighty-eight percent free or reduced price lunch, and is quickly rising. Half of the students at my school identify as Asian, a quarter identify as African American, fourteen percent identify as Hispanic, ten percent identify as Caucasian, and one percent identify as American Indian. My classroom is rich with diversity and we celebrate each student's identity and culture. My students are always moving! I use alternative seating, center based learning, and differentiation to target the needs of all of my students. In my school, the classrooms are co-taught and have a cluster of students who are just learning English or have special needs. I currently have a Language Academy room. Next year, 2016-2017, I will have the special educatioon room and I couldn't be more excited! A lot of the learning in our classroom happens sitting on the carpet (that I'm requesting in another project) looking at the easel. The easel my class has right now, is extremely old, does not erase, and does not hold supplies that we need to easily access in order to learn. The easel we currently have is small and the students at the back of the carpet cannot always see the board which hinders their learning. My students need this easel cart with magnetic numbers, blocks and letters to increase their ability to learn and give them the same chances that other students in wealthier districts have.
needStatement: My students need an easel with magnetic teaching numbers, blocks and letters, plus a calendar kit.

name: If You Give A Man The Internet...
description: My students are creative and compassionate young adults hailing from the South and West sides of Chicago. They live in the face of extreme violence and frequent instability. At our school, 100% of the students are African American and living in poverty. They are dedicated to taking care of themselves, their friends and their families. They bring it every day and that motivates me to bring it every day - and to fight to give them the school they deserve. If you give a man information, you teach him for a day. If you give a man the internet... you will allow him to teach himself forever. And that is really the ultimate goal of education! Our classroom would be transformed with the ability to go online and use Google's suite of applications any time, any day. The internet is humanity's greatest access point to our collective knowledge - and in many ways to one another. And besides the general richness of ideas, knowledge and opportunities that providing this to my students will allow, the internet also provides endless new science simulations, activities, and tools to enhance our lessons and engage in authentic learning experiences. As a teacher, this will streamline our class operations (I envision using Google classroom, providing an updated calendar with each day's lessons and deadlines, not PRINTING EVERYTHING OUT) and astronomically multiply our learning opportunities. For my students, digital literacy is HUGELY important to developing into our future citizens and workforce- they need more experience typing, writing emails, and learning to effectively search and vet sources online, to name a few skills. They also crave anything connected to the internet and computer time (we do not have a library or dedicated devices for all our students to use; the lab is usually taken for online classes). So having computers will certainly engage them in learning in an avenue they are already deeply invested in exploring. We hope they can send you a thank-you email soon!
needStatement: My students need chromebooks and carts to store and charge them.

name: Al-WRITE Al-Write Al-Write!
description: I have a wonderful group of 24 first graders from a rural area in central Arkansas. It is a diverse group of personalities and backgrounds that includes ELLs, > 50% free/reduced lunch, military families, special needs, and most importantly awesome kids who are eager to learn! My 1st graders are brimming over with enthusiasm and excitement for learning, life, friends, and interests. We jump into projects with both feet, make big plans, work at a breakneck pace, and don't miss a thing! The notebooks will be great for helping us stay organized and on the subject, but also the students are always excited about having their very own writing notebooks. Writing notebooks are also great for assessing their writing growth over time-as well as a special keepsake for families. Writing is a major focus area in 1st grade; I want to get them off to a great start as writers, and on a solid foundation. A great pencil sharpener is a must! I am eager to have them put sharp pencils to papers and hit our handwriting skills hard and heavy this year! I hoping the happy hedgehog kit will be a great motivator to promote neat handwriting this year!
needStatement: My students need writing materials: pencil sharpener, writing folder, & writing notebooks.

name: Innovative Seating, Innovative Learners - The Power of Choice!
description: The students that I teach are full of life. They want to learn in a manner that suits their own personalities. My students are 21st century learners, meaning they love technology and overall are kinesthetic learners. I think giving them choice and opportunity to do work wherever they want in the room is motivating and beneficial to their learning experience. Since every child is different, I believe in having different choices and opportunities for them. They love having a voice and choice in their seating arrangement and activities during the day. My dream is to set up my classroom like a coffee shop. When you go into a coffee shop to do some work, you have choice. I don't have someone telling me my spot for the remainder of my time there. I have the choice to pick my seat. I also have the choice to change my mind and sit somewhere else during my time at the coffee shop. My students love the opportunity to have a voice in the classroom. Having different seating options will really help them in determining where they want to complete their work. Setting my classroom up as a coffee shop will really emphasize the type of learning environment my students want and need. I want to lower one desk and have the deluxe sit-upons as an option for students who want to work at a desk but in a different way. Wobble chairs around a table would be the perfect asset to my classroom for those students who like to move while they work. Other things I plan on doing is having one table with chairs and one table that will be raised up to be a stand and learn desk. I will provide stools under the raised desk to provide a seating option if need be. Yoga mats and clipboards will also be utilized in my room for those students that work best lying down. I also have two youth camping chairs and a metal table to provide different seating.
needStatement: My students need 10 pillows and 4 wobble chairs.

name: Fire Up Online Learning with Kindle Fires
description: Our school provides quality education to urban students in Washington D.C. One of the primary ways we engage students and support their individualized learning needs is by incorporating blended learning into our classrooms. The students in my class are most excited to learn when they have the opportunity to engage in online learning websites. Students also enjoy accessing the internet to conduct research, create PowerPoints and brochures that describe what they are learning. These online opportunities are also great for providing an individualized learning plan for each student to be successful. My students come from a variety of backgrounds and are often at different academic and behavioral levels. Using technology allows us to be as specific as possible with what students learn to ensure they are learning at the perfect pace for themselves. At our school students spend a large portion of their day learning on blended learning websites. These websites increase student engagement and allow students to learn at their own pace and level. When students have additional access to these websites, their potential success in school increases tremendously. Students at my school LOVE working on ST Math, which is a game-based math learning website. This website helps students develop a deep understanding of math concepts in a fun way so that they are excited about math. I have requested five Kindle Fires plus protective cases so my students have the opportunity to access online learning sites more often and maximize the learning that can happen through websites.
needStatement: My students need 5 Kindle Fire e-readers and protective cases and screen covers so more students have additional access to our online learning websites.

name: Wobble Baby Wobble!
description: I am SO excited to dive into the world of flexible seating in my classroom! I am extremely blessed to work with some of the most amazing students in the world! Although we are a very small school, I don't want to limit the opportunities for my kiddos. In my classroom, I am a firm believer of song, movement, play, and engaged learning. Each of my students have their own special way of learning, and giving them a flexible seating choice will certainly help foster more engagement!In my classroom, I have found that giving students a choice and voice is a huge part of their learning! With flexible seating, my students will be able to make decisions of where they would like to sit, based on their learning style. I am always looking for best practices and researched based ways of learning. Flexible seating will engage my students, especially with the movement on the WOBBLE chairs! These resources will give my students the opportunity to work in groups, as well as, individually. They will also cut down on behavioral issues, which will give us more time for learning!
needStatement: My students need some Kore WOBBLE chair, balance balls, and cushions for our flexible seating!

name: A New Fitness Room for Weight Training at LHS
description: Lankenau HS is an off-site, special-admissions program for students who thrive in a small, family-like environment. We are a high school of approximately 350 students and staff, located in the hills of Upper Roxborough on a scenic campus, far away from the pressures of city living. We have often been called 'The Country Campus for the College Bound.' That is a fitting description of our physical setting--and we do expect every student to go to college. All students are transported from their neighborhoods to our front door. Our student body is serious and goal-directed, maintaining an average daily attendance of over 90%. We are proud of our students and believe that each one can achieve at high levels. We have high expectations for student learning and achievement within a safe and supportive environment. Our students will be able to use the the new fitness room as a Lab for health and PE class, as well as, gaining a hands on understanding of how muscles work. Our sports teams will have a place to train and to lift weights; weight training is a necessity for football, basketball and sports like track and field. Many of our students come from lower economic backgrounds where they can not afford a monthly gym membership. Lankenau will hopefully be able to offer the students a place to get a proper workout. It is also important that our faculty remain healthy and fit, our fitness room will provide a place to help them stay in shape. Please help in raising funds to create a wonderful new weight room at Lankenau High School. This money will be used to purchase new, up to date equipment as well as enhance the appearance of the room. Our kids deserve a modern, state of the art facility. The weight room is where it all starts!!! This weight room will be a wonderful new addition to our school.
needStatement: My students need smith machines, free weights and cardio machines that would compare to a regular gym outside school.

name: Help Dot and Dash Come Home!
description: Welcome to Gahaferland! This is a sign that hangs on the front door of our classroom. It started out as a catchy phrase but has developed a far deeper meaning. Gahaferland is home to energetic and eager learners. Gahaferland calls a rural, Title 1 school home. In our classroom alone we speak 5 different languages and call several countries home. My students are diverse in socioeconomic background and home environments. Many students do not have Internet access at home, and some live in a mobile home community. I have several gifted and talented students eager to create and learn. Although they come from various backgrounds, one thing they have in common is their enthusiasm to learn. They are an energetic, and a very gracious group. Dash & Dot robots are hands-on learning tools that teach creativity, problem solving, and coding to children. Children can see their code come to life in a real-world, hands-on way that engages them fully in the concepts they are learning about. As robotics and computers become increasingly prevalent in students’ lives, understanding programming concepts is becoming very important for students’ success. Students will work in small groups to develop their collaboration and communication abilities as they learn valuable 21st century skills. Help my students get introduced to STEM early and cultivate their skills for the opportunities of today’s world. The possibilities are endless for these robots and I can’t wait to use them in all subject areas to enrich my student’s learning. My students live in a rural part of our county and many are on free and reduced lunch. Many of them do not have the opportunity to learn through through technology, let alone robots, at home. I want to give them opportunities to learn and grow and develop real world skills. I want all of my students, especially my female students, to feel inspired in the field of science and technology. There are possibilities for me and my students to use the robots in reading, writing, and social studies as well. I know these robots would have huge impacts on my instruction and classroom environment this year! Any help would be much appreciated!
needStatement: My students need the Dash and Dot Robot pack and Launcher attachment to learn STEM skills and enrich all content areas.

name: Outdoor Magazine Authors
description: I am going to be teaching at an alternative middle school next year for 6-8th grade students who are at this Title 1 school for additional help academically and to grow into responsible young adults. These students need innovative and authentic learning experience that will motivate them to come to school, try their best and show them how they impact the world around them. These students are faced with many challenges at home and at school so this project will give my students a sense of accomplishment and will give them life skills in reading, writing, science, and caring for the environment. The soft skills such as team work, meeting deadlines, reviewing and editing work, perseverance and grit are all great skills for future college and career goals. In Idaho we enjoy the great outdoors and my science students are going to have great authentic learning experiences because of a partnership with the Fish and Wildlife agency to include adopting a pond/park area next to our school to care for and research the wildlife and natural environment. Our students will work to conserve the natural habitat. The students will be able to contribute to the pond/park by planting willows with the agency, testing environmental factors to keep the pond healthy and monitor the fish population. With all these great experiences our students need to be able to share their learning with others through a printed magazine for younger students and an online format for older students. Both versions will be written by students and shared with the other 13 schools in our district. We are requesting the printer and ink to begin our magazine project so students can print their articles for editing, build a magazine sample for class review and then print to distribute. Students will then send magazine issues of 'Outdoor Idaho' to the 6 elementary schools. The other middle schools and high schools will get 5 printed copies for their libraries and they will also have access to the online version of the magazine. There will be 4 magazines written, edited and produced by the 6th-8th grade students. The Scholastic Science World magazine will be for the class to use as a research tool for topics as well as a model of what a science magazine offers and for the modeling of the format of a magazine.
needStatement: My students need to be able to write about the science around them in the world by creating a magazine to share with others in our state and in partnership with our local fish/wildlife agency We need Science World and a printer.

name: Tech for Talking
description: I have the opportunity to make a difference every day for an amazing group of students with complex communication needs. Many of these students are seen, but not heard. I believe that children should be heard and with your help, communication devices will give students a voice in the classroom. I am a Speech Language Pathologist in an inner-city high need community. Our district is large with over 35 schools and our needs are great...all of our students receive free breakfast and lunch. I currently provide direct therapy and language support services to 35 students with augmentative communication systems. My students range from preschool through high school age and are in several different classes throughout our large district. These students are challenged daily to communicate and interact with others. They have a wide range of communication skills and benefit from technology supports when communicating and learning. Many of these students are non-verbal or have limited verbal skills and need communication devices to augment their communication. Speech generating devices give the students who communicate with pictures a voice in the classroom. These devices are simple, button operated devices. The student touches the picture and the device speaks for them! The devices are small and portable and can be used across many different learning environments. The devices are easy to program and a new message can be recorded within seconds. We have had great success using speech generating devices to promote language growth in our students. Some devices are used for individual students while others are programmed to support class activities such as morning meeting. I am requesting 2 GoTalks to be used with our emerging communicators. These devices will provide many opportunities for language learning and communicating. I am also requesting batteries to keep our devices working. Your support will provide students with a voice. You will give these students technology they need to communicate and an opportunity to successfully express themselves...Let's GoTalk!
needStatement: My students need 2 GoTalk speech generating devices and batteries for communicating.

name: Celebrating Success
description: My students love to receive incentives at awards ceremonies because they are amazing! Being acknowledged and praised for their hard work helps to keep them motivated! Incentives are in great need for the upcoming school year. My students live in the South Bronx, one of the poorest congressional districts in the country. The school's population is about 320 and the majority qualify for free lunch. My students are Hispanic, African-American, African, and West Indian. A large amount of them also live in single parent households. They are hard workers, energetic, talented, and resilient young people eager to learn new things. Incentives will given out at awards ceremonies to keep our students motivated! My students need incentives such as certificates, motivational pencils and pens, ribbons, and stickers to motivate them to continue their hard work in school. We celebrate the academic, athletic, and emotional success of our students. Every quarter an awards ceremony is planned and parents are invited to help us celebrate.
