Students will have an opportunity to walk across the stage and receive an award that states that hard work does pay off. This is the time for my students to really shine! Help us make it happen! It's beautiful to see the smiles on their faces and their parents as their names are called. Students also also surprised on a weekly basis for their leadership role in the classroom and community. These incentives will be used to acknowledge my students' hard work.
needStatement: My students need incentives such as certificates, motivational pencils and pens, ribbons, and stickers to motivate them to continue their hard work in school.

name: A Picture is Worth 1000 Words
description: Our school is considered the second most impoverished elementary school in our metropolitan district. Many of the families struggle day to day to get their basic needs met. We work every day to make sure they are not lacking in these areas. The staff is deeply committed to shaping the learning of children we refer to as 'scholars'. I am a speech and language pathologist who has served this community for many years. Our scholars, like any other children their age, love to see their faces represented in pictures. We have worked hard to post posters of mentors and achievers who look like our multicultural group of students. However the students love pictures of themselves. As a teacher of handicapped students, I also use pictures of the students to help them learn and talk about day to day tasks, to explain to parents what they have done in school., and to display their work. They are used to provide a stimulus to improve their language skills through story telling, as well as to provide the parents with a connection to the school day. I am also the chairperson of the year book committee that relies on candid pictures.I have seen it throughout my career in education. When a student or scholar sees a picture of themselves or and their family and friends, it opens up conversation with even the most language challenged student. Many of the families of the students in our school do not have the resources to spend on pictures. The pictures will increase the students, and their families', engagement in the academic goals, give them a concrete reference to help them talk about events, help them see themselves as learners. Pictures will be used within my classroom but also in the hallways and on video to highlight their involvement in school events and school goals. Additionally, they will help represent our students in the yearbook. Our school provides the yearbook to all families whether they can pay for it or not.
needStatement: My students need a Canon EOS Rebel camera for quality pictures of themselves in their learning community for language/academic enrichment/engagement and for use in the yearbook. Thank You!

name: Seating Choices Make for Happy Students and More Learning
description: As a teacher in a predominantly low socioeconomic, rural area, my students come to me with all kinds of challenges and personalities. I want to create a classroom as friendly and diverse as they are. Sixth graders are in their tween years; they want to be more independent and have more choices. In science and social studies, I'll be building on all of the concepts learned in their elementary years. My students range from gifted and talented, to students with severe learning disabilities and everything in between that you could possibly think of. My students are diverse in many ways and need a diverse learning environment. Seating choices can help. Having seating choices such as not sitting at all, sitting on a chair where you can wiggle, or sitting on the floor with a cushion are just a few of the choices that can make a big difference. Being in 6th grade, students like to be a bit more in control and giving them more choices is a way to make this happen. The diversity of learning styles can benefit with different ways to sit. Some students just cannot sit or they would rather be on the floor. These choices equal happy students, which equal a happy teacher, and this equals more learning. Standing desks will allow students that prefer to stand to have a place to do their work and the foot bar at the bottom of them will allow them to still move without disturbing others. The cushions will allow students to sit on the floor, yet have a bit of comfort instead of sitting on the hard floor. The wiggle cushions allow those students who prefer to sit but still have problems sitting still to move around. These cushions as well as the standing desks have been shown to help these students to be able to concentrate and get more work done. There is also traditional seating available in my classroom for those who prefer.
needStatement: My students need seating choices or to just stand and have a place to work. They need four stand-up desks and eight wobble cushions with pillow cases.

name: Young Mathematicians Excel with IXL Technology!
description: My students often ask each other with excitement, 'Are you a math master yet?' These third graders get fired up about math and gain confidence as they achieve their 'master' status on IXL. Students are highly motivated by this web-based program that lets them review important math skills in a fun way! This technology serves as a tool for math practice and engages students with math games and prizes. I can use this tool, which is aligned to the Common Core State Standards, to assign specific skills and differentiate practice for my students. Eighty-four percent of students at my school are living in poverty. There are twenty-two languages spoken throughout their homes, and many are learning English as their second language. Despite these obstacles, students come to school each day excited to learn something new! IXL has been a wonderful addition to our daily math practice and has increased student engagement through technology!Students get excited about technology and IXL engages them with games and motivates them with prizes and certificates. I can differentiate instruction and practice for students. For example, advanced students move on to more challenging skills, while struggling students work on skills at their level. IXL also allows the teacher to identify 'trouble spots' for students so I can review instruction in that area. Students are engaged and motivated by this website, and can even practice math skills from home! My class needs this tool to continue practicing math in a fun and energizing way. Every student will get their own IXL account to use at school and home. This practice will help each student improve their overall math abilities.
needStatement: My students need IXL math accounts to help them practice the skills needed to become proficient in math, in a fun and engaging way!

name: Lights, Camera, Learn!!!
description: My 3rd graders attend a PK-5 school that ranges from lower to middle socioeconomic households. Many struggle to have their basic needs provided for, but are eager to learn and thrive in a loving environment. The students are motivated by technology and strive for excellence when learning is aided by it. Students are challenged daily with new and interesting things which peek their interest for continual growth. Exposing students to technology and activities, that they would otherwise not interact with, encourages their engagement on both a personal and societal level. This project is designed to effectively give students a 'clearer view' into various aspects of their curriculum. My student will have the ability to use manipulatives, various materials, and be given a range of freedom that allows them to model expectations. One of the hardest things, during class, is to model hands-on activities to an entire class at one time. While a SmartBoard does get a great deal of use in our classroom, a document camera would be an added benefit and another way to engage students. There are always moments when the internet goes down, or interactive lessons fail to work. A document camera will always help keep lessons interactive and technologically focused.
needStatement: My students need an Elmo document camera to 'Zoom-In' on their education.

name: Getting Organized in Kindergarten
description: I teach kindergarten in an inner city in Flint, Michigan. The majority of our students come to us below grade level and have little academic support at home due to the life circumstances of their parents. Our students are eager to learn but need a lot of additional support in all subject areas in order for them to be successful in their future endeavors. Your donations to our projects help us to make that happen for the students that we are blessed to service.I am trying to make my room more colorful, inviting, and organized for my students. These items will help us to be able to learn in an organized and inviting classroom environment. These items will also help not only me to be better organized but also the students. We will be able to have book boxes at the tables for each student so that they can read just right books. Students will also be able to have boxes that close for pencils and crayons so that they can better focus on learning and not playing with the learning tools. These items will help us to store our center activities in a more organized fashion so that students can easily access the materials.
needStatement: My students need book boxes, pencil boxes, material organization bins, and file organizers to help us be more organized.

name: Let’s Start Our Engine By Jumping Into Classroom Essentials!
description: About ninety percent of our student population receives Title One funding. My students depend on the school to meet their basic needs, especially when times are challenging. My school's community is four point four square miles. It is a diverse population that share the common denominator of educational success for their children. Student attendance is about ninety-eight percent. Students report to school to learn, to work hard, and to socialize. My students are happy to attend a learning environment. Parental involvement is present but with guidance, the effort and energy that can be properly use. Parents are open to the support of their child and the classroom teachers. The refrigerator is to store students' perishable lunches. Some students do not eat school lunch, but will pack their lunch from home without an ice source. Perishable food transported without an ice source won't stay safe long. The refrigerator will make sure students' lunches remain free of harmful bacteria. An electric stapler, an electric 3-hole puncher, and an electric sharpener will speed up the process for distribution and help students learn organization. Most of the time, there is a wait to use the units in the classroom and often, the units are jammed. All the essential items will help maximize time, keep paperwork organized, and give proper food storage.
needStatement: My students need a refrigerator, a sharpener, a 3-hole puncher, a stapler, reusable dry eraser pockets and three headphones.

name: Whisper Phones to Improve Fluency and Books on Managing Emotions!
description: The students at my school are special because they come from all different back grounds. We enjoy celebrating our differences at school and understand that everybody’s needs may not be the same depending on his or her situation. Being a teacher at my school is extremely rewarding because I know I am making a difference in these children’s lives. Many of my students cry on the last day of school because they don’t want to leave for summer break. School is a safe and consistent place for them to be. Hardworking, energetic, and curious are a few words that best describe my students. They come into the classroom each and every day eager to learn. Watching them grow as readers and mathematicians throughout the year is one of my favorite things about being a teacher. Some come at the beginning of the year knowing very little and by the end of the year they are reading grade level text and using strategies to solve difficult math problems. Any donations made greatly benefit the students at my school!In First Grade students are learning how to read! It is important that they hear themselves read to improve pronunciation and fluency. Whisper phones are a great tool for students because it allows them to hear themselves read without distracting the entire class. Getting students engaged and excited to read is also important. These bright orange phones are exactly what first graders need! Tattling, regulating emotions, and sharing are all examples of what first graders struggle with. Using books is a great way to teach students how to manage their social emotional needs inside and outside of the classroom setting!
needStatement: My students need Toobaloo Auditory Feedback whisper phones to accelerate student fluency and pronunciation. Social emotional books are also requested to teach kids the importance of the growth mindset and how to manage their emotions.

name: Reaching ALL Children through Reading, Math and Science
description: My students overcome more obstacles on a daily basis then most adults will ever have to face. In my third grade special education classroom, we have students who have learning disabilities, Autism, cognitive impairments, cerebral palsy and attention difficulties. My school is also a Title 1 school, most of our families are very low income or at poverty level. The majority of families at my school speak another language at home providing language barriers as well. In order to be effective, I must provide students multiple opportunities to reach their learning goals, as the expectations for my students are set high to ensure they are successful learners. With all these challenges my students face, they come in each day excited and ready to learn. We are a family that provides each other with the support and encouragement needed to conquer each and every challenge that we are faced with. Together, we learn compassion and problem solving strategies that makes us stronger as a team and individually. In a special education classroom it is important to have a safe and welcoming atmosphere. The large carpet will be a place for students to dive into their books and a place to share what we have learned throughout the day, monitor our progress and set future learning goals. Throughout the day students will be exposed to a hands-on curriculum. They need to be able to use clipboards when they are scientists solving problems and conducting investigations. As math wizards, they need buzzers when their team figures out problems during challenges. Chart paper will be used to monitor our learning and thinking in an organized way that the entire class can participate in. Having books on display is a great way to keep students reading. The new book shelf will be an inviting way to display books that incorporate math and science which will encourage reading in all subject areas.
needStatement: My students need the 'Into the Deep' area rug so we have a place to discuss our learning, share our thoughts and set goals for future challenges, along with a bookshelf, buzzers and clipboards.

name: Eco STEM Support
description: Our school is located in the inner city with under-privilege families striving to get out. Single parents, grandparents and also older siblings strive to instill a better way of living to these small minds. We are 95% African-American, 2% Haitian-American, 2% Hispanic and 1% Caucasian with most students on free or reduced-price lunch. We are a Title I school with loads of potential. The gauntlet has been put down that there is 'no escaping' this lifestyle of poverty, but I disagree and am ready for the challenge of helping my students ready themselves for a bright and better future.I am requesting an Apple iPad Air 2, two packs of card stock and three color Toner cartridges to support a prior Donors Choose project about butterfly gardening. The iPad Air will take my students on a technological journey of learning and help them engage in standards-based learning experiences in 'three-dimensional science' for which details are provided on a special Captain Planet Foundation web page. The toner is essential to print additional resource materials and lessons for my students to use with adult support. It has been said that with more acquired knowledge a person has on any subject matter, it will better equip that person in his/her future endeavors. Supplemental materials will be printed to assist my students in getting a better understanding of the subject matter or theme being discussed during the class period whether it is (1) Language Arts Reading/Writing assignments, (2) Social Studies while developing good citizenship manners, (3) Science with hand-out materials to record data, (4) Writing materials with thematic topics on authors, poets, stories and other subject matters, and (5) home learning materials to go along with the materials given in the classroom. The cartridges will be used in the printer to bring color visualization to the lessons.
needStatement: My students need an Apple iPad Air 2, 2 packs of card stock and three color Brothers Toner printer cartridges to support a prior Donors Choose project about butterfly gardening.

name: Seeing the World Without Leaving Our Classroom!
description: As a teacher in an area where a multitude of families are economically disadvantaged, many of my students are challenged by things out of their control. Their parents work long hours to make ends meet, and often are unable to provide outside experiences. I want to enrich their learning environment by incorporating technology into my small group lessons. A teacher can bring the world to her students through the use of technology! I cannot tell you how many times that I have had students who have never been to the beach, yet we live on an island. They are so eager to learn about their world! Technology can take students on virtual field trips from the North Pole, to the Galapagos Islands to outer space! From the opening of the school day, to the dismissal bell, I strive to make each of my students feel valued and respected. I recognize that each and every student as limitless potential that can be unlocked through the use of technology. They need learning to come to life! Every day at school can and SHOULD be a learning ADVENTURE!!A Surface Pro will aid in the study of many concepts that are quite difficult to grasp. Imagine how immersed students become in lessons when they are given vivid, real-world examples of science concepts rather than listening to someone convey the facts. My students who may have never even left their hometown can take virtual field trips to places like the Moon! Our class could network with other classes around the globe through video conferencing. The possibilities are simply endless! A Surface Pro can bring big events to our little classroom. There is a huge difference between talking about a volcano erupt and actually seeing it happen! The lessons that can be created for the Surface specifically for small group instruction will be of high interest, interactive, and differentiated to meet the needs of the particular group.
needStatement: My students need a Surface Pro with a protection plan to bring the world to our classroom. Lessons that address the multitude of learning styles that are present in the classroom is essential!

name: Library Center Putting Books into the Hands of Children
description: Our Pre-Kindergarten class has 20 students in the classroom. They begin the year with excitement and, for some, with the fear of leaving their moms for the first time. They are like little sponges, so excited to soak up new knowledge and learn about the world around them. They love to be kept busy and explore new concepts that are presented to them. In our class, we love to read books together. This helps us to explore the world around us. A lot of the students don't have opportunities to visit places outside their neighborhoods or see animals and objects in their environments. Our room has a large collection of books, but we need a way to display the books to give our students easy access to view and check out books to take home. Currently, the books are stored in cardboard boxes, and this makes it difficult for the students to locate and find books that they are interested in reading. We would love to have bookshelves and bins to display our classroom library! The bookshelves and bins would organize the books that we already have into groups to ease and assist the pre-kindergarten students in locating a certain type of book. For example, we have a collection of books about horses which are of high interest for my students, and it would be nice to organize all these books onto a shelf in a bin.
needStatement: My students need bookshelves and bins to help them more easily check out books to take home and read.

name: Wobble Chairs for First Grade!
description: Flexible classrooms give students a choice in what kind of learning space works best for them, and help them to work collaboratively, communicate, and engage in critical thinking. Our first grade class is comprised of 25 amazing students, many of whom are full of energy and ready to learn! I truly believe a flexible classroom would help them become more engaged and active learners in the classroom. Our current goal is for every student to have his/her own wobble chair in the classroom. This is a great first step in reaching our overall goal of a flexible classroom. There is ample amounts of research that supports the idea that flexible seating options in the classroom are beneficial to all students especially young learners. Students become more engaged in their learning activities, leading to better grades and test scores when movement is allowed while seated. The Wobble Chair is a simple seat design to allow movement when children are required to sit. 'The Kore Chair is not just a piece of furniture...it's a LIFE-Changer for active kids, kids with ADHD and Autistic kids...Aggressive wobbling on a KORE Chair increases blood to the brain and thereby quiets the requirement for fidgety kids to move...Kids learn better and are more productive...the Kid who may be considered 'Unteachable' is now able to learn!' The Wobble Chairs are the first step in making our flexible classroom wish come true! Please consider donating to our classroom!
needStatement: My students need Wobble chairs to provide seating that is comfortable and allows movement for optimal learning.

name: Music Room Rug: We Need Room to Dance and Move!
description: Think back to elementary school for a moment and imagine how you felt as a child. The sense of wonder, joy, and limitless creativity. These are just a few of the characteristics I see in my music students on a daily basis. My students are joyful learners that love to sing, dance, compose, and play instruments. They enjoy movement, exploration, and creativity- especially when it comes to music! I work in a Title I school where the entire student population receives free lunch and breakfast. Many of these students see school as a safe place where they can laugh, learn, and envision a positive future for themselves. Music and movement go hand in hand. My students need a carpet in the music room in order to thoroughly experience all music has to offer them and to remove the cumbersome desks that currently reside in our classroom. My students love to explore music through dance and movement, but our current classroom set up prevents that-- this rug will give students the space they need to creatively express themselves. It will also provide a space to build community and collaboration between students as they will be able to meet on the carpet for circle time, music games, and group work. A rug for the music room would provide many opportunities for my students to creatively explore music by allowing us the classroom space needed for dance, movement, and playing instruments.
needStatement: My students need a large, clean carpet in the music classroom so we can get rid of our cumbersome desks and have room for movement, dance, and playing instruments.

name: Reading is Sweet with The Lemonade War!
description: The minute you meet these fourth graders you know they are eager to learn! They bubbled over with excitement when I met them for the first time at Open House. Their curiosity is contagious. These scholars are ready for a challenge and hungry to learn! I relish their enthusiasm! What better than to know these students will be future leaders. Sky is the limit when it comes to learning. They are soaring for success. I am honored to be their teacher. Reading is key to success in all other subject areas. Engaging students with a good novel is key! Our goal is to have several classes reading The Lemonade War at the same time, that way students can reconnect and/or get acquainted through a good book. There is nothing sweeter than finding a good book to read, and The Lemonade War is always a hit! As a teacher, I am excited that a plethora of language arts standards will be addressed through the text. Through the use of whiteboards students can share and connect to the text and each other. Also not only will The Lemonade War be beneficial for comprehension, but this will lend itself to various writing projects. These skills will be beneficial as they continue in their academic career!
needStatement: My students need engaging text, The Lemonade War, to get them excited about the school year. To monitor comprehension, I will use responses written on whiteboards.

name: Increase Student Learning with Flexible Seating for All!
description: My students are some of the hardest-working kids I have ever met. They continue to grow and blossom in front of our eyes. With my school being a Pre-K thru 8 we see the changes that occur while a student growing with our school. Their needs are constantly changing and we need to make sure to accommodate those needs. Our school has a 75% free/reduced-price lunch and we are a Title I school that serves the needs of our community which is quite diverse. In my classroom, specifically, about 40% of my students have special needs. I need to make sure I accommodate their way of learning and this project would be an amazing way to do so. Flexible seating gives students a choice in their learning which is very important to the culture of a classroom. They are able to choose the type of work space that works best for them just as adults do, in the comfort of their own home. With this kind of seating, students are able to figure out how the learn best and it increases the opportunity for students to work collaboratively or independently. Educational consultant, Kayla Delzer wrote about the benefits of flexible seating and how it benefits students by burning calories, improving metabolism, and increasing motivation. I want my students to have opportunities to move, sit, and stand to maximize their learning capabilities; students learn best when they are able to choose how they learn. In order to make this happen in my classroom, my students are in need of Stand-Up desks and stools, stability balls, Active Chairs, among other seating.
needStatement: My students need the Safco Stand-Up desks and stools, Active Chairs and Stability Balls to allow them to learn in a way that is most comfortable for them.

name: Four Large Magnetic Whiteboards Needed to Teach Students
description: Our school is a STEAM school (Science. Technology.Engineering. Aerospace.Mathematics). It is an inner city school, located in a high poverty area. A majority of our students are English Language Learners. We are a mix of American Indian, Asian American, African American, Hispanic American, and Caucasian American. We have about 82% students receiving free and reduced-price lunch. My second grade students are hard working, loving kids. Our school is the 'Home of Future Leaders'. We are hoping you can help us continue our journey!I am teaching second grade at a different school this year. I am asking for four large magnetic whiteboards to hang on our classroom walls, so I can teach the curriculum to my students and have my students show their work. Whiteboards will allow me to efficiently teach my students this fall. Our district does not have whiteboards for our school, and there are many classrooms in our school without whiteboards on the walls. I am hoping this DonorsChoose.org project will help with my classroom, and I can pass the word on to other teachers at our school to give it a try.
needStatement: My students need large magnetic whiteboards on our classroom wall, so I can teach our curriculum and to help support their learning.

name: Interactive Science Notebooks
description: In our school, almost all of our students are first- or second-generation immigrants that came from various East African countries, such as Somalia, in search of better opportunities for their families. Most come from low-income households and cannot afford to purchase the extra supplies needed to have a successful academic year. The enthusiasm and motivation of our students is unparalleled, but without the necessary supplies we cannot provide them the education they deserve. Your donation will help these students have a fun, engaging year of science. One of the best ways researchers have found to teach students science is through the use of interactive science notebooks (ISNs). ISNs are notebooks given to each individual student to use throughout the year. During each unit in the class, students receive notes, activities, and review materials via sheets of paper that can be cut and pasted into their ISN. These materials are often more interactive than your standard worksheets, and ISNs allow students to engage with and take ownership of their learning. In addition to the notebooks themselves, the scissors and glue sticks will allow students to cut and paste items into their ISNs, and the labels will allow us to properly organize the notebooks, seeing as they will all look similar and will be used for multiple grades and sections. The name tag labels will be placed on the front of the notebooks and have the students name, grade, and period, and the neon colored labels will go on the spine of the notebook and have the grade and period so that the notebooks can be kept in the classroom and stay organized.
needStatement: My students need scissors, notebooks, glue sticks, and labels for their interactive science notebooks for the year. A notebook will be given to each student and belong to them for the entirety of the school year.

name: Ready to Relax and Read
description: My students will come from a variety of backgrounds and learning needs. I'll have special education students, ESL students, and students that just need to move while learning. Students begin second grade as very young and new readers. It is my desire to have a learning environment that meets the needs of all students' learning styles. I want them to love literature first and foremost. Then be able to focus on learning to read and then reading to learn. They will soon enough know what it will be like to sit in a hard desk for several hours. Meeting the learning styles students will make a world of difference in their desire to learn. It won't be hard! I need to make some simple adjustments, like adding beanbag chairs, exercise balls, and a few other options. Will this be the best seating for all students? No, traditional desks and chairs will also be in cooperated in the room arrangement. There is no longer the need for the 'everyone to sit up straight and have both feet on the floor' general education classroom. My project will create a variety of seating for students to be comfortable while they are learning to read and reading to learn.
needStatement: My students need a variety of seating options to help maximize their learning.

name: Learning in Comfort!
description: I work at a very special school. We are located in the middle of nowhere. Our free and reduced lunch rate is 73%. We have students that have very difficult home lives, but come to school and work hard to enjoy their day. We love our students and work hard to make a difference In their lives. We have a small budget and of course buy most things from our own pockets. I have purchased lots of things with my own money so far this summer, but would love some help with the remaining purchases if possible!We need Nikki stools, balance balls and a wobble cushion. Everything I can do to make my classroom interesting and exciting for my students improves their learning. I can't wait to see their smiling faces as they enjoy their new and comfortable classroom. I would be forever grateful for any assistance. Thank you so much! I want to be the teacher and classroom that makes a lasting impression on their lives. Many of my students live in homes without what I consider normal furniture or meals. I just know they will love all of the best seating I am trying to prepare for them. I love my students! Anything I can do to change their lives is worth t!
needStatement: My students need to enjoy their school environment and experience flexible seating. I have spent a lot this summer preparing our classroom, but I am still lacking Hokki stools and balance balls.

name: Wood Carving: Learning History and Responsibility Through Woodworking
description: The students in my classes are like most kids in the middle school years; gentle one minute, fierce the next, still full of childlike wonder but checking over their shoulders to see what the rest think about it. They're trying to figure out who they are as individuals while wanting to slip into the invisibility of belonging to a group. My students are regular kids with a hunch that life might matter, they might matter, and things will be expected of them in this world. My students are perhaps different than other kids their age by just how much has been expected of them so far. In fact a recent study claimed that many urban learners experience trauma that is equal or greater to that suffered by soldiers returning from war. For many of my students middle school is one of the last chances to utilize their resilience and experience to create a way forward that will truly live up to their promise. I recently went to a wood carving class with my 10 year-old son in Northern Minnesota. The instructor was lamenting how knives are seen as weapons in our modern culture and wished that they could be viewed as they are by craftspeople: tools that help people, not harm them. When I saw how careful and serious my son was with the tool and the look of pure concentration on his face as he shaped his piece of wood, I knew it was something that I wanted my Montessori students to experience. Montessori said, 'The hand is the tool of the mind,' and in the digital age a need for authentic hands-on learning has never been greater. With the carving materials I will guide students through a series of projects related to the local cultures we are studying. The craft of wood carving is an important tradition for the native people of our state as well as the large Scandinavian immigrant population. As a test run for this project I had a couple of my 8th graders who were desperate for a hands-on project use a couple of woodcarving tools I had bought myself. They carved two words onto their own blocks of basswood; one word that would guide them through the next year, and another that wood guide them through the next 10 years. One student chose the words 'work' and 'duty.' They are two short words but the process of working over the course of two weeks to carve them in wood I think also gave them the time to let the words truly sink in. Working with wood I think gives middle school age kids the quiet reflective time that they need to begin to shape their own selves.
needStatement: My students need basic wood carving tools and supplies to engage in authentic hands-on learning.

name: To Read Is To Be All I Can Be
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things simple and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences one little piece at a time. This way we can move mountains. “Kid, you’ll move mountains!”No need to get intimidated by the size of the task, it’s just a matter of taking small steps towards your bigger goal. Moving a mountain may sound impossible, but you don’t actually have to move one, it’s just a figure of speech. But there must be a mountain-sized task that you’re facing in your life that feels like you’ll never be able to do. But just imagine if you actually did do it. How would you feel? How would it change your life? Dr. Seuss By donating to my project, the Phonemic Awareness Skills Activity Center, Fluency Skills Activity Center, Roll & Read Phonics Games, Vocabulary Practice Cards, Vocabulary Skills Activity Center and Comprehension Skills Activity Centers will all help to improve and increase academic achievement. I would like to use these during academic intervention hour as a primary tool. The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go by Dr. Seuss. I believe that building the students vocabulary will help with their comprehension of various texts. Oh the places we could go if we just understood what we were reading. What adventures could we go on if we knew how to comprehend what we were reading? The Teaching Vocabulary Skills Activity Center and 5-Minute Vocabulary Practice Cards are going to be used to promote better vocabulary usage. The Roll & Read Phonics Games, Teaching Comprehension Skills Activity Center, Teaching Fluency Skills Activity Center, and Teaching Phonemic Awareness Skills Activity Centers will help promote better reading skills that will ultimately enhance the students reading habits.
needStatement: My students need Phonemic Awareness Skills Activity Center, Fluency Skills Activity Center, Roll & Read Phonics Games, Vocabulary Practice Cards, Vocabulary Skills Activity Center and Comprehension Skills Activity Center.

name: Stimulating Young Minds Through Daily Routines
description: My school is a PreK-8 is low-income/high poverty neighborhood school in a large city in Pennsylvania. My students come from households with varying demographics - some of my students come from two-parent households with stay-at-home moms while others live with single parents or other family members who work multiple jobs. I began teaching here in 2014 and for the first two years due to high-enrollment and limited space I taught in a custodian's supply room with limited curriculum. Last year I moved into a classroom with outdated and homemade manipulatives. For the past three years, my students have surpassed the end of year goals for Kindergarten all while deserving a better learning environment. From the first day of school to the last day, the classroom is a big family. Despite the challenges my students face inside and outside the classroom, they all come to school eager to learn. We welcome our differences and the focus is on their potential to grow and become independent. My students are like little sponges and quickly absorb every aspect of the day as a learning experience - whether it be letter naming and sounds, simple addition and subtraction, or manners and basic respect for others.'Circle-time' routines are daily memorization techniques that allow students to learn new skills and concepts by adding to ones that they have already learned. Everything that is taught in Kindergarten is an essential building block to the daily skills that they will need for the rest of their lives. We begin every day with 'circle-time' routines which can be as basic as learning the days of the week or the letters of the alphabet and as expansive as learning how to compose 3-digit numbers or reading high-frequency words in context. Through the addition of the requested charts and visual aids such as alphabet, number lines, and calendars, students can refer back to these daily routines throughout the day to assist in their math and literacy learning and to build upon what was learned the previous day.
needStatement: My students need high-quality charts and visual aids to assist them in learning the alphabet, numbers, basic math and literacy skills, and other fundamental building blocks needed for the rest of their lives.

name: Our Reading Nook!
description: I teach a large group of wonderful, diverse students with special needs in a very high-poverty school. My students are eager to increase their reading skills and would love to be able to have a comfortable reading center. They love the beanbag chair that we have in class but would really enjoy a more comfortable reading environment. Instead of the usual hard chairs and desks, they have asked if having two or three comfy chairs would be possible to add the their center.  This year we will be working very hard to increase our reading skills and include more collaborative activities. The chairs and table will offer a more inviting reading atmosphere as we continue to work very hard on fluency and comprehension. The alternative seating will help students focus on their reading as apposed to struggling to stay comfortable in a hard chair. The smaller table will assist in my student's organization skills while allowing for student collaboration during the many center activities I have planned for them this year. This pleasing setting will allow for a more thorough engagement of the skills learned.
needStatement: My students need a couple of nice beanbag chairs for comfortable reading seating, and a small table for collaborative work and shared reading.

name: Keeping Students Engaged In A Flexible Classroom Environment
description: We are family. My students see each other as an extension of their home family. They depend on each other and support one another because they understand that positive relationships make them successful. Despite many of them living in poverty with challenging situations, they come to school with curiosity, creativity, and eagerness to learn. Many of them dream of being the first in their family to go to college. Our classroom is a vibrant, busy place where students learn from engaging, discussing, and sharing with each other. They embrace their individuality while finding common threads that bind them. My students are curious and have a desire to learn. Sometimes that desire is squelched when they are sitting for long periods in uncomfortable chairs at rigid desks. How can I help to keep them engaged and motivated in the classroom? I can give them a variety of work stations to choose from. This fall, I will be removing the traditional desks and chairs and replacing them with rolling, swivel desk chairs. This will allow my students to easily form groups and give my fidgety students a chance to 'quietly' be active. I want to give them other options to move as well. Research shows powerful links between physical activity and academic performance. Studies also indicate that introducing standing into the classroom increases heart rate, burns more calories and even helps with insulin effectiveness. I want to give my students the opportunity to stand for part of the day by introducing standing desks. I know from experience that when they are given the chance to stand, their attention span increases. Replacing traditional chairs with exercise balls at a group table will be a third learning station option again giving my students an opportunity to move while engaging with others. Finally, adding stools to a work counter will give one more option for a flexible learning station. Your generous donation will give my students the advantage they need to become engaged in their studies and remain so. It will allow them options to learn in an environment that best suits them, thereby increasing their chances for success!
needStatement: My students need a variety of work stations such as stand-up desks, stability balls, and stools to keep them engaged throughout the school day.

name: Learning from One Another at the NAEYC Conference!
description: My English Language Learners (ELL) students come from homes where learning isn't a priority, making their initial Literacy Gap wider! Strong academic skills are essential in school and the real world. My STEM kindergarten is made up of 28 very diverse 5 and 6 year olds in a southern Arizona Title I school. 99% are on free or reduced price lunch. More than half of my students are refugees from Africa, Asia, Mexico and the Middle East. All come from very low-income households. The majority live in neighborhood apartments and trailer parks. For most, Kindergarten is their first real school experience. Many come without readiness skills to do well in Kindergarten, such as number and letter recognition, sounds and and sight words, which they need to be successful in school and in life. However, they strive to do their best against the odds.I am requesting the registration fee to attend the annual NAEYC conference in Los Angeles, CA November 2-5, 2016. I will spend four days learning from early childhood educators including teachers, program administrators, students, researchers and teacher educators. The conference give teachers the opportunity to explore the latest research and learn new strategies to use with students in my classroom. The NAEYC conference includes outstanding opportunities to network, learn, and advocate for the early childhood profession. I feel this conference will show me interesting ways to increase students' achievement. Conference sessions will give me new ideas to continue creating a high quality early learning experience for my students and ideas to share with colleagues. It will be a wonderful way to grow professionally!
needStatement: I need help covering the registration fee for the National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC) annual conference in Los Angeles, CA November 2-5, 2016.

name: What's a Pirate's Favorite Amino Acid? Arrrrrrginine!
description: My students are very unique and diverse. Some of my students come from homes of rocket scientists while other students come from homes of unemployed Katrina victims. The students are able to overcome their diversity to make our school a wonderful place. Today when I was in the commons area for break, I saw an empty drink bottle on the floor. I asked a student to pick it up. He picked it up and he saw another bottle, which he also picked up. He then told the student that was walking with him that he can throw the bottles in the recycling bin. I am very proud of the students at my school. Amino acids are essential for every metabolic process. It is imperative that students learn about amino acids and how they effect they body. The majority of diseases such as obesity, high cholesterol, diabetes, and many more can be traced back to metabolic disturbances.'People crave laughter as if it were an essential amino acid' Patch Adams. Students will utilize the amino acid kits in order to construct proteins. They will experience how one discrepancy in the sequence can change the function of the protein through a hands-on process. I want the students to acquire a love for learning and a love for science.
needStatement: My students need amino acid starter kits to understand how amino acids serve as a building block for proteins.

name: On the Road to Building Literacy Skills
description: U.S.A., Thailand, Laos, Mexico, El Salvador, Dominican Republic, Guatemala, these are a few of my students' native homelands. Everyday my students come in from a variety of backgrounds and experiences, excited to learn new things. For many of my students, coming to school is one of the only opportunities they get to read books and that in itself, exposes them to a new world of imagination and high level thinking. Furthermore, roughly 2/3 of my students come in with limited English ability as well as hindrances to vocabulary, both of which have a major impact on the ability to read. 53% of our students population are English Language Learners and 86% of students are a part of the free and reduced lunch program for low income. These types of factors are just a few of the influences that prevent the possibilities for my students to get their hands on rich literature outside of school. My goal is to bring it to them on a daily basis through a variety of media.I am requesting these materials in order to offer my students the opportunity to use different forms of activities for literacy centers and push them to work more independently or use peer support in their learning. I have a high percentage of students who come into my classroom behind grade level in reading as well as other skills. Students will be using a variety of literacy media to aide them in building independence that will help them make more progress in their reading and writing skills. These types of products provide students with step by step procedures that are accompanied with both visuals and text to support all learners. Students will be able to use these materials to build on what has already been taught through reading, writing or phonics lessons. Their background knowledge and acquired skills through other literacy subject matter will enable them to keep making progress as they review and practice. My students need to have many ways at their exposure, to review and practice their literacy skills that will support level of understanding but also challenge them. Many of my students are English Language Learners and need activities that are visual specific and provide explicit directions that will increase their independence during work time. They will be able to take what they have learned during large or small group lessons and apply it immediately as they use these type of center activities. These literacy type centers will also hold my students accountable to completely them correctly because of the way the activities are laid out.
needStatement: My students need engaging instant learning centers, such as 'Teaching Reading Skills Activity Centers', 'Road to Reading Activity Center' and 'Stack and Build Phonics Flip Books' because they will help increase reading skills.

name: Accessing Books Around the World and Creating Bookmarks for Charity
description: My students are kind and generous children who strive to do their best in school. 100% of our students qualify for free breakfast and lunch. 33% of the population are ELL students. Many of the students live in poverty. In my experience, most students do not have the resources at home that are often needed in the classroom. Our students love to learn, read, and write. They seek out new ways to lead their own learning. I want to be able to provide materials for them to do so. My students participate in an ELA module designed around learning about maps as well as the geography of the world. They learn about different cultures and different landforms around the world that make obtaining books a major challenge. During their research, students read about different countries around the World and how the students from those countries obtain books as well as their schooling experience. Students become highly engaged learning about literacy around the World. At the end of the module, students choose a country that they have studied about and create an illustrated bookmark with informational texts about that country. Bookmarks are then reproduced and sold to family members, schoolmates, and the community. Profits from the sale of bookmarks will be donated to our local Children's Hospital to purchase books for the hospital's waiting room. These books will help me in various ways. The students use My Librarian is a Camel book as their primary source, however, our curriculum only provided one book. I have made copies of pages for students, but the photographs and text features end up fuzzy from photocopying. The rest of the books are recommended texts for this module. They are at different reading levels. This will enable all of my students, regardless of reading ability to access reference materials at their level. Finally, I would love the write on erase map and dry erase markers for students to be able to mark which country they are researching, and I can point out specific countries when I am teaching a whole group lesson.
needStatement: My students need topic books to read for further research and information including Maps, That Book Woman and Prairie School.

name: Tables and Chairs Make Us Better Working Pairs
description: My students range from Kindergarten to 5th grade and have a wide range of physical and intellectual disabilities. They have many needs that include physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech. The majority of the class and school are from low income, high need areas. We are an inner city school with a decreasing budget so we at times have had to adapt classroom supplies to meet our students' needs. While my students struggle with everyday activities they are always trying to help and cheer each other on. My students work hard and try their hardest every day to exceed everyone's expectations but to continue in our success we need more functionally appropriate supplies. With the help of donors, this project will help my students function better and feel more confident in their surroundings. It will provide the chairs that are far more functional for my students with physical needs as well as my students who perform stemming behaviors. The tables will provide an environment that helps include all students with space provided for assisstive devices. The bean bag chairs will provide needed support for students while sitting in the reading center. Please help provide the supplies we need to work to our potential comfortably. Your help will provide not only functional supplies but also supplies that will help make learning less stressful and more fun while we show everyone how we beat the odds and exceed their expectations.
needStatement: My students need specialized chairs and tables to help with body support and easy access to group activities. The ball chairs are to help students build core strength and no disruptive fidgeting.

name: 07/13/16Robot Map Programming
description: My name is Ms. Mozer. I am a middle school science teacher for an English language acquisition school program. All of our students are newly arrived to the United States. Their families have come to USA to start a new life, away from deadly conflict, famine, or political exile. My Asian (Burmese and Nepali) students have names like: Mang, Pa, Soe, Tha, Guna, and Rai. My students from western parts of Africa have names like: Leonce, Mohamed, Jumbe, and Fazi. My Latino students' names include Roman, Jose, and Louise. Before our students are transferred to a traditional school/classroom they attend intensive English classes. My goal is to build up our students' background knowledge in science. This fall term, our 8th grade lessons for physical science begin with units of measurements and the elements on the periodic table. However I am excited to share with you our code project (Forces: motion, acceleration, balance...). Hands on in class group projects require our English Learner students to participate and engage in learning as a group using one common language, English language skills. Large mapping printed projects are used with simple control code programmed robots (Ozobot and Sphero). These group projects prepare students for more advanced digital technology skills and real world technology language skills used in real occupation tasks and challenges, such as air and ground transportation controls and instructional media. These middle school technology skills/ goals are largely missing in our student population, largely due to language barriers. Thank you all, so very much!Ground space orientation is more than understanding which way is left and right. According to Ms. Mozer, the learning goals are: student can identify and demonstrate uses of grid locations and provide travel instructions using North, South, East, and West vectors. In addition to mapping ground instructions, student can implement basic motion program code to manipulate remote robotic tasks. Ms. Mozer calls it peer learning when some students are able to teach what they understand to some other students. Ms Mozer also says that their is only one of her, so we must all help each other to learn what we need to know each day. She also says that real leaders serve the group. Students from other parts of the world have so much to learn about so many things in the United States. The English language, the technology, the culture are all very different for newly arrived citizens. Science lessons provided learning experiences in language, culture, and technology in one class. The hands-on science projects keep everyone engaged and on task.
needStatement: We need a color printer for in-class mapping projects. We will be implementing basic programming such as activities for Zobot and Sphero. These robots are used to teach motion and direction tasks, for code programs.

name: Magic Carpet Ride
description: My students come to school each day eager to learn. The school is a Title I school which means 99% of the students are below poverty level. They attend a school that has 600 students. Resources are very limited. It is very hard to get students to bring in $2 for a class trip, let alone anything else they need for supplies. Since it is a special education class they really benefit from hands-on class work. Centers, journals, and interactive games are the best way for my students to understand the concepts, and reach the standards that New York State has deemed acceptable for their age group. My class needs a carpet for a common meeting area for whole group instruction. This will help the students carry out many group discussions and be able to share ideas with each other. By having a carpet the students will feel a sense of togetherness when working together. The number grid will also help them during math lessons towards the common core learning standards. This carpet will also be used for small group instruction, and allow the students a place to sit during independent reading times. Students will be able to come to the carpet for read aloud and to work on the smart board.
needStatement: My students need a carpet in the classroom for a common meeting area!

name: Fourth Graders Need Flexible Seating
description: Our school is a Title 1 school where the majority of the students receive free and reduce lunch. Despite this low income area, my student show up for class as believers and dreamers. Each student that enters my classroom every morning brings a smile to my face because I see their excitement and energy!Their energy and desire to learn is the fuel that jump starts my teaching. My students continue to surprise me with their determination and grit day to day. I challenge them to learn outside the box and do their very best with everything. I am a firm believer in keeping the focus on what's really important: the students! As a teacher, I focus on student motivation and higher engagement within all my lessons. When we look outside our classrooms, our fast-paced, ever-changing world is full of independent choices. We are teaching students to make the best choice and be problem-solvers. For many students, sitting still in a chair for long periods of the day can be very difficult. Last year I did many 'brain breaks,' which consisted of three to five minute mini exercise routines that were geared towards 4th grade students' interest. They LOVED it! Now I want to take it one step further with flexible seating. With flexible seating, students will be able to choose which seat will give them maximum engagement while using up energy and creating a better flow of oxygen to the brain. Students will be able to choose which learning space is best for their learning. I would like five round pillow for students who would like to work on the floor, two wobble chairs for students who require more movement, and two bean bags for students who like more of a lower angle of seating. It's no surprise that physical activity is connected to higher academic performance especially when being inside a classroom.
needStatement: My students need two bean bag chairs, two stability chairs, and five floor pillows for flexible seating.

name: Area Rug: A Place For Learning and Building Relatioships!
description: Student in my classroom are military dependents and local residents of Honolulu, Hawaii. My class consists of a very diverse population that includes Filipinos, Micronesian, Caucasians, African-Americans, Samoans, and Asian-Americans. Furthermore, our school has a transient population due to the students with parents in the military. My students are fun, loving preschool-aged special education students. Students have different disabilities such as autism, speech delay, and developmental delay but they are eager, bright, and love learning. I hope to make their first experiences in school fun and engaging!Students in a the preschool special education classroom spend a lot of time in non traditional seating, in this case on the floor! In this classroom children are experiencing school for the first time. I want to make sure the physical surroundings are relaxing and comfortable. A new area rug will provide that for my little students. The new area rug will provide a soft, comfortable area for my students to learn. Also, using an area rug allows for students to understand that the carpet is a specific area and provides a visual boundary. For example, I could tell students, 'Let's go to the blue carpet for movement activities!' and students will know exactly what we will learn and where we will be to learn.
needStatement: My students need an area rug where they learn new skills and share ideas.

name: Preserving Leaders
description: We are a Leader in Me Lighthouse school and proud of it! Our students work so hard to be the best Leaders they can be. Our school is located along the rural Gulf Coast of Alabama and many of our students come from homes with obstacles to overcome. Despite their many obstacles, our students rise to the challenge everyday to be the best versions of themselves so they can help others and our community. Our school motto is Learn, Love, Serve, Lead. Our student leaders are always working so hard. This means that classroom materials get worn out if not laminated and preserved for repeated use and learning. Also, our students love to display all their hard work for each other, parents, and visitors that walk our halls. Between the southern humidity, time, and curious fingers, the work just does not stay looking good for long unless laminated and protected. We want our students to take pride in what they do. It is amazing to see them actually teaching others from the hall displays they have helped to create. As a Leader in Me school, our students give a lot of school tours to visitors and they absolutely love teaching others about our Awesomeness!
needStatement: My students need refills for our laminator to keep their learning materials fresh and their hard work preserved for display.

name: Classroom Rug: A Welcoming Place to Engage Learning!
description: Primary responsibility of an educator should be to assure that no child ever feels like they are not worthy contributors in their classroom. Each child must feel a sense of belonging within the classroom. Learning is not merely the absorption of material by a student. It is a combination of many factors. Class room layout, a child centered class room, positive behavior management techniques, mutual trust, a safe learning environment, lack of bias, cultural sensitivity, and the ability to draw out each child’s special talent to make them feel like worthy contributors. The learning environment will dictate how well or poorly a child will learn. A major factor in the learning environment is the teacher’s role. A classroom must have a positive climate. Color choice is important when decorating a classroom, as well as the organization of the furniture. It helps create a warm environment for the students. Having a colorful rug will help provide my students with a warm and welcoming classroom. The learning environment will dictate how well or poorly a child will learn. A major factor in the learning environment is the teacher's role to make it warm, inviting and exciting! This classroom rug will allow my students to sit in their own personal space to create a less distracted atmosphere. My students will use this rug during whole group learning, small group learning and during literacy and math stations. Providing a diverse seating arrangement for the students will make the students feel more comfortable in the classroom.
needStatement: My students need a rug to create a welcoming place to sit while they are engaged in their learning.

name: Differentiated Supplies Needed for Special Needs Students
description: My students are unlike any other group of children that I have ever worked with before. They are talented and willing to work hard in order to succeed in the classroom and in their lives. They come to school with a variety of knowledge and experiences that allows for in-depth conversations about historical events. Many students come to my classroom with a variety of special needs and are craving more knowledge. They often need many modifications and accommodations to allow them to learn to the best of their ability. The materials for this project will greatly make a difference in my classroom. I am a teacher in a school of various backgrounds of African American, Hispanic, and white ethnicity in a rural community as well as a Title 1 school. My special education students sometimes struggle to pay attention because it is hard for them to sit still. With bouncy chairs and chairs to retreat to, these students will have an environment that is conducive to their learning needs. I plan on having the bean bags chairs and balance ball chairs in my classroom to give students an opportunity to get a break from sitting in their chair all day and allow them to move while learning. The ball chairs will allow students who need to constantly move to have something at their seats that will maintain their focus. The bean bags will give students somewhere else to sit that will improve their focus during independent reading.
needStatement: My students need classroom supplies such as balance ball chairs and bean bag chairs that will increase their focus on the material being taught in the classroom.

name: Give Me Something To Talk About
description: About ninety percent of our student population receives Title One funding. My students depend on the school to meet their basic needs, especially when times are challenging. My school's community is 4.4 square miles. It is made up of a diverse population that share the common denominator of educational success for their children. Student attendance is about ninety-eight percent. Students report to school to learn, to work hard, and to socialize. My students are happy to attend a learning environment. Parental involvement is present, but with guidance, the effort and energy can be properly used. Parents are open to suggestion on the best support for their child's academic success. With your donations, students will have great discourse in the classroom, in the lunchroom, in the playground and in the auditorium about current events. Students love to share their perspective and with different worldwide current events, students can really learn about other people's lives and appreciate how other people live. Reading a Time for Kids Magazine gives students the opportunity to think outside the box. It allows students to grow and develop into other personal areas that can create great social justice causes. Also, the articles are interesting and cover other core subjects which help build their reading skills and other core standards.
needStatement: My students need a Time for Kids magazine subscription to read about current events.

name: Extra, Extra, We Want To Read All About It!
description: I have a class of 25 students that are faced each day with many challenages. My school is located within a district that is low-income/ high poverty. All of the students in my school receive free breakfast and lunch daily. Despite these challenages, my students are eager and ready to learn. Unfortunately they have very limited knowledge of the world. Reading Scholastic News each week will open open their minds. It would present to them at their level so many new and wonderful things!My goal each day is to get them to think and dream of what their future could be like! My students will enjoy reading 'their own' magazine each week. I know many will take it home and share it with their families. Included with this subscsription to the weekly magazine we will have access to online resources and learning videos The students will recieve 32 issues of the magazine with real world topics such as voting, insects and communities. Each topic will be revelevant to our curriculum. The magazine will incoroporate nonfiction reading skills with written texts, lesson plans and a skill sheet. I know from prior use of the Scholasatic News, that my students will anxiously await each week's arrival.
needStatement: My students need a class subscription to Scholastic News.

name: The Games Of Life for Students with Special Needs. (ATPE)
description: I teach a unique, wonderful group of students with special needs. My students require a specialized setting in order to meet their learning objectives and make academic progress. I teach students with Autism and behavioral needs. These students are some of the most creative and academically astute students in our building. I teach at a Math, Science, Technology magnet school in my district. My school is a Title I school and 80% free and reduced lunch. My students need additional supplies and instructional materials in order to become successful, productive, global citizens. Students with special needs require a variety of opportunities and materials to practice skills in a repetitive formation, on a daily basis, as part of their IEP's. The students in my classroom have a structured time in their daily schedule to choose and play a game with a classmate with teacher assistance. My students need these materials in order to have a wide variety of ways to appropriately practice speech and communication skills, turn taking, sequencing, social skills, problem solving, and leadership skills. This donation will provide both variety and opportunity. My classroom does not have any of the traditional board games due to the lack of budget to purchase these needed items. My school is a Title I school with 80% of the students on free and reduced lunch. I have some of the most unique and interesting children in the entire school in my classroom. These students excel when given the opportunity to practice skills in a repetitive format. The skills can then transfer over to their everyday lives and increase their quality of life and ability to socially be included on a daily basis. Every child deserves to make friends and what better way to make a friend than by playing a game.
needStatement: My students need various games in order to have a wide variety of ways to appropriately practice speech and communication skills, turn taking, sequencing, social skills, problem solving, and leadership skills.

name: Ready, Set, Refresh for Kindergarten!
description: I wait at the door each morning for my students to arrive with smiles, hugs and many stories. The love for learning they arrive with is so inspiring! They make getting up at 5:30 a.m. a lot easier! I am lucky to teach a class of Kindergartners. I teach in a inner city school that serves over 1000 students from Pre-K - 8th grade. We are at a 98% free and reduced price lunch rate. We have students who speak Spanish, Somali and English. Many of the Somali students come without knowing one word of English and enter into an environment that they have never experienced before. All of my students are worthy of an excellent educational experience with an inviting environment. My goal is to provide this for them with my high expectations and love for each of them. The rug and seat pockets I am requesting will replace stained, ripped and worn out materials in my classroom. The rug will help with organization skills, reading skills and math skills. I will use the rug to work on colors, letters and numbers. The numbers will help with number identification, more and less than and quantity amounts. I will use the letters for letter identification, beginning sounds and word development. The bright colors will make a very inviting learning environment. With this rug, each child will have a special place to help them learn and grow. If a student learns organizational skills early on, this helps them to attain new information by organizing their thoughts to be more creative and move from concrete to abstract learning. The seat pockets will help each student learn to organize their work and supplies. With your help, I can provide a bright learning environment where students can learn and keep their materials organized! Their organizational skills will help them throughout their lives and into their college experiences.
needStatement: My students need a floor rug and seat pockets to update worn out, torn and stained materials.

name: Help us to Hear: Hoping for Headphones!
description: My classroom is full of learning, love, and laughter, and more importantly the most amazing 3rd graders around! My students come from all different backgrounds and have different learning styles, abilities, needs, and interests. Our school has 1:1 devices, meaning that each student has a chrome book to use. Many students are working on different programs, assignments, or projects throughout the course of the day, and the classroom can get extremely noisy! Unfortunately we have been through many sets off ear buds that just don't withstand the everyday use, and results in an empty wallet for the teacher after replacing countless pairs. The headphones will greatly help reduce the noise and chaos so that my students can stay focused without getting distracted or frustrated with all the sounds going on. I know that these headphones will play an important role in helping my students to use our amazing technology with success so that they can achieve at high levels! Through a grant our school was fortunate to receive 1:1 devices, meaning each classroom has a chrome book cart, and each student is assigned to their own. This helps keep learning engaging and meaningful to our students. I am able to reach each and every student where they are, and personalize their learning experiences. Blended learning through technology is richly embedded into our classroom culture. While the technology is great, my students are often working on their own specific tasks, and the noise is often distracting and frustrating for them. I have purchased countless pairs of ear buds and headphones for them before, but it often results in them not being durable enough to withstand constant use. Our classroom would be a much quieter place if each student could have their own pair of headphones to use with their chrome book!
needStatement: My students need Gorsun over the ear headphones to help them stay focused, and minimize distractions while working on their chrome books.

name: Meeting Time on The Classroom Carpet!
description: I am a first grade teacher in a public, high needs, urban school district. Approximately 95% of the student body are eligible for free/reduced rate lunch. Our students overcome obstacles daily and manage to give their best effort in the classroom. To many, our classrooms are a safe haven from the challenges of their home lives. Through their perseverance, they strive for success in reaching their educational and good citizenship goals. I am blessed to work with such an awesome group of students each year!My students need a classroom carpet where we can gather comfortably, engage in meaningful discussions and share our writing pieces with one another. Our classroom does not have a common meeting place where we can interact with each other comfortably as a group. In the elementary grades, it is especially important to develop the skills of being an active listener and presenter of one's own work and ideas. Having such a place in our classroom where my students can present their thoughts and ideas to each other and actively comment, will help build their confidence as they progress on their educational journey. Engaging in meaningful conversations with one another will also help to foster a sense of community and respect within our classroom environment.
needStatement: My students need a classroom carpet where we can gather comfortably, engage in meaningful discussions and share our writing pieces with one another.

name: Great Students Read Great Books
description: I teach in a school that is extremely diverse racially. These students have parents who are working hard to meet the needs of their kids, but they do not have any discretionary money. Our school falls right under the percentages that would make us a Title 1 school, even though our population looks a lot like a Title 1 population. About half of my class qualifies for free or reduced lunch. On high stakes testing days (district and state), I bring healthy snacks for my students to eat because I have kids that do not have their nutritional needs met to provide them with the energy and stamina to succeed on these tests. Great books can take us exciting places and help us learn through the lives of the characters we are sharing the experience with. These books will provide my students with authentic and fun reading, thereby allowing them to grow an appreciation of literature. Through these experiences, I can help them practice and learn critical reading skills in a fun and engaging way that they will continue to use throughout their lives. The perspective gained through reading enlarges our understanding of the world. Please help me put great books into the hands and minds of my students so that they can become great readers!
needStatement: My students need a class set of the chapter book Freckle Juice and the accompanying teacher guide to provide them with a great reading experience in a fun and engaging book appropriate to their abilities.

name: Exercise While Learning and Sharing
description: My classroom is unique to our school as the students remain with me for 2 years - 4th and 5th grade. We are called a 'looping classroom.' The students and parents LOVE the stability this type of classroom environment offers. Looping with a group of students offers comfort and takes away the feelings of insecurity as the new school year starts. Students and teachers are ready to jump into learning and excel, especially the second year, because the routine has already been established the year before. Today's students spend too much time sitting at desks or lounging on pillows while learning. Standing tables with balance boards allow 'energized' students an outlet for their energy while still remaining in the classroom and being active participants. Balance boards have been proven to stimulate brain activity and help students learn and concentrate better.
