With limited space in my classroom, standing tables allow small groups to work together on projects in corners of the room. These tables and boards will also help to make movement a constant in the classroom without disruption in learning. I really believe these are wonderful!
needStatement: My students need balance boards and tables for energy release learning stations in small classroom areas.

name: Sliding into Spring
description: Our students are unbelievable kids. They are leaders in the school and in our community. They put in a ton of time an effort, often conditioning before school throughout the winter and lifting after school. In addition, they take their school work seriously. Our program boasts many honor roll students. In addition to their hard work and dedication, our students volunteer at park districts across the city to help youngsters learn and appreciate the game of baseball. This demonstrates their ability to be positive mentors. Donations will help our baseball team with its annual costs. Having new pants is a must each year due to wear and tear at practice and games. Taking care of this cost will greatly help our players and their families while representing our school positively. When you look good, you generally gain confidence which allows our players to perform well. The new uniforms will give our players a big sense of confidence when they take the field as well as give them pride in their hard work and dedication. Having new pants will carry them to success on and off the field.
needStatement: My students need new baseball game pants for the upcoming season.

name: Building Resiliency Through Yoga
description: The students in my room are amazing ambassadors of the world. Our classroom family includes a high active-duty military population, multi-generational, single parent, and foster parents. Our students have a mix of different experiences they bring to classroom, not to mention a high poverty neighborhood where more than 75% of them qualify for free or reduced-price lunch. Being a student with parent in the military brings different challenges and stresses. Our students have parents in the Air Force, Navy, Army, Marine Corps, and Coast Guard who frequently leave for extended periods of time. There are physiological benefits that help individuals who practice yoga to become more resilient to stressful conditions and reduce a variety of important risk factors for diseases. As their teacher, I not only hold a traditional teaching degree but also an advanced yoga certification. Providing my students with the props for yoga will give validity to their practice. Benefits of practicing meditation and yoga for those coming into adolescence (10–12 years) include creating a safe place to thrive, while their bodies experience amazing changes and their connections to peers strengthen. With the added stresses my students face, giving them the opportunity to build skills to cope and ease stresses through yoga is just what they need.
needStatement: My students need yoga mats and props to help foster their mental strength while practicing yoga.

name: Hands-on STEM Learning
description: My kindergarteners are full of wonder, enthusiasm and kindness as they rush into school each morning. We share our days in a beautiful neighborhood school that celebrates mindfulness, diversity and community. Although we face daily challenges that are directly intertwined with poverty, we strive to grow and learn as much as we can in the time we have together. We look at the world with fresh new eyes, full of wonder. We spend our days learning, building and growing together. Throughout the day, we share many opportunities to engage our curiosity and learn from each other. This STEM Bundle will provide my students with the opportunity to participate in hands-on investigations. My students will work together to explore all of the possibilities that come with these engaging centers. In kindergarten, play is learning - and the best learning includes elements of play. What better resources to add to our classroom than those that are both fun and learning! Although guided options are provided with all of these materials, students will still be able to use their imagination while developing their own experiments. I plan on encouraging the girls and boys in my classroom to innovate new ways to use our STEM tools!
needStatement: My students need a STEM Bundle and other STEM kits, stations, and sets to cultivate their interest in science, technology, engineering, and math.

name: Cassette Conversion For Classrooms!
description: My students are from a wide variety of backgrounds and socio-economic circumstances. I love that I have such an array of students. I teach in an inner city school where 70% of our students qualify for free/ reduced breakfasts and lunches. Their needs are as diverse as they are, and even though challenging, that is one of the greatest parts of my job. I rejoice in taking students from all walks of life and making them successful. Achievement looks different for each individual student, and seeing growth throughout the classroom truly excites me!My students will be exposed to hundreds of my old read aloud books (on cassette), which have been sidelined since CDs came along. I have invested heavily in these, and know the students will enjoy a huge 'new' selection in the daily listening center. Daily reading, from a variety of genres, opens student's eyes to the world around them. I can give my students experiences and opportunities that they have never encountered. In converting my 'old school' technology to current formats, my students will have a huge selection of books on one small MP3 player. This can be used independently or in a small collaborative group to listen and analyze text and connect it to the world around them.
needStatement: My students need MP3 players and a permanent listening center to increase reading comprehension in my classroom.

name: Kindergarten Readiness, Part 2
description: Ninety one percent of our student population qualify for free or reduced price lunch. My inner city classroom is made up of ethnically diverse, low income families. My classroom is all inclusive and is comprised of English Language Learners, students receiving Special Education services, students with Autism and general education students. There are things that set my students apart. They are resilient and scrappy. They are street smart and have learned to survive on little. They are creative with what they have and can adapt to challenging situations. My students come from a variety of backgrounds, many have not had the opportunity to go to pre-school or a high five program. Students need a chance to socialize and learn how to appropriately interact while sharing toys and classroom supplies. Some of my five year olds don't know how to imagine, pretend and dream. The puppets, sensory items, games and toys that this project provides will facilitate the beginnings of their social emotional learning. Academic conversations happen while students are involved in dramatic play. The writing opportunities are endless when you give children a kitchen to play with and ask them to create a cookbook or when you give them a puppet theater and ask them to write a play. Research has shown there is a connection between dramatic play and literacy development.
needStatement: My students need dramatic play centers, puppets and books that support these centers.

name: Flexible Seating In Our Room
description: My students spend ninety minutes each day doing literacy, thirty minutes on writing, ninety minutes on math, and we will fit in science, social studies, and other fun things! We also have specialists each day including gym, dance, music, media, and art. My students come from a large variety of backgrounds. Many of my students will need assistance building social skills so that they can be a contributing member of our classroom community. Having a classroom community helps the children to feel safe and respected in the classroom. In order to learn effectively, my students must feel safe! This project is one that I've been thinking about for awhile now. After two years of the traditional seating model, name tags and rigid assigned seats, I've realized that the flexible seating model can be a powerful one! Think about companies who are providing their employees with options; treadmill desks, standing desks, medicine ball chairs, all implemented to improve the productivity of work. Why shouldn't students have similar options in the classroom? Not everyone is their most productive self when sitting at a desk all day; it's essential to have choice. Giving students the opportunity to take learning into their own hands will help to empower them and teach them to be responsible for their own learning. In order to do this, our room is going to need some reconstruction. I plan to set up my classroom with various seating options; lower tables with pillows and wiggle cushions, tables with wiggle stools and chairs, and yoga mats where students can sit or lay with a clipboard. As a teacher, I'm always looking for ways to improve the learning that goes on in my classroom. I know that this will be a positive change that will help my students grow as learners and community members (not to mention, one they will love!).
needStatement: My students need to be provided a classroom environment that gives them the power to take learning into their own hands. I believe that flexible seating is a great way to give them that opportunity.

name: Sick Projector Asking for Help!
description: My classroom has a Smart Board that I use every single day at school. My students use the Smart Board to watch me model new concepts and information, as well as play instructional games, watch informational videos, and participate in guided research projects. During the last week of school, my Smart Board projector went out and I recently learned that it cannot be repaired. First grade is FULL of new learning and my kids need to be able to see examples of what they are learning to do, as well as participate in activities that meet their different learning styles and preferences. My students need a projector to be able to use our Smart Board. Donations towards getting this projector will help my students in numerous ways. First, it will allow me to model new skills. I don't have a white board, so the Smart Board is the only way I can show examples to my students. It will also allow me to provide my students with activities that appeal to different learning styles. Additionally, using the Smart Board engages the students and gets them interested in what they are learning. What kid doesn't love learning with technology? By donating to my project, you will not only help my students pay attention and focus on what they are learning, but you will also help make learning fun and interesting to them!
needStatement: My students need this projector so that we are able to use the Smart Board each day!

name: Sensory Sensations for Special Kids
description: I teach at a school that has students in Kindergarten through 5th grade. I am a resource teacher for special education students in all six grades. I have taught at this school for the last 11 years! The photo shows my entire special education team of teachers, paraprofessionals, diagnosticians, and speech and occupational therapists that work together to meet each child's needs. The students we serve have different disabilities, such as Learning Disabilities, Autism, Intellectual Disabilities, and Emotional Disturbances. They often struggle with the day to day challenges that face them in the classroom, and can become overwhelmed very easily. They want to come to school to learn and make friends, but due to their challenges, they often have a hard time doing so.I would like to create a special sensory rich classroom for the students in my school to be able to access throughout the day before they reach sensory overload. This classroom will be a place that they can spend time and feel safe. The sensory tools included in this special room will be used by numerous children on a daily basis to help them be able to relax and get their emotions and feelings back in check to be able to function in their classrooms. These tools could be the life line for many students to help them better perform in a typical classroom. When special needs students begin to feel overwhelmed, they often begin to show behaviors that disrupt the classroom. The rocker, weighted tools, tilt board, and headphones will allow my students enough sensory input to realign their bodies with their minds so that they can function. These tools can be used in the sensory classroom, or checked out by individual teachers to help these students transition into general education classrooms so they can be included like all children.
needStatement: My students need tools to help create a new sensory room which will be set up with tools like the inflatable rocker and weighted tools to help with daily functioning.

name: Wiggles and Wobbles
description: We are preparing our students at a young age to be leaders at home, school, and in their community. My students come from low income families. Some of my parents work more than one job just to meet basic needs. We do not ask for anything but that their students come ready to learn. I have an incredible love of learning and try to instill that love in my students. They may not be able to control everything in life, but they can escape into learning and being hands-on in their education. This is where these materials come into play. They will be able to use these resources to stay moving and focused on their learning. Many students would benefit from a special seat, and it will move around as needed. My students love to move! They are always needing to move to stay focused in the classroom. I help promote movement by changing teaching and learning locations during the day. We also use GoNoodle to keep moving during transitions. Still we need more opportunities for some friends. Not everyone learns in the same way. A student could get easily distracted trying to stay still. Instead of trying to keep my students still I want them to be able to move! They always have the option to sit or stand during work time. These cushions and balance balls would allow students to stay moving in their seats and focus more on their work.
needStatement: My students need stability balls and a wobble cushion to promote movement and help students focus in the classroom.

name: Read to Succeed in Second Grade
description: I work at a school that focuses on STEAM - science, technology, engineering, arts, and mathematics. We have many different cultures and languages represented within our student body, and it creates a wonderful learning community for our students. Our school is also low income, which does provide some challenges in areas such as resources. However, my students have an enduring spirit which outshines and overcomes any challenging circumstances they may have. My students love to read, but since I am switched grade levels from kindergarten to second grade this year, I have very few second grade level books! I'm hoping to get some books so that I can support their love of reading and keep encouraging them to be master readers!This year I've moved from kindergarten to second grade. Consequently, most of my current library of books is for kindergarten age students. I need a variety of second grade books for my students to be able to continue to love to read and to gain the skills necessary to be successful readers. This collection of books is only simply a start to my new second grade library of books, but it will be extremely helpful. I can't wait to see how engaged my students will be with these books during our Daily Five time. I don't want my lack of second grade materials to impact my students in any way, so I thank you for any help you can give! :-)
needStatement: My students need second grade books to read during Daily Five time as I only have kindergarten books due to a switch in grade levels.

name: Active Learners, Please Stand Up
description: I feel privileged that I have the opportunity to impact the lives of the amazing children that attend M. H. Elementary School. These children come from many different backgrounds and have unique circumstances that are shaping their lives, but when they come to school they are eager to do their best and are interested in learning. Some bring a wide range of world experiences and others are the product of homes with limited resources, parents trying to do their best for their families. There are children of divorce, blended families, two parent families and children being raised by grandparents. Your generous donations will make it possible to flip, for the first time, an entire, third grade classroom into a standing classroom! Standing desks provide a movement rich environment that today's children need in order to stay engaged and perform better throughout the school day. My students will be a part of a pilot program that combines BOKS with Stand Up Kids. BOKS (Build Our Kids' Success) is a before school fitness program designed to boost the body and brain. Stand Up Kids is a foundation that combats inactivity and sedentary lifestyles with stand-up desks for kids in school. This project is a pilot program will assess the increase in productivity, performance and behavior of the kids involved.
needStatement: My students need 25 stand-up desks and 10 stools to keep them active and engaged in their learning.

name: Integrating Technology and Reading With Social Studies
description: My students are a group of 34 eager learners in fifth grade at a Title 1 school in a high poverty urban area. Over 90% of my students receive free and reduced lunch. They are eager to learn and love to read and experience new things. Having the opportunity to use their own personalized learning devices this year heightens their interest for learning tremendously. Despite the challenges my students face in and outside the classroom, my goal is to make every learning opportunity count for them. This project will help motivate my students to not only enjoy and participate in learning but also assist them in retaining information learned. The novels will be used to integrate reading and social studies which will allow students to get a deeper understanding of the content taught and at the same time, deepen their reading comprehension. Furthermore, the headphones will help meet the various needs of students while using personal learning devices throughout instruction. Students will be able to use headphones to listen to instructional videos to enhance their learning and use styluses as they take notes and conduct research projects. Since many students have different modalities by which they learn, obtaining an opportunity to learn at their own pace will be highly effective. Therefore, students will love attending school which will boost their confidence leading to successful individuals.
needStatement: My students need novels to integrate social studies with reading, headphones and styluses for personal learning devices to meet various learning needs.

name: Apples Aren't Just for Teachers: Help Us Get iPads
description: My students walk into my classroom everyday full of curiosity, ready to learn, and excited for the activities of the day. One thing my students love is technology! Just think about how often you use your iPhone, iPad, or computer? Technology is such an important part of our world. My first graders attend a Title I school in a low-income neighborhood in Fort Worth where 93% of our students receive free or reduced priced school meals. As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I want to provide my students with engaging and meaningful learning experiences. Many of my students do not have access to technology at home and having the opportunity to use technology at school enhances their learning and prepares them for their future!My students would love to use the latest technology in our classroom. The Apple iPad minis and protective cases will become tools that will help create more authentic learning experiences in the classroom as well as build twenty first century skills that our students need in order to be successful in a quickly evolving technical world. There are many educational apps for the Apple iPad mini that will help my students practice and reinforce skills in reading, writing, phonemic awareness, and math. We can also use our iPads for group research projects that will allow the students access to more information on topics that interest them. These Apple iPad minis and protective cases will keep my students engaged in the learning process and allow them to demonstrate their learning in a new and creative way. The students in my classroom deserve to have all that we can give them. They work hard each day to gain the knowledge and skills they need to be successful and having Apple iPad minis and protective cases can help bridge the gap between technology and learning. I want my students to enjoy learning and using technology is one way we can make that happen!
needStatement: My students need Apple iPad Mini tablets with protective cases to help them build skills in all academic areas and become more proficient with technology.

name: Making Our Classroom a Comfortable & Organized Place to Learn
description: I teach at a Title I school in Mount Vernon, NY where 100% of our students receive free breakfast and many students receive free or reduced lunch. Despite so many hardships, my students are eager to learn and do their best. They want to be in school because they want to learn all they can so they can be successful. These tools will help them on their road to success. In turn, this will help them gain confidence; which is a key to success. The students are very eager to learn and I would like to continue to encourage that. By donating to this project, my students will have chairs and a comfortable place to sit in while in their teacher led station. The bookcases will help students stay organized and self-sufficient. Technology is a crucial part of learning and with headphones the students will be exposed to another avenue of learning. These items I have requested will help foster independence in the classroom. Students who gain independence, also gain confidence in themselves. Please help me to get my students the supplies they need for a successful year.
needStatement: My students need comfortable chairs to sit on while at the teacher led center. Bookcases will make it possible for the students to help themselves to our literature.

name: Share Ideas!
description: I teach social studies to 9th graders in a high-poverty neighborhood. Many of my students are below-grade-level. To be successful in college, career, and to meet essential graduation requirements, my students need to be strong writers, readers, and critical thinkers . The school where I teach is a diverse public high school: 23% of students are African American, 19% Hispanic, 16% Asian, 2% Native American, and 36% Caucasian. Many of my students struggle with challenges outside of school. Over 70% of our students are below the poverty line. Many students are in the foster care system or are homeless. Many are recent immigrants learning English as a second language. I have amazing students who use their diversity and life experiences to their advantage. My students are from Ethiopia, Somalia, Rwanda, Vietnam, Mexico, Guatemala, Myanmar (Burma), Thailand, Micronesia, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and other places around the world. This year I teach freshman world history and two sheltered versions of history for English language learners. Some of my students have just moved to the United States and are beginning to learn English. In my class my students will learn about the world and other cultures. As a social studies teacher, I have the opportunity to help students develop essential skills to support them in many areas. My goal is to prepare them for college, career, and other areas. My students will use pens, pencils, highlighters, and post-it notes to annotate primary source documents and articles. My students will use post-it pad paper, markers and colored pencils to visually represent their ideas and share them around the classroom. My students will use post-it notes, highlighters, and pens to revise essays. These materials will last us the entire school year and will be used everyday in class.
needStatement: My students need pens, post-it notes, pencils, markers, highlighters will help my students everyday in class. They can share ideas, annotate readings, write, and more.

name: Building Community At The Classroom Rug
description: H. H. Elementary is located in MN. This school serves a diverse student population with 95% of the students qualifying for free and reduced lunch and 61% of the students designated as English Language Learners. The students who will be in our 4th grade classroom are energetic and have an immense sense of wonder. I strive everyday to encourage my students to continue their love of learning and curiosity. Many of my students face numerous challenges outside of the school day, and it is my goal to create a safe and welcoming environment where they are able to grow academically and socially. The students put forth amazing effort, and it is so wonderful to see how proud they are of themselves and each other at the end of each school day. Having a central location for students and teachers to gather together is an essential component to building a safe and welcoming classroom community. When students gather at the carpet they know there are specific expectations that everyone follows in order to accomplish a variety of goals such as participating in a mini-lesson, playing a morning meeting activity, or having a class problem solving meeting. A classroom rug also provides a comfortable and alternative place for students to participate in small group or independent reading activities. Desks and tables are important pieces of furniture for a classroom, but having other options available helps increase student engagement and learning.
needStatement: My students need a classroom rug as a place to gather together and build our community during classroom meetings and lessons.

name: The Bare Necessities... (Basic Fundamentals for Learning)
description: 'I am thankful for my struggle because without it I wouldn't have stumbled across my strength.' -Alexandra Elle My students are true over achievers. Even when others attempt to discourage them, my students find the strength to push forward and succeed. Although my students are faced with limited resources and unlimited critics, they refuse to give up. I teach in a Title 1 School. All of my students are on free lunch due to family income, and many have absent parents due to different reasons, including irregular work schedules and absenteeism. We have very few resources and little to no funding to purchase anything. Despite their circumstances, despite the labeled environment, they come to school with a desire to learn!It is impossible for the students to be successful without the basic materials needed for class. Not all students are fortunate to have all items on their 'school supply' list, and in the past, I have covered the tab personally. The items listed in this project will be directly used by the students. If my students are personally provided with the basic materials to succeed, there is no excuse for failure. Allowing the students to receive these materials from the teacher is promoting student responsibility and accountability. The students will be allowed to keep the spiral notebooks and folders to house their assignments, and the pens, markers, and pencils will be divided among classes and kept in the room for use when needed. I feel confident this project will help increase the idea of student responsibility in my class. Thank you for your consideration.
needStatement: My students need supplies such as spiral notebooks, pens, pencils, highlighters, folders, and other items to ensure they have the basic materials needed to be prepared for class and engaged in the lesson.

name: Discovering Life
description: My students are determined and motivated young scholars living in South Central Los Angeles. Many of my students live in neighborhoods that are plagued with violence from rival gangs and come from homes that are broken. Most students come from homes where the highest form of education their parents received is General Education Diploma. Most students come from single parent families and some students no longer live with both parents. In-spite of these harsh realities, many of my students come to school yearning a better future. They work extremely hard and inspire the faculty. As teachers we want to provide an excellent curriculum however, its a charter school with limited resources. It is the purpose of this request to ensure my students are given every opportunity for success. Donations of microscopes will allow students a better understanding of the structure and functions of cellular biology. Students will be able to analyze the difference between animal and plant cells, identify cell differentiation, and create a 3-D model of cells. I feel microscopes will greatly enhance the experience of the students evaluation of cell and eventually larger body systems. Microscopes enlarge an invisible world that becomes larger than life. Students will be able to comprehend levels of organization of life by examining the beginnings of life, cells to the more complex organisms like the human body. Microscopes will enhance their experiences and allows the possibilities of my students' futures to be imagined.
needStatement: My students need microscopes to comprehend cell biology and living organisms.

name: Active Bodies, Active Learners
description: Remember walking into your Kindergarten classroom and feeling nervous and excited? I love embracing my student's excitement and comforting their nerves with a welcoming, warm and prepared classroom that encourages their minds and bodies to grow and learn! Many of my students have difficult home lives and come to school knowing they are cared for everyday. My students are a wonderful group of children from Northglenn, Colorado. Through the school, each child is provided with a free breakfast. These students come to school excited and ready to learn, even with the hardships and challenges they face outside of school. Teaching these students organizational skills, respect of materials, creating healthy lifestyles and many other life skills is important as they grow up. Kindergarten students can be very wiggly, and I love to encourage their movement throughout the day! My students need various seating options such as Wobble Stools, Wobble Cushions, and Balance Balls to help them keep their bodies active which can increase attention and promote self-regulation. This will lead to improved classroom behavior and academic performance! The resources I am requesting will be used daily in the classroom. Students will have opportunities to use each type of seating choice, finding what works best for their learning. Providing ways for students to choose their seats and move while working in the classroom creates more on-task behavior, engagement, and a student-centered classroom. The use of nontraditional seating options can improve attention and decrease off-task and disruptive behavior in students. It also teaches kids responsibility in making choices and about having privileges that can be taken away if not used appropriately. It takes time, patience, and practice for everyone to work together and optimize instructional time. Having different seating options helps in instruction, engagement, and keeps the excitement in learning! Please help me keep my classroom focused on the students and their learning by contributing to this project.
needStatement: My students need seating choices including wobble cushions, stools, and balls that allow them to get their wiggles out while keeping their minds engaged in learning!

name: Student Work...Who Needs a Desk?!
description: My students are from low income families. We are a Title 1 school which means 90% of our students are on free or reduced lunch. That fact by no means diminishes their levels of intelligence. My students are full of life and willing to do what it takes to learn. They are also full of energy. As a second teacher you can count on there never being a dull moment. My goal is to provide a flexible learning environment that meets the needs of all my students Some students truly perform better when they are allowed their own space to focus in. My classroom is currently in a learning cottage. We have a very small space and I plan on taking advantage of every inch of it. How you ask? By letting my students spread out whenever possible! I've found that second graders do best when they get to choose their favorite spot to work. This year I would love for my students to be able to grab a brand-new clipboard that doubles as a whiteboard and find a comfortable spot. I'm also asking for a pencil sharpener so that all the pencils in the room can be sharpened in a flash before the school day begins. It's also super quiet so it won't disrupt the learning in my classroom.
needStatement: My students need an Electric Pencil Sharpener and clipboards to rock their work all around the room and these supplies will help!

name: Resources for Ms. P's Classroom!
description: Hello! My name is Ms. P, and I am currently a fourth grade teacher in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Our school is K-5, and we serve students from all over the world. My favorite part about teaching in Minneapolis, is teaching to such a diverse community of learners!My school has a very high number of students who are English Language Learners, as well as students who receive free or reduced price lunch. I feel passionate about giving my students resources, where they can be excited to learn, as well as feeling comfortable and safe in our learning community. This project will make a difference in students' learning, because it will give them opportunities to stay busy and be challenged in class. Having these resources will allow me to differentiate for students who are at different levels, find extra resources for the standards we are working on, and allow those early finishers to stay engaged within the classroom! I can picture myself using these books, including 35 Reading Passages for Comprehension: Main Ideas and Summarizing and others, all throughout the school day. There are great resources to help turn on my students' brain, while they are coming in and working on morning work, while eating their breakfast. There are literacy skills to go along with mini-lessons. They can also be homework extensions. I will also be able to use these resources to extend math lessons, give exit slips, and to get students to think critically!
needStatement: My students need resources to work on everyday literature skills, test preparation, homework, and resources for partner work and group projects! I can see my students enjoying and benefiting a lot from the 'Daily Math 4'.

name: Fight the Power Against Traditional Classroom Seating!
description: The school that I teach at (which happens to be my Alma mater) is located in Flint, Michigan, and is one of the most diverse districts in the state of Michigan. It comprises of students of several races and backgrounds. Last school year, the racial dynamics of my school were 55% African-American, 35% Caucasian-American, and 10% of races including Asian-America, Native-American, and children of middle eastern descent. Currently, 73% of the children in the district receive free or reduced lunch due to the changes of the financial institution of Flint. Despite the hardships of fleeting businesses, the contamination of water, and other social issues beyond my student's control, they still strive to have a successful life after leaving high school. I work to give them the best education possible by the use of different pedagogy and practices to reach all students and instill a drive to succeed. Flexible seating is an essential change that will meet the needs of my students. Data proves that flexible seating brings upon more stimulating conversation, an increase in grades, and a feeling of comfort against the 'cemetery feel' of most classrooms. Yoga mats, disks, and high back stools will allow students to participate in collaborative learning. Bean bags and LapDesks will give individuals a space to read, write, and learn. The concept of using exercise balls and Big Joe chairs will bring about the feel of a safe and comfortable place where students can feel free to learn his/her own way.
needStatement: My students need a classroom with comfortable seating that goes against the cold, traditional classroom. The change in seating will make them feel protected, allow freedom, and a place of intimate conversations to grow.

name: Hands on Learning: Making Learning Fun and Engaging!
description: My students are from a small, rural town in the Mississippi Delta. The majority of my students come from low income households, and our school is where they love to come to read, play and learn. My students love exploring and learning with hands on materials! They are creative and full of energy, few things get them more excited than new books or new sets of supplies. Many of my students come to first grade behind in reading and math. Because of this, we have to work extra hard to get them caught up and ready for 2nd grade, in just the 182 days we have together. Every day we spend time doing phonics, guided reading, literacy centers, math meeting, interventions and enrichment hour. Our school days are jam packed with activities, learning new things and trying our best!My Students live in a rural town in Mississippi. I am very excited about the subscription to Scholastic News because of the content and grade level reading practice. My students need to be exposed to ideas and stories from around the world in a way that is exciting to read. I know my students will love these weekly readers!My students also love our daily centers routine. During this time, students work in small groups with hands on materials. The fishing games, sight word string activities and model clay are all materials that they will LOVE to learn with. Having these resources really helps new skills stick in their brains, because they are getting the opportunity to learn by doing. Lastly, our room has very little storage to keep our materials in good condition. The chair back organizers will give my students the opportunity to take ownership of their things and practice at keeping their materials neat and orderly. These skills are very important to success in upper grades and real life. Thank you for considering donating to my project. I have put a lot of thought into every item I have selected and how it will benefit my students, I know these materials will make a tremendous impact on our year!
needStatement: My students need daily practice with engaging, hands on materials they are excited to learn with. The Scholastic Weekly News will provide this along with interesting, relevant and engaging stories about things around the world.

name: Common Core Counts!
description: My students are all first generation in this country. They are all American citizens while their parents may not be. The families are very hardworking, sometimes working around the clock and only get time with their children when they are able to take them to work! These children have such a respect for the teacher as well as for the school. They come in everyday excited to learn and eager to please. What I ask for is to level the playing field just a bit and grant us these ELA books. The books I am requesting are extremely useful in implementing the Common Core English language Arts (ELA). They contain every Common Core strand yet presented in a less intimidating way, with plenty of practice pages for young students to work on. These books will help prepare my students for the high stakes testing held in the spring. They are an essential tool that will help level the huge educational gap that currently exist between the 'haves and have not'. They contain performance tasks after each lesson that help students to think critically and respond to open ended questions. Every district should invest in books like these if we are to be governed by Common Core.
needStatement: My students need English Language common core workbooks for daily use.

name: Mindfulness In First-Grade: Yoga Mats Needed Please!
description: This school year, I have a class of 25 amazing first graders who are excited to explore and expand their knowledge and understanding of the world around them. My school is a Title I facility with almost 90% of students living in poverty. Socioeconomic factors can lead to inequities in students' access to resources. I'm making every attempt to get them the supplies that they need to make great learning gains, be connected to the content, and stay highly engaged! With your help, together we can create an optimal learning environment and provide these wonderful students with what they need to succeed!Yoga has the ability to help students connect with their bodies and regain control over their emotions when they are struggling to navigate the effects of stress and anxiety. I recently completed a yoga training specifically focused on bringing yoga into the elementary classroom. I hope to bring awareness of the power of connecting with the breath and body and what that can do for the growing mind of a young child. Yoga mats will allow my first graders to safely participate in our brain break activities, yoga or otherwise, and prepare them to be able to access the education they deserve. The world we live in today requires students to come to school ready to learn. When many students are exposed to trauma and crisis in their homes, it is challenging for them to come with a clear head. Students cannot learn if they are unable to attend to and connect with their education with a mind free from stress. The mats will allow the incorporation of yoga, stretching, and mindfulness activities into the classroom to help my remarkable and promising students reach their full potential.
needStatement: My students need yoga mats for our community building and brain break activities!

name: Restless Students in Search of Squirm Chairs!
description: Our school is a Title I school with a majority of students on free and reduced lunch(More than 85%). I have a class of 25-3rd graders. They are precious students who are eager to learn. Many times they get restless and have built up energy that lasts all day long. I keep them moving as much as I can, but at times they have to sit and learn. These students living situations aren't always ideal for them to get out their energy and move around unfortunately. Many are stuck living in small apartments with a large family and no yard to run around in. Several of my students have ADHD as well. It really is a struggle and constant battle for these students to be in a classroom without moving much throughout the day. Many students constantly struggle with having to sit still all day long in the classroom. Often times they end up getting in trouble because of it. However, these stools give them the ability to rock and constantly move. I have personally sat on these stools and loved them. It is nice having the ability to move around even if it is just a little bit. I would eventually love to have an entire class set of these stools. These stools will be used on a daily basis by all students as they rotate through small groups in math and reading. I can also use them throughout the regular instruction day when I have those students who just need that extra movement. These Wobble stools will increase the blood flow to the brain which will help stimulate the students mind and help them focus on their studies since they are able to get their wiggles out throughout the day. Please consider helping us complete this project. Your help is truly appreciated.
needStatement: My students need Wobble stools that will provide an outlet for restlessness and extra energy.

name: Scholarly Seating!
description: I am a first and second grade teacher in Saint Paul, Minnesota. These students have great energy and curiosity. They truly look forward to learning and being in the classroom with their friends every day. Unfortunately, our classroom is lacking some of the basics needed for learning. Please consider helping our first and second grade classroom get set up for success this school year. First and second grade students need help with organization and self-regulation. They also need personal and community space! Chair pockets and a classroom community rug will help our scholars with such skills. Seat pockets are a great way to keep clutter at a minimum. They reduce the need for classroom mailboxes and cubbies - which tend to take up too much space. Seat pockets are also washable and reusable - making them an investment that will produce results for years to come. Seat pockets keep students organized and give each student a place for their own supplies and books. A classroom rug helps to build a classroom community while at the same time providing a special space for each child. This personal space within the classroom community helps each child to feel safe and secure. When a child feels safe and secure, learning increases exponentially.
needStatement: My students need seat pockets and a classroom rug to help keep organized and practice self-regulation.

name: Stay Focused with Art
description: I am surrounded by resilience and creativity everyday. My students inspire me. I am the only counselor in a K-5 school so I keep VERY busy. My students are very motivated but many struggle with getting basic needs met at home. 100 percent of them get free lunch and most of my parents work nights or two jobs to make ends meet. In addition many do not speak English or very limited English and many are refugees. I deal daily with the kind of problems that stem from not getting basic needs met. In the midst of all this I help children express themselves in ways that help them to build a core sense of self. I learned a long time ago that a young child is likely to be more comfortable initially expressing himself with art than he is going to be at expressing emotions and feelings through words. I stay in at recess and after school trying to keep up with all the needs of my students and after 11 years I still truly love it. The students at my school come into my office to cool down and relieve anxiety in order to get ready to go back to class and be ready to learn. I need the tools to help them get what they need. The repetitive activities such as sewing and building helps many children relax and focus so they are able problem solve and self sooth. I think for a lot of my students self care such as this must be taught, they don't at first know what it is that helps them to calm down. Art therapy such as sewing and sculpting gives children the opportunity to do both in a safe environment. Some common art therapy goals for young children are sensory awareness and integration, problem-solving skills, identification and expression of feelings, and increased self-esteem. My students crave the soothing effects of art. Being able to provide them with the materials they need to be successful in this medium will increase their ability to develop a new skill that will help increase their self-esteem. My students need embroidery hoops, thread, needles and muslin for sewing and clay, paint, and brushes for building their sculpture masterpieces.
needStatement: My students need embroidery supplies and sculpture supplies, two of the most popular 'calm down' art activities. These two activities seem to trigger relaxation in my most anxious students.

name: Sometimes, Simply by Sitting, the Soul Collects Wisdom
description: The Carman-Ainsworth community is the most diverse in our county and one of the most diverse communities in the state of Michigan, north of the metro Detroit area. Our district is in Flint Township with many of our students negatively impacted by the Flint Water Crisis. Over 40% of our students live with only one parent or guardian. On average, our families are trying to survive on a family income of less than $40,000 per year. To say that our community is struggling is an understatement. Struggles are required in order to succeed in life; because in order to stand up, you need to know what it is like to fall down. We are in the struggle together. Because of the lack of health care in our community, many of our students are facing health issues. The lead exposure alone is causing developmental delays, attention deficit disorders, and behavioral concerns. We are doing all we can to help all children feel safe, comfortable, and at home in our school. It is becoming more difficult for our children to thrive in this community. They rely on the school to provide for their needs. We give them clean water, food, and a safe place to rest. It is my job to make them comfortable and free in their environment. I want to give them choice and an opportunity to develop an awareness about themselves by giving them alternate seating. Giving students an opportunity to choose different kinds of seating will build confidence, independence, and security. Learning will increase and behavior problems will cease. These 'chairs' will give my students a chance to thrive despite the challenges in their lives outside of my classroom.
needStatement: My students need alternative classroom seating to accommodate all children. They need chairs at various heights and styles like bar stools, milk crates with pillows, balance cushions, memory foam mats, and a special balance ball chair.

name: Bouncing for a Brighter Future!
description: 'The whole world opened to me when I learned to read.' - Mary Mcleod Bethune. Opening the doors through reading is my goal for my students. Students at my school are so eager to learn and absorb knowledge on a daily basis. With the start of a new group of students, my goal is to see plenty of growth in my students and teach them to love learning. My school is located in a small rural farming area where many of the parents are in the fields picking food all day. We are a Title I and Renaissance school meaning over 90% of our children get free lunches. Most of them have so many needs. Many of my students lack English fluency and confidence in mastering the English language because they come from Spanish-speaking homes. We also don't have a PTA, meaning many of the items that are in the classroom come from our own pockets. The parents at this school have a difficult time affording many necessities, let alone books and reading resources. I would like to help my students learn. I am asking for four exercise balls and bouncy bands for my students. The resources asked for in this grant will be used by my students each day. The exercise balls will be used for students of special needs, helping them to stay focused and release their energy by bouncing. The bouncing bands will be placed on students' chairs, allowing them to tap their feet in class. This is a great resource, because it can be done without disturbing others. These would be used for students that get nervous while working and those that need to center their energy. Both of these resources will greatly improve the attention of individual students. This project will give students the opportunity to be successful in learning, by helping them to focus their energy. Not every student is the same, so finding resources like these to implement into the classroom are key to helping them in learning. Our class will be equipped with the tools necessary to listen in class, as well as work independently. It is so important for children to fall in love with learning and I believe these resources will help them in that process.
needStatement: My students need exercise balls and resistance bands to help them stay focused.

name: Mrs. D's Flexible Seating Classroom
description: Third grade is a big year in students' lives when they grow from being 'little kids' to big kids. Their sweet hearts still want to please, but over their 3rd grade year they become more independent and take more responsibility for their learning. Many of my kids come from deep poverty and have grown up quickly in a lot of ways, but I've found that their sense of creativity and excitement for learning remains strong. My kids still love school!With this project I hope to provide my students with the opportunity to choose how and where they learn best and to allow them healthy movement while learning. Studies have shown that healthy brains require bodily movement and the better the blood flow, the better the learning. Our kids need every resource we can give them to grow healthy minds and healthy bodies! I am requesting wobble chairs and cushions to give my students these options. I believe that providing my students with seating choices, will promote motivation in their learning. As they discover how they learn best, they will become more self-aware and be able to take personal responsibility for their learning. I believe that flexible seating options can help us to develop lifelong learners!
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options to promote movement, motivation and self-awareness in their learning!

name: A Place to Gather Together: A New Large Classroom Carpet
description: In my class you will find students ages 7-8 years old. They come from different cultures, social economic backgrounds and have various learning styles. We discovered this past year that our class consisted of students with backgrounds from 6 different countries (Philippines, Madagascar, El Salvador, Mexico, Somalia & the U.S.). We celebrate the various cultures and learn a lot from each other. However, many of my students come from single parent families. Being raised in a single parent home, can put limitations on things we take for granted like financial resources and TIME. Some of my students have parents that don't speak English fluently, so they are limited with the academic support that they can give their child. In spite of these limitations my students come to school everyday ready to put forth their best effort to share what they know and to learn something new. Our school is considered a high poverty/ low income school. Many of my students are behind academically for a variety of reason, including home life, lack of learning tools, etc. Despite these limitations and challenges, my students come to school eager to share and ready to learn. They make me proud!I would love for my students to have a clean and comfortable place to gather together in the classroom. Last year, our custodian gave us a large carpet remnant from old carpeting in our building. While this carpet served its purpose, it wasn't very clean and caused some concerns after rashes appeared on the legs of a student and myself. The custodian replaced it with some carpet squares that she had. She has moved to another building now and taken the square with her. So this year I would love for my students to have a clean and comfortable gathering place in our classroom. We will use the classroom carpet to meet for morning meetings and morning work. It will also be the place for students to sit and listen to reading as well as the place to students to share their ideas and their writing. It'll be a place for math instruction and math games. It will be the central place in our classroom like the kitchen is in our homes. This carpet will allow the students to have room (their own square) to sit, to stand, to play games and to focus on instructions, the board and me (the teacher).
needStatement: My students need a large classroom carpet to gather together on!

name: Some Kids Just Need to Move!
description: What makes my classroom special? Well, it's the students and the community that I serve. My students are the type of kids which people may not expect much from. When I came to this school is had just received an F, which meant it was a failing school. In my classroom, at least half of my students were one to three grade levels behind. Coming from low socio-economic backgrounds they come to my classroom missing background knowledge and experiences. However, I teach my students to dream and aspire to be more than their current circumstances.I teach my students that no matter what kind of neighborhood you grow up in, they too can leave a great impact on the world. I grew up in the same neighborhood and came back after going to college to make a difference. Many of my students have difficulty focusing and sitting their seat. Brain research shoes that these types of students greatly benefit from alternate seating. I am looking to ditch the traditional desks and chairs in my room! This year I will be moving to a more non traditional approach called flexible seating. Students will be able to choose where they sit everyday in class. They will have the responsibility of choosing the type of seating where they learn best. I will also lower a few tables so that some students may work sitting on the floor with a wobble cushion and raise a table so that students may also stand to work. Flexible seating benefits include burning more calories, using up excess energy, improving metabolism, increased motivation and engagement, creating a better oxygen flow to the brain, and improving core strength and overall posture. Physical activity is linked to higher academic performance, better health, and improved behavior. It is also great for students with ADD and ADHD. The wobble chairs and balls will be perfect for students with excess energy. They can continue this move while they work!
needStatement: My students need wobble chairs, wobble cushions, and balance balls for increased engagement and focus in the classroom.

name: A Comfy Classroom
description: My students are bilingual learning Spanish and English during their school day. Students learning two languages can have more anxiety due to the difficult task of learning content this way. They benefit from different seating options and seem to thrive when given some choices while doing their school work. A variety of seating options has been one way I can help relieve some of their anxious feelings during learning time. Please consider helping my students feel comfortable in my classroom. By donating to my project you will be helping my students feel more comfortable in our learning environment. Learning content in two languages is very scary and offering other seating options can help alleviate some of those anxieties for students. 3rd grade is an important year with state testing starting. It is important to me that my students have a safe and comfortable space to learn and study. Some students are able to learn using traditional classroom furniture while others do much better if they have a wobble seat, excercise ball, stand up desk or even a bean bag chair.
needStatement: My students need a variety of seating options to do their best at school, please consider helping my students learn in a comfortable environment.

name: Strengthening the First Grade Learning Environment to the 'Core!'
description: I teach at an elementary school with a diverse population and a high number of students diagnosed Attention Deficient Hyperactivity Disorder or students that have extreme difficulty concentrating in the classroom. We have one first grade classroom that began an alternative seating arrangement last school year. I was awarded the opportunity to witness the significant impact that it made on student motivation and achievement. The alternative seating classroom is contagious, and I am excited to incorporate some of the same tools that I have watched help engage students to learn by choosing a location in the classroom that best fits his/her learning style.I strongly believe that a variety of alternate seating will significantly improve my students' concentration and behavior. Our students are born to wobble! I have seen this alternative seating plan work across the hall in my fellow first grade teacher's room who was funded right here on DonorsChoose! I'm excited to provide opportunities for appropriate movement, even when at their desks to my first graders as well! The funding will help provide the necessary tools, like a Cubby Tray Cabinet to store supplies since they will not be sitting at desks, to turn our classroom into an environment that nurtures the skills of a 21st Century Learner. This project will motivate students to remain actively engaged throughout the school day by transitioning to areas in the classroom that provide comfort to allow concentration to complete learning tasks.
needStatement: My students need the Cubby Tray Cabinet to store supplies since they will not be sitting at desks and will be transitioning to wobble chairs, balance balls, and other alternate seats throughout the day.

name: Getting The Big Screen View
description: My students are special because they have been playing basketball from 7th through 12th grade. We made it to regionals in the 2016 1A basketball. We are looking to go to the state finals the coming basketball season 2017.My students come from poor environments, some single parent homes, and some are being cared for by grandparents. We have worked together for many years trying to make a better learning environment for these students. We want them to know that they can learn and build a better life for the future. I am very proud of these students and I know that they will succeed in life with your help.'Getting the Big Screen' will give us a new way to view the computer screen. Some students have problems viewing a small computer screen. If we had a bigger screen the students will be able to see it better. The big screen would be a great asset for better teaching and learning. The big screen would enhance my students' visibility. Clear vision has been proven to improve student achievement. Integrating the big screen in the classroom would be an advantage for my students. The big screen would ignite student interest, and it will help them to see the information clearer. Whether you're sharing what's on your screen with the class, demonstrating a new skill from your PC to student smart devices, or working with someone one-on-one, the solution gives you a variety of ways to bridge the gap between your screen and theirs. To add, this will help to integrate relevant technology into everyday instruction. For these reasons, I believe that it will make a significant, measurable difference in student achievement when teaching with this technology. I feel it will actually improve student achievement.
needStatement: My students need the Lenovo desktop for research purposes in our classroom.

name: Why Dry Erase When You Can E-Write?
description: Though I am the computer teacher for grades K-5, I volunteer to work with my 4th grade students for the sole purpose of developing their writing skills. The students that I serve are mostly classified as either at-risk or socio-economically disadvantaged. However, on my campus, we instill within each child that the 'your neighborhood does not define your potential.' Therefore our motto is, 'If it is to be, it is up to me.' You must have experiences or a great imagination to become a great writer. Since my students are not allotted many experiences, I try to provide them with as many as possible through field trips, guest speakers, and incredible journeys across the world through virtual trips. They are always grateful and so eager for every extended opportunity provided.I attended a Tots and Technology conference this summer and saw the amazing Boogie Boards for the first time. No longer would there be a need to have smeared mini whiteboards that are hard to read. Or no longer would we have to waste tissue, paper or sponges trying to create erasers. No longer would I have to try to figure out what is attempted to be written, because students are trying to write with dried out dry erase markers or write on boards that have been used to the point of blurriness. With the Boogie Board, students would have an opportunity to express themselves without having to worry about if it's going to be understood. They could brainstorm ideas, collaborate with each other and I believe using this device would ignite an additional flame of creativity.
needStatement: My students need Boogie Boards to assist with brainstorming and sharing their ideas with me, as their teacher, and with each other.

name: Bring Midwest Food Connection Into Our Classroom!
description: Our 90 students include English language learners, language academy learners, and special education students that are in our inclusive classrooms. They are getting direct support from special education teachers, English language learning teacher, and general education teachers. Most of our students qualify for free and reduced price lunch. Our students are caring, open minded, risk-takers who try their best every day. Our students show perseverence in all that they do! Our classes contain dedicated, lovable students who come from all walks of life with many different experiences. Imagine my students experiencing fresh local produce, tasty and healthy treats, and cooking right in the classroom! Midwest Food Connection teachers bring exciting, practical and interactive lessons about healthful eating right into my classroom! They can bring this energy and delight in natural foods to my classroom. Storytelling, drama, song, and art accompany a bountiful selection of fresh food. Their educators create dishes right in front of students’ eyes, engaging children in the preparation and the processing of food, and astound them with wonderfully tasting food and snacks. Midwest Food Connection will empower my students to make healthy and responsible food choices. Students will learn about agriculture in Minnesota and will be able to share their knowledge with their family. Students will get a chance to experience urban farming and will learn valuable tools that they can carry with them for the rest of their lives.
needStatement: My students need an opportunity to experience fresh local produce, tasty and healthy treats, and cooking right in the classroom! Midwest Food Connection teachers bring exciting, practical and interactive lessons about healthful eating.

name: Sources to Enrich History Courses, Inc. Absent Narratives
description: First some statistics about our student population:-Student ethnicity: 50% white, 21% Asian, 16% Black, 11% Hispanic, 1% American Indian-28% of our students have languages other than English spoken at home with Spanish, Karen, and Hmong the most prevalent home languages.-46% of students qualify for free or reduced lunches, we also run a school food shelf that many students and their families take advantage of. These are our current statistics but we are growing in diversity every year. With our growing population, and more specifically our growing diversity, we are starting district wide initiatives to help with the race-based achievement gap to try and reach ALL of our students. One of those initiatives is to encourage ALL students to take more rigorous courses, specifically AP.As the diversity and achievement gap are growing in our district, we are encouraging students to take more rigorous courses. I will be teaching AP US History and would like to not only challenge my students to help close the achievement gap through rigor, but also provide resources for them to make connections and see themselves in our history. These requested resources will be used to enrich our curriculum through diverse primary and secondary sources. Students will be provided sources from various people to allow for multiple perspectives. Hopefully, these sources will fill some of the gaps of absent narratives in our history and allow students to find more of themselves in the US history curriculum. The books will be providing the sources themselves and the document camera will be used to project the information as we work through these sources as a class. Specifically using the AP model, we will identify the main ideas/arguments, historical context, intended audience, point of view, and purpose. Thank you so much for your consideration.
needStatement: My students need a document camera and American History resources.

name: NJHS 1st Annual Walk-a-Thon to Build Community in K-8th grade
description: My National Honor Society students decided that they wanted to give back to their school. They wanted all students to have equal opportunities when it came to field trips (not- required trips that cost money), books in classrooms, and other class trips to be available to all. Last year they raised money and bought books for every classroom in the school. They were also able to give small scholarships to their classmates in need so they could all have equal opportunities. Their new big idea is to have a annual walk-a-thon to raise money for projects that students and teachers want to do that are the 'extras'. Along with the possibility of raising funds, the entire school will walk 3 miles with their buddies in October. (The 8th graders are buddies to the 3rd to be mentors and to create a healthy environment between the older and younger students in the building.) Not only will they walk together, but they will talk about the health benefits of walking and see our local neighborhood and the history in the area. They want to establish the walk-a-thon so they can leave a legacy of community building for all grades. Students will be organizing a whole school walk-a-thon to help build community in all grades. They will present the walk-a-thon to classrooms. They will collect pledges from classrooms. They will help classrooms graph and total the percentage of students who have participated as well as how much they have collected in pledges. They will map out the route and organize a timeline for all classrooms. They will help classrooms with their banner that they can use all year. We would like to have a school walk-a-thon so we can walk with our little buddies and get to know them better. We also hope that we can raise money so we can help others in the school all year. We want to show others how we can help one another. We will tell other student why it is important to be a leader in our school. We will model how to present and lead a project. We will let younger students help us. We will show the younger students how to give back to our school by having relationships with them as well as by helping them in their classrooms. We will help them design banner that reflect our school theme of 'teaching peace'. We think that to have peace you need to learn to get along with everyone and choose kind even when being kind is not easy. Our school has 9 grades in it. We want to help the younger kids be kind and successful in school. We hope by walking together as a school we can get to know them better so we can be better mentors to the younger students. We are divided onto 3 different floors so we do not see each other often. We want to be thought of as the nice older students in the building who can help the younger students when they are at lunch, recess or before/after school.
needStatement: We need envelopes to collect pledges for walking 3 miles, talking about health, and building community with their buddies. We need sharpies to make our classroom banners for the walk and for the year.

name: STEM Activities For Active Learning!
description: Our Kindergarten program consists of a full day schedule with an emphasis on rigorous academic instruction along with age appropriate activities to encourage personal growth and development. The students come from diverse backgrounds and speak a variety of languages. Every student is valued for their unique strengths, culture, and learning style. Kindergarteners are naturally inquisitive about their world. In our integrated curriculum, science, math, art, and literacy are combined during active learning opportunities to provide experiences that are real and relevant to the students. Our classroom is full of learning opportunities! Science, math, technology, art, and literacy skills can all be practiced and directly acquired through STEM activities. This project provides experiences where all of those subjects come together. With literature links of favorite fairy tales, students will actively learn science, technology, math, art, and literacy skills through carefully constructed activities. In addition, science tools will allow students to explore the world around them to gain a deeper understanding. These materials will greatly benefit the students in the classroom! They will use the scientific thinking to predict, observe, ask questions, hypothesize, and experiment. This project will engage all students with hands-on learning opportunities!
needStatement: My students need activities that allow exploration of science, math, and literacy concepts through hands-on exploration. STEM kits, Manga Tiles, and science tools are found within.

name: Wobble While You Work!
description: The school in which I teach is an arts-infused school. I will be teaching 2nd grade in the 2016-17 school year. My students come from a variety of backgrounds. Some of my students have the latest technology at home, while others see the latest technology in the classroom. The students at my school have a love for learning and a great deal of creativity. They are very active, and they are always ready for an opportunity to show their 'colors'. As a teacher at an arts infused school, it allows me to engage and motivate students by emphasizing active learning rather than passive learning. I have found it to be easier to level the playing field for my children so they all have the opportunity to be successful! My students need a class set of Wobble stools. In this project I am requesting 6 additional stools to add to the 12 already provided by generous donors on this site and from the Pine Street Grant Foundation. The stools are great for students with attention deficit disorders as well as students who just like to wiggle. Having used these in my classroom for a year, I have seen students who are unable to focus become actively engaged in the learning in my classroom because of the freedom these tools provide. Any partnership you can offer to my students would be much appreciated.
needStatement: My students need 6 more Wobble Stools to complete a class set!

name: Nurture Our Global Village
description: My students are excited four and five year children from a diverse area with high levels of poverty and food insecurity. They bring a joy of learning and a welcoming community. Older kids in the building often visit us when they need a little love. We take care of each other in our class family. My students work hard to grow their brains and to work on relationships. Often, our classroom resources are lacking in diversity when nurturing these relationships. They would love to see more diverse toys and books in their classroom. Students need to be able to see themselves in the things that they read. Books with diverse backgrounds are often not found in classrooms. The books requested will allow my children to picture themselves in the books they read and to recognize the diversity in our society. Children in Pre-K are learning to love books and stories. Having a better selection of diverse stories will motivate them to learn to love reading. You can help my students feel important! Dramatic play is an important part of a Pre-K classroom. The toys in this project will allow the children to create families that reflect their own while practicing social problem solving skills. The Pretend and Play families as well as the career vinyl people encourage children to practice different roles and to dream about different careers. Many of my students are learning English. When the Pretend and Play families are reflective of the diversity of the area students are excited to learn and practice language skills including new vocabulary. Vocabulary volume predicts the ability to read and succeed throughout their school years. My district has over 80% of children living in poverty. It is an extremely diverse community. We work hard to learn to work with all of our cultural differences and appreciate our differences. Having classroom toys and books that are reflective of the diversity of race, ethnicity, family make up and experiences will enrich the teaching and learning.
needStatement: My students need books and dramatic play toys that represent the children in my class.

name: Flexible Stability Ball Seating in Kinder
description: You would be funding a project for a Kindergarten classroom in a Title I school with a very diverse population. Most students in my class have never been to any type of school setting or daycare, Preschool. Most live right next door in Section 8 housing and low income apartments. My class will include special needs children ranging from speech students to students with Autism along with their typically developing peers. My children love to move and talk and learn to read. They are sponges who soak up a love for learning and address each challenge with great enthusiasm. We live in San Antonio, a city with a diverse and multi faceted culture that includes English as well as Spanish speaking families. Parents enter the room full of hope that their children will make lots of friends, be kind to one another and have the best year ever. Many of my students have never set foot in a classroom or daycare before. Some of my special needs students have motor control challenges and well as the ability to sit still. Kinder kids not only need to be able to sit in a seat but also require sensory feedback to help them concentrate and learn. I am asking for a variety of storage crates and 4 stability balls to create special seats and storage. These seats will be utilizes at my small group table during which time, learning letters, sounds, and how to read will be a daily stop for all the children in the class. That same small group table will then change to Math concepts and learning numbers, how to count to 100 and solving simple word problems. Helping Kinder cuties to sit and concentrate is a year long goal. Hopefully the flexible stability ball seating will go a long way to reaching that goal.
needStatement: My students need a group set 6 storage crates, 2 large storage/filing crates with handles, a pump and 4 bright colored stability balls to give each child their own space and provide sensory feedback.

name: Relax and Listen to a Good Book With Your Friends!
description: I am blessed every day to teach and learn from a special group of kindergarteners. We are a Title l school where each student receives free breakfast and a daily snack. Watching these kids walk in every day with big smiles on their faces and eager to learn, despite the hardships they may face at home, fills my heart. My students love to read! They love exploring new books, listening to books on CD, and reading with a buddy. Watching them grow more confident as readers is a wonderful thing to witness.
