I want to provide my students with the tools they need to be successful individuals. The listening station will provide my students with a fun way to enjoy a book with their friends. Listening to books not only teaches the fundamentals of reading, but gives students confidence as they grow as readers. We currently do not have an updated listening station. I can only accommodate 2 students and each group contains 5 kids. This equipment will allow my students to find a comfortable spot in the classroom and enjoy listening to a book. I am starting my second year of teaching. Although I have gathered and made many reading games and manipulatives, the reading center kit would give us so many more options during our literacy block. I like to give my students' choices and let them choose how they want to learn. This will help me accomplish that goal.
needStatement: My students need a listening station and reading manipulatives to enrich our literacy block.

name: Chromebooks for the Classroom
description: I have 5 sections of 9th grade Language Arts classes. Each class is diverse in every sense of the word, socio-economically, culturally, and with a range of needs and abilities. With that said, some students do not have access to technology resources, such as the internet, a computer, etc. This can make it difficult for those students to keep up with the increasing demand to be tech-savvy and tech-literate. The students in my classes want to learn and each student deserves access to what will help them be successful in their future. Currently, the access to technology at my school is a challenge. My school has about 1600 students and teachers are only allowed to reserve the computers for 4 days in each month based on a first-come-first-serve basis. The Chromebooks would give students access to technology in my classroom. It would also allow them to authentically engage in the learning and it creates equity because some students do not have access to technology at home, making it difficult for them to achieve at the same level as their peers. I want to set my students up for success in whatever path they choose for their future. I want my students to be prepared for whatever path they choose The technology will immensely improve the quality and access to learning for my students. I believe being tech-savvy and tech-literate is important for all students. However, it is difficult with the limitations of access to technology in both the classroom and at home. The technology will help my students to access more information and resources in the classroom, gain more experience in order to become tech-savvy and tech-literate, and be prepared for post-high school.
needStatement: My students need 5 Chromebooks and a Google EDU Management Console License to give them greater access to resources, researching and the writing process.

name: Building a Bridge to Understanding
description: As a speech/language pathologist in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to make information accessible and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. My students are aware, creative, clever and spontaneous. They also have learning and emotional disabilities. Learning and economic difficulties make it challenging to getting ahead early in life. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their potential and growth. My goal is to teach them strategies to empower themselves through literacy and language and become informed. My students need games and activities that focus on understanding and expressing information, social skills and clearly articulating their thoughts and ideas. My students will use these materials to explore their ability through building sentences, drawing, making letter and sound connections, and then words and finally meaningful sentences. These activities will be used during speech/language therapy and throughout the day as they build their reading and writing skills. They will be able to use these word manipulatives during our whole group and small group to answer question, formulate sentences and problem solve social situations. Your generous donation to our project will improve my students speech and language skills by building a stronger communicators, readers and writers. This will change my students' lives for the better. They will love school and feel success at an early age --- having fun while learning!
needStatement: My students need to learn practical strategies to learn how to comprehend and retell information. The teaching focus is on clarifying information and building on that knowledge.

name: Seat Sacks for the Wise Owls
description: We are a low socio-economic class in Northern West Virginia. We are a happy, energetic class that is eager to learn. Most of us come to school for the very first time in August. We will be learning our letters and numbers and especially how to read. Although we don't have a lot of resources, we try very hard and do our best to be successful. We are diverse and special. We need support to reach our full potential. Please consider being a part of our future. These seat sacks will help the students keep their supplies organized and give the students some ownership of the classroom. We had to use our shelf space for our library. This helped the students be able to access the books and have more choices. Unfortunately, this left no space to store their journals and supplies. It is important for students to feel ownership in their classroom. A seat sack will give the students their own place to put their things and their nameplates. Seeing their names and being able to get their supplies on their own help to build a foundation of responsibility.
needStatement: My students need seat sacks to keep their supplies in. We had to use the shelves in our room for our classroom library. These sacks will help the students be independent and organized.

name: Literacy Library Lift-Off!
description: My new fifth-grade students are starting the year at the top of the school. They're excited and ready to show off what they have learned in their previous elementary years, and I can't wait to help the hone their writing skills to perfection. The students at my campus are all unique in many ways, and each young mind brings something special to my classroom. In my English Language Arts and Social Studies classes, we do a lot of collaborative learning, so that each child's qualities can impact his or her peers in the most meaningful ways. As a writing teacher, I am eager to discover the talents of my incoming pupils, and to watch them learn and grow in their writing skills and creative expression. Here's to a fabulous new school year! Help me build a solid library for my classroom filled with books my students will really enjoy! Having a rich classroom library is essential to all elementary school classrooms, and I want mine to shine! Literacy is the foundation of elementary education, and it begins and continues with a quality classroom library and a text-rich environment. As an English Language Arts and Social Studies teacher, I will use the texts in the library to support my instruction by providing concrete examples of writing techniques in a format that is relevant to my students. I have also requested some primary source posters to display in my literacy-rich Social Studies instruction.
needStatement: My students need a classroom library (I am a new teacher as of January 2016 and started with a limited supply of books), and primary source display items for integrated writing and social studies.

name: Let's Run and Play Like Students Should Each Day!
description: I am a first-grade teacher in a wonderful school in Wisconsin. My students are very special, and I just love going to school every day to see the sparkle in their little 5 to 8-year-old eyes. I also get to connect with students of various ages during and after school. I truly have the most special job in the world and treasure every day with my students! We participate in so many fun activities throughout the year, and our hope is to add even more. The students that I work with need activities to keep them moving and active at the recommended level for school age children! I have been talking to them, and they are thrilled about the possibility of getting some really great activities and games! They are hoping to get a giant Connect Four game, flying disks, fishing poles, a Yardzee game, Flipping Chickens, a composter for our school garden, running batons, and so much more. These items will help all of the children I work with to get involved and stay involved while having fun getting fit every single day! The best part is that these games and activities are cooperative, so the kids can encourage and learn from each other for years to come.
needStatement: My students need activities and games like a giant Connect Four game, fishing poles, rocket kits, running batons, a Yardzee game, and more, so that they are encouraged to become active in a very fun way. They also need a composter.

name: We Like To Move It Move It
description: My students come to school each day eager to learn. The school is a Title I school which means 99% of the students are below poverty level. They attend a school that has six hundred students. Resources are very limited. It is very hard to get students to bring in two dollars for a class trip, let alone anything else they need for supplies. Since it is a special education class they really benefit from hands-on class work and work in an environment that allows them to get up and move around the room whenever needed. My students are always asking for more. More games, more play, more hopping, skipping and running. The activity mat for small group centers and the sports balls will fulfill their need and want to play more with each other. They constantly ask for more play time. Especially after a long day of reading/writing/math. By having the games/activities in the classroom my students will have access to them during indoor recess and during center time in the classroom. They will be able to play with the materials and enjoy socializing with their friends in the classroom. They need to move and socialize with each other outside of the common core curriculum. They do not get many chances to play with other children outside of the school day. They need to enjoy every aspect of it while in school.
needStatement: My students need a active play kit and balls.

name: Interesting Reads Today = Better Reader Tomorrow
description: This will be my 3rd year with these students. They are eager to learn and become better readers. My students love to read, but many have a hard time understanding what they are reading. We are located in a rural area of Beaufort County. All students at our school receive free breakfast and lunch. The majority of students in our school are considered to be below grade level and the teachers work hard to try and bridge that gap. My students are energetic and enjoy learning as much as having funWe all have books for our students to read, but if students aren't interested in the books, they aren't going to read them. I have been moving up in grade levels in my 13 years of education. This year will be my first year in 4th grade and I need more books that are on my students level and that interest them. In order to become a fluent reader, students need to practice reading to themselves and reading to the teacher. This allows the teacher to know exactly what each student needs to work on to become a better reader. Students will be able to read books that interest them and I will be able to listen to them reading by using the WhisperPhone, and they won't bother those around them. Part of becoming a better reader is understanding what you read. The cubes allow students to discuss their books during small group or in pairs to build comprehension.
needStatement: My students need more books in our classroom library that interest them and ways to interact with the teacher to ensure that they are reading fluently and with accuracy.

name: Help Us Spread the Word School-Wide! #CharacterMatters
description: My students come to school everyday despite heavy challenges at home and in their neighborhood. Many of them lack a support system and push themselves to come to school and learn. They make sure they show up. Once they come to school, they know that the doors are open for them to learn and grow. Many of my students have lost at least one of their parents- they have to grow up fast and learn how to take care of themselves. I admire the strength within them that they do not even know they have. The neighborhood the school is located in has been on the rise for gang activity- and because of this, my students need more help than ever. One of today's biggest issues is Anti-Bullying. Our school knows 'not to bully.' But what's missing is... well, how should they act then? With this project, the students will be surrounded with positive words--- on pencils, on buttons worn on their backpacks, on bracelets worn on their hands! This school-wide pilot project is meant to spread the word from our Pre-K students all the way to our 8th grade students! In today's world, being funny and cool is always trending--- but this year, we are going to make #CharacterMatters trend! With these amazing materials, the students will be surrounded with positivity and constant reminders to be responsible, be trustworthy, be kind, and to be respectful. Many of our students are taught by what they see on tv and the internet, and it is our responsibility at school to teach them the right thing. They will also take this knowledge and spread #CharacterMatters to their homes and neighborhoods. I know this will start a chain reaction and create a change in the students' attitudes and actions!
needStatement: My students need to make Character Education TRENDING school-wide with pencils, buttons, and bracelets. #CharacterMatters

name: Alternative Classroom Seating
description: I teach in a low-income/high poverty school district. Despite our low-income community, my students love school and learning. It is my passion to make them lifelong learners. My students are active and energetic! My goal is to provide my students with a fun, interesting, meaningful and safe learning environment. I feel it is important for all students to have a classroom that is comfortable and warm. I want my students to have the technology and materials needed to ensure their success. Because times have changed and expectations of our children have increased, I believe the way I teach and the setup of their learning environment needs to change too. I am completely redoing my classroom to accommodate my students. Alternative seating has many benefits for children. Students are able to move around the room and still learn at their pace. This will allow my active students and my children who daydream a lot to stay on-task and complete a job through the help of movement and choice. Nowadays it is nearly impossible to have students sit and listen so my goal is to change my room to meet their needs. The items I have requested will provide seating, iPods for a listening center, and adjustable lighting. This plan is something that will be able to help children for many classes to come.
needStatement: My students need different seating options to accommodate all learning styles.

name: Flexible Seating for Z's Frogs
description: My students are full of potential and love. I have the privilege of serving a wonderful community full of wonderful students. The students I serve are full of ideas, hugs, smiles, knowledge and energy. For many of my students school is their only safe place to learn, love, play, and grow. I work hard everyday holding them to very high standards, giving them new experiences, and helping them ignite a love of learning that will carry them into the future.I would like to add more options in my classroom for work areas. In order to do this I need to expand my flexible seating in the classroom this year. By purchasing wobble stools and wobble cushions, my students will be able to choose seating that helps keep them focused and engaged in the lesson. Wobble stools and wobble cushions allow students who need to move the freedom to do so without disrupting the flow of their learning. I am excited to see how different work areas in our room will help us all perform at an even higher level. Students will have options that meet their personal needs while they are working independently and as a group. This kind of freedom will foster trust and independence. Igniting excitement in learning is extremely important and I know that these items will be highly effective tools in my classroom.
needStatement: My students need wobble stools and cushions to help with the wiggles and focus..

name: Starting the Year Off Right!
description: We are an integrated collaborative teaching (ICT) first grade class, with a mixture of general and special education students at a high-needs Title I school in the Bronx. While the majority of students come from low-income homes or from homes with limited parental involvement, they are enthusiastic and come to school every day ready to learn. They see school as a consistent part of their daily lives and love to make me proud. My first graders are some of the happiest children I have ever had the pleasure of working with, and they inspire me to provide the best education I can for them. Learning is meaningful to students when they are able to create and make connections. I am requesting the art supplies- markers, yarn, buttons, and construction paper- so that students can create self portraits of themselves to hang on the wall during a lesson on community and diversity. I want to have a visual reminder for them that each one of them makes up an important part of our classroom community! I am also requesting the 'All About Me' posters as an icebreaker activity for my students to complete after we read the book 'First Day Jitters.' It will be a wonderful and structured way for them to introduce themselves to their peers, and to me as well! I am requesting plastic folders for my students because experience has taught me that plastic folders are more durable and last the entire year. I don't want to hear the excuse, 'My folder broke!' if they forget their homework. The birthday crowns are a way for my students to feel special on their birthday! These materials will ensure that my students will have a smooth, engaging and fun-filled start to the school year. It will provide us with much needed materials for our classroom so we can continue to do art projects that are integrated with our learning!
needStatement: My students need a variety of art materials, such as assorted markers, multicultural construction paper and yarn, to create self portraits. They also need plastic folders and 'All About Me' posters to introduce themselves.

name: Active Engagement During Class!
description: My students come to school everyday because they know it is a safe place where someone will protect and care about them. Some have parents who work multiple jobs just to pay rent. It is hard for them to continue their learning at home because their parents are working hard to make ends meet, or they simply don't have any materials to work with. Due to this fact, many of them are below grade level, and struggling to catch up. My students constantly ask me for more recess time. They want to be moving at all times of the day. We have extremely long winters, and students often don't get the chance to go outside for recess at all. Days like these make it even harder to concentrate in clalss. Some students often need to get up and have a walk around the room or school, just to keep his or her brain moving! My students want to do well in school, and need to stay active to make that happen! They have seen our school secretary with a short, round stool, instead of a regular chair. They asked if they could have some sort of new chair so they have the option to move all day, instead of just sit at a desk. Their normal chairs keep them fairly immobile, but with these new, Hokki chairs, they would be able to move, fidget, and wobble until their hearts content. Instead of being so focused on getting another recess and more movement, they would be focused on learning! The bonus being they're moving the whole time they're learning!
needStatement: My students need 8 Hokki chairs to stay active during class.

name: Let's Get Moving: We Need Wiggle Seating!
description: My students are currently in grade 3 at a school in Saint Paul Public Schools, MN. SPPS serves a hugely diverse school population, with over 20 immigrant groups in the metro area. Our students come from a variety of different backgrounds, both culturally and in terms of their socioeconomic status. My students are freethinkers, evaluators, and tremendously creative, and it is my goal to bring this out as much as I can in a variety of ways. We explore and learn about our world with an emphasis on self-regulation and being comfortable in our space, and using the tools we have to creatively show our learning and understanding. We are aware of when we are ready to learn or not, and how to get there. We create art, perform, make movies, dance, journal, and explore. We take breaks when we need to, and talk out problems when we encounter them. We support each other as best we can, and we celebrate our accomplishments. We are a strong community. We have had a couple of ball chairs in our classroom already, and everyone agrees...they help us use extra energy and relieve anxiety or moments of stress. The great thing about a ball chair (or Wobble chair!) is it can be bounced on when you are feeling those things, or used as a regular chair too. The only problem with these chairs is that we would all love one but have to share. We would use these happily on a daily basis because we all know that a comfortable, cozy learning environment is a place that we look forward to coming to and learning in.
needStatement: My students need Gaiam ball chairs, Kore Kids Wobble chairs, and fidget toys as movement opportunities when they are sitting, writing, or collaborating at tables.

name: Zoom In On Learning with a Document Camera!
description: I work at a Title 1 school in Charlotte, NC, where about 90% of our students receive free or reduced lunch. We also have a large population of English Language Learners. Regardless of their home life, my students deserve the best. They are eager and excited about learning and always strive for the best. In order for us to close the achievement gap my students are in need of resources in order to succeed at school. These scholars are the future, and I'm excited about being their teacher as they start on their journey of being life long learners. Your donations will provide scholars with the opportunity to experience and use new technology. A document camera would enhance scholars learning, because you are able to use it in all academic areas and provide students with a large visual. Students will be able to display their work as well as take a closer look at books. Math and science demonstrations can be seen up close for all students. Scholars would be focused and engaged in their learning with a document camera! A document camera would provide my scholars with access to 21st Century learning! Donations to our project will help improve our daily learning!
needStatement: My students need a document camera in order to view and share materials in a 21st century learning environment!

name: Making Learning Come Alive!
description: Last school year, this was the makeup of our students: American Indian 1.6%, Asian American 15.4%, African American 65.4%, Hispanic American 12.6%, Caucasian American 4.9%. This shows just how diverse our school is! The school I work at is a S.P.P.S. school and is very small. Last year we had around 230 students. As a school, we are working on growing it and keeping our wonderful families all the way to 5th grade! The Kindergartners and 1st graders come to school to learn! Very few are able to write sentences or create detailed pictures when they enter Kindergarten. By the end of the year, they should be writing multiple sentences with colorful elaborate pictures. Many of the students that attend my school do not have the materials at home to write with. They are missing paper, crayons, pencils, and makers. Let's give them materials to express their creativity! Donating to this project will help the students to be interested in learning! The materials I am requesting, allow the students to practice necessary skills in a fun way! All of the materials I am requesting about life cycles correspond to a specific area of study that the students will learn about. These materials will allow the students to dive deeper into dramatic play roles. For example, a student can become a doctor and use the MRI Scan to show the 'patient' specifically what is wrong with them. The other materials in the cart, will be used in 'have-tos' for the students to practice a specific skill that he/she needs more practice with. To learn more sight words the students will be able to play the sight word fishing game. To get better at phonemic awareness, which will help the student with his/her writing and reading, he/she can play the interactive Smartboard game. In addition, the number puzzle will allow the students to put numbers 0-30 in order. Being able to identify, write, and represent numbers 0-31 is a high priority learning target in Kindergarten. I am trying to make learning come alive in my classroom. I want student's to see school as a fun way to challenge their learning and enhance their skills. I want my students to become life long learners, who want to learn more!
needStatement: My students need exciting science, math, and literacy materials to help improve their skills and to keep them actively engaged.

name: Growth Mindset Books
description: What makes my classroom special? Well, it's the students and the community that I serve. My students are the type of kids which people may not expect much from. When I came to this school is had just received an F, which meant it was a failing school. In my classroom, at least half of my students were one to three grade levels behind. Coming from low socio-economic backgrounds they come to my classroom missing background knowledge and experiences. However, I teach my students to dream and aspire to be more than their current circumstances.I teach my students that no matter what kind of neighborhood you grow up in, they too can leave a great impact on the world. I grew up in the same neighborhood and came back after going to college to make a difference. Many of my students have difficulty focusing and sitting their seat. Brain research shoes that these types of students greatly benefit from alternate seating. This year in my classroom I plan on focusing on the idea of a'Growth Mindset'. Studies show that students who think they can learn something are far more likely to be successful that students who feel they can't. Many of my students suffer from low self esteem and are afraid to take risks. I am going to encourage a growth mindset in my students and the book that were chosen would help me motivate my students. I will spend more time this year talking about what my students CAN do rather than what they haven't learned how to do... YET! I will use these books as read aloud to frame my growth mindset lessons throughout the year. Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you are right. - Harry FordThe books will also be used to help increase literacy skills. I need new books for them to read in order to help them build vocabulary and begin reading on level or above. I will use the books as mentor books for reading and writing workshop, reading circles, and individual reading. New books will help prepare my students to be leaders and bridge the learning gap.to help keep my students excited about learning through reading.
needStatement: My students need growth mindset books for the beginning of the school year.

name: The Hunger for Books!
description: These students are full of ideas and imaginative feats they cannot complete alone. I want the classroom to capture their attention and help them be endlessly creative. The school has a Title 1 code that provides 80% free or reduced price lunch. Most of the students have never traveled outside of this small town and will most likely continue this generational trend. The involvement of parents grows increasingly difficult in this day and age. Students here face challenges unlike the average child and any comfort not afforded at home, I hope they discover at our school. This project is designed to fill the need for black and white print in the classroom. Along with age appropriate novels like 'Percy Jackson and The Lightning Thief' , 'Hatchet' , and others; our class will be diving into these worlds of fiction to analyze structures, characters, themes, and other English and Language Arts standards covered in sixth grade. Incredible journeys and eye-opening experiences are discovered through the process of reading great works of fiction. I hope to inspire students to discover a love of reading or to continue and deepen their love of something that is so important! The study of literature is something I care for immensely, and I hope to instill that same passion in my students.
needStatement: My students need a class set of the novel by Suzanne Collins, 'The Hunger Games'. We will be analyzing the novel, as well as others during this year!

name: Learning with Flexible Seating
description: My students are like no other. They want to be loved, accepted and grow. I want the best for them. I want to provide them with things that will help them grow as individuals and academically. Our school is located in a rural town in Mid-West MN. Over half of our students are on free or reduced meals. My classroom is filled with energetic, eager to learn, full of life first graders. Their bodies are made to keep moving. The kids in my classroom as shown me over and over again how important it is for them to keep moving to help them digest what they are learning! When their moving bodies and minds work together you get success! Everything I do in my classroom is based on research and best practices for my kids. Redesigning my classroom is not any different. I've found through my research that some of the immediate benefits of flexible seating which includes using Hokki stools, balance balls, and core discs reaps the benefits of burning more calories, using up excess energy, improving metabolism, increase motivation and engagement, creating a better oxygen flow to the brain, and improving core strength and overall posture. It's no surprise that physical activity is linked to higher academic performance, better health, and improved behavior. My goal is to have a classroom environment that is conducive to open collaboration, communication, creativity and critical thinking by providing them with a variety of flexible seating options. By redesigning my classroom and implementing flexible seating, it will increase student motivation, enhance their level of engagement and provide them with the responsibly to choose the best learning space for themselves.
needStatement: My students need stability balls, Hokki stools, core discs and yoga mats to enhance their learning by being able to move their bodies while engaging in learning.

name: Prairie Paintings
description: My delightful young scholars deserve rich and meaningful science and math projects, that are infused with art. We all work together in our small, rural elementary school so that our students may be successful achieving their academic, physical, social, and emotional goals. Our school has a 50% free and reduced lunch population, but our progress and goals attainment demonstrate that hard work and a school-wide positive learning environment can overcome obstacles such as poverty. 'Keep your love of nature, for that is the true way to understand art more and more.' Vincent van Gogh Our tight budget has little room for art projects that require specialized materials. The projects though are invaluable. My students rarely have the opportunity to work on art projects, but they are so engaging and important for their expression and educational experience at school. My students deserve these art opportunities because so many will not otherwise be exposed to them. My classroom has formed a partnership with Audubon Dakota and the US Fish and Wildlife Service in order to educate our students on the importance of our prairie lands. Together we work on nature-based learning projects that educate our students on prairie vegetation and wildlife, as well as prairie restoration. In particular, we have been focusing on the monarch butterfly habitats. While a lot of the projects and instruction occur in our school's nature area and the local state wildlife refuge, we also want to make connections back in the classroom. Art is the perfect way to connect the beauty of our prairie land with the expressive creations of my students. 'Great art picks up where nature ends.' Marc Chagall My students will use the art supplies, canvas boards and paint, in order to create nature-based artwork. They will paint butterflies, animals, wildflowers, or landscapes that reflect what they see in our special prairie lands. The artwork will be displayed and rotated in the school's hallways in order to educate the rest of the school (parents, staff, and students) of the beauty found in our local prairie lands. Together with Audubon Dakota, USFWS, and the generous donations from DonorsChoose.org supporters, my students will benefit from a perfect prairie partnership.
needStatement: My students need multiple canvas boards and acrylic paint in order to create nature-based masterpieces. The bright paints were also ordered so that students will have more color choices in order to enhance their creative works.

name: 'Rockin' 'At the Computer Lab- Busy Body, Busy Minds
description: With the upcoming school year, I am fortunate enough to be teaching a great group of fourth graders! This group of students comes from a small, rural school that houses approximately 300 K-6th graders. Most of these students come from a low-income socio-economic status home. Our school is a Title I school trying to provide the ever-changing resources needed to coordinate with ever-changing educational standards. These particular students are high-energy and have the ability to design and create wonderful things with their academic successes. The obstacle faced, however, is not having the resources needed to support their creativity. Teachers in our district work hard to think 'outside the box' to find ways to meet the students' needs the best we can, but the financial needs are greater than most teachers can work with.A common complaint I hear from my students at our class computer lab is how hard my chairs are. In the past year, my students and I have been working hard to build a classroom mini computer lab that we use during small group rotations. My students LOVE the lab, but find the chairs hard to sit in. This affects the overall learning environment which is the main reason for the lab in our classroom. My students have asked to a student-led project to write a grant for new seating, but they are too young to do this on their own. This project is an answer to their problem. As an adult, I too concentrate better when I can move, and my students need a way to do this without disrupting the whole class environment. By donating to this project, you will be putting flexible seating at our computer lab and allowing my students to 'rock' their way to learning.
needStatement: My students need 3 Zuma Rockers and a Hokki Stool to keep their bodies moving at our classroom computer lab.

name: Indoor Recess Make-Over! Equipment For Moving And Sharing.
description: My kindergarten classroom is full of energy and spirit! My five and six year old students bounce in each day full of excitement for what the day will bring. I teach in a small district that has one building that houses our 450 pre-K to grade twelve students. We are a truly a learning family! My kindergarten students love to move and I love to provide them with equipment and activities so they can develop their gross motor skills and learn to play cooperatively. We often have indoor recess during the winter months when the temperature outside is to cold for safe outdoor play. During a learning activity using recycled catalogs in the classroom, the children saw pictures of play equipment on the pages. They were so excited! They immediately made a list of things they could share at indoor recess and during choice time. I believe my students need intentional opportunities for physical development that will engage them for 60 minutes each day. Body awareness, balance, eye-hand coordination and the social and emotional growth that come with working with a partner and sharing are important skills for my kindergarten learners. We can accomplish this with equipment that challenges and engages them. Young children have so much energy that often adults wish they could bottle it! The equipment that our classroom is requesting for indoor recess will provide the children with ten stations for individual and partner play. By providing my students with these carefully selected learning tools, I can be intentional in fostering the development of physical skills like balance, body awareness and eye-hand coordination while they are engaged and working cooperatively. This equipment can be used daily to keep my students active. Some items can be used at recess and also in our classroom. The bean bags, balance beam, and hopscotch rug are versatile enough that they can be used in our classroom during choice time as well as at recess. The hula hoops, balls and jumpropes can be used inside or outside. Movement can be integrated into our curriculum in so many ways. The variety these items offer compared to what we have available to us now is super! They will be delighted to move and play! I can't wait!
needStatement: My students need a variety of indoor play equipment like the balance beam, jump ropes, hopscotch rug and balls to support their physical and social/emotional growth. They will learn teamwork and sharing as they play together.

name: Whistle While You Work!
description: I'm working with amazing families from one of the best areas in St. Paul. We serve an area with great diversity. Our school is one of several schools that offers free or reduced price lunch to 100% of our families. I am part of an amazing staff that is very dedicated to educating our families and ourselves. We are hard working and passionate about the families that we serve. Our school is the definition of a community school. We are also unique because we use a studio model. This means that we have multiple grade-levels in one studio space. A studio can hold up to four classrooms and our studios are growing faster than our district projected! Teaching kindergarteners can be an interesting art! This year I would like to work on incorporating more music and rhythm in our daily work!I was inspired by a coworker and my nephew to continue my learning. As luck would have it, they are both musicians. So, I am going to learn a few new instruments this year. I thought it would be a good thing to model to my students- learning never ends! We will be using the instruments to engage the students in letters, letter sounds, numbers, shapes, really almost anything can be enhanced with these new instruments.
needStatement: My students need to master the basic skills. I would like to add to our learning tools Oriental Table Gongs, Sand Blocks, Finger Cymbals and Rhythm Sticks!

name: Building Core Strength Builds Academic Success
description: My Title 1 school serves students in a lower socio-economic area. Many families do not have the means to provide supplies or educational support to their children. My students are eager to learn and deserve tools that will help them succeed. In a class meeting last year, my students indicated that paying attention was difficult sometimes and that balance balls force them to sit up and focus on the lesson. Having a class set of balance balls will help my students in getting the most out of their education. In a class meeting last year, my students reported that it was hard to sit in their seats during lessons. They would slouch and put their heads on the table because they got tired, which caused them not to learn the material. My students found a solution to inattentiveness and fatigue! Balance balls and backless balance ball chairs help students sit up straight and pay attention to the lesson being taught. Students will build core strength to help support their backs and enable them to sit up and pay attention to instruction. Overall academic success will also increase as a result of using the balls and chairs.
needStatement: My students need Gaiam backless balance ball chairs to help build core stability to increase attention span and academic success.

name: Sensory Items for Student Success!
description: Students who attend our school have all shown significant behavior issues in their previous school experiences. The vast majority of students in our school have emotional behavior disabilities (EBD) that have interfered with their success in traditional school settings. My students have also experienced significant challenges in their lives. Most of my students are Homeless and Highly Mobile (HHM). They experience instability in their home lives that contributes to their challenges at school. Despite these many challenges, my students are enthusiastic about school. They crave stability and want to be successful. Our program aims to create a safe and supportive community that teaches grade-level content alongside the social skills students need to be successful in school and in life. Students in my classroom need to wiggle and move, which can be difficult to do in a traditional classroom. Kids have asked for other places to work besides a traditional chair, and I have not had many other good options in the past. The items on this list will give students options and tools in order to maintain focus and be successful both in and out of the classroom. In the classroom, alternative seating options and pedal chairs will offer students ways to wiggle, bounce, and move while they learn and work. Fidgets will keep their hands moving and help them calm themselves. Weighted vests will help students calm and regulate themselves. Outside the classroom, new playground equipment will be used by students to take a break from the classroom and exercise their bodies. Students are constantly asking for ways to play outside, and new equipment will be very much appreciated! For my students, recess is also an important time to practice social skills and build relationships with peers. All of the items requested here will help me meet my goal of giving students opportunities to have successful and positive experiences in school.
needStatement: My students need various sensory items to help them focus in the classroom, and playground equipment to help them get their energy out in a positive way!

name: Yoga in the Classroom!!
description: My students are very special because not only are they overcoming living in a low-income/high poverty school district and neighborhood, but they deal with a wacky teacher with extremely high expectations. Despite the many challenges that they face on a day-to-day basis, they continue to put their best foot forward when they enter my classroom each day. My students are bright and full of wonder. When I plan my plan my lessons, I plan to spark their curiosity by exposing my students to new subjects and ideas. My students love to read and they love to see their reading progress through their reading levels each quarter. They also love to see their mathematics progress posted on the board after each math unit assessment. Their academic growth intrigues them and motivates them to always try their best and to keep an open mind when learning something new. I hope to continue to inspire our early learners to strive for academic excellence. My students are very excited to start the new school wide yoga program at our school however they are not as excited to lay on the hard classroom floor. They believe that these yoga mat will be a nice barrier between their school clothes that they do not want to get dirty everyday and the floor. Our school's yoga program requires 10 minutes of yoga each morning which is a lot of time on the floor especially when most parents don't wash uniforms daily. While yoga is a very exciting way to channel the excess student energy because of the climate of our classroom some students may not receive the full benefit. Our school does not have air conditioning which makes learning difficult, when you add the movement of 19-20 kids and a teacher it becomes unbearable. The air conditioning unit will assist with keeping the classroom cool and comfortable for everyone.
needStatement: My students need yoga mats for a school wide yoga program and an air conditioner to keep them cool because we do not have air conditioning in our school.

name: Bouncing into 1st Grade with Flexible Seating!
description: As a teacher in a Title I school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things simple and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. My students are creative, clever and very spontaneous. They like to move, they love to read, solve problems, sing and dance. They also love lots of positive attention. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their potential and growth while they are with me. I may not be able to control their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. By doing this in a creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our earliest learners to continue on a path of academic excellence. First graders are very active and social. They enjoy physical activity and have difficulty sitting still for long periods of time. They want to learn and work very hard, however many students have difficulty sitting and working. The students in my room have the flexibility to move around the room and work. I have seen student productivity and engagement increase when students are given non-traditional seating choices. The students have asked for more seating options, as we have very few choices in the classroom. This project would give all the students in the classroom an opportunity to choose from a variety of seating options. These new choices will promote flexibility and will also help their balance and coordination skills utilizing the yoga balls, wobble chairs and inflatable floor cushions. Students will also have a safe way to move their legs with the chair and desk bands. Thank you in advance for helping keep my students active by providing flexible seating options for optimal learning.
needStatement: My students need to be active. First graders have a hard time sitting still in a desk all day to learn. The wobble chair, cushions, balance balls and other multiple seating options will help the students stay active while being engaged in learning.

name: Healthy Minds Need to Move It, Move It!
description: What makes my students special? Resilience is the word that best summarizes my class. I teach at an economically disadvantaged school where approximately 90% of my students receive free/reduced lunch. In addition, many of my students are English Language Learners, and students with special needs. Despite these obstacles, they come to school with a curiosity, and love of learning that is unparalleled. Words cannot express the pride and love I have for each and every one of them. They are the true heroes. Student choice is at the heart of my teaching philosophy. Choice is what sets the passive learner apart from the active learner. My project will make a difference because it will offer my students the ability to move their bodies, to choose where they will the most successful learner. Currently, our class room is comprised of 24 desks and chairs...not fun! If my students want to venture off to read independently, they do so on a bare floor or place mats purchased from the Dollar Tree. Giving the opportunity to choose comfortable seating for independent reading will boost their love of learning and create the healthy mind/healthy body we all desire. The mats will be used for partner reading or lounge reading. The seats will also be used for reading, but will allow students the choice to sit anywhere in the classroom. The backs allow for support, without the need of a wall. In unison, these tools will provide my students the freedom to move about the classroom.
needStatement: My students need alternative seating choices such as mats, seats and a reading rug.

name: Speech on the Move!
description: My special education students have varying degrees of disabilities that impact their speech production, language processing and communication skills. They come to speech-language therapy in a very small group or individual setting in order to improve upon their skills so they can be better equipped in their classrooms. My students all learn differently through many modalities. Some are visual learners, while some are tactile or kinesthetic learners. While they all learn differently, they all love coming together in speech-language therapy for motivating activities that help them perform better in class and outside of school! My students have amazing willpower and strength as we are all working together to make a powerful comeback after Hurricane Sandy! We are from a Title 1 school in the heart of Rockaway Beach, Queens and were tremendously impacted by the storm. We are simultaneously rebuilding our homes and school for a better tomorrow! All of my students receive free or reduced-price lunch and many rely on our school to fulfill their nutritional needs. As we are a high poverty school, we do not receive any extra resources to meet the educational demand. At the end of each school year, my students and I reminisce about what were their favorite lessons and completed projects. Then, we discuss the future. We ask each other questions such as, what should we continue doing next year or what should we change? Almost all of my students said they learned and retained the most information when they were on the move! When my students found out we were moving classrooms for next year, at first they were upset. Then, they realized we have a door inside of our new classroom with direct access to the schoolyard! That is when they got excited! My students immediately began asking if we can have our 'speech on the move lessons' outdoors for the next school year. My students said they love when they can combine learning with being active! They will use playground balls so they can have a vocabulary word & definition toss and asking & answering questions toss. Sidewalk chalk will be used to recall and explain events and characters from a story by writing on the cement! The portable white board has wheels, so we can bring it outside and my students can look at the board for any previously written material such as directions or examples. They can even use it to record responses that they want to remember for when we come back inside. When we have outdoor lessons, my students will be more active which improves their overall physical fitness as well as the information they retain.
needStatement: My students need playground balls, sidewalk chalk, and a portable white board to have active outdoor lessons.

name: Hitting the Target with Kid Inspired Ideas for Fitness
description: We are an active group of tiny little 5 year olds and we are ready to learn. My students live in a very small, low-income based community. Most are given very few opportunities to venture far from their homes. Their community and their family are their whole world. I believe the old saying 'The World is Your Oyster', and that my young kindergarten students have the ability and the know-how to do anything or go anywhere their imagination may take them.I asked my kindergarten students today what type of equipment they thought we should request for our daily recess and activity time.... Oh boy did they have some inspiring ideas!Kick balls and jump ropes were the first words out of their mouths. But then one of my students said, 'A parachute Ms. C!' What? Oh wow! That was an inspiring idea for sure! Frisbees and horseshoes were also a few of the things on their wish list. Another student suggested we ask for snacks. Of course they are always asking me, 'What time can we eat snack?' In their young minds Physical Education and Snack Time are the most important parts of their day. So because the students asked, we have selected several different kinds of healthy choice snacks and bottled water. Our academic time is super important, but students also need to have fun! That is why they are so excited to have me submit this project for this recess equipment and healthy snacks. They are ready to have fun!
needStatement: My students need jump ropes, flying disks, catch-a-cups, rainbow parachutes, rhythm ribbons, soccer kick balls, 2 large storage baskets, assorted healthy snacks, and bottled water.

name: The Key to Success? Cultural and Family Engagement!
description: Students in my kindergarten classroom are amazing learners and relish experience with eyes brightened when exposed to new learning. We are a Title One and Language Academy School, which provides our community with a diverse group of kids with diverse life experience. Often, these kids are new to our country, have limited English, or limited resources. Their amazing life experience teaches me daily and I love being able to share with them educational experiences as well. My teaching philosophy centers on helping students learn content through many ways, including art. I find that engaging students in art, science, and math in a real way helps them find a passionate drive to learn. I am lucky to set these kids off on their road to education and am proud to have kids leave my walls loving to learn. Students in my classroom thrive when their classroom is a mirror to their own experience, lives, and culture. By engaging families in a welcoming way, using culturally relevant materials and activities, like games and books will be providing easy and comfortable communication tools, I hope to engage all students in my diverse classroom. Projects in this proposal will follow developmental ideals that start with self-identity for kids. Art, like the people-color project and multicultural people-cut outs project will help kids develop a self-concept in race, culture, and learning, that will set them up for success throughout their school year. This engaging and relevant set of projects will not only teach academic concepts, but help students connect their academic space to their home culture and identity. By using multicultural literature, that mirrors the students in my classroom, I can help students see themselves as learners - those who are represented in classroom materials and models. Finally, the guided reading sets chosen are culturally relevant to the population served at Como Park Elementary, and allows for students to read about kids like themselves each and every day, making the classroom an accessible and welcoming place. By providing engaging art, literature, and communication tools, I hope to promote a safe and welcoming classroom where students can thrive academically, socially, and culturally and where families feel welcome and safe to help their student achieve their personal, social, and academic potential.
needStatement: My students need culturally relevant literature, a family communication center, games, and other engaging activities. I want my classroom to features that support equity by creating an inviting space for families, promoting communication and family engagement, and providing racially relevant and educational literature and activities.

name: Let's Play
description: Our students are energetic, active learners. They attend a Title One school and their parents often struggle to buy supplies, uniforms, and provide lunch. They do try their best to send their children to school everyday so they can get a proper education, meals, and exercise and play in a safe environment. The students try hard at everything they do from in the classroom to on the playground, because they like school and feel safe at school. The teachers try equally as hard because we know they are our future and need dedicated educators who care about their success and well being. Our students love their physical education class and recess because they know it is a safe environment to play, make friends, and have healthy competitions. Our elementary school does not have organized sports after school and many of our students do not play on recreational leagues because their parents can't afford it. Our students have asked for the school to organize after school sports where the students learn the basics and have friendly competition. We have parents willing to coach but need soccerballs and footballs to play with. We need scooters, potato sacks, and a parachute to learn how to work as a team while having fun. When the equipment is not being used after school, students can use it during recess and in physical education class which will guarantee the students will get more than sixty minutes of exercise. They will be well on their way to a more healthy lifestyle.
needStatement: My students need playground balls, scooters, footballs, basketballs, soccerballs, and potato sacks to play team sports and learn how to play as a team.

name: Food For All: Outdoor Garden Project
description: I teach in a small rural farm community. While we are a rural community many of my students lack the background and the personal experience of growing their own food. My horticulture class this past year chose to focus on the farm to plate movement. My Agriculture/Personal Finance Program has students from various backgrounds and experiences. Our district services a large free and reduced lunch population, so many families lack the resources to help their child to experience and dream above what they see at home. In spite of the socio-economic level of our community, my students are excited to learn and improve their leadership abilities. We focus on S.T.E.M. (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) education and try to make all students career ready. Students in my horticulture class began discussing the problem of childhood obesity and the importance of eating nutrient dense foods. Students began brainstorming ways they could help with this problem. Our kid inspired idea is to begin an outdoor garden for fall and spring crops. Students in horticulture class will use watering equipment and GroMat heating mats to start plants in our school greenhouse. Students in agriculture classes use Mini cultivator/tiller, garden hoe's and rakes to prepare the seed bed, care for the garden and share in the produce. The wheelbarrow will be purchased with the intent of helping to move supplies and produce to and from the garden site. Students also liked the idea of inviting elementary students to share the harvest and allow elementary students to visit the garden, help harvest and sample some different nutrient dense foods. The purchase of the materials requested will help to make this dream a reality.
needStatement: My students need a Cultivator/Tiller and gardening equipment to help with our outdoor garden project. Students in my horticulture classes wanted to inspire other students to eat nutrient dense food.

name: Eye in the Sky: Fitness with Learnimg
description: I loop with my classes and we form a special bond being together for two years. We are more like family. My students live in a rural area where approximately 64% of students receive free or reduced lunch. Students are very intreagued by any type of technology, as several do not have technology or even Internet at home. Although the community as a whole is poor, it doesn't stop the support we receive from parents, community leaders, churches, businesses, individuals, and others. Education is TREASURED by all stakeholders. The students want to use the drone and fitbit to measure and compare and contrast distances measured by air and land. As a learning facilitator, I will guide students to create paths to a location, travel there using the fitbit and drone, record data, and convert measurement units. Students will reason why the steps and calories vary from person to person and with our backyard including native Indian mounds, students can calculate heart rate and change when climbing to higher elevations. With the drone students will be made aware of possible obstacles in the land travel plans. Students chose these materials because of their popularity and desire to engage in outdoor activities using current technology.
needStatement: My students need a drone and fitbit to explore many topics across the curriculum.

name: 'Fired' Up for Literacy!
description: Imagine coming to work every day with a captive audience, ready and excited to learn the many things you have in store for them. This is a description of my class of first graders. While I work at a Title I school with a high poverty rate, the dreams of my students are just as big as those of any other child. This does not diminish, however, some of the obstacles they face when they leave the four walls of our school. It is my hope to provide them with experiences and knowledge that will empower them beyond our classroom and instill in them the confidence and desire to be their best in all they do. In this technological age, I am always looking for new and inventive ways to keep my students motivated and engaged in their learning. With the achievement demands so great in 1st grade, it is imperative that students have a strong foundation in phonemic awareness and phonics. Without these skills, they are at a disadvantage when learning to read and process information. Throughout the day, students rotate through various independent learning stations to reinforce literacy skills and to connect their learning through authentic practice. Through the use of Amazon Fires, I feel the students would be excited about practicing skills they have learned in a different way. Students would have access to numerous apps and activities geared towards strengthening their skills in phonemic awareness, phonics, and reading. In addition to this, exposing students to Listen & Learn Phonemic Awareness activities and Vocabulary Folder Games enables them to learn by doing. These opportunities would be invaluable to my students. With your donation to this project, you are investing in the success of my students and ultimately improving the quality of their educational experiences. By putting the power of technology and real-world applications in their hands, students will take ownership of their learning.
needStatement: My students need 3 Amazon Fires with cases, a Listen & Learn Phonemic Awareness Activity Program, and a Vocabulary Folder Game Library to strengthen their skills in reading and vocabulary.

name: Flexible Seating for Flexible Learning
description: I have had the chance in getting some of the best students in my area and many more to come. My students challenge me as a new teacher as well as challenging themselves. I work at a 96.4% free and reduced lunch school. While 97% of students are second language learners. They continue to thrive for excellence. They excel in what they put their mind towards. These kids come from a home where their parents are working in the fields all day long or they are only seeing them at dinner time. My students continue to ask what they can do to be better learners. I have always told them to continue to ask questions and they will succeed. A small handful of students come into my classroom at grade level while a majority are still at Kindergarten or Preschool level. We work together and by the end of the year, they are above, on, or slightly below grade level. It's a huge accomplishment. All because they work hard and ask questions. My students have a love for learning. Yet sitting in the same chair or in the same spot on the carpet makes it boring for my students. My students get antsy and are always wanting to walk around when it's work time. I had a conversation with my students and they gave me a list of things that would benefit them to continue to work, learn, experience but also to stay fit. The Stability Ball, Rocker Board as well as the Kore Teen Active Chair are the top tools I have found that can benefit my students love of learning as well as keeping them focused on the task at hand.
needStatement: My students need the stability ball, rocker board and the Active Chair to build posture, balance and focus while having fun doing work.

name: Track and Snack
description: My students are from a very low income neighborhood. They have worked very hard to overcome some unbelievable obstacles, even in their short six or seven years on Earth. They deserve the absolute best education. These kids are truly deserving of all of the opportunities in the world. In my classroom, we work hard to create big goals that will help them reach their full potential. No matter what may come their way, we persevere and teach resilience along the way. During the school year, a consistent problem in my classroom was a lack of healthy snack options. Many of my students would ask for healthy snacks, however, we didn't have those readily available. As a class, we brainstormed some ways to make healthy snack choices. My first graders thought of alternative choices to make during snack time, such as having pretzels, dried fruit, granola bars, and veggie sticks. Anytime I could, I would bring these in for my students to sample. They are so interested in pursuing a healthy lifestyle! Alongside healthy snacking, my students are asking for fitness trackers to make sure they are moving all day long. My students love competition and have asked me for ways to help them keep up with their movements. They are asking for LeapFrog fitness trackers to help them make smart choices throughout the day. These trackers will give them personal challenges, while also serving as a way to challenge the whole class.
needStatement: My students need fitness trackers to increase movement and healthy snacks to improve their nutrition!

name: Indoor Recess Games: An Opportunity for Social and Emotional Learning
description: Our primary school is a Title I campus located in west Dallas, TX. Our homerooms each have a college that they represent and this year, we are Iowa State University and Clark Atlanta University! Our school is still very young and lacking some academic resources that the scholars need to truly develop as scientists and mathematicians. Iowa State Cyclones are bursting with energy to learn! They are highly inquisitive and eager to share their mathematical and scientific thinking. They love any chance for inquiry-based learning, where they can discover connections for themselves. Many scholars are English language learners, and having concrete and visual representations for different concepts in math and science will help them develop their academic vocabulary. Due to the size of my campus playground, my students are not able to have outdoor recess every day. They alternate having indoor recess, but we don't currently have the resources to make this engaging to the scholars. With these games, students will actually enjoy their indoor recess. As a bonus, they will further develop their social and emotional learning by practicing team work and sportsmanship. Most of the games require logic skills as well. One of our goals is to the develop each scholar as a whole being, and the development of social and emotional skills is critical to this. Many of the games also have underlying academic themes as well. Because of the limited time of recess, the games selected - such as Blokus, No Thanks, and Qwixx - can be played in twenty minutes or less.
needStatement: My students need quality indoor recess games that will help them develop interpersonal skills, such as Checkers, Blokus, Connect Four and Qwixx.

name: Busy Brains and Bodies
description: Welcome to 2nd grade- where the students are always active! Our brains are busy and our bodies are always moving. Our school is a safe place for all of us to take chances and have our needs met. The students in our school come from various countries around the world; each bringing our unique personalities, cultures, and learning styles into the classroom. Something we all have in common is our eagerness to learn and excitement to absorb all the new information that is presented to us on a daily basis. The Hokki Stools will be used by all of us in the room at different times during the day. They will be placed at what we call our Brain Table. When we come to this table we bring our brains and are ready to learn new and exciting things. These stools will keep our bodies moving while we are learning to read, and while working together in small groups; practicing 2nd grade skills in other subject areas. Our teacher understands that our busy bodies need to move and by using these stools at the Brain Table both our brains and bodies will grow.
needStatement: My students need Hokki Stools to keep our brains and bodies busy.

name: Active Seating For 2nd Grade Classroom
description: I have 26 lively and energetic second grade students this year. They love to learn and work together toward a common goal. Each one of them brings something unique to the table. They truly are a special bunch of kids that I will be sad to see move on at the end of the year. My students really enjoy being active in the classroom. I try to incorporate movement into as many lessons as possible. They are a very kind and respectful group that look out for each other. My students have told me multiple times each day how hard it is to sit still and work in a hard plastic chair. When I told them about this opportunity they were inspired to help me get the resources we need for our classroom. In this case my class thought that yoga balls in place of chairs would be the perfect solution. Having yoga balls would give my students the chance to be active for the many hours each day they are expected to do classwork in their seat. My students have talked a lot about it being hard to sit still each day. I think the yoga balls are a perfect solution to our problem. It allows the child to move and fidget but still get work done and focus on the task at hand.
needStatement: My students need kids yoga balls to use in place of chairs.

name: Fitbit Challenge
description: My students will change the world for the better. They are innovative, loving, generous, kind, and are very grateful for all of the challenges and blessings that life brings. These kids inspire our entire school! Teachers stop by to compliment the amount of collaboration and innovation that occurs due to their willingness to learn. They always want to know more and the result of their growth every day is incredible! My students bridge the gap that diversity can create. Our city is one of low income and high poverty. All of my students face challenges both in and out of our classroom. Because of this, I feel that one of the most important aspects of my job is providing them with a safe and loving environment where they can grow as learners.I am trying to make better choices and teach my students healthier lifestyles. Fitbits are being worn by the 6-8th grade students and most of the teachers. My students see that and know they are working to make good choices. Now, I want my students to do the same. My students want Fitbits to use during the week to see how much they are exercising compared to their friends by using the Apple Mini. We are going to record each students progress and see how they are meeting their goals. We will use their data and analyse what we see. We are going to do a challenge called Fitbit Friends and challenge all those wearing Fitbits at our school. Our goal is everyone in our class gets a Fitbit. Help us by starting off with 5.
needStatement: My students need Fitbits and an Apple mini to monitor their exercise.

name: Hokki Stools for Learning!
description: My 1st grade students come from a variety of homes. I have English language learners, special Ed students, and a majority of my students qualify for free and reduced lunches! But even while facing all of these challenges, my students love to learn. They love challenges, even though they may not easily conquer them. Our class believes in a growth mindset and realize that mistakes are the best way to learn. These hard workers are always ready to take on another challenge. Some of my students came to me and asked if I had Hokki Stools for them to use. These students told me that they used them last year in Kindergarten and they really felt like they helped them to do a better job of paying attention. I would love to be able to accommodate these students who are so in tune with their learning. As a group, my class has decided that we would like to try some alternative seating, and these chairs will help us to implement that project. The kids are excited about trying the new seating options and deciding which one works best for them.
needStatement: My students need 8 Hokki Stools to help them have the ability to move while still learning.

name: We Want to Move It, Move It!
description: Smiling faces greet me each morning with great anticipation of what the day holds. The students here are eager to learn each day. I teach in a Title 1 school in Nebraska. 55% of our students participate in the free and reduced lunch program. We also have a backpack program to assist the kids in meeting their needs over the weekend. We have 13% of our students entering our school that do not speak English as their first language. Our students are hard working and amaze me with their excitement for learning.I borrowed a Hokki stool from another teacher for a day. All of my students had a chance to use the stool throughout the day. The kids loved it! They were quite disappointed the following day when it was no longer available. My class informed me that they all wanted them and we should get Hokki stools for everyone. They liked being able to move around on the stool while they workedThe Hokki stools allow the kids to move while they are sitting and working. This engages their core muscles. It allows the kids that need to move to do so without distracting the class. The Hokki stools also get the more sedentary students moving as you really can't help but move. They are fun to sit on! These stools help the students that are constant movers focus more on their learning as their energy is channeled into the rocking motion of the Hokki stool. The Alphabetter stand-up desk will provide opportunities for kids to stand and do their work. They can burn more calories and continue to move without distracting the rest of the class. All of these items will get my students moving more which we all know is important for healthy bodies and healthy minds!
needStatement: My students need five Hokki stools and an Alphabetter Stand-Up desk with swinging footrest bar so they can continue to move while they work.

name: Staying Active - Even Sitting!
description: My students love to be active learners! They are very inquisitive students who want to know the ins and outs of everything they interact with! I picked my students up today to begin class, and they each had something they just couldn't wait to share with me ranging from how excited they were to make ice cream today (a hands-on project that turned liquid into a solid!) to how a big brother helped one student with her homework last night. Each student was so excited to be at school. Sometimes this excitement makes me forget the environments that most of my students survive in while they are not at the school building. Many students sleep on couches or share mattresses or even air mattresses, and some students have no help with homework at home because mom works overnights in order to ensure they have a safe place to live. These families are struggling, but my students still put on smiling faces each and every day when they walk into my classroom!My students are always excited to be moving and bouncing! At the end of last school year, I brought in an exercise ball to use as my chair during small group instruction. My students thought it was the coolest thing! They continuously asked to sit on it to do their own work. So I am asking for these ball chairs as inspired by my students last year so they can stay active (moving and grooving) even while sitting! Keeping active is always a goal in my class, if your body is active your mind is as well! This would be an additional way for my students to keep both their bodies and minds constantly moving!
needStatement: My students need 6 ball chairs (2 Zenergy chairs and 4 Runtz chairs)!

name: Balancing Minds and Bodies
description: My class starts every day with the promise, 'Let's make it a great day!' They enter the room excited to learn. They are a group of students who have embraced the idea of being a community of learners who are always there for each other. They are full of wonder. Throughout the school year I watch them develop their ability to delve into a task and problem solve. Our school is built on the idea of community. We are an ELL center based school and have a high level of diversity which is embraced by staff, students, and the entire community. We are also a Title I School that has 72% of students on free and reduced cost lunch. We do not let these things define us, rather we all work harder to overcome any obstacles that the students face that we cannot change. Students and staff give 100%.My class is a Special Education push-in classroom model. I have several students who have ADHD, and fidgets and movement work well for them. Several studies have been done showing the benefits of stability/balance/therapy balls being used in the classroom. Mayo clinic as well as the American Journal of Occupational Therapy conclude that in students with ADHD, sitting on therapy balls improved behavior and legible word productivity. Students using ball chairs were able to sit, focus and write more words clearly. My students have requested fidgets and options for flexible seating to help them stay on task and to strengthen their core. One option that they suggested were balance ball chairs. Ball chairs channel their physical energy in a positive way, allowing them to focus on their work more completely and reach their full potential as learners all while helping to improve their core muscles and posture. These benefits have been shown in all students, not just those with special needs. The strengthening bands will let my students 'stretch' themselves a little further and will be used for fidgets as well as brain breaks.
