The combination of balance ball chairs and strengthening bands will allow students the opportunity to get in more than 60 minutes of exercise per day making them happier, healthier learners!
needStatement: My students need balance ball chairs and resistance bands to help them exercise their bodies as well as their minds.

name: ABCSchool Is The Best Place For Us To Be!
description: Do you know how amazing first graders are?! They are full of energy and enthusiasm! They are excited to read and want to do challenging math problems! They cannot wait to explore our next science unit or participate in our community building activities! Over 75% of my students are living in poverty. Most are from single parent homes. They come from culturally diverse backgrounds. Many speak a different language at home. One thing they all have in common - they are eager to learn and love coming to school! For the majority of my students, school is their most stable environment. My students deserve to walk into a classroom that is inviting and safe. Currently, my classroom rug is fraying at the edges and has no cushion from the hard tile floor. We spend at least fifty percent of our day utilizing our carpet space. The book boxes that I have bought with my own money in the past are broken with sharp, jagged edges. Your generous donation can give my students the materials they need to learn so they can feel a sense of pride and belonging in our classroom.
needStatement: My students need a comfortable, clean carpet to sit on during read alouds, community building activities, and group work assignments. They need functional book boxes to store and carry individual books, and classroom library books.

name: Bouncing, Moving, and Learning STEM
description: My students are 5 and 6 years old and love to be on the move all day long. They come from a wide variety of backgrounds but they are all full of energy and ready to learn. Our school motto is to show PRIDE in everything we do and my kids always try their best. I teach at a STEM school and my students are ready to explore and learn new things through inquiry and movement each day. Some of my students are in school for the first time and they are all so full of energy. As their teacher, I love to take that energy and direct it into meaningful learning activities instead of making them sit still all day. My students will use wobble chairs and stability balls to help them stay focused and do their best work during small groups, learning stations, and independent work time. My students are always full of energy and I would love for them to have a productive outlet for that energy. I currently have one stability ball and my students have said they would love to have more of them in our classroom. I also believe that these alternative seats have a very positive impact on students who might struggle with behavior problems. A Leap TV is greatly requested by my students and I agree with them that it would be a great addition to our classroom because we are a STEM school that also has a large focus on physical fitness. We would be able to use the Leap TV on our interactive whiteboard to reinforce our learning objectives during learning stations and indoor recess.
needStatement: My students need wobble chairs, stability balls, and a leap TV to incorporate interactive learning and movement during learning stations and indoor recess.

name: Growing and Eating Healthy Vegetables
description: Our school is in a Title I district. All of our students automatically qualify for free and reduced-price lunch due to the economic status of our community. Many of our parents are employed in blue collar fields where paychecks can be small or sporadic. For some, English is their second language, and some have special needs. With that being said, they all love to come to school and want to learn. They deserve all the resources we can give them. My students are inspired to create a classroom garden filled with delicious and healthy vegetables. Just outside our classroom door there is plenty of room to build a garden. To do this, my students will need Garden Beds, gardening tools, and soil. If my project is funded, students will be learning how to become gardeners. They will begin by preparing the soil. Students will go through the process of getting rid of unwanted weeds. Each group of students will be assigned a vegetable. They must then research the vegetable to insure the best development, such as the amount of water needed. They will then use the tools to plant the seeds in the starter planters. The planters will then be planted in our garden beds. Throughout the school year, students will be responsible for their vegetable by weeding the garden and watering the plants. 'To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.' ~ Audrey Hepburn. Once the vegetables are grown, students will be able to enjoy a healthy snack. My goal is for this project to not only be 'fun', but to create a healthy eating mindset. Students will value all their hard work and will be more inclined to sample some vegetables. This project will provide some students with some healthy alternatives for snacks. I'm also asking for some fitness items for my students to use at recess like the balance boards and the alphabet bowling. These items will get my students moving.
needStatement: My students need garden beds and garden tools to plant and eat healthy. They also need balance boards to keep them active during the day.

name: Wobble Chairs to Increase Engagement
description: My students come to school every day excited to find out where their learning will take them for the day. My students enter our classroom filled with wonder and a sense of security. We meet each challenge with determination and a can-do attitude. My students know that the phrases 'I can't' and 'that's easy' are not accepted in our classroom. We are a learning community that grows together every day. I teach a group of 23 amazing fourth and fifth graders that come from diverse cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds. I teach at a Title I school in rural east central Minnesota where over 60% of our students receive free breakfast and lunch. I can only imagine the struggles many of my students face on a daily basis, but these students are the ones that need me the most. My students know that I am here for them and care about their whole being not just how well they have their multiplication facts memorized. The determination that my students have to succeed is empowering and I want to do everything I can to make them reach their goals. The students in my classroom come from a variety of backgrounds. Many of my students are not accustomed to having to sit still and really struggle when trying to focus. The students are often asking to get up and move around the room. I have talked with my students about alternative seating options and they requested these wobble chairs. I would like to create a classroom with flexible seating options where the students can choose a spot that meets their needs. Wobble chairs will give my active students an outlet to put their energy. Providing students with alternative seating and the ability to move while learning will increase their engagement and their learning. My students are excited for the opportunity to create a warm learning environment where all of their needs are met. These wobble chairs will create a learning station for my active students.
needStatement: My students need these wobble chairs to help them become more engaged in the learning that is taking place in the classroom.

name: Active Learning!
description: My school is located in Northern Minnesota. We have a very diverse population of students. Their diversity is cultural, economic, as well as academic. Just under half of my students come from low income families. No matter where they come from my students still come into class everyday eager and ready to learn. I strive to promote life long learning in my students and overall well-being. We do a variety of academic and movement activities throughout the day to balance our time with sitting and moving. We are requesting some equipment to help provide additional physical activity throughout the day. After seeing Wobble Chairs and balance discs in other classrooms my students have asked to try them. These stools and discs are ergonomic and they allow for movement while still being engaged in the academic activity. Living in Minnesota we often have indoor recess during the winter due to the cold weather. The students have asked for and need things to get their physical activity when they can not get outside. Many students do not get enough physical activity during the day and these discs and stools are an easy way to build balance and core strength all while working on their academic activity! The exercise dice, and pedal exerciser are great for quick brain breaks as well as getting additional movement. Physical movement promotes a healthy body and a healthy mind. Balance discs and Wobble Chairs promote good posture while sitting. This not only enhances core muscles but it also allows the lungs to work properly providing more oxygen to the brain.
needStatement: My students need wobble chairs, balance boards and a folding cycle to be more physically active throughout the day.

name: Wiggle... Wobble...
description: I have 30 students in the ICT classroom setting. Because of the make up of my school along with the classroom setting, I have a mix of English Language Learners, students who will be receiving services such as speech therapy, occupational therapy and physical therapy. First grade is one of the most crucial years for children where they begin building their foundational skills, especially in reading, writing, and math. One third of my school's population are English Language Learners, so not only do they need to learn the content and build their foundational skills, but they also need to acquire the language to help them meet the standards.I am trying to build in more options for a flexible seating classroom. We are slowly building in different options, such as sitting on the floor (with a lowered table), a standing option (with a raised table), some cushions, and two yoga balls. These wobble chairs will provide a seating option in the classroom and will help them stay focus when learning and working. Being such young ones, they will need opportunities to get out their wiggles and energy throughout the day, other than the Physical Education and recess times that they have. I know that that students will love to have another option in the classroom.
needStatement: My students need wobble chairs to help them stay focus as they work.

name: Who Can Learn on an Empty Stomach?
description: Do you remember recess as a child? We played games like kickball and 4-square at school and then went home and played outside for hours. My class is made up of self-contained deaf and hard-of-hearing students ranging from third to fifth grade. Like many kids today, they spend more time playing on their electronic devices than being physically active. Most of my students communicate through sign language so their hands are in constant motion. If only the rest of their bodies could keep up with their hands. We are a high poverty, public school in a rural area of Florida. My students often get on the bus as early as 6:30am and many times come to school hungry. We don't eat lunch until 12:30pm. I don't know about you, but I can't concentrate when I'm hungry. I often have kids asking me for food. I offer a snack time, but again, they often don't have one or if they do, it's not a healthy option. I was trying to provide microwave popcorn everyday because it's cheap, but I've learned that it is not a super healthy option either. I've asked my students what they would prefer for snacks and they said that they love granola bars, cereal bars, and gummy fruit snacks. I try to buy them myself when they are on sale, but just cannot do that for them everyday. My students also need to be more active when we go outside for recess. Many times they just stand around and when I ask them why, they say that there is nothing to play with. They have asked for balls and other fun playground toys that they can choose from. Having a variety of playground toys will inspire them to be more active and take advantage of that time. My goal is to inspire them to be active at home as well so letting them borrow some toys might help them get in that needed 60 minutes a day of activity.
needStatement: My students need playground toys and healthy snacks to help them be active and focus. This project will allow me to provide a daily healthy snack to every student for almost the entire school year.

name: Active Seating Helps Student Engagement
description: My 2nd grade students (7 and 8 year-olds) attend a Title I school with over 85% free or reduced lunches. This Title I school serves a neighborhood that consists of low socioeconomic students and a diversity of family backgrounds. There is an average of 25 students in the class. The students in this particular classroom have varied abilities from gifted and English Language Learners to special education. Students vary in their learning styles from auditory, visual to kinesthetic. Learning is impacted for students with special needs who require additional supports. Active seating will help my 2nd grade students to stay engaged in learning by providing some wiggle room to move in their seats. As content grows more demanding for students, I have noticed an increased need from students for more movement. These Hokki stools allow students to stay seated while they rock back and forth (subtle movements) assisting their need to move during those longer necessary periods of teaching time. The Hokki stools will be used for students who struggle with impulsivity and focus. They will be used to support self-regulation to stay focused and complete their learning tasks. I hope they will provide a calm and supportive environment in my classroom.
needStatement: My students need Hokki stools to concentrate and keep them engaged in learning throughout the school day.

name: They Need to Move It, Move It!
description: My lovely third graders may come from a low-income community, but they are rich in heart. They love school and are eager to learn. My class is a wonderfully diverse group of Native American, White, Hmong, Mexican, and Black students. Many of these students come from non-English speaking homes (Spanish and Hmong) and are working hard to learn two languages. We are a very happy family in my classroom and have grown close because of this diversity. My students are my kids. I have high standards and they come ready to meet them. They bring joy and courage with them. They persevere and challenge me to be my best because they deserve it. My students have often complained that sitting at their desks all day is tiresome and I completely agree! They have asked for extra recess. They have asked for movement breaks. When I asked them what would help them move and still focus enough to learn, they wanted flexible seating. We brainstormed together what that would look like. They came up with the idea of balance balls and wobble chairs. They believe if they can move, they will be more focused. Knowing that 25 balance balls and wobble chairs was a lot to ask, they agreed to share and to take turns. With the added 20 wobble cushions, every child will have access to movement while they learn. They are excited to move more and learn more. I'm excited to get them more active in the classroom and see them more focused on their work.
needStatement: My students need movement balance balls, wobble chairs and cushions will help keep them moving and focused.

name: Bringing Fresh Vegetables to a STEM Classroom
description: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics are an ever-increasing presence in our world. Most of of my students have not had the opportunity to explore these disciplines in an engaging manner. I want to bring more STEM into our Title I Middle School. My students come from a low-income Hispanic community and attend a Title I Middle School. My students fight every day to learn and better themselves and their community. I have highly motivated and hardworking students that are determined to leave their mark on the world. I am extremely proud to work with these students, and I expect great things out of them. I hope that DonorsChoose.org will help me support their education. Last year, my students began taking an interest in horticulture. We have completed an outside butterfly garden and successfully set up a very small aquaponics set-up in the classroom. The students, however, had to work in very large groups, and there was not enough plant material grown to do anything meaningful with it. The students suggested to me this summer that it would be a more meaningful experience for them if we were able to grow enough produce that we could actually consume it afterwards. I have heard of so many positive experiences from teachers over the years that have been able to promote good nutrition habits simply by allowing the students to be involved in the growing process themselves. I am excited to be able to give my students this opportunity. As this is a STEM class, I have also added an element of experimental design to this project. By requesting standard and LED grow lights, I am now able to allow students to compare growth rates and biomass of their plants along the way and seamlessly integrate STEM and nutrition education. I am excited to share this unique opportunity with my students. My project is requesting an LED grow light and a standard fluorescent grow light. My students asked me, 'Which light will work better for growing the plants?' and I responded with, 'Let's find out!' Additionally I have requested seeds, seed start trays, and small hand tools so that all of my students can get involved in growing fresh vegetables.
needStatement: My students need grow lights and gardening supplies to start growing vegetables in the classroom as part of the curriculum.

name: Stretch Out Our Wiggles
description: I get to teach a great group of students. They are independent problem solvers who love to have fun. In our classroom, students spend the year learning how to take charge of their learning and work to feel responsible for themselves and for their classmates. Our students are excited and curious about the world and what they can do to make it a better place. They love hands-on learning and love taking their learning out into the community through service learning projects and project based learning. One of our most popular teachers this past school year was a teacher who did yoga with small groups of students. This teacher worked to share calming skills with students who struggled to self-regulate. Students who weren't chosen to go were very jealous of these students. In order to share yoga with more and more students, several teachers attended Yoga Calm training this summer. This training will allow these teachers to share yoga with many different classrooms and students. Whole class yoga will give students a shared language to add movement throughout the day so students can stay energized to learn. The materials that we are requesting are materials that would travel throughout the building and be shared with many classrooms. The books and cards would be used as resources to help introduce yoga to students. The mats offer a way to entice students and excite them to learn movement that might be new or scary. Our students will be excited for our new yoga adventure this year!
needStatement: My students need yoga cards, yoga mats, and yoga themed picture books for mindfulness practice.

name: Moving to Learn!
description: My children are a diversified, lively group of urban students. They live in a high poverty, high crime area. All of my class qualify for free breakfast and lunch. Many come from single family homes. Life for these little ones is not always easy but they have an inner-strength that is amazing! Life is not always easy for my students. At home, many of them, are given adult responsibilities even though they are only 6 or 7 years old. They have to watch and care for younger siblings, nieces, and nephews. They may have to get dinner on their own because no adult in the house steps up to the task. They are completely responsible for their homework because no one will help them. It is natural for a child to be on the move! A hard chair is just not what a 6 year old needs or wants to be comfortable! My students are usually squirming and adjusting in their seats. The students are always looking to move to a seat that is more interesting and comfortable to do their work. Hokki stools and Wobble chairs will enable them to do exactly what they have been asking to do! These chairs will enable them to keep moving throughout the day, to move and burn energy but still have a personal space to complete their work.
needStatement: My students need Hokki stools, Wobble chairs, and Bouncy Bands to help them focus and burn energy!

name: Good Fit Books Create Healthy Minds!
description: What makes my students special? Resilience is the word that best summarizes my class. I teach at an economically disadvantaged school where approximately 90% of my students receive free/reduced lunch. In addition, many of my students are English Language Learners, and students with special needs. Despite these obstacles, they come to school with a curiosity, and love of learning that is unparalleled. To that end, my goal is to create a classroom that is deserving of them; a place where they feel safe, supported and challenged to go the beyond our four walls and into a world that wants them to succeed. My students need 10 sets of leveled books. As a child, books were my best friends... my partners in adventure. This is what I want for my students. Unfortunately, they don't have an abundance of high interest, leveled books at their disposal. They must rely on our curriculum or books that were donated to our class library. My goal this year is to be able to provide as much opportunity for my students to fall in love with reading as possible. An inviting and well-stocked classroom library has the capability of turning the most reluctant reader into a book lover. Adding new, high-interest titles will help reach my goal of having a classroom library that my students are excited to explore and fall in love with.
needStatement: My students need high interest leveled readers for their 'good fit' book boxes.

name: Physically Active While Academically Focused
description: My students are great! They love to learn and stay active. The students come from areas that do not always allow for programs and clubs, so to help keep them active in the classroom, while also challenging them in the classroom, these items are valuable. Our district is very diverse; in fact, my particular school is the most diverse elementary school in Oakland County, and would benefit from exercise equipment to keep them challenged mentally and physically. My kids attack work and projects vigorously, and will remain better focused with the exercise equipment. My students have long asked for creative ways to exercise at no expense to their learning. They have said, 'It is too long to sit in my desk. Can we move around as long as we still do our Math?' One even said, 'At my old school the teacher let us bounce and wiggle on cushions and a big rubber band while we did our work.' So, they inspired both the investigation into what these items were and this request for items to help the kids sustain focus in the classroom while also staying physically active. Because of our diversity and clientele, the students often can lose focus and let their minds wander. The wobble cushions will engage their core muscles so they exercise while concentrating on their work. The bouncy bands also allow the kids to exercise their feet and legs and stay active while doing desk work. The exercise equipment will be vital to their learning. The students will easily surpass sixty minutes a day of exercise, physically increasing blood flow and cardio as they complete their class work. My especially diverse student population needs to be challenged in the classroom while staying physically active. In doing both at the same time, they will have better attention, learn valuable information, and retain information better throughout the day. This will help the students not only in the classroom, but also at home and in the community. The students will inspire and challenge each other to be more fit, and as they become more fit, their energy and enthusiasm will increase as staff members work with them on the playground and in extra curricular sport activities. They will also challenge each other peer to peer in competition to complete their class work while using the exercise equipment. This combination of mind and body is vital for all kids, but especially those in a challenging community and environment.
needStatement: My students need stability cushions and Bouncy Bands to help keep the kids active and keep them in good shape while learning.

name: Fitness on Your Mark, Get Set, Go!
description: 'Free the child's potential, and you will transform him into the world.' - Maria Montessori Transforming children is par for the course in the Title I, K to 5 school where I teach physical education. We have one of the largest enrollments of English as a New Language Learners in any elementary school in our city. The challenges these kids face are amazing. Many are learning to speak English for the first time, even as they continue to develop and master their native tongues at home. There are over a dozen languages and dialects represented in our school. This, along with the long hours of school and after school program enrollments, severely limit time available for social interactions and the formation of meaningful friendships outside of school. In every grade, there are students with special needs and all of the children are working hard to meet our newly adopted and rigorous Common Core-based curriculum. What is more amazing than all of this, however, is the dedication these students show day in and day out as they strive to reach all of their personal, social, and academic goals. Physical Education class time is always one of the highlights of my students' day. These fun-filled, high energy periods represent uninterrupted gross motor play and opportunities for moving big muscles. With all the sitting around these kids do, they need to challenge themselves with as many movement opportunities as possible. My students love to play challenging games with simple rules. With limited English proficiency, we have to keep our games simple. But simple can be lots of fun. These balls, pop up hampers, and pinnies will let us play fun pursuit games with toss to target practice. The nature of these games will keep these kids moving around and happily engaged in cardio aerobic activity. By adding the portable PA system to our equipment, we will be able to take our physical fitness practice outdoors and on the road. My students are always asking to play games with their families. This year, we are hoping to host our first family field day. The portable PA system will allow us to guide our students and their families through fun and exciting field day activities and still be able to hear important directions outside. Finally, the printer ink will allow us to print certificates to award these kids for their outstanding work in PE. By purchasing these balls, pop up hampers, pinnies, portable PA system, and printer ink, you will be helping to ensure that these students continue to develop a healthy outlook and set of practices for physical fitness.
needStatement: My students need a portable PA system, balls, pop up hamper targets, pinnies, and printer ink.

name: Let's Get Organized!
description: This year marks the start of my fourth year teaching 1st graders! The majority of my students speak Spanish as their first language, but in my classroom, they are learning to read and write in English. This is a very difficult year for them. To make it even trickier, their parents also speak Spanish. When my students go home and do homework or reading, they don't always have the same support that my English speaking families have. The parents want to help their children, but do not know the language, and it creates a barrier for their learning. My Spanish speaking students have to work twice as hard to learn to read and write in English. When they are with me, I want to make sure that I do my best to provide all of the proper tools for success. My families work hard, and want what's best for the children, but our building is 93% free and reduced lunch and some of our families struggle sending their with all of the necessary supplies. I want to make sure everyone starts the year with the right equipment. In our building this year, each of our 500 elementary students will be given iPads to help increase academic achievement and move towards a paperless environment. I work with 1st graders, and we will also be getting rid of desks. It is going to be a very exciting adventure! In my three years with first graders, I have realized the importance of staying organized for myself, as well as my first graders. All of the changes in the building are going to require a lot of extra focus on organization in order to create smooth transitions and allow easy access to the proper equipment for each subject area. All of the supplies in my room will need a place, and each of these organizers will help me implement that. In the past, supples were kept in desks and pencil boxes, but this year, we will build a community of sharing, and all of our supplies will be compiled and put into community bins.
needStatement: My students need to get organized! These organization bins will help create smooth transitions in between lessons.

name: Music Is A Universal Language That Everyone Can Dance To!
description: I am a Teacher at a Title I school. and I do everything I can to ensure that all the students' needs are met. My class loves to listen to music and move their bodies throughout the day. An iPod will give me easy access to provide the children with movement which will stimulate and develop their creativity. My class has fun learning their shapes, colors, and letters with movement which would be so beneficial. Like Benjamin Franklin said ' Tell me and I forget, Teach me and I may remember, Involve me and I learn.' Most of my students are from low socioeconomic backgrounds. My children learn through music and play. Music and learning go hand in hand. It is their favorite part of the day and the best way to learn and open up their creativity. An iPod and a speaker system will give us access to a variety of music. Using this updated technology will give the students greater opportunities to have a playlist already programed. We use music to learn new shapes, colors, numbers, letters, high frequency words, physical activity, and healthy play. This project provides movement and stimulation for developing critical thinking skills. As the students transition throughout the day, music is used as a management tool, especially when we are not able to make it outside on rainy days. On a daily basis, I will use music to empower, inspire, and develop my students. Besides, music is just plain fun and gives children a way to express themselves through a positive outlet!
needStatement: My students need an iPod and a speaker to give us access to a variety of music.

name: Seating For Today's Classroom!
description: 'We have the best kids.', is what many of the teachers say every day. The students come into my room every day excited to tell me a story or eager to know what we will be doing that day. I want my students to love learning and love school. I teach and live in a small rural community that loves its school. The school is the heart of our community. We are a Title I school reaching many low income students as well as many students coming from hard working families. Our students work hard and have gone on to be successful contributing members of society. Many of them return to our great community!These tables will help me begin transitioning desks out of my classroom. Today's students don't learn the same way students did years ago. We need to create environments in our schools and classrooms that encourage collaboration and creativity. I want to offer new seating alternatives that encourage this idea. I want my students to love their space and their room. I am also requesting some Kore Wobble stools. Many of today's kids need to move and movement has been shown to increase focus in many children. A child who is focused and engaged is ready to learn and ready to be taught!
needStatement: My students need tables and wobble chairs instead of desks. The idea of desks is an old one. They need these tables to promote the idea of collaboration and community. Desks can't do this.

name: A Place For Everyone!
description: I am privileged to teach in an amazing school, with a dedicated team of teachers and support staff. Our school is located in the lowest economic neighborhood in our community. We have a high percentage of refuge children and many face challenges that few can imagine. Over 70% of our students receive free and reduced lunch. Our student population is highly transient. Families move in and out frequently. School is the one constant for many of our students. My students come to school excited to learn, and truly want to do their best! While I cannot control what happens at home, I can provide a warm, inviting learning environment in my classroom! Together, my students and I have been reimagining our classroom space. I have incorporated flexible seating, which includes bean bags, exercise balls, cushions, benches, stools and a standing table. Most of which I have purchased myself. Giving students an opportunity to choose their specific type of seating is the key to student engagement. What is needed now, is to create a new learning space where we can all gather for whole group instruction, story time, student presentations, and problem-solving. This rug will give me the opportunity to assign seats, which will help with behavior management. A new school year equals a fresh start! My students will know exactly where to sit when they come to the carpet, minimizing time wasted during transitions. They can be dismissed by rows or colors. They will easily be able to 'turn and talk' with their shoulder partner.
needStatement: My students need a colorful and inviting rug that will accomodate up to 30 students.

name: Engaged Minds With Engaged Core Muscles
description: 2400 students pass through the halls of WT White High School, a school that was designed to accommodate only 1600 when built. With that much overcrowding multiple trips to the school nurse during the year is inevitable! On an average school day, 100 students pass through my door for a variety of medical needs. With an annual budget of $500, (that calculates out to $0.21 a student), I have to be very 'creative' in my purchases. My campus is Title 1 funded and 70% of our students are economically disadvantaged. The majority of our students do not have health insurance and rely on being seen at the school clinic and referred to a free medical clinic if further treatment is needed. I have the privilege of being assigned to approximately 30 student assistants to help me during the school year. These students do not receive credit hours for taking this class, however they volunteer their class period to help the needs of the campus. These students are taught basic first aid skills, and CPR. They help with organizing blood drives and other health promotion activities along with working with our special needs students. The 2400 students of my school see the same thing when they walk into every classroom. They walk in, plop down in a chair, sit for 1.5 hours, get up, walk to another classroom and the cycle begins all over again, for a total of 7.5 hours a day! Last year I decided I needed to change things up with my desk chair and I purchased a ball chair with my own money. What better way to promote a healthy lifestyle than to engage my core throughout the day at my desk. The kids were obsessed with it! Students would come into the clinic because they heard about my chair and wanted to try it out. Every time I left my office and came back, my student workers had moved it to their work stations and were sitting on it. They repeatedly asked 'Why can't we have these to sit on?' With the annual budget of $.21 a student, there was no chance until now! These ball chairs will not only provide 1.5 hours of exercise and core stability to the 30 students that are assigned to me a day, but also to the entire campus that come to the clinic and have to wait for medical care. Help us lead by example to the entire campus that minor changes in a teenage lifestyle can add up to major health benefits.
needStatement: My students need 10 stability balance balls to continue to promote a healthy lifestyle through exercising while learning.

name: I Like To Move It, Move It!
description: I have 25 wonderful, energetic, and curious first grade students. The students in my classroom speak a variety of languages, eight total! My school is 88% free or reduced price lunch, and is quickly rising. Forty nine percent of the students at my school identify as Asian, 26% identify as African American, 14% identify as Hispanic, 10% identify as Caucasian, and 1% identify as American Indian. My classroom is rich with diversity and we celebrate each student's identity and culture. My students are always moving! I use alternative seating, center based learning, and differentiation to target the needs of all of my students. In my school, the classrooms are co-taught and have a cluster of students who are just learning English or have special needs. I currently have a Language Academy room but next year, 2016-2017, I will have the special education room and I couldn't be more excited! Last year was my first year teaching. I learned a lot about how students learn, factors that make learning more of a challenge for students, and that listening to my students is one of the best things I can do. Towards the end of the year last year I was able to get a couple of wiggle cushions and wiggle stools for my classroom. My students LOVED them! They were so excited and wanted every possible chance to sit on them and use them. They constantly asked, 'Ms. B, why can't you get us more seats like this? Chairs are boring and we don't really like them.' (I also learned first graders are brutally honest)! With the limited wiggle cushions and wiggle stools I had, I was able to help some of my students get in extra exercise by doing core and back strengthening exercises. I wanted my whole class to be able to participate but with limited resources I could only allow a few to do them on a regular basis. My class needs yoga balls, wiggle cushions, and bike pedals so the entire class can move while they learn and so we can incorporate exercise into our day on a regular basis, outside of our short recess. The one other request my students were constantly making was at breakfast time. They always receive fruit and milk or juice for breakfast. A lot of the time they would not want to drink their milk or juice or eat their fruit right away. We had to throw it away because we had nothing to store it in. They repeatedly asked me for a mini fridge so they could store their food for later. A fridge would allow us to keep our healthy foods fresh and keep my kiddos full throughout the day!
needStatement: My students need equipment that will let them exercise and move while they are learning.

name: Sensory Break Needed.
description: My students all have Autism Spectrum Disorder, they are all unique and have varying needs from one another. My students range from 6th-8th grade and are going to change the world some day! At times my students get overwhelmed and on occasion need a break from the stimulation the school environment can bring. My students come to my room to learn social skills and calming strategies. Some children with autism struggle remaining calm, this is a skill we work on daily. Students with Autism Spectrum Disorder at times need sensory breaks. In our class room we have a calming corner where the students can go when they are feeling overwhelmed or may be having a melt down. Our calming corner is not as comfy as we would like! Bean bags would offer them an comfortable area to rest and regroup when that is what their brain needs. This will help increase their success in the stimulating world they are surrounded by. This area is a very important area in the Autism room. Please consider donating to our special needs, anything would help!
needStatement: My students need an area they feel safe and comfortable. We would love beanbags in our room in order to regroup in a comfy location.

name: Staying Active While We Learn!
description: I teach English language learners in a Title I school. My students come from low-income families; their parents are working several jobs to take care of financial responsibilities. How often do you find yourself fidgeting, wiggling, getting up to stretch your legs? Now imagine you are 5-6 years old and how much more energy you have to release. 'We have lost sight as educators of the fact that when we move, we learn, and we learn as we move.' Darren Stowell CEO of ActivEd. My students love to engage in activities outside and enjoy anything to do with movement. To incorporate movement in my class, students actively engage in movement breaks by dancing, and aerobic exercises daily. Unfortunately, many of my students do not get a healthy dose of movement in their day due to their home situations, lack of transportation, or a safe place to go play with supervision. These students are starving for movement, and are consistently showing progress when they get the opportunity to move before any prolonged activities. Not only does movement help academically, but it stops many behaviors before they start!We are requesting six ball chairs and a stabili-T chair to help my students stay active for 60 minutes a day! My students love using Hokki Stools. They asked for other type of Hokki Stools to stay active in our classroom. The ball chairs will allow my students to safely sit and move at the same time. It will improve my students' physical and emotional well-being. The bases of these stools are sturdy and lightweight so there is no concern about children harming themselves. They will also be able to improve their posture while in the stools. This kid-inspired project will help them stay active and focus on classroom tasks and instruction. They will be active as they are learning English! This kid-inspired project will provide more active seating for students to use in the classroom!Students will be able to stay active for over 60 minutes during the literacy block. They will be able to focus on instruction and stay active!
needStatement: My students need 6 ball chairs and a Stabile-T stool to stay active for 60 minutes during the Literacy block!

name: Alternative Seating Options for My 1st Graders!
description: Right now, I have a class of 24 students. Out of my 24 students, 13 are English Language Learners (Spanish, Urdu, Arabic.) My school is located in a high need and low income neighborhood and I strongly believe that they deserve the best that we can provide them with. My students come from a variety of different economic backgrounds and all students are receiving free lunch. Our school is also one of the most ethnically diverse schools. Students speak a multitude of languages including English, Spanish, Hindi, Urdu, and Arabic. As diverse as our students are economically and culturally, they are diverse in their academics. With your help, I know my students will receive all the tools and support they need to help support their learning!Research has shown that there is a neurological pathway leading from a body's balance and movement system to it's alert system in the brain. Movement actually allows for alertness and attention. Wobble Chairs and cushions play an important roll in student focus. In response to the chair's instability, the body instinctively engages its core muscles. Constant movement is required in order to stay seated on the chair, and that movement helps students focus. With wobble chairs and cushions, students feel less fidgety and more relaxed and are better able to concentrate. As we move into different ways of learning along with high expectations, students need choices about how they engage in classroom seating options. They need the best possible physical environment to keep them focused. My students came up with this project after we visited the preschool classroom. Our preschoolers had these chairs and cushions and my first graders fell in love with them and asked me to get them for my classroom. We discussed how these chairs are good for us and how they promote us to be more healthy and active. My students came up with great responses. These chairs will be used throughout the day to get children more active while we are sitting in the classroom. Students will have these at centers-which is a big part of our day so they will definitely get their wiggles out! Children will be allowed to access them at different centers they choose.
needStatement: My students need 8 wobble chairs and 9 wobble cushions .

name: Staying Active and Healthy!
description: My students are Deaf/Hard of Hearing and have very high energy. They use American Sign Language (ASL) to communicate. Most students when they first come to me, have very low language and academic skills, which means we have a long road ahead of us to minimize those large gaps. With these tools we can make this journey more fun!I teach in a high poverty district which makes it very difficult to get the supplies I need for my lessons.I have six students: four in second grade, one in third and one in fifth grade. My students' language and communication skills are very low. My challenge is to teach them their language, ASL, and academics at the same time. It is a tough challenge and my students give me their best effort every day. At the end of last year, I was talking to my students and they were bored of the same old and limited recess activities. I had noticed that they weren't as active as they were at the beginning of the year during recess. So, with my help, we researched and came up with what we are requesting; scooters, balls, longer jump ropes, etc. We also talked about how we can stay active in the classroom and came up with the ball chairs. Exercise and movement keeps your mind open, while keeping your body actively engaged! Requesting these materials will do just this for my students. It will allow them to free their minds while concentrating on other things, like let's say work!I am hoping through this project that my students will learn the importance of health and staying active.
needStatement: My students need various playground equipment including a recess pack, scooters, a storage cart to keep it all in and ball chairs.

name: Homes Needed for New Teachers' Students' Books!
description: I am extremely fortunate to be teaching in a unique and powerful 21st Century Learning Studio, filled by a diverse group of students. In this type of learning environment there are 4 teachers, each with a homebase of about 20 students, as well as an English Language teacher for our large group of English Language Learners. The Studio has only partial walls and a variety of large and small group spaces filled with easily movable furniture--couches, stools, and tables, but no traditional desks--to allow for flexible learning and space for students to learn in the way that works best for them. We are all one 'class,' and teachers share students, and students share teachers interchangeably. Our goal is success for each student. We understand that success looks different for each student, so we focus on personalized learning. Personalized learning lets each student work at their own pace and at their own level. We also focus on preparing students for the 21st century and the future by allowing for extensive opportunities with Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Math. The Studio and our STEAM focus allows for more small group and individualized time for students, which benefits everyone. Due to our large Studio, we have many transitions throughout the day from one space to another. Students spend a lot of time doing individualized tasks and independent work, as well as working in small groups with one of their teachers. Specifically, Literacy time is broken down between whole group lesson, independent reading time, and small group time. Each time we transition to a new portion of the Literacy block, students need to bring their reading materials with them to wherever they are going. Having these easily transportable and durable book bins for students to store their books and reading materials in will make transitions easier and therefore allow for more reading time- the ultimate goal! Reading is a special part of a child's development, and working with a group of students who may not have a large selection of books at home, we want to promote the love for reading in our classroom. These book bins will help organize materials and ease transitions which allows for a smooth and enjoyable reading time for each student!
needStatement: My students need individual book bins to organize and store their reading materials to make for easy transitions to and from group and independent reading time in our large Learning Studio.

name: Focused and Healthy Students!
description: My colleagues and I are a team of teachers who are all passionate about creating a healthy, enriching atmosphere for all of our high poverty/low income students. Our students are readers, writers, creators, and dreamers. Our students face challenges both in and out of the classroom, however they continue to be resilient with their academic, social, and emotional well-being. Despite the many challenges they face, we aim to create classrooms that will engage, excite and motivate them to succeed. Our shared goal is to create classrooms that are a reflection of us all. Our students represent the diverse community surrounding our school. They are children of immigrants and children of long-time residents. They speak multiple languages and represent cultures from all over the world. Nearly 80% of them receive free or reduced-price lunch. Many of them will be the first in their families to attend college- ask any of them and they'll tell you that's where they're headed! Our school is a unique and wonderful community of involved families, committed leadership, and passionate teachers. We have our share of challenges, but we support one another and act as a team with one goal in mind- the success of our students. Donations to this project will impact both how our students learn and what they learn. All items on this list were suggested by fifth grade students. With the items donated to our classrooms, our students will enter their classrooms each day to a calming, welcoming, and healthy environment. Having alternative choices for seating will allow students to choose the type of seating that best fits their learning style to maximize their learning engagement and wellness. For example, pedal chairs will help kinesthetic learners move their bodies throughout the day and maintain their focus. The pillows and alternative seats will allow students to be comfortable and focused on their learning. Having water bottles near their desks will encourage students to properly fuel their bodies and brains throughout the day. A mini fridge will enable us to provide healthy snack options especially for students who do not always have access to healthy food options outside of school. Students who are comfortable in their environment will be more excited to be in school and their overall well-being will improve!
needStatement: My students need flexible seating for sustained focus, water bottles to stay hydrated, and a refrigerator.

name: Stock Nation-Sold! Economics 2016
description: After reading Dave Burgess' book 'Teach Like a Pirate' I am constantly looking for ways to actively involve my students in class. We need hooks to bring the students in and show them 'Real World' applications. My students always want to know how the material applies to THEIR lives. In my class there is a possibility of mix of students in grades 11-12. The students and staff are very hardworking and strive to create a family environment on campus. There is a definite need for outside support for our students. The free and reduced price lunch population at my school is 62.5 percent. My students will form teams and then together they will research companies, analyze data and make informed decisions about which stocks to purchase. Then they will review data along with current news stories and be able to decide how long to keep this stock. Students will use the internet, news articles, magazines and other resources to help them make their decisions. The Stock Market Game allows my students to use $100,00.00 to learn to trade in a safe environment. In the past, one student asked, 'You mean people do this in real life with real money?' The student teams are able to compete with other schools around the state. Each region in the state has winners and the top two teams are invited to a wonderful luncheon and awards ceremony.
needStatement: My students need 26 entry fees for Fall and for Spring Stock Market Game for a stronger economics background and playing the Stock Market Game online will be a great way to engage the students in this learning process.

name: Alphabetter Stand-Up Desks Increase Opportunities for Physical Fitness and Movement
description: My students are energetic, curious, eager learners in the third grade at an arts and technology focused charter school in Michigan. One hundred percent of my students receive free breakfast and lunch. I serve a unique group of learners with a wide range of abilities, passions, and strengths. Some struggle with learning disabilities, dyslexia, autism, and emotional needs. While my students face a lot of challenges daily, their never-ending desire to learn is inspiring. My students love to investigate, explore, wonder, and discover. Our school's mission is to provide an education that is deeply rooted in the arts (visual art, music, dance, and theater) and which integrates the arts into core subject areas. My students are active and full of energy. They need frequent and regular opportunities to wiggle, move, dance, run, or otherwise add movement to their day. My students are looking for more opportunities to increase their physical activity while learning in the classroom. My summer-school group was in awe when they learned about stand-up desks and how they can increase fitness levels and focus. They have asked for these desks so that they can stand, march in place, or wiggle while they work. My students are setting goals to aim for a minimum of 60 minutes of physical activity each day, and with Alphabetter Stand-Up Desks, they can achieve this goal within the classroom. According to a study performed by Dr. Mercola, '[e]xercise increases the number of connections between your neurons and new neuronal growth in your brain.' Not only can standing desks help students make greater academic gains, but there is evidence that standing desks can increase productivity, improve mood and energy levels, and reduce the risk of certain medical conditions such as high blood pressure. I hope to give each of my students an opportunity to use the standing desks during work time each day. This year we are setting class goals for 60 minutes of physical activity each day, and my students believe that these desks will be beneficial and allow them to move while learning. In our brainstorm session, my students and I discussed the importance of staying hydrated, especially during periods of increased physical activity. We are requesting reusable water bottles so that my students can stay properly hydrated while we work to increase our physical fitness levels. We will use the bottles daily. Thank you for supporting my students' goals as they aim for 60 minutes of physical activity each day!
needStatement: My students need Alphabetter Stand-Up desks to increase opportunities for movement and physical fitness and water bottles to stay hydrated as we work to stay active 60 or more minutes each day.

name: Flexible Seating Helps All Students Learn!
description: I have had the opportunity to work with up to 100 amazing 5th grade students everyday! Our Middle School students rotate through classes, so I teach two sections of Science and 2 sections of English Language Arts each day. I love teaching 5th grade - my students are independent, creative and they love learning as much I love teaching them! I have been blessed to be able to develop relationships with these kids and impact their lives, creating a positive introduction to their middle school careers. This fall, I will again have a group of 94 lively and wonderful students! They will eagerly be anticipating their experiences now as new middle school students. Our school is in a rural area and has a high poverty level. With decreasing funding for education, it is becoming harder and harder to provide students with the supplies they need and deserve. My classroom is currently set up as a science classroom, with out-of-date lab tables and chairs. I find that some students often lean back in their chairs, because moving helps them concentrate. Other students cannot learn well at all sitting down, so ask to stand up at my counter in order to work more efficiently. While I often allow one student at a time do this, it doesn't work well since the counter is where Science labs or other projects are set up. Kids all have different learning styles and they need the tools to support the way they best learn. Flexible seating options like Stand-Up Desks and Wobble Chairs would be an awesome way to help students find a comfortable way to learn the way they learn best. It will help them also to be more active while learning, which research shows greatly improves student concentration. This project is kid-inspired because on multiple occasions they have come up to me and asked if they can sit or stand in different areas of the classroom, in short, they are asking for flexible seating options! I would love to be able to give them that option - it would both encourage and inspire my kids, helping them concentrate to do their best work.
needStatement: My students need Stand-Up Desks and Wobble Chairs to give them flexible seating options in the classroom.

name: Yoga to Help My Students Relax and Meditate
description: The students I work with everyday are clever, smart, and willing to work hard when challenged. I am always eager to see how each student contributes to the positive classroom experience. My students continually desire the niceties that are typically found are other high schools. My students are always coming up with new ideas and new innovations that would make their high school experience better. They know how important it is that they remember these four years as time for them to explore new things and join the world as global citizens. Every senior in my high school takes physical education class as part of their graduation requirements. Students often lament that they don't have more options to fill these requirements. At the same time, there is currently a Yoga Club in our school that sees some of the most robust attendance around stressful times such as exams and the holidays. For my students, yoga is a means of relaxing their busy minds and finding 60 minutes of peace and quiet. Many students experience trauma and crisis at home, then are expected to come to school ready to learn. My students would like to take the success of the Yoga Club and bring it to a full year elective that seniors can take in place of physical education. It is my hope that by exposing more students to Yoga, we can begin to bring more peace and relaxation to seniors during a busy time of year. This project will bring in a classroom set of yoga mats, a collection of DVD's and CD's to help facilitate the class, and a set of books for one of our teachers to learn more about Yoga and teach the class.
needStatement: My students need yoga mats, dvds, and CDs for mind/body relaxation.

name: Literacy Is an Adventure Waiting to Happen
description: At 7:15 a.m., my anticipation rises as I hear the chatter and pitter-patter coming closer to my Kindergarten room. 'Good Morning, Ms. R.!' Immediately my day has started, and the fun begins! The amazing scholars at my school are active, engaged learners. Despite the trauma and poverty they may face outside of school, our room is a safe, welcoming community. Here are the stats: 88% free and reduced lunch, 99% students of color, 64% English Learners. The most important statistic is 95% family satisfaction. Our teachers, scholars, and families have high expectations for themselves and each other. We use a growth mindset, using our failures not as things to be ashamed of but to work through and grow from. With that being said, the school and families have and have had many challenges. I seek to create a classroom environment where every child has differentiated instruction and the resources needed to be successful learners. This project will fund my reading and listening centers. My school's goal is to have all children learn to read by grade 3. Giving the scholars a variety of experiences in reading gives them a greater opportunity to succeed in literacy. Each child comes from different learning styles, interests, and language challenges. I seek to meet the individual instructional needs of all students. Utilizing independent reading through an inviting, interest-based reading center will enhance motivation and encourage lifelong readers. We need a listening center, pillows, and read-along library. The listening center will help scholars to see how the words on the page can come alive in a fluid, expressive way. The center helps the scholars focus on the sounds of words read without interruption and provides a model of fluent reading. Audio books also give them an important introduction to listening which is a skill that the children must master in order to learn to read. I could not be more excited at the opportunity to enhance the resources and opportunity for success in our school's goal of literacy.
needStatement: My students need a listening center, pillows, and read-along library to create a literacy-enriched environment with inviting reading and listening centers!

name: A Balanced Class is a Smart Class
description: My students love to move and be active. They are energetic kindergartners with wonderful personalities and various learning styles. They need to have the opportunity to wiggle during the school day. I am forever trying to find ways to teach all of my students and keep them fully engaged in the learning process. I teach in a Title I, high poverty school. My kindergartners live in a small, rural community. Our school houses pre-kindergarten through 2nd grade. They come to school to have fun and feel valued. My students want to be able to complete their daily work because they want to be responsible and please their teacher and parents. This can be difficult for five and six year old children who need to sit comfortably or wiggle around as they perform daily tasks. Usually, wiggles can be spent during gym time or recess, but that isn't always enough for all students. Young learners find it taxing to be successful sitting in a traditional manner in the classroom all day. My students ask why they need to sit in traditional chairs, and if they can sit in various places in the classroom. They often want to stretch, flex, and move during work times, however, they are limited given our current classroom set up. I would like to give him the opportunity to sit comfortably while strengthening his core and stretching his muscles. This will allow students to attend for longer periods of time and practice healthy habits at the same time during our literacy and math times, which amount to 90 minutes per day. The Active sitting stools will be beneficial for students who choose to work in furniture much like a chair, while giving them the opportunity to be a little more mobile by swiveling or rocking in addition to practicing proper sitting posture to strengthen their cores. By using the Stay-N-Play Balance Balls, students will be able to practice yoga techniques for a healthy body and have the cushion and bounce they need while doing daily classroom tasks. The Wobble air cushions will enable students to have options for balancing their bodies on the floor or in a chair during our daily routine.
needStatement: My students need 4 Kids Ace Stools, 6 Stay-N-Play Balance Balls, and 4 Health and Fitness Wobble air cushions.

name: Help Us Regulate Our Emotions to Succeed in Adulthood!
description: How would it impact your life if you were not able to self-regulate your emotions? What would happen if you were furious at work and couldn't stop from lashing out at your colleagues? What would happen if you were nervous at the doctor’s office and couldn't stop crying? Self-regulation is the ability to monitor, evaluate, and modify one's emotional reactions. It is key to being able to function as and adult in the community including post-secondary education and employment. Unfortunately these skills, which may seem easy for you, are very difficult for many teens and adults with disabilities. Due to their disabilities, they are not able to understand their emotions, identify appropriate reactions, and cope on their own. This prevents them from being employed and participating in the community. These are the skills I am trying to target and teach to my students. I am a special education teacher teaching life skill and job skill classes to senior students ages 18 - 22. My students have Intellectual disabilities along with a wide range of other disabilities including Autism, traumatic brain injury, physical disabilities, etc. There are two important programs to teach these key self-regulation skills. One is through the Me Moves DVD. Me Moves is a research based program to help children and adults self-regulate their emotions through movement. The DVD is designed to activate the parasympathetic nervous system, providing the user with an effective tool for self regulation in only a few minutes. Using it for a few minutes in a day day decreases stress, improves mood, and enhances one’s ability to focus. The other research based program is Zones of Self Regulation. The Zones of Self-Regulation posters will help my students learn the key components of self-regulation including monitoring one's own emotions and finding ways to cope.
needStatement: My students need the MeMoves program DVD and three zones of self regulation posters to help them learn to self-regulate their emotions to successfully transition to adulthood.

name: Getting the Wiggles Out for Learning
description: My students are all enthusiastic English Language Learners. They are the youngest students in our school but exemplify the American dream -- even at their age they understand that a strong education is the gateway to success in life. They love to learn and don't let the struggle of learning a new language or facing financial difficulties or assimilating to a new culture stand in their way. My students inspire me each day and are the reason I love my work. Last year I borrowed a Hokki Stool from a colleague and my students loved it. They asked each day if they could use the stool and how we could get more of them for my classroom. I developed an incentive rotating schedule but with 8-10 students in my groups, they only used it once every two weeks. My students waited and waited for their day. Some students began to recognize that they needed a wiggly stool to improve their focus. I would love to give them this support, allowing them to wiggle around while they work. This is the chance to get stools for those students who need them as well as those students who just enjoy the special seat! By adding eight Hokki Stools, most of the students in each of my small groups can use one each day. We will go from five hours of wiggling a day to 40 hours! That will be a great boost for our learning and well-being.
needStatement: My students need Hokki stools to keep them moving during instruction and independent work which improves their focus.

name: Strengthening Our 'Core'- Special Education in Motion
description: I teach special needs students in Paterson, New Jersey where the poverty level is extremely high, however, at my school we work hard to give the students the best, and expect the best in return. Our expectations are high but attainable! My students disabilities range from Autism, Communication, Vision and Learning Impaired. All of my students struggle with remaining focused and attentive to a task. Their energy and ability to be easily distracted holds them back from working to their highest potential. It is important that I maintain routine and structure in the classroom. My students are always happy, but their home lives are not consistent. It is important to me that they know I will always be there for them, and that I am able to teach them independence in the classroom as well as meet their individual needs and help them grow. I believe in each and every one of them and know they are capable of greatness! I love my job and wouldn't change it for a million dollars!It's Tuesday at 10:20am: 'GYM TIME!' They all know. It's their favorite time of day! There is just one problem- today they are going to be walking on the balance beam and bouncing on yoga balls. For special needs students, core strength is an area of difficulty. Core having two meanings, 1. Core: the mid section if your body and 2. Core: a nickname used in reference to the Common Core Standards. My students struggle with both definitions of the word. After gym on this specific Tuesday, one student asked 'why is the balance beam so hard? Learning is easier when we are moving around but the balance beam is hard to learn!' We did some research as a class, and decided we would like to try a yoga ball chair, to increase balance and core strength which would also help us to increase our Common 'Core' knowledge in the process. These yoga ball balance chairs will increase my students balance and core strength while also helping them to focus on the core standards being taught. Now gym time will still be their favorite time of the day because we are working on our gym skills during everyday instruction!!
needStatement: My students need Cando Balance Ball Chairs to increase their core strength and balance during daily learning tasks.

name: Supplies Are Special
description: I am lucky to spend my days with a diverse group of learners. My school serves a diverse group of students, most of whom come from very challenging backgrounds. The students that I work with have all been labeled as having some type of disability; either learning, emotional, physical or a combination of those. Instead of letting their backgrounds and disabilities discourage them, they use them as motivators to work hard every day. Many of the students I work with come from places where they do not have money for food or clothing, let alone money for extra school supplies. Many of the students I work with rely on donations for their school supplies, which are only enough for the general education classroom...not for when they come for their specialized services. It is vital for the students that I work with to have the same access to supplies when working on their individual skills as they do when they are with their peers. My students need basic school supplies: crayons, portfolios, and pencils. These school supplies will make life a little less stressful for my students and their families. They are already cash strapped and find it hard to get school supplies for their regular classroom, let alone being able to afford extra supplies for their Special Education classroom. My students deserve to have the same access to quality supplies while in the Special Education classroom as they do in their general education classroom. When my students come to my room, they shouldn't have to worry about bringing a pencil, paper, and crayons with them. These supplies should be readily available, which will save time and increase time spent on instruction.
needStatement: My students need school supplies to use while they are working on their individual goals in the Special Education classroom setting. The supplies will be used for goals in reading, writing, math, and social emotional learning.

name: Bring Us the News!
description: I teach in St. Paul at a school that has a high free and reduced lunch rate. (over 90%) My students often come to school lacking resources many students and schools in the suburbs have. I love to look for resources to either catch them up academically or projects to inspire them to love school. Many have so many outside worries, that school sometimes is hard for them to concentrate on. I feel it is my job to encourage them as well give them the desire to learn.I have requested two items. The first is a scholastic news magazine subscription for my class. I have had the opportunity to use these magazines in my class in the past, when funded, and the kids are just as excited when the new issues arrive as I remember 30 years ago when I had them in my elementary classroom. The kids also love the online issues that come with them and they watch documentaries and videos, take quizzes, and listen to stories on their i-pads. I love that the subscription comes with a digital subscription as well. The second item is a class set of solar system books. The solar system is one of our social studies/writing units, and we never have enough books in our library. It would be so beneficial to have these in our own room.
needStatement: My students need Scholastic news magazines and solar system guided reading books.

name: Developing Our Social-Emotional Skills!
description: Our students are located in an urban area that has currently been effected by an ongoing water crisis. Therefore, there are additional stressors and difficulties for my students that extend outside of the classroom. I service approximately 100 students, ages 2-14, qualified for special education services under multiple eligibilities. As a school social worker, I have had the privilege to witness the growth each student has made this school year. They have amazing hearts and talents to share with this world! Thank you for considering donating to this project! This project is comprised of a variety of hands-on resources that can be used by the students (and educators) to develop social-emotional skills. Students will be able to learn positive social skills through the use of social stories, interactive activities, and practice. Visual and interactive resources seem to be the most effective in student growth!The resources from the project have the potential to make a difference in the student's ability to build positive relationships, cope with anger, handle stress, and learn appropriate social skills in different situations. These social skills can help students be successful in their academic and home life, reaching into their future. They will be able to carry these skills with them throughout their lives!
needStatement: My students need hands on, visual resources (Children's Books That Promote Resilience, Social Skills Matter, & Dealing with Feelings Board Book Collection) to help them learn, practice, and develop positive social-emotional skills. Thank you so much!

name: Sensory and Occupational Therapy Needs
description: My class is a brand new highly intensive ASD classroom, I am also a brand new teacher this year after being an aide for years. All of the children in my classroom have autism, with a high level of need. The majority of the children are 3 and 4 years old, we get some of our little ones the day they turn 3 when they are able to enter our program. The district provides the basic furniture to run a highly structured classroom, but not all the materials that are needed for the early intervention we will be providing to the children. The children require a high level of sensory, as well as a need for visual supports and manipulative items. This is a highly structured classroom that requires numerous furniture items and visual dividers to help the children learn the different areas in the classroom. Our goal is to help provide early intervention and expose the children to new items throughout the school year. This project include a number of items that will be used on an almost daily basis. The trampoline will be used to help teach the children how to jump, as well as how to get some of their sensory input out, that would otherwise stay locked up inside of them. The sand and art supplies will also help with their sensory needs group small group time, and throughout the day. Laminated icons for the kids to communication and transition with is one of the biggest components in this program, so being able to laminate something at the drop of a hat is very important. Helping the children learn to get the sensory input they need is also a huge component which means having as many ways as possible to help them get that sensory input.
needStatement: My students need to have a laminating machine so their icons can be laminated, learning boards to help them learn dressing techniques, and these different art supplies.

name: Cozy Community Carpet
description: My 2nd grade class is made up of 20 incredible and diverse students. My students come from a variety of cultural backgrounds and many receive free/reduced lunch. These smart and energetic 2nd graders are in need of a classroom rug to make our gathering spot more inviting and comfortable for learning. At the core of my teaching philosophy is creating meaningful relationships with my students. One of the ways we do this is gathering together as a whole group down on the carpet for a variety of both academic and community building activities. Our current classroom rug is over 10 years old, has stains, and is tearing. It is not an inviting space for my students to come to learn. My students need a new classroom rug so they have a comfortable spot to sit as we gather for our class meetings and whole group learning. There are many times throughout the day that we gather on the carpet for learning. We build our classroom community by starting each day with circle time and having a morning meeting. This is my favorite part of the day. I really get a chance to connect and learn about my students on a more personal level. Throughout the rest of the day we gather at the beginning of each workshop block for whole group instruction in math, reading and writing workshop. Having a new rug will give my students a colorful, engaging spot to come and sit as we gather for these lessons. Students will also be using the rug other times during the day as they read to self, participate in number talks, and for other class meetings.
