With continued budget cuts every year, there is not room in our school budget to purchase a quality rug that can withstand the typical wear and tear a classroom rug gets. Receiving this grant will provide my students this year and students for years to come with a colorful, cozy spot to gather as a community of learners.
needStatement: My students need a rug to make our meeting place an inviting and comfortable space to learn and grow together.

name: Student Movement=Student Success! Inside and Outside the Classroom
description: As a teacher in a diverse, high poverty/low income school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. I am looking to make sure that my students have the tools they need in order to be successful. My school is a Title I school, with all of our students qualifying for free breakfast and lunch. Helping each student see that they are safe and loved and creating connections with them so that they can all live up to their potential is a daily goal of mine. Kids these days have many challenges. Sitting still in the classroom is a major one. Our project includes many tools that allow movement and learning simultaneously. When I asked my students what they needed to be successful, the ideas started flowing. My kid-inspired project includes resources that will allow my students to move while learning (stability balls and seating discs) and supplies that make moving fun during indoor and outdoor recess (balls, jump ropes, and an active indoor game). They also said that a large carpet for gathering together would give them a clean place to sit together and play together. The stability balls (FitPro Ball) and the seating discs work to allow active students to move their bodies during times where they normally would be sitting still in the classroom. The carpet I am requesting will not only give a clean place to gather and play, but is also a learning tool in teaching students how to identify their emotions. Combining learning and moving is a win-win for everyone in the classroom!
needStatement: My students need alternative seating, such as balance balls and seating discs, active indoor games for indoor recess, and balls and jump ropes for outdoor recess, and a carpet for a gathering space.

name: Let's Balance, Strengthen Our Cores, and Learn!
description: Teaching in a high poverty/low-income school, my students are faced with several challenges outside of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, my students walk into our classroom every day full of life, ready to learn, and excited for what is in store for them that day. I am looking to provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. My students are bright, ambitious and eager learners. Even though it has become extremely difficult and sometimes frustrating to educate without needed supplies, our students still come to school eager to learn. Our school rarely has extra funding for enriching material, and if they do, the funds are used for older students. Many of my students' families will never have additional money to purchase educational materials; therefore, I hope to be able to provide a fun and interesting way of learning so my students can succeed in life. We are very active in our class and my students want a way to be able to get some movement and fitness into their day. I quickly realized that my students enjoy when we take quick brain breaks to stretch or do some yoga breathing activities. I have asked my students what would make them most comfortable while learning and growing together in the classroom. They have expressed the need and want for movement while they work. This project was inspired by my amazing students. I'd like to provide my young learners with hokki stools that allow them to get some fitness, strengthening and help them get their wiggles out so that they can focus on learning. These stools will allow them the freedom to move around without being distracted.
needStatement: My students need Hokki Stools to help them move, strengthen their core and focus.

name: LCD Projector & HS Phys. Ed Students
description: My students are in the inner city of Minnesota. We are a 9-12th-grade school with over 2,000 students. The school is very diverse from refugees, ELL and locally students. All students are required to take Health and Physical Education to graduate in Minnesota . All Learners need Health and Physical Education to graduate this is just a tool to help ease the stress of Physical Education. This school is the oldest in the district with over 150 years old. I am excited to be at this school. I am asking for an LCD projector for my Physical Education students at my diverse inner-city students. Having a wireless projector allows me to project examples of a skill, I can use it for my Wii, Dance Dance Resolution pads and able to use it to project fitness apps on to the gym wall for all students to see clearly. I have found that having a LCD projector in the gym allows me to walk around and build rapport with my students. I am able to show a skill high enough on the wall for all students to be able to see and for our visual learners.
needStatement: My students need an LCD projector. The projector will be an asset to my Physical Education class. I can project virtually anything that I need from and LCD projector to the Physical Education class.

name: Kindles For Kiddos!
description: I am fortunate enough to get to hang out with 23 very lively eight year olds everyday. I have a great group of kiddos who love to talk, share and have fun while learning. They are a fantastic group who love to learn and love to find new ways to make learning fun. We are lucky enough to get to attend an innovative school where we get to focus on our multiple intelligences everyday. I have kids who are art smart, word smart, math smart, nature smart and music smart. It keeps us all on our toes making sure we keep our classroom a fun learning environment even with all these different learning styles. My students will use these Kindles daily in a number of ways. We will use them in small groups where the students will be able to use adaptive technology websites where they can do work at their own skill level and pace. This is an essential part in making sure the students' learning objectives are being made on the level that is appropriate for them. They will also be able to use them for research projects, classroom assessments, and interactive learning games. Many of my students do not have the use of technology at home so the use of these devices at school will get them prepared for middle and high school.
needStatement: My students need these Kindles in order to build on basic technology skills used in today's world.

name: Hands-on Literacy Learning
description: 'Children want the same things we want. To laugh, to be challenged, to be entertained, and delighted.' -Dr. Seuss. Here is a chance to give young learners a chance to grab onto literacy and run with it. Who wouldn't want a chance to change the world by learning while having fun and being challenged? Second graders are eager and impressionable learners. They strive to learn more every day. In a class with an average of 30 students, my students deserve one on one time with me, their teacher, as well as opportunities to work independently and with small groups. By donating to my second grade class, you will ultimately be changing the world. The donated materials will allow my students to engage in hands-on and fun games and activities that aid in building a solid foundation for literacy. Nelson Mandela once said, 'Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.' Let's give my students who come from low income homes a chance at a successful future. I will use this project to support my students in learning to read in write during our literacy block. During Daily 5, students are given a choice of activities and games. These materials will allow the class to have fun, challenging, and engaging activities to practice building that important reading foundation. Furthermore, the materials will allow students to work independently, with a partner, in small groups, or with a teacher. By incorporating more opportunities to practice phonics, comprehension, fluency, and vocabulary during our literacy block, my students should improve in all areas of reading. For example the folder games are simple and independent activities that allow for self checking and extra practice in phonics and grammar. The writing tiles will be used in the Work on Writing choice for Daily 5. With these various new materials, students will be given opportunities to work on many aspects of literacy. Increased reading skills will promote future success in and out of school. Thank you for helping my students!
needStatement: My students need literacy activities and games that will be used during our literacy block.

name: Flexible Seating for Busy Minds and Bodies
description: Hmong, Somali, Amharic, Karin, French, English, Spanish, Vietnemese ... You might hear any one of these spoken in the halls of my school or inside my classroom. Every one of my students has a unique story. Some of those stories are hard to hear. Our schol has a mixture of socio-economic backgrounds. The public schools do not reflect this. Sixty-six percent of our student population qualifies for free and reduced priced lunch. Some of my students are homeless and often hungry. They take care of brothers and sisters and act as translators for their parents. However, they almost always turn up at my door ready to learn and with a smile on their face. They all deserve the best I can give them. Our classroom is too small for the 30+ bodies we have. Finding space for students to move around is hard. We spill out into the hallway. We make it work. We laugh a lot. We learn a lot. Sometimes I dance. Sometimes we all dance. We just dance in a really small space. These stools will enable me to move out some of the traditional hard plastic chairs and create more space. They are light enough they can be carried easily, which means the space is more flexible. Different students learn best in different positions, or they need to move in order to stay focused. The stools allow students to do this. Giving students a choice is very important in helping them feel valued. It seems silly, but allowing them to choose an alternate seating arrangement can make all the difference in a student's attitude. If students are uncomfortable, they don't learn. Just like you and me.
needStatement: My students need Hokki stools so they can have different seating options. These stools allow students to move while staying seated. Great for busy minds with busy bodies.

name: Picture This! Learning Math with Hands-on Math Centers
description: My students come from a low poverty community that is currently experiencing a water crisis: lead contaminated water. They come from a variety of backgrounds and experiences. Many of my young students have been exposed to some kind violence, hunger, instability, homelessness, etc. What makes my students special is that they all qualify for special education for a variety of disabilities: Autism, speech/language impairments, physical disabilities, developmental delays, cognitive impairments, ADD/ADHD, health/medical impairments, social/emotional impairments, sensory processing impairments, behavioral impairments, etc. They attend an inner city school that is equipped to house special education students (ramps in the hallways, wall handles, swimming pool, school nurse, access to therapists/therapy. Our classroom offers two half-day sessions that are three hours long with a small class size of up to 12 students in each session to allow more individualized instruction/therapy. Students will be using objects to solve math problems. Our classroom is in need of up-to-date, hands-on early math materials that offer a concrete experience to solve math problems for active, young learners. I plan on using these hands-on math centers/materials to broaden and expand on making learning math fun and exciting. I plan on doing this by creating small group math centers for more individualized instruction/learning so that each student has the opportunity to experience the materials. Donations to this project make a difference with my student's learning by offering new and exciting math games/materials that allow them to focus more on having fun while learning essential math skills. Donations will have them focused on playing while forgetting that they are actually learning. Donations will improve their lives for the better, because they can use their hands and other senses to learn new concepts instead of using traditional paper/pencil/book concepts. Donations will capture the active, unfocused, uninterested learner by drawing them in to the fun math games/materials while experiencing success in participation and learning! Donations will have all students excited to learn and anxious to move about the math centers without hesitation.
needStatement: My students need to solve math problems using up-to-date, concrete, hands-on objects. The complete set of hands-on math centers by Lakeshore is perfect to promote these essential math skills for my young learners.

name: Our Target Is Healthy Eating!
description: Our enthusiastic 3rd graders attend a Title I school in the inner city of Philadelphia. Our wonderful students want to succeed academically and realize the dreams that they have for a bright future! In order to do so, they need nutritious snacks to help them get through the day and stay on task! Please help our students be the best they can be by getting off to a healthy new school year and learning the importance of nutritious snacking alternatives. This project is 'kid-inspired' by the need for our children to make nutritious snacking choices. Our students do want to eat healthier! However, the cost of eating healthy oftentimes limits their options. It is an everyday event for students to show up to school with a bag full of chips and sticky candy. For some students this 'meal' comprises their breakfast. As you can imagine, a breakfast such as this cannot provide their bodies with the sustenance needed to focus on their studies. It is imperative to provide our students with the nutritious food they need in order for them to be successful. Our students will learn to make the correlation between healthy eating and staying focused. They will keep an eating diary and measure how they feel at designated times throughout the day using a Likert scale. Snacks will be stored in accessible storage bins so that students may help themselves to a snack when they need one.
needStatement: My students need KIND Healthy Whole Grains Snack Granola Clusters, Quaker Chewy Granola Bars, Nutri-Grain-Kellogg's Cereal Bars and a Mobile 15-Bin Storage Center.

name: Renewable Energy, a Bright Future!
description: I will have 27 excited 4th grade students this year. Our school was recently approved to be the only STEM elementary school with a focus on engineering in our district. My students love to come to school to learn. Our school has over 400 students, we are not a Title 1 funded school so we do not receive many resources other schools may have. Our average class size range from 25 - 30 students. We have a strong parent group that supports our school and classroom teachers as we transition to a STEM school. My students will use the K'NEX Education Exploring Wind and Water Energy and K'NEX Education Renewable Energy Set to bring STEM concepts to life. These resources will offer so many opportunities for my students to start exploring and discovering the world of science and engineering!Students will work cooperatively in small groups to build, investigate, discuss and evaluate concepts, ideas and designs related to renewable energy. With a school/classroom focus on engineering these kits will allow my students the opportunity to use the engineering design process to solve the world's energy problem. These materials will allow my students the opportunity to solve energy problems using hands-on materials along with an inquiry based approach to learning. These skills are needed to be successful in the 21st century.
needStatement: My students need K'NEX Education - Renewable Energy Set and a K'NEX Education Exploring Wind and Water Energy.

name: Ms. O's 2nd Grade Owls
description: This coming school year (2016-2017) will be my fourth year teaching 2nd grade. I have been fortunate enough to teach ESL (English Second Language) for 2 years in a predominantly Hispanic classroom. Last year I had a diverse group of students in regards to abilities. This coming year, I am so excited to meet my students and see the array of different cultures, abilities, talents, and traits that will highlight my 2nd-grade classroom. Every school year, I begin by making sure my classroom includes 3 important characteristics: safe for all learners, bright and eye-catching (for student engagement), and comfortable. My students should be able to come to class each and every day and be excited to learn, comfortable to expand their minds and think outside the box (environmentally and socially speaking), and feel safe enough to open up and be a creative thinker and sharer. In such a diverse community of learners, I am able to really build our classroom around the students' cultures and backgrounds. I learn so much about others and in turn, I learn about myself through the eyes of each student. Teaching is my passion, but I will always consider learning to be my life. As the school year approaches, I hope to get my students the materials that they need in order to succeed. My classroom theme this year will be Owls. In order to give the students the accessories and tools they need, such as name tags for their desks, classroom rules, binders, and paper, I would like to make them themed and engaging for students! It will give them a sense of ownership and participation as a class and as a team. I would also like for my early childhood learners to feel a sense of pride in their work as it is displayed on classroom bulletin boards and school bulletin boards. Colorful bulletin board paper and border will make my students' work engaging and fun for them and the students in the other classes within the school.
needStatement: My students need materials such as binders, paper, and fabric, that will allow for them to engage in the class content and feel a sense of ownership and belonging.

name: Basic Needs to Succeed!
description: I currently teach students who have a passion for learning, but have limited resources. Being a new school does make it difficult to obtain basic classroom resources like all the other schools in the district. This is a huge hurdle that needs to be overcome. My students have to usually do their work on the floor or in the cafeteria where their work has to be spread out across the tables. My students do good quality work no matter where they are, however can you imagine what they could do with the proper classroom materials? My students would be performing better because they have adequate work space to utilize. These students deserve the same options as their peers in the district. Just because they are a small school, does not mean they shouldn't have access to quality resources and basic classroom furniture! If given the opportunity, my students would be able to accomplish more in the classroom by having all of their materials in one location. By moving much needed items from one place to another due to inadequate space to work, is extremely inconvenient for them! By providing my students with stopwatches so that they can focus on time frames of getting specific assignments completed, laminating pouches so that the items created in the classroom can be preserved for future use for different activities, the luggage tags make it more visual for my students to see where they are on the learning goals and scales on the different standards they are learning so that they can easily move their number from 1-4 and know what they mastered and what they still need to work on. The pencil sharpener will enable the students to keep going with their work, with very limited time to warts due to the pencil sharpener making their pencil usage more effective which will then lead to completing their work for efficiently! Learning goals are designed to help students see where they are in the classroom! With your assistance we can meet this need so that the students can focus on whet they need to learn in order to prepare for the next grade, and do it with confidence. These are basic needs that public school children have access to, however due to funding, charter schools need some extra assistance in order to obtain the things needed to succeed in education.
needStatement: My students need stopwatches, pencil sharpener, labels, tags, laminating pouches.

name: Let's Make My Classroom Cozy!
description: When my students come through our door each morning, they are ready and excited for a new day of exploring and learning. My students are 7 and 8 years old. They are full of energy and always on the go. They don't want to be confined to a desk all day! When I work I like to be comfortable on a couch or maybe a cozy chair. Young children are the same. My students will be allowed to choose a seat that is a comfortable work space for them! We have a high population of English Language Learners, and they need to feel at ease when collaborating with their peers. Being a young learner and having such high energy can cause behavior problems for some students if they are confined to one space for too long. By giving students the option of various seating, they will be able to do their best learning and minimize many behavior issues. We are a Title 1 school. One hundred percent of the students receive free breakfast and over 80 percent receive free or reduced lunch.I would like my students to have a relaxing, comfortable environment to learn. Everyone learns differently and that includes how we like to sit as we learn. My students will be allowed to choose where they sit as they learn throughout the day. Classrooms where students are given choices and are student centered are the most successful! I am asking for bean bag chairs, Gaiam Balance Ball Chairs, and Wobble Chairs. There are many benefits of alternative seating in a classroom setting. These will help those restless learners which will in turn eliminate many behavior issues. It will allow students to make choices that fit their learning style, and it will help to create an inviting atmosphere for all of the important learning that will happen this year!
needStatement: My students need Kore wobble chairs, Gaiam balance ball chairs, and Big Joe bean bag chairs.

name: Creating Amazing Avid Readers!
description: I teach in a very diverse community and have students in my class that come from many different socio-economic statuses and experiences. These experiences in turn effect their school lives and often rely on myself and one another to have a successful school year! My students come together to build an incredible classroom community. They range in age from 7-9 years old and have already been adapting to school for four years. Many of them love school and are excited to continue learning, while others struggle with learning. As an early childhood education teacher moving to third grade, I need to provide my students with a full and appropriate library. I wish to expose my students to engaging read aloud stories and leveled series books that they can fall in love with! Series books have been proven to help children grow as readers by following characters and plots across several books. Children tend to fall in love with particular characters and authors, which ultimately creates a reader who wants to read series books. As a teacher, it is wonderful to see these qualities in students because their volume in reading increases. Appropriate series books for third graders include The Magic Tree House, Cam Jansen, Marvin Redpost and many more! Many of my students do not have access to these texts at home and it is my goal to give them the gift of reading in school!
needStatement: My students need appropriate books to further their reading development. Such texts include amazing read alouds and leveled series sets.

name: Leading With Literacy
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things simple and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. C.B Watson Primary is located in Warner Robins, GA near Warner Robins Air Force Base. The majority of our students are on free and reduced breakfast and lunch. I am a firm believer that their should not and will not determine their potential. Gone are the days of sitting at a desk when coming to school. Kids like to move around the classroom and engage in meaningful fun activities. The supplies requested will help ensure that my students are actively engaged and learning at the same time. Phonics and literacy are two passions of mine and the material requested will help me give the best to my students. Worksheets just won't do when you have students that need multiple ways to learn and the Fishing for Sight Words game along with magnetic boards will greatly assist with that. We are ready and excited!
needStatement: My students need Magnetic Fishing Poles and Magnetic Word Building Boards that will help increase their phonics skills as well as literacy.

name: Exercising Our Minds with an Exercise Ball!
description: We don't all learn the same way, but we all love to learn! Our classroom is made up of a diverse group of students with different backgrounds, languages, and ethnicities, as well as a variety of interests, skills, and physical capabilities. The inclusion of students with special needs makes our students and teachers all around better people from the inside out! We all learn from each other daily and have a campus mentality that encourages loves and inclusion of others!My students need a set of large stability balls to use in our 4th grade math and science rooms as chairs. Using exercise balls in place of traditional chairs has been shown to improve learning by keeping students' brains and bodies actively engaged. They are also a great way to help students who have a higher energy level to focus while in class. By having a quiet way to release that energy, they are better able to concentrate while learning. The purchase of stability balls would provide all of our students with a fun way to increase their focus and improve their learning!
needStatement: My students need a set of stability balls to use for chairs in their math and science classes.

name: Growing Healthy Food and Minds
description: My class is a small but mighty group of little learners. They love to come to school and see what new things we are going to learn. School is a place where many of them come to forget about their everyday troubles, get a healthy meal, feel safe, and just be kids. Many of students receive free or reduced meals and backpacks from our food pantry. My students are so excited to come to school and discover new things everyday. I want to be able to give them opportunities to learn and be anything they want to be. My students' idea is to be able to learn about being healthy and growing their own food. They want to be able to learn more about healthy living, so they can share with their friends and families. My students get so excited when we plant our small class garden and seeing all the things we have read about in real life. My Kinders are very hands-on learners and have so much energy. With the 'Be Choosy, Be Healthy Activity Kit,' my students will learn about healthy nutrition and physical activities. The kit will also help them to build their gross motor skills by teaching them to be active daily. We will also use the 'Food and Nutrition Theme Box' to learn in a hands-on way about what foods and how much we should eat. We love to cook in our classroom and knowing what foods are good for us will be very beneficial. My students are the most excited about the 'Growing Things Theme Box' because they get to grow some of the healthy foods they will be learning about. They love to see how much each plant has grown and share with everyone. 'Mrs. Jones look how tall our tomato plants are!' 'Now they have blooms and will have tomatoes soon!' These are my favorite things to hear from my students because they get to experience in real life what they have read or heard in books!Please help fund our project, so we can share our learning with our friends and families. We would also like to use our knowledge during our Science Fair when the community comes to our school to see what we have been learning. Thank you for helping us learn and grow!
needStatement: My students need the 'Be Choosy Be Healthy Activity Kit'and theme boxes so they can learn about making healthy choices. It will also help us as we work toward growing our school garden.

name: Movement in the Classroom
description: I teach 3rd grade in a low income school in southwest Minnesota. My classroom is very diverse with EL, SPED, and mainstream students. This year I will have 25 students in my classroom. Our school does not have air conditioning so it is hard to keep the students focused during the hot days back to school. I recently contained my masters in Teaching and Learning, and did my research on Movement in the Classroom. With this research, I concluded that movement while learning is essential for students to be able to stay focus and retain information. Students were less distracted and were less fidgety while learning. I was able to witness a huge change in both my students and my classroom atmosphere. During my research, I implemented different movement breaks every 20 minutes and allowed students to work standing, leaning against tables, laying on the ground, or whatever was comfortable to them. It was the best decision I have made in my five years of teaching. When I first implemented my research ,my students loved the movement they were receiving throughout their lesson. They were no longer sitting in their desk for long periods of time and they were able to stay focused for longer. My students said they saw less distractions in the classroom while learning and they were able to retain information easier. I was so happy with their response to my research and that they were able to notice the same results as me! They also enjoyed being able to learn while moving instead of sitting stationary all the time. Not only did my students notice a change but the parents did also. My students went home and the parents noticed that their child was excited to go back to school and was excited about being able to choose how to learn in class. I was so pumped during conferences and hearing from parents about my research. I was only able to get five rockers so it was hard for every student to get to sick on theses rockers while learning. My students have voiced the importance of everyone of them having one and how much they would benefit from not having to switch out seats and waiting on their chance to get to sit on one.
needStatement: My students need constant movement with these rocker chairs during learning to allow blood to be flowing throughout their body with using these rockers.

name: Hopping into Health
description: My students are amazing young men and women who strive for excellence every single day. Many of my students come from low socioeconomic families and are not afforded the opportunities of many of their peers. My students make teaching fun and exciting. I enjoy their enthusiasm for learning and physical education. My students come to school everyday excited and ready to embark on a new journey. Even with the many hardships my students face they come to school everyday with smiles on their faces ready to learn and prosper. My students had a wonderfully idea of starting our schools first annually hopscotch tournament between the grade levels. After weeks of sitting with many of my 3rd-5th grade girls, and asking them about different activities they would enjoy participating in during PE, hopscotch came up. They racked their brains for weeks trying to figure out how they would be able to launch their project. They thought about painting the hopscotch squares on the black top and even using jump ropes to make the boxes. They finally came up with the idea of letting each team draw their own hopscotch squares using chalk. I thought it was a wonderful idea that could help get my students who weren't so motivated by PE active and excited about participating everyday.
needStatement: My students need sidewalk chalk in order to conduct a grade level hopscotch tournament.

name: Sphero's & Phys. Education class.
description: My students are in the inner city of Minnesota. We are a 9-12th-grade school with over 2,000 students. The school is very diverse from refugees, ELL and locally students. All students are required to take Health and Physical Education to graduate in Minnesota . All students need Health and Physical Education to graduate this is just a tool to help ease the stress of Physical Education. We know not all students look forward to being in Phys. Education class and by bringing Coding into the classroom it can be another way to engage students. Students are in loving with CODING. Having a Sphero in the classroom will engage more students in CODING and using it in Physical Education class. The students can't wait to have the Sphero's play soccer or basketball on the gym floor. A Sphero is a app-enabled robotic ball for your iPad. Students will be able to play, race against, learn more about coding and particiapte in a different way in Physical Education class. I can see students taking the Sphero's outside to race against them on the track outside of the school. Who doesn't like to race against someone or a robot in Physical Education class.
needStatement: My students need Sphero's. Coding is becoming very popular in classrooms and Phys Education class is another place that CODING can play a huge part in getting students engaged in Physical Education.

name: Moving While We Work!
description: Lively, energetic, and kind are three words I would use describe my young learners. Every day they do their best to achieve all they can. My students desperately want to be actively involved in what they do in the classroom. Living in a large city can be difficult for many young children. My young learners live close to the downtown area in our city. They go to a Title I school where they receive free breakfast and lunch daily. Their basic food needs, except for dinner, are taken care of, but now they need something to sustain their minds. Last year we had Kore Wobble Chairs funded. They worked wonders to help my very active students. Every day they asked when we would be getting more seating like these chairs. 'Moving while we work helps us think better and work smarter' is what my students say about our activity chairs. So, today, inspired by these awesome and enlightened children I'm requesting more chairs that help my students be active and move while they work. While searching for more chairs which promote the movement of students, which is exactly what they need, I came across the Wirk Stamina Orbiter Stiders. Students will be able to choose to use these at a seat daily. The Striders will help them move not only core muscles like the chairs, but they will be actively moving their leg muscles. Each day, students will actively work their core muscles for a minimum of 60 minutes. They will also have the opinion of working out their led muscles. I can't wait until our items are delivered so I can hear their excitement, just lie last year. 'So cool Ms. P., can we all move while we work!'
needStatement: My students need Gaiam balance ball chairs, Stamina Wirk Orbit Striders, and Regency Glow Stools.

name: The Odyssey
description: The students at Crestwood Elementary School are much more than ordinary. They are loving, clever, motivated, and tireless learners. These are kids who walk into school every day, regardless of how much breakfast they could afford to eat or how much sleep they were able to get, and they are ready to commit themselves to learning. I never would have believed to find so many students that have an unconditional love for school. Please help me fulfill my goals to make my classroom the best learning space possible!The document camera is the chalkboard of the 21st century. What better way to model an activity or share student thinking? I'm excited to add this technology to my buzzing classroom. I am in need of magnetic write and wipe boards and other engaging reading centers that will keep my lively students excited to learn and participate in the classroom. These reading comprehension activities look incredible! I love how they already supply a book to root the lesson with. Cuddos Lakeshore Learning! Last but not least, this table top whiteboard will be put to good use! I would love to utilize a whiteboard while working with small math groups or guided reading groups. This one is the perfect size!
needStatement: My students need a document camera, magnetic write and wipe boards and other engaging reading comprehension activities to utilize during centers.

name: Getting Healthier Through Exercise!
description: My students are enthusiastic learners and are beginning to understand and appreciate their environment and the world they live in. They enjoy hands-on activities. They appreciate anything that is donated to our class. Our projects are 'kid inspired' because my students eagerly give their ideas on materials they would like for our classroom. My students need to live healthier lives and learning to ride a tricycle will help them accomplish this. They look forward to this project being funded and receiving the materials. My students have requested the tricycles in this project to help them become more active and be able to develop large muscles. My students want to learn how to master riding a tricycle so that they can eventually learn to ride a 2 wheeler. We are requesting these materials so that they can learn to develop larger muscles, balance and coordination. I am super excited to get these materials donated and look forward to my students getting fit and living healthier. I want to get their little feet moving and enjoy exercising as well. I also want to continue building on the idea of taking turns and sharing.
needStatement: My students need 2 Jumbo Trikes(tricycles) and 1 School Trike(tricycle) to live healthier and happier lives.

name: One Size Does NOT Fit All: Hokki Stool	(Part 2)
description: As the beginning of the school year approaches, I am always looking for new and exciting ways to motivate my students. My students experience a large range of academic needs. One way to meet the needs of all students is to create an environment that promotes collaboration and student choice. My students come from hard working families in a high poverty part of the city. English is spoken as a second language in most families. My students have unlimited enthusiasm and strive to give their best each and every day. I want my students to be engaged by having unique and exciting resources. My students have been requesting for more options when it comes to seating at their desk. With the Hokki stools, students can sway and wiggle on these stools and not disrupt the other students. My students will be able to move around and be comfortable while still remaining focused. These stools will give the most active students the opportunity to be under control yet active during classroom lessons and activities. These Hokki stools are a great way to combine learning and exercise. Students sit for the majority of the day and these stools will help them remain active even while sitting. The convex base allows for movement in all directions. These chairs also help the students build core strength. A classroom should be a comfortable place. My students will be able to stay focused and not worry about getting told to stop rocking the chair because it is not safe. My ultimate goal would be to have a stool for each student in my class. By donating to this project, you will be allowing the students that have difficulty sitting still in class, the chance to move around while still learning. Thank you so much for supporting our project.
needStatement: My students need Hokki stools so they can move around while staying seated.

name: Getting Fit While Getting Smarter
description: My colleagues and I are a team of teachers who are all passionate about creating a healthy, enriching atmosphere for all of our high poverty/low income students. Our students are readers, writers, creators, and dreamers. Our students face challenges both in and out of the classroom; however, they continue to be resilient with their academic, social, and emotional well-being. Despite the many challenges they face, we aim to create classrooms that will engage, excite, and motivate them to succeed. Our shared goal is to create classrooms that are a reflection of us all. Our students represent the diverse community surrounding our school. They are children of immigrants and children of long-time residents. They speak multiple languages and represent cultures from all over the world. Nearly 80% of them receive free or reduced-price lunch. Many of them will be the first in their families to attend college- ask any of them and they'll tell you that's where they're headed! Our school is a unique and wonderful community of involved families, committed leadership, and passionate teachers. We have our share of challenges, but we support one another and act as a team with one goal in mind- the success of our students. Donations to this project will impact both how our students learn and what they learn. All items on this list were suggested by fifth grade students. With the items donated to our classrooms, our students will enter their classrooms each day to a calming, welcoming, and healthy environment. Having alternative choices for seating will allow students to choose the type of seating that best fits their learning style to maximize their learning engagement and wellness. For example: pedal chairs will help kinesthetic learners move their bodies throughout the day and maintain their focus. The pillows and alternative seats will allow students to be comfortable and focused on their learning. Having water bottles near their desks will encourage students to properly fuel their bodies and brains throughout the day. A large majority of our student population live in trailers behind the school, take vans to and from homeless shelters, or are between homes. Having access to clean, fresh water all day will help them stay hydrated and focused! Students who are comfortable in their environment will be more excited to be in school and their overall well-being will improve!
needStatement: My students need mini pedal leg exercisers, beanless chairs, balance balls, water bottles, and flexible chair cushions in order to promote health and fitness on a daily basis!

name: Help us Wiggle While We Work!
description: The students at my inner city Milwaukee Public School are simply amazing. They come to school each day excited to learn and to show off how successful they are in their learning. It breaks my heart to know that over 90% of the students at my school live in high poverty. I want to be able to provide my students with everything they want and more. Our school's focus is 'Personalized Learning' and I want to make learning a personal, fun and exciting experience for all of them. A lot of my students learn kinesthetically by moving their bodies around. It helps them stay focused and ready to take on any new challenge! :)One of my students last year had a wiggle seat and EVERYONE wanted to sit on it. We actually had to take it away because it was a distraction to other students. They all wanted their own! A few of them suggested that I purchase more for the whole class. In my project I am requesting a wiggle seat for all of my students! This way they can come to school and choose how they want to sit comfortably in our classroom. Allowing my students to move around and 'wiggle' while they learn will help them to stay calm, focussed, and ready to take on the day! The yoga balls will be used as a reward for students during whole group time to have optional seating while we are on the rug. I want to make sure all of my students get a chance to use this wonderful equipment.
needStatement: My students need wiggle seats to help them stay focussed as they learn! Many students need extra movement to help calm their bodies in order to stay on task and learn best.

name: Fit Bodies ~ Smart Minds
description: My students come to PE expecting to play sports on a daily basis. For a lot of them they see sports as a way out of their neighborhoods. I enjoy bringing different activities to them to help broaden their vision and I love when they tell me how much they enjoyed the lesson! Many years ago, I was a student at this school. I love the warm, family environment that still exists today! I always knew that I would be back someday! Working at a Title I school where at least 70% are on free and reduced-price lunch is such a rewarding experience! As we do more and more floor work, my students constantly complain that their backs hurt on the floor! Since I do exercise with them at times, I know that to be true! We would actually use the mats multiple times throughout the year: for exercise, for fitness testing, and for after-school PoundFit classes that will bring together students, teachers, and parents! My students have the opportunity to create movement sequences and having the mats will open up new opportunities in those lessons! I know that if we were to receive the mats, they would be extremely excited to not have to share mats or just exercise on the floor! Thank you so much for considering to donate to our youth!
needStatement: My students need a class set of mats so that they don't have to exercise on the concrete and tile floors. I have been incorporating more and more exercise floor work and this would help!

name: Writers in the Making
description: My students are creative, clever and strive to learn and grow. Many of them are being raised in single parent households, qualify for free or reduced-price lunch and are unable to afford school supplies. When my students enter their classroom each day, my job is to encourage them to be as successful as possible. I can not control their home lives; however, I can certainly control their experiences during the school day, by encouraging them in a caring and positive way to be the best they can be. We do not have a functional pencil sharpener in my classroom and these 2 X-ACTO electric pencil sharpeners would be wonderful additions for my students to use! My 5th grade students will be writing a lot of informational and opinion pieces this year and they need to have sharp pencils readily available for them to use in the classroom and at home. The students go through a lot of pencils in the course of a year and a reliable pencil sharpener will allow me to keep my students pencils sharp and at the ready for all their creative writing assignments.
needStatement: My students need pencil sharpeners that can sharpen pencils to help them 'sharpen' their writing skills!

name: Can I Sit On That?
description: I have a mixed group of 6 and 7 years old who have a wide range of interests and abilities. I teach students who still haven't learned all their letters and sounds, to students who are reading a year or two above grade level. This makes it challenging to have enough high interest books that are at a variety of reading levels. One thing that is true about all my students is that they all want to learn, and they are excited to learn. My students ask me all the time, 'When can we get more of those wiggle stools?' I received 2 Hokki Stools last year, but it isn't enough! My students wait patently for their day to use the 'wiggle' stool. They have asked me over and over again when can we ask for some more wiggle stools? The students using the stools are so focused during work time. They move just enough to get the wiggles out but don't distract others. While sitting in the stools, the students muscles are constantly engaged. Students have to keep balanced on the stool, or they'll fall off. They have learned to take responsibility to pass the stools on to their neighbor, and then they have to wait almost two weeks to use it again. By adding two more stools, students would get more chances to move each week.
needStatement: My students need 2 Hokki stools to move while they work!

name: Take Your Seat (or Not)!
description: Our school is in a rural setting, but only a few miles from a bustling city and military base. We are a diverse community that welcomes new faces quite often, so providing a comfortable and inviting classroom is high on my priorities list!My students are movers and shakers, and always ready to exercise their budding independence. They are observant, inquisitive, and conscientious - eager to do what they can for me and their classmates. Lack of funds for supplies, extra materials or projects is a constant for us, but these kids will give their last dime to another in need. I feel privileged to be their teacher and will do whatever I can to give them the learning environment and experiences they so deserve.I was introduced to the idea of alternative seating last spring. To be honest, my first response was, 'How is it not chaos?', but, I did a trial run with the kids, and was pleasantly surprised to see the collaboration, behavior improvement (less off-task chatting) and focus that occurred. Being able to choose or change seats is such a simple idea to enhance learning and cooperation - yet not the usual option in classrooms. Research, talks with colleagues, and many Pinterest pins have convinced me that this is a no-brainer. Our workspaces will include cushion floor mats and yoga balls, a stand-up table, crate seats, low to the floor tables and the customary desk and chair for those who prefer that. Each student has a personal cubby space of their own, but community supplies will be stationed throughout the room.
needStatement: My students need cushioned floor mats, yoga balls, and portable writing tools: class sets of dry erase boards, markers, erasers, clipboards, and a battery operated pencil sharpener to avoid having to plug in.

name: Yoga in the Classroom!
description: My students are from the inner city. They are 100% African American. Our school is an African Immersion school, so 99% of the school is African American. We focus a lot as a school on the wants of Doctor Martin Luther King Jr. when he was alive. So we practice what we call the Kingian Values. This year we are going to incorporate more art into the curriculum to try and curve some behavior issues and increase our academic drive. My students love to be active. They love to get their energy out while exploring their bodies. They want better furniture and to be able to move around more. These yoga ball chairs will be a perfect solution to these problems. Who wouldn't feel a little better about doing a math problem while being able to bounce at the same time? Also the yoga mats will help my students get exercise in using a website called gonoodle.com. On that website there is a page filled with yoga videos. Also I will be able to help them relieve school stresses by leading them through stretches to keep their day going smoothly!
needStatement: My students need yoga mats and yoga ball chairs to use in the classroom.

name: My Students Want to Target Movement
description: Do you ever feel like it's hard to sit still? My students do! We all do! Sitting still is hard for anyone, especially students with attention difficulties, and I do not expect them to do so. I have asked my wonderful students how I can better help them to learn. Their answer is always, 'Let us move! We're tired of sitting all day!' They do not want to sit at a desk all day. They have stated that it makes them feel tired and bored. My students want to move as they learn! This project is their way of trying to solve that problem. They have seen other students using ball chairs, wiggle seats, balance boards and standing desks. They have expressed a need and want for those items, as well. They ask, 'Why don't we have those items?' Their solution to the problem is ask for support. As a classroom, we have received many wonderful supplies through DonorsChoose.org, so my students and I are writing this kid-inspired project. Active seating options allow for movement all day, everyday! It's also a wonderful way to keep the body going and the brain growing. An active body is equal to an active brain! Adding standing desks and stability ball chairs to our classroom will allow kids to choose the tool they feel will help them the best. It's empowering and motivating! This project was inspired by my amazing students. They have expressed the need and want to move while they work. I asked my students what tools they would like to have. They said, 'Any thing that lets us get up and move!' They really like the balance chairs that we have been able to try out. They also asked for taller tables that they could stand at when needed. With the help of the balance ball chairs, my students feel that they will be able to wiggle, bounce and balance in their seats, just as they have requested. Also if they need and want to stand to learn, they would be able to use the standing desk to help them with that. They are motivated and hard workers just looking for a way to help them get their wiggles out to be able to learn. Thank you for your consideration to support my active students and their inspired project.
needStatement: My students need 2 stand up desks and 4 balance ball chairs to get them moving while they are learning.

name: We Like to Move It, Move It!
description: The students at our school are vivacious and loving. Nearly all of them come from homes that are living below the poverty line. There is a large amount of crime in their neighborhood. All of these stressors in their lives means that they come to school with a lot of baggage. Many of our students are reading below grade level and we work very hard each day to improve their reading outcomes and help them to develop a love of reading. We are in our third week of school and I am already seeing that 30 minutes of recess is not enough time for my students to move. I want my students to be active at least 60 minutes each day so that they can focus better and be healthy. I spoke with my students about how we can accomplish this and one idea that they had was to get hokki stooks for our classrooms. Some of my students had these chairs in their classroom last year and they said that they allowed them to move around while they worked. I can tell that my students are dying to move but it is hard for them to get that movement when they are sitting at their desks. I'm also requesting a variety of fidgets because my students say that they are tapping pencils and making noises because they need to do something with their hands. Having hokki stools and fidgets will allow my students to get the movement and exercise they need and also contribute to a more productive classroom environment.
needStatement: My students need Hokki stools and fidgets so they can move!

name: Let's Wiggle While We Work!
description: My students are a bunch of active second graders that love to wiggle as they work. Our school is located in beautiful northeast Georgia foothills of the Appalachian Mountains. Our school houses only first and second grades and it is full of energy. My students are eager to learn and come to my class ready to be challenged. Because of their eagerness, I am also challenged to provide them with the best ways of learning possible. We will soar together to meet this challenge. This kid-inspired project evolved from the students' desire to have alternative seating in our classroom. They saw Hokki stools in other classrooms and asked why we didn't have them in our classroom. The students want Hokki stools in our classroom so that they too can be active learners. Currently, we do not have alternative seating in my classroom for my students to release energy throughout the school day. Alternative seating in the classroom motivates and inspires students to be excited about learning. Imagine sitting still all day in a chair. Research shows that when students are active, their brains are active allowing them to learn even more. Having several Hokki stools in our classroom will not only allow students to use them for sixty minutes a day, they will be able to use them throughout the entire school day. Students will use Hokki stools for reading, completing assignments, and creating a masterpiece. This project was inspired by my students because they want alternative seating to be more active while they learn. The Hokki stools will allows students to wiggle and release energy. The Hokki stools will not only be used for 60 minutes each day but will be used throughout the entire school day allowing students to move while they work.
needStatement: My students need Hokki stools to stay active for 60 minutes a day while they work.

name: Growing Our Own
description: I get to teach a great group of students. They are independent problem solvers who love to have fun. In our classroom, students spend the year learning how to take charge of their learning and work to feel responsible for themselves and for their classmates. Our students are excited and curious about the world and what they can do to make it a better place. They love hands-on learning and love taking their learning out into the community through service learning projects and project based learning. This past year at our school we had our largest gardening days yet. Fifth grade students went out to each grade level for two days of gardening. One for planting seedlings and another for taking those seedlings into the garden. Students loved working with other students and getting their hands dirty in the planting process. Sadly, many of these seedlings weren't able to stay at our school because we didn't have enough room for all of them. We are requesting a GrowLab to be used school-wide so more of our students can see the wonder of gardening. This GrowLab will be used in support of the gardening days that we do school-wide in the spring. Additionally, students have been wondering about what kinds of food can be grown in the winter. We will use our new GrowLab to ask those questions and find out what sorts of vegetables we can grow over the long Minnesota winters.
needStatement: My students need a GrowLab, light bulbs, and plant trays for indoor gardening.

name: Number the Stars
description: My students attend my resource reading class in order to bring up their reading levels to be more successful in school, and in the life. Most of my students have a hard time staying focused in school while in class, and my goal is to make them feel that they are in a safe learning environment where they don't have to feel judged. I teach at a Title I middle school in an urban neighborhood. Seventy-four percent of our students qualify for free or reduced rate lunches. Many come from very technology-poor homes. My students love technology and topics where they can discuss issues and express opinions. My school lacks the technology to meet my students’ needs, and I am concerned that their lack of exposure will not prepare them for the technology fluency requirements in high school. My goal is to create a classroom environment where students are motivated by technology to improve their literacy and communication skills. The best way to get lost is in a good book, and my students are struggling readers at different levels. Almost all of my students pick books based on the covers, and I want to show them it's not the outside of the book that matters. It's what's on the inside that matters. With the requested copies of Number the Stars, my students will be able to plot the story on a story map. They will also be able to make connections to the past, based on this book.
needStatement: My students need 40 copies of the book 'Number the Stars'

name: We Want To Be On Target While Moving!
description: My students are always asking to get away from their desks and sit in another part of my class, which usually means the rug area. After about a 1/2 hour, I see them fighting over wall space because their backs start hurting. Students are always asking me 'can we sit on the rug?', 'can I work in the library area on the pillow?', 'Can I sit in the teacher chair?' I want to get them up and moving while learning, They inspired me to find flexible seating options for them to work, since I hear them everyday asking to sit somewhere other than their desk with a hard chair. They want and ask to move around during the day. 86% of our students receive free or reduced lunch. Our students come from a very diverse family life. Each day many students come into school with very mixed emotions that they are forced to put aside to learn the curriculum. Our students are part of a Title 1 school. We are in our third year of an extended school day, which means they are in school for an extra 100 minutes a day. My students are always asking me to leave their desk area and to find a more comfortable place to sit besides their hard chair. I am constantly hearing students ask me 'Can I leave my desk area to find a different place to work?',' Can I go work on the rug?' 'Can I sit in your morning meeting chair?'. They want to move around, they want different areas to sit. My students want to learn but they want to be comfortable while learning. I was inspired by their daily requests to find them those flexible seating areas to learn on a soft spot. I often see them wiggling in their seats because they want to move around and to be relaxed during assignments. The Glow Stools will allow my active students to sit during reading groups and still be able to move around without disturbing other students. The bean bag chairs will let students read comfortably in the library area without sitting on the hard floor. Finally, the balance ball chairs will allow students with sensory processing disorders to stay focused and to get their brains engaged. All this movement will allow for alertness and attention in the classroom while giving them the comfortable seating options they are asking me to provide them.
needStatement: My students need two bean bag chairs, two balance ball chairs, and three glow stools to sit in instead of chairs.

name: Kid-Inspired School Garden Phase 2
description: I have a classroom full of very caring fifth-grade students who love to learn new things. Over 27% of my students have learning and/or behavioral disabilities. I need to keep their attention by varying the activities in the classroom. I want my students to have every opportunity to learn by using every possible piece of technology. Our small southern Indiana school is a school-wide Title I facility in which funds are limited. Close to 350 students attend our elementary school. When I asked my students what we needed to make our school healthier, they told me more garden space! My students want to make a Phase 2 of the school garden. The students asked me to help them write down a list of what we needed to make their Phase 2 Garden dream come true. Phase 2 will be 256 square feet of lasagna garden style composted raised bed garden spots. They drew pictures of what it would look like. The students need a rain barrel to collect rain water. The peat soil pellets will be used to grow seeds in our greenhouse. Students will need plant clips and Velcro plant stem ties to support plant stems onto the tomato stakes. The garden pruning shears are needed to prune the flowers, vegetables, fruits, and bushes. The critters will be kept out of the garden by using the critter control fences. My students are excited about growing their own healthy food and eating it. Growing herbs and using them in their food will help them to eat healthier! They made a list of what they wanted to grow in their garden. They are going to be healthier because they are going to get to take their garden food home to eat.
needStatement: My students need a rain barrel, Velcro plant stem ties, plants clips, peat soil pellets, herb seeds, elevated garden beds for herb garden, garden pruning shears, critter fence, and tomato stakes.

name: Teaching Healthy Eating Through Cooking Club.
description: My students are in grades fourth through eighth, 100% qualify for free lunch; a large amount of my students are or were English Language Learners. My school also has a large refugee population from all over the world. Life is not easy for most of my students. I love my students and I want the best for them. My students really want to have an after school cooking club to learn how to cook and make healthy dishes, but we do not have the funds to start a program. This project was inspired by my students. There have been several students that have talked to me about their interest in cooking, and have told me that they would really like to learn how to cook. Our school does not offer home economics so these students have not learned many cooking skills, or information about nutrition. Many of my students do not have healthy eating habits, because they have not been taught how to eat and prepare healthy food. Coming from low socioeconomic families, most of their families have to eat cheaply, which can mean not healthy. Several students have told me that they would like to learn how to cook healthy foods so they can share their new skills and knowledge with their families. Our school has a kitchen in our Teachers' Lounge that we will be able to use, but we do not have any kitchen supplies to cook or bake with. They asked for pots and pans, bakeware, cooking utensils, blender, food processor, ceramic mugs, knifes, cutting boards, mixing bowls, pot holders, dish cloths, and other cooking supplies to start their club. When talking to some students about having a cooking club, they were really excited and said that they want to learn how to prepare healthy food, bake and cook it. We are lucky to have a previous Home Economics teacher at our school who has also volunteered to cosponsor the cooking club with me if we are able to get funding for this project. I know that our students will learn the skills and knowledge they need to create healthy food for themselves and their families. Please help our school start a cooking club! It would mean so much to my students and me!
needStatement: My students need pots and pans, bakeware, cooking utensils, blender, food processor, ceramic mugs, knifes, cutting boards, mixing bowls, pot holders, dish cloths, and other cooking supplies.

name: Wobble While You Work
description: I have 18 culturally diverse students. We are part of a Title One school where everyone gets free breakfast and lunch. Many of our students come from poverty stricken homes and need more than an education from me. They need love and support as well. This group is extra special because last year I had 13 of them in my first grade class and now I have the opportunity to move up with them and teach them in second grade. My kids need to move. Second graders are not able to sit still all day. They have built up energy that has to be let out through the day. We have tried wobble chairs and balance ball seats in our classroom and they want more. They beg for the chance to sit in these seats but we do not enough for everyone. Balance ball, and wobble chairs aren't just a 'cool' place to sit, they give my kids a chance to move while they are working. They also help to strengthen their core and help them to have better posture. When my students sit on these seats they are able to bounce or wobble just enough to keep them focused so they want more in our classroom. They ask for more all the time. They promise to work even harder if they are able to move!
needStatement: My students need wobble chairs, balance ball chairs, and wobble cushions for active seating.

name: Como Se Dice...? How Do You Say...?
description: 'Como se dice?' is the beautiful question I hear all day in my classroom. It comes from the curious student seeking information and wanting to create their own language. Every year, we have to replace our class set of Spanish-English dictionaries because of overuse from the previous year. My students are thirsting to know more vocabulary in Spanish. They are curious and creative language learners. They want to be able to communicate their thoughts and ideas; however, as beginners, they are limited in their access to new vocabulary. They often want to say something using unfamiliar vocabulary and Spanish-English dictionaries will be the key tool to guide my students in their quest. Many students love to create in Spanish. Whether it's performing skits, writing children's books, or delivering a newscast, they never cease to amaze me with their enthusiasm and creativity. I find it imperative for a language learner to be able to properly use a Spanish-English dictionary. With this fundamental skill and an understanding of basic sentence structure, a student can explore the Spanish language and express themselves in ways they couldn't before. Learning a foreign language is an essential skill in the 21st century, and I believe that my students deserve every resource that they can get to help them be successful in their journey. You have an opportunity to make an impact on some of the most motivated people I have ever met. New dictionaries will open their minds to even more creativity and knowledge and will provide them with the tools necessary to excel.
needStatement: My students need 30 Spanish-English dictionaries so they can have the necessary resources to create their own language.

name: Brains Work Better With Exercise
description: I teach 8th grade science in an inner-city school. My kids come from all different kinds of backgrounds, we truly are a melting pot. Despite all of the hardships that some of my students face, they come to school wanting to do well. A lot of my students come to school wanting to learn, but don't have the supplies that they need to be successful. My kids are thinkers, inquirers, and risk-takers. They push through obstacles to achieve their best every day. They strive to achieve great things. My kids are awesome!Exercise pedals will allow my students to release their extra energy in a healthy and productive way so they can channel their attention to learning. My students (especially during 7th hour) need to move! We are also in need to clipboards so we can get up, get outside, and learn about science! Because I teach Earth Science, we do many labs outside. Having clipboards would allow my students to stay organized while being able to move around to do lab work. Research shows that movement and cognition have a strong correlation. By being able to provide under the desk exercise pedals I can help my students be more successful by staying in the classroom instead of getting in trouble because they need to move around. Also, by having clipboards available to each of my students, they can explore the wonderful world of science outside while still being productive!
needStatement: My students need exercise pedals and a set of clipboards.

name: Getting Our Youngest Learners Organized!
description: Kindergarten students are amazing! They come to school each day excited to learn. The classroom becomes their home away from home. I have not met my students yet for the upcoming school year, but some characteristics of kindergarten students will always be the same. They will be full of energy and excitement. They will be eager to learn and make new friends. They will come from diverse backgrounds but will be best friends with anyone who is nice. They will want to feel important and will share their thoughts with anyone who will listen. They will strive to be independent. It is my job as an educator to make sure these students have the very best first school experience!A typical kindergarten classroom does not have desks to organize the student's belongings. My old classroom had a fabulous large cubby for the students to independently manage all of their supplies and learning materials. Unfortunately, my new classroom does not have this wonderful piece of furniture. My current classroom is in need of a large cubby where each student will have their own spot to put items such as their school supply box, reading books, writing journal, whisper phone, math journal, and all their special projects and work. Currently, I have to house all of these items in bins scattered around my classroom. This becomes visual clutter and a management nightmare! The challenging part is the time it takes for me to individually pass out the items every time we need them. If you know anything about kindergarten students, you know they do not have the attention span to wait long. We have to keep things moving!!!If there was a large cubby in my classroom the students could take care of all their own items. This not only fosters independence, but it gives each student a place to call their own. The time saved in not passing out and collecting materials can be used for learning!!!!
needStatement: My students need a large classroom cubby to organize their personal supplies and learning materials.

name: Kid Inspired Seating Is A Good Target
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things simple and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. They love to read and love lots of positive attention. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their growth and how far they will go while they are with me. I may not be able to help them with their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. By doing this in a creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our earliest learners to continue on a path of academic excellence. My kids deserve everything they want and more! They want some fun seating! So I intend to try to get them just that!My kids want some good seating options. They said 'they want Hokki stools and yoga balls.' I thought that yoga balls would be to unsafe until I saw they come with chairs too! How awesome would that be to have these chairs for my kids. They would be so excited to sit in something comfortable for a change. They have asked me several times to get them Hokki stools and balance disks. They have also asked for yoga balls and I was very hesitant but they talked me into it!I want to give my students everything they want and more! They would be so surprised if I showed up with Hokki stools and yoga balls! Having these alternate seating options in my classroom will give my students extra added activity in the classroom, giving them extra movement and core stabilization to focus more on learning. Once they 'get the wiggles out,' they can concentrate more on what they are learning and in turn do better in their academics.
needStatement: My students need Hokki stools and yoga balls with chairs as alternative seating!

name: Rocking Into 3rd Grade
description: My students are engaged and eager to learn. I set high expectations and it is my job to give them the tools they need to reach those expectations. My students are critical and creative thinkers, they are energetic and like to move around and most of all they want to learn and do their best. Our students are encouraged to questions, imagine possibilities, work collaboratively, create innovative solutions; and always look for ways to improve. Our school is a high needs school with 75% of our students receiving free or reduced lunch. My students have requested new seats so they have option other then hard chairs to sit in all day. We've discussed how different seating options will allow them to move while doing their work. These materials will allow movement while they work to keep them active and engaged. These are two of the seating options that they want to see in our classroom. Having a variety of seating options will allow each student to take responsibility in their choices of work space. The movement of each item will allow them to fidget without distracting others. I'm requesting the rocking chair so they can rock while reading independently. The stability pads will add cushion to the hard chairs or floor while allowing the students to work their core and move around.
needStatement: My students need a variety of seating choices to keep them focused and engaged.

name: On Target For A Healthy And Active Learning Experience
description: We are located in southeastern Kentucky at a low income school. My students are excited to be learning new skills and beginning to read. My school is a Title I school with about seventy-eight percent being free or reduced price lunch. These students need resources to help them be more active. My students love to move and to be active when they learning! A lot of my students fidget at their seats because they want to be active. I would love to get these under the desk pedals to give them the opportunity to move their legs while they are learning. An in class trampoline would also be a wonderful opportunity for students to be rewarded and it be a healthy reward. In class this year, we have discussed how we can be more active and involve more movement in our learning. I asked the kids for ideas on what they thought would work best to give them the best learning experiences. One of my students said another teacher had a trampoline that they got to jump on when they did something great. Another student said sometimes I just can't keep my feet still. Students also mentioned the need to get up and move sometimes. A healthy and active learning experience will let students excel at whatever they put their mind to! The students being involved in decision making ,such as letting me know what they thought was needed, got me to thinking about how I could get these supplies for my students. My students wanted me to ask for something to keep their feet moving, some learning songs they could dance to, and a trampoline they could jump on. My students will be able to stay on task by getting to be active by moving their legs on the pedals. They will also work on getting recognition for great achievement so that they can have a turn jumping on the trampoline. The students would easily be able to achieve 60 minutes of physical activity in a day by using the under desk pedals and the trampoline, and learning songs that include movement . This project is very important since the students came up with the idea themselves about what they thought would make them more successful. Through this project my students will achieve higher success in their learning as well as be healthier and more active. These will help the students that have a harder time focusing.
