needStatement: My students need under desk pedals, a trampoline, and learning movement songs to get on target to a healthy and active learning experience!

name: Ready, Set, Organize, LEARN!
description: I have the privilege of teaching a group of vivacious, hardworking, elementary-aged students. The fact that they come from high-poverty does not stifle their creativity and curiosity. They are dreamers and are becoming GREAT readers, mathematicians, and scientists. My students are excited to come to school at the beginning of the year and ready to learn! Research shows that an organized work environment helps increase attention. Use of classroom organization tools such as binders and different colored folders will help teach them these life-long skills. Starting the year off right by helping students get organized and then teaching them how to stay organized is an essential skill that will help my kids be successful throughout the year. Your generous donation will help provide key supplies that will help my students do just this- get organized and stay that way. The binders and tabs will be used by the students at the beginning of the year to set up their reading binders where they will keep their notes, writings and other artifacts. The sturdy plastic folders will be used by the students as a place to put their homework, which helps them stay organized at home as well.
needStatement: My students need binders, tab dividers, and folders to start the year off organized and to stay that way.

name: Integrating the Arts
description: My students are amazing and motivated. We are an inner-city creative arts magnet school in the heart of downtown. Every student in our school is introduced to many different paths of arts from sculpture to dance to theatre, creative writing, literary publishing, and music. Our students are incredibly talented and focused. We are diverse and dedicated. Our students are artistic and real. Arts are a very real part of our students' identities and purpose. Our students are, quite simply, amazing. Our school is a creative arts integrated school. Our focus is on integrating, not just attaching an art project to a task, the arts into all subjects. Using a green screen will open up opportunities for students to integrate more diverse locations into their video performance tasks and enhance their education by allowing a greater array of artistic opportunities into their general education subjects. Integrating the arts increases intrinsic motivation, metacognitive competency and social-emotional growth. Integrating artistic tasks cyclically into general education enhances our students' learning. We will utilize our green screen kit and iPad stand, along with apps such as Touchcast to create engaging and high-quality videos to demonstrate and enhance learning.
needStatement: My students need a green screen kit and iPad stand to enhance our arts integration and develop authentic learning opportunities.

name: Breathing and Moving to Social and Academic Success
description: My students are preparing to have every opportunity to achieve their dreams. They are refining their critical skills, increasing their organization and time management capacities, and creating community with each other. They are smart, beautiful, and important in their quest of leadership and identity development. Almost all of my students are fluent in more than one language. They are leaders in their families, and their commitment to education is powerful. Each day, they refine their self-control and deepen their commitment to becoming tomorrow's leaders. A healthy student balances social, academic, and personal goals. The strong commitment my students have to education often increases their stress levels. In several students, this can lead to a mismanagement of anxiety and anger. My students are constantly asking about my own self-care, and several have even requested breath work and body movement as an incentive when class goals are met or as a close of the day process. Being healthy and happy means you know how to manage your emotions and control your body as a powerful tool. The breathing balls will help students visually slow down their breathing in order to create calm before learning. The yoga mats will allow the entire class to bring specific movement work into the room. The mindfulness cards, UFO ball, chime, and music will create a classroom environment that is anchored in community. With the entire group effort, personal health will be developed in order to better serve the whole. With these movement and breathing supplies, students will be able to practice breath and body work in my classroom in order to manage their stress and explore their personal strength and capacity to be powerful.
needStatement: My students need tools such as breathing balls, yoga mats, and UFO balls in order to develop their self monitoring. My students ask questions about how to calm down when angry, or how to manage anxiety and stress. Moving and breathing are key solutions.

name: Jump! Dance! Wiggle! Run! Hop! Your Way to Good Health!
description: I have 18 very active first graders in my class. We live in a high poverty rural community and are a Title I school where all of the children in our school receive free breakfast and lunch. Many of my students live in households where their families are just barely getting by. Some of them don't have basic necessities. These children are all very deserving and my wish for them is to be successful in all areas of life, despite their circumstances. First graders are full of energy from morning to night! They can't wait for time to go outside to the playground where they can run, jump and climb. But in inclement weather and during the winter months when we can't go outside, they still need a way to get some much needed exercise. Recently on a rainy day at school, my students asked what we were going to do since we couldn't go outside for playtime. Unfortunately we don't have access to equipment that allow children some movement during the day when we have to miss playtime. When I explained that we didn't have anything for active indoor play, my students began asking questions about what we would do in the wintertime when it was too cold to go outside. They started thinking of some things they might be able to use inside and came up with many suggestions. Their ideas included balls, jump ropes, ring toss games, balance ball chairs and balance stepping buckets. In addition to the great health benefits of exercise, children who are active also show improvement in motor skills development. Research shows growing evidence that physical activity and academic achievement go hand-in-hand. I would like to provide my students with the things they asked for, but with limited funding it's not possible. Your donation will supply my students with indoor equipment and activities to help them stay active and to become physically fit. My goal is for my students to develop an enjoyment of physical exercise that will benefit them throughout their lives.
needStatement: My students need a speaker for dance music and Ball Chairs, Ring Toss Set, and Jump Rope for exercise.

name: Comfy In The Classroom!
description: My students come in everyday ready to learn and eager for what we are going to do that day. They are a great group of kids and we work hard everyday. I teach at a school where all of our students receive free lunch. It is a very high poverty area, but students do not let that get in the way. They work really hard to reach their goals and we are very proud of them for all the hard work they put into school. My students are six and seven years old. Most children that age do not stay focused long especially while sitting in a desk and chair. If they are not comfortable they will not stay focused long and behavior can become a problem. I have tables in my room that are short enough for them to sit on the floor, but focus is still a problem. I believe if we have these exercise balls to sit on it will improve their focus and will allow them to get any excess energy they have out. In return this will also help with behavior.
needStatement: My students need these donut exercise balls for our flexible seating.

name: Super Students Cooking Super Food
description: Our school is blessed with a culturally diverse population of 490 students from pre-K to sixth grade with 80% receiving free or reduced lunch and also houses a specialized unit for students with Autism. Our school is in the process of becoming a Light House school for the The Leader in Me, a program which teaches leadership and life skills to all students. In our school...every child learns habits that promote happiness and health. At Saks Elementary, every child is encouraged to find the leader inside themselves!My students need cooking equipment and supplies for real hands-on practice in preparing healthy snacks and meals! In a society full of failed diet plans, we are all well aware of how difficult it is for adults to change their eating habits for a healthier lifestyle. Teaching students at a young age how to prepare simple nutritious snacks and meals, offers a greater opportunity for this to become a life-long habit. Research has shown that children who are involved in meal preparation maybe more willing to eat foods they have helped to make. Involving children in meal preparation can have many additional benefits like practicing math skills, developing fine motor skills and exposure to new smells and tactile sensations and well as learning safety measures when cooking. My students will participate in small groups to learn how to prepare simple meals and snacks that are healthy. They will use our measuring cups and spoons to measure foods according to the recipe, cook foods in the oven or on the induction cook top and use the blender to make smoothies. By having the oven, cool top and blender we can prepare a wide variety of nutritious foods!
needStatement: My students need an oven, cooktop, blender, pots and pans, mixing bowls and measuring spoons to learn how to cook healthy meals and snacks!

name: Wiggle While We Work!!
description: I have an awesome group of students this year. We live in the foothills of the Blue Ridge mountains and come from a wide variety of backgrounds. My students are very encouraging and work hard each day. They work together to master our state standards, as well as their personal weekly, monthly, and yearly academic goals. These goal are important to each student to help them start a successful education career by building good work and study habits at an early age. My students have inspired me to do this project and I am very excited! They have seen these stools in other classrooms and really want the opportunity to use them. I asked on a daily basis, 'Why don't we have stools like that?' My students go in other classrooms and come back full of excitement. My students really want these hokki stools, please help us make this a reality. Physical exercise is very important for active student learning. My students will benefit from this project in so many ways. They will feel the joy of earning their first project. They will become involved and active learners.
needStatement: My students need 7 Hokki stools to increase physical activity due to limited recess.

name: Franklin Goes to the Minnesota Center for Book Arts
description: Our middle school is located on the north side of Minneapolis. Our students are 99% students of color, with 77% Black, 16% Latino, 3% Asian, 3% Native American, and 1% White. 96% of our students qualify for free/reduced lunch. Franklin seeks to serve both our students and the North Minneapolis community. We are a STEAM focused school, engaging our students in the focused integration of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics. We not only focus on these areas but intentionally take an intersectional approach to all subjects, finding connections as we learn. We are energetic, intelligent, and witty young people who welcome the opportunity to share their talents. Last Spring, our Rockets were showcased on NBC Kare 11 for writing and recording our school song. Check us out! 'We will shoot for the starsWe’re the RocketsAs a team all together no one can stop us'In 7th grade, we spend a lot of time focused on narratives and story telling all year long. Part of this process means writing, publishing, and sharing our stories with each other. This trip would be a collaboration with the Minnesota Center for Book Arts. The center offers classes for schools that are extremely engaging. I would love for the students to have the chance to make their own books and self publish their stories. This trip would allow students to have a new experience and express themselves in a new creative outlet. On this trip students will learn to make paper and their own flag books.
needStatement: My students need to raise money to cover the cost of our trip to the Minnesota Center for Book Arts.

name: Using A Read Aloud to Time Travel
description: Our school serves students in grades K-5 and focuses on working together to develop life-long learners and responsible citizens. We provide ESL services, special education, academic intervention, and Title I. Being a fifth grade teacher comes with many successes as I watch my students challenge themselves with higher expectations and take on more responsibility. My goal is to prepare my students for middle school leaving with a passion and excitement for learning. My fifth grade classroom molds together 28 unique students, many of who come from bilingual households and receive free and reduced breakfast and lunch. My students come to school every day eager to learn and put their trust in me. With not all students learning the same, I want to give them the best learning experience by adapting my lessons to meet their needs. Incorporating engaging resources and hands-on manipulatives allow my students to work through self-discovery ultimately leading to abstract reasoning. A read aloud is embedded into our daily routine beginning on the first day of school. From a teacher's perspective, reading to my students gives me the opportunity to stop when needed and explain rhetorical or literary devices they wouldn't get on their own. From a student's perspective, a read aloud shows my students that they can understand a book that may be too hard for them to decode themselves. A sense of gratification is created when finishing a book whether they are below, at, or above grade level in reading. I chose these fictional texts because they are rich in historical events and are culturally relevant leading to courageous conversations within our classroom. Please help me with providing an unforgettable reading experience for my students. With your help they will be able to use their imagination and dive into a book with hopes that the texts will change the way they see reading forever.
needStatement: My students need copies of culturally relevant literature for our daily read aloud, which will build vocabulary and gain fluency in a risk-free environment.

name: Kids Choice
description: I teach in an amazing school with great kids and families. My students are unique with individual needs that strive for excellence and success. My students are fun, caring, and excited to learn new things each and everyday. The classroom environment in which I try to sustain is fun, upbeat, exciting and a great place to grow and learn. My students are inquisitive and their minds are always thinking. Each and everyday is different and something new and exciting is discovered. I have the privilege of helping these young minds grow socially and academically to full fill their goals and needs as individual learners. Six and seven year olds need lots of movement throughout the day to keep them engaged and learning! Alternative seating in our classroom is in high demand and my students always request where they feel most comfortable. Flexible seating in the classroom allows students to make a choice of which seating arrangement is best for their learning. Flexible seating promotes movement and activity in the classroom that allows students to build healthy, positive habits for the future. It also allows students to have their own space to spread out, have room to work, and helps with engagement. I want to add a variety of seating options for my class to enhance student learning, build classroom community, and friendships. These chairs and cushions will allow my students opportunities to move around the room with ease to work on classroom projects collaboratively. This type of seating will help improve student work and attention by allowing them to be more comfortable and give them the responsibility of taking ownership over their own learning and management. The wobble chairs(Hokki stools) will allow students with high energy to rid of excess energy while staying focused on the lesson or work in front of them. The cushions are helpful in moving around the room to create a comfortable place to work in small groups or partners. These items will greatly help to improve the diversity of learners in my classroom.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating(soft seat cushions and Hokki Stools) to enhance their engagement, focus, and learning.

name: Help Mrs. Pinkston's Speech Room!
description: 'Are you taking me today, Mrs. Pinkston?' This is the question that I love to hear because it means that my students love speech therapy and want to work with me. A typical day for me consists of pulling students for one on one or group therapy to address communication and language delays. I serve a wide range of students from ages 3 to 12, many of whom come from low income families. I have students that are eager to learn and do their best. I want to do whatever I can to help them accomplish their goals! The requested materials will be used to expand student's articulation skills to help them succeed in the classroom and social settings. The majority of my caseload are students with an articulation delay. Some students are only working on /r/, while others have multiple sounds that are impacting their intelligibility. Many speech pathologists use articulation cards on a daily basis. When I started my job at Twin Hills the only cards available to me were copied and not sturdy. I have used articulation work books for the past three years. While those are effective, we are limited with what we can do with them. The students can only read the words off of the page. With the new articulation and phonology cards, students will be more active during sessions. With the articulation cards we will be able to play games like go-fish and memory. The activities that we can do with the articulation cards are limitless with our imagination! Thank you so much for taking the time to read this!
needStatement: My students need articulation and phonology cards for speech therapy this year!

name: Chromebooks for DC Students!
description: Our amazing and inquisitive 5th graders are ready to read! They come to school excited to discover and learn new things every day. As we begin the school year our students start at many different reading levels and come in ready for challenging and exciting books. For many of the students in our incoming class English is not their primary language. Additionally, at TEC 99% of our students receive free and reduced lunches. Our students need 5 new Chromebooks to get off to a great start from day one! Our students do not always have the opportunity to use technology, so they do not always have access to the excellent software programs available to them. These Chromebooks will ensure that our students have every opportunity to learn and grow as efficiently as possible. These Chromebooks will give access to learning materials, and will enable efficient small group instruction. Your donation will give them Chromebooks that will feed their love of learning!Having technology in the classroom is beneficial for many reasons. It shows the students that we are invested in them! When the students know that their teacher and their school cares about them, they start to care more about themselves. Invest in the students and they will work harder! The Chromebooks allow access to amazing software! There are many incredible software programs that our students could use if we had the technology for them to do so. These software programs keep the students engaged and helps them equate learning with having fun. The Chromebooks allow for better small group instruction! There is much data to corroborate the idea that a smaller student:teacher ratio and differentiated instruction help the students learn. The Chromebooks allow me, the teacher, to focus on the individual needs of students in small group instruction. By holding their attention and efficiently using the time of a group of 5 students at a time, it automatically decreases the student to teacher ratio in my classroom. There are many reasons why and how these Chromebooks will benefit our students. Thank you so much for your donation!
needStatement: My students need five Chromebooks for our fifth grade DC classroom!

name: Keeping Kindergarten Supplied!
description: In kindergarten, you can learn how to be a citizen of the world. -- Jill Lepore My kindergarten students attend an inner city school that is situated in a high-poverty urban neighborhood. As my students are beginning their academic career, they come eager to learn and grow so much during the school year! They not only grow academically, but socially as well. They learn how to become good citizens of our classroom by getting along with others, listening, sharing, showing respect, taking responsibility and more. For many of my students, these social skills need to be taught and reinforced. The materials I am requesting will be used in many ways. The chart paper will replenish my supply and will be used in sharing our morning message or graphic organizers as a class. It will allow me to model proper letter formation and help children retain material we have discussed. The incentives will be used to reinforce and reward students for being a good citizen of our classroom. The rings, cars, jointed snakes, and some snacks will be added to our prize collection for the children to choose from when they have earned one, or to recognize a special event of every kindergarten student's life --- losing a tooth! It's amazing how much these little trinkets mean to my students. They get super excited about earning a reward or recognizing a milestone. The cleaning supplies and paper products will be used as we do classroom chores to reduce germs and sickness that can become so rampant in a kindergarten classroom. The children love being an active participant in cleaning our room and learning how to respectfully share a space and contribute to the tending of it. Your contribution to this project will help provide my students with visual aids, incentives and other materials that will help establish a positive classroom climate and reinforce behavior expectations as my little ones establish these skills they will need for many more years of learning.
needStatement: My students need chart paper, prizes, snacks, paper products, and more that we will use regularly during our school days this year.

name: Music Therapy for Young Special Education Students
description: The students in my classroom are students, ages 3-5 years old with learning and emotional disabilities. Many of them have experienced trauma in their lives and it is often difficult for their families to get them to school each day. This class serves students with a range of disabilities, including intellectual disabilities, emotional disturbances, autism spectrum disorder and physical disabilities and it is designed to provide early intervention to the students and their families. These students learn in a variety of ways and as a teacher I am constantly exploring new ways to reach my students and meet their individual education and emotional needs. Donations to this project will help fund Learning Through Music groups for 15 weeks in our classroom. During Learning Through Music, students will learn academic and arts concepts that are embedded into the music activities (instrument play, singing, finger plays, sensory/relaxation, and movement). The students will also have the opportunity to transfer skills practiced and learned during music group to the classroom as the teacher and special education aides will also participate in the learning. While we use music in the classroom, the money from this project will give the students an opportunity to work with teaching artists that are also board certified music therapists and have experience working with children with special needs.
needStatement: My students need donations for direct service hours for the teaching artists to come into our classroom.

name: Needing Fresh Supplies After the Storm
description: Imagine being excited about a new school year and wanting to have the necessary supplies to learn, but tragedy strikes. My students came to school with smiling, eager faces, ready and willing to learn on Thursday. The next day, many students lost personal belongings due to severe flooding. Let's help them to regain their footing by providing for their necessities. Most of the children receive a free or reduced rate lunch, yet they try to get the things they need for class. This unexpected weather storm has given them a setback. Help our students get a fresh start to the school year. This year we are focusing on being more organized since third grade is where they first begin switching classes at my school. We just need help in making the materials easier to keep up with and put back in place. This will enable the students to become more responsible with their supplies, and they will be able to quickly get started in their different areas of focus. The donations to this project will not only help to improve my student's attention and focus, but also build their confidence as mathematicians, inventors, authors, and illustrators. The materials being requested will help the Math Workshop run more effectively in class. Each student will be able to easily find their composition notebooks, pencils, and dry erase markers inside their heavy duty paper trays. The write and wipe pockets will be placed in focus areas, according to the needs of the students. The colors will make it easier for students to find displayed math options. Also, color coding will help them think about what choices to make about the activities, appropriate manipulatives, problem solving strategies, games for fact practice, strategies for solving equations, detailed explanations, inquiry engineering, and different representations. Research shows how math workshop can be used to give numerous opportunities students need to practice effectively listening, speaking, writing, creating, collaborating, and thinking critically. These skills will ensure the students are ready to face the challenges of higher education and the work environment. We need your help to make this a reality. Thanks!
needStatement: My students need the heavy duty paper trays to organize supplies because they switch classes. The write & wipe pockets with the dry erase markers will cut down on allergens in the classroom.

name: We Are Kindergarten Engineers!
description: My students, who are 4 and 5 year olds, come from socio-economically disadvantaged homes, most qualify for the free or reduced-price lunch program, and for many English is their second language. My students come to school every day eager to learn new things. They are curious, creative, inquisitive, resourceful and bubbling over with wonder. They are my sponges, soaking up all of the innovative, and enriching experiences that I can provide for them. Despite their hardships, my students are enthusiastic and positive and I would like to see their love for learning continue throughout their educational careers. The Magnetic Design Center and Engineer-A-Coaster Activity Kit will be used to introduce building and engineering as required in our Next Generation California State Standards in Science, and will be incorporated into our kindergarten science program. The STEM Kit called Create-A-Chain Reaction Starter Kit will also be used by the students in order to do critical thinking and learn more about engineering. The students will use them in small groups so they are able to experience collaboration and experimentation. At first, they will use them without much direction, as I want them to problem-solve, and to use their imagination while they explore! Then the students will be given small tasks to perform such as how can you design a structure that won't fall down. By the end of the unit, I am hoping my students have had positive experiences with the hands-on engineering materials and will look forward to doing more!
needStatement: My students need these a Magnetic Design Center, an Engineer-A-Coaster Activity Kit and a Create-A-Chain Reaction STEM Kit.

name: Scientist Stools Stimulate Success!
description: I teach at an elementary school that is more than 100 years old. I have a group of 21 wonderful students in a general education class, with about 1/3 receiving exceptional student education and ESOL support services. My students come from many diverse backgrounds to learn in a Title I school. They are generally motivated, curious and eager to learn. Quite a few of them have very few opportunities beyond the walls of our school to explore how and why things work. Dress for success! How many times have you heard that old adage? Well the same can be said for learning environments. The places where students learn and the equipment they use can positively impact their ability to master essential skills and broaden their knowledge. Students who can feel like scientists working in a laboratory setting are also going to think and act like scientists. My students will be more excited than ever to engage in inquiry experiences when they have an authentic lab station in which to explore the scientific world. These science stools would make them feel like scientists. What better way is there to encourage students to become free thinkers and doers than to provide those experiences for hands-on, minds-on activities in the classroom?
needStatement: My students need science stools to make them feel like scientists.

name: Getting to Know Ourselves and Others Through Literature
description: The sense of community is very strong at our school, but can only be made stronger by taking the time to learn more about each other in regards to our different backgrounds. I will see a diverse group of students in my classroom. Some will be students of color, some will be living in different types of poverty, and many will speak English as a second language. With such a mixed student population, it is not appropriate to teach from one perspective. I must provide my students with opportunities to see life through various lenses so they can become culturally competent, well-educated human beings. I am requesting help in purchasing books for my classroom library that depict diverse characters and life experiences. Whether being used for read aloud or for independent and partner reading, my hope is that these books will be greatly loved by all. Additionally, I am looking to provide multicultural crayons and markers to honor our diversity through art. Children need to see themselves in the literature they read. Not only do I want my students to see people of their race, ethnicity, and culture in the stories we read, but I also want them to learn about these topics as they pertain to their peers.
needStatement: My students need access to multicultural literature in our classroom library, and multicultural crayons and markers.

name: Classroom Materials
description: My students are a wonderful group of Chinese speaking 5-6 year olds. Some of them have just immigrated to the states and will be experiencing school for the very first time with me. Others are native speakers but have attended K1 or preschool programs before. In our urban elementary school, we have students that come from many parts of the world. Every day, teachers are inventing new creative ways to capture the attention of focus of these children. Each student is unique in their own way while learning to become one healthy community within our classroom. Our school services many students that are just acquiring the English language, whether they are assigned to a kindergarten classroom or 5th grade class. They are all here eager to learn and to take advantage of all the opportunities we are able to give them. Every year, the curriculum is evolving to better suit our students. Teachers donate so much of their own to be able to provide the best for their students. In this project, I have included things that would better help the children in my class learn and be efficient little humans! Each item has its purpose in assisting their education, from organization of classroom materials, to story wands that can help me assess their comprehension and motivate them to think deeply. As English language learners, one of the best ways to acquire language is to listen to it as much as possible. In my small classroom that holds up to 18 children, I have included a portable listening station so that this center can be mobile if needed. This machine will allow my students the chance to hear a story read to them from someone other than me. Some stories have different voices and tones from characters that can help bring pictures to life.
needStatement: My students need a listening center, story wands and an organizer file to help maximize their learning experience.

name: Tech for Success!
description: The students I serve each day come to our school facing a variety of challenges. Living in the most dangerous section of our capital city, these children have been faced with hardships in their eight years that many could not imagine in a lifetime. 'Education is the most powerful which you can use to change the world' Nelson Mandela. This quote perfectly describes my efforts as I push my students to persevere through their challenges, to the success that lies ahead of them. The given materials in this project exemplify the disparity that currently exists in our public education. Though students are expected to perform in a 21st century world, they are often not given the access to these tools while in school. This project helps to bridge the gap that exists between expectation and reality when it comes to access to technology. The students from one of the most under performing schools in the District of Columbia, will now be able to compete on a global scale with the help of these resources. More specifically, each of these students is a child with disabilities, creating an even greater sense of urgency around these resources. A projector will serve to allow students to access the world from a broader view. Students will also be able to interact with the technology through the use new innovative tools also listed in the project. Supplemental items in the project will cover the organization and set up for the new year, including tools that will help to give scholars better access to the world in which they live. Since all students who benefit from these products have been diagnosed with a disability, these products are also essential to making learning engaging, differentiated, and interactive!
needStatement: My students need access to a projector to access 21st century learning.

name: ELMO, Not Just a Fuzzy Animal
description: My students come from various backgrounds in a high need urban school district. Working in the Fruitvale area of Oakland, we have a high percentage of English Language Learners. However, all learners, no matter their background, can achieve and should be given the support that they need and deserve. Our school uses Waldorf-inspired teaching methods to help target instruction to all learners of our diverse community. My students thrive when they are actively engaged and taking charge of their learning. When given the opportunity to investigate beyond books and videos I have the opportunity to see my students work cooperatively, think critically, and let their creativity soar. English is a second language for many of my students. As research and experience tells us, visuals are an essential part of quality teaching anywhere, but particularly English Language Learners. By providing my students with this document camera, you will be giving them the opportunity to view multiple solutions to math problems, see other students' work, justify answers, learn effective note taking skills, complete graphic organizers, learn to use a variety of math manipulatives and view real life objects, compose classwide pieces of writing, see writing modeled, edit text... and the list goes on! My students understand better and are able to take content to a higher level when they have a reference in front of them. With a document camera, I will be able to present and model new material in a variety of ways to meet the needs of all my students
needStatement: My students need an Elmo projector for science experiments, graphic organizers, and fun, interactive lessons that include a visual component.

name: Moving, Learning and Grooving!
description: Busy, fun, and energetic students. This is the life of a DK student. Yes, I teach Developmental Kindergarten and truly love seeing these students develop and help them prepare for Kindergarten. The majority of students entering Developing Kindergarten come to school with very little or no non-educational experience. A majority of our students are also ' free or reduced lunch.' Our school even provides free breakfast for all of our students. Our school is in a 'very high' poverty area. By having Hooki seats, these fun but special seats will assist students who have trouble sitting still and need to move while learning at the same time. While sitting on these seats one can move, even when you may seem to be sitting still, which is critical to student development as physical movement both increases the well-being and encourages the academic maturing process. These stools will be perfect for the students to sit on during 'Guided Reading, Guided Writing and Math time.' By having these stools located at my table for small group time, it will help students be able to move, focus and learn. I like the idea that these stools are small and light which makes it easy to transfer these stools anywhere in the classroom. Especially where a student may need it for their own personal use in other areas of the classroom.
needStatement: My students need 4 Hokki stools for individual or for small group learning that will help them be engaged in learning while sitting, moving and concentrating.

name: Cultivating Learning With Chromebooks
description: I have a classroom community full of critical thinkers, questioners, and change makers. Their desire to 'Be the change they wish to see in the world' has already begun lifting our school community and they're passionate about inspiring our world. My scholars aspire to be Olympic swimmers, police officers, teachers and the first African-American woman president of the United States of America. Their futures are bright and I want to help cultivate their light. We thank you for your support! At my school, 80% of our student body qualifies for fee or reduced price lunch. One-third of my class are language learners, and one-fourth have an IEP in two or more areas. But, these statistics don't keep us from doing amazing work. What does hinder us is that we don't have access to the technology that we need! Technology will help my students build their math, literacy, and tech skills helping them prepare for and connect to their world in meaningful and engaging ways. The scientists, poets, mathematicians, leaders, and agents of change in our classroom need enrichment and individualized practice. Chromebooks would allow us to be one of the only classes with consistent technology that goes beyond testing. Your donation would provide my students with the ability to apply skills that reinforce what they've been learning through small-group, independent and collaborative projects. The gift of this technology for research, data to back up their debates, math, and science would help prepare my students for lifelong academic success. Please donate today! Thank you.
needStatement: My students need nine Chromebooks, which would allow them to think and dream as they travel beyond our classroom walls by using technology to dig deeper into historical perspectives, science and math concepts, and their books.

name: Getting the Wiggles Out
description: I teach a class of energetic young children who have many types of learning styles and academic challenges. Many of the children in my class have a hard time focusing if they are not allowed some kind of movement while they are working. They move around in their chairs constantly and are in need of some kind of movement while they are sitting. It would be very beneficial for my students to have a chair that would allow them some movement. My students come to school after a summer of being able to move around and do not have to sit still. These cushions will give them the ability to have a little movement while they are sitting at their desks. They are also mobile so they can sit on them when we are doing circle time on the floor. The are small enough and light enough that they can be carried around and use them as needed. They will make the children's chairs that much more comfortable and hopefully will encourage them to stay in their seats and get their work done.
needStatement: My students need stability seat cushions so that they may have the ability to move without actually getting out of their seats.

name: Strong Bodies, Strong Minds!
description: I teach in St. Paul at a school that has a high free and reduced lunch rate. (over 90%) My students often come to school lacking resources many students and schools in the suburbs have. I love to look for resources to either catch them up academically or projects to inspire them to love school. Many have so many outside worries, that school sometimes is hard for them to concentrate on. I feel it is my job to encourage them as well give them the desire to learn. Kids sit A LOT. A majority of the school day is spent sitting and unfortunately many go home to sit in front of a video game. I really wanted to change how my kids thought of exercise. Last year I was fortunate to have received a grant for yoga mats for my classroom. Yoga time was one of the favorite times of the day. I would love to continue to add to our health with videos, cards, and accessories to enhance the love of yoga my class had last year and hopefully for many years to come. I am not only requesting materials and videos for the body, but also brain yoga exercises, so we can make yoga a true whole body experience. My class last year used yoga to improve our concentration, flexibility, and community.
needStatement: My students need yoga accessories for both the body and mind!

name: A Place to Collaborate
description: As a teacher of many culturally diverse students, in a high poverty/ low income school district, my students deserve the most positive learning environment. I am looking to make sure their experience in my class is one that they will cherish and remember for a lifetime. My hope is that with a positive learning environment these students will flourish as life long learners. My 2nd graders deserve access to a quality and diverse learning environment to improve fluency and proficiently in math and reading. This rug will make a difference in our classroom because we will have an organized place to come together and share our learning experiences. Students will have a safe place to take learning risks, share their accomplishments and ask questions about all the great things we will be learning. Collaboration is so important in my classroom, and practicing that skill will be much easier having this rug and a place to learn. There are many times throughout the day we will come together and celebrate each other and challenges or successes we have in our learning. Students thrive on the feedback of their peers and this rug will only help to foster positive relationships in my classroom.
needStatement: My students need a rug for a place where we can come together and learn. We do not have a common meeting area to share books, learning strategies, and celebrate successful moments.

name: Alternative Seating = Movement & Choice
description: Our school has active and enthusiastic students of varying reading and math levels. We have a large ELL and free & reduced price lunch population. Our students go to school in a small rural community. These students would thrive in a flexible seating environment that promotes active learning. The students are in second grade and are excited to learn new things. They enjoy being able to have choices of seating such as wobbly chairs, Zenergy ball chairs, standing tables, and floor seating. Research has shown movement in the classroom aides brain development. It is very difficult for students to sit in traditional chairs all day long. Flexible seating also allows for student choice which research has also shown to benefit student learning. Last year I had a flexible seating environment classroom and it was very beneficial! The kids really responded well and it helped them throughout the school day. I bought some seating options with my own money. This year with full implementation in my classroom, the students would benefit from quality seating options that will not break, tear or crumble. The items selected are of high quality! I appreciate your consideration.
needStatement: My students need wobble stools and Zenergy ball chairs to be able to focus and concentrate on their activities and project assignments. Research shows movement and student choice effects learning positively.

name: Teetering and Tottering While Reading and Writing
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty community, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Some of my students live in a transient situation, some are being raised in single parent households while many receive free lunch based on their socioeconomic status. Despite the various obstacles they face daily and the fact that I am unable to control their home lives, I am striving to keep our educational environment motivating, positive, engaging, meaningful, and creative so that each of my students are afforded the opportunity to thrive. My classroom is designed to influence and inspire each of my various learners both inside and out of the classroom. This year we are implementing a mindfulness program to enable students with strategies to become more resilient to the forces that they cannot control outside of the classroom. The stools requested would allow my students to have flexible seating in the classroom. For many of them, their choices are limited outside of the classroom and having the ability to use something outside of the norm would provide a great sense of normalcy in their changing world. The mats would allow the students to find a space for relaxation and self-reflection when they feel they need a special place to decompress and refocus. My goal is to provide a community in which the students can make choices and realize that they are a part of a community in which there is some consistency and they can make choices in relationship to their educational environment.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options such as Wobble chairs and wobble cushions.

name: Bringing the World into My Classroom
description: My students come from very diverse families. Many speak English as their second language and are new to this country. With that being said, they travel with little to nothing when they leave their homeland. This makes having the essentials for school a distant priority. These families want their children to succeed and work hard in school. They are involved as much as they can be with needed interpreters for conferences and visits to the school. I want to give my students everything that all children need and deserve to be successful, so that they can become amazing citizens in our melting pot. My school can only provide so much and this means that I have to fund my own projects if I want my students to have necessary items for completion. We all want our own children to have what is needed to really enjoy education and making it meaningful, so I must work to give my students the same. My students need to be able to connect what I am teaching to what they can see. This gives them a visual and allows their brain to start remembering and making sense of the information that comes at them. The projector allows me to make things large enough for my students to see the detail in every picture and gives them text that we can dissect together. It is a powerful tool that I cannot live without in making sure my students are successful. When I am speaking about a geographical place, we can immediately go there and experience the culture through pictures and text. This gives my students an example of what I am asking them to do as they research topics independently or in groups.
needStatement: My students need to be able to see what I can expose them to through the internet to enhance my lessons and give them concrete examples. We need a projector.

name: To Plant a Garden is to Believe in Tomorrow!
description: My students are fun-loving and energetic learners. They benefit from hands-on learning experiences in which they dive deep into every topic. We are able to do this in almost every subject in our classroom, by using PBL (Project based Learning) units. Our school is a magnet school with a focus on technology. We are located in an urban setting and have a Title I classification. A typical day in our classroom consists of students collaborating and working together in groups. Our project is 'kid-inspired' because our students decided we need an indoor garden to complete our unit on gardening, seeds, and plants. We have tried growing our very own bean, lettuce, and garlic plants, but unfortunately due to the unpredictable New York weather, it has been too cold for the seeds to germinate. With this AeroGarden, we would be able to successfully grow our own plants indoors, even if the weather is cold! Having our own garden will also help our students learn about how important it is to fuel your body with healthy foods. Our students will be beyond thrilled to grow their own garden, right in our classroom! Since it is not always guaranteed that seeds will grow during the cold New York seasons, it would be extremely helpful to have this AeroGarden to increase our chances of having a classroom garden. We can't wait to see their excitement as they watch our garden change from just a pod of soil, to a large, green, flourishing, vegetable plant. Then finally, they will be able to have a nutritious snack they have grown throughout the year!
needStatement: My students need two AeroGardens and vegetable pods, so that we can grow our own garden.

name: Moving, Grooving and Learning
description: 1st Grade is the most crucial time of learning to read in a child's life. We have a wonderful group of diverse students at our school! All of them love to learn, but might not come to us with the same background or materials available to learn with. About 60% of our students live in poverty. If students comes to school late, missing breakfast, I offer them snacks to keep them from going hungry. Some students are homeless, others change living locations several times during the school year, still others stay in the same home. Some students come to school with all their materials while others don't even have pencils or a backpack. One thing resonates true for all my students: They are loved and given the same opportunities to learn! Students from my high poverty school need opportunities to be active and learn about healthy choices. Through this project, they will be able to grow plants and vegetables in the classroom, move their bodies and more! They will go from having a playground without any green space to having green space right in our classroom! My students will be able to have opportunities to engage their bodies throughout the day both by moving and growing a classroom vegetable garden. They will have a variety of seating options that require them to engage their core, standing balancing options for those students who just can't sit still and the chance to have our own classroom garden of fresh vegetables.
needStatement: My students need to be active and healthy. Growing with the Hydroponics Kit and Classroom Kits Veggie Garden will expose my students to healthy habits. WOBBLE Chairs and Balance Balls will ensure active sitting.

name: Science Goes Viral
description: Learning science in middle school brings out the hero in students. Our school attracts students who are interested in learning through the arts. We are an inner city school with a majority of students on free or reduced lunch. Our school is a rich blend of 20% Asian, 30% African American, 10% Hispanic and 35% white students. More than a third are English language learners. All of them aspire to be actors, dancers, musicians and artists. To study science through the lens of art requires more than facts and information, it must engage students with a sense of life, and vitality. I want my students to capture, edit, and post their learning and use that to create scientific discourse about concepts. Screen casting lessons and posting videos of aspects of our lab have opened my students to digital media and how they can show what they have learned to the camera and to the world. Our classroom could be a blend of traditional and digital learning, already our students use 'Science Selfies' to show their application of science concepts at home or in the community. I recently went to Space Camp and watched how another teacher uses a GoPro camera to document their experience and share it with the world. The Go Pro, mounts, batter and cables will allow my students and I to record science experiments from a unique perspective. Students can then watch on Youtube to reinforce the lesson.
needStatement: My students need access to digitized learning. We will use a GoPro Silver with all of the mounts in order to allow students to create and publish educational videos based on the days lessons.

name: iMake Music
description: Why learn about music when you can make it instead? From the minute students walk into my classroom, we actively engage in music by singing, moving, playing instruments, improvising, composing, and performing. My main goal is to help my students becoming lifelong musicians and I want every student to have access to the musical instruments and materials they need to be the musician they want to be. I hope that through their experiences in my classroom, my students realize music is something they can do, in many different capacities, for their entire lives. In my classroom, students are creative, express themselves, take risks, and work together. I teach about 550-600 students (1st-5th grade) in a low-income/high poverty school. My students are diverse learners with many different learning styles and backgrounds. As an extended learning time school, my students have an 8 hour school day, which totals to 300 additional hours each year compared to most other elementary schools. I truly believe that every child in my music room has the potential to be musical; some kids are singers, some kids are composers, and some kids love anything with a beat.I believe that every child has the potential to be musical. In music class we sing, move, analyze, improvise, arrange, compose, work together, problem solve, and take risks. I hope to inspire my students to become lifelong musicians and understand being a lifelong musician takes many forms: listening with understanding to music, singing in your car or on stage, producing music as a DJ, playing an instrument for fun or professionally. With iPads, the possibilities are endless. Having four mini iPads in my music classroom will empower my students to interact with and create music in a whole new way; every one of my 550-600 students will benefit. Here are just a few ways I plan on using the iPads in my classroom: in band/string lessons my students will record themselves and self-assess their performances, play along with background tracks that track their intonation, notes, etc. providing feedback in real time, and compose their own songs. In lower grades (1-2), my students will use multiple apps to learn about the orchestra, assess their singing voice, arrange songs, create rhythms, and 'play' with music. In third grade, my students will use multiple apps to learn how to read music, arrange and write their own songs using notation, track their singing voices, practice recorder skills, and once again, 'play' with music. In fourth and fifth grades, my students will engage in music production by creating loops, background beats, and music videos using apps such as Garageband, DrumPad24, and Novation. My students are hardworking, diverse, and curious; they inspire me everyday. Please help me acquire the necessary equipment to take their learning to the next level.
needStatement: My students need 4 iPad minis with cases and 2 audio cables to inspire lifelong music making.

name: Puzzles, Puzzles
description: My students live in a very rural area of southwest Alabama. The town of less than 2000, has one traffic light, one small grocery store and one corporate gas station. A recent merge of the schools and the lack of job opportunities has sent many families to other areas of the state seeking employment and ultimately another school. All students in our school qualify for free breakfast and lunch. My students are awesome! Super sweet and so full of energy! We work together each day to overcome various obstacles and make our classroom environment a safe, clean and inviting place to explore, build friendships and set high levels of learning. I want my students to have the opportunity to think critically, use reasoning skills and experience the joy of completing a puzzle. I have discovered over the years that students that come to me are not able to put together a simple puzzle. They lack the experience and skills to complete the task. Puzzles require students to think, reason, and set goals. They must manipulate pieces to complete the picture. Oh the joy on my students faces when they have stuck to their goal and completed a puzzle. It is priceless and always inspires my students to try another one!
needStatement: My students need 10 puzzles to aid in their critical thinking skills and to help reinforce the learning of letters of the alphabet, numbers, sight words, blending and diagraphs.

name: Charting Our Answers
description: In our classroom community you will see many different cultures and hear many different languages. Many of the students live in poverty and lack resources for learning at home. Despite these obstacles, they all show up for school ready to have fun and learn. Every day the students' learning grows as: readers, writers, scientists, athletes, engineers, technologists, and mathematicians. I set high expectations and they meet every one of them. When you choose to give to our students you are giving to growing brains and life long learners!In our classroom community you will see many different cultures and hear many different languages. Many of the students live in poverty and lack resources for learning at home. Despite these obstacles, they all show up for school ready to have fun and learn. Every day the students grow as readers, writers, scientists, athletes, engineers, technologists, and mathematicians.I set high expectations and they meet every one of them. When you choose to give to our students you are giving to growing brains and life long learners!The versatile chart is an easel, chart stand and storage cart—all in one! It has a magnetic write & wipe board so we can write answers and comments to lessons. The ledge makes it easy to display big books, so all the students can see. The unit also comes with 8 big bins that keep tons of supplies right within reach so I will always be organized and ready for lessons. The chart stand is the center to all of the whole group lessons in first grade. Having one that is sturdy, colorful, full of storage, can hold extra flip charts, and is magnetic is a teacher's dream come true!
needStatement: My students need a chart stand to read and write responses to comments and questions.

name: Classroom Rugs are the Center for Learning in First Grade.
description: Frost Lake is an urban elementary school is St Paul. We are a neighborhood school serving mainstream students as well as many bilingual students who are learning English. Some of our students have recently arrived in the United States and did not have an opportunity to attend school before. About 86% of our students receive free and reduces lunches. Our students come to first grade eager for learning. Music, activity and movement helps our students to be the best learners they can be. They love to dance and jump run in place to the music. A classroom rug is a center for learning and activity in the classroom. My students need a classroom rug so that each child can find a personal space for moving, learning, and building community. We gather there each morning for Morning Meeting. Throughout the day we take breaks to get kids moving and fired up for learning. We run in place, jump, pretend to swim, roll our arms in large circles, and dance to music. Each child needs to find a personal space to move freely without bumping into furniture and other students. The rug our class is requesting is divided into individual squares large enough for each child to be safe and free to move. It is also divided into colors, which helps us turn the activity into a game: “Red squares, run in place! Blue squares, jump on one foot!” The frequent activity breaks for movement provide our students an opportunity for fun and exercise and to release the incredible energy they have inside. Children learn the activity breaks and then 1-2 children lead the activity . Children are taught how these activities help their brain get ready for learning. After a few minutes of activity, our students are ready for reading and math. Each learner finds a square on the carpet for a lesson. The squares help them to find a partner to talk about their learning and ask and answer questions. Socializing, talking, and moving are important for learning in first grade. We also have regular times throughout the day, especially after lunch and recess when students need help calming down. We use yoga calming movements to help our students learn to regulate their high energy to calm themselves. The individual squares on the rug will help our students find a safe personal space.
needStatement: My students need a new classroom rug that is clean and appealing, so we can gather on it throughout the day in small groups and large groups during learning times.

name: Peddle Away (Science) Anxiety
description: My school is exclusively for pregnant and parenting teens. We are an all-girls High School, where half of the building has classrooms for their babies, toddlers, and preschoolers. We specialize in connecting with students who haven't experienced success with school in the past. Our students come from high-poverty backgrounds with a lot of instability and traumatic experiences, so forging strong relationships with students is critical. Once we have a safe classroom environment, I have found the highest engagement via collaborative projects and hands on-experiences. The passion and creativity my students regularly show is truly inspiring, I learn a lot as we investigate questions together. In addition, it's rewarding to be involved in educating these young mothers, because it's not only helping the high school student, but also the child(ren) they are raising!My students have requested something to keep them going when they're working on a tough problem, keeping their bodies awake by peddling while they're sitting at a lab table is a fun, healthy solution. Because of pregnancy or recent childbirth my students are always looking for low-impact, and safe, ways to exercise and relieve tension. Our students have requested a greater emphasis on healthy choices and personal wellness, and this school year we have designed our school wide projects and courses around the theme 'Health and Self'. Research has shown that exercise releases beneficial hormones that reduce stress, and anxiety. New parents that are juggling school, a family, and low-income struggles would benefit immensely from healthy ways to alleviate stress. Being able to focus in class, stay awake, and feel productive is just an extra benefit!
needStatement: My students need a physical way to alleviate tension so they can focus on science. Under desk peddles will help them accomplish their health and science goals!

name: Creating An Effective Learning Environment
description: Our school has over 400 students from grades Pre-K to 5th. Our students enjoy a wide range of art activities with specialists in visual arts, music, dance, and theater. Students are very diverse and 83% of our students qualify for Free and Reduced lunch. In the first grade classroom, we welcome all learners from those who have newly just arrived in American to those who were been born in St. Paul. First graders come to school excited and ready to see what new learning they will do. Our first graders are utilizing more technical learning and transitioning from individual desks to tables. These transitions incorporate more and better diverse activity and cooperative group work. With this change, it is necessary for students to have the tools to take full advantage of their academic time. With the help of headphones, students will be able to work at their individual learning pace on electronic devices. The elimination of desks will require new storage areas. The seat storages will offer an area for getting their school supplies such as pencils, crayons, books, and notebooks in an instant when needed with little interruption.
needStatement: My students need seat sacks for an organized area for school supplies and headphones to attend to their selected auditory reading.

name: Flexible Seating So 3rd Graders Can Excel!
description: My students are amazing! They are energetic, inquisitive, culturally diverse 8 and 9 year olds that want to excel in school. We are a low income, Title I school serving a wide variety of students, including a large number of English learners and students in special education. Our school is located in Saint Paul, MN. My classroom is a co-taught special education 3rd grade room, which includes students with Emotional Behavior Disorders, Autism and Learning Disabilities. My students are just on the verge of taking responsibility for their learning, by knowing what's best for them. Students with wiggles are constantly asking to work while standing up or requesting wobble cushions. Unfortunately, we only have two wobble cushions in our classroom and our tables don't accommodate students that want to stand. Other students prefer to work on the ground or have their bodies more engaged by sitting on stability balls. In our classroom, we only have standard size tables and chairs, which are only effective for a small number of children. By providing the Pro Fit Balls, wobble cushions and Yoga mats for my students, they will be given the opportunity to take their learning in their own hands. Their bodies will be constantly engaged, freeing their brains to focus on their school work.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options in our classroom, like stability balls, comfortable yoga mats, wobble cushions and stools.

name: A Walk in the Park... (Alternative Seating)
description: The scholars at my school are the leaders of tomorrow. Many of them work so hard to use education as way to defeat poverty. Not only are most of our scholars tackling the challenges of poverty, but many are also learning English as their second language. They come to school everyday eager, willing and ready to learn. None of my scholars use any of their challenges as excuses to succeed, therefore I work hard to give them every opportunity to help them in their journey to the top. Many of my scholars would always love to work outside, every single day. Help me to recreate an outside space in my classroom for those students. This alternative seating project would create a park like seating area in the corner of my classroom for students to work. My scholars need a park bench to sit on and a rug that is made of carpet grass to give the feel of being outside. And my students need wall decals of trees to help put the finishing touches on creating the perfect environment for 'being outside.' Help me to make everyday a sunny day in my classroom for my scholars.
needStatement: My students need a park bench, a carpet rug, and a decal to help make some creative alternative seating.

name: Kindles to Set Our Reading on FIRE!
description: Students at Little Wound School come from the small town of Kyle, SD, or the surrounding countryside. The vast majority are from Native American families who all reside on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation. Little Wound strives to affirm Lakota identity and culture in the classroom and also emphasizes the importance of athletics in the community and tribe. The Little Wound middle and high schools both employ Lakota language instructors and work to support students as individuals with unique identities. In the middle school we work as a small staff of about 16 teachers, councilors, supports staff, and administration to ensure our Lakota students have access to an education that will benefit their family, community, and tribe. Kindles will allow students to read independently with this new form of technology that many find more appealing than paperback books. Students that struggle with independent reading need barriers to reading removed while also finding new incentives that offer novelty and fun to the experience. E-readers are popular among kids and adults, and now my students can try one out in the classroom. Plus, Kindles can access more books than could ever fit into my classroom. With a single Kindle and a year of Kindle Unlimited, students can access over 1 million titles right from the classroom and be exposed to a new option for summer reading, when books are less accessible to the community. Kindles are quite inexpensive and students may learn to love using one in the classroom, and seek to acquire a Kindle, and the vast potential it offers, outside of school.
needStatement: My students need Kindle Fire tablets to read books that are not in our library, and to be introduced to a great way to read during the summers when books are unavailable.

name: Interactive Early Literacy Materials for Students with Special Needs
description: I am blessed to teach students in grades k-5 with cognitive and other impairments in a self-contained special education classroom. My students are kind, energetic, inquisitive, and love to learn! They are amazing young people. Many of them come from homes that have their share of struggles. Over 80% of students in my building are considered at-risk due to low socioeconomic factors. I strive to make school a happy and positive place to be for them to express themselves and learn. These incredible students enjoy learning when they can actively participate in the lessons. This project will further allow them to do just that! In my classroom, students in grades k-5 work to build their beginning and developing reading skills. In my special education self-contained classroom, I need more hands-on literacy materials to make the learning process more interactive for my students. Countless studies have proven that students are more engaged in learning when it is presented in a hands-on and interactive format. I will use the interactive letter tools to create lessons and learning stations where students will learn by doing. My special needs students benefit greatly from learning that is presented in a way that they can feel, touch, move, and fully experience. The centers and materials such as the talking sight word boards will allow my students to gain confidence and a sense of accomplishment and independence in the classroom. These requested materials will greatly assist me in planning engaging literacy lessons for my incredible students!
needStatement: My students need sight word magnets, talking boards, write and wipe pockets and other hands-on and interactive materials to engage in reading instruction.

name: Sports Make You Smarter!
description: My students and I are very lucky to have Chromebooks in our room and to be able to use technology every day. Since over 90% of the students are on free lunch, bilingual, and struggling with basic literacy in both English and Spanish, leveraging technology allows us to overcome those obstacles. Their desire to learn and catch up to speed with the grade level requirements is what is moving us into the 21st Century learning. We are a 5th grade room full or energetic, curious learners! We have flexible seating, which makes it possible for each student to find a spot where he or she learns the best. Some like to sit on the floor, some like to stand... We work hard, set goals and are operating on the growth mindset. The only person they have to impress in themselves!My students want to get moving and running and jumping to both burn and create the energy! 15 minutes of moving a day is not enough! By having the sports equipment easily available in our room, we can incorporate repeated short bursts of exercising and take advantage of the open gym time as it becomes available. I see student motivation, energy levels and engagement changing for the better, as their bodies are not stiff and tired of sitting the whole day. They will learn better when feeling refreshed and recharged. The ideas came to the students on a cold Chicago winter day - another one with the indoor recess. They returned to the classroom with zero energy for the afternoon. We started a class discussion on how this problem can be solved, and a student suggested having some sports equipment in the classroom. As we eliminated some of the obviously impractical options, a suggestion came through: 'How about a table tennis table? We could have a tournament!' The cheers followed, and then another great idea was heard:'Ms. Madas, if we have Fitbits like you, then we can walk and track our steps. Even when we run in Gym!'. Next, we turned our attention to the good weather and planned for soccer, badminton and volleyball. It was amazing to see what great energy was created in the classroom and feel energized! If we had the right equipment, we could meet the 60 minutes a day goal: 5-10 minutes in the morning, a couple of 5-minute quick brain breaks, 15 minutes of recess and a gym period. My students need this equipment so we can live up to the good old saying: Sound body, sound mind!
needStatement: My students need a table tennis set for the rainy and snowy indoor recess days. They need portable pop-up soccer goals and soccer balls to get their recess games going on fast! They need Fitbits!

name: *Expand Your Learning Through Flexible Seating*
description: We are the home of the 'Gators', a strong, diverse community that has gained a well-earned reputation for focusing on the development of the whole child. We are committed to cultivating a love of learning, teaching our students great character, and empowering students with the knowledge and skills to excel as productive citizens in the 21st century. We have the privilege of working with students from many different backgrounds, experiences, and interests. Because my students have a variety of preferred learning styles, and are at different levels of academic readiness, it is imperative that I find ways to differentiate in my classroom, not just in my instruction. It is my job to make connections and understand each student and to use this understanding to deliver instruction that honors individual differences. My students deserve an equal opportunity to learn in an environment where they are comfortable and their needs are met. Our school values the individuality and learning styles of each and every Gator. In order to help foster a true love for learning, students need to be empowered to make choices that help them be their best learners, collaborators, and thinkers. That learning, collaborating, and thinking does not always happen while sitting at a desk. In order to engage and empower students to take ownership of their learning, they need the autonomy to choose seating that allows for movement, collaboration, and differentiation. This project will provide my students with the opportunity to select the type of seating that helps them focus and learn best. The pod seats, rugs, stools, lap desks, and foam mats will provide a variety of work space opportunities for students and will move away from the old-school mentality that all students must be instructed at their desks. The caddies will allow students to bring their supplies to their preferred work space easily. I believe that by providing a variety of work space options, students will be more engaged and collaborative in their learning, which will deepen their love for school and make them successful, lifelong learners.
needStatement: My students need the opportunity to expand their learning by having flexible seating that allows for movement, collaboration, and autonomy.

name: Cozy, Comfy And Ready To Read!
description: Our elementary school is 'home' to almost 1,000 kiddos. Our school is pretty unique as we have a very diverse group of students in a rural community. We have many students that can speak more than one language and some students that are new to the country. More than 50% of our students receive free and reduced lunch. The students in my classroom come from all over the world. I am fortunate enough to have so many different smiling faces in my classroom. For some of my students, school is the only place where they get the opportunity to read. Reading is a gateway to so many different learning experiences. With having tile flooring in the classroom, students are not excited to find a spot to sit on the floor and read their favorite book. WIth their own carpet square and/or pillow, the students will be more excited to get comfortable and start reading. Providing materials that make the students feel more comfortable will promote a better learning environment and will encourage students to read more. Students will be able to find a place anywhere in the classroom to get cozy with their book boxes and start reading.
needStatement: My students need floor cushions, carpet squares and pillows.

name: Setting Learning in Motion
description: A look into our kindergarten classroom during the day will make any visitor smile! My 25 eager learners are such a busy group - they love to learn and try new things!
