If my students go home feeling happy, loved, listened to, and educated, then I have done my job for that day. Recently, our district began the rollout of individual iPads for every student. This is a very exciting adventure with 26 kindergartners and we spent last year learning with different apps and working on incorporating them into our daily activities. The students loved being able to create something and then record their voice telling about what they created. However, the students were only able to use the microphone on the iPads to record and it ended up being very loud in the background and hard to hear. I also went through numerous pairs of cheap headphones that I purchased just to make it through the year. The headphones that I'm hoping to get are designed for children, so they are durable, have volume control, and have a microphone for recording. These headphones will make it safe for my students to listen to stories and/or videos and also make it easier to record a story to go along with a creation.
needStatement: My students need headphones that are durable, created safe for children with volume control, and have microphones so that students can record their own stories to go along with their creations.

name: Dry Erase Supplies!!
description: My students learn everyday through inquiry and multiple means of representation. They love exploring different ways to solve one problem, they think outside the box when finding solutions. In our classroom we like to not only learn by listening but also by, seeing and doing. My students not only learn from me but they learn from each other and themselves. My students are curious and eager to learn! With team work and perseverance they can accomplish anything they set their minds to in my class! Personal dry erase boards will be beneficial to my classroom and students in many ways. First off, having students use dry erase boards for doing work will minimize the amount of paper being used in the classroom. Students will use the boards at their seats and on the rug and will use them for many different purposes. These purposes include: math problems, making tables to help with math, instead of scrap paper during tests, practicing drawing shapes, practicing spelling words, writing sentences, and more. It will also help me as an educator to do informal assessments quickly and efficiently by asking students to write an answer on a board and then quickly showing me. The map will be used for geography purposes. Students throughout the year will be researching where their family originated from; this is important especially for my class because they are so diverse. This map will show students which part of the world they are from. Students will also refer to the map to look for any place if it is brought up in a book or if the student is simply curious. In second grade the continents are also part of the curriculum and this map will help educated them.
needStatement: My students need personal dry erase boards, dry erase markers, and dry erase board erasers! They also need a map of the world!

name: Stand-Up Desks Improve Learning for Active Students
description: Benjamin Franklin once said, 'Tell me and I forget. Teach me and remember. Involve me and I learn.' Students need to be involved in their learning so that they can take ownership of what they are doing. Students need to get their hands 'dirty' by using them to research, create and make learning meaningful. I will teach about 22 eager, energetic 3rd grade students in my classroom this year. We are a Title I school with 100% participation in the reduced price/free lunch program. Many of our students have never left the community nor experienced anything outside of the area. All of our students are eager to learn and need experiences that they do not get at home. We do not have much parental involvement at our school and we are looking to change that. We want parents to associate school with love, learning and caring. We would like to change parents' points-of-view from the negative experiences they may have had as a child, to be able to see the positive experiences we provide their children. My students need a stand-up desk to have the choice of standing or sitting when completing assignments. If given the opportunity to use a stand-up desk, I know those children who require movement and walks would be able to focus more during a lesson. They would be moving their legs and body while standing at their stand-up desk. Right now my room has 20 desks and 20 chairs which are all the same size. My students are not all the same size. Sitting in a chair can be very uncomfortable for some. Having a stand-up desk in a classroom will be better for my more active and fidgety students. Children love to run, jump, climb and swing because they are still developing and growing. Telling a child to sit still is not going to help him or her in the classroom. In fact, too much sitting is bad for children's health.
needStatement: My students need a stand-up desk to have the choice of standing or sitting when completing assignments.

name: Lego My Legos!
description: I teach in St. Paul at a school that has a high free and reduced lunch rate. (over 90%) My students often come to school lacking resources many students and schools in the suburbs have. I love to look for resources to either catch them up academically or projects to inspire them to love school. Many have so many outside worries, that school sometimes is hard for them to concentrate on. I feel it is my job to encourage them as well give them the desire to learn. Creative play It is an important part of learning and development. Often is is dropped as students get older. I have noticed over my many years that many of our students have not had the same opportunities for hands on play materials many kids have had growing up. Resources such as legos, mazes, puzzles, and play doh cost a lot of money and require some care. I know these materials will help with problem solving, social building skills and oral language skills in our classrooms. We are working on building on problem solving and making our kids thinkers. These tools would be very helpful.
needStatement: My students need academic play activities for recess and choice time.

name: Welcome to Literacy!
description: My early learners come to school with the desire to grow into independent readers. When reading is nurtured soon after birth, literacy develops naturally and children can become readers almost miraculously. 'Children are made readers on the laps of their parents.' ~ Emilie Buchwald My school educates a diverse population of approximately 350 students in grades PreK - 4. My school is a nurturing community of dedicated teachers led by a principal committed to literacy and promoting joyful reading experiences. I am a Reading Specialist and work as a Basic Skills Teacher for students that are identified as at-risk or experiencing reading difficulties. My students are eager and enthusiastic. They are hard-working and resilient. The older students are, the more difficult it is to remediate reading difficulties. We work to provide targeted intervention as early as possible. Often my learners come to school in Kindergarten without the necessary literacy experiences. Many families are not aware that the critical time for brain development is birth - age 4 and that the #1 best thing that they can do to support their children's learning is to read to and talk with them at home. This project will make an investment in our future population by supporting our families as soon as their children are welcomed into the world. Many families do not have books at home. I would like to encourage reading at home for our future students. I can do this by supporting the families that have children already enrolled in my school. Creating 'Welcome to Literacy' baskets is my vision for getting this message out to families early. Whenever a student currently enrolled in my school welcomes a sibling to the family, they will be provided with a welcome basket of reading goodies ~ board books, developmental stacking blocks, a baby product, and literature modeling the importance of reading and talking to babies beginning at birth! Research supports the dynamic impact that reading to children can make on literacy development. I am hopeful that by extending our educational partnership to our students' infant siblings, we will help to lay a stronger foundation for our youngest readers!
needStatement: My students need a home collection of popular board books in English and Spanish and developmental learning toys to support cognitive growth.

name: Music Therapy in Early Childhood Special Education
description: The students in my Early Childhood Special Education classroom are all unique and special in their own ways. They learn and process information differently from their peers. One thing all of my students have in common is their love for music. This is another great way for us to connect with the students and for the students to connect with each other! The opportunity for my students to work with a certified music therapist would allow them another way to get engaged, participate and express themselves. Music is a world within itself, with a language we all understand -Stevie Wonder. Students in my class range from three to five years old. They have delays in 2 or more areas (cognition, motor, communication, social/emotional, and or functional/adaptive) of their development; however, they are still unique and fabulous scholars! They are loving, caring, energetic, and want to learn! With the help of music therapy many of these students are given another opportunity to learn. While we use music in the classroom, the money from this project will give the students an opportunity to work with teaching artists that are also board certified music therapists and have experience working with children with special needs. Donations to this project will help fund Learning Through Music groups for 15 weeks in our classroom. During Learning Through Music, students will learn academic and arts concepts that are embedded into the music activities (instrument play, singing, finger plays, sensory/relaxation, and movement). The students will also have the opportunity to transfer skills practiced and learned during music group to the classroom as the teacher and special education aides will also participate in the learning. In terms of brain development, musical performance is every bit as important educationally as reading and writing --Oliver Sacks. While learning through music, students will be engaged in finger plays, song, introduced to instruments, and movement.
needStatement: My students need music therapy to help them learn and develop together!

name: Yoga Mats Are Where It's At!
description: My class is comprised of all Special Education students. My school is a 6-12 secondary school in a high poverty, high risk neighborhood. We have 100% free and reduced breakfast and lunch. I would like to incorporate more health and wellness opportunities for my students by teaching them yoga once a week during advisory (homeroom). I think students will benefit mentally and physically from yoga instruction. Many of them could use a brain break during the day to stretch, breathe, and meditate. School isn't just about reading, writing, and math anymore! Health and wellness is just as important during the school day. Yoga is the answer to a much needed break from the stress of daily life especially for students with documented learning and emotional disabilities. Yoga will provide students with a much needed brain and movement break during a busy school day. If each student has one mat, I can teach yoga to them for 30 minutes once a week. What an opportunity for them! They are young and they want to move. And school is hard for them so I want to provide other things besides just academics.
needStatement: My students need a yoga mat to practice yoga once a week during advisory (homeroom).

name: Hands-on Learning for KinderGators
description: I'm working with amazing families from one of the best areas in St. Paul. We serve an area with great diversity. Our school is one of several schools that offers free or reduced price lunch to 100% of our families. I am part of an amazing staff that is very dedicated to educating our families and ourselves. We are hard working and passionate about the families that we serve. Our school is the definition of a community school. We are also unique because we use a studio model. This means that we have multiple grade-levels in one studio space. A studio can hold up to four classrooms and our studios are growing faster than our district projected! The materials in this project are all around tens frames. These materials will give children a chance to participate in classroom activities as well as work in small groups/pairs to learn in a new way. We work hard to reach each student in our studio. These materials will allow for us to reach/teach in a new way. We have a few of the materials already and they have been a big hit, both in interest and progressing the learning of our gators. If funded, this project will help us to reach more students and allow for us to teach in new ways. Students will be able to manipulate and solve problems with these materials. We will be able to teach new games and introduce new whole group ways to participate in learning activities to master math standards and skills.
needStatement: My students need Ten-Frames Magnetic Answer Board, Card Deck and other more hands-on options to solve and see mathematical equations!

name: Help Us Learn Our Letters and Words!
description: My classroom consists of twenty-six energetic, enthusiastic children that have a passion for learning and enjoy coming to school everyday. English is a second language for majority of the students. They come from various countries including Cambodia, Vietnam, Mexico, Nepal, and China. This is a high poverty Title I school where students receive free breakfast and lunch everyday. The students all have different learning styles, and many learn best with hands-on engaging activities. It can be very challenging for these students with little English, as well impoverished backgrounds, to learn without lots of motivation. Our school is a very supportive environment that allows our students to flourish and grow, not only academically but as contributors to society. Every project that I create is designed to keep the classroom a successful learning environment and have students highly motivated to come school everyday!This year I will be teaching 2nd grade and the majority of students are English as a second language learners. Many of them are not on reading level and need lots of support and engaging materials to help them learn to read. The word building and writing centers that I previously used in 3rd grade are not appropriate for my current students who are at Kindergarten and first grade reading levels. I want my students to love learning to read new words and nothing is more engaging and stimulating then hands-on activities! I want my students to practice their phonics and sight words by stamping the words, beading the words, using magnetic letters, and sketching the words on rainbow scratch paper. In addition to the word work, I want my students to apply these new words into their writing. The Ready to Write Prompt Box gives students a choice of what they would like to write about and provides sentences starters and frames which supports the English as a second language learner. The Sequence and Write a Story Tiles provides pictures for students to sequence and then use the pictures to write a story. It also gives the students words on the back of each card if they need help. These learning centers are highly engaging and I need your help to keep these students motivated to succeed and to love reading and writing!
needStatement: My students need a Small-Group Teaching Easel, Ready to Write! Prompt Box, Classroom Magnetic Letters, Sequence & Write Story Tiles, Color Ink Pads, Reusable Write & Wipe Pockets, a Storyteller Writing Box, and Lace-A-Word Lowercase Beads.

name: Individual Organization Bins
description: Our students come from a variety of different economic backgrounds and 100% of our students receive free lunch. My students speak a multitude of languages including English, Spanish, Hindi, and Arabic. As diverse as our students are economically and culturally, they are diverse in their academics. Despite so many hardships, my students are eager to learn and do their best. They want to be in school because they want to learn all they can so they can be successful one day. In Kindergarten we strive for our students to gain independence and by providing each student with their own individual bin, it will allow them to keep track of their own material. During our day, students are navigating their day using a schedule but it is also self directed. With each student having the opportunity to have their own bins to keep their material, they will learn the importance of organization. Many of my students have never had something of their own to take responsibility for and by providing each student with their own bin they will have a stronger sense of responsibility to keep track of their work.
needStatement: My students need 30 individual bins to help them keep their school material organized.

name: You Can Earn It!
description: My students are ages 14-18, or grades 9-12. All are initially diagnosed with 'behavior disorders,' and most have additional disabilities as well. Our school is large with about 1700 students, so often my kids get lost in the shuffle and find themselves slipping through the cracks. No two days are alike and we are a fun, busy classroom. Students work on Chromebooks (purchased with Donor's Choose), read quietly, work on their Algebra, play with a Rubix Cube, fiddle with a yo-yo, and complete work from their 'outside,' or general education classes. Our school does lots of incentive programs and contests, but with it being so large, our class gets lost in the mass chaos that is our population. I want to always make sure to have our own class contests and recognition opportunities for my students so they don't lose motivation toward reaching their goals. Our high school is large, and while there are opportunities for students to win prizes for attendance and grades, my 12 students often get lost in the big campus. I want to make sure that I provide them the same opportunities as their general education peers. If students feel they get rewarded for their efforts, they are more likely to continue to try and make improvements both academically and behaviorally. In my class, I give students the opportunity to earn high-value items for perfect attendance, improved grades, and decreasing their tardies. Students will use the earbuds to listen to their music privately or do their math online work. Students are always in need of backpacks and the bluetooth speakers are still another incentive for them to earn in the classroom contests and incentive opportunities. Wireless mice are helpful because sometimes it's hard to use the Chromebooks without a mouse. I try to prevent frustrating situations from occuring in my class as much as possible. These items help motivate my students to come to school.
needStatement: My students need their own opportunities to earn prizes, like the students on the big campus. The backpacks, speakers, and headphones are items that students will work for!

name: Books For Boys!
description: I teach in St.Paul at a school that has a high free and reduced lunch rate(over 90%). My students often come to school lacking resources many students and schools in the suburbs have. I love to look for resources to either catch them up academically or projects to inspire them to love school. Many have so many outside worries, that school sometimes is hard for them to concentrate on. I feel it is my job to encourage them as well give them the desire to learn.I was sorting through my classroom library the other day and had a big noticing. My books are not exactly interesting for all of my kids, especially the boys. I have plenty of animal, friendship, and fictional stories, but that is not what my kids today want. When we go to the library, they fight over the limited graphic novels available, so I decided to change that. I know my boys (and many of the girls as well) love graphic novels. I truly believe if they had books that they had more interest in, their reading scores would increase and they would enjoy reading a lot more.
needStatement: My students need high interest reading materials. The boys especially want graphic novels!

name: So, Have You Read (Heard) Any Good Books Lately?
description: I teach in an urban school that serves a very diverse population of students where 92% of the students receive free or reduced price lunch. We serve immigrant families new to the country and bilingual students. Our school mission focuses on developing life-long learners and responsible citizens. We provide special education, academic intervention, Title I, and ESL services. My goal as an educator in my fourth grade classroom is to provide a differentiated learning environment that will help my students to develop confidence and self-esteem, achieve academic success and engage in the love of learning through collaborative teamwork. My fourth grade classroom is comprised of 28 amazing students, many of whom come from bilingual households and receive free or reduced price lunch. My students have very diverse needs and it is my job to provide engaging, differentiated instruction to meet those needs in a safe, fun learning environment where collaboration and teamwork are fundamentals in problem-solving and educational exploration. I am requesting balance ball chairs and a bean bag chair to get all students comfortable in the classroom, even students with special needs such as attention deficit disorder, so students can really focus on reading books. The iPod shuffles, Percy Jackson books and audiobooks will provide a format for reluctant chapter book readers to try tackling longer engaging chapter books with audio support. Book bags give them a waterproof case to take home the book, the iPod/audio book safely to and from school and will allow them to read at home and school. Providing this opportunity to two students allows students to collaborate and share their reading experiences with a peer. Every classroom needs to have shared reading experience to help engage students and work through reading skills together; 'Dear Mr. Henshaw' will provide that opportunity for my students. Adding the video, 'The Mighty' will allow us to compare and contrast a media adaptation to a novel. We have a class set of 'Freak the Mighty' so reading the text then having students identify similarities and differences between the two will allow students to more deeply engage with the text.
needStatement: My students need a classroom set of Dear Mr. Henshaw texts, two iPod shuffles, Percy Jackson books and matching audio books, two balance ball chairs and a bean bag chair to help us get reading!

name: We ALL Get to Read About Our World!
description: I want my students to be amazed at all that exists in our world, and to learn that reading is one way to discover its wonders. I teach a multi-age class of enthusiastic 2nd and 3rd graders, whose reading skills range from kindergarten through 5th grade and whose interests are as diverse as they are. My school is a K-8 option school in our district that parents choose for their children. As an alternative school we attract students with a wide-array of learning styles, interests and backgrounds. I have many students who are diagnosed with learning disabilities, Autism-Spectrum Disorder, Sensory Processing Disorder and ADHD. My students will use these sets of books during guided reading time when they get support in a small group from a teacher. Because the book sets are at a variety of levels, I will be able to work with students at their just-right reading levels. These books will also be used during independent reading time, allowing groups of students to support one another as they practice their reading together. This collection includes informational books about high-interest topics to 2nd and 3rd graders as well as folktales from many different cultures. Students will gain confidence as readers as they learn about this wondrous and diverse world we live in. With your support my students' lives will be forever changed by being able to read about their world!
needStatement: My students need interesting low-level book sets that include informational texts and folktales.

name: Safe Spaces for Social Learners
description: My class of diverse learners comes to school excited and ready to learn every day and I get so excited each year seeing them become global citizens and internationally-minded thinkers. Ours is a classroom rich in cultural diversity, kindness, and fun! By providing us with these classroom essentials, you are helping my students feel safe, welcome, and excited about their school day. My students face many challenges outside of the classroom including violence, poverty, and unstable family lives. School gives them a safe space to learn, make mistakes, and grow. Please help them get the best start possible on their education career!First and second graders are blossoming as readers. They tear through books and climb through the levels as quickly as you can imagine! By supplying my classroom with book bins, you are giving my students necessary tools to keep their instruction individualized and helping me to meet each child's needs specifically. First and second graders are also innately social, energetic, and excited. Because of this, we need a space in which to practice social learning each day, and a morning meeting rug would provide this for us! In addition to giving us a place to host morning meeting, this rug would provide students with a fun place to work individually, collaboratively, and increases their options for classroom seating.
needStatement: My students need a space for morning meeting. This rug will provide them with adequate room and a comfortable place to start their day. They need book bins to keep their collections of books each week.

name: Movement Matters
description: Have you ever been forced to sit all day, when all you wanted to do is move? Well, it is very hard for students too! As a Special Education teacher in a high poverty area, my students face many challenges inside and outside of my classroom. I strive to provide them with a safe and comfortable environment where they have the tools necessary to be successful. My school is working hard to support kids through positive attention, community building, and teaching students to become self-advocates. My students love to move during learning. These materials will help my active students focus and engage during instruction and independent work time. These tools will provide students with the sensory feedback necessary to concentrate while not disrupting the learning of those around them. My student's behavior will improve and more time will be spent on task improve learning outcomes for all students. My students will be able to feel success in the classroom (some for the first time) while using these stools or desk cycles. I am excited to be able to provide students with the tools they need to experience success and foster the potential I see in all of them.
needStatement: My students need the desk cycles and stools to help them get the movement they seek in a way that will not disrupt their learning or the learning of others.

name: Living the Past: Historical Fiction Genre Study
description: 'Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.' -Helen Keller. Therein lies the power of the classroom, and any teacher worth their salt knows that forming a community--particularly a reading community--is the foundation to a great year. My students are bright and willing, but need assistance in terms of literacy resources and experiences, which is why I am constantly on the lookout for great books to read together. Most of my students come from families with two working parents. As a working mom with two children of my own, I often lament my family's loss of reading time to the demands of just making it through the day. Reading, in my opinion, is mistakenly considered a solitary activity. You may take the words in through your own eyes, but I believe so much is lost if you don't share everything that happens after that--the joy, surprise, confusion, frustration and reward of reading good books. I want to create these opportunities in school, for this is what creates lifelong readers. If my project is funded, my students will participate in a genre study of historical fiction. Students will be able to chose an historical novel that interests them and read in small groups of 3-4, while together we will use our selections to examine the genre and its traits. It is important that students are exposed to and immersed in many kinds of print and many types of literature. A genre study is one way to accomplish that. I chose the genre of historical fiction as one way to support history standards. Our past is too vast and complicated to be covered in one history class per year; reading historical fiction not only brings the past to life, but it also exposes children to parts of history that may not be covered adequately in their course of social studies. Additionally, my students will read primary sources and informational texts associated with the time-preiod of their chosen novel, which adds another element of genre exposure (fiction v. non-fiction). Ultimately, a genre study will allow us to not only enjoy historical content, but also to 'compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.' (CCCS RL 10)
needStatement: My students need multiple copies of high-interest historical fiction novels for a class genre study.

name: Let's Get Our Wiggles Out
description: Our school is located in the suburbs of Atlanta in a very diverse community. Our schools population of students come from all over the world. Our school is a Title 1 public school, and my classroom alone serves around 100 students. Many of the students in my classroom are being served in one or more of the following programs: ESOL (English as a second language), Special Education, and TAG (our district's Gifted Program). Our students work incredibly hard each and every day at school! Every year, I am amazed by the progress the students are making, and the effort they are putting forth in school. I love my job, and I feel incredibly blessed to work with such amazing students! By the end of the day, many of our students struggle to sit still and focus during math class. We have found success with allowing students to bounce up and down on yoga balls during class, but unfortunately these take up a ton of space in the classroom. Hokki stools allow our students to wiggle/rock/dance/bounce in their seat while focusing on their math assignments! By providing students with an alternative seating option, our students will be able to focus on being successful in math class while exerting their energy. The whiteboard easel will easily allow my co-teacher and I to have small group instruction happening in the front and the back of the classroom. This will increase the number of students we reach in a small group setting in a single class period. These resources will allow our students to be successful and continue to love school!
needStatement: My students need Hokki Stools and a Whiteboard Easel for our classroom!

name: Give the Gift of Technology!
description: My students are active fourth graders that are learning to be critical thinkers, courageous problem-solvers and compassionate community builders in a focus option K-8 in Portland, Oregon. Our school's mission is to promote these habits of mind in our students through constructivist teaching practices. We emphasize learning by doing, and therefore our study of history and geography involves a lot of research, often on the internet. We encourage the students to engage in their own learning by designing and implementing their own projects and they love to use technology to create engaging presentations. My students need 2 Chromebook laptops and a printer with toner. My students will use the laptops and printer to conduct research, communicate, practice typing skills, work on illustrations and print their work to share. My students are beginning to use primary resources in their research on the geography and history of Oregon and Native American tribes of Oregon. I teach them necessary skills for fact-finding on the Internet and assist them with the writing and design involved with creating engaging presentations about what they have learned. They enjoy giving presentations to their classmates and appreciate using digital tools to enhance their presentations. We currently lack printers for student use, so they will use our new classroom printer to assist in sharing their work with each other.
needStatement: My students need laptops and a printer in our classroom to help them display their engaging visual research projects related to the study of Oregon.

name: Ukulele Madness!!
description: 'Music can change the world because it can change people!' ~ BONO I have a special project unit in my new curriculum based on the Ukulele. 6th grade and I would love to learn Ukulele by doing this unit. They need hands-on learning. I teach in a Title I school. This means that any and all opportunities our students receive musically come from our school. Private music lessons are very expensive and out of reach for most of our students. The student body is made of mostly minorities. I want to ensure that our students here are receiving just as many opportunities as those who can afford private lessons and go to a school with more money/supplies. Ukuleles will serve to help students learn an instrument closely related to the guitar but that is small enough for all hand sizes. We received a new curriculum for grades K-5 but nothing for 6th grade. The one thing I did find in my new curriculum was a special Ukulele Project. This project will help to capture 6th graders attention and will serve to improve music literacy. Ukuleles are also similar to guitars but much smaller fitting everyone's hands. Our district has guitar classes for upper-grade levels and Ukuleles would prepare them for guitar classes. How would you like to be in the sixth grade but still using the same instruments since first grade? Wouldn't you like a challenge? Help us, please.
needStatement: My students need 30 Ukuleles to complete the unit that comes with our curriculum.

name: Finding Our Beat with Boomwhackers!
description: My students bring rich cultural and life experiences to my classroom. My classroom is a mixture of students familiar with U.S. American culture and education and those brand new to the country with varying degrees of formal education. I have students who come to the United States from Asia, Africa and South America, and speak many languages including Karen, Hmong, Somali, and Spanish. Our school population is 80% ELL and 90% free lunch. My students bring a resilient spirit and a growth mindset for learning. All students, at every level of English proficiency, are engaged in deep learning conversations and rigorous activities. It is important to understand that the majority of my students come from collectivist cultures where learning is best done through oral tradition, music, and cooperative activities. The Boomwhacker project would be a way to teach my class how to read and produce music in a cost effective way. We have not had music education for two years due to budget cuts. Over a decade of research has proven that music education is critical to a child's brain development. 'Music, as we know, is one of the most powerful means available to further human development and build great communities and societies. Neuroscience research also now shows us that music education is a very powerful tool for attaining a child's full intellectual, social and creative potential,' said Dr. Peter Simon, President and CEO, The Royal Conservatory of Music.' (The Benefits of Music Education: An Overview of Current Neuroscience Research. May 7, 2014) The Boomwhacker Project would tap into my students' cultural traditions of music and dance, giving them the ability to express themselves authentically, and it would open the door to future music programs in middle and high school. Music is every child's right. Its benefits on brain development, creativity, critical thinking and health are proven. My students do not get formal music education and the opportunities afforded to some for private music lessons. This project would serve to create a more equitable situation that would allow my children the same benefits as those who get formal music education. Because I have music training, I would be able to teach my students how to read and play music with the Boomwhackers. My goal is to provide music education two days a week and private lessons for those who would like more time. This training would also be preparation for performance opportunities that we have school-wide a few times a year. Thank you for considering my project. I look forward to sharing our progress with donors!
needStatement: My students need 9 shared sets of Boomwhackers percussion tubes and the basic curriculum tools to bring music education into our classroom.

name: Speech Buddies for My 'Speech Buddies'!
description: Imagine walking into a classroom in a new school, a friendly student approaches you and asks your name. You answer, but your new friend can't understand what you've said. You clarify a few times, but you fail to communicate the one word that should come naturally to every child. Sounds like a bad dream, right? For many of my students, this is the case. My students are fun and hard-working; they want their world to know it! Let's provide them the tools they need to make them more effective communicators so that they can grow socially and academically! My students would greatly benefit from the tools in the 'Speech Buddies' tool kit. These tools are specially designed to help train the tongue to make the correct shape to form some of the more difficult speech sounds- including /r, s, l/, 'ch', and 'sh'. These tools are proven to work in a shorter amount of time than other types of intervention, getting them out of therapy and back into the classroom!Your donation will help my speech students reach their goals quickly- giving them the power to communicate clearly and effectively with their teachers, friends, and their precious families!
needStatement: My students need 'Speech Buddies' to help make the production of certain speech sounds easier!

name: Play LEGO, Learn STEM, Become Engineer
description: The students I have the honor of advising are talented and dedicated students who are always looking for a challenge. All students are from low-income families who qualify for free and reduced lunch. These students stay after school because they are always looking for opportunities to gain new knowledge. My students are a diverse bunch. Between them, they speak a combine of four languages and are born in four different countries. My students comes from various backgrounds and difficulties. They don't use it as an excuse but as an opportunity to better themselves. My students stay after school to be a part of our Lego League Team. This is a great opportunity to introduce students of low-income to Computer Programing and Engineering. Our first need is better computers. As of right now, we have extremely outdated Macs that don't hold their charge. It was also suggested from other LEGO teams that the program runs best on Windows and not Macs. Last year I used my own personal computer because our Macs crashed. Lego League allows students to identify and solve problems by engineering and programming LEGO robots. Students also research real world problems and present it to a panel of judges. The new Acer Aspire laptops will allow my students to research and program their LEGO Mindstorms robots. Our school LEGO set was made in 2009; we need the new version to use the new sensors and stay more competitive during competition.
needStatement: My students need Acer Aspire laptop computers and two LEGO Mindstorms kits.

name: Nos Encanta Leer-Spanish Book Clubs!
description: My students are enrolled in a dual immersion program (for English and Spanish learners) with many students being native Spanish speakers. Our school is located in a primarily Latino community and many of my students this year are Latino. These children are actively involved in their community, participating in after school programs at community organizations and sports like soccer and football. Reading levels in my class vary greatly. Many of my students are excited to be strong readers with many interested in challenging themselves by reading chapter books. They are interested in animals, fantasy, and real-life, relatable books. My third grade students love to read chapter books an to socialize with peers. This project will allow us to create book clubs with books that not only will strongly appeal to students but will increase the number of high-quality books we have available in Spanish. My students will see that I care about their interests, culture, language and what is important to them in our new library books! I look forward to the reading highly engaged reading that students will do in pairs or small groups this year! This will help gift students with a lifelong skill. ¡Muchas gracias!
needStatement: My students need six copies of titles such as La Elefanta del Mago and Gracias a Winn-Dixie to build up our Spanish books in our library and for us to form book clubs this year!

name: Cafe Style Cooperative Learning
description: are 4th graders, who will be studying math and science. I teach 2 sections of both. They are a diverse group, with various learning abilities, styles, and needs. They include all ethnicities and a variety of family backgrounds. Several of the students have special needs, and others have moved here from other countries. It is a special group of students who are active, energetic, and full of enthusiasm for learning.I would like to work with their diversity by providing a variety of learning options. According to Mark Bendon, a Texas A&M professor, 'Children become more restless and distracted with prolonged sitting. Active work stations reduce disruptive behavior problems and increase student attention by providing them with a different method of completing tasks and breaking up the monotony of seated work.' I am requesting 2 stand to learn desks. The desks would provide another option for students when they learning. Giving students a choice of work station in their classroom has been shown to increase productivity for all students as it makes learning easier for them! 'What we're really striving for are those choices that have a lot of thought behind them,' says Becky Fisher, the director of educational technology at Albemarle County Public Schools, 'We want kids to really be strategic about where they go.' The students would be able to move flexible through the seating options throughout the year. The use of flexible learning options is aligned with purposeful, meaningful, and engaging learning opportunities directed towards mastering academic skills.
needStatement: My students need a variety of seating arrangements, including the ability to stand up while learning. The two stand-up desks would provide an additional opportunity for flexible seating for students.

name: Music Makes Everything BETTER!
description: I am a band director at SA middle school and I teach the MOST FABULOUS students on the planet! Having a music education for these kids is such a privilege to them, and they absolutely LOVE learning about music and how to play their instruments. We have a high minority and high poverty level here, but that doesn't stop my students from wanting to learn music! If children are not introduced to music at a young age, I believe something fundamental is being taken from them. I have 185 students in the band program here, and my classes are divided by grade and sometimes by instrument. I teach students from 6 through 8th grade! I seriously consider my job my biggest blessing because I am able to come to school daily and work with these kids. They truly make my heart happy, and I cannot express enough great things about the students I get to teach on a daily basis. The Community of SA was hit by a terrible flood beginning on Friday, August 12, 2016. MANY of my students lost their homes, quite a few lost the instruments, and the band room at SA middle school flooded. Most things in my band room have been thrown away. The music stands that I am requesting are used daily in class by 185 students. They use them to place their music, folder, and pencil on while we play. If not for the band, what music would the dance team and cheerleading squad dance to throughout the game? My 7th and 8th grade football band will use the music from the Sports Pak daily in class as we prepare for football games/pep rallies. All of my band students will daily use the Foundations for Superior performance book to learn warm ups, scales, chorales, etc. from. Music makes my students HAPPY! So getting them playing again as soon as possible will make a HUGE difference in their lives!
needStatement: My students need music stands and music so we can start playing instruments again this year in band!

name: Just Right Board Books
description: Pike Township is an urban residential community, which is located in the northwest corner of the greater Indianapolis area. It is home to families with diverse social, cultural, ethnic, and economic backgrounds. My classroom serves students in Pike Township with special needs that require a separate classroom for learning than their peers. The special needs may vary from year to year and include but limited to students with Down Syndrome, Orthopedic Impairment, Autism, Hear Impaired, Blind/Low Vision, and Traumatic Brain Injury. The students work on academics, functional life skills, and receive integrated physical, occupational, speech, and other therapy while at school. The goal for the students in the Lifeskills classroom is to as independent as possible. Reading can be difficult due to the skill of turning pages in a book. “There is no such thing as a child who hates to read; there are only children who have not found the right book.”-Professor of Literacy Education and Children's Literature at Arizona State University. My students need the thicker pages that board books offer to be more independent in reading. Board books are their right books. The board books listed below are high interest low readability books, which matches my students interests and levels. The Pike Township Educational Foundation is currently offering 'Double Your Impact' Program. PTEF will match every donation made to my project. “Never underestimate the difference YOU can make in the lives of others. Step forward, reach out and help.' Anonymous
needStatement: My students need board books to enjoy the skill of reading independently.

name: Kindergarten - Learning Through a Hands-on, Meaningful Environment For All!
description: As a Kindergarten teacher in a diverse, low-income/high poverty school district my students are faced with many challenges in school, as well as at home. Each child is special in my class and brings with them a story and background different than their peers. For many, Kindergarten is their first school experience. My goal is to instill the love of learning and unleash their greatest learning potential through hands-on learning experiences through investigations and active learning time. I try to provide a safe and fun atmosphere where their self-esteem is nurtured and enhanced and self-confidence will grow. My students will use these materials in our centers in order to help enhance their experiences, knowledge and interests, as well as develop critical thinking with each other. It will give them an opportunity to have a safe, yet fun environment to develop and practice problem-solving skills, address social/emotional, intellectual and physical needs of the whole child. The students will have the opportunity to develop a deeper understanding of communities, living things, and changes all around us. Young children learn best through play and I would love to create a more enriched, hands-on, authentic environment for them to develop a love for learning . The microscope, magnifiers, and slides I have requested will help students explore items in science first hand, as well as observe changes in fruits, vegetables, and objects in our world. The students will become little scientists ready to explore the world around them. The items such as the grocery store food and pet vet shop center will fill our social studies center with hands-on materials so the children can learn about jobs in our world, cooperative learning and responsibility in a community. This project will improve my classroom engagement because it will give me the tools needed to make our learning environment fun, safe and creative for all learners. The food items and vet clinic items will allow my Kindergarteners to be creative in our social studies center when they learn about community helpers and create a grocery store to buy and sell items like Mom and Dad. The numerous science materials will be very helpful for the children to see and experiment things first hand throughout the school year.
needStatement: My students need hands-on materials in our science and social studies such a microscope, slides, grocery set, pet vet center, mailbox, magnifiers, and weather bulletin board set.

name: Wobbling to Success!
description: Scholars at my school are energetic, playful and enjoy being actively engaged in any given subject they are currently involved in. These kiddos also love movement and rhythm. Our students thrive on voice and choice, individualized learning and our commitment to meet them where they are at. We view their diverse backgrounds as an asset and a tool to engaging them in meaningful, lifelong learning. If you meet a scholar from my place of work, you might just walk away with a big smile on your face, wondering how a child can be so alive and aware of the world around them. I am requesting 6 Kore Kids Wobble chairs to put at a table where I plan to have scholars work with me or as a team, doing small group pull-out activities and receiving specialized instruction. These chairs allow students to be in constant motion, which is beneficial for all learners by allowing for increased blood flow to muscles and the brain during learning and independent practice time. Scholars who learn more kinesthetically will be stimulated in a way that supports their individual learning style. My hope is that greater movement while seated will reinforce safe learning habits and increased student engagement as well as focus.
needStatement: My students need Kore Kids wobble chairs to help them focus on learning while working in small groups.

name: Read Along With Me
description: When you think of preschool, what is the first thing that comes to mind? It may be blocks, recess, art, or even snack time. When I think of preschool I think of the amazing group of kids that I have the privilege to teach. I teach a preschool special education classroom full of students with wonderful personalities. The students in my classroom have a wide range of disabilities including autism, Down syndrome, and developmental delays. Teaching preschool is not that different from a one-man show; you play the role of teacher, mom, nurse, and more on a daily basis. One of the most difficult things about preschool is learning HOW to learn in preschool. For many of my students this is the first time they have been away from their parents. I believe that this age learns best through play and I try to incorporate play into our day as much as possible. With so many different needs, it can be hard to find all the materials you need. However, I do my best to make sure that all of my students learn and have fun every day. Everybody has a favorite story or book as a child. Think about your preschool years. Maybe you loved 'Goodnight Moon.' Maybe it was 'Where the Wild Things Are' that took you on a wonderful adventure. Maybe is was a different book that was special for reasons only you could understand. As a student, your teachers helped you to find, read, and enjoy books you loved. There is nothing more exciting for students than to feel like an independent reader. A listening center is a great way for students to achieve this independence. Being able to hold, listen, and follow along with a book is a great way for students to build their literacy and comprehension. The listening center will be used in our classroom to help expose my students to new stories and foster independence. The classic read-alongs and books with CDs will be used to allow students to follow along and see the words and pictures as they listen to the story.
needStatement: My students need a listening center, a set of classroom classic read-alongs, and 4 individual books on cd to help foster a love of reading.

name: Learning is Easel!
description: I teach in a low income/high poverty school. Students are faced with many challenges and difficulties because of their background. We are fortunate for what we have, but the school cannot provide everything that we need to promote the learning of the students. My students deserve a quality education! I aim to provide a rigorous academic year and promote student growth by improving their literacy and critical thinking skills. I have a great group of students who all have bright futures. Help me give them what the need to be successful. By having an easel they will be able to collaborate and build on one another's thoughts. I can use this in a whole group setting as well as at my teacher table during guided reading or math. This tool will be helpful in supporting my students education. Students will be able to use this board to show how they worked out problems or explain their thinking to their peers. This will encourage students to not only be leaders, but thinkers! An easel will help my visual learners understand the concepts being taught at any level of teaching whether it be small group or whole group.
needStatement: My students need a dry erase easel.

name: Hands-on Activities
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things simple and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. I have 20 kindergarten students that face hunger, minimal sleep, and sometimes they may be homeless. With your help they will be provided hands on activities for various learning centers that will enhance their creativity, interest, and learning. These materials will provide hands on experiences for my students to enhance their learning and make learning fun! The ten frame magnetic boards will be used during circle time and in the math centers to help students develop counting skills, operations thinking, and allow them to show their work. The read aloud book sets will be used in the listening center to help boost reading fluency and comprehension skills. The rhyming sorting houses will be used during circle time and in the rhyming center to help children hear the sounds in words in order to increase their rhyming skills. The magnetic counting chart will be used at circle time and in the math center to help students learn to count, learn to skip count, and identify even and odd numbers. The word building kit will be used in the phonics center to help students learn to build words. The alphabet cards will be used in the ABC center to help students learn to write their letters, identify the different letters, and associate an uppercase letter with a lowercase letter. The fishing sight word kit will be used in the sight word center to help make learning sight words fun. I really appreciate you taking the time to read about my project and considering to donate your hard earned money! My students will appreciate it beyond words!
needStatement: My students need hands on activities for various centers such as ten-frames, read-along book sets, sorting houses, number match-ups, word building and magnetic fishing poles.

name: Mrs. M's Kindergarten: Helping Little Minds Grow
description: My students are so special because they have overcome so much. Many of them have lost their homes and now they have lost what should be a safe haven for them, their school. Our community has come together to make sure our students feel safe and welcome. We have all come together to make sure that our kids have everything they need rather it be clothes, school supplies, or even a should to lean on. This community that I grew up in and the school I attended is the best! These materials will help my students be able to learn hands on. In kindergarten, most learning occurs while children are playing. For example, I have requested a kitchen center and this is a great opportunity for the students to develop social skills and will learn how to work together as a team. I have also requested white boards for my classroom. I use these daily in ELA and math. The students can use them to write and develop phonics skills as well as handwriting skills. Lastly, I have requested unifix cubes for one of my math manipulatives. I will use these for number identification, one to one counting, and addition and subtraction. I have to rebuild my classroom from a devastating flood that affected our whole community. By having these tools and supplies replaced, it will give normalcy to children who don't have stability in their life because of the tragedy. Many children are living at different homes and school will be a safe place where they can learn and grown. While at school, students will be able to focus on learning and socializing. Please consider donating so that little minds can grown.
needStatement: My students need an assortment of learning tools like blocks, costumes, dry erase boards, magnifiers, pocket charts and storage units. My classroom is very hands on and these materials will allow my students to do so. I also feel that social play is essential to student learning.

name: Bulldogs Need S.T.E.M. Materials!
description: Our students are fun, creative, smart, artistic, and very entertaining. They are aching to learn and explore new ideas. Last year I started planning and doing science labs with the 5th and 6th grade students. They loved it. Many of our students haven't been exposed to even the most basic of science concepts. The simple act of adding vinegar to baking soda was super impressive for them. This year I want to challenge them even more. I want the Middle School science students to know what they can accomplish given the proper tools. My students love science experiments. I have been learning about how much STEM projects can positively influence students and stimulate their love of science. My students crave challenges and new learning experiences. The Elenco 130-in-1 Electronic Playground and Learning Center will provide my students with hands-on experiences in building circuits and working with electronics. My Middle School science students love hands-on. They love building and creating. Many times, however, we only have enough resources for me to give them a demonstration, and not a chance to do the project themselves. These kits will allow the students to create something on their own. They will learn that they can create something and be successful making something difficult and complex. The range of these kits will allow all of my students to be successful.
needStatement: My students need the Elenco Electric Playground to explore the wonderful world of electrical engineering and discover how to build circuits and other electronic gizmos.

name: Help Us Read!
description: My 21 students are excited to enter the world of Kindergarten and begin their journey as lifelong learners! I greatly value building a strong classroom community that emphasizes working together, creatively solving problems, and showing kindness and empathy towards others. My students represent a range of strengths and abilities, thus having a curriculum and resources that support the needs of each student is an important goal of mine. These resources will also provide the opportunity for students to use voice and choice while decision making, and personalize their learning towards their interests and goals. The materials listed will give my kindergarten students access to high quality texts that are engaging, fun to listen to, and grows their love for reading! These texts will be important to my students because it allows them to see where the world of reading can take them! Some of the texts will be used as read alouds, and students will have a chance to explore the pages in the book after our class read alouds. Other texts will be used to help fill their individual book boxes with books that are interesting, have detailed pictures, and that they are excited to share with the other kinders! The books will help the students continue to gain a love for learning and help share their love of learning with friends! The art easel will help my students create replicas of their favorite illustrations in books and create their own artwork to share with others!
needStatement: My students need books that give them access to rich vocabulary, detailed pictures, and can be used during our read aloud time! They need an easel too.

name: LA Flood Recovery
description: My students are located in Denham Springs where nearly 90% of the city was 'washed away' by the flood on August 13th. Our school serves students from 10th to 12th grade. These are your 'next generation' students who are about to rule and conquer our everyday world. The students in my classroom come from a variety of backgrounds with a variety of goals. Some really need the chemistry because they are your doctors and engineers, and then other students are just trying to pass. No matter the goal of the students, every single child is putting in effort to understand and grasp the content being delivered to them. Many students are nervous to begin their journey of the chemistry curriculum, but together they leave inspired and fascinated. The chemistry classroom is where the students are able to see details of what is happening in and around them. We do several labs and hands on activities where the students faces just light up with energy and fascination. The students are putting work in daily to understand all the different concepts being taught to them. My school and classroom was one of the areas most affected by the flood on August 13th. My classroom alone had over 4 feet of water and destroyed nearly everything including the newly bought school supplies my students purchased. The items needed are everyday classroom items that were once taken for granted but are now desperately needed. Nothing was able to be salvaged from my classroom. The items I have requested are things that are vital to the recovery of my once lively and joyful classroom. Some items include dry erase markers to write on the mini whiteboards that the students love to use for quick practice or the simple supplies such as loose-leaf paper and pens. I also ask for art supplies for my students to use to brighten up their assignments. My students have the option to use tickets to use the coveted classroom microwave or store their lunch in the mini fridge, which was damaged in the flood. Other items such as the drawer organizer will bring normalcy to the classroom as the students store their completed assignments and classroom packets in this area. All these things, both big and small will not only help my students return to normality, after the flood, but for them to learn and love the world around them through chemistry.
needStatement: My students need everything possible to make a normal classroom work. We lost every single item in the flood from classroom decorations to paper, tape, stapler, hole punch, binders and pens.

name: Centers Galore!
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things simple and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. They like to move, they love to read, and love lots of positive attention. Many of them are being raised in single parent households and receive a free lunch based on their socioeconomic status. These things may prevent them from getting ahead early in life and may not provide them with the life experiences many of us see as 'typical'. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their potential and growth while they are with me. I may not be able to control their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. By doing this in a creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our earliest learners to continue on a path of academic excellence. Moving from kindergarten to 4th grade has been somewhat difficult. These Science File Folder Games, colored paper, CD/cassette player, and headphones splitter will enable me to spend more time on writing instruction, give my students science centers to help integrate it into our literacy block, and allow my students to listen to books on tape/CD that I already own. By adding these additional supports, my goal is that their test scores will increase significantly because of the materials that they will now have available to them. These supplies will enable my students to have enjoyable and educational centers that they will learn and grow from, from now until the end of the year.
needStatement: My students need center materials to use during our 60 minute intervention block such as Science File Folder Games, colored paper, a CD/cassette boombox, and headphones splitter.

name: Centers Made Easy!
description: Imagine it's your first day of school. You had a great day and you are ready to go back. We never had our second day of school. Our second day of school was when 'The Great Flood of 2016' hit. Our school had over a foot and half of water. With this DonorsChoose.org project, we are trying to rebuild our classroom. Any donations that are given, will go directly to rebuilding what we once had. While our school is being rebuilt, we will be housed in the gyms of different schools from our district. Thank you in advance for any help you can give. Once returning to school after the flood, I quickly realized that our class needs items to help with centers. The students love to work in centers and these items will help them to be able to enjoy centers again. They love to work with magnetic letters and in learning stations. With the center chart, the students will easily be able to go from station to station in an organized way. Your donation will help these students get back into a routine that they have been out of for a few weeks. Getting them back to normal has been my biggest goal since returning from the flood.
needStatement: My students need learning station activities, magnetic letters, and a center chart. Our school flooded and we do not have these items any longer.

name: This Kindergarten Classroom is Making a Comeback from the Flood!
description: My Kindergarten classroom is a place to grow, play, and learn together! However, recently my classroom and my students have been affected by the flood in Louisiana. My classroom had 26 inches of contaminated water sitting in it for days, ruining everything in there. All teacher and student resources, supplies, furniture, rugs, and organizational shelving units and file cabinets were lost due to the contaminated water and mold. My students and I are displaced at another school right now borrowing an empty PE room with limited to no teacher supplies/furniture available. Also, I have students that have lost their houses and all the possessions in them as well. For right now, school is their only escape from the chaos at home, due to the vast damage around our community. I have a diverse set of students but the one thing they all have in common is their love and eagerness to learn. Please consider helping my students regain a sense of normalcy in their second home, after all, they spend more time awake here than at home during the school year.GPS is one of the Louisiana schools affected by the recent devastating flood. This project is focused on helping my Kindergarten students regain a positive and safe environment when our home school reopens. I pray we are able to replace essential supplies like bookshelves, big book centers, dramatic play kitchens, and listening stations that were lost in the flood. Kindergarten babies need all of these things throughout the day to make their learning experiences enjoyable and functional. Please consider helping replace what has been lost in my classroom. Our Lil Pirates will benefit greatly from having an inviting classroom to come to when they return to school.
needStatement: My students need their dramatic play kitchen back. They also love when I read at the big book center and then they get to use it at stations! We miss our classroom and need it back!

name: Picasso Wanna-Be's
description: My students live in a very small community in central New Jersey. Their school is so small, in fact, that there is only one class of students in each grade. Their ages range from 5-13, and they all know one another. It's a tight-knit, intimate community. My students are into all sorts of cool stuff including sports, books, and of course, art! We have art one time a week, and right now they don't get to paint nearly enough as I'd like them too, because it's too messy for their regular school clothes. My students love to paint, but the smocks that they currently have are gross, old t-shirts (and we don't even have enough of them for each student). Due to this, most students refrain from wearing the so-called 'smocks' at all costs, causing them to get paint on their clothes, oops! My students also love to draw, and they are constantly trying to learn how to draw new things. Some love to draw animals, some like cars, and others like cartoon characters. But, when learning how to draw, mistakes are inevitable. We currently use pencil erasers to get rid of mistakes, but it's just not enough! Getting smocks and erasers will make my students' art time more efficient, and enjoyable!
needStatement: My students need art aprons and erasers.

name: Tech Deprived!
description: Although my students have severe learning disabilities, they are all eager to learn and relish the opportunity to do so. At times they get frustrated because our district doesn't have the means to provide adequate materials for them, since we are a high poverty, low income district. 99% of our students receive free or reduced breakfast and lunch, but they come to school every day enthusiastic to participate in their learning. The safety and security of my classroom fosters a love of learning . Students truly love coming into my classroom daily, and enjoy learning something new every day. The laptops will be used daily to reinforce lessons during math and reading centers. The school district has access to various web based sites and with the laptops, my students will be able to benefit from them. Laptops will benefit my students by increasing their reading and math skills. One program that my students have access to is called Waterford. Studies have proven, that this program will increase students reading skills with consistent use. Many of our computer-based programs allow me to track their progress and pinpoint their area of need so I can focus my instruction on their weaknesses.
needStatement: My students need 4 laptops to be used during math and reading in order to differentiate instruction.

name: An Easel to Hold Our Charts and Teach our Hearts
description: My students come to school everyday despite heavy challenges at home and in their neighborhood. Many of them lack a support system and push themselves to come to school and learn. They make sure they show up. Once they come to school, they know that the doors are open for them to learn and grow. I admire the strength within them that they do not even know they have. The neighborhood the school is located in has been on the rise for gang activity- and because of this, my students need more help than ever. When we are seated on the carpet together, we are able to learn from each other and come up with great ideas. This is tough to do without an easel. Right now, we tape charts on the wall or lean things against a chair. With this easel, it will make our learning so much easier and fun! The students will be able to come up to the easel and write and share their ideas. The students will also have an easier time viewing what I am teaching and become more engaged and involved. It will also keep all of our posters organized and easy to display. We will also use the whiteboard markers to write on a reusable surface to do our work and save paper.
needStatement: My students need an easel to teach their fellow students and whiteboard markers to show their work!

name: Flexible Seating for Success
description: My students are engaged and eager to learn. I set high expectations and it is my job to give them the tools they need to reach those expectations. My students are critical and creative thinkers. They are energetic and like to move around. Most of all they want to learn and do their best. Our students are encouraged to questions, imagine possibilities, work collaboratively, create innovative solutions; and always look for ways to improve. Our school is a high needs school with 75% of our students receiving free or reduced lunch. My students have requested new seats so they have option other then hard chairs to sit in all day. We've discussed how different seating options will allow them to move while doing their work. These materials will allow movement while they work to keep them active and engaged. They have discussed and voted on what seating options they want to have first. Having a variety of seating options will allow each student to take responsibility in their choices of work space. The movement of each item will allow them to fidget without distracting others. There are studies that show that classrooms with flexible seating increase student's attitude and engagement, increase student participation and conversation and in turn improve student's grades and scores. We've individualized instruction for years now, but still expect kids to sit in hard chairs at desks for 7 hours a day. With flexible seating, I will be able to allow my students to have the space and movement that they need to stay focused and engaged. The variety of seating we have chosen will provide students with different textures and heights for the students to work at. The cushions will allow them to sit comfortably on the floor. The lap trays will give them something to work on of they choose to sit on the floor. Some options, like the exercise ball chairs, also allow movement without it being disruptive to the learning environment. With your help my student's can have the ultimate learning environment!
needStatement: My students need a variety of seating choices to keep them focused and engaged.

name: Today a Reader, Tomorrow a Leader
description: We are a project-based learning STEAM school. I am fortunate to work with a group of students who are full of life and eager to learn. Their enthusiasm, curiosity, and creativity are just a few of their greatest strengths. My goal is to provide my students with an organized and positive classroom atmosphere with appropriate materials available and ready for them to utilize each day. When I look at my students, not only do I see a love for learning, I also see our future. Flocabulary is a web-based learning program that uses educational hip-hop music to engage students and increase achievement. The two subscriptions requested will be for the entire 3rd grade, which is about 93 students. These materials are crucial for the growth of my students as young readers. The student mailboxes will help to easily organize center work. The chart paper and easel will be used for mini lessons and writer's workshop. The CD players and headphones will be used during reading centers to listen to books while looking at the text. The titles and series of books listed were requested by my students and are based on interest and reading level.
needStatement: My students need 'Daily 5' reading center materials and organization to help them with building stamina, fluency, comprehension, and vocabulary. WE need a mobile organizer, Flat Stanley's books and more.

name: Finding 'Balance': The Creative Writing Process
description: Where do I begin to describe the heroes I teach and learn from every day? Almost 20 years ago, I became one of the luckiest people on Earth when I began my teaching career as an English Language (EL) teacher at a school in St. Paul, Minnesota. This school is not only unique in my district, but it is unique in the nation as it serves an all-immigrant and refugee population of learners ages 14-20. They come from over 30 different countries, and they represent different religions, races, cultures, and experiences. They are truly heroes in my eyes, as they have lived lives most of us could never imagine. They have come to America for one reason or another, but most often it is for reasons of war, displacement, gang warfare, poverty, lack of opportunities in education, no freedom, and they seek asylum, refuge, a sanctuary. They ask for little but give so much. What these students bring with them are their gifts that I always strive to recognize, validate, and celebrate. We create a community in our classroom and each member plays a valuable role, each distinct yet united. They complete me. As a creative/academic writing teacher in a high school of all English learners (ELs), I want a classroom that allows for as much inspiration, creativity, and focus as possible. Table and seating arrangements that allow for flexibility and flow support collaboration in many forms. Students will be able to work in multiple group patterns, individually, and as a whole group with the plan I have proposed. Introducing the balance bar chairs gives some learners the options for kinesthetics while learning to stay focused on writing, while spending energy. My writing classroom should not only foster academics, it should provide a sanctuary where learners can craft their narratives, feel empowered, and be comfortable.
needStatement: My students need seating and tables that inspire writing, collaborating, and comfort. This project will transform our room into a creative writing space.

name: Curriculum Materials for Special Needs 3-5 Year Olds
