description: My students are 3-5 year olds with developmental delays and autism. All of the children are non-verbal for the most part, have challenges with learning and some of them have behavior issues. These are some of the most engaging children you will ever meet! Our school is located on the east side of St Paul, MN where 100% of our students receive free breakfast and lunch. Ninety-five percent of our students are children of color. Most of our students have difficulty getting their basic needs met, much less have money for the extras like adapted materials and toys. Our curriculum is designed for typically developing preschoolers. Part of my job is to adapt and modify this curriculum for the students with special needs. It can be challenging to do this with the materials and toys I have on hand. The My Hometown carpet will provide us a comfy place for circle and reading time as well as help us develop social and imaginative play skills! Items such as MakeAMatch Core Concepts Puzzles Colors and the Goodie games Color Cookies will help us learn different colors, shapes and patterns, while the games and puzzles will reinforce skills in a fun way! The Shake & Move Ribbon Bells and Rhythms and Ribbons CD will be used when our Music Therapist comes to work with us. Our teacher is especially excited about the colored baskets as she plans to make each of us our own special basket of activities to work on our special education goals! These materials will supplement the curriculum and give these young learners the opportunity to learn important skills for their future success!
needStatement: My students need lots of repetition to learn basic skills (colors, numbers, pretend play, etc.), these materials will do that!

name: Create a High Interest Classroom Library
description: My students are a diverse group of thinkers and learners who come together in the spirit of learning. We are a public, urban Montessori middle school, and as a school that opened three years ago, we are still emerging and growing as a community. We are located in a historically diverse and low income community. 77% of our students receive free and reduced price lunch. My students love reading! They come to middle school with an enthusiasm for their educations and form a strong community. Our Montessori classroom experience is focused on educating the whole child and creating lifelong learners. While my students come to middle school as readers, my classroom lacks enough high interest books to sustain a year of daily reading. We need updated books in our 6th grade classroom library. We love having books in our classroom, and it would be nice to have some fresh titles. I would like high-interest, engaging, young-adult novels to promote a culture of literacy among my 6th grade students. Specifically, students are always asking to read more books about sports, books in series, graphic novels, and popular YA titles. I want to make sure there is enough reading material readily available to cultivate and sustain life-long reading and learning for my students.
needStatement: My students need access to high interest novels to encourage a love of reading!

name: Sensory Overload (ATPE Member)
description: I teach a unique, wonderful group of students with special needs. My students require a specialized setting in order to meet their learning objectives and make academic progress. I teach students with Autism and behavioral needs. These students are some of the most creative and academically astute students in our building. I teach at a Math, Science, Technology magnet school in my district. My school is a Title I school and 80% free and reduced lunch. My students need additional supplies and instructional materials in order to become successful, productive, global citizens. My students have special needs and require specialized and varied teaching strategies to aid in their learning throughout the day. Students with special needs are very unique and what works for one student may not work for a different student. As a classroom teacher I am in need of more materials in order to meet these student's needs. These materials will give students the opportunity to calm themselves as well as allow them to be in control of their learning environment. Students on the Autism spectrum can often become overwhelmed by their learning environment. It is very important to give these students a place to relax and regroup so that they can be ready to learn again. These materials will provide this opportunity for these students. For example, allowing a student a 5 minute break to play with a sensory toy, build with legos, or lay down on a textured mat or tube can provide the needed sensory input. Once this input is received then the student my continue the learning process with little to no frustration. Sensory items are often well used and wear frequently. Your donation is vital to the continued learning process for the students in my classroom. I am not able to personally supply all the is needed.
needStatement: My students need sensory items such as bubble outie, play mat, caterpillar toy, tunnel and tent, slide, balls, beads and kiddle pool.

name: The Busy Bees in Mrs. B.'s Classroom
description: My students have their own Individual Education Plan (IEP) to assist them in the academic or behavior areas that they need. My students struggle in reading fluency, reading comprehension, written expression, math application and social skills. My students need an environment that can support their different learning styles! Every child has the ability to learn, he or she just needs the right tools to be successful!! The school is a Title I school which means that the students recieve free breakfast and lunch each school day. The students in the area have a hard time getting assistance at home from parents having to work 2nd or 3rd shifts to help support the household. The Backpatter's Seats will be for the reading and writing center so the students are not on the hard floor. The class organizer is to assist in keeping not only my students but myself organized! The materials will help my classroom flow more efficiently this school year!! The students need the materials to be successful in the resource room. The material that will be provided will give the students motivation to learn and try new skills in our learning environment. The more the student is motivated, the better he or she will accomplish in the special education program, classroom and in the real world!
needStatement: My students need the chairs for the reading and writing center. The classroom organizer is to assist in keeping all our data and material organized throughout the year.

name: Managing Materials
description: Low-income. Homeless. High poverty. These are words that people often use to describe our scholars. However, the words people should concentrate on are: high achievers, determined learners, and creative thinkers. We are scholars who have a hunger to learn, a passion for knowledge, and a need to succeed. We are looking to expand our critical-thinking skills, explore our creativity, and develop our talents for twenty-first century learning. We are looking to develop our gifts and talents and need your help to do so. My scholars are currently in a room with little storage space. This makes keeping materials organized in an effective manner difficult, causing frustration for scholars and adding additional time to our transitions. Help us organize our materials with new bins and shelves that will allow easy access to the learning tools we need. We will use these storage containers and shelves to help us manage our materials and time more wisely. By creating systems that scholars can navigate, they will be set up for success and will learn how to manage their own belongings. Help us to manage our materials.
needStatement: My students need a place and a space to organize their materials.

name: A Flood of New Books!
description: I teach first graders who are very curious and inquisitive. Teaching in a high poverty, 100% free lunch school, it's sometimes hard to get needed items to encourage student success. Many of my students do not have access to books at home, school being the only hands on opportunity for them to explore the joy of reading. I would like to set up a reading/listening center for my students so they will be able to investigate the world of reading. Students in first grade are at a critical point in learning to read. It is vitally important that they are exposed to many different forms of texts. My class lost most of their listening/reading center books and supplies due to the flood that hit in August. By having many choices in the selection of books, students are able to choose what interests them. We use Accelerated Reader in our school which is a program that encourages students to read often and take comprehension tests on books read. These books would give the students the encouragement needed to do well in the A.R. program.
needStatement: My students need books and supplies for the listening (reading) center because our books were destroyed in a flood.

name: An Easel and Seat Sacks for All to Learn!
description: Our students come with a variety of cultural and economic backgrounds and 88% of our students qualify for free and reduced lunch. We have 1% American Indian, 16% Asian-American, 72% African-American, 6% Hispanic American and 4% Caucasian American. Overall, 22% of our students are English Language Learners. The students are eager to learn and come to school every day gaining knowledge and skills necessary to become a great leader in the community. Our school challenges students to think critically on a global scale. As an International Baccalaureate school, students acquire the skills of thinking, social action, communication, research, and self-management. Our students will come to school each day knowing that there is a common area where we can learn together as a classroom community. An easel is a place where students learn to read, write and grow. It will be our place for our Morning Message, that students read each morning, a place for our big books to stand on so all students can see, and a place for students to practice writing sentences during whole group lessons. It is important for students to learn with an easel and have seat sacks to teach organization and responsibility. With no cubbies or space available in the class for students to store their supplies, Seat Sacks would make it easily accessible for students. With less transitions to grab materials, students will have more time to learn and work.
needStatement: My students need seat sacks for easy access to their materials and an easel to help enhance their learning.

name: A Little Snug On The Rug!
description: Our students come from a variety of different economic backgrounds and 100% of our students receive free lunch. My students speak a multitude of languages including English, Spanish, Hindi, and Arabic. As diverse as our students are economically and culturally, they are diverse in their academics. Despite so many hardships, my students are eager to learn and do their best. They want to be in school because they want to learn all they can so they can be successful one day. My students need a larger rug for comfortable seating during mini-lesson instruction and active learning time. Scholars will immediately know where they fit and be able to quickly and comfortably go to their own specific place to start begin out learning. No more fussing over who sits where! The clear colored squares with will help the students identify their our space and feel like they have their our place in the classroom to learn. When people have their own place to be, they can relax and begin to feel comfortable experiencing a new culture or way of relating to the world around them. My goal through this project is to encourage my students to settle into their learning environment and take ownership of their learning.
needStatement: My students need a larger rug for comfortable seating during mini-lesson instruction and daily activities. I teach 25 Kindergarteners and my current rug is only designed for only about 15 young scholars.

name: Chevron Fuel Your School White Oak Classroom Library
description: My students are zoned into schools that do not prepare them for lives that will take them to and through college. They rarely see people who look or sound like them in prestigious positions. We spend countless hours convincing them that they are capable of greatness. My students are leaders. My students are fearless. My students are powerful. My students are loud. My students are fighters. My students are determined. My students are thrilling. My students are creative. My students are loving. My students are caring. My students redefine possible. This library will provide 8th grade English students with a library that will promote a love of reading. Without access to quality grade-level novels, the students will not be able to foster this love of reading. Without a love of reading, the fight towards literacy, becomes incredibly difficult. Because of this, I found books that are at grade level both in lexile and in content. These books will catch and hold their attention and push them toward an authentic love of reading. When they have an authentic love of reading and writing, they will be able to think critically about the world around them. More importantly, they will be able to share their great ideas with the world around them.
needStatement: My students need a quality selection of novels to build a love of reading.

name: Pre-K for Success!
description: Pre-Kindergartners! The anticipation and excitement for the first time in school for most of these students are incredible. They come nervous and shy to the open house but I know that by the end of the year, my students will become confident as they continue their education career. We can't limit their potential! My purpose for these students is to have their first experience of school be a foundation for a love of learning, inquiring, and risk-taking. In order to do so, I would love to provide them with materials that they can use as a community so they can practice math skills, literacy skills, and explore in purposeful play! At the age of four, it is important to encourage the curiosity and the exploration of the world. By supplying different types of manipulatives, students will be able to discover and make sense of their world. These Pre-K'ers will learn more than just cause and effect, fine motor skills, or how things come together or break apart; they will learn social-emotional skills such as learning together, taking turns, and working as a team as well. For many students, the writing center will be a first encounter with experimenting with purposeful writing so your donation contributes to a more organized writing center to motivate and provide opportunities for more literate scholars to lead this world! This project will not only reach the 20 students I currently have, but countless future students as well!
needStatement: My students need to practice fine motor skills and working together by using various manipulatives. They will also strenghten their literacy skills in an organized writing center!

name: Screen Printing Rocks!
description: My students live in Sumter, SC. My school is a Title I school; all of our students receive free breakfast and lunch. Because my school is in a rural district there is not tons of funding for the arts. My budget only grants me $1.00 per student for the entire school year, not a lot for 600 students a week. I really want my students to have exciting opportunities to create art. They love coming to art each week and love to learn to make new things, but with my limited budge it is very hard to give them the range materials I would like them to experience.I want my students to experience making screen printing, using multiple colors and incorporating stencils into the process. I want my kids to create fun, successful projects that they will be proud to display. Art can be daunting, but I want my students to also find joy in the process. Art is a way for children to express feelings they may not have words for. I want each child in my class to be able to experience the creative job that art can bring into their lives. These materials will help my students do just that. Join me in helping them make lasting memories in art class.
needStatement: My students need the ink, stencils, screen printing unit, and brushes required for a successful screen printing experience.

name: A Soft Place To Sit In the Library
description: My students are really special to me because they come to the library each week with a big smile on their face, ready to get busy learning and reading. Many of our students don't have access to books at home, which makes my job in getting enjoyable books into the hands of children even more important. Also, the community recently suffered from a historical flood that devastated the school and many of our families' homes. Your support is so appreciated! Our school recently suffered a devastating flood. Unfortunately, our large library rug was lost in the great flood. I recently was able to get a nice medium sized colorful rug for the library. I need one more larger sized rug of the same design to complete the atmosphere! With my two rugs I will be able to define the storytime area for the little ones and the bean bag chair area for the older ones. Our students love to read! We need bulletin board cut-outs and bulletin board border so that I can recognize those students who meet their AR reading goal.
needStatement: My students need a soft, colorful rug to sit on in the library and bulletin board shapes for those who meet their AR reading goal.

name: Terrific Textures!
description: My students live in a poverty-stricken, urban neighborhood. Many come from broken and unstable homes. They attend a Title I school and are eligible for free lunch. Our school's population is made up of African-American, Hispanic, and Kurdish students. Many of them are learning English as a second language. It is important for them to be able to express themselves through their art. My students love art! They thrive in an artistic environment. They need opportunities to show how creative they can be. These textured plates that I am requesting will be used in all grades to learn about textures and patterns. My youngest students will make crayon rubbings of many different types of textures. They can experiment with overlapping textures to see what new patterns they can make. Classes with older students will use these plates in several different kinds of multi media projects. They can use them to make interesting colored papers with patterns to use in collages or homemade books. The can use them for texture in drawings and paintings. They can also press them into clay to make beautifully patterned tiles.
needStatement: My students need plastic textured plates to make rubbings and to learn about texture.

name: Science Research With Irresistible Books
description: My students come from all over the globe to learn in a small and aging school. Our neighborhood is in a huge city with a high number of refugees and energy employees. The diverse ethnicity in the class models the reality of our society, and I love seeing it work in real time! Many of our students arrive in the United States with absolutely no supplies. They learn how to eat in a cafeteria, and how to hold a pencil. This is their first introduction to books and the alphabet. Meanwhile, they are learning 2nd grade science concepts. We have two aquariums and a working garden and butterfly habitats. Quality resources such as National Geographic books for children will draw low performing students into reading. Full color photos of the topic will aid English Language Learners in their quest to read and learn about animals and how things work. Imagine wanting to do your best in a language you don't understand. Frustration can be overcome with these specific resources and a community who believes in student achievement. These well written books with photographs and captions will support all levels of reading and inspire confidence in all students. Learners will be inspired to write their own booklets and reports on topics from these books. Production as young writers will move them forward in reaching their goals.
needStatement: My students need science books to inspire independent reading and researching of topics of great interest to them.

name: Hooked on Books!
description: My students show so much resilience to the poverty they face outside of the school walls. They share their stories and their strengths through the respect and responsibility they show me daily. Being part of the community they live in is both rewarding and challenging. Rewarding because they get to see and experience diversity on many different levels (socioeconomic, ethnicity, etc.). Challenging because they are not given the choice to suffer through harsh realities of living in poverty and not having basic essentials for survival. My school works hard to provide equality for the students we serve with the understanding that equality is not providing the same thing for each student, but providing students with what they need individually. Each child is different and the differences make up the whole of the work we do as educators in providing the best quality education for every student we serve. Teaching students to live their lives being well-balanced, knowledgeable, principled, reflective, open-minded, caring, and an inquirer will make the possibilities of a brighter future a reality. My students are able to read and in order to enhance their reading experience I would like to be able to provide them with materials to build a reading life! Reading is essential to growth academically, and in order to keep up the excitement about reading my students need engaging, up-to-date books along with the classics! Reading allows our minds to go further in worlds created by great authors. My students want nothing more than to go beyond where they are at now. I want them to be able to soar into reading as if their lives depended on it because it does!
needStatement: My students need the resources to enjoy reading in its simplest form . . . paper books!

name: Warriors need Weapons!
description: I am a Pre-Algebra and Algebra 1 teacher and will be teaching all eighth graders that have various learning abilities. My students are from a small community that is very family oriented. A lot of students that were born in the area will continue to live in the area beyond graduation. My students come from various socioeconomic statuses. Some can afford to get calculators, however, some can not. I do not want any to be at a disadvantage because of their home life. Every student deserves the tools to perform at a high level. Starting off the school year, I have not allowed my students to use calculators for two reasons. 1.) I want them to truly understand how to perform simple math functions and 2.) to understand how use various techniques to solve problems. We are getting to a point in our curriculum that is getting much harder and the use of calculators for larger multiplication/division and other operations, a calculator would be very beneficial to my students. They have shown that they can do simple operations, now I need to give them the tools to excel! I do not want my students to hate or perform low at math because they do not have the appropriate tools. It is my job as a teacher to ensure that they all succeed!
needStatement: My students need calculators to perform various mathematical problems so that they can excel in mathematics.

name: Apple Technology for the Future Leaders!!
description: The students in my classroom are all Autistic and have high sensory needs. Some of my students have have limited verbal/communication and some are non-verbal in which they communicate with a core board or PECS. They have sensory breaks in between to explore sand and water. The students in my classroom are in the 3-5th grade. They are always eager to explore new things. They are very technologically savvy. The population of students in this area receives 100% free lunch. My students can benefit from the use of the iPads to help with the language barriers. It can serve as a communication device in which they can transition around the school building. The rocking chair will be great for those students who like to rock back and forth, they are 'flying rockers' !! They can enjoy the rocking chair instead of trying to move in the regular school desk. The math manipulative and games are excellent to help incorporate the counting with the cookie jar. I have several students that need food as a reinforcement so this game would be great!!
needStatement: My students need the iPads, rocking chairs, and learning centers to help with communication needs and increase their technology skills.

name: Support my Students in Advancing their 21 Century Technology Skills!
description: Have you ever been really excited to learn a new technology skill, like video editing, graphic production, or audio composition, and then became disengaged because the resources were too limited, and often difficult to access? My students are a wonderful, and curious group of 9 year-old children, eager to learn about creative technology. They deserve to have access to, and advance their creative technology skills. They all come from a variety of cultural and socio-economic backgrounds, and all live in urban communities. Some of my students have had experience creating multimedia projects, but most have not. All have challenges in accessing appropriate technology resources at their level, and they all need guidance and practice in learning how to utilize multimedia programs. My school has limited resources, and the resources we have are dedicated to providing chrome books to our students to advance their keyboarding and basic knowledge of computer usage.I am seeking to obtain an Apple laptop computer that will create a classroom where all my students have equal access to learn about, and create a variety of multimedia projects. They will also have the opportunity to practice and present orally the projects they create to the class. They would have the ability to create audio book talks, short films, and advance their graphic skills. The laptop will also be used to project both live and static information for students onto a larger screen that will enable them to universally access resources, and participate in a variety of multimedia sessions. I am excited about the prospect of bringing the larger world into my classroom so students can have a richer learning experience.
needStatement: My students need an Apple laptop to advance their technology skills.

name: Our Playhouse Needs a Remodel
description: The students in my TK class are all from very diverse backgrounds and abilities. Each day is a new and exciting challenge for these 4 and 5 year olds. They are building a foundation of knowledge and skills that they will need as they go through the different levels of school and in life. My Transitional Kindergarten classroom is a place of learning and new discoveries! The students are eager to play, socialize, learn and be a part of the school community. The children will be using the playhouse/dramatic play items on a daily basis. They will use the dolls to pretend they have a family or are caring for younger children. They will dress up in the play clothes and transform in to a fire fighter, doctor, mail carrier or teacher. They will use problem solving skills while in the playhouse area to decide who is going to be the cook and who is going to be the patron at the restaurant they have created. While they are 'playing' they will use so many valuable skills such as communication, expressing ideas, mathematical thinking, reading and writing. Young children need time each day to use their imagination and creativity. With so much stress on academics at a young age, we sometimes forget that these kiddos need time to be carefree and socialize with their peers.
needStatement: My students need dramatic play items to help them learn and develop through play while developing their imagination, physical, cognitive and emotional strength.

name: Alphabet Animal Action
description: My students deserve the very best. Everyday my kindergarten and first grade students come to school wanting to feel safe, accepted, and loved. In spite of the many hardships that they face as newcomers to the United States, they demonstrate resilience. These children deserve the best education because they are leaders who live with hope, hope for a better life. A child may have witnessed a father's suicide or a mother's death in a war torn country, but the child comes into the classroom with a smile wanting to learn. A child may have experienced neglect having never been spoken to for the first 4 years of his life, but the child comes to the classroom willing to take risks and try learning new words in English. A child may have experienced hunger, but the child advocates for his baby brother and asks to take milk home to him so the baby stops crying from hunger. A child's may be awake all night from bed bugs and lice, but the child can ignore the persistent itch, stay awake, and focus on what the teacher is saying. These students deserve the very best. Each letter of the alphabet is introduced by an animal. For example Catina Cat introduces the letter name 'C' and the sound /c/. The students latch onto character names and faces when they can see and touch the characters such as Yancy Yak. Each day my students sing a song with actions to reinforce the character, the letter name and the letter sound. The song is to the melody, 'Who Let the Dogs Out?' One line of the song is, 'Who let the G out? /G/ /G/ /G/ And students pound their chests like gorillas while making the sound. Stuffed animal toys make the learning fun and real for kids.
needStatement: My students need realia to support their preprimer instruction. As part of my school's phonics program (Zoophonics), my students need realia to touch and see when learning letter names and sounds.

name: Tuba, or not Tuba?
description: My students are hardworking, persistent and passionate individuals who deserve the best. They are from extreme poverty, homelessness, and broken families. However, what the students do have, they protect and work hard for. My students are the greatest middle school kids ever! In band, we teach them life skills that will help them rise above poverty and become stronger citizens. Music is a passion and wonderful form of expression for these kids! Help us reach our music goals and strive for the highest!Students will love having a tuba stand! Most beginner tuba players are slightly too small to hold the instrument on their own. The adjustable tuba stand can allow them to lower or raise the instrument to the perfect height. The stands are very high quality and will serve the students well. Instead of holding the very heavy tuba on their legs, the students will be able to rest the metal instrument on the stand. Tubas are one of the best instruments in the band! They are the foundation of the ensemble and one of the biggest sounds. Help our tubas excel!
needStatement: My students need tuba stands to help them hold their large tubas when they play!

name: Bringing Technology to Writing
description: TC Junior High School serves a high poverty, rural population. Students come from diverse backgrounds and are eager to use the newest technology. They have easily adapted to the existing Chromebooks in the classroom and are excited about the possibilities they bring them in their writing. Being in a rural area, many students lack or have spotty internet access. They also don't have access to personal computers at home. The computers at school are their opportunity to learn how to use changing technology. We use Chromebooks daily for writing in my English classroom for 6-7th grade students. Students utilize Google Classroom and Google apps to enhance their writing experience. They are able to manipulate their papers easily, receive instant feedback from the teacher or a peer, and have a place to keep all of their project materials. It also allows me to post information and extra help that is easily accessible. This technology gives them the ability to easily research and improve on their writing. The extra Chromebooks will ensure that every student has access to their writing daily and is able to utilize the technology completely.
needStatement: My students need 4 Acer Chromebooks to round out the group of 26 already in the classroom. The largest class I have is full of 27 students and we often have 1-2 laptops down with issues.

name: We Want to Read!
description: I teach third graders in a low-income/high poverty elementary school. My students face challenges at home that most adults don't even have to overcome and when they come to school they need compassion, attention, and a place that feels like a second home. My students often arrive at school stressed, frazzled, or half asleep. My goal is for them to leave smiling. My students are street smart, creative, some strive, but many struggle academically. They like to socialize with their peers and they crave positive attention from their teachers. Many of my students are living in multi-family homes, where they don't get much sleep or attention and they get free lunch based on their socioeconomic status. Their lifestyles have the potential to set them back in life and my job is to prevent that from happening. My students need all the help they can get growing as readers. Our classroom libraries are very dated and I know if we put some new fun books in there, they will be more motivated to read and grow as readers. They would be so excited to receive a brand new pack of books just for them. They'll be fighting over them; fighting over books! Yay!I want them to love reading and this would be a step in the right direction. We also need new pencil sharpeners. Every minute of our class time is so precious and our sharpeners keep breaking. I'd really love to spend every moment of our day on learning and growing.
needStatement: My students need more books to choose from in our classroom library and new pencil sharpeners! Ours keep breaking!

name: Successful Seating: A Place for Everyone
description: Our school challenges students to think critically on a global scale. As an International Baccalaureate (IB) school, we challenge students to understand the world around them and how to take action within it. The IB program strives to help students develop an international perspective through class projects that examine real-life situations around the world. These are the words from our website that describe our school. We are a Title 1 school in an urban environment. To help students succeed they need to have the resources available to them on a daily basis to support their learning. The students at our school are excited to achieve, learn, experience, and to make a difference in the world. This carpet will allow for students to have a predictable spot for our learning time and for our very important beginning of the day, Morning Meeting. Having students gather together on a carpet where they know in advance they have a place that is their own is important to increasing self esteem. When students can quickly and easily transition to the learning space they often feel more in control and are able to be more successful. Having their own 'spot' will support calm transitions and increase social skills. In first grade students are all about learning those social skills that support successful learning. A predictable and safe learning environment supports student learning.
needStatement: My students need 1 carpet for the classroom to allow for predictable seating arrangements during lesson time and our morning meeting time.

name: Choice Independent Reading Books for High School Students
description: My school is an inner-city performing arts school, in small building that does not have a school library. Resources are limited. My classroom library is open to all of the students in the school, not just my fantastic 9th grade students. My students are amazing! Many of them will be the first in their families to go to college. College is the goal for all of them and they are very driven not only academically but in the arts as well.I am asking for help to build my classroom library. Choice reading is important and serves as a way to increase the student's interest in reading, and in turn their reading level. I am hoping to give them more of a variety of books to choose from. Students will be creating interactive notebook activities using their independent reading books as well as projects of presenting their books to the rest of the class. This year my students asked me for more graphic novels and mystery books. Yes! They actually asked for books and get very excited to see new ones come into the classroom. Please help me feed that book hunger!
needStatement: My students need a variety of choice books for independent reading.

name: Use of Chromebooks Leads to Comprehension
description: Living in rural communities, many of our students don't have access to the internet at home. School is their only opportunity to interact with current technology. We are trying to teach our students how to use 21st century technology. This is difficult, though, when we don't have enough computers. With over 40% of our school demographic fitting the profile of 'low income' and 15% of our student population needing Special Education services, our school budget is diminished very quickly, leaving little money for technology. The internet based reading program our Special Education students use encourages them to read more, read faster, and comprehend better while still providing instruction at their learning level. The program itself works great, but we are in short supply of computers to implement the program without having to beg and borrow computers daily from other areas in the school. By having the computers in our room, we are guaranteed access to this beneficial program every day. Even in our current situation, we are seeing gains we might not have seen otherwise. Imagine the progress that could be attained if we had computers of our own!
needStatement: My students need five Chromebooks to help them gain comprehension skills.

name: We Like To Move It, Move It!
description: I'm a second grade teacher in a rural town in Central Minnesota. I also teach second-sixth grade Gifted and Talented students. All of my students are absolute sponges when it comes to learning and trying new things! My students continually inspire me to engage them in learning through discovery and active learning experiences. We welcome any opportunity to learn through doing! Any opportunity I can give my students to learn and grow, I will do what I can to provide it for them!We know from research that it is unhealthy for students to be sitting still all day at school. Last year, I noticed a lot of students who were very antsy at their desks and were getting out of their chairs a lot. When I pulled them aside and asked what was wrong, they kept telling me they just felt like they needed to be moving around to help them concentrate. One of them told me she often bounced on her mom's yoga ball at home to do her homework. When I asked what I could do to help, my student requested I allow her to move around while she's working. I noticed another student in my room who made noises often and couldn't keep themselves working quietly. This student said that he often listens to music at home. He asked if I wouldn't mind playing music while they work. After these conversations, I incorporated movement breaks and flexible seating into my classroom. Wow, did I sure see a difference! Through the use of my Pandora playlist, GoNoodle, and seating, I got students up and moving around the room more often. I have some students who have a difficult time focusing on tasks and these seating options gave them a chance to find what worked best for them! It made me realize how we often force students to learn in a way that works for the environment, instead of accommodating the environment to their learning. However, we are limited by the time it takes for me to pull up my playlist and by the amount of seating we have available to the students. The stools, ball chairs, and bands would make it possible for my students to choose their best learning environment and make music for our movement more readily available!
needStatement: My students need an Amazon Echo, stools, balance balls, balance discs, fitness dice and resistance band set.

name: Wiggle Seats for Wiggly Kindergarteners
description: Students learn best through movement. Movement helps children concentrate and retain new information. We use movement all the time in our lessons. I have a class of 21 wonderful kindergarteners who are extremely creative and energetic. My students need many opportunities to move throughout the day to help them focus and learn. In my classroom, we spend a lot of time dancing, playing educational games, learning with hands-on manipulatives, and participating in movement activities to help improve concentration. My students love to be active, and many have a very hard time sitting still for longer than 3-5 minutes. My students would benefit from having wiggle seats in our classroom. These seats are filled with air to give children a chance to wiggle without getting out of their seats or making excess noise. I am currently using partially inflated beach balls as temporary wiggle seats. My students are responding very well to the “beach ball wiggle seats,' but I am confident that if my students had access to real wiggle seats, they would be able to focus and concentrate even more during our reading and writing lessons. I would absolutely love to have 6 wiggle seats for my students to share during our small group literacy block. I strive to do everything I can to give my students what they need to succeed, and these seats will help my students stay on-task. The seats will not only help students this year, but many others in the years to come!
needStatement: My students need wiggle seats to focus and maximize their attention during various academic tasks.

name: Integrating Technology & Music!
description: I teach at a Title One school in Minnesota where over 70% of students qualify for free and reduced lunch. The students at my school are compassionate and grateful for their education. They are eager to learn new musical experiences and explore their creativity. My students are talented, passionate young musicians! They have a strong desire to learn music, and their focus is matched only by their enthusiasm. It is an honor to watch my students grow into talented, dedicated musicians!The students in my piano class are fortunate enough to have individual key stations to work at, and their own personalized iPads. The USB to Lightning Camera Adapters will be used everyday by multiple students to connect their keyboard to their iPad. The cable protectors will ensure that students in the years to come will have the same amazing opportunity. My students are inherently savvy when it comes to technology and incredibly motivated to learn how to make music. The ability to connect our iPads to our keyboards is so essential to creating an engaging and culturally relevant learning environment. With these tools students will be able to share musical ideas with me and with other students in the class. I will be able to more effectively assess and give feedback on student progress. Students will be able to creatively demonstrate their musical understanding by creating recordings, looping tracks, and sharing their work with others.
needStatement: My students need USB to lightning adapters and cable protectors.

name: A-tisket, A-tasket, a Technology Filled Basket
description: Music is a piece of art that goes in the ears and straight to the heart! I want my students to be able to create and listen to music that touches their hearts. Teaching music to third, forth, and fifth graders is always a fun adventure! We are a title one, low income school. There is no money budgeted from the school district for the music department. To gain supplies, resources and materials for my classroom, I depend on fundraisers, grants, and donors. My students love coming to music class. They enjoy the time we spending using technology, dancing, singing, playing instruments, and learning through games and hands-on activities. In my music classroom, I have access to a projector, Apple TV and computer. However, I do not have a document camera to use in displaying worksheets, musical scores, or notes. I did some research and found a neat way to use an iPad as a document camera. The iPad works as the camera, and the stand will hold the iPad at the correct spot, so the work can be displayed on the board. This project is more than just a document camera! Using the iPad instead of a traditional document camera will allow me to also have mobility in my room. The iPad will be used on its own to display videos, games, and other music activities on the board. The students will also have access to the iPad for small group project-based learning. With all the different apps out there, the limitations for my classroom will be endless!
needStatement: My students need an iPad and a tablet stage stand to use in music class.

name: Books Battered Beyond Belief: The Saga of Mr. Bennett
description: Your condition does not need to be your conclusion. My students live in what is known as the International District of Houston, Texas. Refugees from many places around the world make Houston their new home. There are 80 different languages spoken within the borders of our school district. My specific school is 89% free and reduced breakfast and lunch. Almost 50% of the students at my school are labeled Limited English Proficiency. My students face many challenges. Yet I try to instill pride in them. I have them focus on what they can do, and where they can go. We keep a positive outlook on life and read several text pieces about heroes overcoming adversity. My number one complaint of being a new reading teacher, is we don't have the books we are supposed to read! I have used my own funds to purchase 60 novels that our English Department has been teaching for the last 5 years. I have begged and borrowed books from other schools. Only to find that they are covered in orange Cheeto dust and missing the first 30 pages. Your donation will help Middle School students receive the education that they need. In order to instill a love for reading, we need to show that books are valuable and should be treasured. I am asking for funds to replace over-used books. I am hoping that this will motivate my students to enjoy reading.
needStatement: My students need class sets of novels that are new or gently used.

name: Improving On-Field Performance and Off-Field Character
description: This project is for my students on the baseball team. I am a first year head coach at the school and a math teacher. When I met my student-athletes, I could not believe the overwhelming hardships that some must overcome each day. Some of my players have absolutely no food in the house, while others have no homes all together. Baseball has become their only outlet from the poverty they face. My goal to use the game of baseball to motivate these young men do well in school, to give these young men a sense pride and self-confidence, and improve their on-field performance as well as their off-field character. I believe, in a position as a coach, I have a huge opportunity to influence these students' academic choices, values, and goals. It would be a shame if I wasted the opportunity. The baseballs, tees, training balls, and hitting sticks will allow us prepare the players for games. Student-athletes who face extreme hardships will have an opportunity to play baseball. These purchases will make an extreme difference in the ability for the program to operate, in the lives of the players, and for our community as a whole. The equipment will help us accomplish of mission of improving on-field performance and off-field character, as well as bring forth our vision of using baseball to improve the lives of the student-athletes we serve. OUR PLAYERS and THEIR FAMILIES will be in extreme gratitude for any contribution you make to our cause.
needStatement: My students need basic materials to play and practice baseball. We need 5 gloves to have in our shed in case a player tries out, but does not have and cannot afford a glove.

name: Clean, Comfy Carpet
description: I teach third grade in an urban creative arts magnet school. Our school offers music, visual arts, dance and theater classes. We also integrate arts into our reading, social studies and math classes. The students in our class come from all around the world, and English may be the third or fourth language they will need to learn. In our active learning community, the students work hard to become proficient with both the third grade curriculum and the English language. We work hard to make sure all of our students feel safe and have a sense of belonging. We need a clean and comfortable carpet for our students to sit on during lessons, independent reading time, and small group work. By donating to our classroom, you will help our students have a clean and comfortable place to sit during our lessons. As an added bonus, the carpet has the United States with all fifty states on it, so the children will get a better sense of where each state is located. Having a clean and comfortable place to sit helps the students encourage more creativity with their writing. We need to utilize all the space in the classroom, so the children can find their own space to be focused. As an active learning environment, it is important that they can move around in the room and find a place to sit and focus on their work.
needStatement: My students need a clean, comfortable United States carpet to sit on during instruction time.

name: Supplies for Stellar Students with ASD
description: I teach in a high-need, special service school district in New York City. Our 3rd grade class has six amazing students with autism. These children have many challenges ranging from their disability and the economic challenges in their community. Let's give them everything they need to find success in this world. These children learn best when they are provided with multiple sensory enrichment. They love to dance, sing, and play while learning. Teaching a class with autism is challenging and fun. What helps my students learn best are hands-on materials and engaging activities. My focus in the classroom is taking student strengths and expanding on them to help them achieve goals. My students thrive from individual attention and positive praise. My students have many sensory needs everyday. Without an outlet for sensory stimulation they become restless and distracted. Learning is difficult and stress related behaviors begin to occur. This supply list will address the many sensory needs of my students with autism in different ways across the entire school day. Fidget toys will help students remain calm and focused during class time and transitions. Counting, sorting, spelling manipulatives will create a sense of play and engagement to make learning achievable, meaningful and fun for all my students. Dry erase boards will help to make writing more sensory based. They will also make mistakes easy to correct, creating a sense of encouragement and achievement. The classroom rug will assist in creating a reading space for other positions than just sitting in chair. In addition, it will serve as a great place to practice social sharing skills. Trays will help my students keep track of supplies, return supplies independently. Overall, these supplies would help my class become more engaged in the learning process and increase student achievements throughout the school year. Learning should be painless and fun!
needStatement: My students need fidget toys to keep them calm during school, counting tools to increase number awareness, letter tiles to promote spelling and reading skills and dry erase boards to create engagement for writing.

name: Help Wanted For Little Learners
description: We are the first Pre - K through 8th Grade public conversion charter school in the state!Our three targeted goals for the school year were to increase student achievement by showing a significant gain on the Palmetto Assessment of State Standards (PASS) and ACT Aspire, to meet Annual Yearly Progress (AYP), and to increase overall school morale. My classroom is inviting, colorful, and decorated with my little one’s work. My centers are literacy, math/manipulatives, block, art, technology, sensory, pretend play, and science. These centers invite students to explore and learn new concepts. They all are print-rich with books, posters and other print material. My pre-k students love their classroom!Early learners are really kinesthetic and tactile learners. This means they learn best by hands on experiences. The more they can actually be involved in a process and be able to use their senses eyes and hands. The better understanding they will have. This would change my students’ lives because it will allow us to have classroom outdoors using the cart. I can place manipulatives on cart and do math and literacy outside. My students will thoroughly enjoy this! The listening center would be an awesome gift inside my classroom because I can use this during literacy lessons. Both of these items are really needed. Please help today!
needStatement: My students need a listening center and also outdoor cart for toys and manipulatives to use outdoors.

name: Growing the Vocabulary of Language Learners
description: The children in my classroom learn English words quickly when given the opportunity to use their imaginations and work with toys that build their vocabulary. Most of my students live in poverty. My five and six-year-olds are eager to learn. Many are having their first school experience. Some children come from refugee camps in Thailand. Other English learners come from Ethiopia and Mexico. The students who grew up knowing English as their first language are wonderful at beginning the fun. My Kindergarten students will use English while playing with dolls that look like their family members in a doll house. They will use their imaginations to create stories about what is happening in the house. The children will design what the inside of the house will look like by placing the furniture in the rooms. A few years ago we were granted a doll house with furniture and dolls. It was played with so much that the furniture has become broken and the dolls are lost or breaking. I would like to replace the broken toys knowing that the new items will be used and loved by my five year old students every day.
needStatement: My students need a set of doll house furniture and sets of small dolls that look like their families.

name: First Grade Science Readers!
description: Our students come to first grade eager to read. They love to sit down with a friend to read, and they love to talk! Reading and talking about science with a friend helps them grow as readers and helps build their interest and knowledge of the world around them. Our school is an urban elementary school in St. Paul. We are a neighborhood school. We have two first grade Language Academy classrooms serving mainstream students as well as many bilingual students who are learning English. Some of our students have recently arrived in the United States and did not have an opportunity to attend school before. They come to school excited to learn. Every day I see first graders working together, playing together, and engaged in learning about math, reading, writing, and science. They are a community of learners that cares about each other. First graders love Partner Reading. With a buzz of excitement, pairs of students select a set of books from our reading cart, which is shared between two classrooms. Having chosen their books, they sit down together and share the books. There will be two copies of each book, so that each child has one in hand. They practice listening to each other read and matching their voice to read at the same pace. They work together to figure out difficult words by looking closely at the word and at the pictures, and thinking about the story. First graders are especially interested in science and in learning about the world around them. They are asking for sets of non-fiction science books for Partner Reading because they love to read about science and talk about the amazing facts they learn. After reading a science book together, the students will help each other retell the important facts they learned and ask each other questions about the book. Our first grade English Language Learners need many different opportunities to read and work together. Partner Reading will help them become better readers. The students will help each other understand challenging science concepts in the books they read. Reading together will help them develop social skills as they learn to work together and listen to each other in a conversation. Talking together will strengthen their oral language skills and vocabulary. Students will be excited to read because reading about science together is fun. They will want to read and learn more. Who knows, some of them may grow up to become scientists!
needStatement: My students need two sets of science books so that they can and read and talk with a partner. Reading about science will engage their curiosity about the world around them!

name: Adventures in Chemistry: Let's Get Organized
description: My chem students are awesome. Now that we are into the new school year we are getting to know each other, and the students are getting to know their way around our lab. My students are amazing for so many reasons. Our school is in a working class neighborhood in New Jersey, and my kids make do with very little. I am continually surprised at the reaction the students have when they receive the smallest of treats. Our school does not have some of the frills of more fortunate areas, but we find creative ways to provide an exciting environment for the children. We have awesome facilities in our Chem lab, but the one thing that we are short on is storage space. We have text books and supplies in every nook and cranny of our room. It would be nice if we could properly store our stuff in an more organized fashion utilizing a couple of book cases. This would enable us to move some supplies that are taking up space on our lab benches. I try to set a good example for the students by keeping our room nice and neat. These book cases would be the perfect solution (pun intended).
needStatement: My students need two book cases to help organize our materials.

name: Take Me Away to Camp St. Croix
description: Set in the picturesque Como Park neighborhood of Saint Paul, our school serves a highly diverse population. While a portion of our students are brand new to the country, others have been in Saint Paul, and even our school, for generations. Our diverse fifth grade classroom includes 25 students, speaking 9 languages in addition to English. Most receive free or reduced lunch. Because of such a diverse group, teachers work hard to meet the needs of individual learners. While some need 'gaps filled' because they may be in school for the first time (yes- in 5th grade), others need enrichment and challenge in order to stay engaged. The magic happens when students work together. They have as much to learn from each other as from me. The fifth grade is in need of funding for transportation to and from Camp St. Croix. This project would help cover a portion of the cost for bus transportation for 80 students and adults. Another teacher has submitted a proposal for another portion of the transportation cost. Last year, when our students were in 4th grade, they were able to attend a one day field trip at Camp St. Croix to help build community and teamwork within their classrooms. As an extension to last year’s field trip, the fifth grade will be going back to Camp St. Croix for an overnight stay. This is the first year our students will be attending an overnight field trip to Camp St. Croix and, for most, will be the first time away from their families overnight. Camp St. Croix would truly be a once in a lifetime experience as many of our students would not be able to provide the funds given their financial status. Throughout the trip, students will learn about the diverse wildlife and ecosystems at Camp St. Croix. They will participate in hands-on nature lessons and will be engaged in activities to strengthen teamwork in small and large groups. The field trip will also integrate part of the 5th grade science state standards as the students will also be learning about erosion and renewable and non-renewable energy found in Minnesota. The educational benefits of this experience are endless. Research shows that sound field trip experience have a highly positive impact on students' science learning. Camp St. Croix would be a lifelong memory for our students as well as open students' eyes both to possibilities in environmental science and their influence on the environment.
needStatement: My students need assistance with a portion of transportation costs for our first ever fifth grade overnight experience.

name: Music Stands for Success
description: Zoltan Kodaly once said, 'Real art is one of the most powerful forces in the rise of mankind, and he who renders it accessible to as many people as possible is a benefactor of humanity.' Our school is a Title I school with 55% of students receiving free/reduced lunches. Many of our students come from military families and relocate often. Most students do not have access to a variety of instruments at home, but they love making music in the classroom. They are eager to learn every day. They ask thoughtful questions and work together to synergize and make great music! Our classroom currently has a couple very old borrowed music stands. We are looking to gain our own class set of music stands so many students can perform instrumental music at the same time. When music is practiced and performed students discover how learning to play music can be the perfect vehicle for teaching team building, respect, focusing, listening, problem solving, and other important life skills. By donating to this project students will be able to become a community of musicians. Our classroom environment will improve because we will all have appropriate resources to make music together. This is teamwork at its finest.
needStatement: My students need a class set of music stands for performances.

name: Reading Practice Grows Readers
description: I teach 2nd grade in a high poverty school in St. Paul. My class is made up of many different cultural backgrounds: Hmong, Hispanic, African American, Native American and KaRen. Some students have been in the U.S. for only a year or two. I also co-teach and have students in my classroom with special needs. I have a wide range of readers in my class. Some students that are just starting to read to above grade level readers. The needs of my readers is very broad. I want to get books in my students hands, to be reading every day during their independent reading time during reader's workshop. I need more books at different levels to continue to hook kids on reading. The more you read, the better reader you become. I need to order leveled books that match my students' independent reading levels. My goal is to improve their reading achievement by increasing the amount of time they read at their independent reading level. Research tells us reading and rereading is recommended for increasing fluency, which also contributes to improved comprehension. There is a direct correlation between the amount of time spent reading and the level of reading achievement students reach. Thus, independent reading needs to occur everyday. You will make it possible for the students to be able to read a variety of books each day at their just right level. The time spent reading will be more productive because they will have appropriate texts to choose from in our classroom
needStatement: My students need a wide variety of just right books to have choices for them to read during independent reading time.

name: Kits for Kids!
description: My students are special because they have learned tolerance and appreciation for the diverse population that we have at our school. Each student comes from a different cultural background in which we all have practiced how to be receptive of others regardless of how they come to school, the color of their skin, ability level, and what they look like. We are located in the Buckhead, Atlanta area with a population of: 75% White, 5% Indian, 10% African American, and 10% Hispanic. 'It takes a village in order to close the educational gap.' Students receive a plethora of services to reach their full potential. I am a strong advocate for meeting students where they are and enhancing their learning through multiple, enriching avenues. The materials within this project have been strategically selected to promote the various learning styles of fifth grade students. Often times throughout teaching, educators use the same resources year after year to help students reach or master standards. Seeing the same information in a different format will assist in closing gaps for students along with the retention of knowledge. By using the items selected under this project, students will be able to take a different approach in learning the valuable information. Bright colored activities, educational games, and interactive forms are all ways in which I believe will promote enjoyable learning.
needStatement: My students need interactive learning kits to increase their engagement and to promote active learning.

name: You Can Ring My Bell!
description: My school is located in a tiny, rural community. We are the smallest and poorest elementary school in the district. The student body is 95% African American. All of my students are on free lunch and breakfast. Surrounding the community are large plantation homes. Because we are on the southeast coast, these students are direct descendants of the slaves from these plantations. Because of the low socio-economic standing of our community our kids go without things other schools consider standard. For years I've been using bells that were purchased in the 1950's. Just as technology has evolved since then, so have music classroom instruments. These tone chimes are beautiful and would greatly enhance my students' musical experience. Playing an instrument in elementary school is a necessary introduction to the world of bands and orchestras. Singing is only half of the musical opportunities available and not all of my students enjoy singing. How wonderful it would be for ALL students to be able to participate successfully in a music program early on so they desire to continue in middle and high school. These tone chimes would give them this rewarding experience.
needStatement: My students need to enhance their music education experience by playing these beautiful tone chimes.

name: Project Projector
description: This school is a school that serves students on the East Side of St. Paul, Minnesota. Our school has an aerospace focus, meaning that we enrich our curriculum with opportunities for students to experience and learn about aviation, flight, and engineering. All of our students are relying on the education that we provide them in order to expand their options after high school. We are a high needs school, with 100% free lunch program. A high percentage of our students are also English Learners, meaning that in addition to their core subject, every teacher is also teaching the majority of their students English as well. Students will be able to follow lesson plans more easily if they are projected on a large surface. Currently, students must follow paper copies of the daily lesson slides, which adds clutter to our already cramped classroom. With a projector, students will be able to experience multimedia (such as videos and slide show presentations) and display their own digital creations to the rest of the class. In the 21st century classroom, a working projector and a large projection board is necessary for a teacher to clearly communicate the material and expectations to their students. Having a reliable projector will allow us to focus on the content and the methods of learning it, instead of always focusing on workarounds for technology that is no longer functional.
needStatement: My students need a projector to be able to interact with lessons and display their digital content to the rest of the class.

name: There Was An Old Lady Who Needed Some Books
description: My students are loud, clumsy, shy and talk with their hands. My students are Deaf. My classroom is unlike any other in our school, but my students don't know that. Deafness is their normal and they assume everyone is Deaf too. That's one of the greatest joys of prek and kindergarten, everyone is a friend, even if they don't know your language. My students are so full of joy and eagerness that their smiles spread as we walk through the school. My students love 'There Was An Old Lady Who Swallowed A Fly'. They loved her so much that our book was crumbled, torn, taped and stapled until finally it disappeared. In my search for a replacement, I found 'There Was An Old Lady Who Swallowed A Bat'. This Halloween tale was an instant hit! My students have asked me to read this book everyday for the whole month of October. We have acted the story out, sequenced it, created our own characters that she should swallow next, and still my students are not tired of this story. I am deeply concerned that if I don't act fast, this book will suffer the same fate as the original book. I am asking for several versions of the story, including the original. I am also asking for storage containers to organize our books, props and all the activities that we will create to go with them.
needStatement: My students need classic books for all seasons and storage containers.

name: Help Bring Technology to 8th Grade ELA
description: My students are 8th graders in an ICT classroom made up of English Language Learners and Special Education students. They represent seven different countries and most of them speak more than one language. Many of them have learning disabilities and/or language development needs. All of them are at least one grade level below in reading and many lack learning resources at home to help them improve their reading, writing and computer literacy skills. Despite these challenges, they are extremely hard working and dedicated to improving their skills and getting prepared for the demands of high school. With the help of other donations, we currently have six Chromebooks in our classroom. They are great for small group work and we use them almost daily! When it comes to bigger projects, like individual research, typing up essays or using online reading programs, we all need our own computer! Right now, we have to vie for time in the computer lab with other classes in the school. In our world today that is increasingly dependent on technology, it is important that all my students are gaining computer literacy skills that they will need in high school, college and in their future jobs. Right now, students struggle with basic research and typing skills. Being able to use these computers will help facilitate the learning of basic computer literacy skills and improve their confidence in reading and writing as they use online programs to read and write their own texts. We are trying to get computers for our ELA class to help us with kinds of ELA assignments like Achieve 3000 reading program, research for projects, and making PowerPoint presentations to show to the class. Also, we type our stories and essays that we write in ELA, which is nice because we can print them out and they look neater than writing them in pen. We can also add pictures and show them to our classmates and families. We want to help our classmates get a better education, so it is important for us to help make this project happen. We will tell everyone in our school to share this project so that we can get these computers and start using them every day to make our class better and help us learn more. Using laptops makes learning more fun. You can do all kinds of things on computers that you can't do in the regular classroom. Personally, a lot of us just have cell phones and not laptops or computers at home and the only time we get to use computers is at school for projects and writing things.
needStatement: We need Chromebooks and a charging cart for storage to provide every student in our class with a Chromebook to use in class daily!

name: Being Able to Hear What My Students Have to Say
description: The children in my classroom learn English words quickly when given the opportunity to use their imaginations, work with toys that build their vocabulary and practice speaking to others. Most of my students live in poverty. My five and six-year-olds are eager to learn. Many are having their first school experience. Some children come from refugee camps in Thailand. Other English learners come from Ethiopia and Mexico. The students who grew up knowing English as their first language are wonderful at beginning the fun and they too could use some extra practice. My Kindergarten students can become very shy and quiet while trying to speak in front of the class. Speaking loudly and clearly enough so everyone can hear what they have to say is sometimes just too overwhelming while a student is searching for the words to use to express what they are thinking. Being able to increase the volume of what is being said with a microphone, takes away some of the stress placed on the student who is concentrating on finding the words they want to use. I will use the microphones and speaker every day, several times a day. Using the amplifying system will also help the students who are listening stay engaged and learn from their classmate.
needStatement: My students need a speaker and microphones to speak into so everyone can hear what they have to say.

name: Voyage to the Past: Roanoke Field Trip
description: Our students are young explorers who have a passion for History and Science! As a engineering focus school, our STEMgineers are always excited to learn about early engineers and inventors, as well as how things work. Our students exemplify diversity and culture. For many of our students, they are first or second generation Americans and are new to the English language. Many students receive free and reduced-price lunch and come from high poverty homes. Regardless of their backgrounds, we collaborate with the community, engage and empower every student engineer to reach their maximum potential. This project will enable our students to have charter bus transportation so they can to go to the Roanoke Island Festival Park. Here they will pump the bellows in the blacksmith shop or use a cross-cut saw to cut a log. They will become a tradesman, and explore all about 16th century life in the days of the Roanoke Voyages, including the Elizabeth II, a representative 16th-century sailing ship. Even though our students live less than 3 hours away from the Outer Banks, most have never visited the beach, must less toured a ship. Having this opportunity would culturally enrich our students. They will be able to discover Roanoke Island's place in history as the birthplace of English-speaking America. Help our young explorers set sail on an adventure of a lifetime. Donating to this project will help create an opportunity for our students that they may never get to otherwise. Every child should have wonderful opportunities to travel and explore new places.
needStatement: My students need two charter buses to travel to Roanoke Island Festival Park.

name: Stand Up for Wellness and Learning!
description: Our school mission is to build a respectful, successful learning community through art-centered and technology-enhanced practices that develop intelligent behaviors in all students. Our elementary school is a creative arts magnet school in an urban district that uses interdisciplinary teaching and daily arts instruction to positively affect all students in the school through hands-on, interactive learning experiences. In our overall school population, 81% of our students qualify for free/reduced lunch. Our 5th grade classroom has students from diverse backgrounds and experiences who are bused to our school from all over the city. The students are highly motivated to learn but they have a wide range of learning needs. In our classroom, we have 30 students of which 41 % are English language learners from El Salvador, Mexico, Ethiopia, Somalia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Additionally, 6% of the students have IEP’s (individualized educational plans) because of identified learning difficulties. My school has many diverse learners. Standing desks give all students an opportunity to have success. My fifth grade students are very active. They need to move. Stand up desks would be a great addition to our classroom. Many students learn best when they are allowed to move. Stand up desks would help students focus on the lesson and work towards their potential. I teach math to 77 students daily. Think of the impact on learning these desk can make. I am excited to help my active learners by giving them the opportunity to stand while learning. Your donation will help students for many years to come. Thank you in advance. Your support makes a world of difference to my students and me.
needStatement: My students need a stand-up desk and stool to help them channel their energy in a positive way, keep focused on their learning, and increase their daily activity level.

name: Classroom Helper
description: I have a typical seventh grade class. My students are from a variety of socioeconomic and racial backgrounds. Many of my students' parents are in the military. The skill level varies from extremely high to extremely low. I have an average of 25 students in each of my 5 classes. Most are highly motivated learners and are very interested in science. They love technology and embrace its integration in the classroom. Fostering a love of learning and training lifetime learners is the main goal in my class. They are our future leaders. We will be using Chromebooks in class. We have carts with 30 for the students to use. It would be beneficial for my class to have an instructional example. I would like the students have access to Chromebook to use in the class on a daily basis. This will allow for us to become proficient with thier use and enable me to effectively help my students with this technology. I know using this technology will allow for to maximize instruction and motivate students. I can prepare lessons and integrate them with my smart board. This will stimulate visual learning and activate interest in the topics being discussed. Because it is portable, I can take it with me and work on instruction at home.
