Students will be able to use it in centers for research projects. There are hundreds of websites that have amazing science resources. Students that need extra help or enrichment will benefit greatly from this added resource. I have been an educator for 16 years, and I have discovered that anytime you include technology in a lesson, the students will pay more attention. They are so used to using computers and phones in their daily lives, and they can instantly relate to these devices.
needStatement: My students need a Chromebook as an instructional aid for the classroom.

name: Science stools for classroom
description: My students love dancing, acting, drawing, sharing, and are courageous in sharing how they feel and standing up for what they believe in. They have lots of energy and are ready to use it in a meaningful way that will help both their peers and community. I teach at an inner city middle school where 60% of students have free or reduced lunch and 36% are English Language Learners. My students enjoy coming to school for both social and academic reasons. We have an amazing staff who support each and every student socially, emotionally, and academically. To able to do this, many of us spend our own money to support our students. My school district has had a furniture (especially stool) shortage for the past 2 years. Our stools are so old that 4 have already broke this school year. I do not have enough stools or chairs for students to sit on in my class, so they must stand. I start and end class in a circle, which I believe helps students feel a sense of community. Stools are moved from the front and back of the classroom 6 times per day, which can take a toll on old furniture. Having the correct furniture in a classroom can go a long way. My students literally come to class right away so they can get their favorite stool and move it to sit in the circle. Not having enough of something's so essential to a classroom also leads to disagreements about whose stool was whose. Both my students and I would be so grateful!
needStatement: My students need stools to sit on in class that are the right height for the lab tables.

name: Reading Takes You Places
description: My first graders love to learn. When given the correct tools and instruction they love to display, practice, and apply their knowledge .First graders enjoy collaborating with their classmates to discuss books that they have read, solutions to math problems, and sharing their own personal goals. They love spending time on technology whether they are practicing reading or becoming fluent with adding and subtracting. My students participate in the IB PYP Program. They study, promote and reflect on attitudes and attributes that promote them as being global citizens. My students practice writing daily entries into their reflection journals. They reflect about what they have learned and what they have questions about. They each have a journal for each subject area of the day, including a personal reflection journal. The personal reflection journal allows them to write their reflections about their behavior and goals. My students will benefit from more books that will be used as read-aloud. Read-aloud books provide students the opportunity interact with text. Students are able to develop meaning and understand of stories before reading, during reading, and after reading. My students need rich and engaging text that encourage them to learning how reading works. The chosen books will allow me to provide instruction with a gradual release approach that will help my students learn how to search for meaning within a text. These books will allow me to we introduce comprehension strategies that can be applied within shared, guided, and independent reading.
needStatement: My students need books that have strong literary merit that empower children of different ethnic backgrounds. We need books such as The Three Pigs, This is Not my Hat and more.

name: Butterflies Help Us Learn
description: My students are a diverse group with different needs and abilities in and out of the classroom, however they are so eager and willing to learn. When they step foot in our classroom, they know they have a teacher who loves them, classmates who want to help them, and a school environment where they can feel safe and successful. They are passionate about their learning and embrace challenges. Our school lacks a lot of the resources needed for students to be as successful as they could be. I am hopeful to help my learners continue on a path of academic excellence.I will be teaching life cycles of plants to my students this year. They already have background knowledge on life cycles, but I am wanting to show my students that animals also go through metamorphic changes like starting out as a tadpole and transforming slowing into a frog. What better way to understand changes than to watch a caterpillar transform into a beautiful butterfly and observing each day the growth and changes? We have a butterfly garden at our school where we can release butterflies once we are done learning about them. We currently do not have a set curriculum or materials to teach science at my school. I have the standards and I pull books from the library, but I would love to teach my students about science in a fun, interactive, and educational environment where they can walk away impacted with knowledge because of donors like you who made a difference in education.
needStatement: My students need a butterfly larvae set to see an insect's life cycle.

name: Impact the World Through Writing
description: Our 4th graders are hard workers. They are outgoing, sociable and respectful. Our students attend a diverse school, with many different backgrounds, cultures, languages and lifestyles. With many low income families, over 75% of our students receive a free and reduced lunch. We work hard to be accepting of everyone. We strive to make everyone feel welcome, each and everyday. Despite the many hardships that our students go through, when they come to school, they do the very best they can. My school district has graciously given each of my students a tablet. This is a wonderful tool to help my 4th grade students learn through technology. Everyone is very excited to try new things on our tablets. However, right now, we are only able to access the online keyboard, making it very difficult to type. Having a keyboard for students to type on would be extremely valuable. Writing is an essential part of life. Students can use their new keyboard to create wonderful stories, take notes and research many things, not to mention improve their typing skills. The sky's the limit.
needStatement: My students need keyboards to go with our tablets, batteries and chargers.

name: The Art of Science
description: I have a typical seventh grade class. My students are from a variety of socioeconomic and racial backgrounds. Many of my students' parents are in the military. The skill level varies from extremely high to extremely low. I have an average of 25 students in each of my 5 classes. Most are highly motivated learners and are very interested in science. They love technology and embrace its integration in the classroom. Fostering a love of learning and training lifetime learners is the main goal in my class. They are our future leaders. My students create projects all through the year in science class. These art projects provide hands on learning of the science skills covered in class. They are beneficial to students who do not test well. A well designed project will often help pull up a poor test grade. These projects provide also help sharpen research skills and team work. They are often required to use outside sources to find information and synthesize this information with this information with their collaborative groups. These skills are vital to survival in a future workplace. The students are usually very excited to create these projects. This excitement fosters a love of learning. I want them to strive to be lifelong learners and gain skills for their future.
needStatement: My students need art supplies for science reports, projects, and presentations.

name: High Interest Books For All Reading Levels
description: I work with a diverse group of 4th and 5th graders. They are curious, determined, and global citizens. My students are passionate about learning about the world around them. We are small urban school serving approximately 320 students in grades PreK through 5. The school has been part of the community for 125 years. Our families are dedicated to the success of their child, former students now teach at Maxfield or send their children and grandchildren to learn in the same community they did. Every student deserves to have a wide range of books at their finger tips. I have a wide range of ability levels which requires a wide range of books. These books will engage and motivate students to be life-long readers. Along with the books, I have requested large pillows to provide my scholars with comfortable seating so they can curl up with their new books. Many of the books I have picked out were requested by the students themselves. Graphic Novels are very popular with my students. Bright vivid pictures help the students engage in the book and make connections with the vocabulary. Many of the books come in series which gets the students involved and dedicated to the characters. These books will have a positive impact on my scholars. It will be hard to ask them to put their books down!
needStatement: My students need high-interest books to help them be life-long readers.

name: Focus on the Groove!
description: In accordance with our motto 'Sing, Move, and Play EVERY DAY!' and the Georgia Performance Standards, students in my music classes get to learn music through simply having fun in 3 different areas: singing, moving, and instrument playing. Every day I am impressed with my students' musical abilities. It saddens me that, due to the low income area of our school, many of these students do not have the opportunity of exploring their talents outside our music classroom. Therefore, I believe it is so important for me to give them as many experiences and paths to explore and refine their inner musician as I possibly can!Due to the funding we've already received from donors choose, my school is well on its way to having regular drum circles during our class time. Gathering drums, with their low and loud sound, will help ground us and keep the beat steady. It's hard work trying to keep 30 students all drumming in time! These gathering drums will be heard over all the other drums and will keep us all together so that we can continue to achieve our drumming dreams! I can't wait to add these to our collection and see my students' faces when they get to try them for the first time!
needStatement: My students need gathering drums to help us set a strong beat in our drumming ensembles.

name: Inspiring Creativity!
description: My students are 5th grade readers and writers from a wide range of ability levels and cultural backgrounds. As their teacher, it is important for me to give them many creative ways to learn. There are never enough supplies to bring their imaginations to life and I am hoping to give them more resources to spark their engagement whether their level is high, medium or low. I am very proud of this group of students who are trying to do their best and use their creativity every day. Whether it's building on their word practice, cutting and pasting work into their reading journals, building a diorama, or just utilizing various supplies to inspire their engagement in Reading, Writing and Social Studies, my students could really use some more supplies in the classroom. With more choices for markers, pencils and paper, my students will have things that they need to fulfill so many of our classroom lessons in both Reading and Social Studies. We use many supplies on a daily basis, like glue and colored pencils, in order to differentiate with the wide range of ability levels in my classroom. We often paste vocabulary words, graphic organizers, and other questions and answers into our journals. Teachers are only allotted so many supplies from our office and some of the supplies are of very poor quality. It is very important to me as their teacher to instill responsibility and organization so I know that they will take pride in their new supplies and keep them safe. Moreover, all of my students will have resources to keep them motivated to do better work. Thank you for helping our classroom function at its best!
needStatement: My students need more supplies such as markers, crayons, paper and glue sticks for our classroom in order to inspire their engagement and creativity.

name: Moving Through Math Facts
description: My students come from a diverse background, from all over the world. I have students who were born in the United States and some who were born in other countries. We are a large melting pot of all nationalities, including some from the continents of Africa and South America. My students are excited about learning! Since the first day of school, they have been eager to learn. They love to participate and aren't afraid to ask questions. They enjoy educational games and videos, as well as reading and listening to good books. My class also comes from a range of socio-economic levels. We have lots of working parents who aren't able to come in to volunteer due to work or who aren't able to send in things, but we have great parents who are supportive of their kids' education. My students need headphones so that they can hear the various sounds that accompany the educational websites that they visit to help support their reading, writing, and math skills. We also need a wireless keyboard and mouse so that I can easily facilitate students viewing educational videos, using PowerPoints, and playing educational review games from the front of the room. By donating to our project, you are not only helping my students have the chance to hear the websites they are using, but you are also allowing the rest of the class to continue their work without being disturbed. My children use a website to practice their math facts every day. The 'teacher' on the website speaks to them and they need these headphones to be able to follow the directions. It is so important for the children to master their math facts. They need to be able to automatically know the answer to basic math facts so that they can move on to being able to solve word problems and think critically. The wireless keyboard and wireless mouse will allow the students and me to lead computer activities from the front of the room and still view websites and videos. Currently, the computer we use is on the side of the room. It makes it more difficult to simultaneously keep all the students engaged and run the computer. A wireless keyboard and mouse will allow us to do both!
needStatement: My students need headphones and wireless keyboard and mouse to make practicing math facts and playing educational games easier and more fun!

name: Classroom Supplies
description: Our students come from low socio-economic homes in a large migrant community. Many families travel from Florida to Georgia and then to Michigan picking produce. The families are often non-English speaking and the students struggle to keep up academically because of these unique challenges. However, they are grateful for everything they receive and take nothing for granted. You can't help but fall in love with our students! They love technology and come to the classroom early to get on computers, iPads, or whatever I can provide. After a Professional Development Training with Dr. Michelle Forney, I am hoping to bring 'Alexa' into my classroom and encourage my students to find the answers to their questions. They love technology and will learn while having fun. Who said education has to be boring? Not me, that is why I am hoping to share scented markers with my students and allow them to use them on projects. We are always running out of pencils, paper, and folders. Hopefully with these extra supplies, we can get through the next few months. We take fact fluency tests daily and our dry erase markers don't last a month. Keeping them available will allow the students to continue their daily practice. Thanks for checking out our project!
needStatement: My students need an Amazon Echo, markers, paper, pencils, and folders for everyday work!

name: Let Me Learn
description: Learning can occur in many different ways. The students in my classroom are kinesthetic learners, they learn by doing. My students love to learn on the computer. They like to go on various educational websites and 'play games.' Even though they are playing, they are really learning and they do not even realize it. But when the computers do not work there is no joy in the classroom. The disappointment in their little faces is heartbreaking as technology fails them. I walk into my classroom with my fingers crossed hoping that the computers didn't break down overnight. Sometimes, we're lucky. Most times, we're not. Once my students see the computers are not up, they know that means computer time is either extremely limited or not happening at all. I am requesting an iPad mini for my students to use to access reading and math programs. If my students can use an iPad mini it brightens their day because an iPad doesn't break down overnight. My students would love the opportunity to work on their 'own' tablet in school. The reading and math sites that they go on when they use the computers will be available to them on the iPad as well. Learning can take place at the touch of their fingers.
needStatement: My students need an iPad mini to learn using technology tools in the classroom.

name: Getting Comfortable with Informational Text
description: My school is a Title I school in a high poverty area. I teach students with special needs in grades 3-5. Students in my classroom require extra support in all subject areas and social skills. They spend most of the school day in a self-contained setting to address their academic and behavioral needs. My students participate in small group and individualized lessons throughout the day that focus on promoting their strengths in order to address their weaknesses. The students in my classroom love to attend school and have great attendance! They love to learn and experience new things. In my classroom, we focus on personal growth and celebrate meeting academic and behavioral goals. Every morning we take a moment to dance and celebrate each other by handing out rewards or giving personal compliments to one another. This small activity sets the stage for the rest of the day. It puts all the students in a good mood and creates a positive learning environment where students celebrate each other. My students and I would like to ask you to donate informational texts to our classroom library and writing materials. We currently have a classroom library that has many great books, but it lacks non-fiction literature. The research shows that informational text can help improve literacy skills in students. The informational books that we are asking for are leveled from B to H. It will be text that students can read with the teacher or independently. My students need help strengthening their writing skills. The writing materials in this project will help my students transfer their reading skills to their own writing. My classroom is also in need of different flexible seating options. My students would love to curl up with a good book on some soft seating. Flexible seating helps students feel more comfortable and safe in their learning environment. It also promotes speaking and listening between students. This soft couch would give students the chance to sit with each other and partner read or discuss components of a story. My students and I hope that you will consider making our reading center even more enjoyable with these amazing materials.
needStatement: My students need informational text added to our classroom library along with a read and relax book station for more flexible seating options.

name: Seating for Success
description: My students are gifted and talented 4th and 5th graders in a small town Title I school. They are highly intelligent, motivated students. They are eager learners and crave a challenge each and every day! Traditional methods of teaching often bore them easily, and as a result, I need to find ways to engage them in fun, purposeful, challenging learning even when learning basic skills. In my experience, the classroom environment plays a key role in students' success, and this group of kids LOVES to have options when it comes to seating and workspaces! Our classroom has transitioned this year to a flexible seating room. Rather than asking kids to sit in a chair with their feet on the floor for 7 1/2 hours per day, students in this class have options for workspaces and seating. I have noticed a huge positive impact in academic success as well as classroom community since making this change. Students are comfortable, willing to participate, and most importantly they feel like the space is theirs! We started the year with 3 stability balls, but they were old and did not hold air. The balls were one of the students favorite seating alternatives, so I am hoping to be able to get the funds to replace them! Also, they have requested bean bag chairs, and since it is very important to me that this space belongs to them, I am hoping to be able to fund two bean bags as well.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating and workspace options to help them succeed!

name: Technology to Teach Academic and Functional Skills
description: Welcome to the Exceptional Wildcats program! Our program serves students with a variety of disabilities in the self contained setting. Our school is a high poverty school in the Lowcountry of South Carolina. The majority of our students receive free or reduced lunch. The purpose of our program is to equip our students with the academic, functional, and job skills needed to succeed in the world! It is our pleasure to be able to teach these skills to our students, however, sometimes we need help providing all the things we need to help our program run smoothly. Technology is a huge part of our world today! Unfortunately, many of our students do not have access to computers and laptops outside of school. We spend a majority of time helping students fill out applications, completing resumes, and helping students write cover letters. Each classroom in our 4 teacher program has 4 computers, however, at any given time 1-2 may not be working properly. Having a set of Chromebooks would allow our students to work on their job skills and academic skills at their desk, all while gaining experience using technology. Finally, many of our students use read aloud or other software to help them understand the words on the screen. Over the years, our headphones have become worn out from many years of use. A classroom set of 10 headphones will replace the old and broken headphones and will be used for students to listen to read alouds and to play music for calming purposes. It is very frustrating to not have enough headphones when needed. Students will borrow other students headphones and forget to return them. By having a class set of headphones, we are assuring that each child using a computer for school purposes has access to headphones for their work station.
needStatement: My students need Chromebooks and headphones for academic, functional, and job skills purposes.

name: Sensory Play to Learn Math in Kindergarten
description: The children in my classroom learn math concepts quickly when given the opportunity to use their imaginations, work with sensory materials that build their vocabulary and practice speaking to others. Most of my students live in poverty. My five and six-year-olds are eager to learn. Many are having their first school experience. Some children come from refugee camps in Thailand. The students who grew up knowing English as their first language are wonderful at beginning the fun and they too need opportunities to learn about volume. My students are eager to explore the world and express themselves with materials that engage the senses. Pouring, measuring, scooping, raking, sifting and funneling sand in a sensory table, is way to understand volume. My students will be comparing the sizes of the containers that are filled with sand. They will count scoops of sand. The children will design paths for small cars to travel between piles of sand. They will notice what falls through the holes of the sifter and what is too big to fit through the holes. There are endless opportunities for practical applications of mathematical vocabulary.
needStatement: My students need sand for the sensory table to learn about volume.

name: ECHO...We are Burning with Curiosity!
description: The minute you meet these fourth graders you know they are eager to learn! They bubbled over with excitement when I met them for the first time at Open House. Their curiosity is contagious. These scholars are ready for a challenge and hungry to learn! I relish their enthusiasmand know these students will be future leaders. The sky is the limit when it comes to learning. They are soaring for success. I am honored to be their teacher. The key to learning is to realize that it is an art, an experience and an ongoing journey. There is no better time than now to instill in our students that the best remedy to cure curiosity is to never stop learning. Although my students are all in the same class. They all have special talents. I want to nurture their talents by providing technology that we can all use to inspire our interests. Using Echo in the classroom will allow students to inquire about things they are reading to deepen their understanding. If I teach my students to quench their curiosity, they in turn will be prepared to engage in life as long life learners.
needStatement: My students need an Amazon Echo.

name: Music and Math
description: My students are energetic, creative, and inquisitive students who live in high poverty. They lack the resources at home to give them a head start in life. Therefore, it is up to the teachers they have to supply enriching and motivating experiences. They love the opportunity to create and perform music and show off their musical talents in concerts. My students love performing on classroom musical instruments, moving to music, and singing and playing folk song games. The music classroom is a place where they can have fun and express themselves creatively. My students need hand drums, xylophone, and rhythm sticks to perform their music math compositions. Students can practice and review their math skills of addition and subtraction by creating and performing their own creative music compositions. The students use the values of the notes and rests in various meters to solve music math problems. They can perform their compositions for the class by using the drums, xylophones, and rhythm sticks. All students love to perform for the class and the class enjoys listening to their peers performances. The students first practice learning the note and rest values. Then they can write their own compositions using 2/4, 3/4, or 4/4 meter. From their practice of music math, they know what combinations of notes and rests to use in each measure.
needStatement: My students need musical instruments (drums, xylophones, and rhythm sticks) to perform their creative compositions while using math skills of note values and time signatures to demonstrate the relationship of music to math.

name: Hands-On Sensory Fun!
description: Kindergarten is not how we remember it. Often times, this is the first exposure to a school setting and a rigorous schedule for my students. I have students that come in not knowing how to hold a pencil, sit and listen to a story, work with a friend, or write their name. The one thing they all have in common, though, is their eagerness to learn.I work in a high poverty, urban school. All of my students have a story of where they come from. Some are happy stories, some are scary stories, and some are emotional stories. You don't know their story until they enter your classroom. Then they become part of your story. My goal as their teacher is to create a safe and fun learning environment. The expectations for kindergartners is much more demanding that most would expect. I have discovered that with high expectations, high rewards are to follow. My kiddos amaze me every day because even though their story might be tough; their willingness to learn is even tougher. My kindergarten classroom is an inclusion classroom. Therefore, I teach many students with special needs involving sensory needs. I want to integrate sensory learning and play throughout my curriculum. As students grow, their senses are the most basic way for them to explore and process new information. Sensory play enhances learning through hands-on activities that stimulates their senses. This kinetic sand is a great way for my students to do this! They will be able to explore the sand during sensory breaks. They will also be able to build their literacy skills by creating words in the sand using the letter stampers or finding objects in the sand using letter/sound recognition. It is a double win for my kindergarten students!
needStatement: My students need a fun, sensory driven way of making words using kinetic sand and letter stampers.

name: Rock, Paper, Scissors, Fires...Part Two!
description: We love to learn! My first graders are working hard every day, and so am I! These six and seven year olds are learning to read, have become writers and have made big gains in math. We are busy all day long, and there's still much to do. My students are in first grade, and enjoy coming to school. They come from a wide variety of living situations. Some come from two parent homes, some from single parents, and some with multiple generations, or multiple families living in one apartment. Some of my students come from families who support public education and encourage their students to do their best while at school. While at school, I hold high expectations for each student in their behavior and their academics, no matter their home life. We learn together, we work through problems together, and we celebrate successes together. Helping my students learn the skills of reading and math will help them for their entire lives. Last year my class was blessed to receive five Kindle Fires through the generosity of donors through Donor's Choose. I am happy to report that these Kindles are used on a daily basis. Due to an increase in class size, I am requesting another Kindle to allow each student the opportunity to use this technology more frequently. It comes with a free year of Amazon Free Time Unlimited and a kids' proof case. We will be able to use this for reading and math practice. There are many apps available such as books that are read to the students to help them listen to fluency, and math games that can reinforce skills taught in class. I plan to use these during reading and math groups. This donation of a Kindle Fire and accessories will allow my students to practice important academic skills and be exposed to using a touch screen, building their technology skills too. The memory cards will allow more storage of educational apps and allow me to differentiate the technology easily. The headphones allow each child to have an individual experience, and keeps the noise level down in the classroom so that I can conduct small groups. We are coming to state testing, and again this year it is a computer based test. This will continue in the years to come, I'm sure of it. These materials will allow the students more time with technology, and will help prepare them for tests, as well as giving them time to practice reading and math activities. Some students have little or no access to technology in their homes, so the practice at school is critical to help them prepare to show what they know on the state assessments.
needStatement: My students need more experience with technology, this Kindle Fire and accessories, will help improve their reading, math, and technology skills.

name: Battle of the Books, on Audio!
description: I work with students who need academic and behavior support. Students often want to come to my classroom to receive support with their academics or to talk about what is going on in their lives. I feel honored students feel comfortable enough to want to come to me and share a part of their day. I would like to offer additional tools for students when they are with me to continue their support needs. The items requested would be available for students to use when as a draw and as a reward to support behaviors. There are times when students need a reward for after completing an academic or behavior goal and I would like to be able to offer additional resources for my students. I would also like to have these resources available for students who need something to have to calm them down if their behavior is not appropriate for the classroom; at the time. I thank you for your time and interest in my students. Working to be proactive with my students, school, and community to offer more resources for all children. Building our school audio library for all students. I am a huge advocate for EC students to have the resources they need to foster their success in independence. Some of the students with an IEP (Individualized Education Plan) have shown an interest in reading the books listed in the Battle of the Books List, however, most of the books are above their reading level. However, none of the books are above their love of reading or comprehension level. The donations to this project will help to improve my students' reading comprehension and love for reading. After the winter break our school will start to implement the Daily 5 procedures. One of the centers is a listening to center. Having books on audio will be able to be utilized throughout the school and for students to check-out from the library. This will change our students' lives for the better because they will love reading and feel success at an early age --- having fun while learning!
needStatement: My students need audio books from the Battle of the Books lists.

name: Interactive Learning to Support Digital Learning for Students With Disabilities
description: Our class serves inner city students with a range of disabilities, which include: specific learning disabilities, emotional behavioral disabilities, autism spectrum disorders, other health disabilities, developmental cognitive disabilities, and developmental delay. The typical student in my class struggles with basic reading skills, phonics, number sense, writing, language, social skills, and self regulation. Our classroom budget to spend on materials for my students this year was $80. Our students could benefit from new technology in our room to help engage the diverse learning needs of each student we work with. The interactive white board would help provide another modality for my students to engage with their learning. Students with disabilities often benefit from hands-on and visual learning materials. The interactive whiteboard would allow my students to see material visually as well as engage interactively with the lesson. It would also help reluctant learners to engage in learning while using technology. Students would have the opportunity to interact with activities in reading, writing and math. This project would help me to individualize my lessons based on student need by integrating multiple sources and tools with my students. Using an interactive white board would help meet the unique needs of all learners by engaging in different learning styles. Your donation would help increase academic learning by developing their 21st century skills.
needStatement: My students need an interactive white board system.

name: Technology Ties In Families!
description: My students are very energetic and love to do hands-on activities. They are very social and still learning how to interact with their peers. My students love to learn through movement and play. Although my students are very different in where they are with their educational needs, they are very supportive and push their peers to be the best they can be. As a class, we love learning together in fun engaging ways. We love our Kindergarten family and all the fun things that we do! Having educational dvd's will help my students dance, sing, and move while learning grade level standards. As five year olds, my students need movement throughout the day. Taking two or three minutes before a lesson to participate in an educational song, will really help them take a brain break and refocus. Working with parents to make a team that wants the best for their child is very important to me. Many parents do not know how to approach school work with young children who are tired, and are not wanting to work more after a long day of school. I want to be able to send these resources home to make that tie between home and school fun. These children are surrounded by technology and by purchasing these dvd's for my classroom, I would be incorporating what my children love most, in an educational way that involves the family.
needStatement: My students need engaging activities with motion that can help them remember information.

name: I Like to Read My Books at Home!
description: Ours is an urban elementary school in St Paul. We are a neighborhood school serving mainstream students as well as many bilingual students who are learning English. Some of our students have recently arrived in the United States and did not have an opportunity to attend school before. About 86% of our students receive free or reduced-price lunches. My students come to first grade eager for learning, and their parents are equally eager to support their children in learning, especially in learning to read. They are happy to have their children in school, and they are happy to work with me to help their children become readers and thinkers. This year I am engaging the families of my first graders through home visits and academic parent teacher teams. The families of my students are excited about helping their beginning readers by reading books at home and helping them develop a deeper understanding of the book by talking about the books they read at home. In my class I have students who are new to the United States and are learning to speak English as well as learning to read in English. They need interesting books at an early reading level to take home to read with their families. The books in the Red Rocket Reader series provides beginning readers just what they need to be successful: a simple, repetitive text with beautiful pictures that match the words. The books they are asking for are about animals on a farm, funny monkeys, children visiting grandparents, children playing outdoors, and other familiar topics. This supports the comprehension of early readers. While learning to read even the most beginning books, my students need to be able to talk about the story and retell it. Students will learn to think about what the story is about (characters, setting, and events) and about what happens in the story and why. When students take the books home parents will be empowered to help students retell the story. Parents will know how to talk purposefully with their child about the books. Your support of this project will help our first graders to become readers and thinkers, and help our families to become involved in and support their students' learning to read.
needStatement: My students need three sets of early reader books to take home to read with their parents. They are learning to retell stories and talk about the characters and events in the story with their families.

name: Leveling the Playing Field
description: My Kindergarten students are an eager group of learners. They are so excited for new opportunities and are willing to try anything to boost their school experience. My students come from culturally and racially diverse families, including Karen, Hmong, African-American, Honduran, Caucasian, and Somali. Practically all of my students live in Minnesota. The school itself is a community school and receives Title 1 funding. As a staff, our 2016-2017 school year goal focuses on expanding literacy opportunities for all students and raising academic achievement in reading, writing, and speaking. Students will use leveled books during reading time to practice reading independently, with a partner, or in small groups. From the first day of school on, my Kindergarteners read common sight words and use reading strategies to help them secure word knowledge and reading skills. I want to spend time with my students connecting these practices to their reading. In addition, having access to more books means added exposure to different publishing styles- especially fonts, pictures, and genres- which will allow students to transition from one type of book to another with ease. I plan to spend time with them comparing different types of texts.
needStatement: My students need Level A and Level B texts to increase their opportunities for reading to ensure they are reading at grade level by the end of the school year.

name: My Mini Picassos
description: My little artists love to create things. The imaginative ideas that they have amaze me. When I give them an assignment that requires pencils or crayons they get so excited. That is one thing I do not have to tell them to do twice. Of course, in order to sustain creativity one needs supplies. My students will share, but it is getting harder to do so with our drawing supplies dwindling. I want them to continue their artistic dreams. Who knows, maybe I have the next Picasso in my class. My students use colored pencils during math, ELA, scicence and social studies. They are constantly graphing, filling in charts, or checking their rubrics. Needless to say, we go through a lot of colored pencils. I find that when they use markers, they tend to bleed through their papers. I don't want to have their work ruined. My budding little artists are in need of some supplies. They will be able to use these colored pencils almost on a daily basis. The sharpener is also a great tool because they need it to continue their work. Wherever there is a pencil, there will always be a pencil sharpener. The paper is for their recess time. That's when they really let their imagination go wild. These items will greatly enhance my students creativity.
needStatement: My students need supplies to enhance their creativity. They need a durable pencil sharpener, colored pencils and drawing paper.

name: Reading Corner
description: My students are special not only because of the unique differences and daily challenges they face. Yet they still come and try their best at school and are motivated to learn (most of them). We are a neighborhood school in a low socioeconomic neighborhood, serving less than 400 students. We are 99% free and reduce lunch; mostly Hispanic and African American. My students deserve the best yet we are not given essential materials or help. I also serve a split level classroom this year with first and second grade students. Students love that difference in the approach for learning. Doing something other than sitting at a desk in a chair. Students have an opportunity with the fun chairs, a bench, and mats to lay on and just enjoy reading. At a young age it is so very important to children to love learning or in this case love reading. I would love to be able to create that space for them here. As we work on independent learners, I want them to be comfortable; and these materials/furniture will help my students with that. Having a different place to go will help them feel like they are doing something different than what they usually do.
needStatement: My students need Something different. My students need an environment which is welcoming, caring, calm, and comfortable. My students need a space to read, a reading corner.

name: Technology and Literacy in the Social Studies Classroom
description: My school is a large urban neighborhood community middle school. We participate in the Title I program, for over 75% of our students qualify for free and reduced lunch prices. My students are currently in a mixed level classroom--grades 7 and 8--and this year we are studying US History. They are curious, good-humored, and hungry for knowledge! They love to use technology to further their understanding of US History topics!This year we will be participating in National History Day by creating student-chosen research projects. Despite the fact that students these days grow up with more knowledge about computers, tablets, and technology, little opportunity has been available to explicitly teach 21st century technology skills like typing. In our classroom, we are fortunate to have 1:1 iPads, but students have yet to learn the standard QWERTY keyboard that is used in most schools and places of work. My project is to help students learn basic typing skills so that they are able to successfully communicate more effectively and efficiently with peers, teachers, and future employers. By implementing keyboards in the classroom and giving mini lessons on basic typing format, I hope to see an increase in the desire to write and the desire to learn.
needStatement: My students need to learn how to type efficiently and effectively so that they are prepared for high school, college, and a career. These standard QWERTY keyboards will plug right into their school-issued iPads.

name: Books Glorious Books!
description: Our school is a community school with about 300 students in K-8th grades. All students qualify for free lunch. The students are African-American, Hispanic and White. A few are above grade level, a few more at grade level and most struggling to get there. They are my biggest worry and my greatest love. I cannot control their life experiences outside the classroom and so I strive to make their school life safe, educational and fun. Donors choose has helped with this mission. Every year in my classroom I set a goal for the students to read 50 books and pass 50 small comprehension test on each. When the students reach their goal, I make cupcakes to celebrate. The person that reaches the goal gets the large cupcake and everyone else gets a mini cupcake. I looped with my class this year and a lot of my books the students have already read. This has meant that our goal is a little stagnate. I need new books that will make the students reach up in the air like Oliver Twist and plead, 'Please, [Madam], I want some more.' I found such books with a collection of graphic novels. If you are unfamiliar with graphic novels, think back to the joy of reading comic books. I have a few of these books and even the most reluctant reader will silently read for at least twenty minutes. Furthermore, students tend to read above their grade level and still comprehend these novels. I was very excited and pleased when I found these books at a store that is supported by Donorchoose. I hope you choose to support our classroom so the students can devour some books, glorious books.
needStatement: My students need high interest books to keep them on their goal of reading 50 books!

name: Keystone Science School - Combining Fieldwork, Adventure, and Expertise
description: At our school of Expeditionary Learning, we come together to explore, question, and create in order to do better work and be better people than we ever thought possible. In a nutshell, Expeditionary Learning provides students with an interdisciplinary education connected to character and community. An integral component of a student’s education at our school is through “Learning Expeditions”, in-depth studies of a compelling topic tied to literacy standards. These Learning Expeditions go hand in hand with field work experiences within our local community to further investigate and explore real world connections. We think our third grade students are extraordinary minds working to solve these real world problems. With 87% minority students, 68% of the students qualifying for free or reduced-price lunch, new immigrants from Mexico, Syrian refugees, students in transitional housing, and a multitude of languages spoken, our students bring their insight and diverse background experiences to the problem solving table. We believe that these students are changing the world. Our dream is for our entire third grade to attend an overnight three-day program at the Keystone Science School in the mountains of Colorado. This project will cover a portion of the cost of this field trip. This Spring, our third grade students will be engaging in a three-month long learning expedition to explore our urban watershed and nearby creek’s water quality, and come up with a plan to take action in our community to improve the quality of the Creek that runs along the back of our school. Our creek is part of a larger watershed, one that begins in the mountains and ends in the Gulf of Mexico. By engaging in the learning at the source of our watershed, students will gain the knowledge to understand water on a global scale. Our dream is to have our students work alongside scientists at Keystone Science School to learn the necessary background knowledge and skills to tackle water issues. This three-day experience at Keystone Science School is pivotal to shaping our students into scientists. We will take this content back to the classroom and our nearby creek, making connections between the world around us and our community. Most of our students have never been to the mountains, despite the close proximity. This fieldwork experience will broaden their horizons as scientists and world changers.
needStatement: My students need an opportunity to gain vital background knowledge about water with experts at Keystone Science School in order to solve the water problems within our community.

name: Tick! Tock! We Need a Glock! (Glockenspiel)
description: My students love to perform music on instruments, especially barred instruments like xylophones, metallophones and glockenspiels. We just don't have enough. Physical playing time is reduced, and student learning is limited. My students learn best through singing, movement, speech, creating and performing on instruments so increasing the amount of instruments will increase student learning and understanding.I teach 600 students in grades K-5, and they come to me for 45 minutes once a week. My school is a Title I school in a military town. Military families many times will move away due to orders or deployments, but often return 1 to 3 years later. Students at my school are eager to learn and are most excited about performing on instruments and creating and performing their own compositions.I am certified in the Orff approach and use this approach daily as a way for my students to learn. Students learn through exploration and creating. With another soprano glockenspiel, students will be able to improvise melodies (create on the spot), compose melodies, and accompany other students who are singing, moving, speaking or performing on other instruments. The music used in the Orff process is based on folk songs to which students have connections. They will be able to connect with students who are not from America (we have students from Yemen, China, Mexico, Columbia etc), places families have been deployed (Japan, Germany, Africa etc), and, of course, American folk music!While 1 more instrument may seem insignificant, having 1 more Orff instrument (glockenspiel) will allow more students to participate in an activity. This will reduce time and the number of groups switching out on instruments. One extra instrument will impact students by allowing them more learning opportunities and more time to appreciate those opportunities.
needStatement: My students need a new soprano glockenspiel and mallets to use in creating and performing music.

name: Reading With Magazines
description: Our class serves inner city students with a range of disabilities, which include: specific learning disabilities, emotional behavioral disabilities, autism spectrum disorders, other health disabilities, developmental cognitive disabilities, and developmental delay. The typical student in my class struggles with basic reading skills, phonics, number sense, writing, language, social skills, and self regulation. Our classroom budget to spend on materials for my students this year was $80. Our students could benefit from new technology in our room to help engage the diverse learning needs of each student we work with. Students in my room like to practice reading. They like to use books, magazines, comic books, etc. Students would enjoy reading current, up-to-date, real life articles that they can relate to or learn from. Getting magazines in my students hands would help engage my learners with the bright pictures, glossy pages, and exciting new topics to intrigue their learning. Putting reading material in the hands of low-income students will help increase their love for learning, engage their interests, and allow them to practice reading articles and current events. My students would be thrilled to receive a fun and engaging magazine in the mail every month. It would give them something to look forward to every month!
needStatement: My students need magazines to engage in reading, support their interests, and learn about current events.

name: The Drumming Mission is Complete!
description: In accordance with our motto, 'Sing, Move, and Play Every Day!' and the Georgia Performance Standards, students in my music classes get to learn music through simply having fun in three different areas: singing, moving, and instrument playing. Every day I am impressed with my students' musical abilities. It saddens me that, due to the low income area of our school, many of these students do not have the opportunity of exploring their talents outside our music classroom. Therefore, I believe it is so important for me to give them as many experiences and paths to explore and refine their inner musician as I possibly can!Through previously funded DonorsChoose projects, I have acquired 5 sets of tubano drums in various sizes, as well as a couple of gathering drums. To have a complete class set of tubanos, I need just one more set of 3! Our classroom will then have 18 tubanos, enough for a class of 32 students. Studies have shown that drumming reduces stress, lowers blood pressure, and lifts mood - it's fun, it's physical, and it's easy for anyone to do! We all know that kids these days have more stress on them than they should. Having drum circles in my classroom will hopefully alleviate some of their stress and bring them to a place of fun and enjoyment!
needStatement: My students need this last set of tubanos to complete our class set!

name: ¡Queremos Más Libros! Help Build our Bilingual Library
description: Our school is located on the south side of Chicago in a primarily Hispanic neighborhood, and 85% of students qualify for free or reduced lunch. We are a dual language school, meaning that my second grade students receive 80% of their instruction in Spanish, and are learning to read and write in English AND Spanish! The task for staff and students alike is demanding, but we thrive by nurturing a community committed to risk-taking, health & wellness, curiosity and encouragement! We have the joy and privilege of learning to read in not just one but TWO languages! In second grade, most students are beginning to receive direct English literacy instruction in addition to continued Spanish instruction, so for the first time we are searching for 'good fit' books in both languages. It can be a challenge for a 7 year old to be motivated and self-aware enough to navigate a bilingual library, so we need all the accessible, engaging books we can get! This classroom library provides the books they read at school and at home. With 28 students reading short books in 2 languages, we go through a LOT of titles! Our classroom library is unfortunately quite tattered and picked over, and in order to satisfy the voracious readers and entice the reluctant ones, I need to build up a stockpile of exciting, age-appropriate books in both languages. We love classics, graphic novels, nonfiction and everything in between. ¡A El Salón Anaranjado le encanta leer! ¡Somos lectores fuertes! Thank you for your consideration!
needStatement: My students need more books in English AND Spanish to stimulate their growing minds!

name: Quill You Help Us?
description: All students can learn if they are given the appropriate tools. A typical day in my classroom involves my learners engaged with hands-on activities. They are involved in their learning through group and partner learning as well as independent learning. My students come from a very diverse range of home structures. They live with families that are nuclear, single parent, multiple-family, foster, and military families. My students are fourth graders who love learning. The majority of my students come from low socioeconomic backgrounds. More than 65% of our students receive free or reduced price breakfast and lunch. My students have learning or emotional disabilities and many have multiple diagnoses. Our school can be described as a fun, caring, and creative environment for our students to come to daily. My students enjoy completing task card centers. This is great practice for my students to work independently. They also gain a sense of self pride when they are able to complete all of the work themselves without having to ask for help. We will use the ink, laminating sheets, and ink to print and make task card sets for each of my students on their independent level. My students like using colored pens to answer their work. Using colored paper and pens is an easy fix to making work fun and it is a bonus that they are learning at the same time.
needStatement: My students need laminating sheets, colored pens, colored paper and ink for our printer in order to have a set up task card station for the students to complete independent work.

name: Taking the Leap on the Daily!
description: My students and I have had an eventful year, and it's only half way over. We experienced the Great Flood of 2016 and as a result we experienced an influx of students from various areas. Our school is a true Title I, so funds are heavily appreciated, especially after the flood. So as a first year teacher, I have been taking in stride all the challenges that face us. Through it all, including the rotation of many faces I have been able to learn my students (a.k.a. 'my kids'). There are so many leaders in my classroom that love taking the initiative to help when able. They also have various learning styles too. This is definitely a group that will keep me on my toes. The items requested are essential to my students because it will give them the opportunity to be constantly exposed to materials needed not only for their standardized test but also for the rest of their lives. Students will use the daily book as their bell ringers and refreshers. With so many learning styles, I know that a hands-on experience will help them become successful and keep Science and Social Studies fun! Also, by having a printer I can use it to find multiple activities that can accommodate the students' unique way of learning. Plus, we always do research, so by having a printer, it will make it easier and save time for all 20 plus students to have an opportunity in one class period.
needStatement: My students need center activities and daily morning work to help them prepare for their standardized test at the end of Spring. Also, we need a printer to print class and homework assignments!

name: Crazy for Chromebooks!
description: At first glance you wouldn't think our school, housed in a quiet and unassuming building, holds close to 600 amazingly hard-working and happy learners. Their energy, captured during daily line dancing sessions, all but seeps out of the rafters and out to the concrete jungle surrounding it. The students come to school knowing both what is expected of them and how much their teachers love them. What our school is lacking in resources, we make up with out-of-the-box ideas and a lot of hope. Within our classrooms, magic happens! My students call a low-income and high-poverty area home. Despite their backgrounds, they come to school every day ready to learn. One of their favorite classes in school is Computers, where they get to use the technology most of them don't have access to at home. Technology is a language that translate well with my students, and it helps them get a deeper understanding of the material they are learning. Chromebooks are another way for students to receive extra time and attention on certain skills while having fun at the same time! Adding a computer center into our rotation will give my students an opportunity to use curriculum-based games to strengthen certain areas of need. It also foster a sense of independence and responsibility in our classroom. Many of my students come from homes with limited or no access to a computer and their only opportunity is at school. Our district does not get enough funding to provide technology for each student. With this new computer center, my students would gain valuable independent time with technology.
needStatement: My students need Chromebook computers to create a new small group computer center!

name: Paper Goes a Long Way-Problem Solved in Just a Day
description: Our school is a Title 1 school. Most of our students come from a low socioeconomic background. However, they are extremely special and unique in more ways than one. They have an extreme love for learning and will stop at nothing to achieve success. However, my students face daily challenges that include poverty, housing conflicts, unstable households, violence and crime. The majority of my students have witnessed a murder or heard that a family member or close friend was killed. All of my students receive free and reduced lunch and sometimes, this is the only hot meal they will eat. This is their reality. The students at my school are learning what it means to be given restorative justice. They are being trained on how to solve problems and forgive. Our students know that when harm has been done, we need to sit down and discuss it with everyone that is involved. My students need ten packs of various colored project/cardstock paper to complete memorable conflict resolution projects and activities inside our Resolution Room. These materials will help encourage our students to make the right choices, continue to participate in class, remain engaged, and be successful in school. We teach our students conflict resolution strategies and have them complete activities and projects in our Resolution Room in order to come to a solution. Some of these projects may be a letter to each other, detailed drawings of the incident that took place, resolution ideas and suggestions, and many more paper-based activities and projects. In addition, many of our students lack motivation in their classrooms and tend to turn to misbehavior to seek attention. Research shows that when you are proactive and have students take part in tracing back, reflecting, and solving the behavioral issues, students are more likely to behave in the future. Our school would benefit from project paper in order to complete Conflict Resolution projects when behavioral damage has been done. This paper will help motivate our students to make the right choices on a daily basis. They will also be a reminder that we are paying close attention to their choices and including them in the restorative process. If my project is funded, this can help serve as a reminder and teach our students that for every problem, there is a solution. We would like the climate of our school building to be filled with happy, motivated, engaged, and determined students. We feel in order for this to happen, our students need to know that we care about them. They need to understand that we are willing to go above and beyond to show them that we truly do love them.
needStatement: My students need ten packs of various colored project/cardstock paper to complete memorable conflict resolution projects and activities inside our Resolution Room.

name: Meeting 'Whole Child' Needs
description: My students. The 'gray area' students. You know the ones. It may be a child who struggles learning how to read, but are not behind enough to receive services. Or a bright student who doesn't test well due to anxiety, and misses out on enrichment programs because of a single test score. Or that student who can't hold a pencil correctly or tie a shoe in 3rd grade, but does not qualify for Occupational Therapy services. These are MY students. HELP my students FEED their Nervous System! By funding these weighted vests and blankets students will be able to feel pressure, when needed. They will also have mobility with the Bitty Bottom seats when sitting for prolonged periods of time. If this project is funded, our Title I school will be able to purchase a set of hands-on resources that teachers could pull from and try and help students with sensory processing disorders more appropriately in a classroom. Essentially, this will be a moving toolbox with lots of options to utilize to help meet those student needs. Using these multitude of resources will allow students the opportunity to 'feed' their nervous system and, in turn, develop stronger communication and personal skills. Help US help so many students out there that need something a little different. By helping these students be more successful, we are helping the entire classroom of learners!
needStatement: My students need weighted vests and blankets, ball cushions and one silly sensory set.

name: Where Do I Sit?
description: I work on a Title I school where most students are from low income homes. Our school is in a low income neighborhood. One of the great things about our school is the parent participation in our school events. Even though most of our students do not have great advantages, they are intelligent, inventive and creative. My classroom is made up 20 Hispanic bilingual students who are eager to learn. This year my students' reading levels range from those reading at a third grade level to the ones on a kindergarten level. As a teacher, I have to make sure that my classroom is organized so that students are always on task. My students don't have a lot of stability at home, so it is important for them to have stability at school. They need to know what is expected of them and when and how to do it. My classroom currently has no area rug for my students to sit during whole class instruction or during story time. This rug would make it possible for my students to have their own assigned space to sit and be comfortable during story time and whole class instruction. If my students have a rug it would make them more likely to listen and pay close attention to their lesson during whole class instruction. It would also cut down on behavioral issues where students are fighting for their own space or how to sit comfortably in the floor. A rug would make a great difference in my instruction.
needStatement: My students need a story time area rug to sit on and be able to have their own personal space.

name: Daily Needs for Learning
description: We are in a small rural community where many people are below or at the poverty line. Many of the students come from homes where English is a second language or no English is spoken. The students have an appreciation for learning and want access to the proper education they deserve through supportive and engaging materials in the classroom. Many of the students struggle to have the basic needs in the home setting so we work hard to make sure they have what they need in the classroom to promote their education and future. These students have a desire to learn and want the best education they can have. These materials will help ease daily school work for all students. Many students lack the basic school supplies to complete their classwork and homework such as pencils, crayons, and glue. We use these materials in all subject areas on a daily basis. Our students spend a lot of time completing interactive notebooks that require a lot of cutting out paper and gluing into a notebook. Students use these notebooks to demonstrate learning but also used as a text to go back and review in place of textbooks. Many of the students lack crayons, pencils, and these items. Our students have to rely on once a day sharpened pencils because our classroom lacks a pencil sharpener in the classroom. By having access to these materials for all students; the entire class can reach it's potential in learning and in their work without having to worry about not having the basic school supplies.
needStatement: My students need basic school supplies for daily classroom use and to complete daily assignments.

name: Help Offer Students Voice and Choice: Africa Book Clubs
description: We are Kimberly Colbert and Erin Whitcraft, and we teach in a large public school in the heart of St. Paul, MN. Our students are part of a community of learners who self-select into our honors World Literature courses. Our students are a widely diverse group of 10th graders with incredible energy and curiosity. Their learning styles and skill levels are diverse, as well. They will benefit greatly from literary works from a wide cultural spectrum; the students will be challenged by these books culturally and in terms of reading level. We are striving to offer a more diverse view of Africa by providing our students with four titles of African novels and non-fiction choices, spanning South Africa, Sierra Leone, Ghana, and Nigeria. The titles include: Ishmael Beah's Radiance of Tomorrow, Ghana Must Go by Taiya Selasi, We Need New Names by NoViolet Bulawayo, and Chimamanda Ngosi Adichie's Purple Hibiscus. The books selected illustrate cultures around the continent, which is important to us because it will nurture our students as global thinkers. Working in book clubs will encourage their reading and discussion of perceptions of characters, cultures, and conflicts. We are excited to offer them choices to fit their interests and create connections. These books will support 200 students this year and will continue to impact students for years to come!
needStatement: My students need four titles funded with 45 copies per title. The titles are We Need New Names, Ghana Must Go, Purple Hibiscus, and Radiance of Tomorrow.

name: Headphones On, World Off
description: On a typical day, my students come in and do a typing warm up for 10 minutes. Then we work on our projects where often they are creating videos, digital stories or presentations. They are a fun group of kids that teach me a lot about myself and how I teach technology. Kindergarten is ambitious and each week they love getting more and more responsibilities. All of my kids like to type within the time frame allotted but it's hard for them to focus when only some of them have working headphones. My students will be able to use these headphones during their typing drills, multimedia projects and also state testing which is also done in my computer lab. We like the headphones as opposed to the earbuds because some of the smaller kids have a hard time putting them in their ears. We often spend too much time trying to find headphones that are working or not tangled, in the classroom. When we're doing our activities, it's very distracting to the people around us as well. We also use the headphones to do slide shows and other projects. Its nice to be able to use them and hear what videos or sound effects we can add to our slide shows. We sometimes use videos to help us complete projects so it is so important to hear the directions to do our work. Some of these projects include code.org and projects in Scratch. Many of my Kindergarten students prefer these headphones over theirs. They fit them better than their earbuds they have in their regular class. They also keep them in their seats instead of being distracted by the other students.
needStatement: My students need these headphones to use during their typing drills, multimedia projects, and also state testing, which is also done in my computer lab.

name: Wobble While You Work!
description: I may work in a low income school district, but my students' potential is high and waiting to be maximized. As a reading teacher, I see students in grades K-5 who are struggling learners in need of intervention. These students have to go the extra mile in order to keep up with their peers which is why they deserve a really special and fun place to learn. They come to me to put in the extra work so I'd like to give them an extra special environment to learn in.I am in need of flexible seating options for my reading intervention classroom. These Wobble Chairs will help my students focus their energy on learning to read rather than trying to remain seated. These wonderful Wobble Chairs will provide my students with a seating option that promotes needed movement without having to get up or climb, thus minimizing distraction to other students and maximizing engaged on-task learning. The students that I see are already struggling to read and have to work extra hard to keep up with their peers. Many are also struggling with attention, focus, and hyperactivity. These stools will help reduce their fidgeting and frustration so that they can focus on learning to read. It is a way to help them overcome some of the obstacles that they face when trying to learn to read.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options that will provide an outlet for excess energy so that they can focus and be engaged during instruction.

name: Books, Books, Books!
description: I want my students to know that they are able to succeed regardless of where they are from or the things they are going through. They have witnessed more crimes and deaths than most adults I know. They come to school every day willing and ready to learn. They shouldn't have to worry about whether or not they can find a pencil or paper to complete their homework. About 90% of the students in the school receive free or reduced rate lunch. Many of them worry about where they will be sleeping that night or if they will eat. I had students unable to complete their homework because they did not have a pencil at home. I want to be able to give my students everything and anything they need; anything that will make their life a little less of a struggle. The leveled books will give all the students an opportunity to have many books to read regardless of what level they are on. This will also give me the opportunity to send books home for my students to read since many of them cannot afford books. The Word Work Station will help my students become better writers. It will expose them to various types of writing skills and techniques. This will open the students' eyes to know that people out there really do care about them. They care about their future and they want them to succeed regardless if they know them or not. My students are so used to having people walk out on them or not caring. This will prove that there are amazing people out there. Any little bit can and will help!
needStatement: My students need the level books to help enhance their reading skills. The word work Activity Station will also help improve their writing skills.

name: Summer Fun!
description: Every day is a new adventure and we are excited to learn new things. I teach Dual Language Spanish, and my students really enjoy developing their Spanish skills. They enjoy reading bilingual and Spanish books, listening to read aloud and using Spanish materials during centers and free time. Unfortunately, we are not provided with Spanish materials to meet the children's needs and further their interest in this language. I teach in a high-poverty urban area and I want my students to have the necessary resources to achieve mastery and be able to graduate on time. I want all my students to be successful and to achieve all their goals. I teach in a great school, but we do not have all the resources to meet all the students' needs. My students are first graders and they are all English Language Learners. They are very sweet and have a great desire to learn. They are always excited about learning new things and moving on to the next grade levels. These books will be sent home over the summer for students to practice the skills they have learned this year. Most of my parents do not have the resources to put their children in summer school, or the technology to be able to use different software to practice these skills, but they have the willingness to help their children succeed. By providing each student with a practice book to take home, they will be able to review skills and strategies learned throughout the school year. When children practice reading, math and other content areas during the summer, they are able to enter the next grade level ready to achieve new goals.
needStatement: My students need books to take home and practice over summer break.

name: Interactive Science Notebooks
description: Students that enter my classroom are bright, young individuals that come from a variety of backgrounds. My school has a very high free lunch rate. Many students in my school struggle to bring a pencil or paper to class. My school houses a garden that students have the chance to work in. I believe every student can be successful. In my classroom students are taught to work hard every day no matter what they are facing in life. I believe that every student is able to overcome and triumph. Many of my students rise to my expectations through their behavior and classwork. As a science teacher, I have always wanted to engage students through science notebooks. Every year I have a huge number (at least half), of my students that are not able to supply a composition notebook, or the students run out of space in their composition notebook. Due to this, science notebooks have not been 100% successful in my class. I would love extra composition notebooks to be able to take science notebooks to the next level in my classroom. Vocabulary plays an important role in the understanding of science concepts. The card stock will be used for vocabulary sheets. In the past, the students vocabulary sheets have not held up well because they were not on card stock. The vocabulary on card stock would work fantastic in the science(composition) notebooks.
needStatement: My students need composition notebooks and cardstock to keep an interactive science notebook in class!

name: Snug On Our Rug
description: Our students come from a variety of different economic backgrounds and 100% of our students receive free lunch. My students speak a multitude of languages including English, Spanish, Hindi, and Arabic. As diverse as our students are economically and culturally, they are diverse in their academics. Despite so many hardships, my students are eager to learn and do their best. They want to be in school because they want to learn all they can so they can be successful one day. My students need a larger rug for comfortable seating during mini-lesson instruction and active learning time.
