Scholars will immediately know where they fit and be able to quickly and comfortably go to their own specific place to start begin out learning. No more fussing over who sits where! The clear colored squares will help the students identify their our space and feel like they have their our place in the classroom to learn. When people have their own place to be, they can relax and begin to feel comfortable experiencing a new culture or way of relating to the world around them. My goal through this project is to encourage my students to settle into their learning environment and take ownership of their learning
needStatement: My students need a larger rug for comfortable seating during mini-lesson instruction and daily activities. I teach 25 Kindergarteners and my current rug is designed for only about 15 young scholars.

name: Learn a Ton, Reading is Fun!
description: I teach in a public preschool classroom in Lewiston, Maine and I work with a very diverse population, with many of my students never experiencing a school-like environment before. My children get super excited to interact with our classroom materials, especially our books. The joy and the excitement that the children have when they interact with classroom books and literacy materials warms my heart. They don't have a lot of access to many of the literacy materials that we have at school, so we want to be able to provide them with a wide variety of materials for them to explore and to foster their love of learning. Many of the children are English Language Learners (ELL) and being able to retell the stories using storytelling kits helps them to understand and connect to the stories. Acting out their favorite stories by using the felt sets gives the children a way to engage and participate in the readings, even if English is not their first language. Having a visual aid, such as these storytelling kits, allows them to have an understanding of what we are saying and talking about when we read. It also allows them to explore the story and act it out with a peer or by themselves. These materials will generate excitement and eagerness to explore books in different ways. This generous donation will allow the children to expand their love of learning.
needStatement: My students need these storytelling kits to help them bring the books to life.

name: If They Build It, They Will Remember It: Magnetic Letters
description: It is my honor and privilege to be able to teach a group of 15 highly motivated, compassionate, and intelligent first grade students in Illinois. My students are very observant and they enjoy interacting with the world around them. In our classroom, we never sit still! I am always trying to get my students up and moving around, singing, or exploring in small groups to make learning engaging. They learn best when they are having fun. I work very hard to provide my students with meaningful experiences on a daily basis. There is nothing I love more in this world than watching the pride on a student's face when they realize for the first time that they can read words. Each day I meet with small groups of students to work on their individual learning needs. During this time we work with words, practice reading fluently, and discuss what they are reading. Your donation of magnetic letters and boards will help beginning readers make connections to reading and writing. The magnetic letters on the white boards will help them practice their alphabet, letter sounds, word families and sight words. By working with words on a daily basis I have no doubt that all of my students will become fluent readers.
needStatement: My students need magnetic letters and dry erase boards to help them practice word patterns during small group time.

name: Chromebooks for Classroom
description: I teach Special Education and work primarily with students who have emotional and behavioral disorders. While my students present some challenges here and there, they are awesome kids. We are in need of some supplies to help these students be successful academically and also to help them learn to self-regulate when they are upset. These kids are truly a joy to work with and I wouldn't trade them for anything! I look forward to some new things in our classroom to help them be the best they can be!We are moving into a digital world at a very rapid pace. In order to prepare my students for this, we are working to expose them to technology in the elementary schools. Our district is pursuing 1:1 technology in middle and high schools, but we are left with classroom sets of Chromebooks or iPads in the elementary. General education teachers get these classroom sets, and as a special education teacher, we get to share one set that rotates around on a cart. My students have access to these devices in their classrooms, but are not always able to bring them along to work on assignments or projects when they come to my room. Also, they have small group instruction in my room and we could really use these devices! My students use online curriculum for some extra support and have access to their books online in our reading program. We can use these devices to make the curriculum and activities more accessible for students that may not be as successful with traditional means. My students also work toward reward time to break up their day a bit. It is hard to sit for 6 hours through elementary school! For my students in particular, it is often a struggle to get through a 30 minute small group, and we use many rewards and incentive programs to hold students accountable for behavior and engaged in lessons. These students can use the Chromebooks during their reward times to listen to music, play educational games, or even journal if they would want. Thank you for your support and I am sure my students will be thrilled to have Chromebooks in our classroom!
needStatement: My students need Chromebooks to incorporate digital literacy into our classroom!

name: Let's Soar As High As We Can with a Chromebook!
description: My students LOVE to come to my classroom to learn English! The group of dedicated teachers and aides at our school believe in providing all students with the skills they need to achieve their dreams, even though this is a high-poverty urban school with 95% of students eligible for free lunch. Despite the challenges of living in a lower-socioeconomic urban environment, our students are eager learners because they know they need language skills to communicate effectively in everyday life and in an academic setting to be successful in life in their new country. The challenges of living in a lower-socioeconomic urban environment doesn't stop these wonderful students from striving to learn English as well as doing a lot of catch-up with basic literacy and writing skills. Some of my students are special needs students in addition to being English Language Learners. My fellow colleagues and I try our best to provide a safe and comfortable environment for our students because we know about their often difficult home situations. The students are VERY eager to learn English, and they love the games we play in class. Games? Yes, games! It's easier to learn a language when you're having fun. Some of the games we play are the Flyswatter game (students swat the appropriate picture on the floor when I read the vocabulary word in English), a modified Simon Says game to learn parts of the body, matching games, and competitive games with whiteboards. You, the reader, will notice that none of these games that we play in class involve technology. Unfortunately, we do not have enough Chromebooks or laptops for all of the classrooms, and shared Chromebook carts are not sufficient or easy to access. Our school has embraced the use of Google Classroom and Google Docs, but we need Chromebooks in my classroom to effectively implement Google Classroom lessons and provide access to online ESL teaching sites. An example is text-to-speech websites that allow students to hear text read aloud as they read. It's all about increasing literacy, and another Chromebook would be a fantastic supplement to our regular ESL lessons. Thank you for considering a donation to our project!
needStatement: My students need a Chromebook to allow them to soar beyond the school building while learning English.

name: ALL Kids Get to Read About Their World!
description: I teach an enthusiastic class of 2nd and 3rd graders whose interests are as diverse as they are. Their reading levels are diverse as well, ranging from kindergarten through 6th grade. My students are eager to read about this amazing world in which we live. My school is an urban option school that parents can choose for their children. I have many students with special education needs including learning disabilities, Autism-Spectrum Disorder, Sensory Processing Disorder and ADHD. These special needs can impact their ability to read at grade-level. My students love reading about their world. They especially enjoy reading books about topics that interest them. It can be frustrating for kids who aren't yet reading higher-level texts, however, because they want to be able to read about their interests, too. Our classroom library just doesn't have enough books at the lower levels these kids need. The collection of books I am requesting includes informational books about topics of high interest to 2nd and 3rd graders. While high-interest, the books are at a lower reading level so they can be accessed by all students. My students will use these books during our daily Reading Workshop. The sets will be used for guided reading when the students will receive reading support in a small group from a teacher. The other books will be used during independent reading time so children can read about topics that interest them. Students will gain confidence as readers as they learn about this wondrous world we live in. These nonfiction books will help them be engaged and excited about reading!
needStatement: My students need high-interest low-level nonfiction texts so they can read about their world.

name: Discovery and Critical Thinking Through Technology!
description: As an educator in a low-income school district, I do my very best to expose my students to a world filled with possibilities and opportunities. These young adults worry more about supporting broken families than education. It truly has become a privilege to help open their eyes to a great big world where hard work can afford them a better life. Sadly, as this community is still suffering the damage of Hurricane Sandy, too many of my students' concerns are about having a roof over their heads as opposed to their futures. If I could help, in even the smallest of ways, give them the advantages other students have, this would mean the world to me. Our job as educators is to help better the lives of our students, not just by teaching our content area, but by preparing them for their futures. Without question, my students would benefit immensely from having tablets readily available to them for purposes of research, critical thinking, and discovery. Most of my students do not have access to technology other than the limited resources our school district strives to provide. By giving all of the students who enter my classroom each year the opportunity to learn virtually, you are improving the lives of future generations. Undoubtedly, my students would further excel in areas of writing, research, close-reading, discovery, and independent thinking by having access to the internet during our English class. Being able to speak and write well is a skill that transcends all professions and a big component of our 9th grade curriculum is research. Preparing and composing a research paper is no easy feat and doing so with limited resources is even more difficult. If my students had the capabilities of exploring our virtual world during this unit, it would not only help spark curiosity but also allow them to master writing a research paper. I cannot put into words how special and meaningful it would be to close the technology gap in my classroom. My students are so deserving of this and it would be a humbling honor to be able to share this gift with years of hard working students.
needStatement: My students need tablets in the classroom to better explore literature!

name: Fun Flexible Seating
description: My students are incredible. I could never describe them in one word. They are students that come from low-income families and have a wide range of special needs. These students never let their disability stop them from reaching their goals. They work hard, harder than an average student. We have a lot of fun together and they truly are 'my kids'. They make me want to be a better teacher everyday and I am always looking for ways to help them. Can you imagine being expected to stay focused and learn while sitting in the same chair at the same desk everyday when you are 10, 11, 12 years old?Standing desks, flexible stools, backjacks, these are supplies that my exceptional thinkers need to help them stay focused. It is so hard for my students to stay focused everyday. They want to move and walk around but, unfortunately, in the classroom setting that is not always feasible. I want to change that for my amazing students. These supplies will give them a choice of how they want to learn and what works best for them.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating! The traditional way of sitting in a chair with a desk is not working for my exceptional thinkers. We need flexible seating so that the students that lean better.

name: Floored Over Reading!
description: The school in which I teach is an arts-infused school. I will be teaching 2nd grade in the 2016-17 school year. My students come from a variety of backgrounds. Some of my students have the latest technology at home, while others see the latest technology in the classroom. The students at my school have a love for learning and a great deal of creativity. They are very active, and they are always ready for an opportunity to show their 'colors'. As a teacher at an arts infused school, it allows me to engage and motivate students by emphasizing active learning rather than passive learning. I have found it to be easier to level the playing field for my children so they all have the opportunity to be successful! My students need a rug to gather on when we do read alouds and/or small group lessons. My students will easily move to the rug in an organized fashion and have a specific space to sit when we share read alouds and do small group activities. The students will love having an area to come to when we sit on the floor. I chose a rug with the map of the United States of America because we are always looking at the map to see where places are when we are making connections in stories. Second graders love looking at a map so they can see how far away places are from where we are!!
needStatement: My students need a place to gather as a group for read alouds.

name: Science! Science! Science!
description: Low-income. Homeless. High poverty. These are words that people often use to describe our scholars. However, the words people should concentrate on are: high achievers, determined learners, and creative thinkers. We are scholars who have a hunger to learn, a passion for knowledge, and a need to succeed. We are looking to expand our critical-thinking skills, explore our creativity, and develop our talents for twenty-first century learning. We are looking to develop our gifts and talents and need your help to do so. We are currently reading about science when we should be doing science due to the fact that we are lacking materials for our Science Lab. Learning Science Activity Tubs will allow us to create a space where scholars can use hands on experiences to generate their own conclusions. Since science involves hands on learning, we need materials to support learning. With these kits we will be able to setup hands on rotating stations that scholars will have access to. This will allow for individual exploration and discover. Science is a key tool to the future so it is important we set our scholars up for success with the right experiences and materials.
needStatement: My students need science kits to help explore scientific concepts in our science lab!

name: If They Build It, They Will Learn!
description: We are a classroom with 25 energetic and eager to learn kindergarten students and we find that we are spending a big part of our day looking at screens – a smart board, desktop computers, and tablets – which is awesome, but we want to do more than just sit while we learn. We want to get up and play! We are looking to introduce STEM - based activity into out classroom. Students can balance blocks to build a tall tower, push and pull magnets together and apart, and slide colorful disks together to design magnificent structures. But more importantly, this play will improve our memories, relieve stress, and encourage us to explore and investigate. The STEM based toys we have selected would be utilized in small groups, but would also be engaging for a single student. Students can communicate and collaborate, while developing critical thinking skills, and each will experience a sense of achievement when creating with these materials. Learning is most effective when it engages kids, and what engages kids more than TOYS! STEM toys are designed to nurture curiosity and to develop creativity, problem solving and critical thinking skills and they offer an opportunity to teach Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math in a fun and interactive atmosphere. Please help us to get up and play!
needStatement: My students need a collection of STEM toys for our classroom.

name: Readers' Workshop Immersion Year
description: My fourth graders amaze me every day! My students range in age from 9 to 10 years old. Nine different nationalities are represented in our classroom this year and many of the students are bilingual. In our classroom each student is treated with mutual respect. We learn the importance of patience, kindness, respect, diligence, self-motivation and hard work. My students are a team! We win together, lose together, and work together. Everyone is encouraged to do their best always. My students are excited for their first year using the Readers' Workshop model. Readers' Workshop is a teaching method in which the goal is to teach students how to use strategies for reading and comprehension allowing differentiation to meet the needs of all students. The desk buddies will give the students a place to keep their book bags and Readers' Workshop notebooks. The tote bags will give students a place to keep their books when book shopping or transporting books home for night reading. The wobble cushions will be used to help students who struggle with attention to sit and concentrate during reading. The tape and markers are for creating and hanging anchor charts around the classroom to highlight the skills we learn.
needStatement: My students need Readers' Workshop supplies such as wobble cushions, tote bags, and pocket charts for their immersion year of the program!

name: Scientific Success!
description: I work in an amazing middle school that serves families in Essex County, New Jersey. Our students come from different cities in our area, but they are all driven to succeed and be amazing scholars while they are with us. Our students and families show their commitment each and every day with an extended school day and an overwhelming dedication to homework and school involvement. All of our students show a drive and determination to learn in everything they do. In our science classroom in particular, our students are excited to learn more about the world around them and determined to do their best as they prepare for high school. They are an inspiration and keep me engaged in our classroom and my commitment to help them be their best. My science scholars have started utilizing a new lab station rotation that allows them to explore and learn about life science, physics, and chemistry though team work and self guided exploration. This has been a great addition to our current curriculum and labs, but we need some materials to make it work. Supplying our scholars with opportunities to work independently and in small groups has been vital to preparing them for high school. With some additional organization materials for our lab stations, we will have laminated task cards to use for years as we read and assess our knowledge in science. We will have readings and station directions stored in sheet protectors that we can use endlessly. We will also have an entire years worth of material that will help our students prepare for the NJASK and an opportunity to showcase four years worth of knowledge and highlight all of their hard work.
needStatement: My students need sheet protectors, lamination pouches, binder rings, and copy paper to organize our science stations.

name: Getting Moving in PE
description: Our kids are smart, bright, funny and an energetic group of kids who love to be active. They are from a small rural town in South Alabama. They love playing anything inside or out. Many come from hard working families as well as low income ones. They are some of the most respectful kids I have ever meet. I wouldn't want to leave this school for anything. I try to give them the best but without people like yourself that's not always possible. Our students love to play at PE. We would like to use an iPad to play and download the newest music for them to listen to while they are doing various activities. It would be a great motivator for the students to get moving if they were able to listen to the latest kids bop CDs while getting their exercising done. When you go to the gym you can look around and see just about everyone working out has headphones. If the students get more activity while at PE they would be able to sit and pay attention in class throughout the day.
needStatement: My students need an iPad for PE to listen to music while playing.

name: Charged and Ready for Success!
description: My first grade students come from a wide range of backgrounds. Regardless of their socioeconomic status or home language, all are curious and eager to learn. They thrive with hands on activities, cooperative learning, and small group support. I strive to create a learning environment in which students can thrive, learn, and grow. Historically, the young students at our school have performed below their peers in the district in their reading and writing abilities. I want them to be on par with their peers when they reach middle school and to be competitive and active participants in our community. As 21st Century learners, my first grade students thrive with the use of technology. We recently received 10 iPads from our school district. We now need headphones and a charging station for the iPads so that we can get the most use out of them. My students love to use the iPads to work on their reading, record videos, and do research. The headphones will allow my first graders to get the most out of the iPads with their independent work. They will be able to work side by side without distracting one another. The charging station will ensure that our iPads are always charged and ready for learning. They will keep our technology organized and allow easy access for the students.
needStatement: My students need headphones and a charging station for our new classroom iPads.

name: View, Interact and Learn!
description: Our school mission is to build a respectful, successful learning community through art-centered and technology-enhanced practices that develop intelligent behaviors in all students. Our elementary school is a creative arts magnet school in an urban district that uses interdisciplinary teaching and daily arts instruction to positively affect all students in the school through hands-on, interactive learning experiences. In our overall school population, 81% of our students qualify for free/reduced lunch. Our 5th grade classroom has students from diverse backgrounds and experiences who are bused to our school from all over the city. The students are highly motivated to learn but they have a wide range of learning needs. In our classroom, we have 30 students of which 41 % are English language learners from El Salvador, Mexico, Ethiopia, Somalia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Additionally, 6% of the students have IEP’s (individualized educational plans) because of identified learning difficulties. My school has many diverse learners and interactive learning with a whiteboard system will help all students achieve success.I am requesting an interactive white board system, document camera, document stand and digital pens to more fully integrate technology into the preparation, presentation and use of teaching materials Research shows that students learn best when they are fully engaged. The use of a document camera and an interactive white board system allows the teacher and students to access a wide array of curriculum resources, project digital content to a screen and then interact with it. This type of multi-sensory, hands-on, collaborative learning is a great way to encourage student engagement. Some of the ways we will use these technology resources include collaborative problem solving, multimedia presentations, and showcasing student work. This project will benefit all the students in my classes and will help me meet the individual needs of my students by using technology to address different learning styles and encouraging active learning.
needStatement: My students need an interactive white board system to fully engage in their learning.

name: Cold, Clean, Filtered and Green: Water Bottle Filler Fountains!
description: Recently, three students, Azriel, Madeline, and Deiny approached me from the School Wellness Council proposing we raise money to get new water fountains in our building. Water is something many people take for granted in day to day life. However at our school, water is a common complaint amongst our students. Many of our students opt to not drink any water during the day rather than drink the warm tinted water that comes from our water fountains. The students at our school come from low-income homes making it hard to fund projects like this even though new water fountains would greatly help all of the students and staff in our school. The students have classes such as Physical Education that involve physical activity and staying hydrated is important. The students at our school spend all day working to ensure that they pass their classes and have a future, yet they are unable to have access to clean none the less cold water. Hydration is essential to life. Sadly, our students don't take the time or have the desire to properly hydrate themselves during school. The reason is simple. Bad water. The students hate drinking the dirty, warm water that our school water fountains provide. The students will have a better understanding of how important water is to their learning and health if they had cold, clean, filtered water at their disposal on a daily basis. The water bottle filler fountains also provide a green, waste free option which will help the environment in which the students live. Understanding how important it is to drink clean water and how important it is to save water, will give our students a better understanding of how they can help others who are in need of clean water and ways they can conserve and waste less. We are trying to get three cold filtered water bottle stations (one on each floor of our school) installed at our school. As members of the School Wellness Council our responsibility is to find ways to make our school and community healthier. Drinking clean, filtered, cold water throughout the school day is one way we want to help our community and school. Plus the water stations are waste free and thus saves our environment in the process. We are planning on selling water bottles for the Parent Teacher Student Association that will help raise funds for the PTSA. We will be responsible for collecting the money and promoting the use of the water bottles in the new water stations. We will also be educating our peers in the importance of staying hydrated throughout the school day. This information will be created and given during a school wide event by us students in the School Wellness Council. We believe that since our peers don't drink the school's water they instead are either drinking the 'sugar' free sodas provided in our school's vending machines or they are drinking nothing at all during the entire school day. We believe that providing water bottle stations that produce clean, filtered, cold water will increase the amount of water our peers will drink. This will keep them healthier and also provides them with a FREE drink option that is better and healthier than what the vending machines provide.
needStatement: We need clean, filtered, cold drinking water in our school that is easy to access and fills water bottles.

name: Writing The Art Form!
description: My students are from all over our city in New Jersey. Around 85% of our students are African-American, and the remainder is Hispanic and Caucasian. One hundred percent of our students receive free or reduced-price lunch. I teach students who are currently in the 7th and 8th grade but reading at a 3rd-grade level. They love to learn but hate to read. They are often frustrated by our lack of available resources such as books, laptops, projectors, sometimes even supplies. Even though they have these challenges, they still strive for excellence inside and outside the classroom. Writing should be a fun experience for students. Students will take more ownership if they have their composition notebook. Students can personalize them and make them their own. Our 21st Century learners communicate in text talk and short phrases. Our writer's notebook will help students to become effective communicators. Students will learn that writing is a continuous process. Our young writers will be able to take their notebooks with them to jot their ideas down. Their thoughts can be saved and continued throughout the day. Writing becomes a way of expression that will help our learners become greater communicators and life-long learners.
needStatement: My students need notebooks to write things down and show their writing creativity.

name: Love Trumps Hate: Embracing Our Diversity Through Literature
description: My three dozen spunky fifth graders are a diverse group of young scholars with a wide range of interests. They are motivated to succeed and eager to learn about the world around them. Despite the negativity they may hear, my students embrace their diverse backgrounds and see their cultural heritages as strengths. They are eager to learn more about role models and heroes that reflect their backgrounds. We are a title 1 school in eastern Las Vegas. Our classroom welcomes a plethora of different types of learners and embraces all.I am requesting thirty five books that celebrate African American and Latino cultures. I am requesting books that celebrate scientists and female pioneers. I am also requesting books to inspire and empower my diverse student learners. By filling our classroom with books featuring role models from all backgrounds, I want to inspire the next round of scientists, doctors, architects, lawyers, artists, humanitarians, and thinkers. My students are diverse and need literature that celebrates their backgrounds. While the current political climate may send messages of prejudice, my classroom will display the opposite. All my students, regardless of race or cultural background, are accepted and challenged to succeed. Help me fill my library with books that celebrate our differences.
needStatement: My students need books to represent their backgrounds.

name: Playing Games with Their Minds
description: Our school is diverse urban school. Our students come from a variety of different economic backgrounds with a large percentage of our students receiving free breakfast and lunch. We are an ethnically diverse school with language barriers as diverse as our varied backgrounds. Students are offered after school sports teams but many students need an outlet or club to be apart of to keep them busy after school. My classroom hosts a games club to get students to interact and participate after school in a safe, fun way that allows them to make friends and gives them a place to spend quality time after school. Their interactions allow them to work on problem solving skills and peer relationships. I have purchased games and my colleagues and friends have donated games but many are in less than good shape. Also, I can always use more games so kids are not waiting for games to play and losing interest in being here. I have students currently come after school to play games as a way to provide a safe and educational experience. Many students go home to empty houses or rarely get to experience the fun of working with peers on a game or puzzle and lose the social skills involved with such activities. Giving kids a place to fit in and have fun with peers is important in helping them shape and develop social skills, as well as provide a safe place to do such things. Offering an after school club such as this opens the possibility to every student in the school (over 700 students!) to have a place to go after school and become involved in a positive thing. Hopefully with newer and different games I can entice the kids to stay involved and bring more to join us!
needStatement: My students need games and activities that are fun and thought provoking for an after school club that allows them a place to stay and interact with peers that is safe and educational.

name: Urban Montessori Discovers North Woods
description: My students are a diverse group of thinkers and learners who come together in the spirit of learning. We are a public, urban Montessori middle school, and, as a school that opened three years ago, we are still emerging and growing as a community. We are located in a historically diverse and low-income community. 77% of our students receive free and reduced price lunch. As a Montessori school and strive to provide our students with a variety of experiences outside the classroom. Our students thrive from experiences outside our building, immersing themselves in the community and the natural world. Parkway Montessori Middle School is focused on educating the whole child and immersing our children in the natural world. We are raising funds so that ALL our 6th grade students are able to fully participate in a three day field study at the Audubon Center in Sandstone, MN in March 2017. This field trip experience would offer our urban students a unique opportunity to discover the world outside of the city. As part of this experience, our students and staff will focus on stewardship, community building, and reflection. The field study will include a variety of courses from the Audubon Center, such as the Ojibwe Hike, Maple Syruping, Voyageurs and Fur Trade, as well as offering our students the opportunity to develop and strengthen their commitment to our core values (peace, community, learning, hard work, respect, and service). Maria Montessori said, “Scientific observation then has established that education is not what the teacher gives; education is a natural process spontaneously carried out by the human individual, and is acquired not by listening to words but by experiences upon the environment.” Our philosophy of education strives to embody this principle, providing our students the opportunity to drive their own learning and explore the world around them. We can only provide this amazing opportunity if we raise the funds. Thank you for your commitment to our youth! After donating, please help spread the word to family and friends.
needStatement: My students need busses to get to the Audubon Center of the North Woods for a three day wilderness experience.

name: Fidgety Feet: Keep Them Busy And Their Minds Focused
description: Every morning my students walk in full of life, asking questions, and ready to learn! They have come such a long way with staying focused and gaining the confidence they need to keep striving for the stars everyday! I work at a Title 1 school here in Lehigh Acres, FL where 100 percent of our students receive free breakfast and lunch daily. I want my students to know that no matter how hard something may seem to accomplish, it's never impossible! My students are ESE, very active, and sometimes struggle with staying focused on tasks. They often are tapping their feet, wiggling in their seats, and have a hard time sitting still. These Bouncy Bands will help them a great deal by channeling their energy appropriately and helping them remain focused on their academics. We strive everyday to do our very best and have come such a long way! This extra assistance will help them shine just a bit brighter! Although somethings are harder to achieve, that doesn't make it impossible, that makes it all that much sweeter when we reach our goals!
needStatement: My students need an outlet to help them stay focused while seated. These Bouncy Bands attach to their chairs/desks and will assist in keeping their busy feet occupied and their mind focused!

name: Can You Hear the Story?
description: My students are young and eager to learn! All of my students come from low-income households in a high poverty community. Their home lives are broken and battered yet these children come in the classroom every morning smiling and willing to start a fresh day of learning. We have 30 kids in our room because of overpopulation in our school, therefore creating a co-teach. Most of our students are performing below-level in due to the fact that many of them did not have any prior preschool experience before entering kindergarten. These kids love to be in the classroom and enjoy coming to school learn new things. Even with all of the chaos in their young lives, being bounced around from family member to family member, being raised in a single parent household, or even being raised by a grandparent without a mother or father figure, these students still want a chance to learn new things and become someone important to society. Listening to reading is an essential rotation in daily 5 reading centers, however we do not have the resources or funds to purchase one for every kindergarten classroom. Giving our students a listening center will not only enhance their education, but support their love for reading and support their future education. A listening center is not only great for building on the students reading, but also building their listening stamina. We could really use the help in our classroom and utilize a listening center to support our students over all experience in literacy. We are trying to build great readers so that we can create a bright and educated next generation.
needStatement: My students need a listening center for our daily 5 reading rotations.

name: The Missing Piece to Our Math Center!
description: Our kindergarten program consists of a full day schedule with an emphasis on rigorous academic instruction along with age appropriate activities to encourage personal growth and development. The students come from diverse backgrounds and speak a variety of languages. Every student is valued for their unique strengths, culture, and learning style. Kindergarteners are naturally inquisitive about their world. In our integrated curriculum, science, math, art, and literacy are combined during active learning opportunities to provide experiences that are real and relevant to the students. Our classroom is full of learning opportunities! The puzzles, dice, magna tiles, and game will help enhance the math center to provide students with materials for independent practice. The materials will help kindergarteners learn to count, compare, learn shapes and problem solve in engaging learning opportunities. They will have the flexibility to work independently or in small groups. These materials will make the math center more inviting for students so they are excited to learn! Your generous donation will not only help students to meet kindergarten math standards, but also help to develop a love and passion for learning! Independent practice helps students to be accountable and responsible for their own learning. Good work habits will follow students across grade levels and subject areas!
needStatement: My students need math manipulatives and puzzles to enhance the math curriculum. They need fun games and center activities to independently practice math concepts taught in class.

name: Project Seat Sacks - Take 2
description: I am a general education 3rd grade teacher. I have students of all ability levels in my classroom. I usually have students with learning disabilities in my classroom as well, which is why I recently went back to school to get my Master's Degree in Inclusive Education (usually known as 'special ed.'). I spend countless hours (and money) making my classroom accessible for all types of learners. I am continuing to further my education, and am currently working towards my second Masters Degree in Technology in the Classroom. This year I have a wonderful class of 23 third-graders. They are such a hard-working group of students, and I love providing them with new and exciting things in the classroom. I was hooked on DonorsChoose.org after hearing about it over the summer, and just completed our first project! My project of 'Project Spacious Carpet' was fulfilled, and my third graders are now enjoying a nice, new carpet! An important skill for my third graders to learn is organization. For that reason, I am fundraising to raise money towards seat organizers, called 'Seat Sacks,' for the back of their chairs. In these, I plan on having students store their library books and morning journals that are used every day. The 'Seat Sacks' are color-coded to match the color table students belong to. These colors are also featured on our new classroom carpet to indicate where students can sit. As you can tell, I am a bit obsessive about ORGANIZATION! I tried this project before and did not reach the goal. I am trying it out again, and hoping it works better the second time around!
needStatement: My students need twelve Seat Sacks for the backs of their chairs to help them stay organized!

name: Graphic Novels for All Readers
description: My second graders have learned to work cooperatively within our classroom community and be engaged in their own learning. They are excited to begin a new book, or to begin writing a new story. They are learning to be excited about their education. Each day provides rich, new experiences. Our school is home to a very diverse community of young students. We are a Title I campus, meaning most of our population is from low socioeconomic households. Some of our students do not have books at home to read, and beg me on a daily basis to borrow our classroom books because they are so eager to learn and start an adventure in a new book. Of course, I encourage these exploring young readers to read as much as possible. Having the necessary materials and furniture in my classroom is essential to continuing to create this academic growth in each of my students. Our school is a small, but wonderfully close community of supportive teachers and students who help foster a true love of learning and educational curiosity.I have so many students who are reluctant to read, until I place a graphic novel in their hand! So many students don't know the world of graphic novels and sadly we would have so many more eager readers in our schools if we had more graphic novels. More graphic novels in our classrooms will create more excited readers in our classrooms! With this donation for TOON books in our room, my students can have the opportunity to explore new and different reading options. Books open the imagination and creativity of our youth and more graphic novels in our classroom can be the next open door!
needStatement: My students need more graphic novels in our classroom library to reach a more diverse set of interests.

name: Marvelous Math (and More!)
description: My seventeen second graders are avid readers, writers, and mathematicians! We have a wide range of abilities and interests in class. My students are full of curiosity and energy. They love to learn, explore new topics, and have fun while doing it! My students follow their own ambitions and interests, take ownership of their learning growth, and share that excitement with other students. They come in each day with a smile on their face and your contribution to this project will make their smiles even bigger!Adding new materials to our classroom will provide my students with more options and opportunities to grow. These resources will allow my students to explore math concepts (time and measurement), learning habits, and more! Students will use the slap bracelet watches to learn how to tell time and the retractable measuring tables to measure various objects around the room in different units of length. Lastly, the write-and-wipe folders and erasers will help provide materials for centers and games within the classroom. Donations to this project will improve our classroom by providing students with a wide variety of materials to learn and grow from!
needStatement: My students need 10 watches, 24 retractable measuring tapes, 24 whiteboard erasers, 10 write & wipe pockets, 1 gallon of blue paint, 1 pencil sharpener and band-aids!

name: Paw Prints on Our Hearts: A Student-Run Philanthropic Store
description: How can we help our students grow up to be positive role models for our world? It's easier than most people think. It's all about philanthropy! My fourth-grade students have been making a positive difference in the lives of stray animals and police dogs in their community. Currently, they are in the process of opening up their second philanthropic business in our classroom to help animals. They are working tirelessly to make a positive difference in the world. My school is located in a high poverty area, but that does not stop them from helping animals in need. My caring students are opening up another philanthropic store in our classroom to help the MCSPCA and the Monmouth County Sheriff's K-9 Unit. They named their business Paw Prints on Our Heart and their slogan is Shop to Adopt and Help the K-9 Crew! My fourth-grade entrepreneurs need dog and cat items for the pet section of their charitable store. Students will be advertising the pet items for sale. They will also decide on how to price all pet merchandise. Students will work together to set up the pet section of their business and will keep track of their inventory. Receiving donations for their store will enable students to understand real life economics. Students will price their merchandise according to supply and anticipated demand. They will also reinforce the crucial skills of counting money and understanding the value of a dollar. The best part of this is that they will be working collaboratively to reinforce these skills while giving back to their community. My students are very committed to this project. Once reluctant writers are now eager to create advertisements and commercials for their business. Students have given up their recess time to create informational posters for Paw Prints on Our Hearts. The collaboration in my class has grown ten-fold since September. It is a beautiful thing to see kids giving back to their community. Please help my incredible class save animals!
needStatement: My students need pet supplies for the pet section of their philanthropic store, Paw Prints on Our Heart.

name: TOONing Into Reading!
description: My students are eager to learn daily despite the fact that most of them come to school with little or no school supplies. I focus on providing a fun and creative learning environment. I teach at a Title I school where 100 percent of my students receive free breakfast and lunch daily. My students are Regular Education and English as a Second Language Learners. Most of my students live in single parent homes. I know I can not change the struggles they face at home, but I can make sure their lives at school are positive, exciting and rewarding. Having this TOON Graphic Book Set will allow my students an opportunity to read different types of books. These books can be used for different reading levels. TOON books use language that is reading level appropriate for my students to understand. Falling in love with graphics is the new learning. Having fun and exciting pictures will grab my students attention while reading. Using these graphic comic books will introduce my students to different genres, artwork and original stories. Most of my students have never read a comic book but having these TOON Graphic Books in our library will help them broaden their reading experience.
needStatement: My students need 14 Prize-Winning TOON Books to enhance the reading experience.

name: Reading About Science and Animals Is Exciting!
description: Ours is an urban elementary school in St Paul. We are a neighborhood school serving mainstream students as well as many bilingual students who are learning English. Some of our students have recently arrived in the United States and did not have an opportunity to attend school. About 86% of our students receive free and reduced-price lunches. My students love to play together, and they love to learn together. They are a caring community. Playing together at recess helps them learn to cooperate and gives them opportunities to be caring. This year I am engaging the families of my first graders through home visits and academic parent-teacher teams. The families of my students are excited about helping their beginning readers by reading books at home and helping them develop a deeper understanding of the book by talking about the books they read at home. In my class, I have students who are new to the United States and are learning to speak English as well as learning to read in English. They need interesting books at a beginning reading level to take home to read with their families. While learning to read, they also need to be introduced to the content of our first-grade science standards. First graders are very interested in science. They especially like reading about animals. Your support of this project will help our first graders to become readers and thinkers, and help our families to become involved in and supportive of their students' learning.
needStatement: My students need 36 science and animal adventure books to read at school and at home with their parents.

name: Blossoming Writers Need Chromebooks!
description: My third graders are motivated, hard-working, and inquisitive students who really love solving tough problems and exploring new technologies. Many of them are English language learners who come from low-income families. My wonderful bilingual and biliterate students would love a chance to expand their minds! My students are avid readers and writers in both English and Spanish. My students have not only the opportunity, but also the capability to learn in more than one language. Some of my students are learning Spanish for the first time in my classroom! I am lucky to have very supportive parents in my class. They love to dedicate time to their student's studies. However, some parents are unable to provide all of the school supplies that their child needs. This year, our goal is to help deepen their writing pieces. As my students write in both English and Spanish, they have half the amount of time to work on two different pieces of writing. Allowing my students to write on Google Docs facilitates the ability to provide instant and relevant feedback on their writing. My students are currently working on writing literary essays where they create claims on what the lesson is in the books they've read. Although I start our writing periods with a lesson, not all of my students are benefiting from the same lesson at the same time. Right now, I have 6 Chromebooks that my 32 students have to share. My students who have difficulties writing with pencils, as well as focusing on their writing are usually using the Chromebooks during writing time. Since using Google Docs, their writing pieces have flourished. I would love for more of my students to have this support with extra Chromebooks!
needStatement: My students need 3 Chromebooks in order for them to work on their writing digitally, allowing me to provide real-time feedback.

name: We Grow, Root to the Fruit
description: My students walk into our classroom every day full of life, ready to learn, and excited for what is in store for them that day. I say, 'All Stars' and they clap in reply, 'We are!' I want them to know I believe in them and they can do anything. I teach at a Title I school in Northern California where 100 percent of our students receive free breakfast and lunch. Many of my students receive backpack food on the weekend, and our school also runs a food pantry for our families. Despite so many hardships, my students are eager to learn and do their best. They want to be in school because they want to learn all they can so they can be successful one day. The resources that I am requesting will help my students to grow not just a flower garden to improve the look of the campus, but a vegetable/herb garden that will help to provide healthy foods. The garden will teach the students where their food comes from. How to take care of nature and it will also teach them self-sufficiency and responsibility. This garden will teach the students how they are able to help others as well. By making donations to our project, donors can help a new generation of students discover the value of the earth and their community. The donations will help us to purchase supplies, and equipment that will ensure our projects success. Some of these supplies are a plant light to help our seeds grow as well as the seeds themselves. Tools to be able to investigate the growth of the plants as well as the interactions between the plants and animals of the garden. Our garden study will be using Science and Technology, as well as art to track our growing garden. These tools will help bring a better understanding of the importance of growing and choosing healthy food all while keeping the planet healthy. The impact that this project will have on the students is immeasurable. They will learn how to be responsible for something other than self, as well as learning to prepare for the future. Give a man an apple he eats today, show him how to garden he eats for life.
needStatement: My students need growing supplies including a plant light house and butterfly kit to nurture our plants from seedlings to maturity.

name: Help My Students Become Life-Long Readers!
description: I work with a diverse group of 4th and 5th graders. They are curious and determined to be global citizens. My students are passionate about learning about the world around them. We are small urban school serving approximately 320 students in grades PreK through 5. The school has been part of the community for 125 years. Our families are dedicated to the success of their child, former students now teach at our school or send their children and grandchildren to learn in the same community they did. TOON Books is the world's premier graphic literature publisher, and they believe that making meaning out of reading with the aid of visuals may be the best way to become a lifelong reader. With these books, TOON aims to introduce more children to the pleasure of comics while supporting teachers with effective teaching tools to promote visual literacy. My students are struggling readers, with various disabilities, who benefit from books with lots of visuals to engage and motivate them to become life-long readers. I am a third-year teacher and have been slowly building my classroom library by bringing in various graphic novels and high-interest books for low readers. I have seen students who went from never picking up a book to never putting down a book. I am excited to expand my library with even more graphic literature to continue encouraging my students to love reading.
needStatement: My students need more TOON graphic literature books to motivate them to become life-long readers.

name: 'A' Bass Bar a Day...Keeps My Students at Play!
description: My students love to perform music on instruments, especially barred instruments like xylophones, metallophones, glockenspiels and bass bars. We just don't have enough. Physical playing time is reduced, and student learning is limited. My students learn best through singing, movement, speech, creating and performing on instruments so increasing the amount of instruments will increase student learning and understanding.I teach 600 students in grades K-5, and they come to me for 45 minutes once a week. My school is a Title I school in a military town. Military families many times will move away due to orders or deployments, but often return 1 to 3 years later. Students at my school are eager to learn and are most excited about performing on instruments and creating and performing their own compositions.I use a variety of approaches to teach concepts in my classroom, however, the majority of my classes are taught through the Orff approach. Students learn through exploration and creating. With this additional barred instrument, students will be able to contribute to the creation and/or performance of a piece of music and help to accompany other students who are singing or performing on other instruments. Currently, our classroom only has three out of seven bass bars. Because of this, the bass bars do not get utilized as much as they should. While adding one more instrument may seem insignificant, having one more Orff instrument (bass bar) will allow more students to participate in an activity. This will reduce time and the number of groups switching out on instruments. An additional instrument will impact students by allowing them more learning opportunities and more time to appreciate those opportunities.
needStatement: My students need a xylophone bass bar to help complete this instrument set. Currently, our classroom only has 3 out of the 7 of the necessary bars.

name: Math Is Fun
description: I teach at a Title I school. We have a very diverse and enthusiastic student body that participates in the free breakfast program. At our school we encourage our students to follow the R.O.A.R of being respectful, open-minded, accountable, and responsible. We strive to help our students reach their full potential. Our school has a high ELL population. Having lots of hands-on and visual materials is essential to their learning. For many of our students, kindergarten is their first experience with school. It's essential that we build a strong educational foundation from the start. When we believe in them, they believe in themselves!Ten frames will allow my students to practice addition and subtraction skills. They will be able to manipulate the two-sided colored chips to come up with various number equations. The beehive game will provide the students with a visual to help them understand the process of subtraction. They will have fun putting bees into the hive and taking them out. The self-check cards will assist them in their independent learning. Sorting jars will allow the students a number of opportunities to compare and contrast various objects in different shapes, sizes, and colors. All of these material will help to make our math centers fun and engaging. Your generosity will help to make a big difference in the educational experience of my students. Thank you for considering our project.
needStatement: My students need sorting jars, ten frames, and a subtraction game for their math center.

name: Attention Dr. Seuss Lovers!
description: Hello and greetings. I teach at a Title I school in South Carolina. Our current school demographics qualifies the school for 100 free breakfast and lunch. A few of my students receive backpack buddies filled with food to assist them over the weekend. The school is located in a area of South Carolina that is very rural. Furthermore, our county is currently in the process of building a new library that will better accommodate not only our students but our community. Despite many difficulties the students are very excited about learning and are very well behaved students. The students are eager to read and are constantly wanting me to sit and listen to them read. However, many struggle with basic sight words. I have found the students really enjoy reading or trying to read the Dr. Seuss books, which are full of sight words. The classroom has a great selection of leveled books. However, we have very few book options that are fun enjoyable books. Therefore, it is hard to teach the joy of reading when most of the books are for educational teaching purposes. I feel very strongly about trying to get good books in the hands of our students. I have always been a big fan of Dr. Seuss. However, I have only had a few copies of his books for my class. My students share my passion for Dr. Seuss and I would like to provide them with their own copies to use during the year. This will help them with their sight words and their reading fluency. I have found that the class has really taken to the Dr. Seuss books. They wait very patiently for what few Dr. Seuss books I have to make there way around to their own personal book basket. My project is to add to their classroom library so that they can continue to read great books that appeal to them.
needStatement: My students need to be exposed to Dr. Seuss books that have sight words and that are fun to read.

name: Art Captures the Heart and Feeds the Soul!
description: My students are bright, engaging, young minds. Our school is an urban, inner city, Title 1 school. My students come from an array of incredibly diverse backgrounds. They are socio-economically, religiously, culturally, and racially very diverse. As an example we have 22 languages spoken in our school. These kids come together every day to share their thinking and lives with each other. They are wonderful readers and thinkers. I am excited for them to grow up to be the next generation of adults. My students will use these materials for our printmaking unit for Art. Printmaking teaches students valuable skills that can be applied to many other areas. Students learn problem solving skills in how to create an image with limited colors. They have to plan their ideas fully before engaging in the process. Also, they will use materials that are truly unique and new to them. This process forces them to work 'backwards' to develop their image. It is very challenging and I have witnessed first hand the light bulb moment when they truly understand the process. You see a flash in their eye with an almost immediate, 'I get it now!' response. Your help will ensure that these students get what they need to become better artists and become more well-rounded. These materials and projects are experiences that these students will remember for the rest of their lives. Most (if not all) students will have never used brayers, gelli plates, or scratch foam to create these unique pieces of art. These unique materials open up a whole new world of art to students. Please help us to make this a reality for my students and me.
needStatement: My students need materials for printmaking, including brayers, gelli plates, and scratch foam.

name: Mystery Books are Fun and Exciting!
description: Every morning after the Pledge of Allegiance we recite: Never give up-perseverance, Encourage others and Do your best! Our school has the highest rate of free/reduced lunch and the lowest performing students in our school district. My students live in the oldest part of the city which is the most economical area to reside in our area. Books are often missing from these homes so students check out classroom books to read at home each night to increase their reading skillsOur school uses the Lucy Calkins Reading Workshop Model to teach reading. This year a mystery unit was published. My lower performing students were unable to participate on their own during reading because we do not have mystery books at their level. We need mystery books at lower levels to read successfully on their own. The donations from this project will aid struggling readers in third grade by allowing these students to enjoy mystery reading independently. My students will be able to practice reading (like their higher achieving peers) which will boost their confidence and ultimately their love of reading. It will also encourage their independence as they will not have to rely on their teacher or technology to read to them.
needStatement: My students need mystery books at lower levels to read successfully on their own.

name: Digital Literacy for Kindergarten Students
description: Kindergarten is a magical place where our youngest learners develop the foundational skills needed for future grades. They come in excited and eager to learn. My 25 students come from diverse home environments and I want to provide them with a comfortable, safe, and innovative school environment. My Kindergarten students have a variety of learning needs and come to school at different academic abilities, so it is important that I differentiate for them. I want to provide a learning space that allows me to meet the individual needs of my diverse learners. With an increased student to iPad ratio, my students will be able to choose how they wish to demonstrate their learning through the uses of different media, such as video, text, images, and audio. Worldwide competition for employment means that today’s students must not only be well-educated and creative problem solvers, but that they must be equipped to collaborate globally as well. Some of the specific activities that will take place in my classroom involve using iPads to dictate writing, creating math videos using SeeSaw learning journal, and recording informational videos using Chatterpix. The addition of modern technology to the classroom for students in such a developmental stage will set the tone for success and equip them with the tools to thrive in a quickly progressing educational and technological world.
needStatement: My students need iPads to learn how to become digitally literate in today's world.

name: Outlets for Their Energy
description: My students are from an extremely low socio-economic and isolate tiny town with no available extra-curricular activities and no exposure or access to the world beyond their dead-end environment. Some of them have never been outside the town to see a movie in a theater. The staff is constantly looking for ways to show them that there is something better out there for them if they can focus on their studies, they can break this cycle. As expected, in this impoverished town and tiny district, there are no funds to support anything. The energy that my students have can sometimes interfere with their ability to focus on me and their independent work. I have found great success with substituting the standard desk chair with an exercise ball. This gives them the ability to wiggle around while still paying attention to the task at hand. I have a few that I picked up here and there when I could find a bargain but am desperate to expand my collection on the teeny tiny budget I'm working with. These high-quality pilates/yoga balls are exactly what they need. Thank you so much for considering this project.
needStatement: My students need energy outlets to focus while seated at their desks, and these exercise balls fit the bill!

name: Carpet Squares for Character Sessions!
description: In our school, we have a diverse group of students from a variety of backgrounds and needs. My students range from Kindergarten to 4th grade and are a great bunch of kids! They come to see me to develop and enhance their social and emotional skills either through individual or small group sessions, as well as entire classes coming in for character education lessons. While they sometimes need prompting and reminders of the steps necessary to make good choices or feel better, they are all kind, motivated, and eager to please! I love my job and helping these kids be the best versions of themselves every day is so incredibly rewarding!I see students from all grades (K-4) in my classroom every single day. They come in for individual, small group, and large group sessions to develop their social and emotional skills. Additionally, starting in March, I will be hosting entire Kindergarten classes for Character Education lessons to help them build upon foundational inter-personal skills. It is imperative to their social/emotional growth that they are taught in a variety of ways so that they can make connections to the content. Activities such as videos and songs, interactive Smartboard lessons, games, and 'think, turn, talk' moments are just some of the ways I engage my students. I do not have enough table space or chairs so having these carpet squares would be the perfect way for them to have their own place to sit. They will provide comfort, as they will not have to sit directly on the ground, and flexibility, as they can be moved all around the room depending on the activity. My students and I thank you for your consideration and are eager to share an update, should our project be funded! Thank you in advance for helping to provide us with comfort while we do character education!
needStatement: My students need 1 set of carpet squares for when they come to my classroom for their Character Education lessons. These squares will minimize the clutter chairs will create and be movable for activity variety!

name: Pictures are Worth a 1,000 Words
description: At a school where over 90% of students qualify for free or reduced lunch and the community consists of people who are mostly retired or receive government assistance, how do we show students that learning is worth their time? What if we added that the percentage of students with learning disabilities is greater than the state average? These are just some of the difficulties 7th grade students face in a low income area in Georgia. So how do we motivate struggling learners to read? How about by showing then that reading takes place in many different forms. provide a student who struggles with word decoding audio to read along with and they are supported to learn new words and fall in love with a new story. For those visual learners, introduce them to a graphic novel! Many struggling readers feel like novels are inaccessible to them because of the length, vocabulary level, or they have a hard time comprehending what is going on in the story. Graphic Novels allow struggling readers access to novels. By providing students with images to go along with the words they will be more willing to choose a book with a longer story, face challenging vocabulary and keep reading to the end! The visual aids that Graphic Novels provide give students visual clues that aid in the understanding of the story and can help students infer ideas they might not have if there were not images.
needStatement: My students need more access to Graphic Novels in their classroom library.

name: A Place to Plant Creative Thoughts
description: Where do I begin to describe the heroes I teach and learn from every day? Almost 20 years ago, I became one of the luckiest people on Earth when I began my teaching career as an English Language (EL) teacher at a school in St. Paul, Minnesota. This school is not only unique in my district, but it is unique in the nation as it serves an all-immigrant and refugee population of learners ages 14-20. They come from over 30 different countries, and they represent different religions, races, cultures, and experiences. They are truly heroes in my eyes, as they have lived lives most of us could never imagine. They have come to America for one reason or another, but most often it is for reasons of war, displacement, gang warfare, poverty, lack of opportunities in education, no freedom, and they seek asylum, refuge, a sanctuary. They ask for little but give so much. What these students bring with them are their gifts that I always strive to recognize, validate, and celebrate. We create a community in our classroom and each member plays a valuable role, each distinct yet united. They complete me. We're almost there! My students, who never ask for anything, were so fortunate to receive tables for our classroom and now we just need the chairs. They are grateful for everything they get, so to have a classroom that feels welcoming and comfortable, means increased creativity and motivation. Chairs will get us to the finish line. As a writing teacher, I know the difference that seating can make for effective and focused writing. These chairs will serve hundreds over many years to come. Thank you for your consideration in helping my classroom become a place my students never want to leave.
needStatement: My students need chairs. We are almost there to reach the end of our project. When they saw their new tables, let's just say there was excitement.

name: Balancing the Scales
description: My students live in a modern suburban community. However, in terms of classroom supplies, they are used to sharing old, obsolete and sometimes barely functioning equipment. Three biology teachers currently share 6 electronic balances that may or may not function correctly on any given day. This means that lab procedures that should take 20 minutes can sometimes take 40 minutes as students line up to use electronic balances. Many of our students are on a free and reduced cost lunch program (46% of our population), and we have a high proportion of English language learners on our campus (32%). Despite this, our school has a vibrant campus culture with clubs and activities going on during lunch and recess most days. The rallies and athletic events are well-supported and well-attended. It is my belief that our students deserve the same equipment in their science classrooms that other schools in our district routinely receive from parent donations; however, our science programs are often hampered by limited funding. My project does not have the excitement of many others as I am simply asking for the funding to purchase 1 electronic balance. A single electronic balance does not sound like it will make much of a difference but when you have twelve lab groups and one student from each group responsible for collecting data thats 12 students in line. A single functioning electronic balance added to the room can halve that line to 6, if my other two balances are working the lines drop down to 4. Suddenly, the data can be collected in a timely manner during one class period. Suddenly we can move on to the analysis THAT day and not the next and the lesson has momentum and that makes a difference to learning.
needStatement: My students need an electronic balance to allow them to collect accurate data in their labs in order to collect evidence to make claims

name: All - A - Board
description: My students strive to learn as much as they can. They are eager to discover new things and they absorb every little thing possible. The beautiful thing is they don't even realize that they are in a high poverty district. They don't realize that there are not enough adequate resources. They just want to learn. To have that true intrinsic instinct to learn is what amazes me every day. I am proud of my students and I want it all for them. During phonics, my students love to use the magnetic letters in the classroom. They work with the magnetic letters on the rug and their desks. We have some boards but they are not magnetic. When the students want to move, or it's time for another group to go to the rug, the letters get all jumbled up. Using these boards will keep their letters from falling off and keep us from losing letters every day. The students will be able to show their work without worrying about losing their letters. I know this will be a great improvement to our daily phonics session.
needStatement: My students need magnetic wipe off boards to help with their phonics.

name: Light the Way
description: All of my students have some type of visual impairment. They all attend public school in a district with 38,000 students where 72 languages are spoken. There is a large immigrant population, of which my students are no exception. My visually impaired students are a diverse group. Ranging in ages from ages 5-12 years of age, each student has unique ways they visually attend to educational materials. Two are braille readers. Many use enlarged print. Several of my students prefer the brightest light possible to see details. All of them benefit from the advances being made in technology for individuals with visual impairments. During the week, I travel to several schools in the city to provide one-on-one instruction. My car looks like a gypsy wagon, packed full of braille books, white canes, iPads, power cords, and special lined paper and black writing pens. What is missing from my gypsy wagon is a large yet portable light box with educational accessories. Many of my visually impaired students need bright lights to help them visually access educational material. Because my students are spread out over a large city and my car is my office, I need something that is portable and can be used by many. The light cube meets these requirements: portable, accessible and bright lighting. Visually impaired students thrive with hands-on learning experiences. The light cube and accessories will provide those hands-on experiences. The light cube can be used to enhance classroom discussions in a format the student needs through the use of light. All subject areas can be addressed.
needStatement: My students need a portable light cube so they have a bright light to help them visually attend to the various educational material.

name: Flexible in First
description: I am privileged to work with a group of amazing students that come from a variety of different backgrounds. My students are the sweetest, most eager-to-learn 6 and 7 year olds in the world. They are always on the move. Our school is located in North County St Louis, Missouri. We are a lower socioeconomic area with more than half of the students receiving free and reduced lunch. My students learn best when they have the ability to move. My 25 students are very active. Our classroom is full of movement. Students are constantly making up hand gestures, silly sayings, and songs to remember concepts. The kids work so hard, but often their bodies get in the way of their learning. The students in my class do best when they are moving or sitting in a position in which they learn best. Flexible seating invites creativity, collaboration, communication, and critical thinking. Many of my students have trouble staying focused. Having multiple options for students to work at, aside from sitting in a basic chair or standing, is one way that helps my students to stay super engaged and on task. My students learn best when they are moving around in a controlled environment. Our class is in desperate need of more seating options to help meet the variety of needs in our classroom. With a shorter amount of time for recess and special areas, like p.e., students need flexible seating to meet the needs of their body.
