The immediate benefits of flexible seating include burning more calories, using up excess energy, improving metabolism, increased motivation and engagement, creating a better oxygen flow to the brain, and improving core strength and overall posture. Physical activity is linked to higher academic performance, better health, and improved behavior. Stability balls, wobble chairs, and saucer chairs will provide my 25 students the best environment to do their best learning. Students will learn life skills through having flexible seating options as well, such as responsibility, safety, and respect. It also will help the students to learn how to self-monitor and reflect on their learning.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options to keep their little bodies moving.

name: Marching Towards Justice with John Lewis!
description: My students make me want to teach for a lifetime in this urban environment. They are part of one of the largest urban school districts in MA. There are 42 languages spoken in our school community. We struggle with many of the same issues all urban school struggle with: full classrooms, not enough supplies, the many faces of poverty, but that is not what defines my students! My students are bright young individuals who deserve access to a thriving educational environment which challenges them to examine their own identity and how they can relate to others in this diverse world.I don't think there has ever been a time when I have so desperately wanted to engage students in conversations around social justice, equality, and history's continual reemergence in our present. John Lewis marched for civil rights beside Martin Luther King, Jr. and he continues to march in Washington, D.C. I would love to bring the graphic novel co written by Lewis into my Race and Ethnicity classroom. Graphic novels provide a unique window into the intersection of art, literature, and history. Students respond well to this type of text and it is a first step in introducing multi model literacies into the classroom. The Graphic Novel March will be the first step we will take in our journey to unpack and explore media literacy concepts and help students learn to look at news with a critical lens. New media literacy, involves skills that are critical to being able to function successfully right now and in the future world. With the use of graphic novels we will begin to work on some of the following skills: Multitasking — the ability to scan one’s environment and shift focus as needed to salient details. Collective Intelligence — the ability to pool knowledge and compare notes with others toward a common goal. Judgment — the ability to evaluate the reliability and credibility of different information sources. Negotiation — the ability to travel across diverse communities, discerning and respecting multiple perspectives, and grasping and following alternative norms.” (Jenkins, 2006, p.3)
needStatement: My students need graphic novels to bring our country's graphic past to life, and to jump start our discussion of media literacy today!

name: Help My Students Mountain Bike!
description: My students are a diverse group that have backgrounds from many cultural groups. They are in the 6th, 7th, and 8th grade with both boys and girls. We are a title one school with over 60% of our students eligible for school lunch. Most students are not allowed to walk, bike, skateboard, or scooter to school and they lose out on a lot of exercise. Our school has always been able to achieve high fitness scores due to quality instruction and student performance. Mountain biking is an activity that most of my students never get to do due to the urban location of our school. Traffic is too heavy for parents to feel it safe to ride to school but our school has over 50 mountain bikes that our Physical Education students get to ride on campus. We need more helmets as ours are over 10 years old and several have broken so we do not have a class set. Research has shown that physical activity is also a main contributor to students academic success and we support that success through biking on campus. The physically active student will have better motivation and behavior in the classroom and biking on campus using these helmets will hep them succeeds as students.
needStatement: My students need bicycle helmets to replace broken helmets for our 'Mountain Biking' unit. Bicycling is a great cardio vascular activity.

name: Learning Math Through Strategic Games
description: Our school mission is to build a respectful, successful learning community through art-centered and technology-enhanced practices that develop intelligent behaviors in all students. Our elementary school is a creative arts magnet school in an urban district that uses interdisciplinary teaching and daily arts instruction to positively affect all students in the school through hands-on, interactive learning experiences. In our overall school population, 81% of our students qualify for free/reduced lunch. Our 5th grade classroom has students from diverse backgrounds and experiences who are bused to our school from all over the city. The students are highly motivated to learn but they have a wide range of learning needs. In our classroom, we have 30 students of which 41 % are English language learners from El Salvador, Mexico, Ethiopia, Somalia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Additionally, 6% of the students have IEP’s (individualized educational plans) because of identified learning difficulties. My school has many diverse learners and interactive learning with a whiteboard system will help all students achieve success. I would like to provide a variety of game resources for my three fifth grade math classes to actively engage the students and address their individual needs. Using these games will provide a fun and engaging opportunity for them to develop their mathematical thinking, deepen their understanding of math concepts, and practice their math skills. The use of games can also strengthen the home/school connection by introducing a fun way for families to engage with their student’s math learning. These resources will benefit all the students in my classes by engaging them in fun, challenging activities that will build their interest in math and make their learning fun!
needStatement: My students need additional math learning resources, and access to a variety of quality math games would help them practice their skills, develop a better understanding of math concepts and broaden their strategic thinking.

name: Tell Me a Story
description: Our students come from a variety of different economic backgrounds and 100% of our students receive free lunch. My students speak a multitude of languages including English, Spanish, Hindi, and Arabic. As diverse as our students are economically and culturally, they are diverse in their academics. Despite so many hardships, my students are eager to learn and do their best. They want to be in school because they want to learn all they can so they can be successful one day. This year my goal is to create a reading center for my students that is engaging. I am asking for donations for a reading center that includes 4 headphone sets, a CD player and reading center stand to keep everything organized. This project would allow for 4 students to listen to stories together. The donations for this project will improve my classroom by allowing my students love of reading to grow as they go on wild adventures as they read new stories. My hopes is that by students being able to listen to stories they will be able to gain word knowledge and a stronger understanding of concepts of print. We achieved our first goal of starting a new class library, our next step if to add a listening center.
needStatement: My students need a listening center so that the stories can take them on wild adventures!

name: Chromebooks For Science
description: My students love dancing, acting, drawing, sharing, and are courageous in sharing how they feel and standing up for what they believe in. They have lots of energy and are ready to use it in a meaningful way that will help both their peers and community. I teach at an inner city middle school where 60% of students have free or reduced lunch and 36% are English Language Learners. My students enjoy coming to school for both social and academic reasons. We have an amazing staff who support each and every student socially, emotionally, and academically. To able to do this, many of us spend our own money to support our students. My district is 1-1 iPads, but that doesn't mean students come with their iPads fully charged and ready to go. In my science class, we use technology regularly. If a student's iPad is broken, dead, or was left at home, they cannot participate in the activity. Chromebooks are also easier to use for some students for many reasons: reading, typing, and flash programs. We use PhET simulations and other flash programs that do not work on the iPad. Students use technology to create new things and show their learning. We play online review games, and use Earth Science interactives and nearpod presentations.
needStatement: My students need Chromebooks that they can stay within the science classroom to participate in learning: online interactives, writing documents, and creating presentations.

name: Show It, Say It, Model It, Project It!
description: Our school is a small K to 4 school in an urban area of Eastern New Jersey. We have a very enthusiastic staff who are interested in caring for all the children in our school. Over the past year we have held many fund raisers, and our PTO has purchased over 40 computer notebooks for classroom support. Our goal as a school is to be one to one by 2018. The students from my class are energetic, bright and interested in being better learners. Most speak 2 or more languages and are first generation citizens. Many of their parents work 2 or 3 jobs to keep food on the table and a roof over their heads. Most are here on time every day and helpful to their classmates and schoolmates. The Cuisenaire rods allow children to explore quantitative patterns. For example one green rod is half of a white rod, but 10 white rods make 1 yellow rod. This means 1 white is 1/10 of 1 yellow unit but 1/2 of green unit (colors may not match). When children can see this exploration in a concrete manner, it helps immensely. The document camera will allow me to show student work immediately. They will also be able to show concrete models of their mathematical thinking. The discussions and feedback will be more organic and genuine, keeping students more engaged in the concepts being learned.
needStatement: My students need a document camera so they can see real time examples of quality thought for discussion and growth. They need Cuisenaire rods so they can see relationships and make better connections.

name: Learning to Code Using Tynker!
description: My students love to learn new things and use technology in the classroom. Going to the Mac lab is one of their favorite things. We are an academy where we focus on science, technology, engineering, arts, and mathematics. Many students at my school are coming from surrounding areas to focus on 21st century learning skills. Most of my students are low income and don't have the ability to use coding programs at home. They love to use technology and design their coding programs to share with other students. Our school has an awesome Mac lab that we use to learn how to code. This year we started using Tynker and the kids love it. They have already flown through all the free lessons and I would like to continue encouraging them using the paid version of Tynker classroom. Tynker allows the students to learn real world coding skills using easy to understand commands. The students have created many movies, moving greeting cards, and different scenes using coding. The students have been using Tynker since the beginning of the school year and would like to continue being creative while incorporating technology.
needStatement: My students need to continue using Tynker to learn how to code. We have been using the free version since the beginning of the school year and students have completed all the free lessons.

name: More Diverse Books!
description: I teach 50 5th grade students English-Language Arts and Social Studies in two separate classes. We are located in a high poverty area of a large school district. Many students do not have access to diverse books or the technology that they will need to prepare for middle school and beyond. These great kids also have a wide and diverse set of skills and abilities. I have many students that need assistance in the area of reading, as well as many bilingual students. They are eager to learn and love the little bit of technology we do have and the small classroom library we have managed to accumulate. My students have a wide range of abilities and skills and need books in the classroom that reflect those abilities. Many do not have access to books at home so school is their main source of reading materials. Our media center does a great job but they also have limited funds. Having new diverse materials in the classroom will give my students easy access to books that they can and want to read. These students need to read, read, read and write about what they are reading in order to become proficient. They also need to see themselves in the literature so we need more diversity in our classroom collection.
needStatement: My students need more diverse books in a variety of reading levels that they have easy access to.

name: #Stand Up, Be Active, and Learn!
description: 'Environment shapes experience, and that's no less true in the classroom' -Mary Ellen Flannery. When I need to get work done, I like to sit on the couch or find that comfortable spot in my house or in my classroom... The same goes for my students. It may be at a table, in a quiet corner, standing up, or on wobble seats, where they work the best. My students are full of energy and VERY active, just as I am. Why should they be restricted to one kind of space? I, as a teacher, can't imagine being restricted to one kind of space! Every single one of them are so bright with so much to offer! Our school serves approximately 800 students in grades Kindergarten through Third grade. We have been recognized as a Title I Distinguished School since the school opened ten years ago. In addition, we were recently recognized by the Governor’s Office of Student Achievement as a Gold Medal School! Kids are meant to move! This year, I am determined to get ALL of my kids up and moving throughout all parts of our day! That’s why standing desks in my classroom make sense. It encourages healthy behavior that leads to physical and academic improvements in students and I am positive this is just what my kids need to continue our transition to more active learning. With our rigorous class schedules edging out recess, one way to reintroduce activity is by integrating it into the general curriculum. In recent news it has been said that “Children who are more active performed better on standardized tests, and show greater attention and faster thinking skills than did children who are less active.” Another reason why standing desks are just for us!
needStatement: My students need 4 height-adjustable student desks to continue to transform our classroom into an active learning environment with mobility.

name: Get Your Wiggles Out!
description: Children need to be given the opportunity to work freely and independently in a prepared environment to develop into the people they are meant to be. Education is a time for exploration, development, and practice of different materials and subjects in a variety of ways that meet the needs of each individual child. Children in our classroom are able to explore their interests through work in our environment freely. Teachers should create an environment that has respect, responsibility, safety, support, order and care for each other and the environment. My students are part of a public urban Montessori school. Students in my classroom are in 1st, 2nd and 3rd grade. They are an active but hardworking group of children that love to move about and work alongside their classmates. My goal is to support the students in my classroom on their journey of learning in a peaceful Montessori setting. I am requesting Kore Kids Wobble Chairs, stability cushions, a stability balance ball, stools and lap trays to support children in my class with their focus and engagement during their 3 hour work period in our Montessori classroom. In our classroom, children are given the freedom to choose where they work and what they work on. Based on the child's choice of work, they may need to sit at a table or on the floor. With the availability of alternative seating, children will be able to frequently move about while in a calm, safe and peaceful manner without disturbing their classmates. Children may need motion to concentrate on their work and retain more information while working on cognitive tasks.
needStatement: My students need Kore Kid Wobble Chairs, a stability balance ball, stability cushions, stools and lap trays to support their active bodies as they engage and focus on their work.

name: Alphabet Soup!
description: My students deserve the very best. Everyday my kindergarten and first grade students come to school wanting to feel safe, accepted, and loved. In spite of the many hardships that they face as newcomers to the United States, they demonstrate resilience. These children deserve the best education because they are leaders who live with hope, hope for a better life. A child may have witnessed a father's suicide or a mother's death in a war torn country, but the child comes into the classroom with a smile wanting to learn. A child may have experienced neglect having never been spoken to for the first 4 years of his life, but the child comes to the classroom willing to take risks and try learning new words in English. A child may have experienced hunger, but the child advocates for his baby brother and asks to take milk home to him so the baby stops crying from hunger. A child's may be awake all night from bed bugs and lice, but the child can ignore the persistent itch, stay awake, and focus on what the teacher is saying. These students deserve the very best. Young children need to be engaged in positive early learning experiences. For many children, kindergarten is their first school experience. For newcomers, first grade is often their first school experience. In spite of the pressure for children to be reading by the end of kindergarten, learning still needs to encourage curiosity and incite joy. Kids learn best through play. Letter names and sounds can be introduced in creative ways. For example, I can have puppets such as 'Ellie Elephant' introduce objects beginning with the letter e from the soup cans. Children can put them in the play soup bowl, and use the soup spoon to laddle up sounds. As for the book Alligarors All Around, there is a corresponding song by Carole King. With the Johns Hopkins reading program Success For All Learning letter names and sounds can be fun. Soups on!
needStatement: My students need puppets and alphabet sorters, games and books for hands-on materials to learn letter names and sounds.

name: Theater: Creating the Jungle Book
description: I have the privilege of working with the students of Fruitvale neighborhood here in Oakland. Many of my kiddos were born and raised here in Oakland and unfortunately, most of them come from households that struggle financially. Our school is predominantly students of color and 100% free and reduced lunch. My students' enthusiasm is contagious and their determination is inspiring. They have shown a strong desire to express themselves through the arts and we'd love to provide them with the opportunities to do so. They are such creative individuals who amaze me everyday with their imagination, drive, and excitement for the arts. Their desire to try new experiences is amazing. For the very first time, our school is offering our students the opportunity to participate in the performing arts through the Jungle Book Musical. This amazing experience will allow them to express themselves through a variety of ways that they haven't had before. One such way is through set design. This is where we need your help. I am asking for construction paper and paint to provide our students with the materials necessary to build our Jungle Book set. Currently, they are struggling with imagining what the entire musical will look like. By providing my students with these materials, they will be able to use their imagination and creativity to design their very own musical set. The goal is for our students to be actively involved in every part of the process. We are requesting construction paper to build the actual jungle. This will be used by the students to design their own trees, bushes, and plants. We are also requesting paint for the students to add their own amazing details to our jungle props. Finally, we are requesting face paint for students to wear on the day of their performance. We'd love to make this a possibility for our kiddos. Thank you so much for your support!
needStatement: My students need art supplies to decorate our Disney musical set.

name: Fostering a Love of Literature and Learning
description: My students are a diverse group of young and reluctant learners. They are funny, kind, thoughtful, and smart, but many of them have struggled in school this year and many years before. Some of the students see themselves as non readers, and many have heard from teachers they are not smart or destined for success. I want these kids to know they are special, worthy, and capable of success. I want them to have an experience where they read about people who are similar to themselves, and I want them to fall in love with a book, possibly for the first time in their lives. First, I want my students to see someone actually cares about them. I want them to know they are important enough to have new books picked especially for them. Many of my students have been told by teachers and adults they will never amount to anything and they won't amount to much in this world. I want them to see that someone recognizes the potential in them, enough to put this request out there, and enough to buy books for them. Many of my kids have never finished a single book. Through these titles kids will be empowered, because not only will they be reading a high interest book, they will see their own lives reflected in the stories they are reading. They will see stories riddled by tragedy that are also stories of success. They will see stories of people overcoming hardship and becoming better individuals in the process. They will see themselves reflected in people who are strong, capable of success, and people who overcome. I want my students to understand how strong they are, how capable they are, and that they, too, may overcome all odds.
needStatement: My students need books they can connect with and see their lives reflected in. Not only will students experience stories they can directly relate to and connect with, they will be exposed to relevant topics.

name: Choice Projects!
description: My students motivate me to not only be a better teacher, but be a better person. Many of my students come from diverse cultural backgrounds and diverse situations. I have some students who are economically advantaged, and some who come from disadvantaged situations. When students grow and learn in my space through choice projects, it creates a rich learning environment where all can succeed. I teach 10 different classes of 6-8 grade students. In total, I have over 300 students that take my class each semester. I have four units planned for the remainder of the year. All of the lessons use different materials and are listed below. The first lesson is to design a flag. Students will analyze different flags and come up with their own design. Students will sew or hot glue cut fabrics to complete their design. The second lesson I have planned is block printing. We already have Linoleum blocks, but we are in need of ink in different colors. Students will carve their design into the linoleum and then print on paper. The third lesson will be designing and building a clay mask. Students will look at masks of specific cultures or regions, then create their own design. Students will create an oil pastel landscape of a Minnesota location. They will use multiple layers of oil pastels to recreate a scene that is significant to their lives. My class is often the only place students have the opportunity to learn in a hands-on and independent way. Markers, rulers, pencils, tape, and sharpies, are all used in project development and sketches. They are also used for posters for our classroom and school. Getting these supplies could make a world of difference and would reach 300+ students this year. I believe giving students a choice in what they create is the key to engagement.
needStatement: My students need a variety of art supplies so they can continue making awesome choice projects.

name: Wiggling Our Way to Second Grade!
description: My students have come from all around the world, from many different and often difficult situations. Despite a language barrier, my students walk into our classroom every day full of life, ready to learn, and excited for what is in store for them that day. I want them to know I believe in them and they can do anything. Imagine moving to a new country, walking into a classroom where you have this smiling teacher talking to you in a language you don't understand. These are the students I teach every day. My first graders love to wiggle it out and keep their bodies moving as their brains are learning! I am requesting three Hokki stools to use during small group instruction, as well as to have as a free choice seating option during centers. Hokki stools have the ability to allow children to get the wiggles out and appear to sit still at the same time. They promote an active learning environment and excellent choice in a flexible seating classroom. By donating to our project you will ensure an engaged and active physical learning environment for 24 first graders. These Hokki stools will allow my students to keep moving as they are learning without distracting others by minimizing the distraction of falling out of their hard seats during the school day.
needStatement: My students need three Hokki stools to keep our brains engaged and bodies active to ensure success in the classroom.

name: Amazing Creatures in Kindergarten
description: Many of my students are learning English along with our content areas. They come into school ready to learn and gain new vocabulary and experiences every day! My students are inquisitive and love to ask questions and look for answers, especially about nature and animals. Later this spring we will begin a science and language arts unit on Amazing Creatures that my students are already anticipating! They love to learn about large animals, scary looking sharks with big teeth, and ask and answer questions about the dinosaurs. With these materials my students will be able to enhance their study of animals. The Animals Magnetic Activity Tin will allow students to sort and classify animals while using new science vocabulary. As they work the puzzles they will use problem solving skills and learn about sea animals and insects. We will use the books in small groups as students practice non-fiction reading strategies. The books will also be available for students to use during self-selected reading and to choose as take-home books for homework. Sharing their new learning with families is exciting and brings families into what we are learning at school, too! I will set up a science station with the model animals and students will be able to 'play' with the animals in their habitats, learning about how the animals find food and water. Another station will have the life cycle models for students to sequence and write about in blank books that I will provide. The 3D models of theses life cycle stages will be much more engaging than the black and white pictures that come with our science curriculum. Kindergartners love to touch, manipulate, and talk about what they are learning about. I try to make as much learning as possible hands-on for my students. Taking science out of a 30 minute whole group lesson into our independent center time and also integrating it into our language arts lessons makes it more exciting and real for the students. Colorful and child-sized materials will make learning more engaging and my students will be more motivated to learn about these amazing creatures we share the earth with!
needStatement: My students need nonfiction books about animals, models of animals, floor puzzles, an activity kit, and some storage baskets to keep the materials organized.

name: With Yoga Mats...We can all YogaCalm!
description: I work with a little over 500 students, many of them have ASD and other special needs. Our elementary school is a diverse Title I school where over 63% receive free or reduced lunch. Our school is also located very close to the Mexican border and many of our students are English Language Learners (ELL); this language barrier often prevents students from being completely successful, both academically and social/emotionally. I have given many of our incoming and returning students new backpacks, school supplies, and clothing over the years. Most of them will not be able to afford a yoga mat for our new YogaCalm program. Since December, I have been teaching the YogaCalm curriculum to my K-6th students inside their individual classrooms. My kiddos cannot afford their own yoga mats and neither can our school's limited school counseling and health budgets. We have been forced to either stick with chairs, use small classroom spaces throughout the room, or use the music room where there is old carpeting. The magical and special element of each student have his or her own mat to use during YogaCalm instruction would be such an amazing, positive sensory addition for our yoga work. Having a mat enhances the unique and individualized experience for the children, and I would be able to introduce dried flowers, scented oils, leaves, stones, and other natural elements into my YogaCalm lessons if the kids had provided mats. Most of my students have never seen a real yoga mat before, so the novelty of getting to use the mats will be super exciting! These students truly deserve to experience the wonderful feeling that comes with using a real yoga mat during yoga instruction. Thank you for considering my request :)
needStatement: My students need Yoga Mats to enhance their overall yoga classwork

name: 5th Grade to Wolf Ridge
description: We are a kindergarten to 8th grade school in a diverse neighborhood. Our students come from all kinds of families and from all over the world. We have students that live in the neighborhood and many that have just moved to our country. Our school is filled with terrific students and dedicated staff. Our parents are very involved in the education of the students and all of us want to help our students develop into healthy, active learners and good citizens of the world. This is our 2nd year taking our awesome 5th grade learners to the Wolf Ridge Environmental Learning Center in Northern Minnesota. Last year's trip was such an amazing experience that we knew that we had to do it again! We have a very diverse group of students that love new experiences and adventures! Wolf Ridge is a great place for them to experience the outdoors in ways that they have not done in the cities. We have a great number of students that are new to our country or are from backgrounds that haven't had the same opportunities as other students. When we get to Wolf Ridge none of that matters! All of the students are trying new things and experiencing the outdoors and all that it offers!
needStatement: My students need an opportunity to leave the city and head north! Our goal for this trip is to help our 5th graders connect not only with each other but with the environment up North.

name: Turn It Up for STEM Success
description: Our school is a Title I school which means 90% or more students receive free or reduced-price lunch. My students are from low income households where most come from non-English speaking parents. Sadly, many of my students have failed 3rd grade already and began this school year with minimal resources. Despite the hardships they endure, my students are eager to come to school to learn every day. They enjoy participating, working collaboratively and motivating each other to work hard, however they are very limited on their access to technology. TOGETHER, with a little push and help, I am CONFIDENT our class will succeed and surpass expectations! NONE OF US IS AS STRONG AS ALL OF US!STEM is a curriculum based on the idea of educating students in four specific disciplines — science, technology, engineering and mathematics — in an interdisciplinary and applied approach. My students would benefit greatly from having a speaker that is both portable and easy to use in the classroom. Many times, we use websites like GoNoodle, BrainPOPJr, and Discovery KIDS to explore concepts or ideas. This speaker will not only facilitate teaching for me, but learning for my visual and auditory learners. They will use music and technology to empower their ability to understand and learn new concepts and ideas. My students were born in this digital age where technology is taking over. Unfortunately, my students do not have the access nor resources to truly dive into all the different options available. Giving low-income students access to new technology is an investment in their future. This will improve their school lives because they will be exposed not only to the technology but to Science and Mathematical concepts through the power of music and sound.
needStatement: My students need a speaker for more access to technology. Music is essential to the optimal cognitive development and successful education of young people.

name: Strategies for Success
description: My school works to reach and teach students with specific learning disabilities. Their academic limitations create many academic and emotional struggles. These students experience high levels of frustrations. This can damage their confidence, willingness to try, and connections with peers. Our school focuses on the academic as well as emotional needs of our students. We work to creatively present lessons in a highly structured small classroom environment. Students travel from all over the county to attend school somewhere they feel understood and a sense of belonging. . The materials that I am requesting are therapeutic work books. They are designed to provide creative ways to present lessons help motivate students to strive through their struggles. I work with many of these students throughout their formative school years and want to continue to provide fresh innovative ways to assist them in becoming their best selves. Different messages reach different students so continuing to build my resource library allows me to the best chances to reach all the children that I work with. My lessons developed through these resource materials work to build students motivation, confidence, mood regulation, and healthy interactions. Children are taught to work through their frustrations with schoolwork and classmates. They learn to have courage and overcome the challenges presented by their disabilities. The workbooks help children to understand how their actions affect others and their relationships with them.
needStatement: My students need therapeutic workbooks to build resilience through developing improved coping skills.

name: Full STEAM Ahead in Kindergarten!
description: Students in my kindergarten classroom are amazing learners and relish experience with eyes brightened when exposed to new learning. We are a Title One and language academy school, which provides our community with a diverse group of kids with diverse life experience. Often, these kids are new to our country, have limited English, or limited resources. Their amazing life experience teaches me daily and I love being able to share with them educational experiences as well. My teaching philosophy centers on helping students learn content through many ways, including art. I find that engaging students in art, science, and math in a real way helps them find a passionate drive to learn. I am lucky to set these kids off on their road to education and am proud to have kids leave my walls loving to learn. Daily, I provide lessons, literature, and centers that teach core concepts in creative ways. One of the best ways to integrate it all is through STEAM. Science, technology, engineering, art, and math are all integrated into three separate projects planned with these materials. These items will provide STEAM projects for kindergarten students, encouraging creative exploration and learning across the curriculum, allowing for core knowledge and life skills to be developed in the most engaging way. The first project, called Little Red Makes a Basket, uses the decomposition of numbers, physical science, and engineering in a creative art-based learning experience. The second project, called The Art in in the Details, focuses on life cycles, observations, and engineering using Rainbow Fish as its art-start! Finally, this set of resources will allow us to implement a third project called, The Bridge Where Rosie Rides, will teach measurement, number sense, and engineering through a bridge-building puppet theater with which kids will play dramatically. These three projects, integrating science, technology, engineering, art, and math skills will help students internalize and use core knowledge in creative and exciting ways. There is no better way to teach and learn than through memorable and engaging projects!
needStatement: My students need science, math, and art supplies like counters, books, life-cycle models, and a digital microscope to complete STEAM projects within our curriculum.

name: Book Bins for Bright Brains
description: I have been blessed with 18 eager to learn second graders this year. Although we have only been together for a couple weeks, I am amazed at their abilities. I cannot wait to see what great things they will accomplish this year. I strive to provide my students with the most engaging, enriching, and fun learning environment possible. The joy I get from providing them with such experiences is indescribable but comes at a cost. When my students enter the room each day, I can see how excited they are to be there and they cannot wait to find out what new things we will be doing that day. It is my goal to keep that look on their face for all 180 days of the school year. With your help I can make that possible!When it comes to reading my students can't get enough. They are constantly visiting our classroom library to see what new books they can read each week. We have been using cardboard book bins throughout the year, and as a result of being carried around the classroom countless times they are tattered and torn. Having new book bins will allow my students a safe and sturdy place to store their books in without having to worry whether or not their (cardboard) box will fall over and spill their books all over the floor. Having these book bins will not only help my students this year but it will help students in the years to come.
needStatement: My students need book bins to hold their selected books throughout the year so they are able to access them more easily.

name: Get Them Started Young- Financial Literacy in Kindergarten
description: Students in my kindergarten classroom are amazing learners and relish experience with eyes brightened when exposed to new learning. We are a Title One and Language Academy School, which provides our community with a diverse group of kids with diverse life experience. Often, these kids are new to our country, have limited English, or limited resources. Their amazing life experience teaches me daily and I love being able to share with them educational experiences as well. My teaching philosophy centers on helping students learn content through many ways, including art. I find that engaging students in art, science, and math in a real way helps them find a passionate drive to learn. I am lucky to set these kids off on their road to education and am proud to have kids leave my walls loving to learn. Kids in kindergarten need to start learning about and playing with money and the choices that surround money. Learning about wants and needs, identifying and spending money, and developing early financial literacy is imperative in preparing these students for success. In this project, students will learn about financial literacy, wants vs needs, spending decisions, and play with these ideas in their dramatic play centers. Kids will first learn to identify coins, using several of the books, like Ayo's Money Jar and manipulatives, like the magnetic coins and ten frames. Next, students will begin to develop ideas surrounding their wants and needs using books in the project like The Pigeon Wants a Puppy and Those Shoes. This will lead them to making decisions about their finances. Decision making will be practiced during playtimes at the Melissa and Doug Marketplace which will be turned into a flower shop, a lemonade stand, and a farmer's market. At this young age, we can start kids thinking about money and the best uses for it so that they are more prepared for developing a strong financial future.
needStatement: My students need books about financial literacy and a dramatic play market to practice their skills in economics.

name: Wobble Chairs for the Classroom
description: Our students come from a variety of diverse backgrounds, but our elementary school acts as an all-inclusive family to meet the social and academic needs of our learners. Over 60 percent of our scholars are English Language Learners, and over 95 percent of students identify themselves as African American, Asian American, or Hispanic. Over 90 percent of our students qualify for the USDA's Free and Reduced Price School Meals program, meaning that over 250 of our approximately 277 students come from families whose incomes are below the poverty level. A classroom set of Wobble Chairs will allow my students to stay engaged while learning. Our school serves students with a variety of learning needs, and Wobble Chairs allow children with ADHD and Autism to get the movement they need while simultaneously completing classroom work. These chairs rock and spin on a domed base, encouraging active sitting. Our school has very small classrooms. Most rooms are half the size of a regular classroom due to walls that were constructed as enrollment increased. These chairs are lightweight and portable, giving students the freedom to move to a learning space that best suits their needs. Students will be able to move their chairs into the hallway for small group work, take a chair over to our library for independent reading, or form a small learning area for English Language Learners. Wobble Chairs will help these learners take the initiative they need to learn in the unique way that best suits their needs.
needStatement: My students need a classroom set of Wobble Chairs to help them stay engaged while working. These stools give kids an outlet for their energy, and working is no longer sedentary.

name: Math Manipulatives to Help Improve Math Scores
description: I work with some of the most creative and caring students who come from difficult situations. Our students come from a variety of different economic backgrounds with 100% of our students receiving free lunch. These children have such passion to learn but are restricted due to an inadequate amount of math manipulatives that we have. My students are hands on learners. They love to be up and out of their seat, singing, dancing and playing with different manipulatives. The lack of student resources are holding my students back from reaching their full potential. I want my students to understand that they have the power to accomplish anything they set their mind to! My second graders are hands on learners. When they are able to use math manipulatives to understand the concept you can see a light bulb go off in their head. When a student is physically able to put 3 coins in 3 groups they understand that 3 x 3 = 9. Math Manipulatives are concrete objects that a student can physically handle and alter in order to demonstrate their understanding of the concept being taught. During morning work the students are able to use math manipulatives to complete the problems. These tools will also be valuable in small group and in centers.
needStatement: My students need hands on math manipulatives to understand different math concepts.

name: Non Fiction in Kindergarten!
description: Our school has a very high poverty rate. This means that enough of the students qualify for free or reduced priced lunch that the school provides free breakfast and lunch to all students and weekend meals to many. My classroom is filled with students who come from many different backgrounds and speak many different languages. For many, this is their first experience in a school setting. They need exposure to as many different types of learning experiences as possible, to help them catch up to their peers who had early childhood experiences. These books will be a great addition to our class listening center. Many of the books I currently have are outdated and have cassette tapes. It is getting harder and harder to find tape players. My listening center needs an upgrade. With these new listen center sets, with CD's, they will last for many years to come. With these books my students will have great non fiction books with real pictures to read and listen to. My students will love learning real facts about all of the different kinds of animals and insects that are featured in the book sets.
needStatement: My students need non fiction books and storage containers for our listening station.

name: Study and Organization Materials to Enhance Memory and Learning
description: It is definitely true that the students in my area come from a mixed variety of backgrounds. Most of my students are on reduced or free lunch, and some even become the parent to smaller children when their school day ends. Through hard work and dedication, they made their way to my school and into my AICE psychology class where the level is that of a college course. If my students can pass a Cambridge exam at the end of the year, they receive free college credits. This is huge to most of my kids because chances of them affording college is low. Any way I can get them closer to a college degree, the better; not just for their own success, but for society as a whole. These are our future leaders. These children are of high intelligence and have wonderful minds. I just need the tools necessary to get them to their fullest potential. Color and organization is going to be the deciding factor for most of my students in their ability to study and obtain details associated with their curriculum. Color is the key; the use of different colors stimulate different function in the brain which includes: improved focus, relaxation, creativity, happiness, critical thinking and memory. Students will be able to create visual spatial maps as well as colorful web maps along with any art/images that will help them remember material. In combining these colorful effects with the use of note cards, we are able to have endless possibilities. The note cards will enable students to create games such as memory, taboo, jeopardy and even charades. The possibilities are endless! These games will encourage memory retention of the core studies associated with their final exam(s). Yes there are two exams they must pass in order to obtain their college credits. Finally, for those students who think in linear format the binder sleeves will become another way in which they will be able to organize the in depth details of the 10 core studies. Since I teach 90 students and there are 20 studies, 10 sleeves each (front and back) should hold that material quite well.
needStatement: My students need study materials for their upcoming AICE Cambridge exam: plastic binder sleeves, index cards and multi-colored pens.

name: Over the Rainbow Mathematics Classroom Carpet
description: My students at school are energetic, loving second grade students that have a passion for learning and socializing. Each of them is unique and intelligent, and collectively they make learning fun each and every day. The students in my class come from many diverse backgrounds, experiences, and language ability. We have fun learning from each other and where we come from. Many of my students are learning English for the first time and I appreciate how we all help each other. The students in my classroom like a variety of learning styles and I hope to impress upon them the love of mathematics. These materials will allow for the students to learn second grade mathematics concepts in an interactive and exciting way. The large-size classroom carpet will be used daily during math time and help make math the focus of the room. This project will make a difference in how the students learn ratios and proportions, place value, base-ten operations, and much more. The Lakeshore Learning classroom carpet will focus the students on math by using whole-class kinesthetic learning strategies for mathematics. My students will come to identify the mathematics in the world around them and this will improve their problem solving and thinking skills. The materials from this project will help all students love math and appreciate math in their school and home lives.
needStatement: My students need a large-sized classroom carpet enough for 30 from Lakeshore Learning with columns and rows to aid in math instruction such as graphing, ratios, skip counting, and place value.

name: Struggling Students Striving for Success with Graphic Novels!
description: I am lucky enough to teach 25 adorable and hardworking fourth graders. My students come from diverse ethnic and financial backgrounds, but they all come to learn. My classroom is designed around my students and is truly all about them. I tossed my desks out years ago and replaced them with tables; my classroom is an alternative seating experiment. My students are treated as little humans who can make their own decisions when it comes to learning, including decisions about the physical environment in which they learn best. They use the restroom, get a drink, switch their seating etc. when it best meets their needs, not mine. I have high expectations and set individualized goals for each student. While one student is working on mastering grade level curriculum, another is being challenged at their own level and working on 7th-grade educational experience. Please help me in my journey to do this by supporting our little 'scamily' (school family).My students are amazing little humans. In my classroom I have all levels of learners but they have one thing in common.... their amazing attitudes towards learning and their GIANT amounts of effort they are willing to put into their studies! Ninety percent of my class come outside of school hours each week voluntarily to improve their areas of greatest needs. For many of my students, this area is reading! The majority of my students truly struggle with independent reading and it's almost like pulling teeth to get them to pick up a book on their own! TOON Graphics are amazing, colorful, high-interest novels that even the most reluctant reader will love. Please help me add these amazing books to my classroom library! I know the appeal graphic novels have on even the most struggling learner. Their great illustrations convince kiddos to read every page. The use of visuals these novels use also ties into many higher level thinking skills and help to meet many state and national standards for fourth grade. My students are very into mythology this year. It is also a difficult genre to teach! These novels would allow them additional practice with so many fourth grade skills including interpreting graphics and how they relate to the text, determining theme, understanding allusions in myths, and understanding and using figurative language. Please help me to help my students dive into independent reading with fun, exciting, interesting TOON Graphics!
needStatement: My students need high-interest Toon graphic novels to build their enthusiasm for independent reading with amazing stories including Greek mythology, fantasy, adventures, and fairy tales!

name: Read and Really Dance
description: If you came to our school you would never know that it is a title one inner city school with over 90% of our students on free or reduced lunch. Many of our students face challenges that even adults would have difficulty with. Our team works actively to find each student's special talent and guide them toward life success through character building and the 7 habits of highly effective people. As a Leader in Me Lighthouse School we teach students the habits to be successful regardless of circumstance. When you walk into my classroom you will see students using their personal artistic voices, exploring movement, listening, following and creating their own dance movement. Students who have difficulty learning math are suddenly learning mathematics easily through movement. Students having trouble with letter recognition are creating the shapes of letters with their bodies and using the letter sounds to create the music they will perform to. We are using the performing arts to overcome the affects of poverty and empower our students. These books will give low-income students in grades PreK-5 access to reading activities directly connected to their passion, dance. Students will increase literacy as we dance, read and write using these books during our performing arts dance class. Our class will expand literacy while adding to their understanding of what dance is, how we dance and who dances. It will be easier to meet statewide and national standards for education with the proper materials in our classroom that are easily accessible. Students will learn to read through multiple intelligences and cross-curricular learning will be able to occur readily. These books are an investment in their future as well as yours.
needStatement: My students need books that inspire their reading skills and increase their knowledge of dance!

name: Reaching Readers- Audio Books and Accessible Reading Centers!
description: We are a small but mighty self-contained classroom of students with varying abilities in grades 1-3. Our students learn differently through autism spectrum disorder, cerebral palsy, sanfillipo syndrome along with varying physical and intellectual abilities. We pride ourselves on growing our knowledge through experiences inside the classroom through art, gardening, cooking, and sensory integration and outside of the school through trips and experiences in the community. We learn valuable life-skills and work daily to communicate effectively with our peers and interact with the amazing world around us. My exuberant kiddos can be quite tough on our library and audio equipment and sometimes struggle with the feeling of traditional headphones on their ears. Funds will be used for multiple pairs of headphones with varying durability and features (flexible, headbands, noise-canceling) to meet the needs of the different students in my room, a CD player with easy to use and clear buttons, headphone adapters, a set of audio-books for use in the center as well as some replacement books, and a set of ‘indestructible’ books for students that are waiting for their turn in the audio-book center. My students don't always learn in traditional ways so my goal as their teacher is to provide multiple entry points for my students to connect to learning and create a welcoming and accessible space. There are numerous benefits to having technology available to expand reading experiences and increase independence for reading. Multiple books provide choice and opportunities for choice-making. Improved reading skills, task independence, and reading interest are just some of the expected outcomes for this amazing class. We're so excited to dive into reading!
needStatement: My students need adaptive headphones, easy-to-use DURABLE books, and audio equipment to access new and exciting reading experiences!

name: Fish From Fermentation
description: My students attend a continuation school in a high-crime area. Most of them are from low-income households. Many of them have lacked motivation in the past and many have lots of drama in their lives that have contributed to poor success in school. Interesting activities often spark a renewed interest in education that puts them on the right path for a successful life. They really appreciate being able to do special activities that usually only the comprehensive school sites that they came from are able to fund. My students want to take thrown out school food and compost it anaerobically to produce superior worm food. The daphnia and duckweed will all be fed to the fish which are producing waste to feed our plants. This project allows students to experience the rewards of recycling. They will observe how nutrient cycling by micro-organisms benefits higher trophic levels. Their aquaponic set up will now have its own food supply courtesy of the garbage can. The bokashi mix uses yeast and bacteria to ferment food scraps which then get added to the vermiculture to be finished off by red worms. Worm castings are great plant fertilizer and the worms keep the fish happy and healthy. Students will be engaged by this hands-on activity that will not only help them with biology, but also help them to be more thoughtful global citizens.
needStatement: My students need bokashi kit, daphnia and duckweed for creating their own eco-machine to convert wasted school food into fish and plants.

name: Graphic Novels for Aspiring Readers
description: My students are a diverse group of thinkers and learners who come together in the spirit of learning. We are a public, urban Montessori middle school, and, as a school that opened three years ago, we are still emerging and growing as a community. We are located in a historically diverse and low-income community. 77% of our students receive free and reduced price lunch. My students love reading! They come to middle school with an enthusiasm for their educations and form a strong community. Our Montessori classroom experience is focused on educating the whole child and creating lifelong learners. My students who love graphic novels quickly read through every book on the shelf. We need more graphic novel choices to help keep our growing readers reading. I would like high-interest, engaging, graphic novels to promote a culture of literacy among my 6th grade students. Everyday, students read choice-novels in class, and many students choose graphic novels. Reading graphic novels not only improves comprehension but also skills such as inference, memory, and sequencing. The graphic novels in this project span several genres, expanding the options that students will have for independent choice reading. The content in many of the graphic novel series, such as Dork Diaries and Smile, are age and developmentally relevant to my students. They show the successes and struggles of adolescent characters working through real-life issues such as bullying, growing up, and fitting in.
needStatement: My students need high interest graphic novels to keep them excited about reading!

name: Students with Wiggles and Stress, Oh My!
description: My students walk into our classroom every day full of life, ready to learn, and excited for what is in store for them that day. We work extremely hard everyday to be the best learners today, to become leaders tomorrow. My students have amazing stories to tell, they love to collaborate, and enjoy being around each other. My students are full of energy and inspiration! Our school is a low income school. Many of my students face challenges I cannot even begin to truly relate to. Many have family situations that are far less than ideal and less structure at home than they need, resulting in chronic stress. In our classroom our workspaces are flexible and students can sit wherever they focus best. Seven and eight year-olds are wiggly! They love being able to sit on the floor or stand at a table, but we also need seating which allows them to move. Seats like Wobble Chairs and balance balls where students can fidget while working, will allow my students to work without distracting themselves or others. Living in situations where stress is chronic follows my students into the classroom. Having the ability to fidget and relax will help my students to not stress and instead focus on enjoying school. This will enhance our learning, make our school day even more fun, and decrease negative behaviors in our classroom. My students and I are so excited to have even more workspace choices and stress relief tools for our learning!
needStatement: My students need wobble seats, balance balls, and soft seats to help with their wiggles!

name: We are Scientists!
description: Our school is made up of mostly African American scholars. We have a large population of students who qualify for free/reduced lunch and my students are scientists! They love to explore and learn new things especially when they are able to use materials that they can touch and feel. My students crave science instruction and want to learn more about what we are working on in the science center everyday. Unfortunately, our school does not have a science teacher, so classroom teachers are put to the task of teaching science along with all other core subjects. I want my kids to love science and all the learning that comes from being scientists. They are great at questioning things and always are eager to learn more. Our classroom has six centers where students can learn. They can choose to learn in the art center, library, writing center, math center, dramatic play, and the science center. My students need materials they can use in the science center to learn more about the scientific process. My students are always looking to learn, explore, and experiment with new things, the materials just are what is missing. My students have a desire to work in the science center, but when the materials are limited, so are their experiences. I want my students to have hands on materials they can use each day to become scientific thinkers. The resources will be put into the science center in our classroom. Students will use the materials to explore magnets finding items that are magnetic and which items are not, explore using microscopes so they can see pictures up close and with great detail, and also explore engineering ideas by creating 3D buildings using Magna-tiles. As a teacher, I will use the experiment book to plan hands-on experiments for the students to investigate understand the scientific process.
needStatement: My students need hands-on materials to explore science topics and create a lab-like experience.

name: Creating Chromatography
description: Not every International Baccalaureate student will become a biologist, but each of my students will have the opportunity to view the world through the lens of a scientist. Our school is an amazing place where staff and students provide daily inspiration. Our students are typical inner-city students who have chosen a more rigorous International Baccalaureate education. They are hard workers and achieve great things despite obstacles in their paths. Our school has graduated our first class of seniors and we are excited to continue a tradition of excellence. Students need materials for their Chromatography Lab! Scholars will be able to separate the different plant pigments, like chlorophyll, based on their size during this hands-on introduction to photosynthesis. Our students will complete this lab as a part of the Diploma Program Biology International Baccalaureate program. Students will also have a variety of enzymes available for their individual investigation of chemical reactions! Students will learn proper lab techniques and experimental design skills as they investigate this topic. The data they collect will be compiled and analyzed through graphing and statistical analysis. Students will also improve their technical writing skills through the presentation of their findings in a lab report.
needStatement: My students need chromatography solvent and chromatography paper to study the different plant pigments in photosynthesis.

name: Children's House Maker Space
description: CH Elementary is a community school that is in the process of transitioning to a Montessori program. My goal is to create a makerspace station that lets students become creators and inventors. The makerspace station will allow students to develop skills in inquiry, science, engineering, and math using a variety of materials, along with fine motor, problem solving, speaking, listening, comprehension, planning, initiative, creative, and observational skills. Students from four Children’s House rooms attend my classroom for fifty minutes each day where they have the opportunity to explore, create, and work with others in an environment that facilitates active engagement and experimentation. The classroom is in need of science and engineering materials including Lego bricks, baseplates, marble runs, Science Discovery kits and children's tools to create a Maker Space in our classroom. I am requesting these materials to provide my students with a variety of opportunities to design and develop structures and help further develop their imaginations and creativity. Our students come needing more options to explore and design on their own. Students will work together to solve problems, develop their creativity, and collaborate with each other to design projects using a variety of materials. Students will build with Soft Unit Blocks, Legos, Strawbees, HABA Tap and Tack, and create marble runs along with using hand tools. These materials will help facilitate experiences for students to create and make a variety of items that will help bridge science and engineering concepts, along with developing their problem solving and team building skills. The soft blocks provide a safe and quiet form of building which helps students hold their concentration. In Montessori, it is important for students to not be interrupted while working. The table will help students create and maintain their projects and allow for others to add onto ideas.
needStatement: My students need a variety of manipulatives such as soft unit blocks, marble runs, Legos, and a building table to create items in the makerspace area.

name: Keep us COOL!
description: My students are diverse and eager group of children. They live in an urban community and come to school every day with a smiles on their faces! They love to learn in different ways! My students surprise me every day with how much they know. We strive to always have something new and exciting to learn every day! They are sweet and always ready to do what is asked of them. I am looking forward to a productive and amazing year with this special class. Our classroom becomes extremely hot once spring rolls around. Our school is almost 100 years old and has no air conditioning. My students are unable to focus in such hot temperatures. If we have four fans, one in each corner of the room, that will help alleviate the heat and humidity. We all DREAD the hot days. Valuable learning time is lost when it's hot! My hope is that if we have these fans, the spring and summer days will be more bearable. We will be able to spend more time learning and less time sweating it off! Please help us!
needStatement: My students need four fans to circulate the air in May and June. We have no air conditioning and our room becomes extremely hot.

name: 10 Points to Gryffindor
description: My wonderful students come from a very high poverty area where most of the 700 or more students in their school are on free or reduced priced lunch. Most of the students are bilingual and don’t start speaking English until they begin Kindergarten. At home they do not have access to many books or technology needed to strive in the twenty first century. Their only exposure to these things is when they are at school or what they bring from school to use at home. Despite all of their hardships and struggles they come to school everyday happy and ready to learn!At the school that I teach at the enrollment hovers around 700 students. Many of the students love to read but aren’t challenged enough. This year a group of teachers decided to change this and brought Battle of the Books to our school. It was a huge success. If you don’t know what that is I’ll explain it for you. Battle of the Books is when the students read books from a list. The books on the list are of various difficulty but picked to challenge students. Teams are formed and they compete in a day of competition answering questions about the books they read. Eventually, it comes down to two teams and a final battle. After the final battle a winner is crowned! It is a fun and exciting event that we hope to continue for years to come. In order for us to continue the competition we need multiple copies of high interest but challenging books for our next competition. One of the awesome things about Battle of the Books is that students can read the books individually or teachers can read them with their class. The book and audiobook (so students can listen to the book and follow along) that I am requesting is Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone. The students at my school love the Harry Potter series but many have not read the books but have seen the movies. We all know the movie version of a book is often very different from the book itself. There are only a few loved copies of the book in our library. As soon as the books come, teachers and students from all grade levels will be able to have access to them and get a start on the next Battle of the Books.
needStatement: My students need Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone to unleash their imagination and take them to a magical world.

name: Sitting in Style
description: My students face many difficulties both in the classroom and at home. Half of my class is learning English. A majority of them had never been in school until they started in August. Many of their parents are not supporting their learning at home. They have made so much progress. The first month of school was very challenging due to behavior and academic issues. However, as I look back at August and look at their progress, I am so proud of them. My classroom has a tiled floor but I was not provided with any rugs when I moved in. Currently, my students are using an outdoor rug with masking tape squares. The rug constantly slides, is falling apart, and the edges are curled. My students need a rug meant for Kindergarten children to sit on. When my students sit on the taped outdoor rug, it slides from place to place. With this new rug, they can each sit in their own square. This rug will help with classroom management and dismissing students from the rug. I can also pair students for partner activities quickly and easily with this new rug. Without it, it will takes more time to organize students and some still may not know who they need to partner with. With this rug, I will be able to say red pair with orange and green pair with blue. My students will know who their partner is and we will not waste time.
needStatement: My students need a rug that does not move so easily and gives every child personal space.

name: Financial Literacy for Special Needs
description: Our mission is to engage students in critical thinking and teamwork that empowers them toward lifelong learning and global citizenship. Our vision is to provide a school that creates an inclusive community working together to support student achievement and builds a strong sense of self-worth. NCA was founded by a small group of parents, educators and community members who saw the need for another choice in secondary education. NCA services 70% of our students on the free or reduced rate lunch program and 40% special education population.I am requesting several supplies to help teach financial literacy to those who are most vulnerable. I am seeking hands on teaching supplies, games and interactive activities to help teach students about financial literacy. Students need to learn about needs vs wants. Students need to learn how to know when a price of an item is 'expensive' and they need to have an understanding on how ATM machines work and credit cards. This project has everything students need to learn about financial literacy from teaching what the value of money is to actually being able to use a cash register. Students will learn how to make change and how to count the money they receive. Students will learn about financial literacy by exploring hands-on economic activities, playing games like the ATM Action! Money game to practice real life experiences, Jumbo Double sided magnetic money that we can use to practice in small groups and Money Folder Games for individual practice. Students can practice Saving & Spending through the hands-on activities and practice using a cash register.
needStatement: My students need supplies (computer games, cash register and activity centers) for financial literacy. This includes hands-on activities for financial development.

name: PreK Loves To Learn Through A Variety Of Sensory Activities!
description: My PreK scholars are amazing! The are the only full day class in our school. They are eager to learn and love being in school. Our school is very diverse and takes pride in welcoming and engaging all scholars and families. We are committed to creating a school where kids feel safe, loved, and motivated. As a school, we take pride in creating an environment where we celebrate diversity, discuss and study racial equity, and 'inspire all scholars to reach high levels of social and academic achievement and to become future leaders through a collaborative system of support' (Our School's Mission Statement).My scholars learn a lot through their senses. One of the favorite centers in my classroom is my sensory table because scholars get to explore with their hands and play with things such as sand, water, leaves etc. I would love to add more sensory activities and choices throughout my classroom and centers. Sensory activities are calming, fun, and can improve focus! I am looking forward to adding different materials such as kinetic sand and snow to our sensory table. My scholars can be creative and discuss their observations with their teachers and peers. My scholars will also love learning their letters and numbers by finding them in bin full of beads. The sensory paint is also a safe way and fun for scholars to create art with their hands. We are so lucky in PreK to have so much choice in our classroom for our scholars.
needStatement: My students need to explore sensory materials for fun and calming play!

name: Captains of Creativity!
description: My classroom is made up of 17 fourth graders who all have that little 'something' that makes them special! Some of them excel in art, others in writing, and some in acting. Having such a great group of diverse learners has made teaching so much more exciting because they teach me knew ways to think everyday! Despite how different they all are from one another, my students have one huge thing in common: they love to be creative! Research projects and STEAM activities are a huge part of our classroom so we would love new materials that we can use to help us get hands on with our learning!My students' need new craft supplies such as poster board, cotton balls, clay, markers, paper, etc., costumes, and storage containers to help us when creating new projects in our classroom. They absolutely love hands-on learning and by giving them a variety of materials to work with, I believe that they will have more freedom in their creativity. Having access to so many new materials to use whether it's a book project, a project on the solar system, or a skit re-enacting the first European Explorers will help students think outside the box. Allowing students to use these materials will have not only have a positive impact on their learning but also allow their imaginations will soar!
needStatement: My students need materials to help us get creative!We are in need of new craft supplies, costumes, props, and storage to allow them creative freedom when completing projects in class.

name: In PreK, We Need to Run and Play Everday!
description: My PreK scholars are amazing! The are the only full day class in our school. They are eager to learn and love being in school. Our school is very diverse and takes pride in welcoming and engaging all scholars and families. We are committed to creating a school where kids feel safe, loved, and motivated. As a school, we take pride in creating an environment where we celebrate diversity, discuss and study racial equity, and 'inspire all scholars to reach high levels of social and academic achievement and to become future leaders through a collaborative system of support' (Our School's Mission Statement).I believe children need to have a good balance of movement and sitting activities throughout their day. It is my job to provide my scholars these activities. We have so much fun! My scholars are most successful IN the classroom when I give them opportunities to run, play, and climb OUTSIDE of the classroom. Here in Minnesota, the weather can be very unpredictable. If it is too cold or wet/rainy outside, I like to plan fun gross motor activities inside. We have an open space in our school where I can be creative in coming up with a variety of fun activities; parachute, dance parties, obstacle courses, and stations. The materials I have chosen will allow my scholars to crawl through the I See You Peek-a-Boo Tunnel. The Giant Number Stepping Stones and Step A Logs will help scholars to count, balance, and plan their body movements to improve coordination. The Color and Shapes Activity mats will help my scholars learn colors and shapes through movement. My scholars love Hula Hooping. These Hula Hoops do not kink, therefore they will last a long time! Finally, the Body Poetry cards will get scholars moving and challenge them to move their body in creative, specific ways. My scholars will exercise, have fun, and be ready to learn after our gross motor play!
needStatement: My students need physical activities like Step A Logs, activity mats, and hoops for inside to exercise and play during cold and rainy weather.

name: Creative Communication
description: Our school community is unique in many ways. Our community is specifically designed for individuals needing a special school environment to support their everyday needs. Students who attend this school are honored for their abilities and praised for their successes, both big and small! Our school is filled with staff who are committed to creating a meaningful school experience for all students and their unique needs.
