Last year, 2/3 of my students were English Language Learners. With support from teachers and family, my students were able to show a tremendous amount of growth. Much of Kindergarten instruction happens on 'The Rug'. To effectively teach on this magical spot, I needed a dry erase easel to teach important academic content. My school was generous enough to donate one from the conference room but it was one meant for 'grown ups'. The easel would constantly tip over from excited students ready to show what they have learned. The safety hazard is the biggest reason for this project. The new easel is kid friend and cannot tip over and will help to ensure that all students, even the ones in the back row, are able to see and access the content. Thank you so much for your consideration.
needStatement: My students need an easel for fair access to all the content in class.

name: Comfortable Spots = Focused Readers!
description: I teach an enthusiastic class of 2nd and 3rd graders whose interests are as diverse as they are. They walk into the classroom every day ready to learn. Watching my students succeed and become confident learners inspires me to find more ways to support them. My school is an urban option school that parents can choose for their children. I have many students with special education needs including learning disabilities, Autism-Spectrum Disorder, Sensory Processing Disorder and ADHD. These special needs can impact their ability to access the skills and concepts I am teaching. During our independent reading time each day, my students find spots around our classroom to read their books. Two or three kids get to be cozy in our classroom library, but the remaining children have to sit on the floor or at their tables. Bean bags and wobble cushions will allow more kids to have comfortable spots for reading. And when they feel comfortable, they will be more focused readers! In addition, when small groups meet with me for individualized instruction, they will no longer have to gather around me on the floor. Instead, they will have stools on which to sit.
needStatement: My students need seating to be cozy and comfortable while they read!

name: It's Ozobot Time!
description: 'Is it time to go home already?!' The children I work with love coming to school! Our school is one of the most culturally diverse and welcoming schools in the St. Paul Public Schools district. Our demographics are American Indian 22 % Asian American 33% African American 25% Hispanic American 14% Caucasian American 7%. Many of our children come from difficult lives, filled with trauma and uncertainty. School is a safe place that provides 100% free meals, loving care and dedicated teachers. We strive for a warm community of understanding, between all of our school's cultures. We do not have a Science Specialist in our elementary level. Classroom teachers teach Science and we are in need of materials to help us to do so! We are all related! This Ojibwe teaching is a common belief at our school. Given the diverse backgrounds we all come from, our classroom community is so strong and each child has a voice! In turn, the children take their education seriously. They understand that educating themselves is the foundation for the rest of their lives. Due to school budget cuts, my school recently lost our Elementary Science Teacher. After going it alone last year in my classroom, I discovered that it was time for me to roll up my sleeves, and seek out ideas and materials to breathe life into my Science Instruction. Last spring my eldest daughter, while doing her own student teaching, turned me on to the idea of teaching STEM with 'Ozobots.'She was raving about how focused and involved her students were, in learning code, & programming, when they were able to put it to life with their Ozobots. My school district has iPads for each student already. This will allow me to teach online lessons from the Ozobot website and lessons from the curriculum.code.org website as well. The Ozobots work on regular paper, with any markers (the colors of the markers are what tell the Ozobots what action to take). The Ozobots also work on iPads! The students can draw their scenario on drawing apps, and the Ozobots move around on the iPad screen, as well as paper. This all has me very enthusiastic and I know that my students would absolutely LOVE the STEM opportunities Ozobots would excite in them!
needStatement: My students need Science materials and projects that will excite them about STEM!

name: We Don't Tolerate Intolerance
description: Seeing my students learn is the thing that makes me the happiest. I love to be able to give them all the information that they need in order to understand and appreciate the world that they live in. Curious, creative, and very vocal, my students are the future of our society and I want to make sure they are equipped and ready to handle it. Faced with some difficult obstacles that they have to go through in their own neighborhood, I want them to know that the obstacles in the classroom can be overcome. With hard work and determination they will become the best of our future. Using the iPad my students will be able to find strategies on hot to deal with intolerance and bullying. We will do an investigation into the different ways to stop a bully and how to accept people for who they are, regardless of size, shape or color. In a perfect world our children are shielded from the ugliness that adults show towards one another. But in the real world, we know that is not true. Our students need to learn that we have to be accepting of others and practice being tolerant to each other both in and out of the classroom.
needStatement: My students need an iPad which will help them find different ways to fight intolerance.

name: Color Me Happy
description: Seeing my students learn is the thing that makes me the happiest. I love to be able to give them all the information that they need in order to understand and appreciate the world that they live in. Curious, creative, and very vocal, my students are the future of our society and I want to make sure they are equipped and ready to handle it. Faced with some difficult obstacles that they have to go through in their own neighborhood, I want them to know that the obstacles in the classroom can be overcome. With hard work and determination they will become the best of our future. When we want to get creative in our classroom, it becomes a fun time but also a stressful time. My students need crayons, colored pencils and paper to use for their projects. I have students that come in with little or no schools supplies. We quickly run out of crayons and colored pencils before the school year is even half way over. I want them to be able to get creative and do their best with ample materials to get us through the school year. We do share with each other, but it's easier to get through a lesson when everyone has their own supplies.
needStatement: My students need crayons, paper and colored pencils for the classroom.

name: Rock It!
description: My students are the sweetest children in the district and are always so excited to learn when they come into my class, because I engage them in project-based learning. The students I teach come from a wide range of backgrounds and a diversity of traditions. However, most of the children have limited background knowledge on many subjects areas and topics. Each year I engage students in hands-on project based learning so they can explore and take ownership of their futures. This grant project will compliment the 4th grade science standards on Earth science for minerals and rocks. Students will have hands-on learning through the exploration of their individual rock kit collection. This will expose the students to real life learning about the rock cycle. It is research based that students understand academic concepts the best when they are active learners. Students will create a visual arts hands on model of the rock cycle using clay. This project based learning will do just that. By students understanding the rock cycle, they will learn the origin of how rocks are form, the Earth's formation as well as how different types of rock are used in architecture, sculpture, and even jewelry.
needStatement: My students need books on rocks, clay to make a model of the rock cycle and rock kits to learn about the rock cycle.

name: Learning Responsibility
description: My students primarily come from an underprivileged population in an urban environment. Many of my students do not have the resources at home to maximize their learning potential. It is my goal, then, to provide them with the best tools and resources possible for the time that they are in my classroom. I believe that every one of my students can be college-bound, despite the fact that many of them come from families where this has not been a reality. In order to achieve this goal, my students will need a variety of tools to meet their needs as individual learners. My students need a variety of materials to help them stay organized this school year. I am asking for folders in four different colors so that students can have one folder for each subject. I am asking for pencil pouches to organize individual materials. I am also asking for labels so that students can easily identify their own materials. As teachers, our job is not only to teach academics, but to teach life skills, including responsibility. Having a system to organize their own papers and materials helps students to develop responsibility. Through your donations, I will be able to work with my students on this important skill that will remain with them for the rest of their lives.
needStatement: My students need folders, pencil boxes, and pencil pouches to stay organized and learn responsibility.

name: Word Builders Lay a Good Foundation
description: As a teacher in a high-poverty, low-income school district, my students are faced with challenges both in and out of the classroom. My school is a Title I school, and we have an extremely high percentage of students who receive free/reduced lunches. Many of my students' families were not able to afford school supplies, so I purchased what my students' needed out of pocket. This is usually what has to be done if you want your students to have the materials that they need. My students are extremely eager to learn new things. My kindergarten students need to learn the basic skills needed to become successful readers, and having phonological awareness is a requirement for that. These word building boards will make a huge impact on my small-group reading instruction. Students will be able to physically place letters together in the open section on the board, say each sound, and quickly move their finger under the word to blend the sounds together to form a word. Understanding phonological awareness and blending are extremely important skills that are the foundation of reading. Our class will use these boards daily in small-group instruction. We will practice putting words together, changing the onset and rime of words, and practice saying each individual letter sound. These kits will greatly impact our word-building skills.
needStatement: My students need word building boards to support their ever-growing blending skills!

name: Pick a Seat!
description: My students are a group of very curious and intelligent 3rd graders. My students love making jokes, playing soccer and telling stories. The kids I have this year have especially taken an interest to reading graphic novels and writing non-fiction books about topics they love. The majority of my kids don't have access to books at home, so learning to read and write in school is especially crucial to their learning. I teach at a Title I school with a population of over 80% minority students. Many of my students are English Language Learners and several also come from migrant families. My school has over 70% free/reduced lunch, meaning many children also come from low-income households. I need more flexible seating options for my students to use during centers and individual work time. Last year I received a donors choose donation for 4 wobble chairs and it made a HUGE difference in my classroom! The wobble chairs helped my wiggly students focus while also helping my reluctant learners want to come to small group instruction. While these chairs have been such a wonderful tool in my classroom, we are in high need of more options that can help students stay active while learning. If I had more wobble chairs along with balancing boards and balancing pods, I could meet the learning needs of all my students. My goal is to have several seating choices available for all children, so they can choose what piece of furniture works best for their needs. If I had these materials, I would be able to let all students have an opportunity to move while they work independently and in small groups.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options to choose from during work time.

name: Word Masters Challenge
description: Our school mission is to build a respectful, successful learning community through art-centered and technology-enhanced practices that develop intelligent behaviors in all students. Our elementary school is a creative arts, magnet school in an urban district that uses interdisciplinary teaching and daily arts instruction to positively affect all students in the school through hands-on, interactive learning experiences. In our overall school population, eighty-one percent of our students qualify for free or reduced price lunch. Our fifth grade classroom has students from diverse backgrounds and experiences who are bused to our school from all over the city. The students are highly motivated to learn, but they have a wide range of learning needs. In our classroom, we have thirty students of which forty-one percent are English language learners from El Salvador, Mexico, Ethiopia, Somalia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Additionally, six percent of the students have IEP’s (individualized educational plans) because of identified learning difficulties. My school has many diverse learners. The WordMasters Challenge will provide a fun and engaging opportunity for my fifth grade students to improve their vocabulary skills and reading comprehension using analogies. This resource will benefit all the students in my class by engaging them in fun, challenging activities that will develop their logical thinking, deepen their understanding of verbal reasoning, and improve their vocabulary skills. Fifth grade students respond well to competition so this challenge will encourage their engagement while meeting their individual needs. Three times a year we will use the WordMasters word lists to prepare for an analogy test. We will then report our scores to compete with public and private schools throughout country. WordMasters will analyze the results and post a report detailing the median team scores and other statistics related to the competition. These statistics will enable me to assess my students’ achievement. At the end of the competition year, certificates of achievement and one Champion Medal will be awarded to the top achievers.
needStatement: My students need a subscription to The WordMasters Challenge™ which is a vocabulary competition based on completing analogies.

name: Dominguez's Scholars Seize Learning
description: The minute you meet these fourth graders you know they are eager to learn! These students bubbled over with an incredible amount of excitement the minute I met them. Their curiosity is contagious. These scholars are ready for a challenge and hungry to learn! I relish their enthusiasm! What better than to know these students will be future leaders. Sky is the limit when it comes to learning. They are soaring for success. I am honored to be their teacher. Students in fourth grade are really preparing for a middle school transition in just two years. One way to best prepare them is to help them stay organized. Chair pockets will allow students to have ample room to keep all of their materials. Having less items in their desk will allow for rapid transitions. Star student work will shine in our room! Another way to prepare students is to help them work on presentation. The supplies will help students create a high quality final product. This is a skill that needs to be nurtured and modeled on a continual basis in order to achieve mastery.
needStatement: My students need supplies such as At-Your-Seat Storage Sacks to stay organized and turn in quality work.

name: Chromebooks for Communication, Collaboration, and Creativity
description: I teach at an inner city Chicago Public School on the south side of Chicago. I am a Learning Behavior Specialist, which is a fancy way of saying Special Education teacher. I teach 7th and 8th grade diverse learners for Language Arts and Math. Their disabilities range from high-incidence to low-incidence and each child has a unique IEP (Individual Education Plan). My students face many challenges living in a poverty-stricken neighborhood. Additionally, there is an increase in violence and gang activity right outside their homes. Despite their adversities, all of my students come to school everyday, eager to learn and their curious minds are my motivation. I am excited for this school year and all the adventures that lie ahead. We are a STEM school and our mission is to enrich our students in all areas of science, technology, engineering, and math. Our world has become increasingly centered around technology. Many jobs today require hands-on experience with various forms of technology. In order for my students to be college and career ready, I want them to have daily access to technology in their classroom. I want to have a virtual Google Classroom where we can collaborate, communicate, and use our creativity for various tasks including research projects and the engineering design process. My students all have special needs and the Chromebooks will help them to reach their full potential. I want to integrate the Chromebooks into daily learning so they attain proficiency in using various Google applications. To do all of that, we need these Chromebooks!
needStatement: My students need Chromebooks to enrich their daily education through technology.

name: Multiplication Masters
description: My students are special because they are what make our school great! Students that attend this school are predominately Latino and low income, but there is a small European and Asian population. The families are caring and extremely hardworking. They have much fondness for the school and generations of families have been attending it since its infancy. Smiling faces fill this building daily and it's an amazing experience to witness it as a teacher. It's a great place to work and a wonderful place to learn!These materials will make a difference in my students' learning and improve their school lives because all students need to memorize their times tables by the end of third grade and these flashcards will help them do just that. Having this class set of flashcards enables students to practice multiplying in the classroom with a buddy or even by themselves. My students LOVE quizzing each other on their times tables so it's an enjoyable activity for them. Usually my students make their own flashcards however this year I have a lot of diverse learners in my classroom and it may be a challenge for some students to create them. As you can see, these flashcards are important for my students to have!
needStatement: My students need multiplication flashcards to help them memorize their times tables.

name: Tolerance With Technology
description: My students are very energetic and love to do hands-on activities. They are very social and are still learning how to interact with their peers. My students love to learn through movement and play. Although my students differ in where they are with their educational needs, they are very supportive and push their peers to be the best they can be. As a class, we love learning together in fun and engaging ways. We love our Kindergarten family and all the fun things that we do! These iPads will be used daily as a center. The work that the students will be doing through these iPads will be specific to their needs. Sometimes students will be using them to help them learn their letters and numbers. Other times they will be using them to learn important life lessons such as being kind, sharing, and treating others the way they would like to be treated. Technology is important in todays society. It is important for me to teach my students skills that they need for everyday life. These devices will give me the opportunities to teach my students these important lessons and many more!
needStatement: My students need ipads to use during their daily 5 centers. Many kindergarteners have used iPads before and they know how to use them properly. These iPads will help me differentiate instruction to reach student needs.

name: Visual Literacy to Promote Lifelong Reading
description: My students are an amazing group of 5th graders who inspire me every day with their enthusiasm and dedication to learning. They are passionate about becoming involved in the world around them, and what better way to continue to encourage them than to provide technology for them to use in the classroom? I'm always looking for ways to challenge their thinking and to invigorate their love of learning. Best of all, they show up to class eager and excited to find out what is in store for them that day! We live in a visual society, so it only makes sense that children are drawn to visual media. Graphic novels are the first choice for many of my visual learners, yet I have a very limited amount in my classroom library. Comic books not only boost confidence in students who are at a lower reading level, but also boost reading and language skills. Visuals are also very beneficial to ESL students in aiding their English language development. I believe that making meaning out of reading with the aid of visuals may be the best way to become a lifelong reader. TOON books aim to introduce more children to the pleasure of comics while supporting teachers with effective teaching tools to promote visual literacy. I often see students skim the pages or speed through reading. When reading comics, I see them slow down and look at the images and text to fully ingest what's happening in the plot.
needStatement: My students need a variety of graphic novels to promote and continue their transformation into becoming lifelong readers.

name: Happy and Healthy Me!
description: My students are preschool age children with special educational needs . They have varying educational labels such as emotional disturbed, autistic, health impaired and intellectually disabled. Well to me they are just kids not that different their age peers in other classrooms . I teach in Milwaukee where students receive free breakfast and lunch daily . Many of my students have limited language skills so we try to incorporate hands on lessons to expand their learning. Our classroom is shared with another special education 'class' so space is limited .  Our students are among the youngest children in the building and our school serves ages 3 to 14. My classroom serves preschool aged young children with a variety of special needs such as autism, developmental delays, vision or hearing loss, learning disabilities and / or health impairments. Like all people, when we look our best we feel our best . A majority of my students have self-help and self-care as part of their school goals. Basics like healthy grab and go snacks, tissues, hand wash, cleaning products and personal combs help us with our daily self help and self care needs.
needStatement: My students need items, such as wipes, cleaner, and snacks, that promote good health and good hygiene.

name: Operation Author: Adding Tech to 2nd Grade Writing
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. My students are creative, energetic and eager to learn! Many of my students are being raised in single parent households, by grandparents, or foster parents and they all receive a free breakfast and lunch based on their socioeconomic status. These things may prevent them from getting ahead early in life and may not provide them with the life experiences many of us see as 'typical'. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their potential and growth while they are with me. I may not be able to control their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. By doing this in a creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our earliest learners to continue on a path of academic excellence. Writing has always been of great interest to me but, unfortunately, it is often a struggle for the young people in my second grade classroom. While our district stresses the importance of writing, and opportunities for writing abound in our curriculum, technology to assist in publishing, adding graphics, and color printing are either scarce or shared between many classes in the building. On many occasions, I have found myself bringing students' work home to print on my color printer or going to a local office supply store to get things printed. With the supplies I've requested, I will be able to set up a dedicated writing center in my classroom. It will allow the students to feel like authors...to be able to use proofing and editing tools, add illustrations, and print their finished work on the spot...and in color, not from a black and white copier! Your help in funding my project would mean a great deal to some wonderful kids who would truly benefit from the motivation provided by an opportunity to publish like a pro!
needStatement: My students need a laptop, printer, and ink for exposure to technology and the ability to publish their work.

name: Bouncing Back from Hurricane Harvey
description: My classroom is a very busy place with 25 kindergarteners! 😁 They love carpet time, calendar, the reading corner and centers. Due to hurricane Harvey we lost the carpet, books from the library and center supplies that make their learning possible. The reading corner is one of their favorite places and the carpets, bean bags and books were damaged in the flood. Books and reading are so important on the kindergarten level! Trying hard to rebuild so these kids can have a great year!We won't let hurricane Harvey stop us. We will rebuild and push on and have a great year! This is the 3rd time in 4 years that our school has flooded! Harvey has been the worst! Trying to rebuild the reading corner, carpet area, library and centers so these children can grow and thrive this year. These busy little five year olds live to learn and these materials will help to keep them engaged and interested. Reading and books are so important for kindergarten and I lost my entire library! Helping fund this project would be greatly appreciated by myself and my students!
needStatement: My students need a carpet, a listening center, books, and beanbag seats that were lost to hurricane Harvey! Rebuilding to come back even stronger!

name: Learning Through Music: Early Childhood Special Education
description: The Early Childhood Special Education students that attend my class are ages 3 to 5 years old. They come from a variety of cultural and language backgrounds. My students attend an ECSE class because they have a variety of needs that have resulted in Developmental Delays. Students in this class have needs ranging from: medical needs, physical impairments, language delays or inability to speak, Autism, and a range of social and behavioral challenges. About 85% percent of students at my school qualify for Free and Reduced Lunch/Meals. Donations to this project will help fund Learning Through Music groups for 15 weeks in our classroom. During Learning Through Music, students will learn academic and arts concepts that are embedded into the music activities (instrument play, singing, finger plays, sensory/relaxation, and movement). The students will also have the opportunity to transfer skills practiced and learned during music group to the classroom as the teacher and special education aides will also participate in the learning. I have welcomed Music Therapists from this organization into my classroom for the past 2 year and I have witnessed the great gains that my students have made in communication skills as well as learning general content knowledge. Every student I have had in class has benefitted from participating in music therapy! This year this project will reach two Early Childhood Special Education classes with a total of 16 students.
needStatement: My students need music therapy to enhance their learning and to help them to develop language and communication skills.

name: Itty Bitty Budding Biologists Buggin' Out On Environmental Education
description: My students are the smallest in the school, but often have the biggest aspirations like being dinosaurs, police officers, superheroes, doctors, veterinarians and princesses! These students are from all backgrounds, Somali, Hispanic, Caucasian, Vietnamese and African American. They are predominantly immigrant children of taxi drivers, daycare providers, manual laborers, and other proud hard-working parent pathways. My little learners are exploring and discovering fantastical facts about nature and the world around us. We are scientists, researchers, botanists, biologists and often just observers reflecting and collaborating about the awesome amazements we've witnessed in our environmental playgrounds. Memories & experiences that will excite and invite us to take an interest in STEM or specialized environmental career paths as we grow our minds and bodies. These materials make all the difference in my students' learning about the environment around them because it makes them want to learn and even better--not even realize that they're also receiving cross-curricula, standards-based instruction. While learning about communities, we will investigate ant farms and how an ant colony is built by different colony members doing different jobs. This will be impactful in that the students can transfer what they are seeing our little ant colonies doing to what some of the people do in their own community. The students also learn about butterfly life cycles and with the butterfly farm they will get to transform the read alouds and paper-based activities to a real world context as they witness first hand the process of a caterpillar transforming into a butterfly. They'll have grubby hands and engaged brains! Brains processing all the weird, funky, fun facts about the various living things serving as the catalyst for schematic development, and an exuberant love for science in their environment. These materials will help turn our humble classroom into an enthralling environmental laboratory where we don our imaginary lab coats and goggles while we wonder, hypothesize, observe and investigate the many interesting things in our classroom 'lab'.
needStatement: My students need an ant farm and a butterfly kit to expose them to grubby hands, dirty fingers, wide eyed, laughter inducing LIVE nature-derived, environmental learning experiences that teach them about life cycles, and how animals work together in nature.

name: Color Makes the Brain Happy: Redesigning Lab Handouts in Color
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things relevant and provide my students with meaningful learning experiences that will prepare them for exciting careers in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Math)! Our school has a high minority population, a high proportion of ELL students, and a majority of student who live in poverty--these are the students who are typically underrepresented in STEM careers. That doesn't mean that they aren't bright, talented, and eager to learn. Daily, I see my students engage and deepen their understanding of core science, engineering, and math standards in my class. Daily, I see my students engage in inquiry and critical thinking. They deserve to see themselves as future scientists, engineers, and tinkerers. We live in an area of the country where companies often hire immigrants to fill high-tech jobs because there are not enough young people going into STEM careers. I want to make sure that my amazing students have every opportunity to experience STEM in the classroom so we can reverse this trend. Recently, I attended a conference session where the presenter offered up a basic question: would you rather look at a black and white handout with just text, or an engaging, full-color handout with graphics, pictures, and less text? The answer was obvious, and this has some pretty drastic consequences for our students, many of whom struggle when asked to read instructions on lab handouts. Students who struggle with reading, or are learning English, or who have learning disabilities often can't meaningfully interact with text. This creates a challenge during labs where students need to refer to written instructions. Having a color printer would allow me to redesign our lab handouts so that they would be colorful and immediately engaging to all students. More graphics and less text would also allow our students to have visual cues on the page and find information easier. Finally, research shows that color helps increase memory, engagement, and increases participation--all factors that can improve in any class! Thanks so much for your consideration of my project!
needStatement: My students need a color printer and toner so lab handouts and instructions can be visually engaging.

name: Help Create the Dream Reading Center
description: I have taught middle school for the last four years, however, I am now in for a new adventure. These 4th and 5th graders are very different and unique. I am enjoying learning from them. They are Oglala Lakota from Wounded Knee. They are ambitious and excited to succeed, and I believe with the right guidance and the support of their families and community they can achieve their dreams. I'm excited to see how much we can achieve this year. As a kid most of us loved reading. Before cable, cellphones, xboxes, and ipads we had books. Books helped change many of our lives. Today, there are so many distractions that are preventing our children from reading. I want to create a space where students are looking forward to their independent reading time. The light will be used to create an at home corner where students can sit and read. The bean bag chairs will be used by the students to have a comfortable seat to sit on instead of a chair. The light and bean bag chais will help the students have the best environment to read. The school has already purchased a rug and bookshelves. However, I know the seating will help make a welcoming environment and help the students be more excited to read.
needStatement: My students need 6 bean bag chairs and 2 floor lamps

name: Cool Classroom for Cruz
description: My students are ELL students who have been in the country for a short time in most cases. The majority of my students are refugees. I teach in a public urban school district in Minnesota that is 92% free and reduced lunch. My students are special because they are incredibly motivated to learn. These students deserve to feel comfortable, focused, and ready to learn. They will be better prepared to learn if the temperature is cooler in the room. :)We are going through construction at my school for the next three years. My room is in a former book closet which has no classroom door to the hallway. There is no air circulation in my room and after the first day, I don't know if the temperature in the room will be bearable. Please help us stay cool! There is no AC in my school. Also, my room is quite small so I will have to find ways to better manage the space so that I can stay organized. I want my classroom to be a comfortable and welcoming place. Right now it feels like a tiny, hot book closet with tables and chairs in it.
needStatement: My students need a comfortable learning space! We need a cooling device in my classroom which is a former book closet! 30 students in a book closet is not fun!

name: I Survived Books Need Rescue (Again)
description: My school is in a rural community setting with a high migrant population. We are also a high poverty community. The school library is the main library that my students use. My school has Kindergarten through 8th grade. Most of my students come from hard working families that may not be able to afford books at home or have the time to go to the public library. My students are great readers. It is a challenge to keep books in the library for them to read. Funds are limited as in every school. My students want to read the books they see in stores but are unable to purchase. The school library is their way to get to those books. They are well deserving students that are hopefully turning into life long readers. My students absolutely love the 'I Survived' series by Lauren Tarshis. We have them all in paperback and they have been much read and loved to the point where they are beyond taping. I use tape to make them last but it is time to ask for some help in getting hardbacks. I don't see the interest my students have for this series waning as we are anxiously awaiting the next book in the series. They are excellent adventure books with true history facts in the story. My students are improving their reading skills while learning historical facts without even knowing it. The series has also led some of my students to want to read more non-fiction books about the read historical events. I cannot say enough good things about this series.
needStatement: My students need books from the 'I Survived' series in hardback. The series is written by Lauren Tarshis. They love this series and our paperback copies have been taped and re-taped.

name: Harvey Is Out of Here, Let's Read On!
description: I am a teacher at a low-income/high poverty Title I school, meaning that the majority of our students receive free/reduced lunch. We have recently lost lots of teacher and student supplies to Hurricane Harvey due to flooding. Currently our school is flooded; we will not return until further notice. I want to create a safe, inviting, and loving environment for them by offering various supplies to assist them to become successful. The children may not understand the devastating damage around, but they can connect with someone who will make them feel safe at school. These materials will help increase our reading fluency and comprehension. Due to Hurricane Harvey, we lost most of our books. The books and games will be used not only in the classroom but at home as well to share with their families their love for reading. We are a strong community and no storm will stop our learning and love of reading. The books that I am requesting are to begin our process of healing. The books will put smiles on our faces and the writing materials will allow us to write about the good, the bad, and ugly of Hurricane Harvey of 2017.
needStatement: My students need leveled books and other items since I lost all our books due to Hurricane Harvey.

name: Book Bins!
description: My students learn every day through inquiry and multiple means of representation. They love exploring different ways to solve one problem; they think outside the box when finding solutions. In our classroom, we like to not only learn by listening, but also by seeing and doing. My students not only learn from me, but they learn from each other and themselves. My students are curious and eager to learn! With teamwork and perseverance, they can accomplish anything they set their minds to in my class! My students spend at LEAST 25 minutes each day independently reading. It is a very important part of the day where students learn to love reading and practice good reading habits. During this reading time, students are reading books that are at an appropriate level for them. This ensures they are not reading books that are too easy or challenging for them. My students self select 5 books each week at their level! They then store them in personal book bins for safe and easy keeping. Currently we have book bins but two major issues, most of them are falling apart and we only have 21, and there are 24 students in our class! My students deserve the best supplies and should not be using bins that are falling apart and that have been written on. Three of them are also temporarily using cardboard! My students desperately need and deserve new book bins!!
needStatement: My students need book bins to store their leveled books in!

name: Classroom Carpet for Community Learning
description: Our students come from diverse backgrounds and families. Students speak a multitude of languages including English, Spanish, Vietnamese, Mandarin, Cantonese, Tagalog, Somali and Arabic. Some students have parents who attended our school as children while others have just arrived in the country. Almost 80% of our students qualify for free or reduced lunch. We see the diversity of our students’ home cultures as part of the richness of our school and strive to create a place that is inclusive and inviting for all families. As an international school we focus on the importance of global citizenship and democratic leadership in our classrooms. Our students strive to understand the world and their place in it. Gathering together on the carpet is an essential part of elementary education. Students learn and grow by working together and being in close proximity to the book or lesson being shared. Sitting together on the carpet is great opportunity to build language skills. The classroom carpet is also the place to sit together to solve problems and to celebrate our achievements during classroom meetings. Having a defined, designated place to sit also helps to create a sense of belonging and importance. Students will be set up for success by knowing exactly where to go, and we will not waste instructional time with redirection to an unclear location.
needStatement: My students need a classroom rug for read alouds, group lessons and community classroom meetings.

name: The Foundation of Learning Starts with the Space You're In
description: Our school is an authorized Primary Years Program of the prestigious International Baccalaureate organization. This means that our students focus on acquiring the skills of thinking, social action, communication, research and self-management. Our school is in the heart of a Promise neighborhood, which provides programs to improve educational outcomes for students in distressed urban neighborhoods. 88% of our students qualify for free and reduced lunch and 22% of our students are English Language learners. Our students are dedicated to becoming life long learners through the supportive and safe atmosphere that teachers create!The foundation of learning starts with the space you're in. My students are active learners and are in need of a carpet that provides them with enough space for them to feel they can be engaged and motivated. My students deserve a safe, comfortable and personal space to learn in. Currently I own a small carpet that can fit about 10 of my 27 students bodies comfortably on it, therefore requiring the rest of them to sit on the hard floor surrounding the carpet. As of now, my students' main focus has been more on fighting for a shared spot on the small carpet than being able to learn successfully.
needStatement: My students need a 30 square carpet in order for them to all have a space to sit.

name: Technology for Reading and Math!
description: I have some of the most incredible, hardworking students you will ever meet. Every day they are willing to try new things and learn everything they can. My students strive to do their best in everything that they do. Having more technology in the classroom will benefit them daily as they will be able to use it for many things. It will offer them the ability to discover new ideas using technology and will increase their curiosity to learn. It will offer them valuable experiences. Having more Chromebooks in the classroom will enhance my students in many ways. First, it will offer them the opportunity to have technology every day while they improve their reading and math strategies. Secondly, it will offer them the ability to research different subjects that spark their personal interests. Lastly, it will offer them many opportunities to engage in reading and math websites that will encourage their curiosity. Chromebooks are essential for students in today's world. By having these Chromebooks in my classroom, it will offer my students access to many things that broaden their horizons. It will offer them a chance to explore many resources.
needStatement: My students need more technology in the classroom. I would love to add 5 more Chromebooks to our classroom.

name: Making Math Meaningful To Young Minds
description: We love to learn! My first graders are working hard every day, and so am I! These six and seven year olds are learning to read, have become writers and have made big gains in math. We are busy all day long, and there's still much to do. My students are in first grade, and love coming to school to learn!They come from a wide variety of living situations. Some come from two parent homes, some from single parents, and some with multiple generations, or multiple families living in one apartment. Some of my students speak English fluently, and some do not. Some of my students come from families who support public education and encourage their students to do their best while at school. While at school, I hold high expectations for each student in their behavior and their academics, no matter their home life. We learn together, we work through problems together, and we celebrate successes together. Helping my students learn the skills of reading and math will help them for their entire lives.I teach math daily and the students will use these materials both in morning tubs to start their day using their math brains, and in small groups to review concepts that they've learned in class. These games and materials such as Magna-Tiles, dominoes, and flash cards will be very interesting to the children, and will help them gain valuable math skills. My students come with a variety of math skills, and these materials will allow me to differentiate work stations, and give me more time with students who need help in small groups. As a teacher, it is my job to make sure my students are learning everything they need to know. It is also my job as a teacher to make learning fun and meaningful. These games and materials will allow the children to have fun while reviewing taught skills, thus building their number sense and their math knowledge.
needStatement: My students need math games and math materials such as Magna-Tiles, dominoes, and flash cards to use daily to enrich their math brains and experiences with numbers to build their computation skills.

name: Comprehension and Fluency the Fun Way!
description: As a special education teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to find resources that will help me provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences! My students are caring, sweet and hard-working students who deserve to have all the supplies and resources needed in order to have a successful school year. Please help me make these students' dreams come true!I am requesting various ELA games and cards. These games and practice cards will allow my students to strengthen their comprehension, fluency and retelling skills. I really feel that these items will be a fun, interactive and engaging way to reach my students in both reading and writing. These items will help develop skills in reading literature, key ideas and details, craft and structure, and integration of knowledge and ideas. My class deserves to have all the supplies and resources needed in order to have a successful school year. The games and cards will be used during our ELA block. They will be used in grades K-5. The games will be used in SETSS as well as during daily small group.
needStatement: My students need interactive practice cards, magnetic charts and story tiles to build comprehension and fluency!

name: Explore, Think & Connect
description: Our school is located in St. Paul, Minnesota. It serves students from very diverse backgrounds. My students are very curious about the world that we live in and ask questions like, why is math important? We work hard every day to make sure that they go home having answered that questions. They enjoy interacting with each other and are very tech savvy. They are open to new ideas and challenges and are willing to take risks while learning. Mistakes are something that are valued as learning opportunities. Students naturally enjoy exploring objects around them. I want to take that curiosity and build on it by making the study of mathematics tangible, relevant, approachable and attainable. From there, students begin making connections to bigger and more abstract ideas in mathematics. Our district is making a huge shift in our current math practices and are moving from procedural teaching towards a more conceptual approach to allow students to explore and make more meaningful connections. In order for these connections to take place, we are in need of the materials that students need to begin making them. We are polishing our problem-solving skills and one of the strategies we use is for students to visualize the problem they are solving in an open number line. The whiteboards that have them drawn already will be a huge time-saver and will do wonders for us being able to keep them consistent. I have also asked for other manipulatives like rectangles for helping us calculate the area of quadrilaterals and foam cubes to help visualize volume in 3D. We have the future of our country sitting in our classroom - let's make them fall in love with math!
needStatement: My students need math manipulatives, white boards, and graphing boards to connect their everyday tangible world to ideas that are more abstract in nature.

name: Young People, Can You Hear Me?
description: Teaching young people who simply want to be recognized, accepted, and praised make going into work a daily worthwhile choice. Fortunately, my students are those young people! They are some of the most creative, enthusiastic, and awesome people in the world! 'Ohh, I get it now!' is one of my favorite phrases to hear from my students. The pride in their faces and the boost in interest when the lightbulb comes on is a moment my students and I both look forward to. Serving students who chiefly reside in poverty-ridden neighborhoods, where formal education is not always held in high regard, has the potential to create an obstacle. That obstacle, however, is commonly overcome with earnest compassion and support. Innovatively inspiring our students to learn is the daily mission at my school. As a teacher in the Ninth Grade Academy, many of my students are constantly being introduced to new ways of learning. Every teaching technique is purposed to not only teach common high school subject matter but is also designed to teach acceptable social and work ethic skills. Personalized and self-paced learning has become one of the new leading instructional methods at my school. Having individual headphones for each student will help promote this style of learning. Between the 'Wait, I didn't get that' and 'Hurry up so we can move on' from one student to another, teaching classes larger than 25 students using the traditional method of whole class direct instruction becomes very cumbersome. I want my classroom to be a space where each student can be comfortable learning at their own pace without feeling rushed or slowed by other students. Having a class set of headphones allows me to offer each student the tools they need to actively participate in the learning environment I am aiming to create. When I can offer each student a pair of headphones, I am also offering them a sense of control by allowing them to stop, pause, and rewind any part of the lesson for any reason. Creating Educreations video lessons personalizes the lesson and gives students control on how quickly or slowly they obtain the information I am presenting. Educreations videos eliminate students idly waiting around or completing 'busy work' while others are finishing assignments they have already completed. Video lessons eliminate those issues by allowing students to move through the course content at their own pace. Navigating lessons at a comfortable pace.
needStatement: My students need headphones to watch the video lessons I create on Educreations in order to promote personalized and self-paced learning.

name: The 'Fine' Things in Life
description: My students are 4th through 6th graders with special needs. All of my students receive occupational therapy support to help with fine motor abilities and sensory needs. We also work often on learning how to calm down and relax when a student gets upset or overwhelmed by something at school. Many things that we work on throughout the day are things that others take for granted. The ability to express one's emotions and self-regulate are difficult skills to teach and often require additional materials that are not always available in a typical classroom. My students need more materials to help with their fine motor skills. Fine motor tasks, such as writing, can quickly get boring and exhausting. Having more creative ways to strengthen these skills will help students be excited to work on these tasks and make writing easier in the future. Magnetic shapes and letter beads can help with math concepts and spelling skills while strengthening the muscles needed for fine motor tasks such as writing and cutting. Scooper tongs and suction cups require a lot of strength to make them work and are less frustrating to practice with because they are fun! I am working hard to create a space that is calming and relaxing for students when they need a sensory break or materials to help self-regulate their emotions. Have a soft place to sit and calming items are the best way to teach students how to calm themselves down when they are overwhelmed or upset. A beanbag is a perfect place to plop in to when you're upset or overwhelmed-we do not have any other soft spots to sit! The timers are a great tool that the students can use on their own to determine how much time they can take in the break area without an adult having to start and monitor a digital timer (and it is calming to watch the sand fall!). Have you ever been frustrated or upset and needed a big hug? Or wrapped yourself tightly in a blanket? This is exactly what the body sock does for my students and is a great item to have available for students to crawl in to when they have
needStatement: My students need materials such as Giant Sand Timers, Big Joe chairs and Body Sox to help them with fine motor, sensory, and self regulation skills.

name: Espresso Yourself Coffee Cart
description: Our students receive Special Education Services including Speech Therapy and/or Occupational Therapy. This collaborative project will help us better serve our students through Integrated Comprehensive Services outside of the therapy room. The students on our caseloads are children with disabilities. Our students have difficulty with social communication skills & executive functioning skills. Positive social interactions are critical to success. Our students are working to improve their understanding and use of language while learning to improve the social components of communication (verbal and non-verbal skills which dictate interactions). We serve students with a wide range of disabilities, including cognitive disabilities, emotional disturbance, autism spectrum disorder & specific learning disabilities. Staff in my building LOVE coffee to start their day. They often stop for a morning cup of joe on the way to work. Staff need coffee & my students need to improve their social communication skills . With coffee cart supplies, they will begin their own business: 'Espresso Yourself', a student-run coffee cart. My students' coffee cart business will help them practice important life skills such as: money management, how to start and maintain conversations, how to listen, how to ask questions for clarification and increased independence. Students will take orders from the Staff at our Elementary School, will make coffee, customize coffees based on each customer's order and will deliver coffee.
needStatement: My students need supplies for their Coffee Cart business to help improve their social communication skills.

name: Books for Bilingual Readers
description: My students come from all different backgrounds. High income, low income, suburban, urban. Some are native Spanish speakers and some are native English speakers. The one thing they all have in common is that they all went to a Spanish immersion elementary school. They are bright kids, all on their way to being fully bilingual and biliterate in English and Spanish. Some are even trilingual at this point! My students will be excellent additions to the future workforce, both in the U.S. and internationally. My students are at all different levels in their Spanish acquisition and have different taste in reading material. Often teachers have to choose a book to read as a class that is appropriate for the average student. This often leaves some students unchallenged, some overwhelmed and others uninterested in chosen text. These books will provide my students more choices to stimulate their interest in reading independently. This will provide texts that are engaging and at the appropriate level for all students and helps them to feel successful and achieve growth. Having many books to choose from helps make reading fun rather than a chore.
needStatement: My students need books in Spanish that interest them for independent reading.

name: STEAM the DREAM!
description: My students are so amazing! Each morning I am joyful that I have the chance to go to work and teach them! My students are always happy and show much concern for me and their peers. I am greeted each morning with many smiles, hugs, and loving notes. I have students that are genuinely interested in learning about the world and all that it entails. As the world progresses, my desire is to teach my students 21st Century skills so that they can thrive and be successful throughout their academic career. In the past, studies have shown an enormous lack of students graduating from college and entering into careers such as science, technology, engineering, art and music. However, in present time, STEAM jobs are in high demand. While these jobs are in high demand, the challenge is finding qualified candidates to fill the positions.I believe if I introduce the numerous facets of STEAM, students will be more knowledgeable about its details, what they entail, and prompt their curiosity. My students will use the Legos to invent structures that we have read about in various fiction and non-fiction books. Students will be given differentiated tasks to invent or create structures based on their own imagination. The STEM gadgets that I am requesting will be used for the same tasks as well. Finally, the beatbox will be used to teach about engineering and how it is used not only to govern electricity but also in the music and instruments that are heard on a daily basis. Students will be able to explore a small portion of music production using the beatbox. Having these materials will transform my classroom into an interactive space where learning is not just taking place, but children are having fun feeding their interests.
needStatement: My students need to explore STEAM content more. STEAM stands for Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Music...studies have shown that there is a high demand for STEAM jobs, but not enough people to fill the positions.

name: Room to Learn!
description: My school is 88% free or reduced price lunch recipients, and that percentage is quickly rising. 49% of the students at my school identify as Asian, 26% identify as African American, 14% identify as Hispanic, 10% identify as Caucasian, and 1% identify as American Indian. My classroom is rich with diversity and we celebrate each student's identity and culture. I have 27 motivated 4th grade students. They come to school each day ready to learn. We use the latest technology to provide personalized instruction to target each students needs. We need a larger rug because there are too many kids on the carpet and it feels like we're sitting on a bag of chips and we're all crunched up! We need more space because it is hard to sit in a circle for our morning meeting. Morning Meeting is where we gather to greet each other and to begin our day. When we are so squished we get distracted and it is harder to learn. We have 27 students right now and we don't all fit on our small rug. Thank you for thinking about our classroom.
needStatement: My students need a large carpet to gather on as a classroom community.

name: Chairs Engage the Mind and Core
description: I am a special education teacher at a Chicago Public School. My students learn in unique ways. They benefit from various modes of teaching, i.e. experiential, visual, and auditory. As middle school students, they have a slew of social and emotional changes going on in their lives, and I try to make academic growth as accessible as possible. My students are hard working, and eager to attend high school. They recognize that they need more support than their peers, and still try to learn as mus as possible before taking the next step to high school. The exercise ball chairs will allow my students that have difficulty sitting still remain seated and focused on school work. Some of my students can physically not remain still, but with the support of these chairs, they can sit comfortably at their tables or desks. Learning is already difficult for my students, they need to be in a physical environment that will support their ability to grow academically. Other students, that have gross motor differences will also benefit from these chairs. The exercise balls will help build core and lower back strength, while also supporting leg muscle development. These chairs will make students eager to come to class.
needStatement: My students need chairs that allow their bodies to move, to help them focus.

name: Baby It's Cold Outside!
description: Our school is now a STEAM Academy, but we have students who come from high poverty homes. We love to see the students engaged in their education as we complete hands-on activities in all areas of learning. We integrate our lessons with Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, and Math. Students are not only learning the third grade curriculum, but learning the skills they need in the twenty-first century. As we have better technology and resources, we still need winter items. Sweaters will help our class stay warm as it gets colder. My students are in need of school uniform sweaters. Most students need these inside the classroom due to fluctuating temperatures. They also need them as a second layer outside once winter comes. The sweaters will help my students stay warm as well as keep them healthy. When our students do not have proper clothing to wear at school, they usually miss a few days later. My students are unable to spend money on extra clothing that isn't usually necessary. When my students get these sweaters they will feel comfortable and achieve their basic need of warmth in the colder months.
needStatement: My students need school uniform sweaters. The colder weather is coming!

name: Melody To Memory
description: My students attend school in Texas. They are creatively driven and focused on Choosing Kind. As fourth graders, they are at a phase in their life where they are becoming more independent and ready to discover and build upon their talents! The kids I work with are extremely empathetic and driven to make the world a better place. This project will open their minds to what is possible in the realm of school. As we say everyday, 'Let's create something great!'Since the beginning of the school year, my students have expressed the desire to create music and perform. I thought it would be a great opportunity for the students to incorporate music into learning by having a classroom keyboard. I play the piano and would love to play for them and encourage them to create their own jingles or lyrics to a preset tune. I know my students would be totally enthralled by a classroom keyboard, and I've always wanted to make it an integral part of my classroom environment as well! I hope to make this dream a reality.
needStatement: My students need a musical outlet to express their talents and to learn new skills! Coming up with jingles or putting their knowledge to song will enhance engagement and understanding!

name: Flexible Seating for a Healthy Child and an Active Brain.
description: Loving, sweet, unique, full of energy. Those are just a few words to describe my students. They are so diverse in culture, backgrounds, and strengths and weaknesses. The school fosters education to 90% of students who are in the poverty index and all of the students receive free lunch. The school I work in is such a unique school in that they get extra support for the students who need it, this includes ESOL, family outreach, Special Education services, speech therapy, and more. Our students are in great need in a variety of areas but the school shows time and time again that they do their best to help these students grow in a safe positive environment. Although they are all different and come from low economic backgrounds they walk in the classrooms full of spirit ready to learn. Many of my students are limited in what they can do at home. Most of them don't have books at home or internet access. Some of them are limited in the English language but they continue to work hard. My students show me that they are in need of amazing unique learning opportunities that will help foster a love for education. I can't imagine what it's like to have so much energy you can hardly sit. That is how some of my students feel on a daily basis. With this flexible seating option I hope to help my students that have ADHD and my students who are just really fidgety have a little more movement even when they're sitting. This can help them focus on what I am teaching and help them stay on task when it's time to independently work. The benefits of these stability chairs go from better posture to a relaxed environment. It would help my students in everyday tasks.
needStatement: My students need a flexible seating option that helps them stay focused and comfortable.

name: Math Games Galore!
description: My students are walking into a bright fun brand new classroom and learning how to be ALL day learners. They are eager, excited, and ready to get the school year on it's way. My first graders are active, happy, empathetic students. They are full of creative ideas, make the best stories, and LOVE to explore. They like structures and routines, and want to know what is happening next or exactly how to complete a task. We spend a lot of time together to create a strong classroom community. We learn together that as a team anything is possible!My first graders play LOTS of games. We use a lot of materials to play math games, but one thing in particular that we make are game boards. Having a quality printer in my classroom will make the game making process quicker and easier to print off math games and materials for my students. The unifix cubes will help them play the math games I would be able to print off on the printer. My students would benefit greatly from having these materials to play fun math games with each other. Partner learning is an important piece of first grade! With your help I can make and print these games off right in the classroom to have ready for my students!
needStatement: My students need math materials like unifix cubes and a quality printer to print off and play math games.

name: Flex Seating to Flex Thinking!
description: I am first year teacher at a small school in Texas. I teach 4th grade ELAR and Social Studies. Two classes rotate through my classroom and I teach a little over 40 students a day. My students are energetic and eager to learn. However, my students have extremely varied backgrounds and intellectual capabilities. I have many that require accommodations or require different resources. Being a first year teacher is overwhelming, but amazing all at the same time. I am enjoying getting to know my students, identifying their struggles, and pointing them toward success. These flexible seating options would benefit my class greatly with concentration and retention. My students this year are adjusting to a shorter recess, new TEKs and the Writing STAR test. It's very different from the third grade. Many of them are struggling with concentration and working for longer chunks of time. By adding flexible seating in my classroom, my students could be stimulated through their environment and have the ability to concentrate longer. They have been exposed a few types of flexible seating briefly in other classes and have shown a significant difference. Many of my students have a diagnosis that would benefit from flexible seating as well. These supplies would supply each desk a wobble cushion and bouncy band. This would be able to be used by all students during independent and whole group instruction. The balls and stools would allow for students to use flexible seating during small group instruction. They would excite the students about small group time and help me keep the students' attention longer. The longer they can concentrate, the more they can learn.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating to help with concentration and retention. It is also an incentive to use if they are working hard. Some of my students have a diagnosis that would greatly benefit from this.

name: Help Young Kids Become Readers!
description: As a Kindergarten teacher in a diverse, low-income/high poverty school district my students are faced with many challenges in school, as well as at home. Each child is unique in their own way and brings with them a story and background different than their peers. For many, Kindergarten is their first school experience yet they are eager to learn and do their best despite the hardships they may face. My students are caring, warm, bright, and creative. I want to help unleash their excitement for learning how to read. My goal is to instill the love of reading while tapping into their own personal learning styles and help them go on a journey in a great book. I make it my top priority to provide a safe and fun atmosphere where their self-esteem is nurtured and enhanced and self-confidence will grow. It is also important to me to provide multiple opportunities for students to gain information based on their needs and learning styles. Guided reading is the part of our day in which they work in small groups with a teacher. Together, we read books at the students' reading level. Children need books in their class library in order to practice skills independently. For pre-readers this can be challenging if the books are too hard and they become easily frustrated and less motivated to learn how to read. Your contribution will give students an opportunity to become readers at their level and confidence in themselves as readers. My hope is for my class to begin to love books and become life long learners .
needStatement: My students need leveled books (level A, B, C, and D) to use during guided reading group time and independent reading, as well as leveled books for our classroom library.

name: Technology in the Speech Room!
description: I am a bilingual ASHA-certified school-based SLP in Bronx NY. In our school, we serve a unique and multicultural population. I work with children from kindergarten through fifth grade who present a range of deficits specially in reading and literacy. In addition, I also work with English Language Learners who have various challenges and needs. The use of technology can aid in the efficiency of treatment of speech and language disorders by keeping the attention and motivation of the students. It will encourage students to participate and learn in more fun way. Technology has many benefits such as being able to engage students and allowing SLPs additional resources for extra ideas. My students need interactive and fun materials to develop a program to improve their reading, language, listening and phonemic awareness skills. My students need an iPad to experience learning on a different level. Speech Language Pathologist can make a positive difference in the life of a child who presents with speech, language, reading and even social delays. I am trying to incorporate technology into practice by exposing our students to the use of different technologies while working towards their speech and language goals to help our students adapt to a future involving continued use of technology. I feel that addressing multiple learning styles (visual, auditory, kinesthetic and tactile) and building brain connections through a multi-modal approach to instruction, is the best way of teaching our students. The use of the iPad and the projector will help students become more collaborative with each other. The iPad will help my students improve reading/literacy and language skills during speech therapy sessions and will be able to generalize their learning into their classrooms. I have requested materials to improve communication skills in children through the use of technology such as an iPad and a projector. Computer-Based Intervention can be a great help for traditional speech therapy. The use of technology can aid in the efficiency of treatment of speech and language disorders by keeping the attention and motivation of the students. Technology has many benefits such as being able to engage students and allowing SLPs additional resources for extra help and ideas. Children these days love technology and find it more fun and entertaining than listening to the teacher or filling out a worksheet. Anything to keep the students engaged in therapy sessions is worth giving a try.
needStatement: My students need an iPad and a projector. The use of the iPad and the projector will help students become more collaborative with each other. The iPad will help my students improve reading/literacy and language skills.

name: Flexible Seating in Middle School
description: As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to keep things simple and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. My students are creative, clever and very spontaneous. They like to move, they love to create different types of projects. Many of them are being raised in single parent households and receive a free lunch based on their socioeconomic status. These things may prevent them from getting ahead early in life and may not provide them with the life experiences many of us see as 'typical'. From the minute they walk in the door of my classroom I focus on their potential and growth while they are with me. I may not be able to control their home lives, however, I can certainly control their experience during the school day. By doing this in a creative and positive way, I am hopeful to inspire even our middle school learners to continue on a path of academic excellence. Flexible seating allows my students to get their fidgets out while still working. I have visited a classroom like the one in my dreams. Children have choices and flexibility while still learning; structured seating without really being structured. My students are so excited for this change! I have already lowered my desks and purchased floor pillows, and my students love this! They are even willing to donate some of their own pillows and cushions! My next step is to introduce stools and yoga balls in a structured way. I have visited Goodwill and many different yard sales to look for bean bags but those are items that are usually damaged with holes and covered with duct tape. I would love for my students to have nice, clean bean bags.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating in order to concentrate and achieve to the best of their ability.

name: Mathematically Moving
description: The learning communities at SMS is made up of students that come from various walks of life. Of the middle schools within our district, SMS has the largest special education population. Differences and learning styles greatly affect the classroom dynamic, therefore, differentiation through teaching strategies greatly assist with providing students with opportunities for success. Although, our students come to our school with many deficiencies, every teachers' job is to mold and shape them into sharp individuals that possess the necessary skills that are needed to survive in a global society. Students in my class are eager to learn. Through this work bike, students will be allowed different seating options in their learning environment. Students will use the work bike to complete assignments and daily projects. The work bike will assist students with completing their assignments on their chrome books as well traditional paper and pencil. As a STEM accredited school, student engagement in the area of mathematics and technology is promoted. Standard seating with traditional desks can be uncomfortable for students with learning differences. There are a number of students on my team that suffer from ADHD and due to the need for mobility many of these students have difficulty staying seated during instruction. However, with the assistance of a work bike, this growing issue in classrooms can be minimized. My project will make a difference because the classroom environment will be transformed through seating options. The work bike will foster learning for my students by creating an engaging environment.
needStatement: My students need a work bike to create seating options for student success.

name: Continue To WONDER With AUGIE: Crusading Against Bullying and Intolerance
description: Our school is a title I school with 75% minority, a growing ESL population, and 90% qualifying for free/reduced price lunch. Our students come from predominantly single parent homes where survival, and not literacy, is paramount. We have a dedicated, highly professional faculty, yet 'extra' materials that enhance curriculum are not a priority. Most teachers write grants and/or spend their own funds in order to facilitate the basic needs of our children. Our children need to be exposed to authors who deal with issues such as: violence, prejudice, intolerance, and human differences.
