This would be a great way to differentiate instruction discreetly and also keep the students engaged.
needStatement: My students need tablets to read an endless collection of literature to increase vocabulary, write effectively, and speak with more advanced diction.

name: Children New to Minnesota Need Some Minnesota Nice-Warm-Clothes!
description: I have an incredible group of first grade students. They are eager and ready to learn. They are creative, hilarious, and motivated... and they break out in song at least twice per day. I'm not kidding. One student will start humming...then two students...then someone begins to sing the words to whatever song it is, and before you know it, the entire class is singing. They sing through whatever song, and then go back to work. It is the funniest and sweetest thing ever!!! My students love learning, and they live for things that make their learning fun! Our classroom is a safe and joyful place. For many of my students, it is their happiest place. I want to give these students everything they need to continue having an AMAZING year!I have many students who are not prepared for Minnesota winters! Students come to school dressed in wind breakers or heavy sweatshirts in freezing temperatures! Not all families know how to prepare for the frigid temperatures, or do not have the means to provide adequate cold-weather gear. Help children have fun this season by giving them what they need to safely enjoy our Arctic Minnesota winter temperatures! From building igloos and snowmen, to shooting down a hill on a plastic sled - enjoying winter outside is important as a young Minnesotan - and that isn't possible if kids are not prepared!
needStatement: My students need warm winter clothes for the frigid Minnesota winters!

name: 3D printers bring things to life.
description: We are a small school, Clarendon High School, whose enrollment is 205 students in which our district is 100% free and reduced lunch. We are trying to provide technology and critical thinking skills for our students. Many of our students have never left Monroe County except on field trips with the school. I would like the opportunity to take them to colleges, and businesses that depend on technology. This would give them an opportunity to expand their thinking and possible open up career choices for our students. Ty, Leary, Colette, Delana, Laura and Allison were given an idea on using 3D printers to help teachers in the classroom. They have attended conference and witnessed what other schools are doing with technology. They decided to work on getting a 3D printer for the EAST classroom. Students working in EAST Initiative classrooms gain a sense of community and working in groups. When students work with computers and printers they learn a skill that can lead to a career. As a low income community, we don't have the money to buy technology that is new and innovative. We want to be able to print articles to use in the classroom and will help make students understand concepts easier. Teachers can work with students to create items that can be used in the classroom to teach, this will help build repoire. Students will provide visual aides for teachers. Students will work in groups and learn to work as a team. The students will then go out and explain what they are doing and how a 3D printer can help teachers. We will be leaders in the school when we work on computer skills and share our ideas to learn. We really think this project is important to progress our school in technology and the ever changing world. We do a lot of community service projects in Clarendon and the surrounding area and we can use the printer to make trinkets. This project will help with technology issues we have in our school.
needStatement: We need a 3D printer to work on projects to advance their technology skills.

name: Culturally-Relevant Books!
description: My students walk into our classroom every day full of life, ready to learn, and excited for what is in store for them that day. We emphasize in our classroom that we are a TEAM, and teams need every single person to work together to achieve a goal. I want them to know I believe in them, that they can do anything, and should be proud of everything they accomplish. These small humans are amazing, and despite the climate of America right now, they always come to school with smiles and stories to share. They are proud of where they come from and they know that learning is a way to do something important and help others. My classroom is 100% students of color, and a lot of our books don't have characters of color. Books are expensive, and really important in 1st grade! It's important for students of color to be able to see characters that look like them, especially in books about important people doing amazing things. Being able to be inspired and have the courage to grow up and change the world has to start somewhere; and I hope it can start in my first grade classroom. But, students of color need to see characters of color in their reading. My students love reading and books, and I can't wait to see their reaction to new books!
needStatement: My students need to be able to see book characters that look like them!

name: What We Need Is Elephant and Piggie!
description: I have 25 students in my classroom. Twenty-four of my students are students of color. There are six different languages spoken in the classroom. More than half of my students' parents need an interpreter to communicate with me. Most of my students are receive free or reduced-price lunch. We are a trauma-informed school, which means we understand that many of our students come to school with traumatic childhood experiences, and we do whatever we can allow them to be kids at school. Regardless of our adversities and situations, what makes us laugh is Elephant and Piggie! We love the simple and humorous Piggie and Elephant series. We have read, 'I Got a New Toy' and 'I’m Invited to a Party' over and over again, yet it is still so funny! Story time is brings all of us together on the rug to just laugh off our worries and be silly. Students will read if they find books that interest them. Since I introduced these books to them, my students have been looking for them in our small, outdated library. Many times, these books are not available to them because other students also love the books. These fun and easy-to-read books will build reading confidence in many of my low readers. They will enjoy them over and over again. The copies that I have in my room are well-loved. As a reading teacher, I know that these books will help my students love reading. In addition, the age appropriate concepts will allow my English language learners to comprehend the meaning of the texts and laugh along with my English speaking students.
needStatement: My students need a complete set of Elephant and Piggie series.

name: Learning in Collaboration
description: My students, first and foremost, are incredible young people! They are intelligent, funny, compassionate and resilient! We are a racially, ethnically, and economically diverse school. Our demographic breakdown is about 30% African American, 30% Asian/Pacific Islander, 25% Caucasian, and 15% Hispanic. Our free and reduced price lunch students make up 78% of our total population, with another 24% of students receiving Special Education services, and 31% being Multi-Language Learners. My students come from backgrounds as diverse as their demographics: single-parent households, lower-income, homeless, abuse, mental health issues, and others come with very little trauma to face. Honestly, many of my students struggle, some with previously mentioned issues, many with academics. I am grateful to be able to share this time with them and to support their growth and independence. Together, we work together to learn, play, grow, and create a community of hope and respect in the classroom. Our school has had overenrollment by 89 students, which is excellent, yet challenging. As a result, we are short on space, materials and resources. Moving forward, we are focusing on a collaborative learning environment that is inclusive, positive, respectful and engaging for all students. Having stacking stools in class will take up little space and have an immense impact on how students will come together to be a team. It would have great impact on how they will work with each other. The card stock allows me to provide materials needed for students to complete their projects, themes, and cycles without having to ask their parents for them. The decks of cards are not just cards, they will become math activities that teach teamwork, group work and math concepts such as integers and number sense.
needStatement: My students need stacking stools to work in a small groups, bright white card stock for themes and cycles, and decks of cards for math activities.

name: Exploring the Outdoors: One Unforgettable Field Trip
description: Our school serves students in grades K-5 and focuses on working together to develop lifelong learners and responsible citizens. We provide special education, academic intervention, Title I, and ESL services. As a fifth grade educator, I have observed many success stories of students who challenge themselves, raising their expectations to higher levels, take on more responsibility, and become independent students. My goal is to prepare my students for middle school, leaving them with a passion, excitement for learning, and confidence. My diverse fifth grade classroom molds together 28 unique students, many of who come from bilingual households and receive free and reduced-price breakfast and lunch. My students come to school every day eager to learn and put their trust in me. Every student has a unique learning ability, and I want to give each individual the best learning experience by adapting my lessons to meet their individual needs. Incorporating engaging resources and hands-on manipulatives allows my students to work through self-discovery, ultimately leading to abstract reasoning. This educational philosophy, I believe, will promote not only good decision-making in the classroom, but also establish a fundamental lifelong skill. The fifth grade is in need of funding for a field trip to Camp St. Croix. This project would help cover a portion of camp fees for 84 students and 12 adult chaperones. Another fifth grade teacher has already submitted a portion of our funding. Our students attended Camp St. Croix in fourth grade for a day field trip to help build community and teamwork within their classrooms. As a scaffold to last year’s field trip, the fifth grade will be going back to Camp St. Croix for an overnight stay. This will be the first time away from their families overnight for many of our students. Camp St Croix would truly be a once in a lifetime experience as many of our students would not be able to provide the funds given their financial status. Camp St. Croix would truly be a once in a lifetime experience as many of our students would not be able to provide the funds given their financial status. Throughout the trip, students will learn about the diverse wildlife and ecosystems at Camp St. Croix. They will participate in hands-on nature lessons and will be engaged in activities to strengthen teamwork in small and large groups. The field trip will also integrate part of the 5th grade science state standards as the students will also be learning about erosion and renewable and non-renewable energy found in Minnesota. The educational benefits of this experience are endless. Research shows that sound field trip experiences have a highly positive impact on students' science learning. Camp St. Croix would be a lifelong memory for our students as well as open students' eyes both to possibilities in environmental science and their influence on the environment.
needStatement: My students need funds to help support them to go on a two day field trip to learn environmental science standards, learn to work collaboratively, and experience staying in a cabin overnight with peers.

name: These Third Graders Are Thirsty for New Books!
description: These eager students are third graders in a diverse urban school. These kids are gobbling up reading material as fast as we can provide it. Half are English Learners with home languages of Hmong, Spanish, Amharic, Oromo, Somali, and more. All the students are engaged learners and working hard to improve in all academic areas. No matter if they are working at grade level, below or beyond, they are learning and improving every day. Our school's free and reduced lunch rate is about 50%. Many supports are needed to help students get the most out of their school day. The ability to read well is THE most important skill our students are cultivating for success in their future. A large part of our reading curriculum is for students to spend sustained time reading independently. To become better readers, they read! During the students' reading class period and at home, many are motivated to read by current popular titles, graphic novels, non-fiction books on topics of interest, and more. Unfortunately, their classroom library consists mainly of well-used books that are 10 or more years old! This project will help us refresh their classroom library with books these kids WANT to read, at a variety of difficulty levels to serve ALL the reading levels in the classroom. In the pictures you can see some of the titles and topics of interest in their own words.
needStatement: My students need engaging and appropriately-difficult books for independent reading.

name: Books, Books, and More Books!
description: As a first year teacher, I have loved my first class of 28 students this year. We have 20 girls (yes, 20 girls) and 8 boys, so the boys are greatly outnumbered, but we are making a great amount of progress this year. At our school, 99% of the students come from socio-economically disadvantaged families. They all have different goals, dreams, desires, and skills; but they all one common hope for this year: to be further along than where they were at the end of last year. It is no secret: in order to succeed in schooling, one must be able to read and comprehend a wide variety of texts. Too often, students do not have access to books that they truly enjoy reading. Instead, they are expected to be glued to a book that they do not have the slightest bit of interest in. This disinterest in reading leads to a lack of motivation across the board, which results in students reading less, as well as putting forth less effort, culminating in lower student achievement. If students do not hold the necessary skills for literacy, then they are in severe danger of falling behind in school. But, if students are reading books that they find compelling, they are more likely to develop both skills and an enjoyment of reading. This is especially true of students from low-income backgrounds: The most successful way to improve the reading achievement of low-income children is to increase their access to print. That is what the purpose of this project is: to get high quality books in the hands of my 28 students. The addition of high quality, popular texts in my classroom will almost certainly increase student enjoyment of reading. I would love for you to help play a part in supporting the growth and development of my students.
needStatement: My students need high quality, engaging books to enjoy reading in our class.

name: Caddies for Constructive Classes
description: A teacher can create a highly engaging lesson, but if they don't plan for efficiency, they will likely end up losing precious class time! Setting up a classroom in the most efficient way possible allows students to focus on learning. As a wall-to-wall International Baccalaureate school, instructional time is very precious. Students are preparing for their IB exams, writing their extended essays, and doing community service. They are busy kids! As an IB teacher, I need to make sure my instruction is tailored to their needs, and that my classroom has the materials needed to help students succeed.I am requesting desk caddies for my students to use. In my classroom, students sit in groups of four to facilitate collaboration. Our class uses interactive notebooks every day, which require the use of scissors and glue. My students also frequently use highlighters, sticky notes, and dry erase markers for assessment activities. Having students get up to retrieve these items each day causes my class to lose valuable instructional time. By using desk caddies, my students will be able to efficiently transition between activities and gain more time for learning. In this project, each group will receive a desk caddy to organize their highlighters, sticky notes, and other tools needed for routine classroom activities. These supplies will be used to facilitate class in a more organized, time-efficient way, and allow me to spend more time tailoring instruction to my students' needs.
needStatement: My students need desk caddies to organize their materials and maximize time for learning.

name: Boogie on with Learning
description: I work at a brand new school that just opened this fall. My school is a Title 1 school serving a variety of different cultures and academic needs. This year I am teaching first grade. First grade is an amazing year because students are constantly growing and learning. Most students come in as non-readers and by the end of the year, they are reading beginning chapter books. In math, students learn how to add, subtract, solve story problems, tell time, and so much more. They are also learning how to interact with other students, solve problems independently. My students need these Boogie Boards writing tablets for writing station time and math rotations. These tablets will allow my students to write and erase quickly without wasting class time and materials. We will no longer need dry erase markers which only seem to last a few weeks. My students write daily, practicing spelling words, sentence structures, along with math concepts. These tablets will also be used during science time to allow students to write about newly learned science content. Having these Boogie Boards would make writing time fun and meaningful. I plan to use these Boogie Boards daily and look forward to seeing my students have fun while learning new concepts. These Boogie Boards will be a great addition to my classroom!
needStatement: My students need Boogie Board writing tablets for writing station time.

name: Spanish Novels for Novices
description: When the school day begins at our school (OWL), you'll find students and staff from diverse cultural backgrounds discussing, exploring, and learning in a place where innovative programs and hands-on methods encourage curiosity and discovery. OWL is a credentialed member of the national network of Expeditionary Learning Schools, which promote rigorous and engaging curriculum; active, inquiry-based pedagogy; and a school culture that demands and fosters compassion, collaboration, and good citizenship. Our curriculum is designed around Learning Expeditions—projects that allow students to investigate issues and affect change in our school, community, and the world. The study of big ideas enables us to weave work across subject areas. Students dive deep into important issues and develop projects with authentic audiences to showcase their learning. Our “small school” learning environment inspires students to go big!Reading for pleasure is one of the most important activities a child can do to improve their literacy skills, especially in a foreign language classroom. If we are serious about my students learning Spanish, they need a chance to read at their own pace with literature at their acquisition level. Not only will they be able to read at their own pace, we will also read together as a class and discuss what we are reading to check comprehension, make connections, and tell parallel stories, all in Spanish! The reading and discussing of novels is a very important development step in the scope and sequence of a beginning level foreign language classroom. Such reading and discussing of a beginning level novel should start in the last third of the first year of study, after many other language building activities that happen throughout the first 2/3 of the year. My students will be ready to read and discuss in Spanish when the time comes. But we need the books. Stephen Krashen, well know linguist, pleasure reading advocate, and researcher of second language acquisition, said, 'We do not just want reading that is interesting, we want reading that is so interesting that the rest of the world disappears.' Yes, we want our students so engaged in what they are reading; analyzing, making connections, re-reading passages, silently asking questions, etc., that the rest of their world disappears. These mini-novels in my classroom library will help make that happen.
needStatement: My students need a classroom set of novice level Spanish novels in order to advance their Spanish acquisition.

name: Inspiring Our Children To Read
description: I am lucky to teach such a great group of kids. They try so hard to do their best and hardly ever miss a day of school. My students are so eager to learn and especially excited to learn to read. Their enthusiasm makes my heart smile. I teach first grade in a very low socio economic school, we have 100% of our students receiving free lunch. Most of my students have no books at home to read. All kids deserve to have books to read. The donations for this project will enable us to have quality books when teaching. Student engagement is critical for learning. I have chosen a variety of books that directly correlate with the lessons we cover in our reading series. Having books that interest them will allow our students to make life connections with what they are learning. With these books I will be adding non-fiction and fiction trade books to our daily lessons. Having good books available for my students will encourage their reading. One of the most important and rewarding things I do in this world is to teach children to read. I know by offering on level books that are interesting it will help my students.
needStatement: My students need a variety of interesting fiction and non fiction books to supplement our reading program.

name: Perseverance in the Face of Adversity: Inspirational Young Adult Literature
description: I am a passionate teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, and my students face many challenges, both in and out of school. However, my 8th grade students are extraordinary young adults with strong leadership skills and a great deal of resilience. They work hard and want to do their best, therefore we see incredible amounts of growth during a school year because they use their challenges to push themselves academically. One of my favorite quotes is from William Wordsworth: 'Treat a man as he is and he will remain as he is. Treat a man as he could be and he will become what he should be.' My students know I live by this quote and view them all as incredible humans beings with great potential. I believe in their success, and I always hold them to high expectations! Universal themes and lessons learned through great literature can bring us all together. My students are encouraged to acknowledge different perspectives and gain an understanding of the struggles people face all over the world. Through a unit about adversity and perseverance, students read novels about the harrowing experiences of people around the world; people who have encountered the horrors of war, the beauty of kindness and the challenges of trauma. When they read about the resilience of fellow humans, their empathy increases and their world-view changes. These stories open their eyes to the suffering of people around the world and allow them to build empathy and understanding. By expanding my book choices, students will have greater exposure to diverse and culturally relevant literature; literature that is engaging and thought-provoking, literature that will make them think and open their eyes to how people all over the world live.
needStatement: My students need to read young adult literature about the challenges people encounter all over the world. They need to be inspired by the perseverance individuals can show in the face of great adversity.

name: Baby, It's Cold Outside!
description: Our school is working tirelessly to close the learning gap by challenging the norm of education through our creative and innovative strategies to reach our black and brown scholars. Many of our scholars live in poverty or are homeless. By providing citywide transportation, our scholars that move frequently can have a consistent spot to call their home school. We believe that having a stable learning environment will move our scholars ahead to greater successes in higher education. We inspire our scholars to reach high levels of academic and social achievement and become future leaders through a collaborative support system. All of our scholars come to school with short-sleeved uniform shirts and shorts or pants in the fall. Many parents are not able to purchase both long and short sleeved shirts, so during the colder months, we have cold little bodies wanting to be warm.I want to help our families by giving them some warmer uniform options. I am seeking long sleeve uniform shirts and sweaters to give to the scholars that need something warmer in the winter months. I am also seeking a few pairs of snow pants, boots, and gloves for the scholars that are not able to purchase them for winter.
needStatement: My students need uniform clothes and winter gear to stay warm in cold weather.

name: We Like to Wobble Wobble!
description: How long can you sit still and stay focused for one period of time? Imagine how much harder that is for a first grade student! As teachers, we have so much to compete with these days for students' attention. We are always looking for new ways to help our kids stay focused and engaged, and this project is a good one! Our school is a part of a small coastal county. Although we live near the beach, many of the students that attend our school come from high poverty or very diverse homes. Research has shown that students from high poverty backgrounds have trouble staying focused and engaged during instruction as they are more inclined to focus on basic needs such as food, clothing, shelter, and affection. In addition, today's first grade classrooms are more structured and rigorous in an effort to prepare our students for a future in a competitive society. As teachers, we try to find anything and everything we can to help our students stay focused and engaged to give them every opportunity available. The four stools requested with this project have the potential to make such a difference for my students! These stools allow the students to move quietly without interrupting instruction. The movement allows them to release energy while staying focused and engaged, and they would make an awesome addition to any learning environment . . . especially mine! My project, if funded, would provide the most updated materials available to help my students stay focused and engaged so they can receive the education they need and deserve! Help us make our learning environment the most effective and efficient it can be!
needStatement: My students need stools to allow them to move and stay active while still staying focused and engaged during instruction.

name: Help Us Get Our Ticket To 'Wonder' - Part 1
description: The majority of my students in our small rural school live in poverty. In spite of their own family struggles, they strive to become the best they can be. However, they need to have experiences that enforce their efforts to become empathetic and supportive of others. Sometimes they struggle to visualize story elements that are key to understanding the themes. Attending the movie 'Wonder' will allow them to experience the emotion of the character Auggie on the big screen. They will be able to better connect with the themes of the book that we read and discussed in class.ALL of our middle school students are reading the book 'Wonder' by RJ Palacio. The story is about a boy with facial differences who starts fifth grade in an elementary school for the first time. I want to take our students to see the movie version of this heartwarming story that teaches about tolerance and acceptance of others. Our students will discuss and contemplate bullying, accepting difference, tolerance, leadership, and friendship. This will secure the idea of choosing kindness above all else. Donations to this project will help improve classroom dynamic, class discussions, and how my students treat one another.
needStatement: My students need 75 movie tickets to 'Wonder' as a closing for our learning tolerance through literature unit.

name: 'Battle of the Books!' It's On, If You Help!
description: Our school district is located in the inner city in northern New Jersey. Our students receive free school breakfast and lunch. It is not an easy place to grow up, but our students in these two urban schools are bright, motivated, and love coming to school. They arrive at school every day ready to read, write, analyze and learn. They are active learners who will someday make a difference. We are two schools who will choose four of our very best readers for a unique opportunity to represent themselves and their schools as the champions they are. These students love to read and deserve a chance to let their reading skills shine in a healthy, competitive, fun environment that will reward their talent and scholarship. Two urban schools are joining together to increase reading scores by challenging select teams of sixth graders to a Battle of the Books challenge. Prizes are needed for winners so they can continue their exploration of new books using electronic devices. Help reward our winners with new Kindle Fires to inspire, reward, and offer these deserving children greater access to literature and reading opportunities. We are also looking to fund modest $25 gift cards for our nonwinning team members. In order to win the Battle of the Books, students will read three pieces of literature: Crash, by Jerry Spinnelli; Wonder, by R.J. Palacio; and Wishtree, by Katherine Applegate. Students will go head to head answering trivia and comprehension questions selected by the librarian in advance. This activity is designed to foster a love of reading and community in a fun and competitive social experience for young middle school students. As educators, we want to encourage strong reading skills. Help encourage our talented readers in this under-served district by celebrating and recognizing their talent!
needStatement: My students need Kindles as prizes in a cross-school Battle of the Books! Kindles will allow access to online books and print and to offer much-needed increased access to technology.

name: Lights, Camera, Action! Filming Equipment for Our iPhones
description: My students attend a public charter school in downtown Charleston. We serve a very diverse population of students: they come from all over Charleston with varying backgrounds and experiences. Each year the teaching staff is charged with collaborating to produce a project-based learning unit of study where students can immerse themselves in the experience of inquiry and problem solving. This year we are delving into event planning for a sporting event. My team is quite large and our students will produce a mini-World Cup, complete with a half-time Battle Bots show and media production for the event. My specialized group is charged with producing the media that will market the event and for filming the game day. My students have broken into production teams, but now we need the filming equipment to make our project come to life. My students have little to no experience with filming, so this project will literally bring the world of film and media to their fingertips. I've already seen some of their leadership skills take off. I'm excited to offer them the opportunity to use real equipment in an authentic way. My students are ready to film and put into action what we've learned about media production, but we don't have the equipment. We've studied shots and angles, lighting, and make-up. What my students need now is the camera equipment to take their learning to the next level. We're using what we already have in our pockets: iPhones, and we're looking to improve the quality of our shots and video by using equipment specifically made to shoot with the iPhone camera. My students will use the equipment to film professional looking commercials and our sporting event action. I'm requesting a microphone, camera lenses, a gimbal for stability and movement, and a spotlight for effects. My students will have to market our mini-World Cup event, they will have to interview the student coaches, and film the action of our Battle Bots half-time show. We need equipment that will allow my students to film and produce action shots easily and that will capture sound and dialogue to enhance our audio. This media and filming project will bring the film world to life for my students who otherwise have no other opportunity for this experience.
needStatement: My students need a microphone, camera lenses, a gimbal, and a spotlight for filming on their iPhones.

name: Organizing Determined Minds
description: Our students have been selected to take part in the AVID elective class at our high school because they have demonstrated an intense desire to succeed and eagerness to strive for advancement in their education. The AVID program offers a structured curriculum that provides opportunities for under-served students to avoid the 'achievement gap' by taking part in coursework that pushes them to reach their fullest potential. These students are full of potential and are voluntarily taking part in the rigorous AVID curriculum with the belief that it will better prepare them to face the challenges of both the 21st century and 21st century college and career readiness. AVID students are bright, young minds focused on developing a strong academic identity and better understanding the pivotal role he/she can have within the community. AVID students have committed themselves to outstanding achievement in all classes and to model respect and citizenship inside and outside of the school. While AVID students are quite diverse in terms of their cultural backgrounds, all of these students share a common desire to reach their fullest potential. The AVID class helps them realize their potential through a support system that helps them to overcome obstacles. The AVID elective class takes students that are likely to fall into the achievement gap and gives them the tools that will help to catapult them into the successful futures they deserve. WICOR strategies provide the framework for the AVID curriculum. Each letter in this acronym comprises one of the tools we commit to teaching the AVID students. The 'O' in the WICOR acronym focuses on the need for organization in order to be successful at anything we aspire to. The AVID elective, therefore, requires students to be highly organized and carry a large binder with them to all of their classes that maintains organization for all of their core academic classes. The AVID binder is often our students' most prized possession, and they are proud to show how hard they have worked to establish, maintain, and commit to organization as a reflection of their commitment to their futures. This binder is the heart of the AVID organizational system and is checked weekly for consistent organization of materials. However, many students struggle to purchase these binders and/or have their binders fall apart from wear and tear. The types of materials selected for this project reflect the need for binders and the types of reinforcements necessary to maintain this organizational tool throughout the school year.
needStatement: My students need organizational materials to improve success in all classes!

name: Back to the Basics
description: My fifth grade classroom is a place of growth and learning. A high percentage of my students are learning English as a second language and benefit greatly from visual aids and hands-on activities. The students in my title one classroom are fifth graders in a rural Utah town. These students are excited to learn and find joy in the challenge that the learning process can bring. This school year we are focusing on future goals in education and maximizing the potential of each child to achieve great things as they progress through life. In my classroom, I have seen great benefits from the use of dry erase boards, particularly for math instruction. It is a great break from traditional paper/pencil and allows my students to look at math and analyze problems in different ways. I want my students to know that the work they are doing is important enough to merit materials that have been cared for and kept in good shape. We have been given a set of dry erase boards that has been used for decades and is in very bad shape. My students deserve to use supplies that are taken care of. Children can sense the importance of what they are doing based on the way materials are handled and treated.
needStatement: My students need a classroom set of lap boards to use in our daily math instruction.

name: Book Clubbing Basics!
description: Hello! I am writing to you as a Special Education Teacher from a small rural school with a total school population of 138 students in grades K-4 through 5th grade. Of these students 70% receive free or reduced lunch. My students come from a wide variety of backgrounds, and all have a vary diverse set of educational needs. What has been astounding to me as I continue to work with the students at my school is their willingness to read, and their spark for joining clubs and activities that involve reading here at school! When I started as the Special Education teacher this year I thought it may be fun to start a small book club to promote literacy school wide, what I did not anticipate was the amount of interest the Book Club would generated! The students who joined the Book Club have done so simply because they love to read, and I want to continue to help foster their love for reading and books!Unfortunately, to have a successful Book Club we need books! We need sets of books so that the students can partner and read in pairs. The students work diligently setting goals and reading!Reading is a transferable skill that is needed to make gains in all areas of life. Having students who are passionate about reading makes me, as an educator, excited to come to work each and everyday. Not having the funds to provide my students with the simplest resources needed, such as books, is difficult. By supplying students with books and encouraging them to continue to read, I hope that they will see that there are not limits when you truly put your mind to something. I hope to set an example for the students and encourage growth both in reading and socially!
needStatement: My students need BOOKS, BOOKS, and more BOOKS! They love reading and I want to be able to help them channel that love of reading in our school Book Club!

name: Learning Through Music for Deaf/Hard of Hearing ECSE
description: The students in our class are 3-5 years old and all have a hearing loss. Most are students of color and come from homes where the primary language used is not English. Our school is located in the inner city and many families are low income or at the poverty level. Many of our students have low levels of expressive language (either signed or spoken) and/or delayed social emotional development. Over half of our students have an additional disability. Despite their hearing loss, they all love songs, chants, and exploring musical instruments/toys. While we use music in the classroom, this project will give the students an opportunity to work with teaching artists that are also board certified music therapists and have experience working with children with special needs. Donations to this project will help fund Learning Through Music groups for 15 weeks in our classroom. During Learning Through Music, students will learn academic and art concepts that are embedded into the music activities (instrument play, singing, finger plays, sensory/relaxation, and movement). The students will also have the opportunity to transfer skills practiced and learned during music group to the classroom as the teacher and special education aides will also participate in the learning. In past school years, we have loved to see our students' faces light up when they're told that we're having music today. The sessions with our music teacher are engaging and fun. Students often ask to repeat the songs and activities days after we learn them.
needStatement: My students all have a hearing loss and need weekly music therapy in our classroom.

name: Seating for Scholars
description: My students come to school every day with smiles on their faces, ready to learn and become college ready. In our class, we work as a 'team' to make each other better and accomplish anything that comes our way! I teach at a large school in New York City where 100 percent of my students receive free breakfast and lunch. Many of my students come from low income families and lack the resources needed to extend their knowledge at home. Despite so many hardships, my students come to school ready to do their best and learn all they can so they can be successful. The flexible seats and math resources I have requested can be used in a variety of ways to ensure that each and every child has their choice on how they want to learn. The class sits together on exercise medicine balls during cooperative learning in both reading and math, and all lessons in content areas such as science, social studies, art, music, and even writing. These flexible seats will allow my class to be student-centered. This will be in a way where they show responsibility for their own work and decision making. Having flexible seating is an important community-building experience that is the center of learning most of the school day. Having such an inviting, well-marked seating arrangement will ensure all students feel they have an equal stake in their daily learning experiences, as well as a comfy place to work as a team to complete task.
needStatement: My students need exercise balls, emoji pillows, bean bag chair, focus toys, math learning resources to help take charge on how they choose to learn and work in class.

name: My 'Special' Class 'Needs' Resources to Help Them Be Successful
description: My students need a variety of resources to enhance their academic growth as developing learners in the classroom. My Special Education students are full of energy, love, and a hunger for knowledge. Most of their attention spans are very short, so they are constantly moving. Their attention gets drawn away from what they are doing easily, so keeping them working is a challenge. Although these students struggle in Math and Reading, most of them are very eager to learn. They love to stand up and do their work. They are constantly out of their chairs and leaning over table to do their work. Therefore, standing bed desk would be perfect for them to be able to get comfortable while working. As a teacher in a Title I school, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I am looking to make things fun and enjoyable and provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. The materials and supplies I am asking for are 'special' resources for the Special Needs students in my school. Most of these supplies are only needed in the Special Ed room, not a regular classroom. Keeping the students on task and focused is challenging. As a Special Education teacher I get to work one on one with the students. This helps me to be able to assess their needs. Things like the stand up bed desk, timers, pencil grips, noise cancelling headphones, and See-N-Read tools are things I can use with the students who need them. Some of my students have ADHD. It is hard for them to stay still while working. The stand up bed desk, will allow the students to stand will doing their work, they seem to work better if they have the option of sitting or standing. Timers are a great way for them to see how much time they have remaining so they can stay on task. The pencil grips help the students that have problems with fine motor skills. It helps them hold their pencils correctly, so their writing improves. The noise cancelling headphones helps students with ADHD to keep the outside noises from distracting them. The See-N-Read tools will help keep the students focused on what they are reading, one line at a time. It also reduces distractions on the page as the students are reading. It can help increase their reading skills. The dry erase easel is ideal for small group instruction. The students can easily see the easel and even use it to work out their math problems. The easel chart paper is great for making reference charts with definitions or examples of problems to hang up in the classroom for reference.
needStatement: My students need stand up bed desk, timers, pencil grips, noise cancelling headphones, and See-N-Read tools to help them feel successful in reading, math, and writing.

name: Next Level Puppet Theatre
description: My students are from Flint, Michigan and the surrounding counties. As a city, Flint has faced its fair share of tough times. Our school is a strong ally of our community and is heavily embedded in the community, working diligently to aggressively fight against our odds. Since we are an alternative to a traditional high school, we have an extremely diverse group of students. We have a large number of students who feel they just don't fit in with traditional high school. When we get our students in 9th grade, the majority have not had an art class since they were very young. Because of the many backgrounds and the small size of our school, my students have an extremely strong bond and a fierce loyalty to the school. I think we also have a tendency to be much more creative than a traditional high school. My students tend to be extremely empathetic to others, and we pride ourselves on being heavily involved in our community! Many of my students also come from poverty stricken areas and households as we are about 89% free and reduced price lunches. We have been creating original puppets and performing puppet theater for the past 3 years with the help of our community, school and donors like you. This year, we would like to step up our quality of puppet making and set creation into a professional style theater company which allows our students to gain real world experience within theater and puppetry. Going from paper mache to silicone rubber and foam is one of the many ways we intend to bring our high school puppet theatre to the next level. The materials in our cart will help us design, sculpt, cast and create new and professional forms of puppets and costumes. They will also allow us to upgrade our quality of set design, construction and presentation.
needStatement: My students need upgraded puppet making supplies and set making supplies to help create our original urban fairy tale puppet play this year.

name: Seating Switch Up
description: My students are amazing individuals who are trying their best to survive and thrive in a challenging world. Many of the students at my school are from single parent homes and high-poverty families. It is very important to me that my students feel welcomed and safe as soon as they walk into my classroom. Our school is located right in the heart of a high-crime area, where many of my students live. Despite circumstances, I always encourage them to succeed. In order to appeal to today's youth, we have to find ways to keep them engaged and motivated. This new classroom layout will do just that! Flexible Seating is shaking up the education world, and changing the way classrooms function for students and teachers alike! The room room layout will feature tables with a mixture of seating arrangements including stools, milk crates with exercise balls, donut ball chairs, and bean bag chairs. The room will also utilize a few standard desks, as well. The classroom will be divided into groups and they will rotate through the seats throughout the year.
needStatement: My students need a variety of seating options. I will have 3 bean bag chairs and five tables, each with donut balls, stools, and exercise balls inside of milk crates.

name: Teacher Training at RCA... Ready to Roll!
description: I have been teaching 3rd grade for 16 years, and my students make going to work every morning a highlight of my day! Every day I see a 'light bulb come on' I see how I'm making a difference. Since 2003, I've worked in a Title I school with a high percentage of low-income students. My students over the years have all helped me grow to become the teacher that I am today--and I thank them every day for that. I've taken joy in being a part of a school community where students, families, and teachers work together to give all kids a strong social-emotional and academic foundation. It is truly a blessing to be able to live out my calling in life and touch the lives of children every day!I am requesting funding to attend Ron Clark Academy so I can take part in this once in a lifetime professional development to be able to bring back tons of information to better my classroom, me as a seasoned teacher and most importantly MY STUDENTS! I know I can gain so much knowledge through this training. I consider it a privilege to be surrounded by the ever-changing world of education. I will be able to bring back a wealth of knowledge to broaden the learning horizons of each of my students in both Language Arts and Mathematics not only for the present year but for years to come! The knowledge gained from this unique experience will directly impact the success of my students. Ron Clark brings so much excitement to teaching and learning. I will bring back innovative ways to teach and learn to share with my colleagues as we find new ways to increase student engagement and achievement. Through this training, my students will become more innovative learners as I am able to bring back several engaging strategies. Please help to make attending the Ron Clark Academy a reality and not just a dream! Your generous donation will directly affect every student in my classroom on a daily basis. Thank you!
needStatement: I need a professional development day at Ron Clark Academy to bring innovative methods back to my classroom!

name: All the Cool Kids Wear Helmets
description: My girls are fired up and ready to play ball to win a championship. Thes girls have the heart and determination to be better than they were yesterday. These girls are full of energy on the field and are full of life. Most of the students at our school come from low-income households that are not able to afford all the equipment their child will need to play a sport. Being a middle school team we do not have all of the equipment we need. We are always underfunded and always get high schools equipment when they get new equipment. With this being said I would like to provide my players with new equipment for how hard they work on a daily basis. My softball players will use these helmets every day to protect them. This donation would help my players that are worried if they are going to be able to afford to get the correct equipment they need for the season. These items will ensure the player's safety at games and at practice. This donation will help us start up a successful middle school softball program. This will help my girls know that there are people out there that will support them and help them. This generosity will show a reward on how hard they are working. Let's get out with the old and in with the new.
needStatement: My students need these helmets to protect them at games and at practice.

name: Getting Comfortable and Cozy in a Student-Centered Classroom
description: This is my first year of teaching and I was lucky enough to land a job teaching third grade. I graduated from university in 2016. I teach at GJBL Elementary School in Maine. This school has a very diverse student body. The students consist of over 60% English Language Learners and 99% of the students come from low-income families. My students deserve every opportunity to help them become the successful adults I know they will become someday. Many of my students are very behind and are not on level, especially in Literacy. Some of them are more than a grade level behind. Allowing my students a comfortable space to learn in will help them reach the goals they need to meet by the end of the year. Many of my third-grade students come from poverty-stricken homes. For many of them, my classroom is their happy place. It is my goal to provide them with an environment that will motivate them to work harder and push themselves to do their best. Having these materials in my classroom will not only allow my students flexible seating, but it will help improve their focus, engagement, and overall success in my classroom. It is my job to provide them with a comfortable and homey environment to learn in. If my students are comfortable when they are learning, they become even more excited about what they are doing. At the moment, we have 2 crates with cushions on them in our reading area. My students love these two seating options and always want to sit on them when completing work and/or reading. When I see my students using these seats they are fully engaged with their work. You can see them getting lost in their academics and it's an amazing thing to witness. All students should have the opportunity to complete their work in a comfortable/student-centered space. It is a proven fact that movement helps children focus. These materials will immensely help those students who have ADHD as well. The resources to help these students focus in the classroom are scarce at my school. It is my hope that having these materials will enhance their educational experience this year, as well as the rest of my other students. My students and I would be extremely thankful to have more seating options like the requested bean bag pillow chairs, balance ball chairs, stools, and fidget bands in our classroom. This way, more than just two students at a time can take advantage of this opportunity.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options such as bean bag pillow chairs, balance ball chairs, stools, and fidget bands that will ensure them to focus, stay engaged, and allow them to learn comfortably.

name: Calling All Mice! We Can't Hear You!
description: I am a Pre-Algebra and Algebra 1 teacher and will be teaching all 8th graders that have various learning abilities. My students are from a small community that is very family-oriented. A lot of students that were born in the area will continue to live in the area beyond graduation. My students come from various socioeconomic statuses. Some can afford the equipment to use technology effectively, however, some can not. I do not want any to be at a disadvantage because of their home life. Every student deserves the tools to perform at a high level. The materials requested will allow my students to use the class set of Chromebooks that we have easier by allowing them to listen to instructional videos with the headphones and navigating around the screen with the mouse. Many times, we use a program called Educreations that allows the students to be creative when designing a presentation about certain topics that we have learned in class. This allows students to use their creative art side when developing math presentations. The mice will allow students to draw and write more efficiently than using the pad on the computer. With these tools, students will be allowed to create, share, and navigate through presentations easier than it would be with the mouse pad on the computer.
needStatement: My students need these headphones and mice in order to effectively use the class set of chromebooks.

name: Kreative Brainy Moments
description: 2017-2018: My tenth year as a teacher and my students seventh year (including Kindergarten) of learning. Every day, the students I work with leave home, where things may not always be great, to come to school and enter into a safe environment; an environment cares for the whole student-mind, body, and spirit. Between my three classes, there are 90 individuals who come to my room to learn 21st century math skills. Of these ninety students, they all receive two free hot meals a day. The receive multiple individuals asking how they are doing. They come to class ready to learn; ready to be challenged. This school year, I have decided to once again to put traditional teaching methods away and teach to the level of students that I am working with. Despite my school being a Title one school and a school where some say the kids cannot do anything; I say watch them! With my help and guidance they will break the model and become great. Some might see this cart and think toys for the classroom but I ask you to look beyond. See them as opportunities for the students to explore and create. See them as opportunities for the students to engage in 21st Century Hands-on Learning. See them as opportunities for students to step away from traditional teaching to explore and apply what they are learning. See they are not toys; they are learning experiences waiting to happen.
needStatement: My students need Legos and K'nexs to provide an engaging brain break moment with my math class.

name: Keepin' the Kids Warm
description: Formed in the summer of 2017, PreK at Rondo serves 80 four and five year olds from the Saint Paul area. Our program was formed thanks to a generous grant from our Governor. Our school strives to put students first. Students develop self confidence through their accomplishments and a sense of empowerment to pursue their dreams. Our school succeeds in closing the achievement gap in the multicultural community through the delivery of rigorous curriculum and an individualized learning plan for each student. Many of our students come from low income, high poverty households. As the weather is getting colder, we are noticing many of our kids don't have the winter gear they need to keep warm. That means they can't go outside! We are hoping to get enough mittens and hats provided for our students that we won't have that problem anymore. These will stay AT SCHOOL so they will not get lost. This way, we can use them for years to come! Please help us provide the gear to keep our kids warm so that everyone can experience a FUN Minnesota winter.
needStatement: My students need winter warm gloves and hats so they can play outside!

name: Phonological Awareness
description: I have a wonderful and diverse group of students. I have over six different languages spoken in my classroom. Many of my students speak very little English and have just recently come to the United States as refugees from other countries. The diversity in the classroom can cause challenges for teaching, but it also makes my room unique and special! I wouldn't have it any other way! My students love to learn, laugh, and play! They are curious, self-motivated learners who always want to know more! I am requesting a set of phonological awareness activities that will help my students while working in independent small group areas. These activities will allow my students to practice hearing beginning and ending sounds within words. It will also all allow them to practice rhyming words. My students love to learn to play and exploration. This phonological awareness set includes 3 games. Each game focuses on a different kindergarten skill, beginning sounds, ending sounds, and rhyming. The students must find manipulative and objects that match the given letter. These materials will be a perfect addition to our small group learning areas.
needStatement: My students need phonological awareness manipulative games that help them practice beginning sounds, ending sounds, and rhyming words.

name: The Exchange Clothing Closet: Student-Led Leadership Project
description: Step into our building and walk our halls. You'll pass students at lockers chatting with friends and overhear conversations about Maker Club. You'll see our student-created artwork, team trophies, and classroom bulletin boards promoting growth mindset. What sets our students apart can best be described using the word INNOVATIVE. We have students who have a strong sense of ownership of this school and a strong sense of empathy. We know that TOGETHER, we can make the lives of others better. We live by our mission to enrich the lives of others by giving of our time and our talents!We have students who want to be problem-solvers! Our project is two-fold: provide clothing for students with a need; provide leadership training for all students. 'The Exchange' will be a clothing closet for students to access resources and to learn how to manage a program. We will provide a safe place for students to gain access to clothes and hygiene products in order for them to come to school ready to learn - rather than be consumed with embarrassment, or miss school days because they are ill from lack of weather appropriate clothing and footwear - or unprepared to venture outside when winter is upon us. Additionally, 'The Exchange' will be a way for students to give back to their school and community through the student-led management of this resource. We have students who arrive at school with clothes that are too small, too big, inappropriate for their age or for the weather, or saturated with the odor of tobacco or pet urine. Our youth must have these basic needs met to fully engage in learning. Not having clean and presentable clothing is also a barrier to students' social and emotional growth - often experiencing exclusion that is damaging to their self-esteem. These middle grades are an especially vulnerable age for students developing their sense of worthiness and social connections. Seeing themselves as EXCHANGERS - taking a resource and giving their time and talents in return - is a healthy way to develop as a contributing member of society. This is a project that our INNOVATIVE students will manage.
needStatement: My students need four garment racks to hang clothes. We are creating a student-led clothing exchange program. Currently, we have donated items in black garbage bags. Our goal is to create an inviting student managed space.

name: Let's Color!
description: My five and six-year-olds are eager to learn. Many are having their first school experience. Some children come from refugee camps in Thailand. The students who grew up knowing English as their first language are wonderful at beginning the fun and they too need to build their fine motor skills. Most of my students live in poverty. The children in my classroom love to use their imaginations and draw and write. Having the choice of many different color crayons to use would be very inviting and motivating. The donations toward this project will be used to purchase the biggest box of Crayola Crayons available, 96 different colors. There is something very empowering about having a large selection of colors. It is also a valuable lesson in organization. The children will need to keep track of their crayons and not break them. My students need to build their fine motor skills. The five and six year olds in my classroom need as many opportunities as possible with writing tools in their hands. Their finger muscles need exercise to be able to form letters and numbers correctly and quickly.
needStatement: My students need crayons. They love to color. I have very few crayons donated by families.

name: Please Send Me to the Ron Clark Academy!
description: What makes my classroom special? Well, it's the students and the community that I serve. My students are the type of kids which people may not expect much from. When I came to this school is had just received an F, which meant it was a failing school. In my classroom, at least half of my students were one to three grade levels behind. Coming from low socio-economic backgrounds they come to my classroom missing background knowledge and experiences. However, I teach my students to dream and aspire to be more than their current circumstances. I teach my students that no matter what kind of neighborhood you grow up in, they too can leave a great impact on the world. I grew up in the same neighborhood and came back after going to college to make a difference. By the end of this school year those 75% of my students are now reading on grade level! The Ron Clark Academy is a model school that allows educators to learn new and dynamic teaching strategies. Through classroom observations and workshops, I will learn ways to increase student engagement, ensure academic rigor, and create a climate and culture that leads to success. By participating in this educator training, I will be able to observe master teachers in action. I will have the opportunity to learn and grow in the areas of student engagement and high rigor for all students. My students will be able to benefit from the new strategies that I learn while at RCA. By increasing the engagement of my teaching I will also increase the amount my students learn in class.
needStatement: I need to participate in a two-day training at the Ron Clark Academy in order to learn how to replicate RCA's teaching styles, philosophy, and success in my own classroom.

name: Reading About the Modern Black American Experience with Critical Students
description: My Honors English students this year are leaders in many different ways. Most importantly, they have a deep sense of what's right and wrong in the world and the importance of being allies. From day one, students have modeled honesty and vulnerability in my classroom, encouraging their peers and sharing personal stories. My students willingly speak up, not only on behalf of themselves, but on behalf of others. The diversity at our 2,800-student public high school allows a safe space for empathy and meaningful opportunities for advocacy. Yes, we are racially diverse, but also socio-economically, religiously, and linguistically. My honors students are Latino/a, Chinese American, Vietnamese American, African American, Filipino American, and white American. I have students from both middle-class and low-income families sitting shoulder to should daily-- same goes with different religious backgrounds and first/home languages. San Leandro is south of Oakland and north of Hayward, Ca. It's a city with a rough history of racial discrimination and a stronger future of inclusion. Students are athletically talented (Div 1 school) and a large population are college-bound. Specifically, this year I have quite a few football and volleyball players, and also Marching Band members. Right now, we have literature, articles, and poetry that center primarily on the Latino/a experience and the white American experience. For example, Of Mice and Men and House on Mango Street. Now, we need to integrate a text that is current and accurate about the black American experience, especially at our high school where almost 1/4 of students are African American. This book, The Hate U Give, is relatable, and, most importantly, it will challenge students' thinking about racial realities in our country. All of our novels are 'classics' and pretty worn out. Students will be filled with newfound eagerness when working with these new books.
needStatement: My students need the novel The Hate U Give by Angie Thomas. This book will be a platform for discussion about the modern black American experience.

name: Cast a Spell: Help Make Our 4th Grade Magically Flexible!
description: They like to move it, move it. Choice is king. Novelty is exciting. They are active, full of ideas, and eager to propel themselves forward. Our classroom is Harry Potter themed, hence the magical slant to our message. My 'wand'erful students are full of energy! Our district is rural- composed of multiple towns around about 96 square miles. We serve many students who qualify for free and reduced lunches. Despite some of the challenges they may face, our students are ambitious. Their ambitions will come to fruition if we give them the tools they need to be successful in the classroom. My students are immensely active. I hope to increase their success by supporting them with in classroom environment that embraces their unique learning styles and provides them with outlets to express their diverse needs. As active learners, a traditional classroom setup can inhibit their ability to reach their potential. My dream is to provide my students with a fully functional classroom composed of flexible-seating choices. However, as a new teacher, setting up a classroom with diverse choices can become costly. Flexible seating options will ensure that those students who need a little room to move will surpass expectations. Wobble stools provide wiggle room at desks so that students can move while sitting. Stability balls are a favorite among my learners as they can be physically moving without causing tremendous distraction to other students. My students are learning the regions of the United States; the amazing carpet will help their ability to grasp the geography of the U.S. by increased exposure to the map (even during carpet time). The carpet is also a bonus seating area in which the lap desks will be implemented. Please help make this new teacher's dream for a flexible seating based classroom a reality and support my magically flexible 4th graders!
needStatement: My students need the selected tools to create flexible seating options in my classroom which will eliminate distractions and allow my students to be successful while providing choice and autonomy.

name: A Home For Our Books
description: It is my honor and privilege to be able to teach a group of 23 highly motivated, compassionate, and intelligent first grade students in Illinois. My students are very observant and they enjoy interacting with the world around them. In our classroom, we never sit still! I am always trying to get my students up and moving around, singing, or exploring in small groups to make learning engaging. They learn best when they are having fun. I work very hard to provide my students with meaningful experiences on a daily basis. Our books are EVERYWHERE! Book bags are ripping and book bins are falling apart. My students are passionate about reading and have so many different interests! Because of their enthusiasm I've added tons of new books to our classroom library, but we don't have enough bins for all our books, and our old bins are so full they are cracking! We currently store their guided reading books and library books in plastic Ziploc bags. These bags do not hold up very well in the hands of busy six year olds. They are always ripping to shreds and books are getting lost. I want to help my students keep our classroom library organized so they can spend their time reading and not struggling to find their favorite book.
needStatement: My students need new book bins and bags to replace our old broken ones, and to fit and organize all of the amazing new fiction and non-fiction books we have added to our library.

name: Adapting To Changes
description: I have a typical seventh grade class. My students are from a variety of socioeconomic and racial backgrounds. Many of my students' parents are in the military. The skill level varies from extremely high to extremely low. I have an average of twenty-five students in each of my five classes. Most are highly motivated learners and are very interested in science. They love technology and embrace its integration in the classroom. Fostering a love of learning and training lifetime learners is the main goal in my class. They are our future leaders. This year there have been many changes in my classroom. Our science benchmarks have changed and the class use of technology has increased. We have a greater focus on physical science in the state standards, so my students need chemistry kits to create models to achieve a deeper understanding of these standards. We have become a Google classroom and we use the technology to the best of our ability. The addition of an iPad will allow my students to video and research when they need it, instead of just when we are scheduled to have the media cart. Students often struggle understanding the concept of molecular makeup and atomic structure. If students are able to build models of these difficult concepts they will gain a better understanding of these benchmarks. The chemistry kits will allow a hands-on approach that will greatly benefit kinesthetic learners and visual learners alike. Students learn by doing and these kits allow students to create molecular structures and atomic models. The added use of these kits has the ability to create a great cornerstone middle school and high school chemistry. Every year my students create science videos of the benchmarks they learn in seventh grade. The students will be able to use the iPad for these videos and they can video other science demonstrations. Students will be able to peer teach each other by videoing demonstrations and science labs. Students will also help out their classmates by videoing important classroom lessons for future reference. All of these videos can be added to our Google classroom to be used as learning aids. The added technology will also be used for research in the classroom. Students will be able to have a reference aid right at their fingertips for research on science topics we cover throughout the year.
needStatement: My students need concrete examples of abstract science concepts such as atomic and molecular models, plus an iPad and case to aid in research and video.

name: Getting a Closer Look at Math
description: My third grade classroom is a place of high expectations. Students will spend the year focused on math and science, a topic that is both enchanting and challenging to them. They are excited to explore the world of multiplication and division, as well as the complexities of the scientific method. Best of all, they take pride in their efforts and are willing to challenge their minds for the sake of learning. While 100% of the school qualifies for food assistance and 98% are minority scholars, they are working hard to overcome their circumstances and get college ready. This year has been rough as I try to make multiplication and division sound interesting and connected to my student's lives. I've had some success with posters, physical manipulatives, and other visual aids, but it hasn't been enough. Being able to project my daily lessons onto the front board would change my lessons dramatically. Differentiation is always a necessary challenge in a classroom. Being able to project math word problems on a board would not only serve visual learners, but would connect the class as we explore continually complex mathematical concepts. Knowing that my students and I were all following along on the same material would connect us and, I think, allow my students to be more free connections for themselves.
needStatement: My students need to be able to see my lesson and stay connected with their own work . A document camera would allow that to happen.

name: Theater to Bring Reading Alive!
description: My school is an urban option school that parents can choose for their children. My students are an enthusiastic group of second and third graders who are excited about learning. Many of my students, however, face significant learning challenges. I have students who face the challenge of dyslexia, ADHD, autism, visual tracking issues, and other learning disabilities. These special needs can impact their ability to access the skills and concepts I am teaching. Watching my students succeed and become confident learners inspires me to find more ways to support them. Reader's Theater inspires my students to read fluently and work together! My students love Reader's Theater! During Reader's Theater, students read from scripts rather than memorize their parts. It's a fun way to develop reading fluency and expression, especially for struggling readers. One of my students' favorite parts of Reader's Theater is making simple props and costumes for their performances. With the arts and crafts supplies, such as styrofoam balls, pipe cleaners, masks, and feathers, my students will be make adorable masks, hats, and props. Then they will use the vacuum cleaner to clean up the big mess that will have been created! Reader's Theater will give all my students a real reason for reading aloud! These supplies will help bring their performances alive!
needStatement: My students need arts and craft supplies to make simple costumes and props for their Reader's Theater performances -- and they need a vacuum to clean up the mess!

name: Kindergarteners' Computer Science Style!
description: My students are from the second poorest county in America living in Pine Ridge, South Dakota They are on 100% free and reduced lunch. Most students lack internet access at home/technology resources. Our school has two computer labs K-12 with outdated technology resources. To be able to become technologically competitive, have increased self-esteem when they compete in real-world occupations, and to have foundational computer science skills, our classroom needs enough Kindle Fires for every two students. We would use the Kindles for coding, rigorous math and science tasks and daily ELA skills. My low-income students will be empowered and engaged in problem-solving activities that will increase their potential to explore and create in their world!These Kindle Fires will help integrate technology in all content areas including, math, computer science, coding, ELA, and STEM activities!Given these opportunities it will support thinking skills, such as collaboration, critical thinking, persistence, and risk-taking. We will be able to scaffold children's learning and to provide independent and group activities. The students will become more cohesive for their continued learning throughout all content areas kindergarten through twelfth grade. Our kids deserve the opportunity to succeed on their path forward!
needStatement: My students need 10 Kindle Fires with cases to strengthen their computer science and academic skills, due to the lack of technology at home and at school.

name: Honing My Skills as an Orff-Schulwerk Instructor
description: I am going into my second year as a general music teacher and I am so excited to be teaching the students at my school. My students come from a wide range of different cultures, backgrounds, and even different languages. Regardless of what language they speak at home, music is a language in which everyone can communicate and share. 'Music is the universal language of mankind.' Henry Wadsworth Longfellow could not have put it more accurately. Music allows me to communicate with all students. It does not matter what language they speak, what culture they are from, if they have a disability, etc. Music speaks to all, and through music, I can speak to all.
