needStatement: My students need Knex Intro to Structures: Bridges kits so they can design and test bridge models.

name: Let's Put a Stamp On It
description: Seeing my students learn is the thing that makes me the happiest. I love to be able to give them all the information that they need in order to understand and appreciate the world that they live in. Curious, creative, and very vocal, my students are the future of our society and I want to make sure they are equipped and ready to handle it. Faced with some difficult obstacles that they have to go through in their own neighborhood, I want them to know that the obstacles in the classroom can be overcome. With hard work and determination they will become the best of our future. My 1st grade students would benefit greatly from these stamps. I believe learning should be fun. These sight word stamps would help to increase my students vocabulary in an educational and fun way. The math stamps would help to individualize each student's math fluency, as well as make it colorful and vibrant for them. Sometimes, the old fashioned way of learning doesn't seem to help. When students can create their own words and math problems with their very own hands, it allows them to take ownership of their education. That's what I want for my students, the joy of learning.
needStatement: My students need the sight word stamps to help increase their vocabulary. They also need the math stamps to increase their math fluency.

name: Narrative Nonfiction Independent Reading Books
description: I work in a large school with a very high immigrant population. I have many students who have very limited schooling in their own language. They are now thrust into a formal school setting and are learning English for the first time. Most receive free/reduced-price lunch and breakfast. As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, I aim to provide my students with creative and meaningful learning experiences. My third grade class is currently using the Teacher's College Reading and Writing Units of Study. We are currently in our Informational Reading unit and need Narrative nonfiction books in our independent reading library to support students throughout this unit. The students need to have narrative nonfiction to read independently so that they can practice the skills that I teach them during our reading minilessons. I think that having these books on their levels available to them will not only get them excited about the unit, but it will give them the opportunity to transfer the skills and strategies independently.
needStatement: My students need narrative nonfiction books on their reading levels to support our Teacher's College Informational reading unit.

name: Funny Characters Keep Us Reading!
description: My students live in Minnesota and come from a variety of backgrounds. Many of them are learning English as a second or third language. With 100 % of our students receiving free lunch, poverty is a reality for almost all of them. However, they are unfalteringly determined and they diligently strive to achieve and succeed in school. Providing literacy resources at school is critical for our students. We are hoping to offer some new and funny books to our classroom library for our students to read at school and at home. My students are amazing. They work hard and are beginning to show huge gains in reading. However, they often don't have access to many books at home. Our classroom library is often a place they begin to cultivate and grow their love of reading. We are hoping to add some engaging new titles to our library. We have a few favorite characters that make us laugh and some favorite topics that help us learn more about the world. The books we have requested are some current and classic funny characters. Once we know the characters, the books are so engaging because we can predict how they will act and how they will feel. We love to laugh along with these characters and talk about the stories. I also have included some informational books that relate to our favorite research topics. These books will inspire us to read, talk, write, laugh and learn!
needStatement: My students need funny, engaging, series books and high-interest non-fiction books at their level.

name: Student Led Book Clubs
description: My students are a diverse group of thinkers and learners who come together in the spirit of learning. We are a public, urban Montessori middle school, and, as a school that opened three years ago, we are still emerging and growing as a community. We are located in a historically diverse and low-income community. Seventy seven percent of our students receive free and reduced price lunch. My students love reading! They come to middle school with an enthusiasm for their educations and form a strong community. Our Montessori classroom experience is focused on educating the whole child and creating lifelong learners. Here at our school, we are always seeking to provide extracurricular opportunities for our students to further expand their learning. Book club is a new activity we are offering to students this year. This student led book club will provide our middle school readers a space to read and discuss engaging young adult titles. It is also an opportunity for our 6-8 grade Montessori students to come together, connect, and share their thinking. This title is the final book selected by our students. In addition to the book club book, students have asked for copies of the entire series so that they can continue reading after we meet. This book is a continuation of the selections students chose to meet a variety of interests and genres.
needStatement: My students need sets of young adult books for a student led book club.

name: A Night To Always Remember: Our Junior Prom
description: Remember reading that first book that helped you develop a love of reading? Do you remember those integrated art lessons during math or history class? My students are from one of the poorest and most violent cities in the country. Every day they strive to broaden their horizons and reach for the stars. For many, school is the only safe haven they know. I work to teach them that there is a bigger world out there than the one they see every day, that they matter, and that they will always have a safe place to explore the world around them in our classroom. Camden is the poorest and one of the most dangerous cities in the U.S. School is typically the only safe haven these kids know. Our schools, for a variety of reasons, lack the resources to provide these amazing kids with the education they deserve. You're giving them the opportunity to dream of a better future. These kids have never experienced the excitement of a prom. Their parents have never seen their kids' faces as they are preparing for this big moment in their young lives. This is something that takes place in every community across our country and last year because of the support of donors on Donors Choose, we were able to have our first Junior Prom. This year we want this class of juniors to experience the prom, too. That's why we need these items such as the drink dispensers, the fountain, the extension cord and mini signs to make junior prom a special night for these amazing kids. These kids just deserve a night where they can leave behind their stressful existences growing up in a place where their monsters are real and violence is commonplace. That's why I want to make this Junior Prom special. Last year was the first year we have had a Junior Prom at WWHS. This year I want to make the prom even better than before. We hold the Junior Prom in our gym due to financial issues. However, I want to truly transform the gym in such a way that the kids can't tell they are in the gym. We are raising money to purchase a prom theme set and other decor. Anything you can give would be great. All the items listed are to decorate the prom and make it a night to remember for these kids.
needStatement: My students need drink dispensers, drink fountain, extension cords and mini signs for their Junior Prom.

name: Fabulous 4th Graders Need Some Stuff!
description: My 4th graders are a wild bunch of personalities, and they are so eager to learn. We have struggled in having the necessary supplies needed to make us as successful as possible, that is why we have set up this DonorsChoose project. All students at our school receive free breakfast and lunch. Many students receive bags of food for the weekend just to get them by until they can have a hot meal on Monday in school. Despite so many hardships, my students are eager to learn and be successful. Please help us be successful by enabling us to get some necessary classroom supplies!The headphones will allow for my students to use their iPads with sound without disturbing others. This is hard when working with the teacher in small groups, some on iPads, some playing games, and some reading quietly. We also use the iPads for math apps throughout the year. Many of the skills are taught in video format, so the need for headphones is immediate! Anything in a game format, gives them immediate motivation! These materials will also allow them to practice their reading skills in a game format when they are working around the classroom in small groups! These board games will get a lot of use! The chart paper, markers, expo markers, and other classroom supplies are for the students and me to be able to make anchor charts to hang around the room for the students to use as resources throughout each unit for each subject. Vocabulary lists are common in our classroom to help my students who have low academic vocabulary knowledge, due in large part to English being their second language. The students also like to use individual whiteboards in class to complete work, so expo markers are needed.
needStatement: My students need supplies to help with using their iPads effectively and games to use during reading small groups!

name: Vlogging for Struggling Readers and Creative Minds
description: Our 6th through 12th grade students are redefining possible at our charter school in Texas. Many come from low-income families and struggle with a variety of issues before they even walk into the classroom. As a Reading Interventionist and the school’s librarian, I’ve seen all of our students embrace a whatever-it-takes attitude to ensure their personal literary growth. Our students are hard-working, determined individuals with a desire to attend college; many would be the first to do so in their family. Our goal as a school is to provide rigorous curriculum, build meaningful student relationships, and provide experiences outside of the classroom as we prepare them for college and beyond. My students don't yet believe they can fall in love with reading, but I am out to prove them wrong! In my reading intervention class, students are anywhere between 1 - 3 grade levels behind in reading, and also struggle with their academic self-confidence knowing they are not as successful in this area. With this video equipment, students will be given a fun, interactive platform that excites them after finishing a short story, a poem, or a full novel. Students will have an opportunity to vlog about their thoughts from the reading material they dive in, summarize the text, or make connections to previous reads. These vlogs are alternative means to current homework that involves writing book reports. Ultimately, this equipment will also be used to start a vlogging club, piloted by my students and supervised by myself as our school's librarian.
needStatement: My students need camcorders, tripods, and video equipment to begin vlogging as alternative homework assignments!

name: Strum and Play with Us!: Ukuleles in Music Class
description: WRES has a wonderful diversity of students, with a variety of backgrounds including language, abilities, and socioeconomic status. Our school culture of perseverance and hard work provides our large student body with the tools and resources to succeed on a daily basis. All of our students, including students with special needs and ESL, are provided with daily instruction using a variety of hands-on, experiential learning opportunities. In addition to classroom instruction, students are provided with a variety of specialties in physical education, visual arts, technology, and music. As the music teacher, I have witnessed a natural passion and enthusiasm, in all of our students, for creating music. They are always ready and eager to fully engage themselves in daily music education. With your help, we can enhance their music education to help them achieve their personal musical goals and dreams!It is well known that music is extremely beneficial to childhood development. Learning to play an instrument, such as the ukulele, provides students with many benefits, which are applied inside and outside of the music classroom. When students learn to play the ukulele, fine motor and coordination skills are developed as students learn strumming and chord patterns. Students develop and build their listening skills as they tune their own instruments and learn to play a variety of songs. When playing in an ensemble, students work collaboratively and collectively, improving their social and emotional skills on a daily basis. In the music classroom, students will compose their own songs, which provides students multiple opportunities for creativity and risk-taking. In my years teaching music, I have seen how music education, in which students sing and play instruments, provides an outlet for creativity and individuality. I have seen my students grow out of shyness and self-doubt, and have seen them blossom into strong, self-aware, performing artists.
needStatement: My students need ukuleles to help them engage and further their studies in music class! Learning the ukulele will help students develop musical, as well as, social, emotional, coordination, fine motor, reading, and listening skills.

name: The Shape of our Work!
description: My school and students are as diverse both ethnically and linguistically as they come. They come from all over the world; many of them refugees to our elementary school. They impress me on a daily basis with their enthusiasm and work ethic. Our class is full of curious and motivated students. They are enthusiastic and always ask brilliant questions to get to the bottom of problems. Our school is a dual language immersion program in both Spanish and English. Our students and their families are incredibly hardworking and generous people. Our First grade Dual Language students love to get their hands on materials. We are studying Geometry and how to manipulate shapes to make other shapes. We are in desperate need of Die Cuts to easily precut shapes out of paper to use in our work. It is essential that students physically manipulate Geometric Shapes in order to understand the Math concepts we are teaching. These die-cut sets and materials will facilitate the students' ability to physically interact with them and will help develop a deeper understanding on geometric concepts. Also included in the project are die cut shapes like hearts, handprints, and stars; students will also be able to create original shape artwork to accompany their understanding of the concept.
needStatement: My students need precut shapes and die cut sets to create shape collages during math time.

name: Climbing Adventures in Maine
description: Our school is located in rural Maine. My kids love classes indoors, and the outdoor adventures they have been on as well. The kids are hard working, and love their time in PE. It is a chance to get exercise in, in a fun way. Climbing works on strength, endurance, flexibility, and works the brain as well. It is important to plan out moves in order to make it across the wall. Climbing also helps with motor skills, movement patterns, and responsible behaviors. This wall will always be used under supervision, and with mats underneath. It is a shortened wall for safety, so no kid will be going too high off the ground.I plan to use this wall in my PE classes. It is important to plan out moves in order to make it across the wall. Climbing also helps with motor skills, movement patterns, and responsible behaviors. Students spend too much time in their seats during the school day, and this is a great innovative way to get kids up and moving, while stimulating their brains. This wall will always be used under supervision, and with mats underneath. It is a shortened wall for safety, so no kid will be going too high off the ground. I plan on using this wall grades K-8. Climbing is a big workout for the upper body, as well as a strategic activity with where to hold, and where to step. It can be used for all different skill levels, and you can map out courses based upon difficulty. The climbing wall I am requesting is a 20' by 8' wall. This is the larger one in size so it will fit our area, and maximize participation so kids don't spend their time waiting.
needStatement: My students need a wall large enough to get multiple students on at the same time to limit down time. It is the largest we can use in our gym due to size.

name: Books will Make our Minds Strong!
description: First grade marks an exciting and important milestone for young children. As first graders mature from prek and kindergarten, you see the sparkle in their eyes when they are able to crack the code and start to understand what letters and numbers really mean. The students' enthusiasm for school and life is so infectious and makes teaching them a joyful experience. Even after our 1st day of school was pushed backed 2 weeks to due Hurricane Harvey, students came to school each day with huge smiles on their faces and ready to learn. Our school is a Title 1 school, meaning our school has high numbers of children from low-income families. Some of the conditions the children face are high mobility rates, unsafe communities and poor health. The children often fall behind in school and require additional resources to catch up and stay on track. The best way to become a better reader is to read, read, read! My students were struggling reading on grade level at the start of the school year. However they have shown growth of their reading level in the 1st semester of 1st grade. Now that we are entering the 2nd semester we want to keep the momentum going with reading more and more books. The best way to become a better reader is to read the right kind of book. In 1st grade, students are expected to grow 7 levels. The leveled readers will be used in our classroom library for the kids to check out to take home. The leveled readers would be perfect because the books will not be too hard or too easy. They would be just right for them. The more access to books on their level will help them tremendously in reaching their reading goal.
needStatement: My students need books to check out from the classroom library to use for reading at home.

name: Totally Tubano...Dude!
description: My students love to perform music on instruments, especially barred instruments (xylophones, metallophones, glockenspiels and bass bars) and drums. While our classroom does have many barred instruments, we are lacking drums. Due to not having enough drums, physical playing time is reduced, and student learning is limited. My students learn best through singing, movement, speech, creating and performing on instruments so increasing the amount of instruments will increase student learning and understanding.I teach 600 students in grades K-5, and they come to me for 45 minutes once a week. My school is a Title I school in a military town. Military families many times will move away due to orders or deployments, but often return 1 to 3 years later. Students at my school are eager to learn and are most excited about performing on instruments and creating and performing their own compositions.I am certified in the Orff approach and use this approach daily as a way for my students to learn. Students learn through exploration and creating. Our classroom is lacking in drums, specially world drums to allow for students to explore, learn and create. Tubano drums are similar in tone to both an African Kpanlogo drum and a Conga drum. All of which my students have not had access to playing. Having these drums would open up the ability to teach and for the students to learn about the music and culture of areas that have been missing from our classroom: Latin America and Africa. While three drums may seem insignificant, having these drums in our classroom will allow for a more authentic application of world music. This will positively impact the students learning experience by giving them the opportunity to learn through exploration and to create with their peers.
needStatement: My students need high quality world music drums (Tubano Drums) to learn and practice rhythms, perform music from other countries/cultures and to create their own music and accompaniments.

name: Mrs. M's Classroom Story Time Library
description: I teach K-5th grade self-contained class of students with ASD and other disabilities. This wish list is for our autism program and will be shared with 20+ students that have sensory needs. Our students have task boxes that are individualized to their instructional level and educational goals. The instructional materials in this wish list are for their task boxes and to develop fine motor skills for pre writing. In an effort to gear our classrooms and the materials towards independence these materials will be extremely beneficial. Our students access learning better with visuals and interactive activities. These books are tied to a visual story map that shows the title, author, illustrator, characters, setting and sequence. Each story has a sequence of events where our students practice fine motor skills such as cutting, gluing and writing. The story map is always in front of them and is used every day. Each story has an interactive activity that uses 'WH' questons, and has 3 visuals choices for answers. The students take turns coming up to the board to circle their answer. There are quizzes tied to each story as well. Having these books donated to our library will help us continue our author study style story time.
needStatement: My students need more books for story time. These books would help build our classroom library. Each one of these books is tied to visual story map, interactive group lesson on the smart board and worksheets.

name: Tables for Teamwork!
description: First grade is a wonderful year of growth! My first graders come to school every day excited to learn and improve their reading, writing, and math skills. In addition to academics, students are also working on developing social and interpersonal skills, such as having conversations, working together, sharing, and making compromises. These are important, life-long skills! I strive to make my classroom a place where ALL students feel welcome, respected, and safe. The students in my school are wonderful children. I am fortunate enough to work in a building where above all else, children are valued for who they are and what they bring to the table. They are nurtured and cared for from a young age. Children are celebrated by their successes and not their short comings. Everyone in the school works together to help all the children in the building regardless of who the classroom teacher may be. Last week, I found myself saying, “When your desks are touching the wall, you know you’ve gone too far!” My classroom is filled with first grade students who are energetic, enthusiastic, and eager to learn! Currently, students are seated at desks, which are old, wobbly, and difficult to keep organized. No matter how hard we try, throughout the school day, the desks seem to shift across the classroom. This results in our community supplies and math manipulatives falling off of the desk! There is not enough space to do most projects, and the students are not able to effectively work as a team. We are requesting five rectangular tables to enable my students to work more collaboratively. My first graders are still working to develop their social skills and need to practice these skills. They will be able to work better together during instruction and centers. This project will bring engagement and cooperative learning in my classroom!
needStatement: My students need five rectangular tables to enable them to work more collaboratively. Currently, my first graders are sitting at desks, which wobble and 'magically' move throughout the day. They are also very tricky to keep organized!

name: Reading Has to Start Somewhere
description: I have the privilege of working with some amazing, creative children every day. Many of my students grow up in households with parents that work multiple jobs. Many of these children see and are responsible for more in their day to day life than they should at such a young age. Seeing their bright and enthusiastic smiles every morning proves to me that I am in the right field and the least I can do for them is to make learning fun and to provide a safe environment for a few hours a day. We fail together, make mistakes together, but most of all we learn and grow together. I try to not only teach my students reading, math, social studies, and science, but also life lessons, as well. The first thing they learn from me is that we are a family no matter what. This teaches them to be empathetic and it is amazing to watch them cheer each other on at all stages of their learning!My classroom is lacking a few basic supplies that could really help our classroom and my students thrive. We are in need of stools for our small group reading table along with magnetic letters. These letters will help my kindergarteners learn to read and write. They begin to learn to read by stretching out three letter words and listening to the sounds they hear. These letters will allow my students to begin to do that and then move on to manipulating letters and sounds in words. Lastly, we need new headphones for our listening center. All of these new supplies will bring our reading block to the next level and in turn help my students learn to read! Kindergarten is a big year of growth for my students and you have the chance to make a difference in their lives and help them grow as well.
needStatement: My students need a variety of different items to help us learn to read. We need stools for our reading table, paint brushes, magnetic letters, and childproof headphones.

name: Have You Heard? We Need Headphones!
description: Our classroom bursts with the excitement, wonder, and urgency that young children bring to everything that they come across. Our 1st grade students are eager and thoughtful learners- ready with the foundation they gained in kindergarten to fully launch into becoming readers, writers, mathematicians, and scientists. They have gracious hearts, resilient spirits, and limitless curiosities. We are lucky to be their 1st grade teachers. Our neighborhood is known to be one of the most diverse in the country and every classroom in our school reflects that gift. In addition to the richness that such diversity brings, we also recognize that different opportunities and experiences in early childhood can create inequitable beginnings for children in school. As a school community, we know without a doubt that all of our students are highly capable and work with determination to ensure that every student has the resources, instruction, and support necessary to achieve success. First grade is a time of tremendous growth for students. They launch from the building blocks of kindergarten to delve further into more complex thinking. In reading, they move from working with the alphabet and decoding words to making meaning of texts by making connections, comparing and contrasting characters, making inferences, and more. In math, they move from working on counting and using models like fingers and drawings to add and subtract to using a variety of strategies to mentally solve problems with greater and greater quantities. This rigorous work demands fluency both in reading words and in math facts. Our first grade classes use various computer programs to help our students develop this fluency. Of the 12 computers that are shared among our 3 first grade classrooms, half don't have usable headphones. Many of the headphones are low-quality- with only one side still emitting sound. Others are missing the foam cushioning or are even taped together. The remaining are adult-sized, so go past the ears of our first graders and frequently slip off of their heads. The 10 headphones donated from this project will replace our old, broken, ill-fitted pairs so that students can productively engage in their learning without being interrupted with headphone issues. By successfully focusing on developing their reading and math fluency, our students can better tackle the complex work of making meaning and problem solving in first grade and beyond!
needStatement: My students need 10 pairs of high-quality, child-sized headphones to share among our 3 first grade classrooms.

name: 24 Hour Classroom Access for the 21st Century Learner
description: I am fortunate to teach in a caring and supportive community. Most of the families have lived in the area for generations. The community supports its schools despite the fact that its residents are low socio-economic population. Due to decreasing enrollment at the school, the school is in financial distress. Our school parents, like all parents, want what's best for the education of their children. They give as much as they can to fund supplies and consumables that go to the classrooms. However, the financial problems of the school have negatively impacted every classroom. Our student-teacher ratio is extremely high and students are often crammed into classrooms that are too small to allow them much room to comfortably work. I actively look for ways to facilitate teaching and learning, allowing my students to move and collaborate while learning in a rich and welcoming environment. I have flexible seating options and desks that can be easily arranged for a variety of tasks. I want the students in my class to be excited to enter the room each and every day. Each and every one of my students is priceless to me and so is their education. Swivl camera tracks the speaker, whether that be a teacher, an individual, or a group of students. It will record individual or group presentations. Student collaboration and presentation skills will be enhanced through the frequent use of this device. Parents, teachers, and students can review and rewatch the presentations anytime, not just during school hours. The Swivl camera would enhance students learning beyond the classroom and even beyond the school day. It allows students to access recorded videos from any mobile device, which fits in with their busy lives. Students will be able to reinforce concepts covered in class while independently reviewing at their own pace. Even students who were absent can see what happened in the classroom and avoid that 'lost' feeling when they return to school.
needStatement: My students need a Swivl cam as a way to record audio and visual understanding of concepts and behavior and show other students, the teacher, and parents what they've learned.

name: Coding Coming to Life!
description: I have a bright and inquisitive group of 20 third graders. My students have gelled together nicely over their short 3 and a half years of learning together. Although they haven't been in every class together, they have a sense of respect and camaraderie that deserves acknowledgment. With the right attitude in learning and team-building, I know my students will go far in life. They are empathetic, risk-takers, fun-havers, and mistake-makers. They strive to be the best people they can and help each other through the support of their parents, peers, and other people in their life. They are appreciative in all they do and what they receive. They are my bacon bits. My students will see the importance of coding when they see these inanimate bots come to life. For the majority of my students, this will be the first time they code. It will give them an opportunity to seize the love of programming, which opens up doors for the future. My biggest hope is that this will create a sense of challenge that targets every individual human that touches these robots. Let the problem-solving and grit-grinding begin! As my students discover their new-found talents with these robots, I will task them to share their findings with our school community by linking with buddy classes. They will be able to teach the younger grade levels and seek advice from the older grade levels.
needStatement: My students need Dash & Dot Robots and Fire 7 Tablets to expand their technological skills and explore the world of code in one of the most engaging ways possible.

name: Get Ready, Get Set, STEM!
description: We love to learn! My first graders are working hard every day, and so am I! These six and seven year olds are learning to read, have become writers and have made big gains in math. We are busy all day long, and there's still much to do. My students are in first grade, and love coming to school to learn!They come from a wide variety of living situations. Some come from two parent homes, some from single parents, and some with multiple generations, or multiple families living in one apartment. Some of my students speak English fluently, and some do not. Some of my students come from families who support public education and encourage their students to do their best while at school. While at school, I hold high expectations for each student in their behavior and their academics, no matter their home life. We learn together, we work through problems together, and we celebrate successes together. Helping my students learn the skills of reading and math will help them for their entire lives. These materials are for upcoming STEM lessons that I have planned from Picture-Perfect STEM Lessons, K-2. STEM lessons and activities create critical thinkers, increase science literacy, and enables the next generation of innovators.STEM activities provide hands-on and minds-on lessons for the student. Making math and science both fun and interesting helps the student to do much more than just learn, and allows creativity and problem solving. The plastic animals are apart of the Design a Habitat lesson, where students will apply their knowledge about the needs of animals by designing and building a model habitat for an imaginary pet of their own. The molds, card stock, and paper bags are apart of the Crayons lesson. Here students observe crayons as they endure physical changes from breaking, melting and cooling. Students will then design their own process from recycling broken crayons and demonstrate understanding through a creative writing activity.
needStatement: My students need plastic animals to design a habitat, to complete a STEM challenge in our classroom. They also need materials for a crayon STEM investigation.

name: Listening Station Fun!
description: I work at a Title I school in South Carolina and my students are a great bunch who come from low income families. My students come to me eager to continue on their journey to learn and LOVE to be read to. Reading opens the mind to a whole new world!Starting a Language Arts lesson with a mentor text always gets my students engaged. Everyone loves listening to a good story, especially a classroom full of eager, excited second graders!Everyday my students rotate through two literacy stations. I have 6 stations total that they get to complete two to three times a week. I have a listening station but the CD/cassette player just stopped working and my students love this station. Listening to books on CD, will help my students hear what reading should sound like. This is very important, as I want my students to learn to read with expression and to not sound like robots reading. Books on CD are a fun and engaging station that my students look forward to going to multiple times each week.
needStatement: My students need a brand new listening station to hear how great reading should sound!

name: Self-Regulation Tools
description: Our students come from a wide variety of backgrounds with more than half of our students receiving free and reduced lunch. Currently, there are more than five different languages spoken in my class other than English. We have a variety of needs. I have both four and five year old students in my class. We are in a Montessori Children's House classroom. The Montessori philosophy encourages students to work at their own pace and at their own level. They get to explore five different areas in the classroom: culture, practical life, sensorial, math, and language arts. The flexible seating options will provide the physical needs/wiggles to assist my students to sit quietly and listen and complete independent work. These materials will not directly teach my students new skills, but they will help prime my students for learning in all content areas and with many daily living skills by staying focused. For example, while students are independently working, if they feel like they cannot stay focused due to excessive movement they can channel that movement in to one of these flexible seating options. The rock zen garden, Buddha board, and yoga cards can give them an option to clear their mind and regroup to continue to learn the content they chose to work on. Sometimes students tend to get overwhelmed or emotionally filled and need to take a break. These provide an option to regulate their emotions and mental state.
needStatement: My students need several ways to help regulate their bodies physically, mentally and emotionally. My students need timers and wobble cushions.

name: Strong Readers Make Strong Citizens!
description: My students currently attend a year-round school in St. Paul, MN. I have 23 vibrant kindergarten students that truly love to come to school. My class has a very diverse set of needs with 1/2 of the students speaking english as a second language and 1/3 of my students receive special education service. Each day is a new adventure in the world of learning. My students come to school to be fed, feel loved and find their place in this world on top of learning how to be a citizen in today’s world. They enjoy the safety of the community we have built at our school. I am requesting a variety of materials to have strong literacy based centers during our independent work time. The items I have asked for will ensure my students are learning the basic set of skills they need to be strong readers and writers. I will use these books during my guided reading period. I plan to read these books in small groups with my students. I will introduce new reading strategies, vocabulary and improve their comprehensions skills. I expect students to work independently on a task/activity, when I pull a small group to work with on a specific reading goal. When I am pulling students in a small group the rest of the class will use the materials I have requested to work together on specific literacy skills: phonics, making words and recognizing letters. By having the requested items in my classroom, it will make for a stronger reading block for all in my room!
needStatement: My students need a variety of books and literacy centers to help them grow into strong independent readers.

name: Montessori and Beyond!
description: My students come from a variety of backgrounds and all at a different level of learning. Currently there are 5 languages spoken in my classroom other than English. My school has over half the students on free and reduced lunches. The classroom contains half preschool and half Kindergarten students. The children typically stay in my classroom for a two year period. This helps me build a strong relationship with my students and their families. It also allows me to continue the child's learning without stopping between grades. The Montessori philosophy encourages students to work at their pace and level while exploring areas in the classroom: Sensorial, Language, Mathematics, Science, Cultural and Practical Life. Giving the children these opportunities to move around the classroom as they choose, they become independent learners and goal setters. Once a student masters a skill they move on to the next. There is never an end to learning in the classroom no matter the child's skill level!The books will help build my Guided Reading so that each student can have a book to work with rather than sharing; this is why I am hoping for at least 3 sets (fiction and non-fiction). The books are at different levels so that my students can be challenged at the level they are at. I am also hoping to receive some additional materials that will do provide the following:*help organize the classroom (the rod holder) *replace materials that are missing pieces (the 100 board) *create new hands on experience (the scale, geometric puzzles, lacing, feel and find set)*expand concepts (mighty minds) The children will be excited to have new materials to use in the classroom. Whenever a new material is added to the class we all speak about how we handle the materials so that they can be used for current and future students. Any donation
needStatement: My students need books for Guided Reading and additional materials to extend the Montessori materials.

name: Reading That Reflects Reality
description: My students are a very diverse group of learners. I get the privilege to co-teach an English class that works to make all students successful. My students love to read and write about their lives and experiences. Many of my students live in traditional families, but others don't. Being able to 'see' themselves in the work we do each day is important to get them engaged and keep them engaged. Many of my students don't love school yet, but that will change. Kids who are great and not-so-great readers love books that reflect their reality. Students in my classes get bored easily, and it's no wonder. Many of the titles chosen for middle school students are dated and often discuss things they know nothing about. By choosing relevant, meaningful titles my students will see themselves, and see why reading is important. Something as simple as selecting up-to-date 'real' books supports strong and weak readers to finally engage in something they think is important. Students in the 21st century deserve to read things that support and stretch their ability to think critically, and thoughtfully, about important topics.
needStatement: My students need interesting books that reflect their reality, and their specific learning needs. The Stars Beneath Our Feet and Dear Martin speak to kids who are often forgotten in traditionally assigned fiction at school.

name: We LOVE technology!
description: I have some of the most incredible, hardworking students you will ever meet. Every day they are willing to try new things and learn everything they can. My students strive to do their best in everything that they do. Having more technology in the classroom will benefit them daily as they will be able to use it for many things. It will offer them the ability to discover new ideas using technology and will increase their curiosity to learn. It will offer them valuable experiences. Having more Chromebooks in my classroom will offer my students more opportunities to use technology within the different subjects. It will expand their knowledge in different subjects such as math, science and writing. It will give them an enhanced understanding as they research different real world situations and apply them to their learning experience. It will also offer them opportunities to collaborate with others and give them more opportunities for inquiry based learning. This will benefit students and prepare them for future skills they will need to learn in life. These Chromebooks will be a great addition to our classroom.
needStatement: My students need more technology in the classroom to be more successful.

name: Can You Help Me Be Successful?
description: I teach at a high poverty school full of energetic, eager-to-learn students. They come to kindergarten on a variety of levels and from a variety of backgrounds. They all want to be successful. The best part about kindergarten is they can have fun with just about any lesson. It is my job to see to it that school can be a fun place even while they are learning. We make every day special for everyone by having fun while becoming successful learners. Where do you sit when you are doing your best work? On a couch, on the floor, at a table, standing up? Everyone has a different place that they learn best. I want to give my students choices of where and how to work so they can do their best work for me. These lap desks will allow my students the freedom of choice as to where to sit to do their best work. I firmly believe if we allow the students to move and sit where they can work best we will get better, more quality work from them.
needStatement: My students need lap desks so they can do their best work.

name: Breakfast, the Most Important Meal of the Day!
description: My students are a group of 7th - 12th graders at BPJSHS. My students with learning and emotional/behavioral disorders all learn in their own way and at their own pace. If you were to visit my classroom you’d see chaos, but there is so much learning taking place! My students are learning how to read, how to complete multi-step word problems, how to identify their emotions, and how to cope with those emotions. Yes, it’s chaos, but it’s my favorite kind of chaos!Have you ever gotten to work and realized you forgot to eat breakfast? Your tummy is grumbling, and you’re feeling yourself get crabbier the hungrier you get. Now pretend the same thing has happened to you, except you’re a teenager. You’re hungry, and increasingly crabby, and are being excepted to learn geometry, or anatomy. You can barely focus because you’re so hungry. Now, don’t forget that you also have ADHD, or depression, or a learning disability. You’re being expected to retain all of this abstract information, while your body and mind are running on fumes. Supplying my students with the food they need in the morning allows them to start their day on the right foot! Breakfast gives your body and mind the fuel it needs to run well all day. For most of my students, school is already difficult. Add an empty stomach to that, and they can sometimes feel it is impossible. While it seems simple, breakfast is a big deal for my students.
needStatement: My students need breakfast foods to meet their basic needs so they are ready and able to learn!

name: Creative Art Leads to Creative Learning!
description: I have a wonderful group of students who are always excited about responsibility and learning. My students love to learn and often share the exciting activities that are completed in our classroom. Our mission is to transform and inspire an educational movement. We exist to inspire the children of our school through education to maximize their potential and transform society. We are continuously striving to make sure every child is successful. We are committed to helping all of our children bring their dreams to fruition. Our school is a great community of families, educators and professionals. The Cricut cutting machine will be used to make creative, hands-on games to practice in Language, Writing and Math centers, whole group Language, Writing, and Math lessons and activities. The CRICUT EXPLORE AIR 2 will make Math and Language projects appealing and more professional than hand writing on poster board. I would also use the Cricut in making my bulletin boards more exciting and educational for my students. These activities will provide my students with engaging hands-on activities that meets the needs of the diverse learners in my classroom. Just imagine, being able to print, cut out numbers, make mathematical signs, shapes and vocabulary words for the week! I get excited just thinking about its uses!
needStatement: My students need a Cricut Explore Air cutting machine to create fun center activities.

name: Computer Upgrade Will Make the Grade!
description: My class consists of nine unique, enthusiastic, and diverse students who have special needs. We are in a low-income urban school district. Our elementary school includes pre-k through third grade classes, with several self-contained special education classrooms. My class is a community of learners who have numerous strengths but also have learning challenges. The students work hard every day to improve their skills and show growth. They are energetic, fun, happy, and eager to learn. Each day is an adventure, and my students will always be my 'kids' long after they leave my classroom! My students need a new computer and color printer in our classroom to enhance their learning and provide additional opportunities to use technology. In addition to using educational websites to reinforce skills, the computer will also be used to view videos to supplement my lessons. My students will benefit from a brand new computer and color printer, and they will be motivated to use the computer as a learning tool. In addition, the current computers in my classroom are older and do not function as quickly or effectively. A computer upgrade is really needed! The earbuds are needed to replace headphones that do not work properly. Each student will get their own set of earbuds to use at the computer.
needStatement: My students need a new HP computer (desktop) and printer in our classroom to provide additional opportunities to integrate technology.

name: Chromebooks for Learning!
description: I work in a low income urban district teaching kindergarten. A majority of these children are bilingual. Their parents don't speak English which makes it difficult to communicate with them or have home support. The students receive free breakfast and lunch. I have students who live in shelters and others that come from broken homes. They have seen more things than I could have imagined at their age. I realize that no matter what their lives are like at home, my students always feel safe at school. They are eager to learn but lack the supplies that would further enhance their learning. I am very passionate about my job. I would like to provide more for my students; however, we have limited supplies. I purchase many supplies out of my own pocket, but this becomes expensive. Most of my students come to school improperly dressed for the weather or without needed school supplies. It would be great to have some assistance for my classroom to give the students a better education. These Chromebooks will enable my students to use technology to enhance their learning. They need to be familiar with 21st century skills. We will be using the Chromebooks on a daily basis for both math and reading skills. We use softschools.com, starfall.com and razkids.com as well as youtube video to help us learn key materials to help us learn the necessary information to grow. My students will be able to access educational websites that will help them become better readers, mathematicians, and scientists. Being in a high poverty school district with a large number of ESL and ELL students, many of them do not have access to technology outside of school.I want to create challenging and fun learning experiences to build on their skills. As a teacher in a low income, high poverty area many of my students are faced with multiple challenges both inside and outside the classroom. Technology is a great way to foster learning goals at a higher level. It allows them access to technology which they do not all have access to in their homes. Many families are just making ends meet and having a computer at home is not a priority. However, my students need to learn technology skills to help them thrive in the learning environment as well as give them the knowledge to do state-mandated tests on the computers at school. Through the use of three Chromebooks, my students can expand their way of learning.
needStatement: My students need Chromebooks to help widen their horizons through technology to enhance their learning capabilities.

name: Sport Stories for Girls
description: My students live in a small rural community. My school serves K-8th-grade students. The school library provides books and services to all 9 grades. Most of the students here are from low-income homes or homes where English is a second language. They wait patiently every morning for me to unlock the library door. They come to the library for a variety of reasons; to read, check out books, get warm, use the computer and other activities that I provide for them. Some of my older elementary and middle school female students are starting to need encouragement and support to play sports. They are at the age where playing sports is sometimes not seen as 'ideal' for a girl. They need to know that playing sports and being active is a good habit for a lifetime. The Jake Maddox Girl Sports Stories series definitely supports the idea of sports being for everyone. When students read about girls in sports and see the books in the library it will help them to know that playing sports is cool. Playing sports does not need to ever end if they enjoy it. Sports and physical activites are for everyone.
needStatement: My students need to feel empowered about girls in sports. 'The Jake Maddox Girl Sports Stories' is a great series that show girls playing all different kinds of physical activities.

name: Let it Snow!!!
description: Every day the second-grade scholars at our school can be heard chanting and stepping from down the hall as they celebrate their African American identity and their academic achievements. Many of these boys strongly connect to stepping, as it has been a positive outlet for them, because it empowers them to create a strong and powerful culture. Every time these boys step, they forget the hardships of living in North Minneapolis and are empowered to be the best they can be, and celebrate not only their culture, but their learning as well. 'I put my B in front of me E whoooo (lean back) my S in front of my T ahhh it looks so good on me, you wish you could be me ahh uhh! 1, 2, 3, (stomping) I put my B in front of my E whooo my S in front of T. (pause) Pause for the picture and don't you forget we are the BEST boys college-bound, too legit to quit, ahoooo.'My students need winter clothes to stay warm and dry in Minnesota winters. The boys in my class come from an underprivileged part of North Minneapolis and most of them do not have the appropriate winter gear to stay warm at recess and on their way to and from school. My students desperately need your help in preparing them to stay warm these cold winter months with snow pants and gloves. With your help not only will my students stay warm and enjoy their time outside, but they will also feel like their community cares about their well being. These students deserve to be kids, and not worry about staying warm this winter but rather worry about what to build in the snow. This will not only enhance their sense of well being, but the sense of pride and comfort in their community.
needStatement: My students need winter wear to keep warm in chilly Minnesota weather!

name: Foundational Phonics Books And Tools for New To Country Students
description: Our elementary school is a creative arts magnet school in an urban district that uses interdisciplinary teaching and daily arts instruction to positively affect all students in the school through hands-on, interactive learning experiences. In our overall school population, 81% of our students qualify for free/reduced lunch. The students I work with are English Language Learners who are new to our country and come from diverse backgrounds and experiences. The students are highly motivated to learn but they have a wide range of learning needs. This school year, I worked primarily with small groups of 5th grade learners from El Salvador, Thailand, Sudan, Mexico, Ethiopia, Somalia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. My students need assistance in developing their phonics and decoding skills and this project is in hopes to do just that. My morning meeting groups consists of fifth-grade students who are all new to the country. Many of which, have had little or no exposure of the English language. As educator know, phonics is a foundational skill that students are required to have in order to succeed academically. The books and tools I am requesting will be used during 30 minute 'morning meeting' time that focuses on foundational phonics, decoding, and fluency building skills. Because my students are entering middle school with limited English language exposure, this project essential to their future success. We will work closely with books that focus on sight words. I provide as much exposure to these words in school as possible. Due to the fact that most of them do not have the English support at home. I'd love for them to be as prepared as possible as they navigate through post-primary education, and beyond. Thank you
needStatement: My students need practice with sight words and phonics skills which these books provide in an easy to follow format.

name: Frozen: Great Movie, Bad Feeling
description: I work with 100 amazing kindergarten and first grade students as an EL (English Learners) teacher. I co-teach content areas with four outstanding classroom teachers, and I also pull small groups of beginning level English speakers out for targeted instruction. My school is comprised of ~70% EL students. Many of our children are recent immigrants and are also adjusting to their new life in the U.S. All students at my school receive free breakfast and lunch, and we rely on community partners to help provide school uniforms and supplies to families in need. My students are eager to learn about the world around them and are hard workers. Everyone deserves to have a warm and cozy sweatshirt on a cool day. Minnesota winters are long and can be very cold. My kindergarten and first grade students could really benefit from a sweatshirt they can keep at school to stay warm. I selected fifty simple sweatshirts that will be comfortable and also follow our uniform policy. Please consider helping me keep little ones warm and cozy. Many of my students have very limited access to clothing and they could really use a new sweatshirt to keep them comfortable. I am able to wash the sweatshirts at school as needed. I will distribute the sweatshirts to kindergarten and first grade children as needed and have them keep the clothing at school until the end of the school year. Thank you for considering this project.
needStatement: My students need warm, soft, uniform sweatshirts so they can be comfortable in the classroom.

name: Break Out Learning
description: I teach at a Title I school in South Carolina where 100 percent of our students receive free breakfast and lunch. I have 18 bright students in my classroom. Despite so many hardships, my students are eager to learn and do their best. They want to be in school because they want to learn all they can so they can be successful one day. My class is heavily populated with ESOL students who need the visual learning to clearly understand the concept. I need hands on materials to help give them the education they need. Help me make sure my students have all that they need to believe, achieve, and soar!Breakout boxes are known for targeting the 4cs: critical thinking, collaboration, creativity, and communication. The break out boxes will be implemented in all five subjects that I teach. In 5th grade, my students are standardized tested in ELA, Math, and Social Studies. The break out boxes will help improve their learning because they are hands on. These boxes help make learning fun and effective. Students will work in teams with different puzzles to break out the box. Breakout boxes are good for any age level or academic level. This is great because they can be used for differentiated instruction. I love breakout boxes because they make the students work together and critically think, which are two essential skills they will need forever! The wobble stools will allow my children to have optional seating in my classroom. The wobble stools will be implemented during whole group and small group lessons. These chairs allow my students who love to wiggle, focus.
needStatement: My students need breakout boxes to help support hands on learning. This also will allow students to work collaboratively in the classroom. The wobble chairs will help my children who love to 'wiggle' focus.

name: Brighten Our Reading....
description: My kindergarten students enjoy spending their school day in a rural 4K-8th grade school that has a population of 420. There are two classrooms per grade level. My kindergartners are fortunate to have access to a beautiful school library, a rich and diverse classroom library and some tablets in the classroom to listen to stories. Dr. Seuss said, 'The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.” In their short time in 5K, they have learned that books allow them to to discover things they never knew and to experience amazing adventures. I am teaching my students to learn to read so that they can read to learn in the future. My goal is to have children fall in love with reading! Debra KostrewaRaymond School 5K TeacherHaving my students read their little reader books to their families every week is the cornerstone of our school’s homework program. I currently have to send home photocopied little readers with my students due to the lack of emergent reading level books in our school’s book room. The books I requested will replace the black and white photocopies. These books are beautifully illustrated, rich text and filled with sight words that my students can read. I know that all of my students will be thrilled to take these new little reader books home to read to their family. What better way to have students fall in love with reading than to have them read a story to their family members and take them on an adventure! Thank you in advance for your consideration. “Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better, it’s not.”~Dr. Seuss
needStatement: My students need level reader books that will engage them and motivate them to become readers.

name: Bring Midwest Food Connection Into Our Classroom!
description: Our 48 students include special education students, general education students, and English language learners that are in our inclusive classroom. They are getting direct support from a special education teacher, an English language teacher, and a general education teacher. Most of our students qualify for free and reduced-price lunch. I buy whatever I can, but sometimes I need some help. Every project I have had donated has directly made a positive impact on my students! They are appreciative and truly enjoy all the materials we receive. Our students are caring, open-minded, risk-takers who try their best every day. Our students show perseverance in all that they do! My class has dedicated, lovable students who come from all walks of life with many different experiences. Imagine my students experiencing fresh local produce, tasty and healthy treats, and cooking right in the classroom! Midwest Food Connection teachers bring exciting, practical and interactive lessons about healthful eating right into my classroom! They can bring this energy and delight in natural foods to my classroom. Storytelling, drama, song, and art accompany a bountiful selection of fresh food. Their educators create dishes right in front of students’ eyes, engaging children in the preparation and the processing of food, and astound them with wonderfully tasting food and snacks. Midwest Food Connection will empower my students to make healthy and responsible food choices. Students will learn about agriculture in Minnesota and will be able to share their knowledge with their family. Students will get a chance to experience urban farming and will learn valuable tools that they can carry with them for the rest of their lives.
needStatement: My students need an opportunity to experience fresh local produce, tasty and healthy treats, and cooking right in the classroom! Midwest Food Connection teachers bring exciting, practical and interactive lessons about healthful eating.

name: 'Bone' Please
description: My students live in a small rural community. My school serves K-8th grade students. The school library provides books and services to all 9 grades. Most of the students here are from low-income homes or homes where English is a second language. They wait patiently every morning for me to unlock the library door. They come to the library for a variety of reasons; to read, check out books, get warm, use the computer and other activities that I provide for them. Graphic novels are the hit of every school library. Few are more popular than the 'Bone' series by Jeff Smith. Our school library only has a few books of the series. We are asking for these new books to complete the series. The few books that we have are never on the shelves and the students are so disappointed when they come back in to check out the next book and find out that we have an incomplete set. There is something about this little ghost and his adventures that the students can relate to. The storyline and the graphic pictures with it makes this series a constant favorite.
needStatement: My students need the series Bone by Jeff Smith. We need these books to help complete the incomplete set we have.

name: We're All About That Dinosaur Roar
description: I am a primary Montessori teacher in a Title 1 School. Being a teacher within a Montessori school, I am able to work with my students over the course of three years, assuming that they begin when they are three years old and do not leave. I have a class of twenty-four children who are oh so eager to learn. While they are all unique in their own way, the majority of them come from a low socioeconomic background. Many of my students have never left the county, let alone the country. With that being said, it is my goal to give them as much exposure as I can to the world around them. Dinosaurs are a huge topic that the children love. They are big and mysterious and seem to spark so much creativity among our little ones. Children have a natural curiosity that surround the topic, and these materials will allow my children to satisfy that inquisitiveness. The dinosaur figurines can be used for multiple lessons within our classroom that will allow them to make connections from what they see and hear in the books to their world. The 3-D excavation kit will allow them to be paleontologist and discover fossils for themselves. They will get to see and feel what it would be like to dig up real dinosaur bones.
needStatement: My students need books that will show them what life was like when dinosaurs lived as well as other items such as 3-D excavation kit that will teach them how to be paleontologist.

name: Read Before You Think
description: My students are teen moms trying to finish their high school diploma. They love to read! During the school year we read a book a month. We meet at lunch to discuss them. Most have had traumatic experiences and limited success in school, and they are adjusting to being parents. My students have never been in a book club before, and they want to read more than what we are just discussing. I feel that this experience is making them better students, better parents, and better citizens.I am asking for a set of books to help support the AGAPE book club. I have a great group of girls the really love to read and enjoy Book Club. With Book Club it is a place where the girls can come and relax and get to know some of their fellow classmates. Book Club has helped a lot of the girls who thought they did not like to read find that with the right book they do like to read and it can be fun. I have enjoyed have Book Club with my students and hope I will be able to continue to have Book Club the rest of the year.
needStatement: My students need these books in order to continue with book club.

name: It's All About Fact Practice
description: We love to learn! My first graders are working hard every day, and so am I! These six and seven year olds are learning to read, have become writers and have made big gains in math. We are busy all day long, and there's still much to do. My students are in first grade, and love coming to school to learn!They come from a wide variety of living situations. Some come from two parent homes, some from single parents, and some with multiple generations, or multiple families living in one apartment. Some of my students speak English fluently, and some do not. Some of my students come from families who support public education and encourage their students to do their best while at school. While at school, I hold high expectations for each student in their behavior and their academics, no matter their home life. We learn together, we work through problems together, and we celebrate successes together. Helping my students learn the skills of reading and math will help them for their entire lives. My students love Daily 3! Daily 3 rotations include Math Writing, Math by Myself, and Math with Someone. During Math with Someone, students have the opportunity to play math games that review the skills that have been previously taught and they have practiced at Math by Myself, and Math Writing. These skills include addition, subtraction, and place value, and number sense. As the teacher, it my job to plan games and activities that are meaningful and interesting to the students. These games are already created which gives me more time to focus on the needs of my students, and to plan other activities. My students need 4 Way Countdown, Sum Swamp, and I Sea 10! to help them practice basic math facts. The games will hold their attention, and add fun to their daily routine. The sheet protectors are used in Math Writing on a daily basis. I print off practice sheets and the students write on the protectors with dry erase markers. I add new practice pages to their math binders almost every day. Daily 3 has helped my students LOVE math!
needStatement: My students need 4-Way Countdown, I Sea 10! and Sum Swamp to practice addition and subtraction facts.

name: Personalized Alphabet Books
description: Our school is located in St. Paul, MN. This school serves a diverse student population with approximately 65% of the students qualifying for free and reduced lunch and 47% of the students designated as English Language Learners. The students in this school are energetic, creative, and have an immense sense of wonder. I strive everyday to encourage my students to continue their love of learning and curiosity. It is my goal to create a safe and welcoming environment where students are able to grow academically and socially. The students put forth amazing effort, and it is so wonderful to see how proud they are of themselves and each other at the end of each school day. Over the course of the next several weeks, first through third grade students will participate in an alphabet book project. They will explore a variety of alphabet mentor texts. They will then choose a theme for their own alphabet book, participate in the writing process, and finally publish their own alphabet book. Providing each student with their very own blank book will serve as an exciting and valuable way to publish. The students will spend a great amount of time making their writing strong. The blank books provide a special space for students to display their hard work and creativity.
needStatement: My students need blank books so they are able to publish their alphabet books.

name: Go for the GOLD!
description: We are a Title One school where 82% of students are low-income. My advanced band and orchestra are scheduled to compete in the Forum Music Festival here in Southern California. We have participated the past three years and have earned a Silver ranking. This group is amazing this year and are going for the Gold but our school district has been hit with a budget crisis and we need your help to pay for a bus!! We are active in the community. The orchestra recently performed for the Rose Parade decorating event for the Girl Scouts and the Band performs for the Latino Heritage Parade and will be marching in this year's Black History Parade here in Pasadena for the 5th year in a row. They are dedicated to the art of music making, love sharing their talents with the community and inspire those around them. They are truly deserving of your help, generosity and this opportunity. Thank you. The Forum Music Festival is an adjudicated event in which professionals in the field rank the groups according to to the California State Standards of Music Education. A Gold ranking represents student achievement in the top 10% of the state, Silver is the top 20% and Bronze is the top 30%. This project will help to boost the student's confidence in their individual and overall group performance and inspire them to want to continue their music education at the high school level as well as realize what can be achieved with hard work, practice and dedication!They will return to school feeling proud of their accomplishment in knowing that they put forward their best effort and that the community is supporting them. They will take this confidence to the other core subjects in school and in their personal lives. Many of these students are struggling academically and often struggle to find the confidence needed to be a better student. Music helps students become self motivated and find strategies that work both in school and at home helping them cope with the realities of life. The instrumental music classroom is a place where these students can find that confidence and put them on the path to college.
needStatement: My students need a bus to take them to Forum Music Festival!

name: Flexible Seating in the 21st Century Classroom!
description: I teach at a Title I school in East New York. My students are special needs students with various disabilities. They all come from a very low socioeconomic background. My students face many challenges that they have to overcome on a daily basis. Regardless of their hardships, they always walk in the door with a big smile on their faces and look forward to various learning opportunities. My students would love to have flexible seating options available to them that will help them succeed and meet their individual needs. They often get fidgety and restless. A comfortable learning environment would enable them to be more engaged and ensure learning throughout the school day. My classroom is full of very energetic second graders. They love to move around and explore new things every day. I try to provide them with as many movement opportunities as possible. After all, who likes to sit still? I also like to empower my students to have a choice in everything they do. My students need to have a variety of tables available such as round tables, a rectangular table and triangular tables to give them choice in their seating options. By donating to our project, you will help the learning environment of my students by providing them with flexible seating. My students wish to have seating options that are fun and comfortable. They struggle with being engaged while sitting at the same desk all day long. There are studies that have proven that students work better when they are comfortable and physically active. Since all my students have different learning styles and needs this project will help meet all their various needs. They will have the choice to sit at a table that works for them. They will be able to work on the round table for small group work. The rectangular table will be lowered and mats will be available for them to sit on. This gives them the choice of not sitting on an assigned chair. The triangular table will help the students that need to work alone. By donating to this project you will help transform my classroom from a 'typical' classroom to a classroom that's 'fun' and feels like home.
needStatement: My students need to have flexible seating options in order to ensure their success in the classroom.

name: Leadership Library
description: My students come to school everyday looking for how school applies to the real world. In this Leadership Class we are learning about very real global issues and the students are creating possible solutions to problems they are passionate about. We use all kinds of engaging resources like videos, music, and interactive experiences to keep the classroom engaging and connected to the world. My students are 21st century learners who are constantly seeking knowledge and they recognize the value of technology and books to gain valuable information. The students are growing up in a fast paced informational world, and we are learning how to ask the right questions, access relevant and meaningful information, and then use that information to become great citizens. Classroom resources can be expensive so students often have to share which limits the amount of learning they can explore on their own.A Strong library is the foundation of a great classroom. Books are the perfect way to introduce a topic, enhance an idea, provide research resources, and answer questions. The picture books will help introduce important topics of character development, empathy, grit, creativity, and compassion. All the workbooks will give us lots of examples of how to improve skills and the activities and game books will let us practice. The team building and leadership activities are an invaluable way for students to practice team work, communication, leadership, creativity, and resilience. When Hurricane Harvey came through Harris County and hit Humble ISD my apartment, with a large chunk of my classroom library, was flooded. This project stands to replace what was lost and enhance the library for the students. Some of our population at WMS was flooded, and ALL of our students were personally impacted. Every student has multiple friends or family members who were dealing with flooded homes and lost property. Being able to provide fun, funny, engaging, and character building resources will be a great way to continue to help my students have the personal mental tools needed to continue to thrive after Harvey.
needStatement: My students need a Leadership classroom library to help them learn the skills they need to be the best citizens they can!

name: Douglass Band to Chicago
description: Our students at Douglass High School are mostly low income, inner city students from Oklahoma City. Although these students are from the inner city, they are brilliant and very good musicians. Most of my students are excelling academically. These students definitely work hard for the Douglass Music Program. These children display devotion discipline and musicianship to exemplify how a Frederick A. Douglass Band Student represent themselves. They have one numerous awards for their showmanship under the direction of their director Jason N.
