Morgan The Douglass High School 'Pride of the Eastside' Marching Band is endeavoring on traveling to Chicago, Il for the Proviso East Battle of the Bands. These children all come from the inner city of OKC and only about 3 of them have ever traveled further than Dallas, Texas. This will be a great experience for them first to compete in another state and second to see one of the largest cities in the world. While we are there, we will visit Lake Michigan, Navy Pier and The DuSable Museum of African American History in addition to the Battle of the Bands. The Band students have been working hard in the band room and in their academic classrooms. We have a great group of students who are talented musicians. We would appreciate your support to help us achieve this opportunity for our children.
needStatement: My students need help funding their transportation for the Proviso East Band Competition in Chicago, Il.

name: Bring Yoga and Meditation to Bronx Students
description: The bell rings and after only two minutes of transition between classes, my students are expected to focus on a new subject. Yet their minds are already filled to capacity. Many of them are still processing what they were taught in the previous class, the latest gossip heard in the hallway, or an encounter along their commute to school. They are energetic, inquisitive and thoughtful adolescents eager to learn but labeled 'at-risk' due to many circumstances beyond their control. My students have a lot on their plates, frequently juggling adult responsibilities and teen angst. There is no time to be a kid and even less opportunity for respite from their daily routine. Many of my students live day to day in a state of fight or flight. However when they are presented with a chance to sit in a circle, meditate and talk about their feelings, the positive impact on their social-emotional well-being is evident. As their teacher, I endeavor to create a sense of community for them by providing them a safe space to be themselves. Students need tools to manage their emotions as well as internal and external conflict. Yoga and meditation are effective tools that many of my students don't know how to access. On occasion, I have had opportunities to teach yoga and meditation to my students. Each time I have noticed the positive impact these moments have had on their behavior and their overall social-emotional well-being. I have relied on DVDs and apps to guide our practice because I did not have the training to lead them on my own. I am requesting support for the Breathe for Change 200-hour Wellness Champion and Yoga Alliance teacher certification that is specifically designed for educators. This training will provide me with the formal education needed to effectively teach meditation and yoga to my students. Furthermore, it will enable me to positively impact the mental and physical health of my school community.
needStatement: I need financial assistance for a 200-hour yoga and wellness teacher certification so that I can provide my students with the tools to manage their social-emotional needs.

name: 'Never Forget Who You Are' -from The Lion King
description: Our interdistrict magnet school is filled with incredibly bright and talented students. We nurture a student's capacity to think strategically, critically, and creatively through the arts, and we seek to embolden problem solving skills within each student. As an arts and academics school our vision is to empower students to excel through arts integration. As an art teacher to more than 400 students in grades Pre-K through grade 8, I can proudly say that my students are learning to persevere through challenges and to solve them creatively. More than half of my students come from urban or low-income households. By discovering creative solutions to problems in art, my students will acquire the skills needed to solve the problems they may face in their every day lives. My goal is to provide my students with the tools they need to 'think outside the box' so they can become competent, successful adults. Students in my school celebrate diversity by studying various ethnic groups and traditions. This year, the entire school will be focusing on the cultures, traditions, and people of Africa. Each of my art classes will be creating and displaying artwork based on a country in Africa. This year, as a culminating project, the students in my school will be performing 'Lion King, Jr.' Your generous donation will help my art students create the scenery and props that will make our play come alive! They will be using the canvas drop cloths and paints to create background scenery and banners. They will also create a giant 'Tree of Life' featured in every scene. They will be using cement as a support base and plastic poultry mesh to create a tree trunk, covered in butcher paper. Dowels will be used to create the supports for leaves, which we will make using green construction paper. Students will also create giant animal puppets, held by the long square dowels. Student artwork will be attached to the walls and ceilings using the double sided tape, creating a jungle atmosphere throughout the school.
needStatement: My students need art supplies like paint, Drop Cloth Tarps, and Kraft Paper, to create scenery and props for a school-wide production of 'Lion King, Jr.'

name: Restock, Resupply, and Rejuvenate
description: I teach English and Language Arts in 5th grade. My class is majority Special Education and English as a Second Language students. Our school educates a diverse population of students, including a majority of Hispanic students as well as refugees, making our school's demographic breakdown significantly different than other schools in Indianapolis. Our English as a Second Language population is significant: we educate students from 20 different countries who speak 18 different languages. Meaning, that many of the students I serve are working to overcome learning disabilities while learning English at the same time. Regardless of all the challenges my scholars face, they inspire me on a daily basis. Their desire to learn and grow as students and people is what makes this job worth it. We need these materials to restock our classroom supply. These items will help us have beautiful interactive notebooks, pens for peer editing, and post it notes for making annotations in our text while close reading passages. Close reading and interactive notebooks helps keep our students engaged! These materials will help us be successful and reach our goals. We are running out of classroom supplies and we are only halfway through the year!We need hand sanitizer, tissues and Clorox wipes to keep us healthy and germ free. If we are clean and healthy, we can be ready to learn! Please help us start 2018 strong, prepared, and healthy!
needStatement: My students need basic classroom supplies, such as Clorox wipes, post-it notes, and ink, to restock halfway through the school year.

name: You Play, We Play, We All Play!
description: My students currently attend a year-round school in St. Paul, MN. I have 23 vibrant kindergarten students that truly love to come to school. My class has a very diverse set of needs with 1/2 of the students speaking English as a second language and 1/3 of my students receive special education service. Each day is a new adventure in the world of learning. My students come to school to be fed, feel loved and find their place in this world on top of learning how to be a citizen in today’s world. They enjoy the safety of the community we have built. Young children need regular active play to develop and grow properly. Active play strengthens the brain and establishes connections on how to work with others as part of a team. Active play is crucial for one's emotional well-being. With the materials, I have requested my students can learn how to take turns, work together, and learn how to be a good sport. The materials will be used for small group as well as large group games for recess and morning meeting to reinforce teamwork, cooperation, assertion, responsibility, empathy and self-control within the classroom. Your donation to my classroom will help each one of my students grow into the best version of themselves. Their little minds are still growing and exploring the world. With your generous donation students will be able to work on gross motor skills, problem-solving, working together, and social interaction with their peers. These are life lessons, and can't always be taught in the classroom. My students will have the opportunity to work together with a partner, small group, or even large group, utilizing the sports equipment/games I hope to have purchased for us. I will model each activity/game to the class and partner students who will help each other grow. With the items I have requested, students will be introduced to group games/partner games. My class will use the balls to play group games like four square, kickball, reflex ball, and push and catch. The class will also have a chance to work on being a partner and taking turns with the scoop ball sets, disks, and some of the board games (the indoor recess) I have requested. After each group/partner games, the class will come together and talk about what worked well, what can we work on and how we used active play to come
needStatement: My students need a variety of games/activities to establish social skills.

name: Tech Teacher Needs Tech!
description: We live in a rural Idaho community that still values 'vocational' education. My students are interested in learning skills they can use in their daily lives - possibly even for making a living. We have about 600 students in a 7th and 8th grade only building. I get to see on average 100 of them each trimester. Studying technology can be a wonderful experience. I'm hoping to increase my knowledge base and skills in order to better relate real world examples of life skills to them. I am requesting a new computer to use as I take re certification classes online and prepare to work on my masters degree. Living in a rural Idaho town doesn't give me any option other than online classes, and I'm finding my current laptop is just not up to the task. I am hoping to use this opportunity to broaden my knowledge base and increase my skill as a teacher. This will help my students in many ways. I am currently taking an intro to psychology class and have already used information from it in several ways relating to robotics. The class is also helping me understand thought processes which is helping me to connect with my students better. As I further my studies, I will be better able to follow the STEAM model in my classroom. I teach technology already, and do a fair job of incorporating science and mathematics. This computer will be the gateway to me being able to include more science, technology, engineering, art, and math into my classes.
needStatement: I need a computer so I can continue my work towards a masters degree.

name: Conversations About Books
description: Our students are country kids that enjoy reading when they have a chance to choose what they want to read. Our kids are great kids. Many communities say this but it's true about our kids. Our kids need books that they enjoy and they need multiple books that they can enjoy so that they start to talk about those books! It is my goal to provide those books so that more reading conversations can take place! If kids don't have adults who are showing them reading, they won't read and this helps. Having multiple students reading the same books gives them a chance to engage with their books in ways that they don't usually get to engage. Kids need engaging material but we need it in multiple students' hands in order to foster conversations about reading. These books will foster conversations about topics in books that kids enjoy and get kids talking about reading and off of their phones. When kids see other kids reading books that are recommended, they ask for those books and this project will make those books available to more kids to get them reading and talking. Reading is the key in education for every subject area and for success in school and out of school. Conversations about books is about getting kids engaged in something other than technology and games. I am requesting a wide range of popular literature titles to increase our reading options.
needStatement: My students need books to have conversations about in and out of the classroom.

name: Science Kits for Learning!
description: I teach in a diverse area, and my hard-working students come to school every day ready to learn. I love my students! They are hard-working, eager learners. They come from diverse backgrounds including various ethnicities and diverse socioeconomic backgrounds. I use whole-brain teaching strategies in my classroom, so my students are constantly engaged in learning and sharing ideas with each other. I want my students to have all of the essentials they need to be able to love life every day. Science is an awesome subject to teach! There is a lot that I can do with the topics of science within the classroom. My students are always engaged and excited to learn something new. In America, each grade level has designated science standards that we need to teach to our students. In first grade, we learn about animals, weather and life cycles. These kits will help my students have a hands-on approach to learning about plants, animals, their 5 senses and many more! With your help, these kits will give my students activities to help build their science skills step by step!
needStatement: My students need kits to help them have a hands-on experience with science.

name: Digital Storytelling!
description: My students are very energetic and love to do hands-on activities. They are very social and are still learning how to interact with their peers. My students love to learn through movement and play. Although my students differ in where they are with their educational needs, they are very supportive and push their peers to be the best they can be. As a class, we love learning together in fun and engaging ways. We love our kindergarten family and all the fun things that we do! The Teachers Pay Teachers Gift Card will be used to purchase Google Classroom files that will allow my students to create their own digital stories that they can share with their peers and families through our classroom. Our grade level just received dress up items from a previous DonorsChoose project that they can use while performing their digital story to the class. Our school has monthly character assemblies where a group of students can share a quick skit or story. My goal is to have a group of students share their digital story at the school wide assembly relating to character education.
needStatement: My students need digital files from Teachers Pay Teachers that allow them to tell digital stories that can be shared through the Smartboard.

name: Learning Through Play!
description: The school I work at is a low income inner city school with a diverse student population. I work as a special education teacher with students with disabilities. These students have learning disabilities, emotional behavioral disabilities, visual impairments, other health disabilities, autism spectrum disorder, and physical impairments. The students I work with often have deficits in the area of social skills. I would like to provide more opportunities for my students to engage with each other through positive, team building activities. The games and activities will be used in a special education classroom to help build social skills. This project includes games and materials for creative play. These materials will be used with my students to increase positive peer interactions. This project includes many different building materials such as Legos, K'Nex, and Marble Run to build things and work together as a team. This includes learning how to demonstrate good sportsmanship, positive conversations, taking turns, and more using games such as Guess Who, Even Steven's Odds, and Battleship. This project will help with the building of crucial life long skills. My students will be able to practice these skills in a small group setting with the hopes of them transferring what they learned to the general education classroom and eventually into the community. Thank you for your support to make this a reality!
needStatement: My students need games and activities to use to work on cooperative play.

name: Treasures For Treasured Students!
description: As an educator at a low-income/high poverty school, where 100% of my students receive free lunch and over 40% of them are identified as homeless, my students come to school faced with many challenges and disadvantages. However, many of these students have low self-esteem and don't have much confidence in themselves. Their lives are full of personal struggles and limited to almost no recognization or praise, so when these students come to school, I make it my number one priority to make them feel loved, appreciated, and special when they accomplish positive tasks or obligations. I am requesting small toys, treats, prizes, such as stress balls, writing pens and paper, stress-free coloring books, Yo-Yo, play dough, kids stampers, notebooks, activity books, and other items for my treasure box that will be available schoolwide to all students. I am requesting these items for my treasure box because I am the one person that provides prizes and rewards to the entire school for the students. I provide these prizes, treats, and rewards because many of these students do not get the chance or opportunity to celebrate the small but wonderful accomplishments that they make while in school. These small toys, treats, prizes will make a difference in these students lives by lifting their confidence, making them feel worthy, providing them with opportunities to be recognized for being an important part of their school.
needStatement: My students need rewards, treats, and small toys to help lift their self-esteem and overall emotional well-being!

name: Basic Classroom Supplies for Organization and Fun!
description: I work at a Title I school located in Tacoma, Washington. My class is filled with bright students from diverse backgrounds who come to school excited to learn every day. My students are future engineers, teachers, and politicians, and we are working hard in fourth grade to prepare for college, career, and citizenship. Because of our diverse backgrounds, my students have diverse strengths and needs. I work hard to plan exciting activities and experiences to meet their needs every day. These materials will help us organize our learning and use both sides of our brains. Clipboards will help us move around the room to facilitate discussions and exploration during reading and science. Whiteboard pockets will help scaffold our learning by being able to add appropriate inserts such as blank number lines or multiplication charts to aid us during math practice, as well as to keep all of our supplies in one place. Art supplies will allow us to demonstrate competencies in other areas, and give us a brain break after the hard work we do every day. We need these supplies to help us stay calm and collected during the school day!
needStatement: My students need basic classroom supplies to help us keep learning and having fun in fourth grade.

name: World Travellers Through Literature Adventures!
description: My students are a diverse group including those who are local and those who came from around the world. My classroom population is predominately English Language learners who have recently moved to the United states. We may have many language barriers in the classroom, but we always find a way to communicate to one another. Students come with what they have, and it is usually a great spirit that lends itself to learning. When they are not able to supply their own materials to learn, we step up and help our community. Students are willing to share their supplies with those without, and I have a supply for the year for the new students that come into our lives every day. Being a magnet school in the Twin Cities, we are an open enrollment school for new-to-the-country and new-to-the-district students. Our school's focus is on the arts, and we value the differences our students bring to our classrooms. The class set of The Red Pencil will be a great addition to our exploration of children's experiences as refugees, immigrants, and learners. We are not able to travel around the world to know what it is like to live in a country at war. We are able to experience this through literature that is either true stories or realistic fiction. My students love to explore the world through stories about children their own age. We have learned a lot about ourselves through the books we read, and this book set will add to our understanding of who we are and how we can change our own futures. We are able to find inspiration through the books that we read, and we are best able to do this when we have a class set to follow along in. This story provides a perspective that is unknown to many of our students. It will assist them in broadening their understanding the hardships of many children their age who have grown up in areas of extream poverty and war. My hope is for my students to learn empathy for people who have gone through these experiences to better prepare them for discussions related to race, geography, history, and the lives of others as they continue their academic careers.
needStatement: My students need a class set (30 copies) of the book The Red Pencil.

name: Relevant Literacy Helps Create Leaders!
description: My middle school students are the absolute best! They come to school daily ready to tackle, challenge, and explore. Although they come from all different walks of life, their commonality is in their love for learning. They all hold one another to the highest standards. Newberry is located in Lincoln Park community, however, the majority of my students are bussed from all around the City of Chicago. They know that as an educator, I always have my students best interest in mind. Although we have limited access to current novels, I challenge my students to always seek out opportunities and never let the notion of limited access obtaining materials hold them back! The majority of my students learn better with actual paper novels, in which they can annotate and physically hold versus electronic copies. These materials are crucial to my students reading, writing, listening and speaking opportunities within the classroom and beyond. My students need literature that deals with real-world ideas, themes, and outcomes. These important issues need to be addressed! We need authentic literature in our classroom. Both of these titles will assist in bringing reality into the classroom and we will have open discussions that will assist in student understanding. Fortunately, I was able to secure 20 copies of each novel. However, 20 copies means that several of my students would be without copies. This is not an ideal situation for middle schoolers. By helping with this project, my students will each have a copy of these novels to use in class, so they can read to learn and truly understand at their own pace. This will improve their learning, and motivation as well. They will feel empowered and powerful because they can effectively contribute to our deep classroom conversations.
needStatement: My students need need these 2 current titles so they can truly understand what amazing literature dealing with real-life issues really is!

name: {Snack} Attack the Day!
description: When you look into my classroom at any given time of the day, you will see up to 19 children who are full of energy and ready to learn. Most students lack previous schooling, so they are even more excited to have the chance to learn. They have had so many setbacks and challenges, but they are still such happy children. My students do not care that the books are a little beat up or that we do not have the latest technology that some other schools may have; they are simply happy to be here. They have a strong desire to learn and will try their hardest to please you and themselves. They are not afraid to push themselves when they have the proper support and have frequently amazed me at the growth they achieve after such a short time in my room. My students come to school with a wide variety of things they need to work through; whether it be a loss at home, stress about something in their life, or just being home sick. The last thing I want them to be worried about is being hungry. Even though my students attend a boarding school and are guaranteed three healthy meals a day, everyone needs a snack to get them through the day! Students should be busy taking on the tough academic challenges of each day, not thinking about how much their tummy is rumbling. I hope to be able to provide a snack, daily, to my students during our morning reading block. I tried to find some healthy options, including things like crackers, fruit snacks, and Clif Bars. One of the favorite things for young children is to pick a favorite snack and bring it to school. I tried to offer a wide variety of healthy, with a few treats mixed in! Focusing on work is so much easier when your stomach is full and you don't have to constantly wonder when lunch is!
needStatement: My students need a variety of snacks, including crackers, cereal bars, and some fruit snacks.

name: Comfortable and Cozy in Our Room
description: My students are an amazing group of 4th and 5th graders learning in a 12:1+1 self-contained classroom setting. Many of the students in my classroom have been diagnosed with autism and have significant symptoms of sensory processing disorder. It is extremely important to create a warm, comfortable classroom environment for my students. I would like to purchase two standing lamps for my students so that they can learn in a classroom with warm lighting. Fluorescent lighting often generates an audible hum and cyclical flickering of light. We have lamps on the bookshelves in the classroom, but they do not provide an adequate amount of light when the overhead lights are turned off. Additionally, our classroom can become quite dusty and to ensure a healthy learning environment for my students I would like to purchase an air filter to remove allergens and dust. My students with autism need and deserve a classroom that best supports their unique learning needs. Due to significant sensory processing sensitivity, warm lighting and healthier air will help to provide an environment to help my students to thrive. Our classroom is on the lower level of the building and does not have windows. Due to this, it is imperative to provide alternative lighting. The standing lamps will allow for enough light so that we can turn off the standard overhead lights that often generate a soft hum or flicker. The air purifier will help to keep the air clear of allergens and dust that often settle on our classroom shelves or materials. The air purifier will also help to remove any odors in the classroom that can prove to be very distracting for students with sensory difficulties.
needStatement: My students need lamps and an air purifier to create a healthy, warm, and inviting learning environment.

name: Highland 5th Grade Wants to Experience the Portland Youth Philharmonic
description: Even though the students in my class are coming from a high need, Title 1 school, they are Americas Youth that sees, believes, and has faith in everything surrounding them. This makes them special to not only me but to our future. They are eager, curious, and admirable. Many of the lives that sit in my classroom only feel motivated, loved and nourished when they are at school. School is their safe place. It is the place where they can forget about the negativity from outside and are able to go on an adventure within a book, eat foods that their systems crave, and play futsal until their clothing is soaked in sweat. School is a place that they miss when ice and snow fell to the ground. School is a place where they are loved to the fullest and encouraged to dream. Creating an environment where they are valued and motivated is my job. These particular students do not understand what they are missing because of their status. In the end, though, this will make each of them that much more of a special, well-rounded, individual. I feel that allowing students to enjoy rich musical experiences outside of what they would normally listen to enriches their lives and opens their eyes to beauty to which they might be unaware. Our fifth grade Highland students will be able to experience a musical journey at the symphony that they wouldn't normally be treated to in their life. Students will come to appreciate a different form of music and experience the complexity and emotion that a symphony offers. They will come to appreciate how hard work and practice in both individual and group settings can culminate in a wonderful end result.
needStatement: My students need transportation to the Portland Youth Philharmonic in April.

name: Flexible Seating
description: The school I work at is racially and ethnically diverse. In fact, more that 30 different languages are spoken by our student body. Approximately 75% of students qualify for free and reduced lunch. Diversity is the greatest asset to my school. My scholars come from all walks of life, many of which include refugees and immigrants. With the unique learning needs of our scholars, I must take into consideration who I as a teacher can come up with new and creative ways to meet their academic, social, and emotional needs of my children so that they can be better community members, take ownership for their learning, and become global citizens. Our classroom environments should be conducive to open collaboration, communication, creativity, and critical thinking. Comfortable classrooms—physically and psychologically— promote a sense of well-being, keep minds focused, and limit distractions. This simply cannot be done when kids are sitting in rows of desks all day. Flexible Seating options will better meet the needs of students and create a more inclusive environment. Flexible seating will give control of my room to my students. They will choose where they want to sit daily based on what their needs are. But wherever they choose to sit, it has to help them be their best learning self. Students move the furniture based on their needs; even laying on the floor is acceptable, and sitting by friends is allowed. The 21st Century learners need to work and learn in a classroom that fosters collaboration, creativity, and community. A classroom with flexible seating is the way to go! By supporting this project, students will have the freedom to choose from various seating options that would offer flexibility, movement, and various levels of personal comfort. When these needs are met, students can then focus better on their learning.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating options that meet their individual needs.

name: Engaging Both Body and Mind!
description: My students are curious and voracious learners. They come to school every day buoyed by a love for learning. Every day, they teach me to look at life and learning in new ways. They are constantly asking 'why?' and 'what if?' about things I would never have thought about. Their inquisitiveness inspires me to be the best teacher I can be. I have the privilege of working at a diverse school with students from all walks of life. We have students from all socio- economic levels; ethnicities and ability levels. My school is a Title 1, with Learning Immersion and Gifted and Talented magnet programs. The diversity at our school provides our students with the opportunities to build relationships with and learn from people of all different backgrounds. Through the diversity of our school and classroom, my students are able to construct new understandings of others' cultures and to develop empathy and acceptance of our differences. My students love learning and support one another in ways which promote their dreams. When I look at my students, I have hope for a future in which, diversity is welcomed, accepted and celebrated. Have you ever watched a first grader? They are in constant motion from the tips of their toes to the top of their heads. Something is always moving. My first graders are active and tactile learners who would benefit from learning through hands-on activities. The seated peddlers, sand and hands-on games will help my students to learn by engaging all of their senses. Some of these materials will not directly teach my students new skills, but they will help prime my students for learning in all content areas and with many daily living skills. For example, the noise canceling headphones are particularly helpful for students who are easily distracted. They will help those students to block out the noise that comes with engaged learning so they can concentrate on learning. The donations for this project will improve my students' learning because both their minds and bodies will be engaged as they develop new understandings through hands-on activities. In addition, students can become advocates for their own learning by using materials that address their own specific sensory needs as learners. I am looking forward to engaging my students in learning which addresses the needs of the whole child!
needStatement: My students need sensory materials, such as a pedal exerciser, to connect their bodies and minds as they learn!

name: Kindness Rocks
description: My students are very special. They have touched me with how genuine they are and how big their hearts are. They come from all over the world with very diverse backgrounds and they are not only accepting of each other's differences but they celebrate it. It is my goal to provide a top of the line education to tomorrow's future through art. Art has been proven to be a method of therapy and it has aided in helping thousands of people. Kindness rocks is a project that will not only allow my students to express their creativity but it will also bring kindness to other. The purpose of kindness rocks is to allow my students to think deeply as to what would and could brightened someone's day. I want my students to imagine someone having a long hard day and then looking down to feel inspired by their rock. They will bring their vision to life by creating their meaning of happiness through rocks and painting. The materials are not the need, the need is the support to allow them to support others.
needStatement: My students need the tools to express their creativity in a way that will last for years by bringing joy and kindness to others.

name: Bass Bar Mania!
description: My students love to perform music on instruments, especially barred instruments like xylophones, metallophones, glockenspiels and bass bars. We just don't have enough. Physical playing time is reduced, and student learning is limited. My students learn best through singing, movement, speech, creating and performing on instruments so increasing the amount of instruments will increase student learning and understanding.I teach 600 students in grades K-5, and they come to me for 45 minutes once a week. My school is a Title I school in a military town. Military families many times will move away due to orders or deployments, but often return 1 to 3 years later. Students at my school are eager to learn and are most excited about performing on instruments and creating and performing their own compositions.I use a variety of approaches to teach concepts in my classroom, however, the majority of my classes are taught through the Orff approach. Students learn through exploration and creating. With this additional barred instrument, students will be able to contribute to the creation and/or performance of a piece of music and help to accompany other students who are singing or performing on other instruments. Currently, our classroom only has four out of seven bass bars. Because of this, the bass bars do not get utilized as much as they should. While adding one more instrument may seem insignificant, having one more Orff instrument (bass bar) will allow more students to participate in an activity. This will reduce time and the number of groups switching out on instruments. An additional instrument will impact students by allowing them more learning opportunities and more time to appreciate those opportunities.
needStatement: My students need a xylophone bass bar ('E' bar) to help complete this instrument set. Currently, our classroom only has 4 out of the 7 of the necessary bars.

name: Kindness is Cool: Creating a Stronger School Culture!
description: As part of a Social Studies project, a group of middle school students interviewed me on how they could stop bullying. I told them to end bullying, they had to help create a more positive, unified and respectful school environment. As a result, we decided to create a friendship club where our motto is, 'Kindness is Cool!' As a result of their passion and desire to be part of the solution not the problem, a kindness movement was born! At the center of the 'Kindness is Cool' movement is the simple belief that kindness builds stronger communities. We also believe that as an action is repeated, a habit is formed. As kindness becomes a habit, peace becomes possible. The Friendship Club is a student-initiated, proactive and positive approach to bullying prevention. This club will improve school climate and increase student engagement. These t-shirts will be given to students who are part of the Friendship Club and who commit to choosing kindness in a world where they are confronted by many unkind experiences. This group has the singular purpose of making Parkway Montessori a stronger community where we live by the value of kindness. We believe no small act of kindness is ever wasted and that no person is an island, we are all connected to each other. We are committed to being welcoming and accepting of all and to creating an inclusive space where all feel safe.
needStatement: My students need t-shirts to begin feeling unified as the Friendship Club and spread the value of kindness throughout the school.

name: Can You Hear Me Now?
description: Seeing my students learn is the thing that makes me the happiest. I love to be able to give them all the information that they need in order to understand and appreciate the world that they live in. Curious, creative, and very vocal, my students are the future of our society and I want to make sure they are equipped and ready to handle it. Faced with some difficult obstacles that they have to go through in their own neighborhood, I want them to know that the obstacles in the classroom can be overcome. With hard work and determination they will become the best of our future. My students need headphones to use with the iPads and computers that we have in our classroom. We try to incorporate technology every day in our class and in all subjects. Unfortunately, some of the headphones that we had broke, so there is a constant battle over who is going to use the computers or iPads on a given day. New headphones would greatly increase the amount of students who can go on the computers and iPads. My students take multiple quizzes in math and ELA on these technological devices and they are very limited due to the lack of headphones.
needStatement: My students need headphones to use with the computers in our classroom.

name: Student Leaders Learning How to Survive
description: The students I work with are very special and make going to work every day easy and enjoyable! Many of these students live challenging lives at such a young age. Some do not know where their next meal may come from or where they may be staying on any given night. No matter what their lives may bring, they ALL need to learn from hands-on activities that focus on team building, communication, working with younger students, responsibility, collaboration, and cooperation. Our focus in building upon 21 Century Skills. These skills will take them away from their deficits and make them successful in life in the 'real world.' Students have worked all year on leadership skills that can be applied out in the real world. This trip will give them an opportunity to use those skills in a real-life setting. Activities will involve 1. Scavenger hunt, being tied together (forcing students to work together for a common goal (this always brings out the true leaders) 2. Working in small groups building a shelter with limited supplies. 3. Proper fire building and fire safety for cooking their own lunch. Mapping out property (using some math skills) then using their map (learning how to read a map scale) to find their way around. 4. Several cooperative/problem-solving group activities giving students an opportunity work on skills that they will be able to use back in their school setting. This project allows the students to develop their 21-century skills which will carry over to their leadership responsibilities they bring back to assist in leading our younger students.
needStatement: My students need transportation to the Maine Forest Yurts for their end of year class project.

name: Reading is Knowledge
description: My students are teen moms trying to finish their high school diploma. They love to read! During the school year we read a book a month. We meet at lunch to discuss them. Most have had traumatic experiences and limited success in school, and they are adjusting to being parents. My students have never been in a book club before, and they want to read more than what we are just discussing. I feel that this experience is making them better students, better parents, and better citizens. This project is to help keep the book club I run at my high school going with these texts. We lost our source of funding this year, and need help so we can continue to have book club for these young teen mothers. Book club is a great way for the girls to get to know one another and to see that they have more things in common besides the fact they all have a baby. It is a great way for them to relax and lose themselves in a book. Please help keep this book club going. Thank you for all your help!
needStatement: My students need these books to continue book club for the 2018-2019 school year. Please help me continue to provide books for my book club.

name: Knock Knock
description: My students come from a disadvantaged background. The majority of my students live in poverty. The entire school receives free lunch. Some of our students were also impacted by the great flood of 2016. My 4-H students give back to the community! This year they organized and managed a food drive at our school to help families in need. They partnered with The Deaf Action Center of Acadiana to provide toiletries to disabled citizens. Our 4-H students also raised money to support cancer patients in Louisiana. Additionally, the 4-H students partnered with Trees of Acadiana to plant trees all throughout our community and foster preservation and conservation in Louisiana. Finally, these students partnered with local farmers in agribusiness to promote and sell locally sourced produce and commodities. Due to our students living in poverty with limited resources, they lack exposure outside of their community. Our students have worked so hard to give back to the school and local community and we would like to provide them with some hands-on experiences. In this engaging museum, the students can learn special techniques in art using printmaking, painting, sculpting and drawing. Students can also challenge themselves with math activities. The students can also explore new tools and technologies in engineering. This trip can be a window of opportunity beyond what they typically see in their neighborhoods. We hope that you will partner with us to afford them this memorable experience!
needStatement: My students need a trip to the Knock Knock Children's Museum!

name: Please Help Me Touch the World
description: Seeing my students learn is the thing that makes me the happiest. I love to be able to give them all the information that they need in order to understand and appreciate the world that they live in. Curious, creative, and very vocal, my students are the future of our society and I want to make sure they are equipped and ready to handle it. Faced with some difficult obstacles that they have to go through in their own neighborhood, I want them to know that the obstacles in the classroom can be overcome. With hard work and determination they will become the best of our future. My students love to learn in different ways. Their favorite time in class is 'Tech Time.' This is when they get to use the computers in the classroom. However, there are not enough computers to make everyone happy. This iPad would help us to share the technology usage in our class. I want my students to have every opportunity in life. I want them to be able to say, yes, we learned in 1st Grade and had fun. The joy I see on their faces when they are chosen to go on the computers is so fulfilling. I know when they are given a chance, they will seek out extra knowledge. My students should be able to go on educational websites and laugh and learn. They should enjoy math puzzles and funny stories that focus on comprehension skills. This iPad will help them to do that.
needStatement: My students need an iPad to use in the classroom.

name: Mice for Mathematicians!
description: My students are 4th graders in a rural school. They are excited about Donors Choose and the potential of including technology in our daily lessons, including intervention programs. The students are love learning about science, social studies, math, and reading. My students have a heart for learning, and I want to nurture and support that love. I have a class that includes 3 ELL students, 5 advanced students, 2 hard of hearing students, and 9 students with special learning needs. My students often struggle with fine motor skills. The computer mice will assist them in accessing technology. Because students are expected to do more and more lessons on computers, mice will help them in using the technology. With the transition to Common Core standards, students are required to use technology in completing research and in solving more complex real-world problems. With the addition of computer mice to our classroom, students can begin their technological learning journey. Many students at our school do not have access to computers and internet at home. With this project, I will help them develop life-long skills and strategies so that they will be prepared for the future work force.
needStatement: My students need computer mice to assist them in using computers for various district and state assessments as well as daily work.

name: Green Screen For Science!
description: My students love dancing, acting, drawing, sharing and are courageous in sharing how they feel and standing up for what they believe in. They have lots of energy and are ready to use it in a meaningful way that will help both their peers and community. I teach at an inner city middle school where sixty percent of students receive free or reduced-price lunch and thirty-six percent are English Language Learners. My students enjoy coming to school for both social and academic reasons. We have an amazing staff who support each and every student socially, emotionally and academically. To able to do this, many of us spend our own money to support our students. I work at an arts magnet school where we incorporate the arts in all we do. I love technology and incorporating it into any lesson. Students love to use the green screen to create videos about what we are learning. Some of my students are amazing actors and they really come to life in front of a camera. I am always so impressed! We use a green fleece blanket as a backdrop clipped to a bookshelf, heat lamps clipped onto chairs and a chair to hold the iPad to read from. It works, but there is always a shadow somewhere on the screen and it's not super safe to use heat lamps as lighting. My students would love to use a more sophisticated green screen system. They already think the green screen is cool, but having a lighting system would make this a hundred times more professional. It would also be nice to have an iPad stand so they can read their iPads without looking down or to the side awkwardly.
needStatement: My students need a better lighting system and iPad stand to use while recording videos on a green screen.

name: Putting Food on the International Space Station with NASA
description: Our Hospitality & Tourism/Culinary department is made up of a diverse student population. Several of our students are in need of support due to poverty and living with a single parent. Their situations at home often weighs heavily on them though out the day and they have a hard time focusing on school work. However, some find their niche in our program and they shine. Our students have worked hard on this project and this team of four has earned a place in the final competition. First, they researched and wrote a paper about microgravity and processing food for space. Then they found recipes that they felt could be processed for the International Space Station. After finding these recipes they modified them to meet the strict dietary requirements for Astronauts. After doing this, they conducted a taste test to find the top recipe. The team then competed in the NASA preliminary contest at the U.S. Space and Rocket Center, where they received the highest score. They are currently creating a short video of their journey and writing a final paper to submit to NASA. This project has been and continues to be a positive force in their lives. Our DHS Culinary team has made it to the top 10 in the NASA Astronaut Culinary Challenge where they develop food for the Astronauts aboard the International Space Station. They have created a dish taking into account food processing procedures and nutritional requirements so that their dish will meet the standards of the NASA Johnson Space Center Food Lab. This competition is showing these culinary students how research into space isn’t limited to only STEM fields, as well as educating them in researching and presenting their work in a professional environment to a NASA team. The winning entree will be processed by the Johnson Space Center Food Lab and sent up to the station for the astronauts to enjoy. I am looking forward to seeing how this incredible experience will make an impact in their lives. Thank you for helping out these students!
needStatement: My students need help raising support to compete in Houston, TX with the NASA HUNCH Culinary Challenge to put food on the International Space Station.

name: Diverse Books About Women
description: Three-fourths of my school come from a low-income background. They also live in apartment complexes and have a transitional background in their living arrangements. They do have a love a learning and a desire to learn more every day. The parents are striving to give their children more but might lack the ability to know how to accomplish this task. We as educators at our school strive daily to give our students the best education, love, and nurture that we can daily!My students live in the Houston area where Hurricane Harvey came in August. Our district suffered loss in many schools and we missed many instructional days of class. It was difficult for our students to return and start a routine again when so many had gone through a loss or had other family members going through a loss of a home. Students need a variety of books about all subjects. The month of March is about Women and Diversity. I am wanting to incorporate more books about women in our group reading and independent reading. Our students our only taught about the famous people and they need to know about everyone in all aspects of our society who make up who we all are today in our culture and world today. I want them to learn what women have contributed to society and how they have changed our world. We will read about the different roles that women played in make our world great!
needStatement: My students need books about diverse women who showed how they changed the world.

name: Growing Readers Need A Growing Library!
description: My students are an enthusiastic group of first graders at a Title I, low income school, where 78% of our student population qualifies for free and reduced lunch. My first graders come into my classroom eager and ready to learn. First grade is an exciting time for students; this is the year that many of them truly start to read. Reading opens up a whole new world of imagination and exploration. My students are so eager to start reading; they often ask if they can read when they are done with their work or during free choice!My students have grown so much this year as readers! Unfortunately, I do not have a lot of books at my students' individual reading levels. This means that my students have to share their 'just right' books or are reading books too easy or too difficult. In order to grow as independent readers, students need to learn how to choose books that are at their 'just right' reading levels and read their books on their own. We have many opportunities to read as groups and in pairs, but there is something truly special about being able to read your very own book independently at a level that is just right for you! It is my goal to be able to provide this experience for my students. That is why I am asking for leveled books that span all of the levels of my independent readers! I want to help my students grow as independent readers and your contribution to my project will help me do that!
needStatement: My students need more 'just right' books they can read on their own to help them keep growing as readers!

name: Feed The Tummy Fight The Haziness
description: My students come from various backgrounds. Some come from shelters, large families or foster care. For many, this will be the first time they are exposed to a school environment. They will have to learn many new routines alongside academics they have never been exposed to. Our classroom has to be a place where they feel comfortable and look forward to coming every day. Some of my students have been exposed to trauma early in there lives, therefore, affecting their social-emotional growth. Our class not only becomes a place of academic learning but a secure place to grow their social emotional experiences. Have you ever been hungry at work or at school? Do you remember what you learned or what task you had to accomplish? Probably not. Now imagine being 5 and having to pay attention at school when all you can hear is the tumbling in your tummy. When their tummies are talking to them they can’t pay attention and their minds can’t be fed. These snacks will provide a much-needed tummy break for several weeks helping them focus on learning. These snacks will help the classroom become a more inclusive class by providing snacks to those who haven’t had a chance to eat in the morning or who simply need more energy.
needStatement: My students need a variety of snacks such as crackers, chips, and pretzels to help them battle what happens when you’re tummy's hungry and your mind gets fuzzy.

name: Third-Grade Reading Tent
description: Students in our classroom come from working-class families in St. Paul. Many are first or second generation immigrants to Minnesota and all are learning a new language in our school's dual immersion program. My third-grade readers relish time to sit down with a book every afternoon! We love to find corners in our classroom, cozy spots under the tables, and big chairs at the teacher's desk to read independently or with a friend. Students in my room would be thrilled to crawl into a little tent and read their hearts out! This tent would inject excitement into the final months of the school year and inspire us to continue practicing our strong reading habits. This tent will inject excitement into our Reader's Workshop during the last months of our school year! We are ordering a cozy tent for students to read in during independent or partner reading time. We are also requesting a cotton rug to delineate the tent area in our classroom. The rug will serve two purposes. It will make sitting on the floor more comfortable and will also ensure safety and help to avoid overcrowding in our appealing new reading nook. Third graders will be thrilled to take turns enjoying the tent and rug! The space will be motivational and promote strong reading habits for all third-grade bookworms in our classroom. Research shows that building reading stamina is essential for students' long-term academic success. We know the rigorous literacy demands of secondary school and strive to develop a love of reading to prepare students for these challenges. Our new tent will be a lightening rod of reading inspiration for 22 third-grade learners!
needStatement: My students need a cozy tent and rug to inspire Reader's Workshop time!

name: Students Need to Decompress
description: Our students come from low-income inner-city homes. We are a Title I School, and 92% of the students receive free or reduced rates for textbooks and meals. Most of our students arrive to school by bus. They do not have many extras at home - not even a car to get to and from school when there is an emergency. My students are sweet, respectful, responsible, happy and curious students who love to explore the endless possibilities in our classrooms. My students come to school daily ready to learn. I am requesting a weighted blanket for students to use when they have been over stimulating and need time to decompress. The weighted blankets help ground the body by pushing it downwards. This process, known as “earthing” or “grounding,” may have a deeply calming effect. Some of our students have anxiety and need time to calm down in our quiet room after a stressful event.I am also requesting some healthy snacks for students who have need for a snack during the day. Our school Social Worker and/or office staff will be able to use the snacks and give them to students who have been in the calming room or are just simply hungry. Thank you very much in advance for supporting my project and DonorsChoose.
needStatement: My students need a weighted blanket and healthy snacks to help reduce anxiety and frustration from stressful situations.

name: Baking Brulee! Creating a Classic French Dessert
description: Our school is home to many specialty programs including the International Baccalaureate (IB) Program, Advancement Via Individual Determination (AVID), NJROTC and American Indian Studies Program. My students are amazingly resilient. We have a very large and diverse population of students coming from various backgrounds and different places around the world at our school. Every day I am amazed at how many of them overcome huge hurdles and conflicts to get their education and become successful young adults. They are really strong kids who deserve to have happy and fulfilling lives. For this project I would like my Culinary Arts students to practice advanced dessert techniques, specifically, how to use a small brulee torch to make a classic French custard known as Creme Brulee. These materials will provide my students with the opportunity to learn and practice professional techniques that they could use at a job in a restaurant or just to impress their family. It is important for them to practice skills and techniques that they can use on a daily basis and Culinary Arts class is a place they can take what they learned that day and apply it at home.
needStatement: My students need custard cups, butane torches and butane cartridges to make desserts.

name: Read Your World
description: My students live in a small rural community. My school serves K-8th grade students. The school library provides books and services to all 9 grades. Most of the students here are from low-income homes or homes where English is a second language. They wait patiently every morning for me to unlock the library door. They come to the library for a variety of reasons; to read, check out books, get warm, use the computer and other activities that I provide for them. Diversity is important everywhere and maybe moreso in the library. My students come from diverse backgrounds. The books in our school library should also be examples of diversity. Students like to read about things that they find familiar. A character in a book, that is experiencing a problem similar to one they might be experiencing, may make them feel less alone. It also might suggest an answer to their personal problem. I have seen kids' eyes light up when they see a book with a character that may look like them. We are all different so our books in the school library should reflect and celebrate our diversity.
needStatement: My students need books that show diversity of characters and cultures.

name: Please Read Me a Story!
description: I have a classroom full of bright, energetic kindergarten students in a low-income, urban setting. Most of my students don't have books or learning materials at home and they haven't been exposed to how interesting and fun learning can be. There are so many resources my students could use to help them learn, but money is tight, so we're asking DonorsChoose.org to help make our classroom a better learning environment where we can learn more, learn better and learn faster! Kindergarten is a wonderful time for students to read about new topics and characters they've never heard about before. My students love to be read to, but our library is in need of new books to interest them. By donating to this project you'll not only help our library grow, you'll also help expand the imaginations of my students and increase their love of reading! I know these books will bring joy to my students and will provide them opportunities to read to themselves and others. These books will also help them to read about topics like math, science and social studies.
needStatement: My students need interesting and engaging books to encourage them to read in all subjects.

name: We Are Special
description: My students are amazing! They surprise me each and every day and keep me learning more for them. We seriously have some of the best students in our small-town elementary school. My students are always ready to try something new, because of that, I want to be a better teacher every day. I want to grow with them! Our school is over sixty percent free or reduced price lunch recipients, but together our community, parents, and staff work to get us everything we need. I am so grateful to have wonderful people like you also partnering with us to help get our students everything they so deserve. Paula Phillips is the founder of the extraordinary nonprofit Right Road Kids. She is also award-winning radio show host, children's author, and motivational speaker for children and educators. A year ago, I had the opportunity to have her do a wonderful Skype session on self-esteem and kindness with my classroom. From that presentation, I was inspired and able to build on the strong lesson, continuing to teach my students about the joy of random acts of kindness and making the world a better place. This message and lesson is crucial in our children's lives. Now, every month, I have my students take part in kindness events and projects that are life-changing for them AND those they help. This Skype session would again bring Paula and the extraordinary Right Road program into our classroom this school year, all the way from California! In addition to the vital kindness lesson, I want my students to know that THEY ARE SPECIAL. Through this session, Paula would help children come to understand that out of all the people in the whole world, there is only ONE of them. I focus on the importance of relationship-building with my students every day. I let them know that they are each a unique, special person, but hearing it from another adult in the uplifting way that Paula is able to convey is exactly what they need. In addition, Paula would provide follow up in terms of needed school supplies for our classroom even after the Skype session is over. And the corresponding Right Road class pack would also allow us to continue our journey through knowing that we are special, believing in ourselves, and living in kindness.
needStatement: My students need a character education Skype session to learn more about the unique person that they are and how to spread even more kindness.

name: Classroom Craft Supplies and Positive Reinforcers
description: My students are wonderful, one of a kind learners, with special needs. A few classifications of my students include Autism, communication impaired, specific learning disability, and multiply disabled. We are a Title I school, where a majority of our children receive free or reduced-price lunch. Students are challenged each and every day, academically & socially, in a loving and positive environment. In order to meet the needs of all of our unique learners, everything from academic lessons to sensory breaks have been individualized for each child. My students need a variety of supplies for arts and crafts, as well as building materials like beads and lacing string for fine motor strengthening. My students also need clothespins to manipulate during center time, using them to mark correct answers on task cards throughout literacy and math hands-on learning. My children are special learners who learn best through their sense of touch, being able to manipulate tangible materials. My students love to use clipboards! They use the clipboards to write around the room or completing their activity in an alternate seating area that does not have a table top. Post-it Notes are used for children to label different words around the room, as well to label different feelings and thinking moments in their books. The stickers and temporary tattoos will continue to replenish our sticker bin. This bin is used to positivity reinforce good behavior and encourage challenging moments to be turned into a better situation. Students enjoy earning stickers and adding it to their personal sticker books. At the end of every month, they enjoy taking their book full of hard-earned stickers home!
needStatement: My students need a variety of classroom supplies and craft materials such as Sharpies, watercolor paints and paint brushes, dry erase markers, motivating stickers and temporary tattoos, as well as clipboards and clothespins.

name: Some Steel Drum Fun!
description: We are a great school with 500+ elementary students; all of whom come through my classroom twice a week. They love to learn and love to play and in music class, so I try to allow for both. The school itself is a wonderful place that allows students to learn in a safe and kind environment. I am very proud of our school for being innovative, and our principal supports teachers thinking outside the box. Teachers are always looking to find ways to create excitement and curiosity in their students, and I am no different in that regard. Digging through my closet I found an old steel drum. This started me on thinking how I could use this to teach my students about Caribbean music and how to play the steel drum. My students have been working a lot this year on how to read notes on the staff and translate it to instruments and I think this would be a great way to expand on that! I was able to get 2 more and almost have enough now for students to use in our 4 student rotation centers. Playing the steel drum is a unique opportunity that I would love to give to my students!We use centers a lot in my classroom so that students can get more individualized one on one time with different instruments and educational games. I would like to have a center for steel drums so students can have time to go through and be able to figure out how to play songs on them.
needStatement: My students need a steel drum to learn about Caribbean music!

name: Projecting Our Way to the Future!
description: How can we close the achievement gap when students do not have the necessary materials to succeed? As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school district, my students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom. Despite the many challenges they face, they come to school eager to learn and excited to try new things. In my classroom, we are focusing on 21st-century learning and preparing for their bright futures! These students are driven and excited to learn new things and work together to create a life-long learning environment. As teachers, we are teaching our students for jobs that haven't been created yet. To accomplish this, we need to teach students how to problem solve and how to interact with one other to complete tasks. By teaching these different strategies we can help prepare them for different situations they may come across. The doc camera allows students to show their sketches for engineering projects, art designs, and their writing to the class. The iPads allow for students to create with different apps for the design process and coding of our Spehro balls. Students can use they two things together for project-based learning at their third-grade level.
needStatement: My students need the doc projector to help present their work in front of their class for interactive learning. The iPads will allow students to create projects, code, and use with Project Lead the Way activities.

name: Help Us Go to VEX IQ World Championship
description: We are ecstatic that our Elementary Vex IQ Robotics Team KnightBots, Team #5420A made to the Vex IQ World Championship in Kentucky between April 29 - May 1. This has been a dream for our 5th graders that actually came true and they need your support to take advantage of this opportunity. We are a team that stays focused and goes after our dreams to make it real. So far our dreams came true and, we need more motivation with your support to reach our biggest goal; World Championship. We need donations to help our team members' travel cost from Indianapolis to Louisville, Kentucky, US.The costs include transportation, lodging, meal and some robotics team equipment. This is an amazing opportunity for our students to meet and team up with students from all over the World. Please help us to succeed this lifetime opportunity for my students. As an inner-city school, my students choose to be in school every day. They overcome obstacles in many areas of their lives to be on time and ready to learn despite challenges they face on a daily basis. Weather and transportation conflicts are just the beginning of their journey. Focusing daily, completing work to the best of their ability and having the time to also be active with after-school activities and their friends can be overwhelming at times. It is a great experience for them to be able to see a World Championship. They will learn and experience a championship. They will meet so many different people around the world.
needStatement: My students need to stay 2 nights in a hotel so that we can participate Vex World Robotics Championship.

name: Relax and Read!
description: Our school is a racially and culturally diverse school serving over 700 students in St. Paul, MN. Many of our students receive special services:70% of our students qualify for free or reduced lunch. Almost 30% of our students are English Language Learners. About 10% of students receive Special Education Services. We are comprised of 2 separate schools with different programs: Montessori and Science. Students have many hands-on opportunities for learning through the Inquiry Zone, hydroponics lab, iPad initiative, and outdoor gardening areas. Our students are active, inquisitive children desperately in need of resources due to multiple years of school district budget cuts. My students love reading a lot and need a reading bench.. As a librarian my goal is to encourage them to become lifelong readers. Beyond giving them books that interest them the best thing I can do is to give them space for reading. Our seating right now is less than kid-friendly. My goal is to create a comfortable space where students can just relax with a book they want to read. There is nothing better than curling up with a great book. These benches will give my students the perfect place to peruse picture books and share stories. In addition to providing a comfy space these benches also allow me to highlight different collections of books with the display/storage boxes. I can fill the bench with books to celebrate Black History month in February or Women's history in March. I can feature new books to the library. I can let students pick the book topic and select their favorite titles to get them more involved in the library displays. I can make a reluctant reader bench for those students who just can't find a book no matter how hard I try and pack it full of lego, graphic novels, and nonfiction page turners. The possibilities are endless! But they all lead back to the same goal: students learning to love and enjoy reading.
needStatement: My students need a comfy, cozy place to sit for reading.

name: Art for Creative Kids!
description: I teach in a very diverse school with high poverty. Though many of my students come to school with thoughts of traumatic experiences from home they come in with a smile! They are excited to learn and they love any activities that involve working together, art, and technology. My students have been working hard and are proud of their accomplishments and growth in academics! It makes me so happy to see them succeed and their confidence increase! Their perseverance is inspiring to say the least! Students will be using Bienfang Aquademic watercolor paper and Blick Golden Nylon paint brushes, as well as Sakura Cray-Pas Junior Artist Oil Pastels in assorted colors to express their creativity through art in class. The supplies will be replacing the current brushes; which are falling apart and were of poor quality to begin with. With these high quality art materials, students' will receive the message that they are worthy of the best and their art is worth it. My hope is that students will be motivated to slow down and really appreciate their art. They will also learn how to properly take care of these supplies. My students will use these materials to experiment with art materials and create their own work to express their creativity. They will be able to learn about specific styles of artwork including works by Edgar Degas, who famously used pastels in his collection of work. We'll use watercolor paints with our brushes and paper to create works of art while studying Georgia O'Keeffe. At the end of our lessons, students will be able to apply what they've learned and experienced with a field trip to our local art museum to view some famous pieces in person.
needStatement: My students need some nice art supplies, like oil pastels, watercolor paper, and brushes, to let their creativity shine!

name: Let's get SMART with TV
description: I am a Pre-Algebra and Algebra 1 teacher of 8th graders, but also the Jr. Beta Club sponsor. My students are from a small community that is very family-oriented. A lot of students that were born in the area will continue to live in the area beyond graduation. My students come from various socioeconomic statuses. Some can afford the equipment to use technology effectively, however, some can not. I do not want any to be at a disadvantage because of their home life. Every student deserves the tools to perform at a high level. This TV will allow my students and myself to give and/or watch alternate videos or complete assignments other than ones being projected. This TV will be mounted on one of my classroom walls and will be connected to a computer and wifi for access to the smart TV functions as well as internet for other resources. My students will benefit from this TV by allowing them to view resources and DVDs with ease. Some of my students do not have access to computers at home and this will allow them an alternative to viewing videos, work on projects, and complete their assignments on a timely basis.
needStatement: My students need this TV so that it can be used as a computer monitor for them to do alternate assignments or activities while I use my projector for other resources.

name: Soaring to High Jump
description: Our sports teams are a hard working group both inside the classroom and on the track. These student athletes hold themselves to higher standards, and promote a team based on unity. “The difference between try and triumph is a little umph”- Melvin Phillips. They strive to do their best during practice and matches, yet they don't have all the necessary equipment to be successful. This equipment will help the entire team reach their goals and dreams. They work hard, train hard, and play hard to achieve greatness. Yet to be great, they need the equipment to help them reach the finish line. With the requested equipment this team will have what they need. This equipment not only will help the team this year, but the upcoming teams, as it can be used for multiple years, allowing the maximum number of team members to have the chance to be successful. We all want our students to be successful in the classroom, but we also have to help them be successful outside the classroom. This project will do just that. By helping support this sports team, you will be supporting an amazing group of students. The field and track team needs to continue to soar in field events. We have athletes who are great high jumpers, and we have athletes who are just developing a love for the high jump. Our High jump pit however is not in great condition. Keeping our students fit and safe during training, practices, and matches is our number one goal. As a high jumper soars over the bar, to land on the mat, they are met with a puff of dust, and pollen, and bits of foam from our old pit. A new high jump pit will provide safety, and comfort to our jumpers, creating stronger and better performing athletes. This project will provide the field and track team with the equipment they need to stay fit and healthy, preform their best during practice and during matches. This project will benefit the current teams plus the upcoming teams as the equipment can be used for multiple years. Please consider helping to support a hard working amazing group of students.
needStatement: My students need a high jump pit that is safe for them to learn and compete on.

name: A Chromebook to Help Us Keep Up!
description: This year, I am teaching second grade math. I have a few students who are English Language Learners, some who have IEP's, and a few who have emotional problems. My students face many challenges. A majority of my class' parents can't afford basic school supplies for their children such as pencils, paper, or even materials needed to complete classroom reports. Despite these challenges, my students are eager and ready to learn. It is my hope that when my students enter my classroom, they experience an overwhelming amount of love and an amazing education. YOU can also be a part of this!
