I was once in their place as I was raised in the same community they live in, and am now trying to give back and inspire them that if they put their mind to it, they can accomplish anything they want. Our classroom only has one shared desktop computer for daily use. My students need a chromebook laptop they can use on a daily basis to help us compete our math intervention program called iReady as well as to get students engaged and having fun with learning when we play Kahoot! They are in need of 21st century tools to get them excited about learning and prepared for the future. This computer will allow me to get more students using the math program, compete research, and remain active in the class. My students are active learners and this laptop will definitely provide rigorous engagement for them.
needStatement: My students need a Chromebook to help is complete our math interventions.

name: iLearn with iPads in Kindergarten!
description: My students walk into our classroom every day eager to learn and full of energy. The students in this inclusive environment are filled will compassion and the willingness to learn. We work together as a team to support each other and create a safe comfortable learning environment. I teach at a Title I school in North York where 100 percent of our students receive free breakfast and lunch. The students in this classroom have diverse learning needs. With differing abilities, each student strives to be the best they can! Many of the students struggle to access the opportunity to learn in the same way as in a general education classroom. I strive to provide an environment in which all students have access to different supports within the classroom. My students need iPads and protective cases in my classroom which will allow for more differentiated activities throughout the day. I am requesting iPads to provide my students with an opportunity to access technology and create more interactive lessons. We will be utilizing these materials to listen to stories digitally and engage in multimodal math problems. Donating to this project will help to support my students to achieve academic success! I absolutely love walking into school every day to each of my students with special needs. I would love to create more opportunities for my students to become more knowledgeable about technology! With these materials I hope to instill in my students that learning is fun and everyone can succeed.
needStatement: My students need iPads, hub and protection cases to access online reading and math programs!

name: Flexible Seating for Flexible Learning Styles!
description: 30 bright eyed and curious minds come into my classroom every day ready to learn. They are curious about the world around them, experts at asking questions, and desire a place of community and belonging. Spending my days with them makes me a better person! I work at a school where diversity is the beauty that connects us all. We are a community of learners who support one another, push each other every day to be our best, and help each other do good in the world. I want my students to achieve their full academic potential each and every day, but I feel like we are behind in the 21st century as providers of a safe, clean, and bright learning environment. With some of the struggles they come to school with, focus on instruction can be difficult, so anything that can help them to engage them and feel safe inside our four walls is my goal. With your generous help and these flexible seating choices, my classroom will be that much closer to a child-centered space, where responsibility, respect, and passions grow! As I transition from traditional seating to flexible, my hope is that my students will take on a more engaged role in their learning with their own decisions on where they choose to seat; think seating with no seating charts. We need alternatives to store our workshop materials and places to store collective materials to share per workstation, so with storage bins and baskets, students won't have distractions inside their desks to play with. We need options for seating in groups or individually for quiet work time, so with a variety of table tops, students can choose how and where they want to work for the day. We also need alternative seats to make grouping around alternative tables easier to create, so with stools students can move around easily and create work groups efficiently. And lastly, with exercise pedals and a wobble chair, kids balance movement with stationary learning. These options will improve engagement in learning by providing opportunity for movement, which all young children's bodies need. They will have a sense of space that is theirs, not mine and be excited to come to class each and every day.
needStatement: My students need flexible seating and alternative organizational tools for storage as we transition from a traditional desk-filled classroom to a flexible seating and kid-centered learning environment.

name: Awaken Our Senses
description: My school was rebuilt several year ago after it was destroyed by a devastating tornado. Our community has come back strong and has supported our school. The staff has worked diligently with the parents and students to make our new school a home, we are a family. I have a very diverse group of learners, several of my students have special needs, while a few others a performing above grade level, I need materials that help me meet the needs of all students. Last year the classroom I was in was a third grade classroom, therefore I will be needing early childhood resources for my little Panthers. Kindergarten students must have many learning experiences throughout the day. As teachers we must awaken the senses of our students in order for them to be the most engaged learners that they can be. My students thrive on activities that engage their 5 senses, activities where they are not only listening but where they are actively involved in the learning process are an important part of our classroom. We have the listening math centers and they have been a great addition to our classroom, I would love for my kiddos to have the listening phonics center to further enhance our phonics program. This is something the students could do during literacy centers that would keep them actively engaged and would allow me to work with small groups of students on other activities. My students enjoy their time at the sensory center. The sensory balls and sensory beads would be the perfect addition to this center. I would easily be able to rotate these items in and out of this center with letters, shapes and numbers and other manipulatives throughout the year. It's amazing how much fun the students have learning these things when you mix them with sensory fun objects. Thank you for helping making my classroom engaging, ever changing and the best place for young learners to be!
needStatement: My students need sensory materials and a phonics program for center time.

name: Write It, Wipe It
description: Aloha from na keiki o Hawai'i. My preschool special education class provides early intervention services to qualifying special needs children with a range of disabling conditions, ages 3 to 5 years. Most of my students struggle to speak and be understood, and several have fine motor challenges as well. My school is located in a predominantly rural, low-income neighborhood with a considerable portion of the children of Hawaiian and/or Pacific Island ancestry. Our classroom cheer sums it up: 'You too, we too, we all love preschool!' We are a group of actively involved adults-teacher, aide, and therapists, and children working together in our hands-on learning environment.I got my four laptop whiteboards by collecting points from my book club orders over a dozen years ago. (Yes, I bought a lot of books with my own money back then.) As anyone with an older whiteboard knows, after years of use, it just doesn't wipe off very well--the surface permanently smudged with streaks and shadows. They've actually gotten to the point where every time I reach for them, I change my mind and tell myself, 'just throw those away'. They really are that bad. I am requesting enough new whiteboards so my young ones, who are developing their fine motor skills, can easily practice their writing and drawing on their own board. The larger board will be used for teacher demonstrations and instruction. We also need colorful markers for a fresh start on the new boards.
needStatement: My students need write and wipe whiteboards along with colorful markers.

name: Fill my tank so I can “Get My Teach On”
description: My students are a rambunctious, but extremely sweet bunch of first graders. We are an under performing school in a Title I school district. My students deserve the very best, but unfortunately they are not getting it. Right now I have 18 boys and only 5 girls! My students have a wide range of abilities but one thing they have in common is the need to move and be engaged in their learning. I want to do the best I can for them but I need some additional training in engaging a variety of learners. My admission for Get Your Teach On was already funded thanks to generous donors! Now I just need to get there and some food during the week! They say, “Get Your Teach On is sure to be unlike any other educators’ conference that you will attend. You will leave feeling empowered, motivated, and prepared to create dynamic lessons that will challenge your students and leave them hungry for more!” I am more so excited to pack my favorite teacher bag, get ready for some educational magic, and join in San Diego, California, as I prepare to Get My Teach On this summer!
needStatement: I need food and gas to get to Get Your Teach On!

name: Exploring The Wonderful Transformation Of Caterpilliars Into Butterflies
description: 'The highest result of education is tolerance.' -Helen Keller I teach in a full day kindergarten class. My students are cute, eager readers, and motivated to learn. My students are a group of 5-6 year old. They come from a low income community. More than 95% of my students receive free or reduce breakfast and lunch. My students are made up of mostly English language learners. My students enjoy hands-on experiences. I have 23 students in my class. I enjoy working with my students everyday. My students are fascinated with these beautiful creatures known as butterflies. They love watching they fly around our school playground. Students chase them and giggles. They are so excited to see a butterfly when one shows up at school Thanks to Orkin's: Start with Science Innovation Challenge, I am able to create a butterfly unit for my students. I am requesting a butterfly growing kit and plastic containers to help my students keep their research about butterflies and have these plastic containers to help them organized their research. These items will help my student to be physically involved in the learning process. This wonderful butterfly growing kit will allow my students to observe, record and analyze different science topics like the bugs' life cycle, environments, habitat, classification and more. My students will record what they have observed with their kindergarten science journals which will increase their writing and comprehension. My students will organize and store their science journals within these plastic containers. Please help enrich our science curriculum with a butterfly growing kit and plastic containers that will help us understand more about science and make learning hands-on! Thank you in advance for helping me make science fun and exciting for my students!
needStatement: My students need butterfly growing kit and storage bins to understand more about butterflies, their life cycles and their habitat.

name: i Can Learn with iPads III
description: 'We need technology in every classroom and in every student and teacher's hand, because it is the pen and paper of our time, and it is the lens through which we experience much of our world.' -David Warlick My Kindergarten classroom is filled with curious, creative learners. These young scholars run into school each day with an amazing enthusiasm for learning and experiencing new things! They simply thrive when they work together to explore and learn new concepts. My students don't let the fact that they attend school in a high poverty/low income area affect their learning goals. They believe that the harder they work the smarter they will become. Even through hardships my students may face, they are filled with the joy and determination to learn. The possibilities are endless when it comes to technology use in the classroom. My plan is to use the iPads for small group instruction for both reading and math workstations. Students will have an opportunity to listen to stories using a fun and exciting program called MyOn during literacy centers and work on important math skills during our daily math centers using an engaging online program called StarFall. The donation of the iPad will make a huge difference for my students in helping them move forward in their learning and being on grade level as they gain new reading and mathematics skills.'Technology is not an event. It's just part of everyday learning.'
needStatement: My students need one iPad to help them reinforce, practice and enhance their skills in reading, writing, and mathematics.

name: A Better Tomorrow
description: I teach at a Title I, performance improvement school with the majority of our students participating in the free lunch program. Many parents rely on a single income and some even work two jobs and still struggle to support their family. For many of my students, school is where they have access to books, supplies and other resources that support their academic achievement. I teach a special education class with 25 students that range from pre-kindergarten to 5th grade. Their disabilities range from learning disabilities to visually impaired. They come from a diverse background. Some students have limited verbal ability. Five students have limited motor skills, which limits their writing ability. Most are mainstreamed during the day into a regular education classroom. They are at least two years behind their peers. Many come from impoverished backgrounds with little parental involvement. This project will help my students improve their STEM skills and will help them bridge the gap. Our use of plastics has had a negative impact on marine life. The 5 Gyres Foundation estimates that there are 5.25 trillion plastic particles in the world's oceans which have had a devastating impact on many organisms like birds, turtles, marine animals and fish that have been entangled in or have ingested this plastic waste. Through free lessons and resources from The NEED Project and 5 Gyres Foundation, I will teach my students about plastic pollution, how our choices impact the Earth and how people are working to come up with solutions to reduce plastic use. We will simulate a small ocean in a dog pool. The robot will be used to clean up the pollution. We will use the Chromebook to research oil spills and pollution.
needStatement: My students need exciting hands-on STEM activities that will teach them to care for our world using the Chromebook andmini robot.

name: Reading on the Rug!
description: I have a group of 20 eager to learn students who would benefit from a reading/learning rug. My students range from students with special needs to typically developing. My students come from many diverse backgrounds. Kindergarten is a time for discovery and facing new challenges while learning and interacting with peers. It is important for my students to learn through discussion. All of my students need tools in the classroom in order to grow and thrive. Our school is neither low income or high SES. Therefore we do not receive any additional funding. It is extremely important for Kindergarten students to feel welcome, safe, and excited to learn. This project will help to create a comfortable atmosphere for students to feel at ease throughout the day. The rug will serve as a main part of the classroom and students will use it during reading and math time, in addition to serving as a hub for class discussions and meetings. Students will also use this particular rug when discussing the many shapes and colors which is one of the content goals in Kindergarten. The rug will also be beneficial for all students to help with behavior management, as each student is given a specific spot on the rug to sit for each activity.
needStatement: My students need a large rug for discussions, reading, math, and many chances for collaboration!

name: Cardinals Rock!
description: My students come from high poverty, low socioeconomic backgrounds. Many of them live in low income apartments. One hundred percent of them qualify for government assistance and the federal free lunch program. Many of them are ELL learners and speak English as a second language. However, these barriers do not discourage their love for learning! These students come to school every day excited and ready to improve their reading and writing. Their parents are very concerned about their children's education to provide them a better life. Although they are disadvantaged in so many ways, you would never know it by their positive attitudes and eagerness to learn. Due to slashing of the education budget in our state, teachers are left struggling to find creative ways to get things done. This project will create a beginning of the year bulletin board for returning students coming back to school. Team spirit is essential in a school and in a classroom. Our school mascot is the cardinal. I would like to design a bulletin board using cardinal things to give the feeling of unity to our school and for my class. The board will help reinforce concepts of pride and teamwork and make the learning environment more pleasant. Thank you for taking the time to look at my project. I hope you will be willing to support it. We couldn't do this, without people like you!
needStatement: My students need lights, letters, paper and other bulletin board items to create positive school spirit.

name: Breakout EDU!
description: What makes my classroom special? Well, it's the students and the community that I serve. When I came to this school it had just received an F, which meant it was a failing school. In my classroom, at least half of my students were one to three grade levels behind. Coming from low socio-economic backgrounds they come to my classroom missing background knowledge and experiences. However, I teach my students to dream and aspire to be more than their current circumstances.I teach my students that no matter what kind of neighborhood you grow up in, they too can leave a great impact on the world. I grew up in the same neighborhood and came back after going to college to make a difference.  The skills my students will learn using these kits goes beyond content. My students sometimes struggle to work together. More than ever in our society kids need to learn to work with others in a peaceful and constructive manner. These breakout kits challenge the students because they have to use each others strengths and knowledge to complete the tasks. Breakout EDUs are like escape rooms for the classroom. Students solve different critical thinking puzzles and clues to unlock a variety of locks. Inside different boxes are more clues and puzzles, which helps them unlock the next box and so on. The goal is to unlock all of the boxes and 'breakout' within 45 minutes. Breakouts encourage critical thinking, teamwork, and reinforces skills taught in the class.
needStatement: My students need Breakout EDU kits. They bring the fun of an escape room to the classroom. Students have to work in teams to solve challenges based on topics we are learning in class!

name: Sliding Into Google Docs!
description: Our second grade is comprised of 24 amazing students, many of whom come from bilingual households and receive free or reduced price lunch. Many students in my room are speakers of another language. The students struggle with basic math skills but they are eager and excited to learn. Many come from homes where very little English is spoken so parents are not able to help them with the challenges of math real world problems. Many do not come to school with a number sense. My students love the math manipulatives in my room but they are not allowed to check them out to help them to be able to practice their skills at home. Please help them get the Rekenreks or Math racks for use at school and home. My second grade classroom is a place hard working students learning at every turn! Our student goals include preparing to be successful third graders next year but also to have fun collaborating every day too! In my 10 years, I have discovered that students really need a balance of engaging hands-on learning, independent work, as well as technology to prepare them to work in the 21st Century. This year I have 24 incoming 7 year-olds, but I only have a limited amount district-provided Chromebooks. Additionally, the Chromebooks are not necessarily up to date. New Chromebooks will allow us to practice and gain experience with Google Docs, Slides, and Chrome which is fully implemented in grade 3 and beyond in my district. In order to provide a more balanced approach in my classroom and to better utilize my existing resources, I need a few more devices for my students. I feel like six Chromebooks would perfectly compliment our other tech equipment and allow my students to utilize technology on a daily basis.
needStatement: My students need 6 Chromebooks to allow them to study and read about animals, science concepts, different countries, communities, and cultures. We just started getting the hang of how to do a Google slide presentation!

name: With Music, Dancing is Poetry of the Foot
description: Smiling faces ready to learn, running, calm yoga poses, warm ups, dances, picture lesson, skill of the day... This is the routine for my adaptive physical education students needing structure to feel safe. Often coming from low income homes and various family makeups, we all strive to meet their various needs. I travel to four school sites servicing/teaching adaptive physical education to students with physical impairments, autism, developmentally cognitive delays, non-verbal, and motor skill deficiencies. The gym is where my students typically thrive. While developing their motor skills there is also a development of accomplishment, self pride and team work. I have learned so much from my students and how resilient they are. It is through them that I have become a better teacher and can help them achieve the unreachable! My students need a source of music with a portable bluetooth speaker for sound. I have four school sites that I travel to and portability is always what is needed. Through dance, my students focus on the beat of the music and the patterns/sequences for a particular dance. The bluetooth speaker will enable students to dance with an abundance of music while focusing on the dance steps. My autistic students enjoy music and need opportunities for dancing every day within the physical education curriculum. Dancing not only helps autistic students focus but is fun and my students often are seen singing along as they dance.
needStatement: My students need a speaker for music so they can sequence patterns and actions of dance during adaptive physical education.

name: Learning Language Through Literacy!
description: “I did it!” says a speech therapist, taking her hands and putting them over her student’s hands and helping him clap. The student smiles and repeats, “I did it!” He just asked for his favorite toy using a complete sentence without any help today. The student in this scenario is six years old and has autism. Learning to use language, for this student and others like him in our school can be a slow process, happening in small steps. “Little victory” moments, like the example above, occur in my school’s speech room every day. The speech therapists at our school support students with challenges including Autism Spectrum Disorder, Attention Deficit (Hyperactive) Disorder, Intellectual Disabilities, and other developmental disorders. Some students are bilingual and may be learning English in addition to their home language, and others still may be learning how to communicate using a speech-generating device. Our school serves students from Pre-K to Fifth grade, coming from a variety of cultural and linguistic backgrounds. Our goal is to increase our students’ speech and language skills and enhance their learning. Any help we receive to achieve this goal would help us to have more 'little victories' in the times to come. Our students have to overcome unique challenges in order to learn language skills. Visuals and tactile stimulation assist with keeping them focused and help them to accomplish their goals in speech/language services. The nonfiction leveled books would provide visual supports with their interesting pictures and simple text. Having those visuals provides a concrete basis for learning vocabulary, comprehension, and conversation skills. The alternative seating, which are ball chairs with feet, would assist students who have difficulty focusing on a lesson due to sensory-seeking behaviors. Students would benefit from these chairs specifically because they could bounce or balance on the ball while listening or participating in the activity at hand. This helps them be less focused on how to attain sensory input and more on learning from the lesson. These materials would be placed in our speech and language room, and would be used by students who present with Attention Deficit (Hyperactive) Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, and other various developmental disorders.
needStatement: My students need interesting nonfiction leveled books and alternative seating so they can have the visual and tactile supports they need to learn language from books.

name: Making Math Marvelous
description: We love to learn! My first graders are working hard every day, and so am I! These six and seven year olds are learning to read, have become writers and have made big gains in math. We are busy all day long, and there's still much to do. My students are in first grade, and love coming to school to learn!They come from a wide variety of living situations. Some come from two parent homes, some from single parents, and some with multiple generations, or multiple families living in one apartment. Some of my students speak English fluently, and some do not. Some of my students come from families who support public education and encourage their students to do their best while at school. While at school, I hold high expectations for each student in their behavior and their academics, no matter their home life. We learn together, we work through problems together, and we celebrate successes together. Helping my students learn the skills of reading and math will help them for their entire lives.I teach math daily and the students will use these materials in small groups to review concepts that they've learned in class. These games and materials such as 4 way Countdown, and the binders which I will fill with fun practice pages, will be very interesting to the children, and will help them gain valuable math skills. My students come with a variety of math skills, and these materials will allow me to differentiate work stations, and give me more time with students who need help in small groups. As a teacher, it is my job to make sure my students are learning everything they need to know. It is also my job as a teacher to make learning fun and meaningful. These games and materials will allow the children to have fun while reviewing taught skills, thus building their number sense and their math knowledge.
needStatement: My students need dry erase makers and erasers, binders, clipboards, and page protectors.

name: Green Thumbs for Pre-K!
description: I have an amazing group of 20 Pre-K students! Our school is a Title I school in a high poverty area where all of our students receive free lunch and breakfast. Many of my students are learning English as a second language. Despite all of this, my students are still eager learners. They work hard every day by putting forth their best effort. They are so excited to learn each and every day! My students are creative and love to learn!All my students have a love for things nature! They love to watch things change and grow. The garden tools will make such a huge impact in my students' learning and teach them a lot of responsibility! It is a huge challenge to care for a garden when you don't have the appropriate tools! These tools will change that! My students will get learn about plants by using the transplanting tool to plant different types of plants as well as using the cultivator to care for and manage our garden. They will also get to practice fine and gross motor skills while using the garden tools. The storage shed will help teach my students responsibility by helping to organize and take care of the tools!
needStatement: My students need garden tools such as shovels, cultivators, and a storage shed to help our school have an amazing garden!

name: Storage Bins for a Leveled Library 'What Level? Going Up?'
description: I have an incredible group of first grade students. They are eager and ready to learn. They are creative, hilarious, and motivated and they break out in song at least twice per day. I'm not kidding. One student will start humming, then two students, then someone begins to sing the words to whatever song it is, and before you know it, the entire class is singing. They sing through whatever song, and then go back to work. It is the funniest and sweetest thing ever! My students love learning, and they live for things that make their learning fun! Our classroom is a safe and joyful place. For many of my students, it is their happiest place. I want to give these students everything they need to continue having an AMAZING year!First grade students are motivated to read when they are given the opportunity to self-select texts. This is only possible when teachers have the resources to organize books efficiently and in a way that students can access. Storage tubs for leveled books are the perfect tool for making a kid-friendly classroom library. These tubs are beautiful and brightly colored and will add visual beauty as well as accessibility to our leveled library. I want my students to have 'just right' books at their finger tips so that they can use their reading time at home and at school as efficiently as possible.
needStatement: My students need a leveled library with storage bins so they can quickly locate books at their reading levels, return and exchange books independently, and have a visual for all of the books they can read!

name: Earning Cash for the Zoo!
description: I am a first-grade teacher at a public school. My students are excited about learning and want to excel in school. I have a large range of learning abilities in my classroom. They come from diverse backgrounds with a variety of needs. Some have Autism, ADD, or ADHD, but all of the children have the same desire to learn. My students are sweet and they are excited and ready to learn, explore, and to take on the world. They are excited from the time they get off the bus to when they leave at night. All students receive free breakfast and lunch. We are a Title I school. My students need to learn about financial literacy. While creating enthusiasm for this subject while teaching money management skills, I plan to use a board game, money books and a mini zoo. My students love to have fun when they are learning. They don't enjoy just sitting in a classroom. To help them learn the concepts of money, I will have them play Making Cents-Money Game to earn enough money to visit our class zoo. They will have to earn different amounts of cash for different amounts of time and experiences at the zoo. The times will have a range of 5 minutes to 15 minutes and the experiences will be observing at the zoo, cleaning the zoo, tending to the plants, and feeding our zoo (insects) creatures. With a group of busy first graders, it is important for me to have interesting lessons for them to learn such an important skill, as financial literacy. Buying a ticket to visit the zoo and reading books will spark this interest. This game and going on a mini field trip, with friends will also teach valuable social skills in the classroom.
needStatement: My students need Making Cents Money Game, money books, and a habitat for a mini zoo.

name: Preoccupied With Preschool!
description: My students come from high poverty, low socioeconomic backgrounds. Many of them live in low-income apartments. One hundred percent of them qualify for government assistance and the federal free lunch program. Many of them are ELL learners and speak English as a second language. However, these barriers do not discourage their love for learning! These students come to school every day excited and ready to improve their reading and writing. Their parents are very concerned about their children's education to provide them a better life. Although they are disadvantaged in so many ways, you would never know it by their positive attitudes and eagerness to learn. It seems every year we are pushing our students to do more. Today, preschool is more like the old kindergarten that we used to know. Students are tested quarterly over everything from letter recognition to letter sounds and vocabulary. Don't underestimate these little guys, they are eager as beavers to learn to read! That's why I'm asking for leapfrog pads and headphones for my students. These tools have wonderful apps and technology to help them with letter recognition and letter sounds. The head phones help these little guys with short attention spans to stay focused on the activity at hand. The students love using the technology and feel like a 'big kid.'These activities will have my students ready as emergent readers as they begin kindergarten and their pathway to learning to read.
needStatement: My students need leap pads and headphones to help with letter recognition and letter sound identification.

name: Financial Literacy begins Early
description: 'If a child cannot learn in the way we teach, we must teach in a way that the child can learn.' - unknown author My school has a high percentage of free and reduced-price lunch recipients. We also have a high diversity of cultural and ethnic backgrounds. This year I have a mixed ability group consisting of nine boys and eleven girls. Some have grasped reading skills at a faster rate than others and some need a little more time. They are eager to learn. I am requesting books and games about money to teach my students the importance of financial literacy. I believe the earlier we teach about money and the importance of respecting the value of money and hard work the better. I want to teach my students all about the value of saving and learning the importance of working hard to earn money. In first grade we learn the names of coins and the values. They start learning how to add money. Monopoly is a great game for students to learn how to handle money. I am also asking for books and stories about earning and saving. I also am asking for magnetic money to help learn about money. I would love for my students to have their own piggy banks. What better way to learn about saving than actually having a place to put their own money. I am asking for piggy banks that they can create on their own. This will help my students take ownership and want to save.
needStatement: My students need books and games to learn about financial literacy.

name: Super Sphero Students
description: I am a fifth grade Title One teacher in a small West Virginia town. The kids I teach are just like kids all over the country. They are good and decent and want to do the right thing. Our students are funny and intelligent. Most come to school ready to learn, but unfortunately, not all of these kids are given the best foundation. We do live in a high poverty area. Many of our students lack basic needs, let alone technology, in their home. We try hard to fill in the gaps and keep our students competitive with others across the country. The excitement and enthusiasm in our Fifth Grade classes is at an all time high! We have been using other class robots, like the Ozobot, to learn about coding and robotics. We are learning and using skills that my students thought were only for college age learners. Children are giving up recess time to write code and try to out do each other with tricks and courses. These Sphero Educational robots will allow us to advance this type of learning while using different mediums like paint and water. This type of learning encourages collaborative efforts among the students to build bigger and better structures and take steps to further their knowledge in this field of study.
needStatement: My students need Sphero Educational robots, covers and cases to continue learning about robotics and coding. We love it and are learning beyond our wildest imaginations!

name: Soft lights, Squishy Seats
description: My students are eager learners who enjoy new experiences. We are working on being a more well-rounded class and group of kids. My class houses the ENL students so we have the honor of learning from each other as we strive to become more well rounded. With a focus on mindfulness and social-emotional learning, we are striving to become better citizens. Our school district has undergone several transformations in which we have found that our students have greater needs and we hope we can have your support. Our students have lives that are chaotic and can be confusing and stressful. School is a safe haven and a constant that they can count on.I am hoping to create a more calm and serene environment so that students can be comfortable as well as successful. Our class has a focus on mindfulness and social emotional learning and I would love to add a bit more serenity to our room. By adding light filters it may help students who have undergone trauma by creating a calmer environment. The exercise balls would allow the students to get wiggles out while learning.
needStatement: My students need an environment that is calm as school is often the place that they feel the safest. Light filters and alternative seating are options for them to work more comfortably to be more successful.

name: Magical Math Through Computer Graphics
description: I teach students who will make a difference in the diverse, wonderful world we live in. They are eager to learn and become the next generation of achievers. My students all have struggles that may hinder, but will not prevent them from achieving their goals and ambitions. Daily I watch them overcome obstacles created by their academic requirements as well as cultural influences from their personal lives. All my students need is moral support to help them believe in themselves and the tools needed to help them reach their full potential. Our current laptop is not capable of creating the interactive and visually motivating Algebra lessons students need for remediation. They have difficulty understanding the Algebra concepts presented in the general education classroom and need kinesthetic, visual, as well as auditory instruction. With a computer equipped with memory and graphic capability, lessons that capture and engage the students imagination can be designed. Our class can work together to break down and build the ability to understand Algebra concepts through real life presentations. Through interaction and energetic participation students will gain understanding of how Algebra is a vital part of their future.
needStatement: My students need a classroom Samsung laptop computer and DVD reader/writer.

name: Problem Solving with Coding-Dot and Dash
description: My Students My students need beginner robotics and coding activities to inspire them to learn more about the field of technology. Our school has amazing, enthusiastic learners that if given a chance would excel in technology. These students come from low income families and aren't exposed to 21st skills. Many don't have tech devices to use at home to access coding. The majority of the students in my classroom are learning English as a second language. Our school serves more than 500 students along the US- Mexico Border. My ProjectMy after school club is so excited to keep on coding with Dot and Dash. We meet weekly and students in 3rd-5th grades have been using the Hour of Code to learn programming. We do not have a district curriculum we follow for technology skills. Our after-school club would help prepare our students to be 21st Century learners. Having an extra Dot and Dash robot will give them a chance to apply what they are learning about coding on the computer to real life. We are currently utilizing only one Dot and Dash Wonder Pack for the entire club. We would love to have an extra Dot and Dash Wonder Pack to have the ability to work in smaller groups.
needStatement: My students need beginner robotics and coding activities to inspire them to learn more about the field of technology and coding.

name: Suite School Counseling Suite!!
description: I work with a variety of students who come from different walks of life. Some of my students are in foster care because of neglect or abuse, some live with relatives because their parents are incarcerated, some live with single moms or dads who are struggling to make ends meet, and some live in traditional homes where a mom and dad are present and involved in their kids lives. Even though we are all different and have experienced different obstacles in our lives, we are all alike in that we are WARRIORS. Our school is our safe haven and within these four walls, we are family. As a school counselor, my goal is to create a counseling suite where my kids feel safe to come in and talk about life. In order to do this, I have to create a calm and welcoming environment where students feel comfortable to open up and talk about the things they are struggling with. The items I have chosen to be funded will help me create a counseling space that is warm, inviting, and safe for kids as I do one-on-one and group counseling with them. The space will set the tone for our sessions and will give students a sense of belonging. I chose lamps to soften the lighting in the room as well as comfortable seating for students to unwind and relax. I want the counseling suite to feel like a home away from home for my students.
needStatement: My students need a furnished counseling suite where they feel safe to talk about any issues they are facing. The furniture and decor will allow the space to feel homey and allow me to accommodate groups.

name: Wanted: More Books for Emerging Readers!
description: My students come from a variety of backgrounds and all at a different level of learning. Currently there are 5 languages spoken in my classroom other than English. My school has over half the students on free and reduced lunches. The classroom contains half preschool and half Kindergarten students. The children typically stay in my classroom for a two year period. This helps me build a strong relationship with my students and their families. It also allows me to continue the child's learning without stopping between grades. The Montessori philosophy encourages students to work at their pace and level while exploring areas in the classroom: Sensorial, Language, Mathematics, Science, Cultural and Practical Life. Giving the children these opportunities to move around the classroom as they choose, they become independent learners and goal setters. Once a student masters a skill they move on to the next. There is never an end to learning in the classroom no matter the child's skill level!For many of the students books are not readily accessible in their homes. This makes it that much more important to have a variety of books for the students to use in the classroom. The books will be used for the students to 'shop' each week. Meaning they will be able to pick books that interest them but at the same time encourage and challenge their reading skills. It is also imporant to have both fiction and nonfiction books represented in the classroom which is why I am so excited by this series! Giving the students a variety of books and the power of choosing their own books, sets a strong foundation for successful readers!
needStatement: My students need a variety of fiction and non-fiction books to build a love of reading!

name: We Want to Add Illustrations! We Need Supplies!
description: My students attend a school that houses kindergarten through 5th grade. I currently have 26 amazing first graders who are ready to learn! My students are very curious 6 and 7 year olds, who love to learn using different materials and strategies! In first grade we are always looking for new ways to get students excited about their learning, especially about literacy! My students love to have different options in the classroom, so they can choose the best way for them to learn! My students love writing and center time! In first grade, we write narrative pieces about our own lives and non-fiction pieces about different things we know a lot about. Each student also adds illustrations to their pieces to help tell their story! During centers, my students get the chance to be creative with their art and to create new things for themselves and our classroom! My students need markers and colored pencils to help bring their illustrations to life! The use of different types of art materials will help bring new creations into my first grade classroom. These materials will help spark new ideas and projects in my first grade little minds!
needStatement: My students need markers and colored pencils to use during writing and learning centers! When first graders create stories, they love to include illustrations to help tell their story to their audience!

name: Every Artist Was First An Amateur!
description: My students currently attend a year-round school in MN. I have 23 vibrant kindergarten students that truly love to come to school. My class has a very diverse set of needs with 1/2 of the students speaking English as a second language and 1/3 of my students receive special education service. Each day is a new adventure in the world of learning. My students come to school to be fed, feel loved and find their place in this world on top of learning how to be a citizen in today’s world. They enjoy the safety of the community we have built. My students are in need of art and music supplies to stimulate the right side of the brain which is imperative to the development of critical thinking skills. My students need more ways to expressive themselves in the classroom. I am asking for markers, stamps, crayons, and other craft supplies to help each student explore their creative side freely. Each day my class gets 20 minutes of choice time. During this time each student gets to choose a center to work at. During this time students can use the skills I have taught to have a self guided learning time. The majority of the students use this time to learn through play. By having markers, crayons, stamps, etc. will let the kids express themselves, but also allows for social skills and fine motor skills to happen with in a small group of students. The art center during choice time is in high demand and the students live feeling accomplished and proud. I am also asking for music supplies for large group and for small group activities. Sadly, our school no longer has a music program. I will be using rhythm sticks in the class to expose my students to the basics of music of finding and keeping a beat. The class will be exposed to different kinds of music and being able to create similar music of their own! I would also like to have drums, egg shakers, and chimes for students to create their own music during free choice time! Students can choose to go to the music center I create with the items I have requested.
needStatement: My students need art and music supplies to enhance their creativity freely!

name: Best for Belize: Summer Teaching Fellowship
description: My 25 four year olds are curious, imaginative, and yearning for knowledge! Our school is a Title I charter school with extended school hours located in Houston, Texas. My students come from diverse backgrounds, and many are English Language Learners. Growing up in high poverty has helped them become innovative and hard working. With longer school hours, my students are exposed to both rigorous and engaging learning opportunities. I do the best I can to set them up to be successful in school and college. Recently, I have been offered a summer fellowship through an organization called Limted Resource Teacher Training. (LRTT) LRTT connects inspirational teachers from around the world to share best practices and to promote a culture of openness, collaboration, and professionalism. All students deserve a quality education no matter the context they are born in to. Through this fellowship I will be working to achieve that, while living in Belize. One-third of students drop out of school in Belize before they turn 14 due to seasonal demands for agricultural labor. I will be working to help train and coach teachers, while also enhancing my own leadership and teaching skills. I will have the privilege to collaborate with a team of 25 educators from around the world to plan, design, and lead workshops. This opportunity will strengthen my skills, so I can have a greater positive impact on my own students in my community. I know I will come back to my class with a plethora of new and creative ideas to inspire academic growth. In my career thus far, I have worked to make a local impact in my community, and now this is an opportunity to make a small difference in education on a more global platform. After witnessing the effects of Hurricane Harvey on our community, I have realized the importance of collaborating with other communities who have limited resources. Seeing the firsthand effects of the hurricane on my students, and colleague's homes has further validated the importance of being properly trained to provide support and quality education during similar setbacks.
needStatement: I need funding for a professional development fellowship in Belize, where 1/3 of the students drop out of school by the age of 14.

name: Off to the Zoo
description: Aloha from na keiki o Hawai'i. My preschool special education class provides early intervention services to qualifying special needs children with a range of disabling conditions, ages 3 to 5 years. Most of my students struggle to speak and be understood, and several have fine motor challenges as well. My school is located in a predominantly rural, low-income neighborhood with a considerable portion of the children of Hawaiian and/or Pacific Island ancestry. Our classroom cheer sums it up: 'You too, we too, we all love preschool!' We are a group of actively involved adults-teacher, aide, and therapists, and children working together in our hands-on learning environment. My students need to go to the zoo because if I don't take them they would likely never go, so renewing our annual zoo membership is a MUST. We read stories and sing and dance to songs with animals as characters, look at picture books and watch wildlife videos of animals, but nothing beats seeing them (reasonably) up close. I love to take my students to the zoo several times a year as 905 animals and 42 acres are too much to take in in a single trip; however, it's a bit pricey for my parents. With this zoo membership I will be able to uphold my promise when I say, 'Don't worry. We'll be back.' as we sprint past an exhibit while exiting the zoo to catch the City bus. Using the annual pass, we will take four trips during the school year. This allows the children lots of time for extended and multiple viewing and discussing what we observe. I'm also requesting assistance with the bus fares on the City Bus. By developing an appreciation of these wonderful animals, I hope the children begin to understand the richness of life.
needStatement: My students need an annual membership to the Honolulu Zoo and bus fare.

name: Middle School Track and Field
description: I am looking for funding to purchase running shoes. This is my first year coaching the Middle School Track and Field team for students ranging from grades 6 through 8. I have noticed that most of them don't own shoes that are suitable for running. They wear mostly canvas shoes, ripping apart at the soles, or high top shoes that are heavy. Students who stay engaged in athletics have a better chance at graduating, are more likely to enroll in post-secondary education and live an overall healthier lifestyle. My request is a simple one. I want to buy shoes that will enable my runners to make it though a season, injury-free, with a positive experience, that encourages them to stay with this sport for the duration of high school. Shoes are needed. This project is all about middle school students, who innately want to run, jump and exercise. Most of my team has inadequate footwear. Your support would go a long way in ensuring them a positive track and field experience. I'll use the donation to purchase new shoes to serve as an incentive for students who show a commitment to academics, integrity and teamwork. We are a young team that is trying to build on core fundamentals with hopes that it matriculates into a senior high track and field program. It's difficult to retain students when the experience is riddled with inconsistency and injury.
needStatement: My students need running shoes to enable a injury-free, positive experience in this year's track and field season.

name: STEM Learning Through Classroom Robots
description: My sixth-grade students are explorers and learners. They are excited to discover different ways math can be used in the real-world and are engaged in STEM learning throughout their school day. My students are creative problem solvers, and my classroom is a place for them to experience learning in a hands-on environment. Our school is located in the center of a large city, and many students face challenges of uncertainty at home, including issues of economic instability and immigration status. In the classroom, I strive to create a positive learning environment in which students can engage with STEM through real-world projects. I encourage my students to work together and think creatively, and I hope to foster a life-long love of learning and math. The Evo Classroom Kit of 18 Evo robots, 12 sets of color code markers, 18 DIY skins, lessons, and more will be used to introduce my students to computer science and engineering. The lessons that use these robots will help students see how math is applied in different ways in the real-world. Since the robots can be programmed using the color code markers, they can be used in the classroom without additional technology. This is very beneficial since many of my students do not have smartphones, and I do not have regular access to computers in my classroom. Projects involving these robots are endless - student creativity is the only limit. Students can create stories using the robots, solve engineering problems, and learn how to program. Currently, I do not have a way to introduce students to the amazing connection between math and computer science; these robots would provide an exciting and engaging opportunity to make that connection for my students. Most of my students have not yet had the chance to interact with robotics technology, this Classroom Kit would provide a key opportunity for them to explore an exciting STEM field.
needStatement: My students need the Ozobot Evo Classroom Kit to explore math and computer science in a hands-on and creative way.

name: Student Led School News Broadcast
description: My amazing 5th graders come from a very diverse background where 92% of our students have free or reduced-price lunch. I have special education students mainstreamed into my classroom. My classroom speaks more than 9 different languages and some of them face hunger and homelessness, but they have the GRIT and do not give up! My students are eager to learn and experience new things, and they love reading. A majority of my students enter the classroom without school materials, where I must then provide them. Many of them wear the same hoodie to school every day because they do not have another. It's amazing to see them succeed once they feel safe and secure in school. Even as fifth graders they approach me for daily hugs or additional ones if they are in crisis. I look at my class as my family and once they feel and believe it, the learning can really begin. There isn't anything I would not do to help them. Students each year sign up to join our school TV broadcast each year; in fact we have a waiting list to participate. Sadly, our current cameras are slowly dying and we have not had microphones for a few years. I am requesting 2 camcorders, a tri-pod, 2 microphones, a speaker, 2 memory cards and an external DVD drive so students can create their own videos and movies. The school news is watched by our 500+ students each week and is created by the students, for the students. The New program includes the school pledge, lunch menu, jokes, student birthdays, weekly winners for behavior, special segments and our words of wisdom each week. By having new technologies the students will be able to once again go around the school and tape interesting segments. Students can tape science projects and show them on the newscast. My students can use these camcorders and tape classrooms to promote our math activities and reading projects.
needStatement: My students need various electronics like memory cards, camcorders, and microphones in order to upgrade and enhance our school weekly TV news broadcast because our current electronics are on the brink of extinction.

name: Lab Experiences for Memorable Inquiry
description: My amazing students are primarily low-income, disadvantaged, and come to us having little or no experience with lab experiences. Our school caters to working parents with extended school hours, free breakfast, and provides extended learning after school hours. Our incredibly dedicated professional staff works hard to provide hope and especially joy and appreciation for learning which enables young scholars desperate to escape from crushing and oppressive poverty. I am confident that providing actual hands-on lab experiences will encourage and motivate even the more reluctant learners. We are requesting a biochemistry kit, chemistry of esters kit, enzymes and cheese making kit and lead test kit. Being able to engage in scientific inquiry will positively impact my scholars' lives. My students have never had opportunities to experience actual chemistry, and we spent the entire first semester getting caught up on material they should have seen in middle school. However, a quality science program is expensive. I have spent hundreds of dollars of my own money to try and give these deserving youth exposure to this amazing content. Anything my students get to do in the lab will motivate them to achieve excellence and change their lives. I've never taught in a building with no appropriate textbooks.
needStatement: My students need to experience biochemistry and how enzymes impact reaction rates. We are requesting a biochemistry kit, chemistry of esters kit, enzymes and cheese making kit and lead test kit.

name: Chromebooks for Learning
description: My third grade students love to learn new things and use technology in the classroom. We are fortunate that we are one of the few one to one laptop classrooms in our school which allows us to incorporate technology in all subjects. We are a STEAM Academy where the focus is on science, technology, engineering, arts and mathematics. Most of my students are low income and don't have the ability to use technology at home. They are are coming from the surrounding areas to attend a school that is often times better than their neighborhood school. Las Vegas also tends to have a very transient population, and many kids are constantly moving either into, out of, or around the city. As our classroom technology becomes outdated we need to continuously update our technology to provide learning opportunities for our students. We have several schoolwide programs such as ST math, Reading Plus, and Star Reading that require access to the internet. The Chromebooks will be used several times throughout the day to access our schoolwide programs and to create online projects. As we are teaching 21st-century skills such as coding the students need technology that can keep pace with the skills they are learning. Having access to technology that is updated and current help students complete projects quicker and improves their experience using technology.
needStatement: My students need four Asus Chromebooks to replace outdated classroom technology.

name: Learning With Technology
description: Our students come from a variety of different economic backgrounds with 90% of our students receiving free lunch or reduced lunch. As a teacher in a low-income/high poverty school, our students are faced with several challenges both in and out of the classroom everyday. Despite the challenges they face, our students come to class each day ready to learn and ready to do the best they can.I spend a lot of my personal money on classroom supplies and there's not much left over for 'nonessential' items. The use of technology is incorporated daily in my kindergarten classroom, for both ela and math rotations. One of our daily center rotations is computers. I currently have 4 computers in my classroom, but 6 students in each group. This means 2 students from each group are not able to get on the computer each day. By donating to our project, you will ensure that every student gets computer time each day, which will ultimately help to increase their academic achievements. All of my students will be able to learn through engaging, content-based games, take AR tests, and increase their literacy and their desire to learn each and every day!
needStatement: My students need 2 Apple iPads so they can learn with technology every day.

name: Indoor/Outdoor Fun for Preschool
description: My class is a fully self-contained special education preschool class, with daily opportunities for inclusion. We are in a high poverty area, and my students' disabilities include Downs Syndrome, global delays, various developmental delays, speech and language delays, and autism. My students are mostly young three year olds. 75% of my students are nonverbal, requiring intensive detailed programming. The two years they spend in my class are the most critical for intensive early intervention and is their 'window of opportunity' that'll steer their future. My students love the outdoors. They enjoy getting outside to play and the fresh air and sunshine. Unfortunately, once outside of the classroom doors, they lack the skills to play appropriately or to safely walk together without running away. They need to work on walking in line and staying with the class for safety reasons and to prepare them for the future years in school. They also love water and need this 'watch it flow' water table. Those who lack the proper play skills will love watching the water flow, with this particular water table can learn to splash, pour, and catch the water. These materials will be used by all 4 Preschool classes and target a variety of domains, including gross and fine motor development, play skills, safety skills, and social-emotional skills. My students love stuffed animals and animation and need a puppet theater to help develop their social skills, such as sharing, taking turns, feelings and emotions, and acting out social stories to learn to cope in various situations. They also need the therapy putty, which is more effective than play-doh to develop their fine motor skills and strengthen their little hands. This request for a what seems like a mish-mash of materials will help my students in every area of development, and will truly impact their lives.
needStatement: My students need a 'Watch it Flow' water table and a puppet theater to learn appropriate play and social skills.

name: Show Me the Money!
description: My students are from Mississippi. Their location does not define who they are. They are smart, spunky, and full of personality, and they come in every day ready to learn! They come from a range of different backgrounds, but they all have one common mindset. They have the mindsets of champions. They walk in my classroom and own their learning by taking full responsibility for their work. They exceed my expectations daily. My class inspires me to give it 100% every day. This is why I chose to do this project. I want to give them the best so they can continue to strive for excellence and be the champions they are. This year I will be promoting financial literacy in my classroom. We are requesting the Grade K-1 Math Library which is filled with number sense and money books that will help my students understand how numbers and money work. It will also help them to see why they need money to be successful. Grade K-1 Math Library will be read during whole group instruction. Students will also be able to read them during independent reading time. Other resources will include Building Math Skills Write & Wipe Boards and Write & Wipe Thin-Line Markers - 4-Color Set for students to solve money problems and arithmetic problems during whole group and small group instruction. Financial literacy such as the Money (8 Books) from AKJ will also help my students to see themselves as a entrepreneur. Money (8 Books) books will be read during story time and to introduce math concepts such as number sense, money, addition and subtraction, counting up and down and so much more. Before you know it my students will grasp the essential skills needed to show Me the Money!!
needStatement: My students need financial literacy and number sense books to help them understand how numbers and money connect. The write & wipe boards will also be used to help them work on math skills.

name: Small Changes Generate Big Ideas In Painting
description: Our art students come from all over the world. They speak 200 different languages. Many are brand new to speaking English. Some come from war zones and refugee camps. All of our students are curious about color and painting ideas. Some of our students excel at school; some have never been to a formal school setting before they came to our school. Some students spend extra time after school, and some have to get home to care for others while their parents go to work. All of our students want to make art work they like. Prang tempera cakes are the opaque version the watercolor paint students have used this quarter well as the material used by people all over the world. My students come from the same places as the artworks we will study and make painting interpretations. This quarter we will explore watercolor and tempera paintings from their countries of origin. When using Prang tempera cakes, students will make flat color shapes as in Egyptian style painting. Flat shape colors are common in many world styles. These paints will allow students to compare and contrast materials and styles with only small changes. Small changes will refine students’ observation skills.
needStatement: My students need opaque watercolor paint like Prang tempera cakes to continue their world culture watercolor painting studies.

name: First Grade Scholars in Need of Dollars!
description: My students come from a small neighborhood on the south side of Chicago. The majority of my students receive free or reduced fee lunches. My scholars come from diverse backgrounds and mostly single income families. Seeing how some families struggle, it’s difficult to keep a year-round supply of school necessities always available at our tiny fingertips! Despite these struggles, they try their hardest daily to meet and exceed high expectations. They are readers, authors, mathematicians, and scientists giving their best effort to achieve their personal goals. These markers, colored pencils, crayons, and glue sticks could make huge differences in how our creative minds and juices flow! We don’t always have the chance to add color to our content area work, so these coloring tools can make a world of difference! Using our flexible seating during guided math and reading can truly help us focus more on becoming better scholars every day. Being first graders, we have a lot of energy to let out! These balance balls can help us use that energy in positive ways to become proficient readers and mathematicians! These small items can make a huge difference in our day to day classroom experience.
needStatement: My students need basic school supplies that some families are unable to afford on their own. We also need balance balls to keep our energetic minds focused and our ideas flowing during guided reading and math!

name: RHS Jazz Band Swings into the Future!
description: My students are dedicated high school musicians who come from humble backgrounds. Most, if not all, of our students are recipients of free or reduced rate lunch, but that does not deter them from excellence musically and academically. In my jazz band, I have the head of the dance team, lead theatre actors and technicians, top 10% scorers, and all-region and honor band and orchestra students. They participate fully in our program as well as stand out in community music groups. Nothing is worse than have a fantastic drummer, a great drum set... and an awful sounding set of cymbals. Or even worse NO CYMBALS AT ALL, because they are being borrowed by another performing group. This new cymbal will ensure that our jazz band has exclusive access to a piece of quality equipment that matches the quality of the musicianship that the students are putting into their rehearsals every day! It was recommended to us by a well know professional drummer that we purchase a new ride cymbal to elevate the sound of our band and take our performances to the next level. Unfortunately, the school budget will not allow us to purchase this piece of equipment outright. This is the instrument that gives us our inspiration as jazz musicians-it is the heart of the swing tradition and the transcendent pattern played on this cymbal has the power to change lives forever. I know it changed mine; playing in great jazz bands in school inspired me to become a music educator! I hope that the quality of our instruction and the experience we create will provide that kind of inspiration to some of our students. All we need right now is a high-quality heart to get our swing on!
needStatement: My students need a new 22” ride cymbal to take their performances to the next level!

name: Help Us Focus
description: I am a general education teacher in the CSD. I work with students with disabilities and those who are at risk for failure due to gaps in their education, as well as general education students. The students I work with are hardworking students. Many of my students are at school every day despite the hardships their families face, such as homelessness and food insecurity. Every day I work on empowering my students through their learning. I work on giving them successes in the classroom to help them reach their potential. So many times in the past few years I have noticed that students have so much trouble focusing on learning. They need many movement breaks and sometimes even that is not enough. There has been a push to offer flexible seating arrangements in classrooms. From everything I have seen and read, this has made a huge positive impact on attention and student learning. I would love a chance to offer this opportunity to my students using wobble chairs. This will give them a chance to be comfortable, select a working space, and be able to move. I am confident this will improve our learning environment!
needStatement: My students need a wobble chair bundle to help them focus!

name: I 'Hear' There's a Way to Help Me Learn!
description: I teach in a low SES, mostly free- and reduced lunch, Title 1 school. My class is a special education classroom, elementary level. The students are fun, curious, and want to be like and learn like their peers. They make me smile and laugh every day. Most of my students need help with reading passages, and headphones that fit and are comfortable would be so helpful in using our technology to the best advantage. Many websites have the ability to 'read' a text to my students, and some even have built- in media resources to highlight and add to a passage (for example, a dragonfly poem has two media resources to build background knowledge on dragonflies, using short nature and informational clips). I am trying to help my special education students use technology daily. Many websites have the ability to 'read' text to students, and have media sources that supplement text and give students background knowledge(that they typically don't have) on passages. Most of our headphones are small, old, don't fit, and are very uncomfortable. We share about 30 headphones with the entire school of 325 students. Our kindergarten classes currently have the headphones for the little ones. If I need them, I have to borrow them for an hour, then return them to the other side of the building. Without headphones, the noise level of students' devices is very distracting.
needStatement: My students need comfortable and correctly-sized headphones to help them learn to the best of their ability and utilize technology in the most effective way.

name: Pre-K Teacher Workshop-I Love Early Childhood!
description: My goal is to make all of my students feel as safe and comfortable as possible in my classroom. It is themed in a Disney style decor making it as kid friendly as can be. For years my dream was to teach Pre-Kindergarten and I believe that early childhood is the foundation of learning. I love coming into the classroom and greeting each child either with a smile or their favorite handshake. Their innocence allows them to have a yearning for learning and be curious to ask as many questions as possible (curiosity). My lessons and voice in teaching should always be animated and alive making each child feel welcomed and activities as engaging as possible. Allowing my students to feel that this classroom is their second home and that I care for them tremendously to prepare them for Kindergarten. I am requesting to attend a professional development focused on early childhood that will support me in providing meaningful and engaging lessons to all of my students. Being my 1st year as a Pre-K teacher I am wanting to strive to learn and get the best foundation of learning in Pre-K strategies to better myself as an educator and teach my amazing students to be successful for Kindergarten and have that motivation for learning. This professional development will support me in gaining strategies for foundational and emergent literacy and math, positive discipline and management, social-emotional development, and play-based learning that builds independence and curiosity within the child. I would be able to reach each child and see a growth within them making my activities and lessons as motivating and animated as possible.
needStatement: I need to attend an early-childhood workshop called SDE National Conference held from July 9-13, 2018, teaching Pre-K teachers how to gain classroom-tested strategies to build independence and curiosity.

name: Can You Hear Me Now? Part 2
description: My students are always excited when they enter the classroom, especially on lab days. They enjoy hands-on activities, working in small groups and being able to explore with their peers. My goal is to provide my students with an engaging, fun and safe learning environment. My school is located in a low social economic neighborhood where 95% of the students are on free or reduced price lunch. Most of my students are faced with many challenges in the classroom and at home. All of our students Kinder-5th grade use a computer program called Scientific Learning. This program helps provide a digital intervention to struggling readers and helps them continue to build upon the reading skills they already have. We need headphones with microphones so students can hear themselves read aloud to practice reading fluency. What a great way to help a struggling reader and help spark a love of reading by helping build their confidence. The headphones with microphones will be used by my students during daily Intervention time. They will use the Scientific Learning program to practice reading passages out loud to themselves. These headphones will also be shared with third and forth grade during their daily time.
needStatement: My students need headphones with microphone for use in the computer lab.

name: Books, Books, Books!
description: My students come from very diverse backgrounds. Having students from all over the globe is my favorite part of walking into my room. To see children from all over the world interacting and helping each other is amazing. Every year I look for new ways to challenge and push my students. Donations from Donors Choose allows me to have the materials to teach them new and exciting things. I enjoy getting new things for them to interactive with and see their excitement for learning grow. My students and I love to dive deep into learning about historical figures and symbols. I have quite a few books about historical figures but have very few books on American symbols. The books I am requesting would allow us to study in depth about the various American Symbols. I feel it is important for my students to know about these symbols and why they are important to the United States. I am also requesting books about teaching kindness to everyone even if they are different. I feel it is important to teach children about empathy at a young age and learn how to handle different situations. I focus on teaching my children about how to be a leader and show kindness to all. I always ask my children, 'How were you kind today?'
needStatement: My students need books to help enrich our learning about kindness and American Symbols.

name: Citizen Science Birding
description: Parkway Montessori Middle School is the first public, urban, Montessori middle school in the state of Minnesota. As a school that opened five years ago, we are still emerging and growing as a community. We are located on the East Side of St. Paul in a historically diverse and low income community; 77% of our students receive free and reduced lunch. Maria Montessori said, “Scientific observation then has established that education is not what the teacher gives; education is a natural process spontaneously carried out by the human individual, and is acquired not by listening to words but by experiences upon the environment.” Our philosophy of education strives to embody this principle, providing our students the opportunity to drive their own learning and explore the world around them. A classroom set of binoculars will provide our students with the necessary tools to continue students' work with citizen science and birding.
